title: Openings! Engineers for Automotive Ind. - Ontario

title: Maintenance Manager
description:
Maintenance Manager


Requirements:


  • 5+ years Maintenance Supervisory experience overseeing team of mechanical and electrical maintenance technicians - responsible for hiring, ongoing coaching, evaluation, continuous development, KPI reporting and analysis
  • Manufacturing industry experience – ideally within food & beverage or similar high-speed liquid fill type environment
  • Hands-on skills and experience with preventative maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of:
  • Mechanical and Electrical systems
  • Hydraulic systems
  • Pneumatic systems
  • PLC controls and logic systems
  • Welding and basic machining experience considered an asset
  • Experienced working with engineering for continuous improvement, root cause analysis and capital projects
  • Experienced developing and managing department budgets and inventory & supplies requirements
  • Champions Safety as a core value
  • Good skills with computers and MS Office programs, including Excel
  • Work schedule is Day Shift, but must be comfortable with on-call as needed

description:

Requirements:


  • 5+ years Maintenance Supervisory experience overseeing team of mechanical and electrical maintenance technicians - responsible for hiring, ongoing coaching, evaluation, continuous development, KPI reporting and analysis
  • Manufacturing industry experience – ideally within food & beverage or similar high-speed liquid fill type environment
  • Hands-on skills and experience with preventative maintenance, troubleshooting and repair of:
  • Mechanical and Electrical systems
  • Hydraulic systems
  • Pneumatic systems
  • PLC controls and logic systems
  • Welding and basic machining experience considered an asset
  • Experienced working with engineering for continuous improvement, root cause analysis and capital projects
  • Experienced developing and managing department budgets and inventory & supplies requirements
  • Champions Safety as a core value
  • Good skills with computers and MS Office programs, including Excel
  • Work schedule is Day Shift, but must be comfortable with on-call as needed

title: Production Employee
description:
Production Employee

Williams Lake, BC

Full-Time

Are you motivated by hard work, have a positive attitude and a strong focus on safety? If so, we want to hear from you! We are an equal opportunity employer.

Reporting to the Mill Supervisor, production employees have a wide mix of duties and responsibilities within the mill. This posting is for an entry-level production role. It includes rotation through various jobs in the mill including clean-up, general labour and machine operation. On-the-job training is provided, along with competitive pay and benefits. The minimum starting wage for production staff is $30.70/hour.

Production employees will have the opportunity to apply for other internal roles including apprenticeships and various production related positions within the sawmill and planermill after completion of a probationary period.

Qualifications:

  • Commitment to working safely
  • Strong communication & interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work both in a team and independently
  • Flexible availability to accommodate shift work
  • Ability to perform some physical labor
  • Previous experience in an industrial environment preferred, but not required

Want to know what it’s like to work for Tolko? Click here

About Tolko:

With state-of-the-art operations across western Canada, Tolko is a leading manufacturer of a wide range of forest products for customers around the world. For over 60 years, our family-owned company has been recognized by our customers and business partners for being reliable, flexible, efficient and offering quality products.

At Tolko, our values, vision and mission aren’t just what we believe. They’re how we work, live and serve our customers every day. Fundamental to our success is a diverse and committed workforce that thrives on change, building relationships, and a drive toward excellence.

When you join Tolko, you’re saying yes to a company that has been built on integrity, respect, and provides employees with the inclusive environment, support and opportunity they need to build great lives. We’re more than an industry leader. We’re the place where you succeed as our most valuable resource!

We offer:

  • An unyielding commitment to your personal safety
  • Competitive pay and exceptional benefits
  • The opportunity to work with the best and brightest in the industry
  • Diverse opportunities
  • An open, innovative culture
  • A positive, dynamic, and inclusive work environment
  • Technical and leadership training to ensure you work successfully and safely
  • The chance to live (and play) where you work

For more information about what it’s like to work for Tolko, check out our YouTube video!

We thank all candidates for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter to stay up to date on Tolko news and job postings.

title: newProduction Operator
description:
At Oregon Tool, it is our goal to create, cultivate and sustain a global, inclusive culture, where differences drive innovative solutions to meet the needs of our employees and customers.

Oregon Tool invites and encourages applications from all skilled individuals, including from groups that are traditionally underrepresented, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company #SharperTogether.

Oregon Tool is hiring Production Team Members for the midnight shift or afternoon shift.

Midnight shift - 11:30pm to 7:00am.

Afternoon shift - Mon to Thurs, 3:15 to 11:30 pm, Friday 3:15 to 8:45 pm

Job Overview:

You will perform various production operations to produce high quality products for our customers.

Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:

  • Operating equipment and using computer systems to monitor operations.
  • Entering production data into computer systems,
  • Using tools for accurate measuring ensuring the quality of the product.
  • Problem solving and troubleshooting technical issues and performing light maintenance of equipment

Qualifications & Skills Required:

  • Successful applicants come from diverse experiences and backgrounds and have basic writing, and math skills and the ability to learn.
  • Successful applicants are engaged, committed individuals who are used to working in quality first environments.
  • They are self-motivated and demonstrate strong problem-solving skills.
  • Previous machine/equipment operation experience or manufacturing experience is an asset but not required

Featured Benefits:

·Three weeks vacation after 1 year

· Tuition reimbursement

· Paid sick days

· Medical and Dental benefits

· Work clothing program

· Employee and family assistance program

· Industry leading savings plan

· Holiday turkey/lunch and summer picnics

· Three floater days used between December 25th and December 31st

· Service awards

· Safety shoes reimbursed at $100 per year or $175 every two years

· Safety prescription glasses through approved program

About Oregon Tool

At Oregon Tool, we are a passionate group of people dedicated to a spirit of innovation and outside the box thinking to create the world’s most efficient cutting tools and products. We believe in inspiring, listening, learning, and rolling up our sleeves to “get to work” together. Our purpose goes beyond the products we make. We are devoted to positively impacting people, communities, and landscapes around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment and implementing sustainable practices to help reverse the impacts of the global climate crisis. We are built on a pioneering spirit and believe in leading with humility, global stewardship, and owning it day in and day out. We know what it takes to get the job done, and we know our people is the way it happens.

Come grow with us and help us be #SharperTogether

Production Team Member, Production Worker, Equipment Operator, Machine Operator, Manufacturing Jobs, Manufacturing Operator

Work Remotely

  • No

Pay: $22.56-$28.22 per hour

  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift

title: newAccounts Payable(NO REMOTE WORK)
description:
Job description

Company Overview

Over the last 65 years, Omcan has grown to become a leading supplier to the food service industry in Canada and the USA. Our success over these many years is directly attributed to our established relationships with all of our valued customers and through providing them with Diverse, Dependable and Proven products. Omcan continues to help our customers remain competitive. With associates in North America, and Asia, our global footprint continues to expand and we hold to the principal that customers benefit from the accessibility and familiarity of sales teams. In over 200,000 sq. ft. of warehouse space we stock over 5,000 quality food equipment and supplies for the food preparation market.

Check out this video to learn about and meet one of our current home-based employees!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qXOxpyNloHg

We are proud to offer:

  • 3 Weeks vacation to start
  • Competitive Salary and incentives
  • A unique team spirit and culture: Family-Oriented!
  • RRSP/DPSP Plan
  • Continuing Education and Tuition Assistance
  • Comprehensive Health and Dental Benefits
  • Employee Referral Program

Summary Statement:

This position is responsible for ensuring accurate and timely payment of invoices to vendors. It will require good judgement, confidentiality, and adherence to departmental and company policies and procedures.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:

§ Check accuracy of suppliers’ invoices and other documentation

§ Enter invoices into SAP

§ Verify freight invoices have been charged to customers

§ Communicate price discrepancies with purchaser and vendors

§ Communicate freight rate discrepancies with sales department

§ Confirm Omcan receives accurate credit for product returned to suppliers

§ Reconcile ledgers on an ongoing basis

§ Track priority payments to suppliers who give a payment in cash discount

§ Make timely and accurate payments to all suppliers

§ Other duties as assigned

Minor Duties and Responsibilities:

§ Ensure deposit delivered to the bank daily

§ Generate reports and analysis ad hoc as requested

§ Filing and organization of accounts payable documentation

§ Track and tally all expenses for sales department and vehicles

§ Track supplier rebates

Minimum Qualifications and Skills:

§ Completion of post-secondary program with a focus on business administration, finance or accounting

§ High degree of numerical competency

§ Ability to create, read and analyze detailed numerical reports

§ Highly attentive to detail with strong clerical and organizational skill

§ Communicate clearly and effectively with all levels of an organization

§ Must possess advanced knowledge and skill with Microsoft Office Suite, and SAP Business 1

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$45,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • What is your salary expectation?

Experience:

  • SAP: 1 year (preferred)
  • accounts payable: 1 year (preferred)

title: newProduction Worker
description:
About the Role:

This opportunity is based in Brantford and includes a fixed term contract position with the possibility of permanent hire for the following shift rotations:

Weekly 8 hour rotating shifts between days and afternoons

  • Afternoon shift premium: $0.65/hr
  • Operator premium: $2.10/hr

8 hours straight night shift from Sunday to Thursday

  • Night shift premium: $0.85/hr
  • Operator premium: $2.10/hr

12 hour rotating shifts between days and nights every 2 weeks and working every other weekend

  • Weekend premium: $4.0/hr
  • Night shift premium: $1.65/hr
  • Operator premium: $2.10/hr

This is a NOC C level position.

A successful candidate must be:

  • Able to work rotating shifts and overtime when required
  • Ability to meet/exceed goals in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong mechanical aptitude
  • Ability to perform heavy lifting when required
  • Meets the physical demands of the position
  • Excellent eye and hand co-ordination
  • Commitment to adhere to the company’s GMPs including the wearing of PPE
  • Competent problem-solving skills
  • Work in a team environment
  • High sense of urgency
  • Attention to detail
  • Positive attitude
  • Strong communication skills
  • Commitment to Ferrero safety policies and procedures
  • Previous experience operating manufacturing equipment

How to be successful in the role and at Ferrero:

Consumers, quality and care are at the heart of everything we do. So, to be successful at Ferrero, you’ll need to be just as consumer and product centric as we are - dedicated to crafting brilliant results for consumers around the world.

Company description

Ferrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella®, Tic Tac®, Ferrero Rocher®, Raffaello®, Kinder Bueno® and Kinder Surprise®. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in 55 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? Nearly 35,000 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them.

Diversity Statement

Ferrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding.

Accommodation

Ferrero Canada will accommodate the needs of applicants with disabilities throughout all stages of the selection process. If you need accommodation during the recruitment process, please advise the HR Representative. Information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

#INDPW

title: General Labourer
description:
What does WestRock do?

WestRock is a leading provider of differentiated paper and packaging solutions to customers across the globe. Have you ever ordered pizza that arrived hot and fresh at your doorstep, or an item online that you were excited to receive and open? If so, there is a good chance that the cardboard box it came in was made in one of our WestRock facilities. If you are looking for a rewarding career at a company that provides room for growth, has safety and sustainability built into its DNA, and values diversity and inclusion, then you have come to the right place.

Career Opportunity:

Production Workers (General Labourers) working in our clean manufacturing facility are the key to ensuring quality cardboard boxes are produced for our customers.

Working as a team, you are responsible for the daily production of quality corrugated products in a safe and efficient manner. You will demonstrate attention to detail by ensuring order specs and special requirements are accurately followed and perform quality checks according to WestRock’s production requirements.

The daily physical requirements included stair climbing, repetitive heavy lifting, squatting, pushing, pulling, lifting, moving, stacking cardboard through various machines. Must be able to tolerate hot temperatures in the summer months.

To be considered for this position, you must be able to work Monday – Friday, 8-hours per day with a weekly rotating shift; midnights 11:00 pm – 7:00 am; afternoons 3:00 pm – 11:00 pm and days 7:00 am – 3:00 pm.

All successful applicants must be able to have satisfactory criminal background check results, pre-employment medical results and a Clear Drug Test. WestRock pays for these services.

Why work with WestRock:

· Starting wage $19.08/hour

· Wages opportunity up to $27.09/hr as your career progresses as a Production Worker

· Shift premium for hours worked on afternoon and midnight shifts ($0.90 and $1.20/hr respectively)

· Benefits following completion of probationary period; 720 hours

· Pension plan (RRSP / DPSP) after six months of employment

· An Employer that cares about your health and safety

· Training opportunities to work on different machines. Click here to connect our people with our products

· A management team committed to WestRock's values of Respect, Accountability, Integrity and Excellence

· A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety, and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work. Click here to find out more about our commitment to sustainability.

Benefits:

· Dental, Medical and Vision Care

· Short and Long Term Disability

· Life Insurance

· Employee Assistance Program

· RRSP Match

What you need to work at WestRock:

· High school diploma

· Attention to detail

· Ability to work well in a team environment

· Have basic math skills

· Physically fit

· Able to work shifts with a weekly rotation

· Prior experience working in a manufacturing / warehouse environment is an asset however not necessary

As a global company, you will find our boxes worldwide! Next time you get a box, turn it around and see if you can find the WestRock stamp!

title: Food Manufacturing Positions – Afternoon Shift Plant Employe...
description:
Food Manufacturing Positions – Afternoon Shift Plant Employees Required.

Taste of Nature Foods Inc. is a leading manufacturer of snack bars located in Markham, Ontario. We have been operating for over 30 years making delicious, nutritious, quality snack bars for our own brands, retail private label, and co-manufacturing customers.

Our business is experiencing rapid growth which has created a need to expand our manufacturing operations to the afternoon shift and hire additional full-time, permanent plant employees in a variety of positions. We currently have many vacancies to fill in the following job classifications:

  • Batching Operators – skilled labour (4 vacancies; pay rate: $17/hour)
  • Mixing Operators – skilled labour (9 vacancies; pay rate: $18/hour)
  • Cutting Machine Operators – skilled labour (5 vacancies; pay rate: $17.50/hour)
  • Flow Wrapping Machine Operators – skilled labour (10 vacancies; pay rate: $17/hour)
  • Packing Operators – general labour (12 vacancies; pay rate: $15.50/hour)

No prior experience is required as we are prepared to train you providing you meet the following criteria:

1. You’re able to communicate in English

2. You’re physically able to carry 30 lbs.

3. You’re willing to work on the afternoon shift

The afternoon shift employees will have different start times depending on the position they get assigned. The earliest start is 3 pm and the latest start is 4 pm. The shift is 8.5 hours long.

All employees hired will go through a 90-day probationary period before being considered for full-time employment with Taste of Nature Foods Inc.

During the 90-day probationary period, the hourly rate will be $1/hour less than the posted full-time hourly rate.

Once the 90-day probationary period is successfully completed, all hired employees will be eligible for enrolment is the company’s benefits program.

If you’re interested in joining our great company and growing team, please submit your resume to our Production Manager, Idrish Patel.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.50-$18.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Various protocols in place - sanitation, screening, etc.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Markham, ON L3R 2Z5: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: Production Laborers (evening and night shifts positions)
description:
At Hitachi Energy, our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation

Hitachi Energy is a global leader in technology, and the largest supplier of transformers in the world. We are pioneering the digitalization of transformers, while working on the frontier of renewable energy and ultra-high voltage AC & DC applications. Hours: Evening shift: 15:15 - 23:30 Night shift: 23:30 - 07:00 (36.25 hours worked – 40 hours paid) Entry salary: 24,52$/hour with evening premium 0.80$/h and night premium 1,50$/h. Salary after 36 months of service: 29,00$/hour with evening premium 0.80$/h and night premium 1,50$/h.

Your responsibilities

  • Under the immediate authority of the Operation’s Supervisor, the candidate must meet production needs with respect to product quality, environment and health & safety aspects. The laborer is responsible for performing various tasks according to his assignment in any department of the manufacturing plant of distribution transformers. He will need to demonstrate his / her effectiveness and ability to carry out the responsibilities assigned to him in accordance with standard work instructions and product specifications. Without limitation, the following requirements provide an overview of the job:
  • Perform repetitive handling, lifting, assembling, mounting and packaging tasks.
  • Perform work standing, walking, lifting, pushing, pulling and bending frequently.
  • Look for work preparation, make the internal and external connections of the accessories.
  • Read and understand general assembly drawings, schematic, specs and production BOM.
  • Perform general tests, validations and measurements to provide a fault-free product.
  • Complete work orders, fulfill checklists and, if necessary, certain inspection documents.
  • Perform basic maintenance of his work equipment, keep his work area clean and tidy.
  • Meet and promote all standards, regulations or programs related to Health and Safety.
  • Assume all other related duties in accordance with the prescribed instructions and work methods, as directed by the foreman or his representative.

Your background

  • High School diploma completed.
  • Technical Diploma, including reading of plans (an asset).
  • Work experience in the manufacturing and industrial sector (an asset).
  • Ability to follow the Health and Safety rules and procedures in force.
  • Good physical conditions and ability to work standing for long periods of time.
  • Punctuality, reliability, ability to work in a team and ease of adaptation to several tasks.
  • Speed of execution, autonomy, and excellent learning ability.
  • Interpretation of drawings and sketches, functional French and basic math skills.
  • Have the attention to details, be able to combine a high level of quality and efficiency.
  • Common manufacturing tools workmanship, use and interpretation of basic measuring instruments.
  • Availability to work on an evening shift, night shift and sometimes the weekend.
  • As part of this job offer, the male gender is used as a gender neutral, including men and women.

More about us

Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible and secure whilst balancing social, environmental and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 38,000 people in 90 countries. In fiscal year 2020 we generated business volumes of around $10 billion USD as reported by Hitachi. www.hitachienergy.com Hitachi Energy values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. We are committed to employment equity and believe in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Hitachi Energy actively encourages applications from women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities and visible minorities. Hitachi Energy encourages applicants to self-identify in the application process and is prepared to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. Only selected applicants will be contacted.

Québec, QC, Quebec, Canada

Full-Time

Manufacturing/Production Workers

title: Production Worker
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!


Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.


We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.


We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.


Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

Coke Canada Bottling Production workers are responsible for general duties involving physical handling of product, materials, supplies and cooler service equipment.

Responsibilities

  • Set up machinery ensuring all production materials are available
  • Operate and monitor equipment and replenish materials as needed
  • Visually inspect production run and document results
  • Determine and report malfunctions to appropriate parties
  • Maintain cleanliness of equipment and assigned area
  • Ensure compliance with regulatory and company policies and procedures
  • Standing for extended periods, walking, lifting, climbing, crouching, bending, reaching and stooping

Qualifications

  • High School Diploma or GED preferred
  • 1-3 year of general work experience required
  • Prior production/manufacturing machine operation experience preferred
  • Previous experience within high-speed industrial environment
  • Ability to operate manufacturing equipment
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time and complete repetitive tasks
  • Knowledge of industrial technology a plus

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.


Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

<span style="font-family:"Calibri",sans-serif">For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: newGeneral Labourer - Seasonal job ($20.25/h - $22/h + OT++) *N...
description:
Company Description


NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED. We are searching for bright, hard-working and reliable individuals interested in a successful career in manufacturing. Take your chance and come join us!

FROM APRIL TO END OF AUGUST

  • Morning shift (Monday - Thursday 5h30AM to 5h30PM)
  • Night Shift (Monday - Thursday 5h30 PM to 5h30 AM)
  • Week-end Shift (Friday - Sunday 5h30 AM to 5h30 PM)

Interested? Here is how you can apply (NO CV REQUIRED):

  • Apply by phone to this number: 1 877-832-4625 ext. 2
  • Apply online right now

Here is why you must join Techo-Bloc:

  • Competitive salary
  • Starting basic hourly rate $19.75/hour and $20.25/hour at the end of the probation period
  • Overtime opportunities
  • Shift Premiums available
  • Overtime opportunities
  • Several shift options available (day, evening, weekend)
  • Weekly pay
  • Career path opportunities – move to production, distribution, maintenance, transportation or supervisory roles

Other benefits we offer:

  • On-site training and additional courses available such as forklift certification (if it`s a work requirement)
  • Free Parking
  • Epic barbecues

Job Description


Snapshot of your day to day

Are you a diligent worker that loves to work with your hands and you are looking for a stimulating and well-paid job? This is the right place for you!

At Techo-Bloc, our general laborers are a crucial part to our day to day operations. This role is a perfect fit for those newer to the industry, or anyone looking for a career steppingstone in manufacturing.

Speaking of stones, our laborers are true concrete connoisseurs! Your day-to-day will entail handling and inspecting concrete blocks, while serving as the ‘right hand’ to our machine operator and maintenance team.

  • Complete examination of finished product by checking height, shape, color and consistency by applying knowledge of proper company standards as instructed and applicable for in process systems;
  • Complete block checks, remove any defective pieces from pallet or board and replace defective pieces with quality pieces. These tasks vary by line and by product and process that the General Labourer is assigned to;
  • Sort, pack, crate and package materials and products;
  • Performs other laboring and elemental activities;
  • Clean machines and immediate work areas.

Qualifications
  • No experience required, training will be provided;
  • You will be using your manual skills. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds (23kg). We won’t hide it from you, this is a physically demanding position;
  • Manual dexterity, hand-eye co-ordination and a combination of sitting, standing and walking required;
  • Punctuality, concentration and thoroughness;
  • Team spirit and collaboration.

Additional Information


Headquartered on the South Shore of Montreal, Techo-Bloc is a leader in outdoor landscape products. We passionately create new products to allow all design enthusiasts to transform ordinary spaces into exceptional spaces.

Why work for Techo-Bloc, you may ask? We listen and respect our employees and encourage them to make an impact. We love talent and people who are ready to roll up their sleeves to get the job done. If you're looking to put your knowledge, experience and passion into play, this is the place for you. We celebrate change, welcome your bold initiatives, and support you in bringing them to life. Our company has grown rapidly and this is just the beginning. Come join one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies and make this your next big move. You will not be disappointed!

title: Production Entry
description:
Job Description- Shift Production/Machine Operator (12 Hr Shift Work)


Best known for its corporate symbol of the Pink Panther and a Fortune 500 company for more than 50 years, Owens Corning produces various building products for residential and commercial markets. We are currently seeking safety-oriented Packaging Line Attendants for our Edmonton fiberglass insulation plant.


Starting as a Packaging Attendant, you will be responsible for:

  • Working in a manner that ensures your safety and the safety of others around you.
  • Operating high speed product packaging equipment in a world class manufacturing facility.
  • Playing an integral role in quality control through visual inspection.
  • Developing your skills as you move through our lines of progression system into increasingly more challenging roles.


What we offer:

  • Starting rate of $23.88/hour plus applicable shift premium as defined in our Collective Agreement. Rate increases to $28.11 /hour plus shift premium after one year of employment.
  • Full family benefits.
  • Various lines of progression and opportunity for advancement.
  • An opportunity to join an outstanding manufacturing organization.


What we require:

  • Minimum High School diploma or equivalent required
  • Proof of legal authorization to work in Canada
  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Current safety training will be an asset
  • Pre-employment baseline medical evaluation
  • Pre-employment background check.
  • Shift schedule is continental 4-shift. All shifts are 12 hours.


Why work at Owens Corning?

At Owens Corning, we believe our competitive advantage lies in the strength and talents of our employees.

  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Competitive base salaries
  • Competitive Benefits and Company Pension
  • Please note that our facility is not on a bus route. Reliable tranportation and a driving licence is a must.

While we appreciate the interest of all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: General Laborer
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!


Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.


We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.


We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.


Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity


Status : Full Time temporary to start

Location: 2750 blvd de l’Assomption, Montreal, QC H1N 2G9

Wage : Start at $20/hr and increase as per the CBA

Schedule

  • Evening, Monday to Friday, 2 pm to 10h30 pm
  • Overnight, Sunday to Thursday, 10pm to 6h30 am


As a General Labourer, Warehouse you will be responsible for physically handling products, materials, supplies and equipment. Using an electric/manual pallet jack, you will pick our customers order based on the information you have in your handheld scanner. Once your pallet/order is complete you ensure it is wrapped, labelled and prepared to be shipped.

Responsibilities

  • Prepare orders based on provided summary to accurately build orders for loading onto delivery trucks.
  • Where applicable, utilize voice picking software to build orders at or above company standards for productivity and accuracy.
  • Responsible for building, accurate, quality product orders, and ensuring they are secure for transport before being loaded into the truck for delivery to Coke Canada Bottling customers.
  • Capable of operating industrial powered equipment such as pallet jacks and hand trucks.
  • Responsible for meeting daily productivity requirements.
  • Move product and/or materials manually as required
  • Responsible for staging completed pallets in designated shipping areas.
  • Consistently bending, kneeling, climbing and lifting 50+ pounds

Qualifications

  • Must be fluent in French
  • High School Diploma Preferred;
  • Prior warehouse/production/equipment service experience
  • Ability to operate a manual / powered pallet jack or lift product
  • Demonstrated attention to detail
  • Forklift certification is a plus.

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada Bottling”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and drivers abstract review. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regards to this once you are contacted for further consideration.


Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

title: newPress Operator, Manufacturing
description:
A position at White Cap isn’t your ordinary job. You’ll work in an exciting and diverse environment, meet interesting people, and have a variety of career opportunities.
The White Cap family is committed to Building Trust on Every Job. We do this by being deeply knowledgeable, fully capable, and always dependable, and our associates are the driving force behind this commitment.
Job Summary
Responsible for operating 20 - 200 ton presses, while maintaining quality and ensuring that productivity standards are met.
Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities

  • Operates progressive die operation and other related job functions including coil replacements.
  • Assists in set ups as required including first off/ last off, perform necessary quality checks. Follow verbal instructions and job specifications as outlined in the associated work order.
  • Accurately document production reports, quality alerts and other related information in a timely manner.
  • Initiates continuous actions to improve all aspects of press operations.
  • Maintains condition of work area including scrap removal in press area, and ensuring that products are secured in their correct space.
  • Adheres to all workplace safety policies, compliances and regulations.
  • Other duties as assigned by the organization.

Nature and Scope

  • Refers complex, unusual problems to supervisor.
  • Under general supervision, exercises some judgment in accordance with well-defined policies, procedures, and techniques. Work typically involves regular review of output by a senior coworker or supervisor.
  • None.

Work Environment

  • Typically located in a comfortable environment but with regular exposure to factors that may cause noticeable discomfort or a moderate risk of accident or illness, such as temperature extremes, moving machinery, loud noises, and fumes.
  • Most of the time is spent sitting in the same position or standing/walking and/or there is some requirement to lift or handle material or equipment of moderate weight (8-20 pounds).
  • No travel required.

Education and Experience

  • HS Diploma or GED strongly preferred. Specialized skills training/certification may be required. Generally 2-5 years of experience in area of responsibility.

Preferred Qualifications
Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in a production environment.
  • Machine operator experience preferred.

If you’re looking to play a role in building America, consider one of our open opportunities. We can’t wait to meet you.
Functional Area Field Operations
Recruiter Williams, Victoria
Req ID WCJR-004555
White Cap is an Equal Opportunity Minority/Female/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veteran and Affirmative Action Employer. White Cap considers for employment and hires qualified candidates without regard to age, race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, protected veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: newQA Assistant
description:
Quality Assistant

Job Summary

The Quality Assistant performs a variety of administrative duties, maintaining records and preparing information by performing the following duties.

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Preparation of Products (wellheads, valves) data documentation packages
Daily data entry of production reports including material control sheets, NDE
reports, welding, material test reports, etc.
Organize and control the flow of records and documents
Validate production requirements to product specifications
Maintain hard copy and electronic files
Input/extract information to/from ECM database and SAP ERP.
Work as part of the team to ensure deadlines for assignments and projects are
being met
Provide support and liaise with the QC team and other manufacturing departments
Provide good customer service to internal and external clients
Focused on continuous improvement in all areas
Responsible for safety of self and others
Work safely and wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) in
accordance with any training, instruction, or company policies/procedures

Minimum Job Qualifications

Minimum High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED)
Proficient in Microsoft Office Familiarity with ISO 9001:2015 /API Q1 QMS standards and procedures Preferred
Project management certification and/or experience Preferred
Experience with SAP ERP tool Other
Detail-orientated and highly organized.
Ability to work in a team environment and communicate effectively with all the stakeholders.
Candidates must be able to legally work and reside in Canada, without sponsorship
This Office position interfacing within production/warehouse areas, which require safety glasses, safety shoes, a hardhat, a vest and possibly hearing protection.

title: Production Operator
description:
Positions available at Soucy Plastiques, Soucy International, Soucy Caoutchouc, Soucy Rivalair and Soucy Belgen


WHY JOIN US?

  • Permanent, full-time position
  • Shift: evening, night and weekend shifts
  • Salary: up to $26.00/hr depending on skills and experience
  • Varied shift premium: up to $2.50/hr depending on the shift
  • Group insurance (different plans adapted to your needs)
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan
  • Personal and floating vacations
  • Employee and family assistance program
  • Safe work environment
  • Social activities.

HOW WILL YOU BE SPENDING YOUR TIME?

Do you like active, manual and varied work in a manufacturing environment? We have a great opportunity for you!

  • Operate various machines to mold rubber tracks, plastic, cast iron or metal parts;
  • Prepare the raw material for the production of parts;
  • Mould, dismantle and finish the different parts.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • To be physically fit;
  • Ability to read blueprints, write and interpret information related to manufacturing processes.

Even if you have little experience, don't hesitate to send us your application, our team will be there for you!


WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR TO APPLY?

We look forward to getting to know you and working with you!

title: Production Worker
description:
About the Company

Canada Royal Milk is the only producer of infant formula in Canada, manufacturing quality products from Canadian cow and goat milk, ensuring the highest quality and nutritional value for our customers.

We are an international company with a multicultural workforce that is committed to diversity and inclusion. Our team members value and embrace different perspectives and new ideas.

What We Offer

The opportunity to build and grow a progressive company, competitive wages, and extended health benefits.

What We Look For

Curiosity, commitment to learning, and a winning mindset.

Location: Kingston, Ontario

About the Role

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, with frequent interaction with the Production Manager, the Technician has significant responsibility for product quality and safety. The Technician ensures adherence to quality, safety, and regulatory requirements and safely operates dairy processing equipment. All work will be conducted to GMP quality standards and CIP system while maintaining a safe and sanitary work environment within HACCP protocols.

The Technician maintains the production of a uniform product that meets all safety and quality standards. Attention to detail and communication are essential to the milk receiving and pre-treatment processes.

The Technician will be cross-trained in other operational areas once they have attained mastery of the equipment.

Job Requirements

Education: Post-secondary education in a related field is preferred

Experience: Production experience (i.e. operator, technician, laborer, etc.) in a manufacturing environment or in a food processing/manufacturing environment is preferred

Key Duties and Responsibilities

1. Understand the product flow from the milk silos to the packaging department;

2. The Operator must know the type of product, the silo source, and all handling procedures involved each time they begin the process;

3. Analyze process data and equipment performance data to improve quality, throughput, and troubleshoot;

4. Utilizing a continuous improvement mindset, assist in identifying opportunities to improve processes;

5. Master the plant Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for pasteurization, wet processing, dairy separation, HACCP, CIP, and the Site-clearing Management System;

6. Responsible for food safety, pre-requisite programs, and food quality related to designated areas;

7. Ensure all quality assurance checks are performed at designated intervals and all paperwork is done correctly and completely at designated intervals;

8. Maintain a safe, clean, and organized work area throughout the facility and common areas;

9. Make decisions in a timely manner;

10. Anticipate problems and implement solutions;

11. Assume responsibility for the attainment of plant goals and objectives;

12. Follow all GMP’s and work in a manner consistent with all corporate regulatory, food safety, quality, and sanitation requirements;

13. Other duties may be assigned.

Working Conditions

Canada Royal Milk is a 24 hours a day, 7 days a week operation. Rotating shift work (8-12h shifts) is required. Shift patterns are yet to be determined and will include days, evenings, weekends, statutory holidays, and overnight work. Employees must be flexible and willing to work a variety of shifts.

As a dairy processor and infant formula manufacturer, CRM strives to exceed regulatory requirements for food safety, quality, hygiene, and good manufacturing practices. All employees who enter the processing areas for any reason must comply with all food safety protocols in addition to health and safety best practices.

Working conditions are normal for a manufacturing environment and include:  

· Standing, walking, sitting, kneeling, bending, reaching, twisting and other physically demanding tasks performed for virtually the entire shift (12 hours)  

· Lifting to 25 kg (55 lbs) frequently   

· Use of various chemicals (i.e. detergents and sanitizing solutions)

· Possible exposure to dust, fumes, oils, unpleasant odors, noise levels that are distracting or uncomfortable, occasional exposure to ambient temperatures above 28 Celsius and high humidity

· Exposure to physical risks using standardized safety precautions and equipment, including, but not limited to slippery surfaces, working around high-temperature equipment, heavy and repetitive lifting, etc.

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion

We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities.

If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at www.canadaroyalmilk.com

Covid-19 Vaccination Policy

The health and safety of our employees and customers is a top priority for Canada Royal Milk. Therefore, applicants will only be considered who are fully vaccinated, subject to human rights considerations and recognized medical exemptions.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.25-$25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (required)
  • Overnight Shift (required)
  • Night Shift (required)

title: newGeneral Laborer
description:
Competitive Wages, Benefits, Pension, Work Boot Allowance and more. . . .

Burloak Tool & Die Ltd.

Burloak is known for superiority when producing complicated prototype parts for a large variety of industries. All tooling is designed in-house using (3-D) VISI software. We take pride in the fact that all the necessary tooling components including custom die shoes are machined in-house using our state-of-the-art CNC equipment.

Burloak designers have experience with machine design, automotive progressive dies, die transfer, and part development/prototypes. Burloak is the “go to” organization for quality parts, quick turn around and on-time delivery. Burloak has the ability to produce parts of any quantity while strictly adhering to drawing specifications and tolerances. Known for high quality prototype parts, it is a challenge to decipher if those parts were produced off hard tooling. Burloak provides a full in-house stamping facility. Presses and feed lines range from 40 Ton to 800 Ton.

Burloak's in-house stamping department not only provides our customer with quality parts, it also provides added value, with spot welding, surface coatings, a robotic weld cell and a full assembly line.

Burloak Tool & Die is currently hiring Operators for our automotive parts manufacturing facility located in Burlington.

As a General Laborer, you will be responsible for the following;

Primary Job Function & Responsibilities

  • Operation of Machinery ( eg, Press, Brake Press, Spot Welder, Saw used for the production of parts)
  • Assembly of production parts
  • Packaging of production parts in accordance with Packaging Instructions
  • Inform appropriate personnel of any problems encountered with machinery or product
  • Responsible for the quality of parts being produced
  • Responsible to follow process related instructions, procedures and requirements
  • Responsible for the identification of product in the work area
  • Responsible for cleanliness / housekeeping of work areas
  • Responsible for returning tools and equipment to designated storage area
  • Adheres to all Health & Safety Rules and Regulations
  • Adheres to all Plant Rules and other safe requests from supervisory personnel
  • Performing daily Pre-Start-Up Inspection on Equipment as required
  • Full understanding of Die Set-Ups, Operational Flow and production requirements
  • Any other duties as assigned by Press Shop Manager or Supervisor

Qualification Requirements: (Minimum Education & Experience)

  • Grade 10 Education or equivalent
  • Mechanical background preferred
  • 3 years Manufacturing experience working with dies and presses in an ISO environment
  • Experience working with feeders and decoilers
  • Knowledge of care and operation of propane and electric forklifts an asset
  • Basic knowledge of measuring equipment, tools and fixtures

Safety Requirements: (Training and Physical Demands Analysis)

  • Must be able to sit, or stand for long periods of time
  • Must be able to bend, kneel and twist
  • Exposure to dust, fumes, gases, changes in temperature and humidity
  • Able to lift and carry equipment or parts
  • WHMIS Training is required
  • Forklift Training may be required
  • Overhead Crane Training may be required
  • Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) Training is required
  • Able to lift 40lbs

We thank all candidates for their submissions and will be contacting applicants selected for interviews on a rolling basis starting immediately.

The place of work is our office in Burlington, ON near Walker’s Line & 403 QEW. Free parking. Burloak is an accessible workplace and we welcome applications from people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, that can be arranged for any part of the selection process for this position. We welcome applicants from all walks of life.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Burlington, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

title: Factory Laborer
description:
Are you looking to join a team which is built to last, with a strong history and tradition spanning over the years? Do you dream of mountains, lakes and wide open spaces, like those offered by Estrie? Would you like to settle down in a city known as one of the jewels of the Eastern Townships, but all you need is just a little push? It’s taken care of! We pay for your move, up to a maximum of $5,000 [*[1]]*

JOB DESCRIPTION

  • Operate a variety of equipment used in the fabrication of monuments and landscaping projects.
  • Handle granite pieces of all sizes using a bridge crane.
  • Perform quality control of all pieces throughout the manufacturing process.

JOB PROFILE

The candidate we are looking will be a person ready to thrive in a stable environment where he or she can rely on proven work methods to achieve his or her goals. Rock of Ages is proud to uphold its tradition of providing quality training through the support of its team members in a work environment where both French and English are widely spoken. Are you interested? We’d love to meet you!

BENEFITS

  • Salary based on experience and position, up to $25.26/hour.
  • Evening shift premium: $1/hour.
  • Daytime schedule: 6:30 am to 4 pm (Monday to Thursday) and 6:30 am to 12 pm (Friday);
  • Evening hours, from 4 pm to 2 am (Monday to Thursday).
  • Group insurance, pension plan, employee assistance program and telemedicine platform.

For more information, visit our website at www.rockofages.com or check out our social media pages on Facebook, LinkedIn and Instagram.

ABOUT ROCK OF AGES – A POLYCOR INC. COMPANY

Rock of Ages is a company of Polycor Inc. Polycor Inc. is the global leader in the natural stone industry, and its primary mission is to make people fall in love again with this timeless material. Our international reputation stems from the considerable legacy we have cultivated through our stonework on various historical sites, as well as institutional, commercial, and residential projects. Founded in Quebec (Canada) in 1987, the company currently employs nearly 1,300 people and owns more than 50 stone quarries and 20 manufacturing plants throughout North America and Europe.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Any experience deemed equivalent will be considered. Please note that Polycor Inc. is committed to employment equity, and all submissions will be processed confidentially. We will only contact those individuals whose applications are under consideration. Words importing the masculine gender include the feminine and have been used in order to simplify the text.

[1]Certain conditions apply. See our policies for more information.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.21-$25.26 per hour

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • No weekends

title: Production Worker
description:
Job Description

Come build the future with us! Masco Canada has immediate openings! We are seeking passionate individuals to join our rapidly growing production team.

We are currently hiring for the following shifts:

  • Days - Monday to Friday, 7:00am - 3:30pm

  • Afternoons – Monday to Thursday, 3:30pm - 1:30am

  • Midnights – Sunday to Friday, 11pm – 7am

What’s in It for You?

Our Pay:

  • Wages range from $19.33 – $20.21 per hour, plus shift premium

  • Shift premiums are $0.85/hour on the afternoon shift, and $1.35/hour on the midnight shift

  • Rate increases to $20.56 – $23.22 per hour after completion of probation period of 60 working days

Our Benefits:

  • COVID-19 Vaccination is not required

  • Employee Benefits Program including health, dental, short-term disability, and basic life insurance

  • Virtual Healthcare provided through Dialogue

  • Employee Pension Program

  • Employee Assistance Program

  • Employee Discount Program, Employee Store and Dell Discount Program

  • Annual Safety Boot Allowance

  • Vacation time, plus 9 Stat Holidays, and 3 Masco Holidays

  • Enhanced COVID protocols

  • Growth opportunities!

Who you are:

  • Passionate about encouraging a safe work environment and conducting safe working practices

  • Keen eye for quality and service delivery

  • A collaborative teammate with strong understanding of what your work means to the end customer

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Excellent organizational skills

  • Attention to detail and accuracy

  • Active listening

  • Good communication and interpersonal skills

  • Problem solving and decision making

  • Passion & initiative

  • Ability to work in a team environment

  • High school diploma an asset but not a requirement

  • Previous Manufacturing experience is an asset but not a requirement

Masco Canada (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and we want to have the best available persons in every job. The Company makes employment decisions only based on merit. It is the Company’s policy to prohibit discrimination in any employment opportunity (including but not limited to recruitment, employment, promotion, salary increases, benefits, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment) based on race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, pregnancy, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, physical/mental disability, medical condition, marital/domestic partner status, military and veteran status, height, weight or any other such characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. The Company is committed to complying with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. This commitment applies to all persons involved in the operations of the Company regardless of where the employee is located and prohibits unlawful discrimination by any employee of the Company.

title: newManufacturing Labourer
description:
W.R. Davis Engineering Limited (Davis) is a dynamic mid-sized company specializing in the design of infrared (IR) signature solutions for both naval and aerospace platforms. Davis performs ground-up design, development and manufacturing at our Ottawa, Canada facility. More background may be found at www.davis-eng.com.

Daily Tasks include:

  • Assist with metal forming rollers
  • Assist with fitting of metal pieces
  • Assist welders as required
  • Maintain cleanliness of shop
  • Hand tools power tools asset
  • Assist with passivation of completed metal fixtures
  • Trained as fork lift driver (an asset)
  • Obtain and maintain Controlled Goods Clearance (through Davis)
  • Other related duties as required

Knowledge & Requirements:

  • Familiar with metal working hand tools, grinding, sanding, and drilling
  • Must have physical strength
  • Hand-eye coordination and endurance
  • Laborers must be able to concentrate on their tasks
  • Work as a member of a team
  • The ability to understand and communicate information
  • Strong desire to learn new skills
  • Work within company Health & Safety requirements

We thank you for your interest in this role. Please note that only those qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Pay: $20.00-$23.00 per hour

title: Production Chemist 1
description:
Company Overview and Values:

Why work at Entegris?

Lead. Inspire. Innovate. Define Your Future.

Not everyone who works for a global company shares the same background, experiences and perspectives. We leverage the differences of our employees to bring new ideas to the table. Every employee throughout the company is encouraged to share input on projects and initiatives. Our decision making process is truly a collaborative effort as we realize there are leaders at every level of the organization. We put our values at the core of how we operate as an organization — not just when it’s convenient, but in a lasting and meaningful way. We want the time and energy you spend here to have a positive impact on your life inside and outside of the office.

Entegris is a values-driven culture and our employees rally around our core PACE values:

People
Accountability

Creativity
Excellence

The Role:

Entegris is seeking a talented and enthusiastic Production Chemist for our facility in Toronto.


This role supports the Production Department in manufacturing, purifying and packaging materials with hands-on assistance especially with, but not limited to, air/moisture sensitive materials and materials produced in low volumes.


The Production Chemist will work 12 hour shifts (3 days/week then 4 days/week) on a monthly rotation of days and nights.


We are open to training a motivated person with limited manufacuring or chemical experience!


In this role you will:
  • Independently run chemical reactions following a procedure in a safe manner.
  • Be responsible for manufacturing of chemicals according to predefined procedures and within health and safety operating procedures.
  • Maintain a rigid adherence to production specifications and procedures.
  • Maintain strict compliance with housekeeping protocol, and Health & Safety requirements.
  • Ensure that all required documentation is current, complete and accurate.
  • Develop and maintain thorough understanding of chemicals used in manufacturing, production procedures and underlying chemistry.
  • Support team members with your sound understanding and demonstration of safe operations in the plant.
  • Complete associated documentation for ISO, customer and production files.
  • Perform analytical testing; inspect and maintain production equipment as required.
  • Be required to perform shift and weekend work in 24/7 operations.
Traits we believe make a strong candidate:
  • B.Sc. degree in chemistry or college diploma in chemical technology or a related field OR experience in a manufacturing facility working with chemicals or other materials
  • Strong interpersonal and team communication skills
  • Strict attention to detail at all times (following procedures, documentation, equipment usage, chemical storage/disposal/handling)
  • Ability to thrive in a diverse, collaborative environment
  • Technical Competence/Skills
  • Enthusiasm for acquiring new skills
  • Dedication to excellence
  • Being respectful of team members and forming productive partnerships
  • The ability to propose new solutions and implement new ways to add value
  • Can demonstrate a safety-first working environment and actively contribute to a safe working environment
  • Experience in a chemical manufacturing plant is considered an asset
Your success will be measured by:
Performing all activities in ways that demonstrate the PACE Entegris values at all times. ( People and Teamwork; Accountability, Integrity, and Trust; Creativity and Innovation; Dedication to E)
What we offer::
Our total rewards package goes above and beyond just a paycheck. Whether you’re looking to build your career, improve your health, or protect your wealth, we offer generous benefits to help you achieve your goals.
  • Very Competitive total compensation plans.
  • A 401(K) plan to help you plan for your future with an impressive employer match that’s all yours- no vesting!
  • Great health, dental and vision insurance packages to fit your needs to ensure you’re happy and healthy.
  • A progressive PTO policy that empowers our employees to take the time they need to recharge!
At Entegris we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. Our policy is to recruit, hire, train, and reward employees for their individual abilities, achievements and experience without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, marital or military status.
Entegris strongly encourages all of its employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19. At Entegris, COVID-19 vaccination is preferred but not required at this time.

title: Warehouse Worker - UNION BC
description:
At Saputo, our best comes from our people. We’re a talented and caring team with a longstanding history of excellence. Since our first days delivering cheese on a bicycle, we’ve grown into a leading global dairy processor by staying true to the culture that defines us. Each of our employees is committed to uphold our tradition of care, quality, and passion through food, and together, we foster an environment where we can all make contributions that matter–from our manufacturing plants to our office locations and everywhere in-between.
We’re currently hiring at our new state of the art facility in Port Coquitlam!
At Saputo, our best comes from our people. We’re a talented and caring team with a longstanding history of excellence. Since our first days delivering cheese on a bicycle, we’ve grown into a leading global dairy processor by staying true to the culture that defines us. Each of our employees is committed to uphold our tradition of care, quality, and passion through food, and together, we foster an environment where we can all make contributions that matter–from our manufacturing plants to our office locations and everywhere in-between.
This position offers up to 4 shifts, 36 hours per week. Our facility operates 24/7; on-call shift work is required. Full time opportunities will be posted and awarded by seniority as they become vacant.
How you will make contributions that matter:
With your team you will:
  • Participate and learn through in-house on the job training
  • Manually picking orders, building and wrapping skids, using Vocollect Talkman headset
  • Perform manual lifting, stacking, pulling loading and unloading of dairy cases (up to approx. 50lbs)
  • Load and unload various size trailers using a forklift
  • Participate in the setup, takedown and sanitation of all parts and equipment when required
  • Working with, and near sanitizing chemicals (i.e. high concentrations of acids and alkalis)
  • Perform other duties as assigned
You are best suited for the role if you have the following qualifications:
This position is for you if you:
  • Are physically able to stand for long periods of time and perform repetitive movements
  • Can lift up to 50LBS on a regular basis and perform physically demanding tasks
  • Operate electric power jack, counterbalance & high reach forklifts, clamp truck. Experience is preferred, but not required
  • Can work in a temperate and / or refrigerated environment
  • Already have experience in production / warehousing (asset but not required)
  • Learn quickly and you are responsible for your own work
  • Like working as a team and communicate well with your colleagues
  • Hold a Class 1 license (considered an asset)
#LI-DNI
We support and care for our employees and their families by providing:
  • Starting rate at $27.62/hr. 5% increases every 1000hrs up to $36.82/hr
  • Advantageous corporate agreements
  • Full benefits after 1000hrs worked
  • Excellent vacation policy, long term employees can get up to 7 weeks’ vacation per year
  • Group retirement pension plan with employer contribution
  • Purchase option of company stocks
  • Group RRSP
  • Health and wellness program in the workplace
  • Assistance program for employees and their families
  • On-site physiotherapy
Our story began in Canada in 1954, when the Saputo family's hard work and dedication created a thriving dairy business. More than 65 years later, our roots in this country remain strong with our Corporate Headquarters in Montréal. Today, we are a leading cheese manufacturer and fluid milk and cream processor in Canada with well-loved brands, such as Saputo, Alexis de Portneuf, Armstrong, Baxter, Dairyland, Joyya, Milk2Go, Milk2Go Sport, Neilson, Nutrilait, Scotsburn* and Woolwich Goat Dairy. Thanks to our national footprint, we're proud to bring our best to our customers and consumers, and have plenty of opportunities for our employees to grow in their own way. And we do it while also striving to build a healthier future for our people and the communities where we operate, guided by our values and the Saputo Promise.
Join the Saputo Dairy Products Canada team to make your contributions matter every day!

title: newOrder Entry Clerk
description:
Are you a systematic data entry expert? Jumpstart your career as an Order Entry Clerk and take charge of purchase and sales orders entry into the recycling management system, as well as completing other related administrative tasks for the Contract Planning and Fulfillment team.

Why work here?

Competitive Salary

Permanent, full-time position

Benefits

RRSP

Responsibilities:

  • Input and interpret purchase and sales requests from the commercial team
  • Keep track of internal spreadsheets with market pricing specific to supplier’s contract terms.
  • Follow up and monitor changes (such as quantity & pricing) to the orders & update the scrap management system on a regular basis
  • Distribute copies of the recycling orders & any required documents to suppliers, customers & appropriate internal departments in a timely fashion.
  • Perform other ad hoc duties as needed
  • Creates and generates various recycling orders & receiving reports.
  • Liaise with the dispatch, operations & finance departments to ensure order completion.

Qualifications:

  • 1 year or more experience in a similar role
  • Knowledgeable in MS Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Keen attention to detail, organizational & interpersonal skills
  • Ability to effectively communicate & prioritize in a fast-paced team environment.
  • A proactive approach to problem-solving with strong decision-making skills
  • Knowledge of identifying metal alloys is an asset, but not required
  • Some College or University with a focus on Administration is required

Interested in taking the next steps? Apply to this job post with your updated resume!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $45,000.00-$55,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Experience:

  • order entry clerk: 1 year (required)
  • MS Office: 3 years (required)

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
Summary

Reporting to the VP Engineering, the Manufacturing Engineer develops and implements optimal cost-effective manufacturing processes and methods. Recommends and implements improvements to production processes, methods and controls. Coordinates manufacturing launch for new or revised products and carries out process improvement, problem resolution, project management and employee training. In addition the incumbent will research, design and develop manufacturing processes including production flow, assembly methods and production equipment and cost-justifies various tools, machinery and equipment for recommended manufacturing methods.

Job Responsibilities

  • Setup and operate multi axis milling machines
  • Interpret customer drawings and specifications
  • Creation of BOM’s, process and control plans
  • Maintain engineering change management and revision control
  • Perform root cause analysis and implement effective corrective actions
  • Provide organizational technical support
  • Communicate and provide technical support to customers

Work Conditions

  • Ability to attend and conduct presentations
  • Ability to physically implement designs
  • Overtime as required
  • Weekend work may be required

Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as a manufacturing engineer in a high mix manufacturing environment.
  • Expertise in process development preferred
  • Excellent planning, organizational, project management skills
  • Diligent and detail oriented
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong leadership abilities
  • Must be self-motivated, but a strong team player

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: Factory Laborer
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!


Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.


We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.


We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.


Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

Work Schedule: Full Time, rotation shift between day, evening, overnight

Location : 1515 46th Ave, Lachine, Quebec H8T 2N8

Wage : Start at $20/h , increase as per the Collective Bargaining Agreement

Premium : Evening $1.25/h and overnight $1.50/h


Coke Canada Bottling Production workers are responsible for general duties involving physical handling of product, materials, supplies. As needed, you will support the warehouse department with the preparation of orders.

Responsibilities

  • Set up machinery ensuring all production materials are available
  • Operate and monitor equipment and replenish materials as needed
  • Visually inspect production run and document results
  • Determine and report malfunctions to appropriate parties
  • Maintain cleanliness of equipment and assigned area
  • Ensure compliance with regulatory and company policies and procedures
  • Prepare orders based on provided summary to accurately build orders for loading onto delivery trucks.

Qualifications

  • Must be able to communication in French
  • High School Diploma or GED preferred
  • 1-3 year of general work experience required
  • Previous experience within high-speed industrial environment
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time and complete repetitive tasks
  • Ability to lift up to 50 + pounds
  • Prior production/manufacturing machine operation experience preferred

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.
