title: Assembler
description:
At Hitachi Energy, our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation

Hitachi Energy Transformers is a global leader in technology, and the largest supplier of transformers in the world. We are pioneering the digitalization of transformers, while working on the frontier of renewable energy and ultra-high voltage AC & DC applications. Several positions to be filled Salary/hour: $37.36

Your responsibilities

  • Perform assembly work in conjunction with and under the supervision of the operator in the following tasks:
  • Assembly and connection of transformers
  • Assembly and disassembly of transformers
  • Final mechanical assembly, packaging disassembly, and shipping
  • Assembly of brackets and wiring
  • Handling of chemical products
  • Complete the required check sheets and documentation.

Your background

  • Diploma of Vocational Studies (one-year training or less)
  • Knowledge and skills gained from previous experience (1-year experience)
  • Manual dexterity, accuracy, and attention to details
  • Responsible for materials and equipment when handling
  • Problem-solving
  • Degree in welding is considered an asset

More about us

Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible and secure whilst balancing social, environmental and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 38,000 people in 90 countries. We are committed to employment equity and believe in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Hitachi Energy encourages applicants to self-identify in the application process and is prepared to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. title: newProcurement Specialist
description:
PROCUREMENT SPECIALIST

The Opportunity

Al-Pac is seeking an experienced and highly motivated Procurement professional to join the Materials Management team, working out of the Pulp Mill site. The Procurement Specialist will play an important role in developing, implementing, and maintaining strategic procurement processes to support the growth of the company. The position is accountable for creating extensive and detailed requirements specifications for the required products/services, tendering with potential suppliers, evaluating competing bids and negotiating prices. Reporting to the Business Unit Leader, Materials Management, this position will partner with senior leaders to recommend solutions and deliver on the needs of each business unit and ensure fulfillment in accordance with the SCM operational model.

The ideal candidate will have knowledge of the local, national, and international supply chain, knowledge and understanding of Indigenous peoples and cultures, and strong understanding of materials and services procurement. We are looking for a professional with strong communication and collaboration skills, client service orientation, and the ability to manage multiple priorities and complexities effectively.

This is a full-time, permanent position. The successful candidate will receive a competitive annual salary including paid pension and matching RRSP program, 4-week’s annual vacation, company paid dental and extended health benefits, and many additional employee incentives. Relocation assistance is also available for those who will need to move into the local area.

Responsibilities:

  • Procurement – Leading Business Unit Stakeholders and Buyers in building appropriately detailed requirements and specifications for the required products/services; build upon existing initiatives and developing new successful procurement tools and programs in pursuit of world class procurement efficiency and effectiveness; provide technical procurement expertise and guidance within the organization and particularly to Buyers
  • Contract Management – Identify requirements and write specifications for existing and new contracts; review contracts and agreements, editing and negotiating changes, being the first tier approver of such and submitting for final approval to appropriate level of leadership
  • Sourcing - Collect and analyze the key cost drivers, market dynamics and issues, areas of innovation, and alternative suppliers, in consultation with business unit leaders to provide solid market information for decision making
  • Stakeholder Engagement – Partnering with stakeholders, finding out their needs/issues/concern and responding to promote understanding and commitment; developing strategic procurement solutions; assist buyers with stakeholder engagement

Education & Experience:

  • Post-secondary degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, or in another related field.
  • 7-10 years’ relevant experience in manufacturing, forestry, transportation, logistics, Customer Service, or Supply Chain Management
  • Experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining strategic procurement processes
  • Experience in inventory planning / management, supply chain concepts, and related methodologies
  • Experience in contract and competitive bid legislation
  • Proven multi-tasking skills to handle multiple concurrent work items in dynamic environment, under tight deadlines and requirements; strong decision-making skills and ability to work independently.
  • Strong understanding of materials and services procurement as well as contracting and contract deliverables.
  • Global procurement and logistics experience considered an asset

Competencies:

  • Manages complexity Interpersonal Savvy
  • Communicates effectively Customer Focus
  • Business Insight & Financial Acumen Persuasion
  • Ensures accountability

Please forward your resume in confidence. This Position will be considered open until filled.

Successful external applicants must provide government issued proof of full vaccination for COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Proof of vaccination for COVID-19 will be requested upon acceptance of an offer of employment. Please note that for Alberta residents, only the government issued QR code is accepted as proof of vaccination.

Al-Pac is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We wish to express our thanks to all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position; however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Profit sharing
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift

title: Assembly Engineer
description:
Who we’re looking for

Toyota’s Assembly Production Engineering department is looking for a passionate and highly motivated Engineer.

The primary responsibility of this role is to lead assembly new vehicle manufacturing introduction in assigned areas through various phases including strategic planning, simultaneous engineering, process planning, process preparation, pre-production trials, refurbishment, and kaizen across North America Manufacturing companies.

Reporting to the Manager, the person in this role will work with a cross functional team to support departmental and manufacturing objectives for safety, quality, productivity, cost, and team member morale.

Note: This requisition will be used to fill multiple positions at various levels and locations. TMMK, TMMI, TMMMS, MTMUS, TMMC, TMMTX

What you’ll be doing

  • Developing new model introduction strategies including process improvement plans, new and modified plant layouts, capacity analysis, investment requirements, and project justifications with return on investment.

  • Conducting simultaneous engineering with styling, design, logistic services, manufacturing, and equipment suppliers to influence new model designs for innovative, efficient, world class manufacturing processes.

  • Leading process development through design, machine specification, equipment procurement, installation, safety risk assessments, process and production trials, quality and productivity confirmation, and handover to manufacturing.

  • Supporting manufacturing innovation and implementation in several disciplines including new materials introduction, quality inspection, logistics and part delivery, automation, electrification, digital engineering, and manufacturing industry 4.0.

  • Planning and leading onsite equipment modifications during non-production time including weekends and holidays. Travel as needed to support onsite investigations, modifications, and milestone meetings.

  • Working both independently and in a team environment to support overall project activities and milestones.

  • Interacting with multiple customers and outside groups including part suppliers, facilities engineering, equipment suppliers, program managers, accounting and finance, manufacturing, maintenance, and others to collaborate, resolve issues, and provide status (Assembly Manufacturing Pilot, Plant Facilities, etc.) to divide responsibilities and resolve conflicts.

What you bring

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Engineering Tech Degree or Engineering related experience

  • JL14 Level: Entry level positions including new college graduates and maintenance related experience

  • JL15 Level: Minimum of 2 years engineering experience in manufacturing design or manufacturing model change readiness and launch or equipment sourcing & installation.

  • JL16 Level: Minimum of 4 years production engineering experience and/or automotive manufacturing, design or manufacturing model change readiness and launch and/or equipment sourcing & installation.

  • Ability to work overtime up to 30% when required (weekends, holidays, and across multiple shifts to support equipment modification and installation projects)

  • Ability to travel up to 30% when required (domestically and internationally)

  • This position requires driving. A motor vehicle record that’s acceptable by company standards is required for this position

What you may bring (Preferred Experience)

  • Digital engineering knowledge; example CATIA, AutoCad, Etc.

  • Automation experience including specification, design, equipment procurement, and installation

  • Project management skills including scheduling, budgeting, coordinating, problem solving, and reporting

  • Automotive pre-production or manufacturing engineering experience

  • Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) familiarity skills

  • Simultaneous Engineering experience

  • Internal Logistics experience including route planning, simulations and analysis, packaging, and automation

  • New technology development experience including benchmarking, experimentation, trial, and introduction to manufacturing

  • Information systems integration and data networking, analytics, and visualization for manufacturing needs (MIoT).

What we’ll bring

During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:

  • Competitive salary, shift premiums and over-time pay rates, on top of base rate.

  • Exceptional Total Rewards Package

  • Training, development, and growth opportunities

  • Tuition Reimbursement Program

  • Free onsite fitness facility

  • Employee and family vehicle discounts

  • Social and team sport events

  • Full service cafeterias including Tim Horton’s and Panago

Belonging at Toyota

Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong. As a company that has been one of DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity and a member of The Billion Dollar Roundtable supporting minority and woman-owned suppliers for over 10 years, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business.

Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

What you should know

Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities; please advise us if you require an accommodation during the recruitment process.

To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.

title: newHuman Resources Agent
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

010851

Leader in the agrifood industry, proud of the impeccable quality of our products and our 15,000 employees, Olymel L.P. operates in Canada and in over 65 countries under the brand names Olymel, Lafleur and Flamingo.


POSITION TITLE: Human Resources Agent

SHIFT: Day

JOB STATUS: Full-time

ESTABLISHMENT: Brampton – Poultry processing plant

POSITION SUMMARY

Under the direction of the Human Resources Manager, the Human Resources Agent will perform the recruitment function for administrative and unionized employees and related support by receiving resumes, interviewing, testing and conducting orientation sessions for qualified applicants for job openings. Furthermore, he/she will administer unionized insurance plans and ensure adherence to the collective agreement. The Human Resources Agent must also advise managers and employees on policies, programs, procedures and relevant legislation. Finally, the Human Resources Agent must have the ability to maintain data bases, create and maintain spreadsheets and assist employees with questions and concerns.


EDUCATION

  • A university degree and college diploma in human resources or a related field
  • Eligible or in process of becoming eligible for CHRP certification, an asset
  • 1-3 years’ experience, preference in food/general manufacturing environment


KNOWLEDGE / SKILLS

  • Excellent verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Good judgment and ability to work under pressure
  • Demonstrate a high degree of initiative and self-direction
  • Highly thorough, accurate, detail-oriented and well-organized team player
  • Demonstrated ability to exercise the utmost tact, discretion, confidentiality and diplomacy at all times
  • Solid organizational and effective time management skills combined with the ability to prioritize tasks to meet the demands and timelines of day-to-day operations
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft applications including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint and Access


KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Recruitment process for administrative and unionized employees
  • Prepare, maintain and post internal positions and transfers in accordance with CA
  • Assist in the delivery of orientation training
  • Serve as the Health and Safety, JHSC, First Aid support
  • Maintain and update information regarding employees on leave, including short/long term disability, parental/maternity and WSIB
  • Administer group insurance benefits for unionized employees
  • Create professional business letters, memos, reports
  • Schedule and organize meetings (book meeting space, assemble and distribute agendas and take minutes)
  • Maintain grievance records and filing
  • Maintain and conduct salaried birthdays, brunches, and other company events
  • Update and maintain training database and binders, provide information to departments requiring training information
  • Occasional receptionist duties
  • Other duties as assigned

Thank you for your consideration.

If you are not ready to apply or simply if you wish to know about our new posts, join our talent network by clicking here:

http://www.jobs.net/jobs/olymel/fr-ca/join

title: newProduction Worker
description:
[[title]]


LOCATION: [[filter4]] - [[filter5]] - [[filter1]]

DEPARTMENT: [[filter7]]

HR CONTACT: [[recruiterName]]


Advance your career with Tenaris!


At Tenaris, we are looking for individuals who are willing to take on challenges and work in a dynamic and high-performance environment. As a leading global manufacturer, Tenaris supplies steel pipe products and related services for the world’s energy industry and other industrial applications. Across Canada, we have operations in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, Estevan, Saskatchewan, Calgary, Red Deer, Grande Prairie, Ft. Saskatchewan, and Nisku, Alberta, offering many opportunities for personal and professional growth. With a local focus inside a global organization, we are committed to delivering value to customers that range from large established oil and gas companies to exciting new entrants to the market.


We are currently seeking Productions Workers for our Algoma Tubes Steel Mill in Sault Ste. Marie, ON. Production Workers are responsible for performing tasks such as shipping, pipe movements and operating production machinery in a safe and efficient manner according to applicable procedures, complying with defined quality standards.


WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU:

  • Extended Health & Dental Benefits
  • $18.00/hr starting rate of pay.
  • CSA Work Boot & Prescription Safety Glasses Allowance
  • Onsite Parking
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Gainshare Bonus
  • Pension Benefit Plan


POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Full Time Permanent
  • Shift Schedule (12hr Shifts, 28 day rotation).
  • High School Diploma or GED is a minimum requirement.
  • Candidates must successfully complete Fit & Drug testing, pre-employment medical and online assessments to be hired.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Carry out duties in an effective manner meeting productivity and efficiency standards.
  • Perform activities according to applicable procedures / work instructions.
  • Complete and maintain necessary records ensuring information accuracy.
  • Ensure proper use of the company assets, detecting and reporting malfunctions.
  • Attend and collaborate in training activities in order to maintain and increase the company knowledge.
  • Proactively suggest improvements and participate in continuous improvement activities.
  • Adhere to all safety, health, and environmental policies and procedures.
  • Able to respond and work extra hours when required.
  • Participate in meetings (H&S, communications, crew meetings)
  • Maintain a clean, safe, respectful and ordered work environment.
  • Reports hazards and supports implementing corrective action.
  • Abide by all Tenaris policies.omply with company policies and procedures


IDEAL:

  • This role involves a considerable amount of standing and walking (up to 12 hours per shift).
  • Must be able to lift, push, pull and carry up to 50 lbs. throughout the shift.
  • Must be comfortable working at various heights and willing to climb stairs.
  • Proven troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
  • Attention to detail and accuracy is very important.
  • Ability to listen, to express thoughts and ideas to others and present information, written and/or verbal in a clear, concise, logical manner.
  • Must be able to read, write and comprehend English work instructions.
  • Mechanical aptitude is necessary, plus a strong command of basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division).
  • Able to work independently with the ability to co-operate, assist others, maintains a positive attitude, builds relationships, and takes part in teams and committees.
  • Must work in a safe manner, following health and safety policies and procedures.

DIVERSITY & INCLUSION

As a global leader, our foundation was built on diversity in all its forms, including culture, gender, creed, race, nationality, and generation. With diversity among our people, we gain diverse thoughts, abilities and perspectives that keep us both innovative and competitive. Our diverse and inclusive workplace – rooted in our values of safety, ethics, transparency and open communication – brings together remarkable people and enables them to be themselves.With representation from across our Canadian operations, Tenaris has an active Diversity & Inclusion committee that is working to advance a diverse and inclusive workplace through strategic initiatives.


Tenaris is an equal opportunity employer, valuing diversity in employment. Tenaris is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require an accommodation for a disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please advise the Human Resources Department.


If your experience and knowledge match our requirements, please apply

Tenaris is an equal opportunity employer, valuing diversity in employment.

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those that match the criteria required for the desired profile will be contacted.


Visit our Careers Page

Follow us on LinkedIn

Follow us on Glassdoor

Like us on Facebook

Follow us on Instagram

title: newMachine Operator
description:
CASCADES FLEXIBLE PACKAGING


Cascades Flexible Packaging (CFP) is located in Mississauga, Ontario. The plant operates on a 24/7 basis with a mix of continental rotating shift work. CFP operates single and multi-layer blown film extruders, as well as, two world-class wide web flexo presses that manufacture printed film for a diverse range of end consumer applications. With a focus on sustainability and green initiatives, the plant continuously cultivates its safety program and strives for employee-driven improvements.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES


We are currently looking for Machine Operators to become a part of our team working in either our Extrusion or Press departments. We need people who care about the work they do, with a positive attitude, good attendance, quality-focused with strong attention to details.

  • In extrusion you will operate single, and multilayer blown film extruders and use blenders, vacuum loading systems, roll carts, skid wrappers and core cutters
  • In press you will operate gear and/or servo-based presses, work with inks for colour-matching, use core cutters, hand tools and pallet jacks to secure finished products on skids
  • Work as a team to follow production schedules, complete changeovers and meet production goals
  • Perform quality checks and report variances, ensure film sampling and follow quality standards
  • Participate in scheduled equipment PM’s and troubleshoot machine operation issues
  • Follow established safety protocols , wear all PPE and report health & safety hazards
  • Maintain clean and safe conditions around equipment and surrounding work area
  • All other duties as required by the supervisor

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Minimum of high school diploma or equivalent
  • 3+ years of machine operator experience required
  • Proficiency in reading, writing and basic math is a must
  • Basic computer skills for production data entry
  • Be able to lift up to 50lbs and standing for extended period
  • Available to work 12-hour monthly rotating shifts and some weekends

WHY WORK AT CASCADES

  • Starting wages $22+ depending on experience
  • Excellent company benefits package and RRSP plan
  • Profit Sharing Bonus twice a year
  • Free Uniforms & Safety Shoe Allowance
  • Career Advancement Opportunities

Cascades believes in the success of an inclusive organization that values diversity within its team. Use of the masculine in our communications refers equally to both men and women. All qualified candidates will be considered for this position in a fair manner.



Job Segment: Equipment Operator, Industrial, Machinist, Data Entry, Manufacturing, Administrative

title: Production Operator
description:
Production Operator **Sign-On Bonus**

BONUS*****BONUS****BONUS

One-time payout of $1500 (taxable) after 120 days of employment with Arclin.

Employee must be free of attendance, safety and performance infractions to qualify

****Pay Rate: $20.50 - $30.50/hour based on applicable experience****

Arclin – Cobourg is growing - Join our great Team!
Please click link below to apply:

https://www.arclin.com/careers

***Benefits***

· Employee Incentive Program: Each position is eligible for a bonus of 5% - 10% of their base annual earnings, depending on company performance

· 2 weeks Paid Vacation to start & Paid Holidays (12 days):

o Entitled to two (2) weeks’ paid vacation per year, with first year pro-rated based on start date. You will be paid at your normal rate of pay for any vacation time taken.

o Goes up to three (3) weeks’ paid vacation after 3 years

o Production Operators are paid for 12 hours on statutory holidays (10 days in total annually plus 2 float days)

· Full Health Benefit Coverage offered:

o Medical

o Dental

o Paramedical

o Prescription

o Disability & Life Insurance

· Pension (base portion is a company contribution)

· Tuition Reimbursement

o Must have 1 year of service

o $8000.00 per year or $250.00 to $350.00 per credit

o Must secure a minimum passing grade of “B” or its equivalent or obtain a certification to receive any reimbursement. (Sliding Scale)

o Approval must be obtained Before classes begin

o Approved degree programs such as: Chemistry, Engineering, Supply Chain Management, and Finance

o You must complete the program within 6 years

Production Operator Job, Cobourg, ON

Arclin, who is a leading manufacturer of decorative and industrial surfaces overlays, as well as resin and chemical manufacturing, is currently looking for Production Operators for our Cobourg, ON location. We offer competitive wages, great benefits and a pension plan, as well as employee incentive bonuses.

Reporting into the Production Lead, this position is a full-time role that will start in an entry position in our packaging department, but has multiple opportunities to cross-train in other production roles and advance in pay. Operators are responsible for performing tasks and duties pertaining to the manufacturing and processing of impregnated surfaces at the site. This role is required to know and perform all assigned production department functions in compliance with Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) regulations and Arclin’s policies and procedures to contribute positively to an efficient and safely run operation.

Production Operator Job Responsibilities:

Entry Level (packaging department) -

· Inspects and packages final product, according to established procedures, standards and HSE regulations

· Verifies basic product label information, such as dimensions, sheet counts, etc.

· Assists production line operators with pallet changes, clean ups and start ups

· Maintains general housekeeping of production areas

· Assists with larger production area cleaning tasks

· Follows all site rules and procedures as they apply to quality, health, safety, and the environment

· Reports all safety concerns immediately to Production Lead, HSE Lead or site Leadership team

Other Skill Development Opportunities (production line/floor operators) -

· Operate a forklift safely to move large pallets (empty & with product) throughout facility

· Operate a clamp truck safely to move large paper rolls from warehouse to production area

· Operate the production lines, using centerline process information to maintain each product specification

· Complete and report quality testing accurately

· Visually monitors processes within their area of accountability and immediately informs the Production Lead of any deviations or abnormalities

· Works in close coordination with the Production Lead to accomplish the tasks needed to safely and efficiently meet production schedules across all processes

· Communicates and confers with the Production Lead, as well as with Technical, Supervisory, and Support Personnel to resolve process conditions affecting safety, efficiency, and product quality

· Responds to process alarms and interlocks promptly and coordinates timely confirmation and corrective actions to resolve conditions generating the alarms and interlocks

· Performs troubleshooting in the event of process deviations

· Follows all site rules and procedures as they apply to quality, health, safety, and the environment

· Reports all safety concerns immediately to Production Lead, HSE Lead or site Leadership team

  • Participation in the Joint Health and Safety Committee to facilitate safety improvements is a plus

Production Operator Job Requirements:

· High School Diploma or GED required

· Good attention to detail required

· Be able to accurately read and use a tape measure

· Must be ok with rotating 12 hour shifts (Days/Nights continental rotation)

· Must be ok with following strict Health and Safety Guidelines and wear required PPE (Personal Protective Equipment)

· Ability to stand, walk, and bend throughout a 12 hour shift

· Able to lift a maximum of 50 lbs

· Basic computer skills required

· Basic math skills required, including the basic use of a calculator

· Forklift experience a plus; would need to become recertified on site

· Analytical and mechanical mindset an asset

· Previous manufacturing experience a plus

**Please note: The above statements are designed to outline the functions and position requirements of this job. It does not identify all tasks that may be expected, nor address the performance standards that must be maintained.**

Arclin is proud to provide employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodations, please indicate this on your application/cover letter and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.50-$30.50 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Cobourg, ON K9A 4R5: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • Machine Operator: 1 year (preferred)

title: newLaboratory Assistant
description:
BWXT Medical Ltd. provides its customers, who conduct life-saving medical procedures for patients around the world, the benefit of decades of experience in the development, manufacturing, packaging and delivery of medical isotopes and radiopharmaceuticals. Headquartered in Kanata, Ontario, BWXT Medical Ltd. employs over 300 highly-skilled people in Kanata and Vancouver, British Columbia. BWXT Medical Ltd. is part of the BWXT nuclear power segment (NPG) of BWX Technologies, Inc.

Laboratory Assistant


We are recruiting for a Laboratory Assistant for our Kanata office.


Job Description / Duties:

The Laboratory Assistant must have the ability read, understand and follow technical procedures. They must be able to perform work to established Standard Operating Procedures and Process Control Records. They must and be familiar with all aspects of cleanroom and equipment disinfecting. They must have excellent record keeping skills as well as the ability to follow a variety of procedures closely.


Job Qualifications / Requirements:

Normally, candidates must have a minimum High School education with some post-secondary training or 2 years relevant work experience in chemistry, physics or biology.


Physical requirements:

  • Have good manual dexterity and grip strength
  • Must be able to use hands/arms on a constant basis
  • Work at and above shoulder height
  • Push and pull carts with a force of up to 25kgs on an occasional basis
  • Lift up to 10kgs on an occasional basis
  • Wear a respirator for extended periods of time
  • In accordance with Good Manufacturing Practices, the candidate must:
    • be free of a communicable disease
    • not have a sloughing skin condition (i.e. severe dandruff, eczema, psoriasis)
  • Must be able to use aseptic technique and don a clean room suit (over a plant uniform)
  • Must be able to remain in a clean room for potentially up to 3 hours at a time.

BWXT Medical Ltd. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, a conviction for which a pardon has been granted or a record suspended or any other category protected by federal law.

title: newProduction Supervisor
company: Canadian Linen and Uniform Service Corp
description:
About Canadian Linen & Uniform Service

Canadian Linen & Uniform Service (CLAUS) provides uniforms and related products to more than 300,000 customers nationwide, in virtually every industry. From designing and manufacturing to laundering and delivering, CLAUS works with local and national clients to create and maintain a total uniform solution that promotes teamwork and establishes a professional identity. CLAUS operates from over 16 locations nationwide.

The Production Supervisor ensures a high level of service to Canadian Linen & Uniform Service (CLAUS) customers through order fulfillment while maintaining overall profitability by managing safety, productivity, accuracy, turnover, and training within the department. The Production Supervisor maximizes customer satisfaction and minimizes costs by managing the proper level of trained and scheduled staff to meet the capacity demands throughout the annual business cycle.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Plans and coordinates the daily activities of department. Adjust work assignments and workflow as necessary to meet production demands and schedules.
  • Should be able to understand and manage costs as it relates to the department or area.
  • Ensure appropriate staffing levels. Conduct employee evaluations, maintain personnel records, and recommend hiring and disciplinary action of employees as necessary.
  • Resolve personnel problems by analyzing data, investigating issues, identifying solutions, and recommending action.
  • Consistently review work performance with employees.
  • Evaluate new hire performance based on learning curves.
  • Ensure employees are following production procedures through formal and informal observations.
  • Coordinate work needs with other distribution departments.
  • Process daily/monthly reports on quality, productivity, and other areas as required.
  • Responsible for safety and security within department, to include maintaining a safe and clean work environment.
  • Provides training, development, and cross train employees on applicable work methods and operations.
  • Develops talent through projects and additional assignments.
  • Update and add work procedures (SOPs) for all operations in the department.
  • Work towards achieving departmental and personal goals developed in conjunction with department managers.
  • Maintain an environment based on trust, open communication, creative thinking, and cohesive team effort.
  • Lead by setting a good example; behavior consistent with words.
  • Creates and support a culture of adherence to branch standardization in support of, financial, service, and safety goals.
  • Other duties as assigned by general manager or manager.

Requirements:

  • Preferred two (2) years industrial experience in a leadership capacity in a production and/or manufacturing environment is required.
  • A Bachelor’s Degree in related field or equivalent experience preferred.
  • Able to stand and/or walk for long periods of time.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Strong computer skills to include MS Office: Excel, Word, and Outlook.
  • Manage multiple priorities against tight deadlines
  • Strong time management and organizational skills.
  • Ability to instruct/teach.
  • Complete work in a timely manner as well as the ability to meet deadlines.
  • Maintain a positive attitude in the workplace.
  • Maintain confidentiality.
  • Work a flexible schedule (shifts/hours) with notice.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Basic Math reasoning skills.
  • Lifting Ability; up to 100 pounds; Push/Pull Ability; up to 300 pounds assisted
  • Capability to work in a fast paced, loud work environment in a safe and conscientious manner
  • Ability to supervise employees and maintain positive employee relations
  • Read, interpret and apply procedural, maintenance, and policy information
  • Apply logic and reasoning in addressing technical, operational and employee-related issues.
  • Proved record of work attendance.
  • Spoken familiarity with prevalent language of distribution, warehouse and production team.

WHY CHOOSE US?

  • Job stability: Canadian Linen has been employing people for over 95 years in Canada
  • Competitive Base Salary
  • Great benefits and employee assistance program
  • Company pension with employer match
  • Educational Assistant Program, ongoing paid training and mentoring
  • Great teammates and collaborative work environment
  • A consistently growing company that promotes from within

We thank all candidates for their interest. However, only those selected for a telephone interview will be contacted.

Canadian Linen & Uniform Service (CLAUS) is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Working Shifts: Monday to Friday

Location: Kamloops, British Columbia

title: General Labour
description:
The Ajax packaging facility, where these positions are based, is one of the largest employers in Ajax and Durham Region. We provide innovative packaging solutions to the beverage market and serve name brand customers such as Coca Cola, Pepsi, Labatt and Molson to name a few.

The Job Opportunity

The Ajax facility is recruiting general labourers to work in our facility to stack finished cartons onto skids, perform quality checks, assist operators and printers with machine set up and housekeeping duties, communicate as a team to produce quality cartons. This is an opportunity to develop new skills and progress to your full potential with a good wage and benefit program.

What you need to succeed

Must have grade 12 diploma

Previous experience in a manufacturing environment an asset

Good interpersonal and communication skills

Good analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to read and understand specifications

Safety and quality mindset

Physically capable of standing, lifting, bending, twisting

Ability to work shift work;12 hour shifts

Why work for WestRock?

Starting rate $20/Hour with 2 increases per year with satisfactory performance reviews

Educational reimbursement

Team environment with opportunities to participate in safety, Continuous Improvement and Performance Excellent Teams

Career Opportunities and advancement to skilled positions at higher pay levels.

WestRock Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating and maintaining a diverse workforce. As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, WestRock will, upon request from the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact WestRock, Human Resources at 905-428-5986 about your needs and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.

Please submit your resume to www.westrock.com/careers.

title: newTea Packer
description:
Pluck Tea, a fast-growing, 100% natural and locally based premium tea company in midtown Toronto, is currently seeking a Full-time Tea Packer roll to join our team. Joining our team has the potential to grow within our company. This role combines the completion of regular daily tasks, with larger production runs of our retail products.

This position will be 40 hours a week. Please note that the hours will be between 8:30am-7:30pm Monday-Friday. Occasional weekend shifts may be required as needed. Training will be provided.

Pluck Tea values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Pack teas (loose plus tea bag) with high attention to detail
  • Accurately track teas using lot # system
  • Keep work area clean and organized, as well as maintain cleanliness of entire production area
  • Assist with inventory count and control each month
  • Complete Daily Cleaning Tasks schedule each day which may include sanitizing tables and chairs, dusting shelves, and waste management/recycling.
  • Maintain and organize overstock, while adhering to FIFO rules (first in first out)
  • Maintain and organize tea stock, make sure all tea is sealed properly
  • Front face and stock shelves when needed, adhering to FIFO rules
  • Monitor inventory levels for: bags, labels, tea, cleaning supplies, packing supplies. Report low levels to Operations Manager when needed
  • Outputting Labels for the tea packaging
  • Operating Sealing and labeling machine (training will be provided)
  • Assisting with Tea Bag Machine; helping machine operator with quality checks, cleaning, and spot checks. Opportunity to become fully trained on machine operations.
  • Responsible for ensuring food safety and quality compliance along with GMP’s (Good Manufacturing Practices) and adherence to the HACCP systems program.

Qualifications:

  • Experience in production and manufacturing. Food production experience a strong asset.
  • Knowledge of GMP and HACCP Programs
  • Ideally have experience with production manufacturing lines and equipment.
  • Able to lift a minimum of 40lbs and stand for a full day’s shift (8 hours)
  • Strong analytical skills and math aptitude.
  • Comfortable using PC computers and printers
  • Organized, team player, good communicator, problem solving skills
  • Must provide a police check
  • A minimum of 3 work related references required

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $18.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Pluck Tea is fully compliant with COVID 19 protocols and offers a physically distanced workplace. Masks are required while in the facility according to public health guidlines.

Application question(s):

  • Please explain why you are most interested in this role at Pluck Tea.

Experience:

  • Food processing: 2 years (required)

Language:

  • English (required)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (required)
  • Night Shift (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-23

title: newHR Administrator
description:
Hours of work: To be discussed. 8am to 4pm or 9am to 5pm.

About the company:

We have been in the food manufacturing business for over 15 years. We are a growing company and rapidly expanding in 2021 alone. We take pride in our people and believe in harmony of a work-life balance.

We are seeking an individual who are seeking long term employment along with having excellent time management, can work well under pressure/timelines and can work in a collective team environment. We are seeking someone who has both administrative and human resources background.

  • Provides administrative support to ensure efficient operation of office.
  • Responsible for complete hiring process of new employees full on board (posting job ads, interviewing, set up, training)
  • Will be responsible for monitoring employee timecards and completing payroll through ADP.
  • Answers phone calls, schedules meetings and supports visitors.
  • Carries out administrative duties such as filing, typing, copying, binding, scanning etc.
  • Completes operational requirements by scheduling and assigning administrative projects and expediting work results.
  • Makes travel arrangements for senior staff such as booking flights, cars, and hotel or restaurant reservations.
  • Exhibits polite and professional communication via phone, e-mail, and mail.
  • Supports team by performing tasks related to organization and strong communication.
  • Develops administrative staff by providing information, educational opportunities, and experiential growth opportunities.
  • Provides information by answering questions and requests.
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
  • Fluent in English. Another language is an asset.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $55,000.00-$60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • What other language do you speak?

Experience:

  • Human resources: 1 year (preferred)

title: Manufacturing Superintendent
description:
BIOVECTRA is a leading bio-science business in Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, focused on contract manufacturing and product development of active pharmaceutical ingredients, pharmaceutical intermediates, and bioreagents.
BioVectra Inc. has an opening for a Manufacturing Superintendent. This is a permanent full-time position located in Charlottetown, PEI.
The candidate will be responsible for:
  • Overseeing team leads in accomplishing overall departmental production needs and reviewing work to ensure consistency with written standards.
  • Mentoring members of the production group and providing constructive input.
  • Reviewing the completed BPRs (ensuring all QCs, deviations, cleaning sheets, etc. are attached to the BPR, BPR lines are signed and verified, QA review items are resolved, and label requests have been completed).
  • Assisting in updates on batch production records (BPRs) to optimize process efficiencies and to assist in developing new BPR’s or work instructions.
  • Supporting manufacturing schedules through appropriate documentation and staging requests.
  • Training New hires in manufacturing on the Quality management software, BPR, Equipment Use, Etc.
  • Ensuring material and/or solvent counts are completed upon request.
  • Ensuring the equipment and processing areas are in a ready state to meet the posted schedule.
  • Identifying, troubleshooting and resolving equipment, process and facility issues.
  • Participating in the hiring, training and performance evaluation of employees.
  • Participating in regulatory inspections and audits.
  • Interacting with multi-discipline units and personnel to ensure product quality and on-time delivery is adhered to.
  • Performing all manufacturing operation functions when required.
  • Managing the time and attendance software program and ensuring accuracy in all job costing activities.
  • Flexibility for after hour consultation during manufacturing activities or during infrequent production activities will be required.
The successful candidate for this position should have:
  • Grade 12 diploma.
  • Five years of related technical experience.
  • Two years of demonstrated supervisory experience.
  • Ability to function and communicate in a dynamic, project driven team environment.
  • Strong technical, written, communication skills.
  • Demonstrated mature judgement and integrity of sensitive and confidential information.
  • Broad based technical knowledge of process equipment.
  • Efficient in Microsoft suit software
  • Ability to be flexible, shift priorities and reallocate resources to support high priority objectives.
BioVectra offers a competitive salary and benefit package.
Closing Date: May 6, 2022

Individual accommodations due to a disability are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, religion, ethnicity, gender, disability, citizenship status, marital status, actual or perceived sexual orientation. BIOVECTRA is committed to creating an inclusive environment and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We value diversity and recognize that experience comes in many forms and skills are transferable. Please view this description as a general overview, but not a mandatory comprehensive list. If you feel passionate about our efforts and believe that you have the skills to contribute and lead in this role, apply! We thank all interested parties; however, only those applicants considered for an interview will be contacted.

title: newWindow Manufacturing & Assembly
description:
We are looking to hire several individuals to work in our shop assembling wooden windows and doors. Experience in this field is not required, but ideally you will have some experience with power tools and/or wood work related experience. Training is provided onsite and this is a union position. Work is inside.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 40 per week

Salary: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime

title: newSummer Contract - Production Inspector/Packer
description:
Job Responsibilities:

  • Inspect and package ECG Electrodes

  • Ensure product quality and safety compliance.

  • Analyze and document various activities within the process.

  • Set up and operation of packaging equipment.

  • Follow good documentation practices.

  • Develop a good understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices and 5S methodology.

  • Participate in Non-Conformance investigation and resolution where applicable.

Minimum Requirements:

  • High school diploma preferred

  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and teamwork skills

  • Ability to interpret and follow instructions

  • Excellent focus and dexterity while working in a fast paced environment

  • Ability to rotate between sitting and standing positions

  • Ability to work rotating shifts on a 3 shift operation - Weekly rotation between Days/Afternoons/Midnights

Cardinal Health, with over 1300 employees in Canada, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.


Cardinal Health-Gananoque manufactures many life impacting medical devices that help our customers thrive in a changing world. We are your humble partners, striving each day to make healthcare more efficient and effective and our patients as healthy as possible. We are more than 350 employees with 112 years of Canadian history, a deep understanding of the medical devices we manufacture every day and a passion for innovation.


For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings.

Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities.

Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

""

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

title: newAccounts Payable
description:
Job brief

We are looking for a skilled Accounts Payable Clerk or Assistant to be responsible for processing all invoices received for payment and for undertaking the payment of all creditors in an accurate, efficient and timely manner.
Responsibilities

  • Process outgoing payments in compliance with financial policies and procedures
  • Perform day to day financial transactions, including verifying, classifying, and recording accounts payable data
  • Reconcile the accounts payable ledger to ensure that all bills and payments are accounted for and properly posted.
  • Verify and investigate discrepancies, if any, by reconciling vendor accounts and monthly vendor statements
  • Facilitate payment of invoices due by sending bill reminders and contacting clients
  • Generate reports detailing accounts payables status
  • Understand expense accounts and cost centers
  • Understands compliance issues around accounts payable processes (W-9, sales tax, etc.)

Requirements and skills

  • Proven working experience as Accounts Payable Clerk or Assistant
  • Solid understanding of basic bookkeeping and accounting payable principles
  • Proven ability to calculate, post and manage accounting figures and financial records
  • Data entry skills along with a knack for numbers
  • Hands-on experience with spreadsheets and proprietary software
  • Proficiency in English and in MS Office
  • High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • BSc degree or College Diploma in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $25.00-$30.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to commute to Hamilton daily for work?
  • Do you have experience doing Accounts Payable in a manufacturing/industrial environment?

Experience:

  • Accounts payable: 3 years (preferred)

title: newPackaging Operator
description:
INTERMEDIATE FRENCH REQUIRED

Join Shiftfillers and become part of the dedicated team that gets products and orders ready for our client’s customers. You will be processing, preparing, picking, packing, and shipping customer orders. If you like a fast-paced, physical position that gets you up and moving, apply to join our team today.

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for carrying out an array of duties in the manufacturing department

Here are just some of the things you’ll get to do with us

  • Set-up and operate equipment for processing operations
  • Monitor product quality and make adjustments to the process and equipment to maintain batch specifications
  • Perform basic troubleshooting and report process or equipment problems to your supervisor
  • Ensure equipment log books and other relevant records are kept up to date
  • Clean and maintain processing rooms and equipment

Remember this is an active role, and you will be on the move for your whole shift, which is usually 8 hours or more.

Qualifications

  • Be at least 18 years old and authorized to work in Canada
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Be able to lift heavy packages in a warehouse environment

Bonus points

  • If you have 1 year or more experience working in a similar manufacturing environment

Benefits

  • 24/7 support from our dedicated team.
  • Training to perform your job effectively and to grow professionally.
  • Adapted operations in response to COVID-19, to protect the health and safety of our employees.
  • See https://jobs.shiftfillers.com/about/benefits for more details

This position description has been prepared to assist in defining job responsibilities, physical demands, working conditions and needed skills. It is not intended as a complete list of job duties, responsibilities and/or essential functions.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Rejoignez Shiftfillers et faites partie de l'équipe dédiée qui prépare les produits et les commandes pour les clients de nos clients. Vous traiterez, préparerez, ramasserez, emballerez et expédierez les commandes des clients. Si vous aimez un poste physique au rythme rapide qui vous permet de vous lever et de bouger, postulez pour rejoindre notre équipe dès aujourd'hui.

Responsabilités

  • Vous serez responsable d'effectuer un éventail de tâches au sein du département de fabrication
  • Voici quelques-unes des choses que vous pourrez faire avec nous
  • Installer et faire fonctionner l'équipement pour les opérations de traitement
  • Surveiller la qualité des produits et apporter des ajustements au processus et à l'équipement pour maintenir les spécifications des lots
  • Effectuer un dépannage de base et signaler les problèmes de processus ou d'équipement à votre superviseur
  • Veiller à ce que les registres de l'équipement et les autres registres pertinents soient tenus à jour
  • Nettoyer et entretenir les salles de traitement et les équipements
  • N'oubliez pas qu'il s'agit d'un rôle actif et que vous serez en déplacement pendant tout votre quart de travail, qui dure généralement 8 heures ou plus.

Qualifications

  • Avoir au moins 18 ans et être autorisé à travailler au Canada
  • Diplôme d'études secondaires ou équivalent
  • Être capable de soulever des colis lourds dans un environnement d'entrepôt

Points bonus

Si vous avez 1 an ou plus d'expérience de travail dans un environnement de fabrication similaire

Avantages

  • Assistance 24h/24 et 7j/7 de notre équipe dédiée.
  • Une formation pour accomplir efficacement votre travail et évoluer professionnellement.
  • Opérations adaptées en réponse au COVID-19, pour protéger la santé et la sécurité de nos employés.
  • Voir https://jobs.shiftfillers.com/about/benefits pour plus de détails

Cette description de poste a été préparée pour aider à définir les responsabilités du poste, les exigences physiques, les conditions de travail et les compétences nécessaires. Il ne s'agit pas d'une liste complète des tâches, des responsabilités et/ou des fonctions essentielles du poste.

Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans distinction de race, de couleur, de religion, de sexe, d'orientation sexuelle, d'identité de genre, d'origine nationale, de handicap ou de statut d'ancien combattant protégé.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $21.00-$23.00 per hour

Language:

  • French (required)

title: HR/Office Assistant
description:
Are you looking to apply your skills to a company with a long track record of growth and success? Are you available to work afternoons? We are looking for a HR/Office Assistant with substantial experience working in a fast-paced manufacturing environment.

About us:

The AVL Group of Companies was founded in 1998. Hamilton Metal Works® (H.M.W), the group's founding company, focused primarily on large custom fabrications and machining. In 2006, H.M.W. changed its name to AVL Manufacturing™, adding complete assembly, project management, and single-source supply chain services to its portfolio. AVL Manufacturing has transformed into one of Canada’s most extensive privately-owned engineering, manufacturing, and assembly facilities.

Job Summary

The HR/Office Assistant’s primary function is to act as a liaison between the organization, managers, employees, and guests. Perform general HR and Office administrative duties and provide assistance to the financial department.

Job Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities:

1. Assist with day-to-day operations of the HR functions and duties i.e., scheduling interviews, creating onboarding packages, etc.

2. Assist with the formulation and implementation of human resource policies and procedures

3. Ensure a smooth flow of information between employees and Human Resources

4. Prepare and distribute correspondence and communications to employees

5. Maintain and process accurate and complete HR and employee records

6. Respond to requests for data

7. Plan and coordinate employee events such as recognition awards

8. Make travel arrangements

9. Greet visitors in a courteous and professional manner and direct them to staff. Assist visitors with our sign-in procedure and ensure they have the appropriate PPE if they will be entering our shop facility.

10. Coordinate workplace inspections for members of the JHSC and participate in JHSC meetings

11. Updating and maintaining safety related tracking system

12. Answer employee inquiries about health and safety policies, procedures, and programs

13. Provide support for other health and safety-related projects

14. Identify opportunities for process and office management improvements

15. Print and prepare AP mail for processing.

16. Enter invoices in the AP system.

17. Create and print cheques in the AP system, match and attach corresponding invoices to cheque stubs, and mail cheques to vendors.

18. Create purchase orders for office supplies.

19. Answer vendor inquiries with regards to payment status.

20. Prepare AP archives and co-ordinate storage and destruction of annual archives.

21. Ensure all public office areas are kept clean and professional-looking, including kitchenettes and coffee centers.

22. Arrange refreshments or lunch deliveries for meetings when requested.

23. Collect date-stamp and distribute mail on a daily basis.

24. Arrange for couriers and handle all out-going mail e.g. delivery to post office, registered mail

25. Responsible for the company photocopy and postage equipment.

26. General typing, photocopying, faxing, and filing.

27. Ordering Office, Kitchen, and Coffee center supplies

28. Miscellaneous Data entry as required e.g. inventory

Job Specific Requirement/Knowledge/Experience:

1. A degree or diploma in Business Administration, Human Resources or equivalent in a relevant field

2. High proficiency in using PC applications, including, Word, Email, Excel, and PowerPoint

3. High degree of accuracy and attention to detail

4. Strong organizational skills and ability to set priorities and manage time effectively

5. Strong communication and interpersonal skills

6. High level of discretion is required in dealing with confidential matters

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $20.00-$23.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • Human resources: 2 years (preferred)
  • Office: 2 years (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: Warehouse Coordinator
description:
The Opportunity

Dessert Holdings is a leading baked goods platform providing premium layer cakes, cheesecakes, brownies, bars, and other desserts to the retail in-store bakery ("ISB") and foodservice channels on a largely private label basis. We are a rapidly growing company comprised of The Original Cakerie (acq. December 2015), Lawler's Foods (acq. July 2016), Atlanta Cheesecake Company (acq. January 2018) and Steven Charles (acq. December 2021). We are poised for continued growth by bringing high quality products to both retail grocery and food service across North America. Led by a senior team with strong company pedigrees and experience driving improvement – we have exciting opportunities to be a part of this high performance, growth focused organization.

Position Summary

The Warehouse Coordinator helps to manage the shipping and receiving workflow and other warehouse operations.

The key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Print daily To Do list and Pick list
  • Prepare receiving packages for all inbound loads
  • Prepare shipping packages for all outbound loads
  • Answer phone and email traffic for shipping and receiving requirements
  • Manage both Shipping and Receiving calendars and ensure they are up to date
  • Manage and schedule pickups of pallets, recycled pails, empty oil, cream, and egg
  • CHEP and PICO usage reporting
  • Manage FedEx shipments, in and out bound
  • Complete transfer orders
  • Prepare samples to be shipped out
  • Follow all company policies and procedures
  • Adheres to GMP (good manufacturing practices)
  • All other tasks and duties as assigned

Requirements:

  • High school diploma
  • Warehouse experience a must
  • Highly motivated
  • Work professionally in a team environment
  • Excellent social skills to collaborate with warehouse, operations, and customers
  • Ability to adapt to changing organizational and operational needs
  • Candidate must be highly organized and efficient
  • Must have the ability to prioritize responsibilities and multitask in a fast-paced environment
  • Safety orientated

title: General Labourer
description:
Union Job Posting

Maple Lodge Farms, Canada’s largest and most trusted chicken provider is hiring! Started by the May brothers in 1955, we have kept our #FamilyFirst values strong for the past 65 years. We pride ourselves on our advanced health and safety practices as well as the latest in technological advances throughout our facilities. We are looking for committed, excited individuals to join our rapidly growing team to help us continue to Feed Canadians!

WHY JOIN US?

At Maple Lodge Farms we pride ourselves on being a great place to come to work every day, here are just a few reasons why:

  • $1,000 sign on bonus!
  • Benefits provided after 3 months on the job:
  • Pension Plan
  • Health, Vision & Dental Coverage
  • Employee Assistance Programs
  • Life Insurance
  • Paid vacation
  • Employee discounts at our Maple Lodge Farms Chicken Shop
  • On the job training

POSITIONS & SHIFTS AVAILABLE (Monday – Friday 3:30pm- 12:00pm):

  • Tray Packing - Must be able to pack product on a tray while keeping up with standards
  • Cut Up - Must be able to use a knife to trim, size and cut meat to specific
  • Thigh Deboning - Must be able to use a knife to remove bone, excess fat from the thigh while keeping up with standards
  • Pack Off - Must be able to lift 25kgs and dump onto conveyor while keeping up with standards

ABOUT THE ROLES:

  • Responsible for food safety, quality and legality responsibilities as defined in departmental procedures
(e.g., Prerequisites, HACCP, SOPs, BRC requirements, etc.)
  • Complies with the Good Manufacturing Practices laid out by the Company.
  • Complies with the Collective Agreement
  • Promoting and abiding to the Company’s Health and Safety rules.
  • Abide by JOP’s
  • Follow direction from Lead Hand

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:

  • Experience an asset
  • Well organized, team player.
  • Good interpersonal skills.

ACCESSIBILITY STATEMENT

In accordance with Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.

We thank all applicants for applying however only those chosen will be contacted by our Talent Acquisition Team.

Requirements

Company Information

In the 1830s, the May family began raising chickens on a farm outside what is now Brampton, Ontario. They became a pillar of the community, and their proud tradition of hard work, agricultural wisdom, and humble family values inspire and guide us to this day.

Address

7120 Edwards Boulevard, Mississauga, ON, CA, L5S 1Z1

title: newDay Manager Manufacturing Operations
description:
With a legacy that spans over 100 years, Stelco is company that has grown along with Canada and its global partners. We understand that twenty-first century competition demands the highest quality products, period. So, Stelco is bringing together the people, technology, and unmatched market knowledge to, once again, take on that challenge from here at home.

Day Manager – Operations – Coke Oven

Job Location: Hamilton

Job Type: Permanent

About the role Stelco has an immediate opening for a Shift Manager - Operations in the Cokemaking Department, at its Hamilton Works facility in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada. Safety is the Core Value of Stelco and the individual will make Safety the #1 priority in the execution of all work activities, including monitoring contractor/vendor safety in support of work efforts.

This position reports to the Area Manager - Cokemaking.

Your day-to-day

 Administer the Stelco safety program to ensure a safe work environment within the Operating facility

 Promote safety by various means (safety contacts, safety tours, incident investigations and follow up, MSDS and JSA review, equipment condition, etc.) and lead by example

 Ensure adherence to all environmental control procedures and relevant codes and standards

 Supervise hourly workforce and coordinate all administrative activities pertaining to that responsibility (i.e. performance reviews and related documentation, attendance and conduct administration, annual surveillance medicals, etc.)

 Perform administrative activities such as scheduling and paying employees, completing maintenance and operating reports, conducting safety conversations, and compiling other reporting as required

 Communicate, direct, and facilitate the overall operation of the facility; build constructive relationships; ensure accountability, engage employees, and promote teamwork and responsibility to improve employee morale; and ensure consistent productivity and cost

 Maintain an awareness of the condition of operating equipment; troubleshoot equipment failures, and arrange equipment repairs through assigned maintenance personnel

 Maintain accurate production reporting and delay logs

 Actively participates in recruitment screening and selection of prospective new hires

 Establish performance goals and objectives with Area Manager What you bring to the table

Job Qualifications

 More than 5 years experience managing or operating in an industrial environment.

 And/or College Diploma/University Degree in Engineering, Operations, Manufacturing, Material Science, or Business discipline or a combination of education and experience working in a unionized, manufacturing/industrial environment is preferred

Job Skills and Knowledge

 Good communication skills

 Good interpersonal and leadership skills

 Good oral and written communication skills

 Good problem solving skills

 Ability and desire to work in a shop floor environment

 Good computer skills

 An enthusiastic approach and ability to learn quickly and assume responsibility

 As a manager/supervisor of the company, qualified candidates for this role must also demonstrate the ability to manage change, communicate effectively and lead high-performance teams

Your work environment

 Normal, fast-paced manufacturing environment for a high impact team

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Stelco is an equal opportunity employer who is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier free recruitment and selection process. Applicants should advise Human Resources if they require any type of accommodation during the recruitment process.

Job Type: Full-time

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Hamilton, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)
