title: newAssociate, QA
description:
Title: Associate, QA

Date: May 3, 2022
Location: Taro Pharmaceauticals CAN
Company: Taro Pharmaceuticals INC, Canada
Taro Pharmaceuticals Inc. is a multinational, specialty pharmaceutical company with a vision of reaching people and touching lives globally as a leading provider of valued medicines. We are dedicated to meeting the needs of our customers and the overall community through the innovation, development, manufacturing and marketing of the highest quality healthcare products.
Established in 1950, Taro’s world class production facility is located in Brampton, Ontario, with a current team of over 600 Canadian employees. Our company’s focus on the dermatology sector has made us a leading manufacturer and supplier of specialized topical products with a diverse portfolio of creams, ointments, liquids, and gels.
With support from our parent company, Sun Pharma, one of the world’s largest specialty generic pharmaceutical companies, we are committed to providing a healthy, safe and rewarding environment for all of our employees.
Our reward packages have been designed to meet the needs of our diverse workforce and their families. For additional information visit: www.taro.com.
What we offer:
A safe and clean; GMP regulated work environment
Opportunities for career growth and development
A competitive wage/salary
Incentive bonus programs that are designed to reward employees for their individual contributions
Benefit programs designed to support our employees and their families, including a comprehensive health & dental benefits package, group RRSP matching program, direct access to healthcare and well-being programs, and paid time off
Employee training and organizational development programs including tuition reimbursement, internal mobility programs, and employee recognition programs
Our Brampton location is presently looking for Associate, QA
Job purpose
This position is responsible for the maintenance of the quality assurance and release systems to meet Canadian GMP and FDA regulations, to ensure regulatory requirements are achieved and to provide quality oversight to the Taro manufacturing site.
This position acts as an active influence towards elevating the quality practices and guidelines for products manufactured, packaged or tested at the Taro Canada manufacturing facility.
The incumbent holds responsibility over timely decisions on disposition of materials/components for use in production and market disposition decisions for finished products (Taro and 3rd Party) based on the comprehensive review process.

Duties and responsibilities
  • Perform timely evaluation and make decisions on disposition of the finished product/material/component based on the review of all required documentation ensuring accuracy and compliance with the established Standard Operating Procedures and regulations.
  • Update inventory management systems with appropriate lot status designation (reject, hold, quarantine and approved).
  • Determine status disposition for returned goods, complete all necessary documentation and enter this information into the dedicated electronic system.
  • Complete department metrics and reports; communicate with key personnel on the release timeframes.
  • Complete customer requests ensuring execution of the appropriate paperwork; send the samples to the customers in a timely manner.
  • Perform activities as an active user of electronic systems such as SAP, TrackWise, MES, DocuSign etc.
  • Participate and provide quality input in review and revision of Quality Assurance, Production, Compounding, Packaging and other applicable procedures (SOPs).
  • Ensure compliance to SOPs & GMP requirements in regard to shop-floor activities, Retain Sample Program, water sampling, balance calibration, etc.
  • Participate in design of training materials and deliver training targeted to ensure understanding of compliance requirements to Quality Assurance, Production, Compounding and Packaging personnel.
  • Consistently work with other departments to proactively build quality into the processes and systems.
  • Identify and implement key process improvements targeted to enhance systems, gain site efficiencies, reduce cost of goods and elevate the site level of compliance.
  • Participate in and/or lead non-conformance investigations; work with other GMP controlled departments to address quality issues associated with compounding, production and/or packaging stages of the product manufacturing.
  • Participate in GEMBA walks and consult shop-floor personnel on the requirements of the batch records execution.
  • Issue necessary forms and documentation to the shop-floor personnel.
  • Participate in the Product Recall activities as required.
  • Ensure that Good Documentation Practices are followed by Production, Packaging and Compounding personnel; influence “Right First Time” approach.
  • Complete Corrective and Preventive Actions (CAPA’s) within established timeframe.
  • Initiate, and follow through with actions required to close Change Control Records on time.
  • Participate in Internal and Customer Audits and Regulatory inspections.
  • Complete all training assignments and maintain personal training records.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
  • B.Sc. Degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Pharmaceutical Science or related field
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in a Quality role within the pharmaceutical or related industry
  • Sound knowledge and understanding of Health Canada and FDA regulations
  • Experience and/or knowledge of Pharmaceutical manufacturing and packaging is an asset
  • Experience with SAP and Trackwise is an asset
  • Skilled Word and Excel user
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to influence others while maintaining integrity and trust, by keeping a continuous focus on effective communications to ensure achievement of shared goals
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task; attention to detail
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving abilities
  • Change leader and driver
  • High energy level, self-starter
  • People skills, ability to influence others

Working conditions
  • Ability to work under stressful conditions and prioritize workload
  • Numerous and varied responsibilities demanding attention and detail
  • Stress tasks and environment during regulatory and customer’s inspections
  • Regular presence on manufacturing/packaging shop floor in collaboration with Operation’s staff
  • Rotating shifts
We thank all applicants, but only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No phone calls please.
This position is open to applicants legally authorized to work in Canada.
Taro Pharmaceuticals Inc. embraces diversity in the workplace and is committed to achieving employment equity. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. We ensure that our recruitment practices are supportive of this commitment and do not infringe on any characteristics protected by law.
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Taro Pharmaceuticals Inc. will provide accommodation throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources of the nature of accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.
NOTE: All employment is conditional upon the completing and obtaining of a satisfactory background check which may include educational, employment, references and criminal records (for which a pardon has not been granted) checks.
AGENCY NOTICE: Please note that Taro Pharmaceuticals Inc. does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Services Agreement with an agency / recruiter, Taro Pharmaceuticals Inc. will not consider any referrals or agree to payment of referral or recruitment fees. In the event a recruiter or an agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, Taro Pharmaceuticals Inc. explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

title: newCustomer Service Coordinator
description:
KEILHAUER

CUSTOMER SERVICE COORDINATOR

GRADE 5

WHO IS KEILHAUER?

Founded in 1981, Keilhauer is a privately owned, design-focused contract furniture manufacturer. Working with world-renowned furniture designers, Keilhauer is internationally recognized for award-winning design, built with extreme craftsmanship, to the highest environmental standards. At Keilhauer, we believe that because we all share this planet, it is essential that we do our part protecting it. Our comprehensive sustainability program, Planet Keilhauer, driven by our goal of closed-loop manufacturing, is an approach to production in which there is no waste and materials are cycled back into the system, minimizing environmental impact.

SUMMARY

The Customer Service Coordinators provide exceptional, professional and responsive customer service through communication with customers, dealers and sales representatives via email and telephone. Working under the direction of the Customer Service Supervisor, this role works as part of a team that is technically knowledgeable of Keilhauer’s products and services and utilizes that knowledge to manage customer accounts, nurture internal and external customer relationships and respond to inquiries in an enthusiastic and timely manner.

Our customers are our priority. In this role, you will build sustainable relationships of trust through open and interactive communication with your assigned customer base. Working as a liaison, you will work closely with the Operations, Engineering, Quality, Purchasing and Sales departments to provide solutions that fulfill our customers’ expectations of delivering quality product on time.

The position is best suited to an organized Customer Service professional with excellent communication and interpersonal skills who enjoys working in a quiet environment. Responding to our customers’ needs in a timely manner furthers Keilhauer’s mission of making work comfortable for all.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 1 year of Customer Service experience within a fast-paced manufacturing environment;
  • Completion of a high school diploma;
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Outlook and other technical programs; advanced skill level in Excel is required; previous experience using SyteLine or similar ERP is an asset.

COVID-19 PRECAUTIONS

Keilhauer has mandated a COVID-19 vaccination policy in place. As of September 22, 2021, all present and future employees are required to provide proof of receiving all recommended doses of an approved COVID-19 vaccine (or combination of approved COVID-19 vaccines) to Human Resources. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation to employees who are unable to vaccinate for medical reasons.

· Remote interview process.

· Personal protective equipment provided or required.

· Daily screening of all employees.

· Social distancing guidelines in place.

· Virtual meetings when possible.

· Sanitizing, disinfecting and cleaning procedures in place.

DOES THIS ROLE SOUND LIKE A FIT?

Keilhauer is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive, respectful environment for all employees.

If this role is for you, please send your resume to careers@ keilhauer .com and tell us why you would be a great addition to our team! Please note that only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $49,000.00-$56,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Profit sharing
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • What is your typing speed in KPH (keystrokes per hour)?
  • This position entails sending and receiving many emails/calls (~150 per day), attention to detail and remaining calm under pressure. Do you have experience in managing a high volume of emails/calls?

Experience:

  • customer service (phone and email): 1 year (preferred)

title: newBuyer
description:
META is seeking a Buyer for our facility in Dartmouth, NS or Remote. You will play a key role in purchasing goods and services that meet the quality standards, price, and delivery requirements for multiple locations around the world.


About Us:


Meta Materials Inc. “META®” (NASDAQ: MMAT) is a developer of high-performance functional materials and nanocomposites. META® delivers previously unachievable performance, across a range of applications, by inventing, designing, developing and manufacturing sustainable, highly functional materials. Our broad electromagnetic technology platforms enable leading global brands to deliver breakthrough products to their customers in consumer electronics, 5G communications, health and wellness, aerospace, automotive, and clean energy. Our nano-optic technology provides anti-counterfeiting security features for government documents and currencies and authentication for brands. Our achievements have been widely recognized, including being named a Lux Research Innovator of the Year.


What You’ll Do:

Your role will be processing purchase requisitions, issuing purchase orders, negotiating with suppliers, tracking orders, maintaining inventory optimal inventory levels, quality assurance and collaborating with internal and external stakeholders.


Some of the typical responsibilities will include:

  • Research, select and purchase quality products and materials in a timely manner
  • Build relationships with suppliers and negotiate with them for the best pricing and terms
  • Process requisitions and update management on status of orders
  • Cost reductions of materials through the initiation and participation in the benchmarking process
  • Perform other duties/projects/reports as required

Minimum qualifications:

  • Post-secondary education in Materials Management, Purchasing or similar.
  • 3+ years purchasing experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Proficiency in using various types of computer software (Word, Excel, and Outlook, and ERP/MRP based systems)
  • High level of planning, organizational & implementation skills
  • Candidate must be self-motivated with the ability to work without direct supervision and work effectively in a team environment

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge of Plex ERP/MRP system is a bonus
  • Experience in lean concept methodology an asset

Feel like you can’t tick all the boxes above? If you have some of the skills and experience that we’re looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply!


What You’ll Love About Us:

META is a fast-growing company with a positive and committed work culture and a phenomenally talented workforce. Our employees are inspired to do exceptional and innovative work, are proud to contribute to the success of the company and are our greatest asset.

META attracts people from many countries and cultures, with over 25 spoken languages represented across our teams. META believes that diversity drives creativity and innovation. We welcome and encourage applications from underrepresented populations; Aboriginal peoples, racialized persons, people living with disabilities (including invisible and episodic disabilities) and members of the LGBTQ2 community.


Our Benefits:

  • META (MMAT) Equity
  • Retirement Savings Matching
  • Company provided Group Health Insurance (medical, dental, vision).
  • Competitive paid time off policy; vacation, paid sick leave; personal days; time off between Christmas day and New Year’s day
  • Casual dress

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
Imagine being a key member of a team dedicated to manufacturing the most advanced, Canadian Made, infrared heaters in the world. SRP Group ships all over the world – from the most luxurious resorts and patios in Las Vegas and California to aircraft hangars and distribution centers for major airlines, sports facilities, and best in class warehouse and logistic companies. Please come help us Save Energy for Future Generations!

https://youtu.be/JGKDkFzShDY

The SRP Group operates under 4 Core Values: Initiative, Teamwork, Reliability, and Commitment. We are prepared to offer a competitive wage, opportunities for advancement, ample parking and easy bus access, a retirement savings program, and competitive benefits.

Job Overview
The Junior Manufacturing Engineer reports to the Production manager and is responsible for production support in all aspects related to assembly improvements, product improvements, shop efficiency and drawing changes as related to assembly issues. This position will be located at our growing manufacturing plant, located in Stoney Creek, ON.

Duties and Responsibilies

  • Provide support to the production staff
  • Monitor installation manuals and instruction sheets for accuracy
  • Review BOMs & Routings at the work order level & submit change requests to the Material Manager
  • Modify CAD/SolidWorks drawings as required by production in accordance with Engineering rules

Specific tasks

  • Create assembly instructions, quality control documents and videos as needed.
  • Work with Lead Hands to solve production issues
  • Perform internal ISO documents audit.
  • Work to implement Lean Manufacturing principles thru-out the plant
  • Assist in improving manufacturing efficiency by analyzing and planning workflow, space requirements, and Plant layout.
  • Support all manufacturing departments for quality control and assembly efficiency
  • Learn and stay up to date with SRP technologies to provide effective support to all production lines
  • Assist the Production Manager with administrative issues as required

Other tasks and duties, as required

Qualifications & Education Requirements

  • Engineering Degree and/or Technologist Diploma in Mechanical / Industrial Engineering
  • 1-3 Years’ Experience in Manufacturing Environment
  • Experience with ERP system (Navision) considered an asset
  • Experience with Solid Works
  • Experience with AUTOCAD
  • Must have strong knowledge in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Able to communicate effectively, both written and verbally, at all levels of the organization
  • Must possess strong analytical skills, acute attention to detail, good organizational skills, and the ability to work effectively with a variety of people
  • Positive attendance, safety, and quality history record
  • Positive attitude and passion to succeed in achieving 100% on time delivery
  • Must be able to contribute to team efforts by accomplishing results as needed.
  • High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results oriented

Work environment

  • Day shift (7:45am – 4:15pm)
  • Manufacturing environment

Benefits

Full-Time staff benefits include (but are not limited to):

  • Health & Dental
  • Short- & Long-Term Disability
  • Paid Vacation
  • Pension matching plan and voluntary RRSP
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program
  • Company events

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $50,000.00-$53,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Must be fully vaccinated.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Stoney Creek, ON L8E 5S1: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application question(s):

  • Do you have a Degree in either Engineering and/or Technologist Diploma in Mechanical / Industrial Engineering?

Experience:

  • Manufacturing: 1 year (preferred)
  • Mechanical engineering: 1 year (required)

title: Processing Operator (Blender Helper)
description:
Who we are

Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee is a leading customer solutions provider, manufacturing and supplying quality coffee and tea to some of North America's largest retailers and foodservice chains. Our fast-growing EcoCup® brand of single-serve pods makes it easy for consumers to recycle through 3 easy steps of separation. Combining state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation with more than 100 years of business success, Mother Parkers continues to grow. We take pride in delivering a better beverage experience for customers and consumers, and a better employment experience for our people! We operate multiple manufacturing facilities in both Canada and the U.S.

We are committed to doing what's right for the planet, people, and the communities in which we operate. From farm to cup, we're engaged locally and at the industry level in ensuring a sustainable future for our customers and consumers.

At Mother Parkers, we will give you every opportunity to voice your ideas, own what you do, and share your passion for people, our products and our customers. We live by our mission to provide a better beverage experience for our customers; and as a fourth-generation family-run company, we know that it starts with great teams and innovative thinkers. We empower our people to turn their ideas into solutions, execute with integrity, deliver with quality, and take pride in their work. In turn, we foster a culture built on our values that supports everyone to be their best.

Who we need

Our Ajax plant is adding a Processing Operator (Blender Helper) to our team. You will be trained on our high-quality standards, and work as part of a team to weigh, measure, and operate our automated blending equipment to produce high-quality tea blends.

Shift Type: Rotating shifts on days (7 am - 3:30 pm), afternoons (3 pm - 11:30 pm) and nights (11 pm - 7:30 am). Must be able to work all three shifts and on weekends as required.

Pay Rate: $26.29/hour + shift premiums

What's in it for you

Impact. You want to play a critical role in producing quality tea blends that get packaged and shipped out to our customers. You want to learn the business, understand the environment, and do your best work. This is a chance to contribute to processes that reduce non-value tasks and streamline the work of the Blending Team.

Career development. At Mother Parkers, our commitment to continuous improvement starts with our people. With ongoing training and learning opportunities, this is a place to build your career. Whether you are interested in moving into a more technical role in another production and packaging area, you will be supported in your goals.

A company that cares. This is a well-structured, organized, and collaborative environment. Joining us is a chance to be part of a company that prioritizes the health and safety of their teams, from the highest level of plant operations, preventative maintenance, and quality standards. It's an opportunity to work with leading programming, technology, and operations at a Canadian-owned food & beverage company.

What you will do:

  • Learn. You will undertake training in primary and secondary roles and participate in annual performance reviews with your Supervisor. You will gain insights into the emphasis on quality and how to prevent mistakes that have a high-cost impact. You will build out a good understanding of our tea blending, processing and packaging from end-to-end.
  • Preparing the blend. You will be responsible for preparing the tea blend, which includes picking, weighing and measuring the required ingredients per the blend specifications. You will safely operate a lift truck to retrieve and return the pallet of ingredients to its racking location. You will then add the ingredients into the automated blending system to be processed; this will be completed by hand as well as by utilizing the vacuum-lift system. Upon completing each blend, you will follow the sanitization processes to prepare the system for the next blend.
  • Be responsive and meet demands. You will maintain an awareness of when and how the equipment needs to be adjusted to correct for out-of-spec conditions. You will attend to mechanical problems. You will prioritize and plan the blending order to ensure optimal efficiency.
  • Ensure quality. You will be part of our lean manufacturing environment and gain exposure to Six Sigma processes and approaches. You will develop an understanding of our Data Management System and ensure the accuracy and effectiveness of the supply chain from receiving to packaging.

What you bring to the role:

  • The certification and knowledge. Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent with manufacturing experience in highly-automated packaging equipment. You have a technical and a mechanical aptitude with troubleshooting, analytical, and mathematical skills. You have a lift truck operating license (Counter Balance, Reach and Walkie) and can competently operate one in a plant environment.
  • The experience and growth mindset. You may have direct experience in the food and beverage industry or another processing and packaging industry. You want to grow your knowledge through training to develop an in-depth understanding of our automated manufacturing process in a lean environment.
  • The accountability. You take ownership of your work and the quality of the products. You are detailed, accurate and capable of reading and understanding technical information. You work well under pressure, make quick decisions when needed, and handle multiple tasks at a physically and mentally demanding job.
  • The interpersonal skills. You can take verbal and written directions and communicate effectively. You can work independently with minimal supervision and prioritize your work in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment.
  • The flexibility. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing environment with high complexity. You can adapt to different shifts.

What we offer you:

  • We want you to feel appreciated. We provide a competitive Total Rewards package, including health benefits from Day 1, employer matched retirement savings plans, and optional Health or Wellness Spending Account.
  • We value continuous learning, skills development, and career growth and we offer a Tuition Assistance Program for learning outside our environment.
  • We want you to take your work home. While you don’t have to drink coffee to work here, we have an employee discount on our tea and coffee products.

If you want to join our mission of creating a better beverage experience as an integral and valued member of our team, and you have 70% or more of the qualifications we are looking for, we invite you to express your interest here. While we can’t guarantee an interview, we do promise to review your resume and see if this might be a good fit for both of us.

Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates.

title: Packer
description:
Job Description:

Assemble finished ingredients and packaging components into finished products applying knowledge of machines, methods and equipment.

As our Packer, you will:

  • Assemble finished goods utilizing the required packaging components in accordance with specifications.
  • Perform duties associated with running a machine or manually assembling components engaged in the assembly of finished products. This includes feeding components, applying components, removing finished products from the assembly line and palletizing the finished products according to established specifications.
  • Make minor adjustments to packaging machinery.
  • Inspect and sort components and finished products during the assembly process.
  • Observe company policies and Good Manufacturing Practices.
  • Use and record materials and products used in a lot and batch-controlled environment.
  • Clean, wash and sanitize work area, containers and equipment using water, detergents and

Reference ID: https://luda.ca/careers/

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $16.75-$26.50 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Daily disinfecting, mask and hand sanitization

Experience:

  • Packaging Operators & Assemblers: 1 year (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: newProduction Worker
company: Canadian Linen and Uniform Service Corp
description:
About Canadian Linen & Uniform Service

Canadian Linen & Uniform Service (CLAUS) provides uniforms and related products to more than 300,000 customers nationwide, in virtually every industry. From designing and manufacturing to laundering and delivering, CLAUS works with local and national clients to create and maintain a total uniform solution that promotes teamwork and establishes a professional identity. CLAUS operates from over 16 locations nationwide.

Career opportunity

Under the responsibility of the production supervisor, the incumbent performs various tasks, in particular: Verification of clothing as well as preparation of clothing for shipment according to labels and routes. Being able to solve problems.

What you’ll do; All positions in the plant require the following:

  • Perform the assigned tasks in a proficient manner. This includes attaining a minimum of 100% of the production standard for tasks for which production standards have been established.
  • Maintain high quality standards on all work performed. Inspect all materials for damage or excessive wear and properly report the findings to the appropriate responsible person for resolution.
  • Maintain a clean and hazard free work area. Immediately report all broken or malfunctioning equipment or safety hazards to the appropriate person for corrective action.
  • Follow all company and work rules. Must be able to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Support an environment of continuous improvement by making suggestions and implementing where possible.
  • Perform other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of the activities enumerated above.

We are looking for individuals who are:

  • 1 year or more of previous experience in production / laundry / general labor
  • Ability to lift medium to heavy loads, from 25 lbs to 50 lbs several times a day
  • Ability to stand for 8 hours
  • Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment with fluctuating temperatures
  • Comfort of working with machines safely and consciously
  • Ability to carry out the required work according to procedures, standards and deadlines
  • Basic math, reasoning and comfort with work instructions in English;
  • Ability to perform requested work according to procedures, standards and deadlines
  • Be self-reliant and reliable
  • Have a good team spirit
  • Punctuality and assiduity

What’s in it for you:

  • Job stability: Canadian Linen has been employing people for over 95 years in Canada;
  • Competitive pay rate
  • Great benefits and employee assistance program;
  • Great teammates and collaborative work environment;
  • Consistently growing company that promotes from within;


We thank all candidates for their interest. However, only those selected for a telephone interview will be contacted.

Canadian Linen & Uniform Service (CLAUS) is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Manufacturing Team Member, Concentrates 1
description:
MANUFACTURING TEAM MEMBER, CONCENTRATES

(6 MONTH TERM)

Job Location: Aurora Sky, Edmonton International Airport

Employment Type: Full-time temporary employment onsite

Division: Operations, Cultivation

Hours: 40 hours per week

Hourly Wage: $20.00/hr to start


A LITTLE ABOUT US

Hi, we’re Aurora Cannabis, and we’re so excited to meet you!


We’re a global cannabis company driven by our passion to help people improve their lives. We have a diverse team who bring their best every day so Aurora can be the cannabis provider of choice for patients and consumers. We love our work, and we especially love our high quality, innovative brands that make up the Aurora family – from Aurora, Aurora Drift, San Rafael ’71 and Whistler.


Our people combined with our collective passion for the industry is what makes Aurora a special place to work and defines what we call our “A-Team”. We are a high-performing team of cannabis experts, innovators, and champions, that work, learn and win together. We think BIG, act BOLD and execute with PURPOSE in all that we do, and will stop at nothing to cultivate the ultimate cannabis experience for our community.


JOB SUMMARY

Are you a cannabis enthusiast with an energetic spirit? Are you looking to work with a fun group of people? If so, we would love to meet you!


We’re looking for an ambitious and hard-working professional to join our Aurora Sky team in the role of Manufacturing Team Member, Concentrates! In this role, you will have the opportunity to demonstrate your love of cannabis by performing the following:


  • Safely operate manufacturing equipment including but not limited to Tumbler, Hydraulic Press, rotory-evaporator and Hydrocarbon extraction system.
  • Manufacturing support of high-end boutique cannabis products
  • Assisting in post processing of finished product in a fast-paced environment
  • Cleaning and sanitization of the tools, equipment, and production areas frequently
  • Quality control and good practice of documentation and validation of processes
  • Understand, and follow all SOPs and related forms to GMP standards
  • Comply with all Aurora safety standards and procedures
  • Maintain steady and effective communication with Manager/ Shift Lead

You would be the best fit for this role if you have...


  • Knowledge of and experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Commitment to health and safety
  • A strong work ethic and time management skills, highly motivated and enjoys a challenge
  • Detail conscious and result oriented
  • High level of professionalism, integrity and ethics
  • Willing and able to learn new skills and concepts quickly
  • Ability to work effectively with a multi-disciplinary team
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Problem solving and analysis
  • Strategic thinking

WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING AT AURORA

Our people are at the heart of everything we do here at Aurora, and we take pride in fostering an inclusive space that inspires our team to love where they work! From rewarding career opportunities to flexible work environments to team activities, we go above and beyond to prioritize your success and here’s how we do it...


Flexibility: you will enjoy a flexible work environment that is the perfect blend of work and fun! With flexible working hours to compressed work weeks to paid sick and vacation time, you will be empowered to achieve work-life balance.

Total Rewards: we will motivate you to go above and beyond with a competitive hourly wage (with shift premiums), stock options, an RRSP program, annual bonuses, and a health and personal care spending account for you to use for gym memberships, ski-trips or staycations.

Life-Long Learning: we’re lifelong learners here at Aurora and will invest in your professional development throughout all aspects of your career! You will have access to a tuition assistance program, virtual learning activities and annual performance reviews, to ensure you are provided with the toolkit and support you need to succeed.

Perks: we love to celebrate our people by providing corporate perks including employee discounts, perkopolis memberships, company SWAG, paid volunteer time, modern technology and free snacks and beverages at all our office locations.

Team: we are a diverse and global team of cannabis enthusiasts, energetic innovators, fitness gurus, caring parents, foodies and more, with a collective passion to nurture an inclusive environment that helps you grow and provide people better days with medical cannabis.


NEXT STEPS

Think you have what it takes to join our team? So do we!


Apply today by submitting your resume along with salary expectations through our website. You can expect your application to be reviewed by a human recruiter (not a robot) shortly after you apply, and our team will contact you via email if we see a fit.


Think you’re the ideal candidate but you don’t meet all the requirements? Apply anyways! We would love to review your application to see if you’re the right fit or find you an alternative opportunity!


Not the role for you? That’s okay! Visit our careers page to find the perfect opportunity for you or share this posting with a friend or colleague that you think would be a great fit (hot tip: if you are already an Aurora employee, take advantage of the employee referral program by referring this posting to a friend! If they are successful, you will receive a bonus!)


DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION

At Aurora, we are proud to foster and celebrate a diverse community of professionals! We take pride in nurturing an inclusive culture that empowers our people to be their authentic selves, celebrate their differences and love where they work.


Our diverse community combined with our inclusive culture, is what sets us apart in the industry and equips our A-Team with superpowers – and this is why, we encourage all candidates to apply for job opportunities regardless of race, national origin, colour, religion, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital and family status, disability, or any other identifying characteristic.


If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site or alternate format of job posting) during the recruitment and selection process, please do not hesitate to let our team know! We are here to help.


HEALTH AND SAFETY

Our mission at Aurora has always been to improve the health and wellness of our core community. We strive to create a safe, healthy, and inclusive environment for our team and strongly believe introducing a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy will help us achieve this.


As of February 2022, Aurora has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for all employees and as a condition of employment, all candidates must provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19 or receive an approved medical or human rights accommodation prior to commencing employment with Aurora. If proof of vaccination is not provided or a request for accommodation is not approved, the offer of employment will be rescinded.


If applicable, Aurora Human Resources will contact you via your email address provided. We do not contact candidates over Facebook or other Social Media apps. You will never be requested to provide confidential information such as banking information or your Social Insurance Number in the interview process.

title: newProduction Associate I
description:
A position at White Cap isn’t your ordinary job. You’ll work in an exciting and diverse environment, meet interesting people, and have a variety of career opportunities.
The White Cap family is committed to Building Trust on Every Job. We do this by being deeply knowledgeable, fully capable, and always dependable, and our associates are the driving force behind this commitment.
Job Summary
Responsible for performing all tasks involved in the production of products which may include stretch cord, metal, wood and packing. Performs one or more repetitive jobs on an assembly line or sub-assembly line to produce and assemble products.
Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities

  • Maintains high production numbers to achieve daily targets.
  • Produces product with an emphasis on quality, raising any concerns to Lead Production Associate.
  • Operates at least one (1) machine and reports any issues to Lead Production Associate or Supervisor.
  • Maintains condition of work area (i.e. free of mess, product in correct location, 5S, etc.).
  • Follows job specifications as outlined on the associated work order.
  • Adheres to all workplace safety policies, compliances and regulations.
  • Other duties as assigned by the organization.

Nature and Scope

  • Selects correct processes from clearly prescribed rules, past practices, or instruction. Seeks advice and guidance on non-routine or problem areas from supervisor. Deviations from the norm are cleared by the supervisor.
  • Under close supervision, exercises limited latitude/independent judgment. Work typically involves detailed checks or close review of output by a senior coworker and/or supervisor.
  • None.

Work Environment

  • Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
  • Requires intermittent periods during which continuous physical exertion is required, such as walking, standing, stooping, climbing, lifting, and maneuvering material or equipment that may be heavy (50+ pounds) or awkward.
  • No travel required.

Education and Experience

  • HS Diploma or GED strongly preferred. 0-2 years of experience in area of responsibility.

Preferred Qualifications
Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with machines and tools, including their design, uses, repair, and maintenance. Lean manufacturing experience preferred.
  • Familiarity with converting decimal to fractions.
  • Experience reading a tape measure or other measurement devices.

If you’re looking to play a role in building America, consider one of our open opportunities. We can’t wait to meet you.
Functional Area Field Operations
Recruiter Williams, Victoria
Req ID WCJR-003599
White Cap is an Equal Opportunity Minority/Female/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veteran and Affirmative Action Employer. White Cap considers for employment and hires qualified candidates without regard to age, race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, protected veteran or disability status or any factor prohibited by law.

title: newManufacturing Engineering Specialist
description:
· Participate in Continuous Improvement activities and assist in implementing change on an ongoing basis throughout the company to improve safety, quality, productivity and environment.

· Investigates any new concepts or ideas that could improve any aspect specific to manufacturing/production.

· Participates and drives Continuous Improvement teams as a team member or leader and provides the team with expertise, direction and advice. Responsible as a team leader to manage the Continuous Improvement project by documenting each meeting, establishing timelines, goals, objectives and working within budget parameters.

· Participates in the development and maintenance of PFMEA documentation. Leads RPN reduction activities within the plant.

· Updates and maintains overall plant layout.

· Monitors the progress of jobs being performed by vendor(s), Tool and/or Maintenance room and provides direction as necessary.

· Facilitate training sessions to internal employees on an as needed basis (may include welding, robotics, PLC).

· Responsible for documenting current projects e.g. cost, quotes, pay back, timelines, goals, etc. and provides information to management.

· Co-ordinates the implementation of ECN’s (Engineering Change Notices), internally or customer driven.

· Develops and keeps Master Data (i.e. routings, BOM) and is responsible for validating and maintaining manufacturing process routings.

· Responsible for updating and product related documentation, e.g. set-up and operator instruction sheets, etc. and providing operator training as required. Assists operators in trouble shooting issues related to new equipment and provides recommendations on corrective action to prevent reoccurrence.

· Deals with customers on continuous improvement activities directly related to part/component KIRCHHOFF Automotive is manufacturing.

· Train maintenance employees on how to maintain equipment and follow procedures when trouble-shooting for equipment related to the Continuous Improvement projects.

· Works co-operatively with Program Manager on new product launches to develop the budget and equipment acquisition when requested. Supports new launch start-ups in the plant.

· Review and support the plants with Technical Variances.

· Initiates and performs engineering tryouts.

· Monitors and assists operations on capacity validation activities.

· Assists in Managing Engineering inventory location (2500) for the plants.

· Any other reasonable request made by management.

· Contributes to a safe, clean and comfortable work environment that complements the Occupational Health and Safety Act by ensuring the principles of the 5S discipline (simplify, separate, sanitize, standardize and support) are supported and adhered to.

· Ensures he/she is in full compliance with the laws of Ontario and/or any other province or state, while representing KIRCHHOFF Automotive or during the use of any KIRCHHOFF Automotive provided equipment.

· Judgement – exercises judgement re:

Ø Handling various types of personalities when facilitating a Continuous Improvement team to achieve optimum success of project.

Ø Ability to identify improvement opportunities that contribute to quality and cost while still meeting customer requirements.

· Accountability – is accountable in areas of:

Ø Responsible for meeting budget parameters determined for each project associated with the purchasing of new equipment.

Ø Accountable for meeting established project timelines.

Ø Maintain and update required documents in compliance with IATF 16949 standards.

· Contacts – establishes/maintains relationships:

Ø Members of senior management and employees at all levels within the organization

Ø Customers

Ø Suppliers of assembly and manufacturing equipment

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $75,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Profit sharing
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • North York, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (required)

title: General Production Person
description:
For Current Agropur Employees:
Please apply for this job through the Career application of your
Workday Home Page.
Job Type:
Regular
Working at Agropur means being a member of an extended family where simplicity and honesty are part of everyday life, and where the management style is based on integrity, openness and autonomy. You too can join the Agropur family!
GENERAL PLANT PERSONNEL

At our Agropur Milk Plant in Edmonton

This position may be responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of the facility, shipping, operating a variety of production equipment and any chemical testing required. Previous experience in the dairy industry is an asset but not a requirement.

The Edmonton Milk Plant is a 24 hour facility and as a result shift times may vary and include weekend AM and PM shifts.
The hourly wage is $24.04 per hour

Requirements:
  • Physical Requirements for this position include bending, twisting, and heavy lifting up to 65 lbs.
  • Candidates must understand and follow plant policies and procedures including but not limited to: Becoming educated with all plant procedures such as safety training, handling of chemicals (WHIMIS), pallet truck usage ,good manufacturing practices (GMP’S), using personal protective equipment (PPE), HACCP training,
  • The ability to perform other tasks when needed.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Understand and follow plant policies and procedures including but not limited to: To become educated with all plant procedures such as safety training, handling of chemicals (WHIMIS), pallet truck, good manufacturing practices (GMP’S), personal protective equipment (PPE),and HACCP and M&W training.
  • Must be available for weekend morning shifts.
  • This position is responsible for stacking and piling products on pallets and preparing them for shipment using various kinds of equipment for packaging while following specific set of standards and requirements.
  • Previous experience with a power jack and/or forklift and food production experience are an asset.

title: General Labourer
description:
Atlantic Industries Limited (AIL) is a manufacturer of structural plate bridges and corrugated pipe drainage systems.

We are looking for a General Labourer to run various equipment in our manufacturing facility. Experience an asset but paid training is provided. Students are welcome to apply. Wage is $18 - $22 per hour.
**
*Responsibilities: *

  • Assisting operators in machine operation.
  • Keeping the workstations tidy and clean
  • Assisting with trouble shooting and problem solving.

**
*Qualifications required: *

  • Safety conscious

description:
General Worker / Food Production Laborer / General Helper

Fizi Gourmet is a Montreal based operated private label manufacturing company specializing in sauces, soups, marinades, dressings for the retail & foodservice industry. We cater to small to mid-sized restaurant chains, foodservice, distributors, and supermarkets. We are a fastest-growing company and are looking for the best and brightest to join our team.

· Food manufacturing, food preparation, retrieving raw materials, assembling recipes

· Packaging of finished goods

· Clean and maintain work area

· Filling out quality control paperwork, relative to goods produced

· Sterilization and sanitation of equipment

Prerequisites

· Able to work well and collaborate in teams

· Ability to push, pull and lift 50lbs

· Versatile, dynamic, and flexible

· Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment under time constraints

· Previous knowledge of food manufacturing is an asset

· Knowledge of hygiene, safety, and sanitary practices considered an asset (e.g. MAPAQ, HACCP, etc)

17$-20$ per hour full-time Position

description:
Job offer at Soucy Caoutchouc – Drummondville


WHY JOIN US?

  • Permanent, full-time position
  • Shift: evening, night and weekend shifts
  • Salary: starting at 25.75$/hr with progression
  • Group insurance (different plans adapted to your needs)
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan

  • Employee and family assistance program

HOW WILL YOU BE SPENDING YOUR TIME?

Are you physically fit and do you like mechanics? Then... We have a great opportunity for you!

  • Operate a compression press to mold the rubber track

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

Even if you have little experience, don't hesitate to send us your application, our team will be there for you!


WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR TO APPLY?

We look forward to getting to know you and working with you!

title: Production Worker
description:
Our corporate client is looking to hire foreign workers for the Production Worker position in Fruit & Vegetable Manufacture based out in Mississauga, Ontario, Canada:


We are currently looking for 10 Production Workers for a full-time position without higher education and previous work experience.

As a Production Worker, you would be performing the following on a regular basis:
  • Process raw produce and move throughout the warehouse and production area;
  • Wash and clean fruits and vegetables for peeling
  • Feed clean produce and feed to processing machines for cutting
  • Assist machine operators in ensuring machine specifications are set accordingly based on product verifications
  • Pack produce into bags and other containers and organize by product
  • Clean work areas and equipment
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects
  • Assist process control and machine operators in performing their duties, if necessary


Requirements

  • No education requirements
  • No work experience necessary – on-the-job training will be provided
  • Good English language skills
  • Ability to work in fast-paced environment
  • Ability to work different shifts


Benefits

  • Support with getting Permanent Residency in Canada after 1 - 2 years of work will be provided.
  • This is a full-time, temporary position with at least 40 hours of work per week
  • Hourly rate of $23.25 overtime rate applies after 44 hours of work per week
  • Medical, Dental, and Disability benefits
Interested applicants should apply directly through this posting. We would like to thank all applicants for your interest! Only those applicants selected to move forward in the recruitment process will be contacted.

title: Assembly QA
description:
We are currently seeking a Quality Assurance Technologist to join our QA team at our head office in Brampton.

This is a permanent, full-time position with the opportunity to grow with an industry leader.

Main Responsibilities

  • Interpret architectural drawings to determine quality standards
  • Collect and compile data, forming reports regarding the quality products and materials
  • Perform root cause analysis to determine issues regards quality, and communicating the findings with the appropriate stakeholders
  • Participate in LEAN programming

Qualifications

  • 1-2 years of QA experience, preferably in a related setting- construction/manufacturing
  • Ability to read and interpret architectural drawings is required
  • Completion of a 2-3 year college program or equivalent in manufacturing technology or a related discipline is preferred
  • Must have a strong understanding of the Quality Assurance methodology
  • Strong attention to detail, with the ability to work individually or as part of a team
  • Knowledge of CAD programs is an asset
  • Knowledge of LEAN is an asset

We will offer the successful candidate a competitive hourly rate based on relevant knowledge and experience, a discretionary profit sharing bonus and an opportunity to work with like-minded professionals. We can offer you an excellent career path with a high growth company. Please apply through this ad, or email your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications to Human Resources. Only candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $17.00-$20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Brampton, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: newGeneral Labourer Helper
description:
Identification: General Labourer Helper

Supervisor: CEO

Status: Regular, 7-week contract with potential for extension

Location: Watson Lake, Yukon

Iyon Kechika Contracting Ltd. (IKC), the development corporation of Daylu Dena Council (DDC), has been in operation for more than 20 years. IKC works to create economic development opportunities for the Nation. They specialize in civil construction, cement, aggregates, ready mix concrete, and asphalt as well as clearing, environmental remediation, earthworks, labour, slashing, water truck services, road maintenance and much more. Iyon Kechika is looking for a General Labourer Helper to join the team. Located in Watson Lake, Yukon, they are looking for a candidate to work in community, that enjoys the northern lifestyle.

Job Description:

The General Labourer Helper position requires a hard-working youth looking for a summer position, with the potential to extend employment in the fall. This position requires diligence and attention to detail in order to execute the work in a prompt and efficient manner that still meets the standard of quality workmanship in safety, quality, environmental mindfulness, and site tidiness.
Extensive training for this position will be provided onsite providing the individual with potential career-related work experience. This position is funded by Canada Summer Jobs, as such applicants must be between the ages of 15-30.

Responsibilities:

  • Cleaning and preparing the site
  • Loading/unloading materials
  • Operating and assisting with machinery
  • Assisting skilled tradespeople
  • Following instructions from supervisors

Ideal Candidate Should Possess the Following:

  • Local Resident (or willing to relocate)
  • Youth looking for entry level general labour experience
  • Ability to take direction from superiors

P.O. BOX 66 LOWER POST, B.C.V0C 1W0

PH-250-779-3010 FAX- 250-779-3001

  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a team environment
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize
  • Desire to learn from skilled tradespeople

Work Conditions:

Role operates primarily at manufacturing location where the conditions include moving mechanical equipment, dust, inclement weather, heat, humidity, and elevated noise levels.

Job Types: Full-time, Temporary (Summer)

Salary: $22 per hour

Preference will be given to Kaska members who meet the minimum requirements.

Posting is open until filled.

Soga Sinla / Thank you to all who apply, however,

only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Seasonal, Internship / Co-op
Contract length: 7 weeks

Salary: $22.00 per hour

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

title: newGeneral Accountant
description:
Crown Food Service Equipment, Ltd. is a leading design and manufacturer of steam cooking equipment for the commercial foodservice industry.

Crown complements other recent strategic investments in the steam cooking category. With this collection of brands and products, the Middleby steam platform is positioned with industry leading innovations and customer solutions. We are able to address customer demands for labor savings, menu flexibility and automation, while also supporting growing foodservice trends, such as sous vide, organic and other healthy-eating menu options.

We are currently seeking a full-time, permanent General Accountant to assist with day-to-day operations for our accounting department.

GENERAL ACCOUNTING

  • Prepares & Enters account entries by compiling and analyzing account information.
  • Documents financial transactions by entering account information.
  • Recommends financial actions by analyzing accounting options.
  • Summarizes current financial status by collecting information, preparing balance sheet, profit and loss statement, and other reports.
  • Substantiates financial transactions by auditing documents.
  • Maintains accounting controls by preparing & recommending policies and procedures.
  • Guides accounting clerical staff by coordinating activities and answering questions.
  • Reconciles financial discrepancies by collecting and analyzing account information.
  • Secures financial information by completing data base backups.
  • Maintains financial security by following internal controls.
  • Prepares payments by verifying documentation and requesting disbursements.
  • Researching and interpreting accounting policy and regulations
  • Complies with federal, state, and local financial legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation, enforcing adherence, and advising management on actions
  • Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
  • Maintains customer confidence and protects operations through confidentiality
  • Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications
  • Accomplishes the result by performing the duty
  • Protects organization's value by keeping information confidential
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed

ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE

  • Verify Shipped Orders entered by the shippers are accurate
  • Maintaining the billing system
  • Generating invoices and account statements & credits notes
  • Send statement of account at least twice a month to customers electronically
  • Performing account reconciliations
  • Posts customer payments by recording cash, checks, and credit card transactions
  • Maintaining accounts receivable files and records
  • Producing monthly financial and management reports
  • Investigating and resolving any irregularities or enquiries
  • Assisting in general financial management and analysis
  • Verifies validity of account discrepancies by obtaining and investigating information from sales, trade promotions, customer service departments, and from customers
  • Resolves valid or authorized deductions by entering adjusting entries
  • Resolves invalid or unauthorized deductions.
  • Resolves collections by examining customer payment plans, payment history, credit line, coordinating contact with collections department.
  • Summarizes receivables by maintaining invoice accounts; coordinating monthly transfer to accounts receivable account; verifying totals; preparing report.

ACCOUNTS PAYABLE

  • Enters Invoices Material & Non-Material, with 3-way matching.
  • Process payments, controls expenses by processing, verifying, & reconciling invoices
  • Reconciles work by verifying entries and comparing system reports to balances.
  • Charges expenses to accounts, analyzing invoice/expense reports, recording entries.
  • Pays vendors by monitoring discount opportunities, scheduling and preparing checks, and resolving PO, contract, invoice, payment discrepancies and documentation.
  • Twice Monthly ETF Runs in CAD & USD with Manual Cheques as needed.
  • Wire Payments as needed
  • Ensures credit is received for outstanding memos.
  • Issues stop-payments or purchase order amendments.
  • Pays employees by receiving and verifying expense reports and requests for advances.
  • Maintains accounting ledgers by verifying and posting account transactions.
  • Verifies vendor accounts by reconciling monthly statements and related transactions.
  • Maintains historical records by microfilming and filing documents.
  • Disburses petty cash by recording entry and verifying documentation.
  • Calculate & Remit sales taxes, payroll deductions, Tax Installments, WSIB, EHT.
  • Complete Bank Reconciliation including reconcile VISA Transactions.
  • Enter billing and reconcile I/C accounts
  • Identify, calculate, and enter expense accruals.

OTHER

  • Ensure compliance with company policy, safety standards & quality standards
  • Participate in company cross-training program (as trainee and trainer)
  • Standardizing, implementing and creating new guidelines, policies and best practices within the quality operation
  • Adheres to all company policies & procedures, health and safety policies & procedures, regulations & standards, quality standards and good housekeeping 5S practices
  • Commit to and participate in lean manufacturing and continuous improvement methods
  • Will demonstrate, promote and exemplify the company’s core values in safety, people, quality and growth
  • Perform any additional tasks assigned by Management, recognizing that priorities can and will shift quickly to adjust to the demands of other departments for the overall benefit of the company

Requirements:

  • Completion of post-secondary education/applicable certification in Accounting
  • Minimum 3 - 5 years of experience in Accounting
  • Work experience in a manufacturing or similar setting preferred
  • Strong knowledge of journal entries processing and reconciliation activities
  • Practical experience with ERP systems
  • Communication – work in a collaborative environment that requires coordination with other departments
  • Detail and deadline oriented
  • Strong work ethics and the ability to maintain confidentiality
  • General math skills
  • Excellent multi-tasking and organization skills
  • Strong computer skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office; Outlook, Word, Excel, Power Point
  • Highly proficient in advanced MS Excel including pivot tables and v-lookups

Working Conditions Notations

  • Ability to spend long hours in front of a computer screen
  • Maintain interpersonal interactions
  • Requires speed and the ability to interpret data
  • High level of focus with a high level of attention to detail
  • Manual effort - light to medium
  • Able to work beyond normal working hours on weekdays and weekends as required

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$75,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Accounting: 3 years (required)
  • Accounts payable: 3 years (required)
  • Accounts Receivable: 3 years (required)
  • Manufacturing: 3 years (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-13
Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: newCasting Production Operator
description:
As an industry-leading provider of aluminum products and services in North America, Signature Aluminum Canada, Inc. is uniquely positioned to leverage its many years of casting, extrusion, and manufacturing experience into a reliable and consistent supply of extremely complex, tight tolerance, or basic lineal parts.

Our vision at Signature Aluminum Canada, Inc. is to be a company of unquestioned integrity and a provider of high-quality products and services. To accomplish this, we work as a customer-oriented team, dedicated to continuous improvement in all areas. Our work environment promotes involvement, self-esteem, and safety and security for all employees.

With a strong order book, we are seeking to recruit Production Assistants to work as part of our Casting team with key responsibilities for the production and delivery of high-quality products and services to customers. Key tasks include:

RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Operating machinery including overhead cranes, forklifts, saws and other required equipment following training provided

· Undertaking melter duties in a safe and controlled way

· Calculating and measuring raw ingredients in line with product specifications

· Working closely with team members in ensuring the safe, timely production and delivery of goods to other departments and customers

· Performing necessary quality checks in line with quality standards

· Supporting management in helping to trouble shoot problems and propose solutions to issues as these arise

· Participate in continuous improvement initiatives with the aim of helping to raise performance and standards within the department

· Contribute to team meetings and daily handover briefings to ensure key priorities are understood and actioned accordingly

These roles are demanding and will suit candidates who have worked in complex, industrial or construction environments exposed to varying temperatures. With a solid background in manufacturing, ideally gained from a foundry background, you will be able to demonstrate a technical understanding of Casting or metallurgical principles. However, with the right attitude and strong willingness to learn the company is also committed to developing individuals in this field. A team player you will work well with others, be a self-starter and have excellent communication and problem-solving capabilities.

In return we offer:

· A starting rate of $21/hr

· Annual raise after each year of service

· Paid training

· Extensive benefits package (Dental, Healthcare, Vision)

· Attendance bonus

· Pension plan with a Company match up to 3.25%

· Yearly boot allowance

· Overtime

· Shift premium

· And so much more ……

Our Shift Pattern:

· We are a 24/7 operation, 12 hour rotating continental shift pattern

· Start time are always 6.50 – 6.50

· Week 1: Mon, Tues day shift; Wed, Thurs off; Fri, Sat, Sun night shift

Week 2: Mon, Tues off; Wed, Thurs day shift; Fri, Sat, Sun off

· Employees work only 2 weekends per month, 7 days of work over a 2 week period

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act 2005 and SAC's Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act Policy, accommodations will be provided during all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are asked to kindly provide your accommodation needs in advance.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $21.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

title: newGeneral Labourer 1
description:
Redpath Sugar is part of the ASR Group, the world’s largest refiner and marketer of cane sugar, with an annual production capacity of more than 6 million tons of sugar.


The Redpath Belleville plant is a blending and packaging operation producing a variety of sugar containing products for customers in Canada and the U.S. The plant operates state of the art high speed mixing and packaging systems supported by high level safety, quality and logistics systems.


We are seeking individuals who enjoy working in a fast-paced manufacturing operation and have excellent communication skills, a drive for results and have the energy and vision to recognize and implement improvement opportunities both independently and as part of a team with members of all levels of an organization


Overview

As a member of the team, you will be responsible for operating various types of packaging and mixing equipment.


  • Preparing materials and weighing ingredients for product blending
  • Operating mixing equipment and ensuring accurate completion of processing steps and quality requirements
  • Being part of a packaging line team operating packing, labeling, and palletizing equipment
  • Completing sanitation and good housekeeping activities in the plant
  • Maintaining all required sampling, documentation, and verification activities for your tasks.
  • You are a team player who is eager to learn and have attention to detail and pride in your work.
  • In addition, you will also be responsible for maintaining good housekeeping in your area and following Good Manufacturing, Quality, and Safety Policies.


Requirements

  • To be successful in the position, we required High School Diploma, GED or equivalent and ability to use hand tools, use digital scale with timer and enter weights into a computer.
  • Experience in a manufacturing environment or food production environment is also an asset.


What We Offer

  • We offer our employees competitive benefits and pension plan. The starting wage for the position is $18.88 / hour.


For more than 100 years, our employees have taken pride in “Making Life a Little Sweeter” by providing our customers and consumers with quality service and sugar products. Our commitment to that principle drives us in all that we do and encourages us to uphold our company’s high ethical standards of business conduct to ensure our continued success

title: Intern, Manufacturing
description:
JOB SUMMARY:

At Resilience Biotechnologies Inc. (RESILIENCE), we’re specialists in biologics. In our two divisions; RESILIENCE Biomanufacturing, and RESILIENCE Innovations, our passion for quality and patient safety underpins everything we do. RESILIENCE Biomanufacturing is a global contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO); RESILIENCE Innovations is devoted to drug discovery, and research and development. Our scientists are currently developing innovative protein therapeutics in anemia, liver cancer, and hepatitis C.

The student will assist in documentation creation and record keeping. Employee will actively participate in process improvement initiatives, compliance/quality related tasks (revising/drafting SOPs, forms and Batch Records) and gain overall experience in the biopharmaceutical and Contract Manufacture industry.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Works closely with Supervisors on special projects (Compliance Enhancement, Process improvement initiatives)

  • Performs all duties according to the SOPs and cGMPs and all other established safety standards and company policies

  • Documents and record all necessary information/data as per SOPs and cGMPs requirements (i.e. observations, test results)

  • Practices and implements a safe work environment

  • Performs any other related duties as assigned

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Student enrolled in a College or University

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • This position requires a background check

BEHAVIOURAL:

Demonstrated ability to apply the following behavioral competencies on the job:

Decision Making: Consult and ask for help when needed

Teamwork: Working effectively and productively with others at various level of the organization.

Interpersonal Skills: Effectively communicating, building rapport and relating well to all personality types.

Organization and Planning: Utilizing logical, systematic and orderly procedures to meet objectives

Goal Orientation: Energetically focusing efforts on meeting a goal, mission or objective

This job profile provides an overview of the minimum requirements of the job and does not include all of the duties inherent, included or associated with the job or with the performance of the job. The Company reserves the right to make changes to the job profile as it sees fit to meet the needs of the organization.

While we appreciate your interest in this opportunity, only qualified candidates will be contacted. Resilience Biotechnologies Inc. (RESILIENCE), will not be responsible for any agency referral fees arising from the use of resumes that currently exist in the recruitment database or have been forwarded to directly Resilience Biotechnologies Inc. (RESILIENCE), or indirectly without an authorized agreement. Agency referrals will not be accepted unless approved by the Resilience Biotechnologies Inc. (RESILIENCE), Human Resources team.

NOTE: All employment is conditional upon the completing and obtaining a satisfactory background check, including pre-employment medical (where applicable), educational, employment, references, and criminal records checks (for which a pardon has not been granted).

Resilience Biotechnologies Inc. (RESILIENCE), is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process. Applicants are asked to make their needs/requirements known to Human Resources.

title: Production Worker
description:
What does WestRock do?
We are a manufacturing facility that makes corrugated boxes. Nothing fancy, but everyone needs boxes and we are busy! We make boxes for some of the world’s largest suppliers and we need people who want a career in manufacturing to be part of our WestRock family.

Career Opportunity:
Production Workers, or as we call them, Production Technicians, that work in our manufacturing facility are the key to ensuring quality cardboard boxes are produced for our customers. Working as a team, you will ensure production targets are met and that you and your co-workers are working safely. Daily tasks included pushing, pulling, lifting, moving, stacking cardboard through various machines.
To be considered for this position, you must be able to work a 12-hour rotating shift and committed to a full time, permanent job.
All successful applicants must be able to provide a satisfactory criminal background check and pre-employment medical.

Why work with WestRock:
Starting wage $24/hour, $26 after 6 months, $29/hour at one year
A great Management Team and experienced peers to help you along the way
Benefits from first day of employment
Pension plan from the first day of employment (up to 7% with company match)
Celebration lunches and BBQ’s
Family social club events and company golf tournament
An Employer that cares about health and safety
Training opportunities to work on different machines
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety, and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.
A management team committed to WestRock's values of Respect, Accountability, Integrity and Excellence

What you need to work at WestRock:
High school diploma
Attention to detail
Ability to work well in a team environment
Positive, can-do attitude and willingness to learn
Mechanical aptitude
Physically fit
Able to work continental shifts
As a global company, you will find our boxes worldwide! Next time you get a box, turn it around and see if you can find the WestRock stamp!
WestRock Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating and maintaining a diverse workforce. As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, WestRock will, upon request from the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact WestRock, Human Resources at 519-823-4871 about your needs and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.
Please apply with resume to www.westrock.com/careers .
