title: Quality Assurance Person
description:
The Quality Assurance Person (QAP) will report to the VP of Quality and Compliance. They will be responsible for ensuring compliance to quality components of the Cannabis Act and its Regulations, as well as ongoing monitoring of the quality systems, assisting in quality document writing and organization as well as assisting the record of inventories as per Health Canada and Canadian Revenue Agency regulations.

We believe all staff must champion organizational culture. We are a customer focused, community conscious, consumer obsessed, no bullsh*t company. We are not a collection of individuals, we are a team that is bound by our shared values of equality, community, accountability, hard work, dedication and perseverance.

The QAP is accountable for leading the site's Quality Assurance operations.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Manage Quality Management System and related documentation
  • Ensuring that SOPs and GDP requirements are being followed.
  • Analytical testing and validation of methods and the drafting and formulation of certificates of analysis, and the interpretation of scientific results and reporting from internal and external assay results using recognized pharmacopeia and other chemical and microbial analysis.
  • The appropriate use of pest control products and dosage forms
  • Oversight of an effective sanitation program to ensure production, packaging, labeling, and storage activities involving cannabis are conducted under sanitary conditions.
  • Conduct of recalls, complaint management, approval of product quality prior to approval for sale; product return management; sample retention; and reporting adverse reactions.
  • Identify and implement process improvements to increase the efficiency, effectiveness, and quality, oversee new equipment implementation or modification and validation.
  • Work with production team performing in product manufacturing processes validation for regulatory submissions, and preparation for regulatory inspections and commercial production.
  • Support continuous quality improvement.
  • Reconciliation of cannabis inventory on a monthly basis
  • Assisting with cannabis inventory reconciliation during internal and external audits
  • Other duties as assigned.

Skills, Technical and Behavioral Competencies Required:

  • Bachelor’s degree in science
  • Fluent in MS office (Word and Excel)
  • Effective communicator, both written and verbal.
  • Willingness to work flexible schedules as required.
  • The ideal candidate would have the ability to work independently or in a team, be self-motivated and have great attention to detail.
  • The candidate should be flexible in working in varied climates and with performing repetitive work at times.

Experience

  • 1+ years of experience as a QAP in the cannabis industry.
  • Experience with CRA and CTLS reporting.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $90,000.00-$120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Quality Control in Cannabis: 1 year (required)
  • CRA and CTLS Reporting: 1 year (preferred)

title: Scheduling Coordinator (Stators)
description:
SCHEDULING COORDINATOR

JOB SUMMARY:

The Scheduling Coordinator ensures execution the Manufacturing Planning Program is reached through maximizing total resources while supporting company KPI’s regarding inventory, lead times, capacity plan, scheduling, and customer requirements.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Prepare production plan based of Planning Program
  • Set daily and weekly production targets based of facility capacity and KPI’s.
  • Monitor Production activity and utilizing Lean Manufacturing techniques to improve planning targets.
  • Organize and Monitor all related outsourcing requirements related to production scheduling
  • Daily communication with Production Manager and Supervisors on daily KPI targets and objectives
  • Coordinate all activities with Production Planning Coordinator to ensure coverage of plant capacity and program
  • Review with Production any coverage or capacity issues
  • Ensure Production is expediting and pushing daily production program through each work station
  • Produce and process any schedules or reports as required by team, internal or external customers.
  • Review and identify process flow improvements to improve performance and understanding of the Planning Program
  • Review open manufacturing order statuses
  • Maintain accurate manufacturing order schedule with Production Planning Coordinator
  • Entry notes into ERP system regarding status of current backlog
  • Work with Manufacturing, Engineering and Planning to ensure accurate work orders

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

  • Scheduling experience required.
  • Microsoft Office; Word, Excel, Outlook
  • ERP systems; JD Edwards, Microsoft based

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: newFactory Floor Worker
description:
Floor Labour

At our location, we manufacturing tobacco products for the domestic and export market. Your job obligation is to assist machine operator and maintain jobs given. We are seeking matured, reliable individuals to work between 30-40 hours a week. Occasional weekends maybe needed and some overtime.

Job Description: '

  • Assist on production lines
  • keep facility free of dust and debris
  • keep tobacco moist
  • washing trays, trolleys and tarps
  • prep work for pouch table - prepare and set up
  • possible building work tables
  • assist in all facility work places
  • inventory counts continuous and accurate & restocking
  • grease machines, changing parts when required
  • quality assurance is a key

Requirements

  • comfortable with power tools
  • flexible and must be organized
  • some computer skills in Microsoft Excel is required
  • mature and reliable
  • must have reliable transportation
  • not afraid of heights
  • steel toed shoes/boots mandated
  • lift up to 50 lbs
  • able to multi-task
  • team player
  • personal hygiene critical as you are working with a consumable
  • Security Police Check required upon first day of employment

Benefits:

  • Health Benefits
  • Weekend outings
  • Social Committee
  • No weekends or evenings

Tobacco cigarettes and Roll-your-Own is the production line, we manufacture and sell direct from this location. If you feel you have the qualifications to be a divers individual (handyman), the please apply.

An interview will be scheduled through Indeed once the review of resume has taken place. Be sure to bring in 3 references excluding friends and family.

Salary: $15.00-$17.00 per hour

Additional pay:

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
You must have at least two shots in order to be employed at North Shore and to be verified upon signing Job Offer.

  • Manufacturing Facility: 3 years (required)
  • Microsoft Excel: 3 years (preferred)

title: Production Associate - Full time - Shift premiums!
description:
Egar Tool & Die

Egar Tool and Die is a world-class manufacturer of automotive stamping dies, production stampings and welded assemblies. Located in Cambridge, Ontario, Egar has been supplying complex progressive and transfer dies to the North American Tier I automotive industry for more than 40 years!

Production Associates

Egar Tool and Die Ltd. is pleased to offer Full Time employment opportunities in our Stamping and Assembly departments. Our production associates are an integral part of our stamping and assembly processes, ensuring the best quality parts are delivered to our customers. You will be challenged to meet production targets together with your team.

Job Duties & Responsibilities

  • Accurately loading preprogrammed weld cells with 2-5lb parts
  • Accurately pack parts coming off stamping presses
  • Maximize quality and production as part of a team
  • Conduct frequent part inspections for defects (requires good attention to details)
  • Accurately and safely pack parts into appropriate bins to prepare for shipment
  • Perform and maintain 5S standards in areas of responsibility

Qualifications

  • Ability to stand for long periods (full shift)
  • Must be fully mobile, lifting and bending involved (must be able to lift 35 – 50 lbs)
  • Proficient in written and spoken English
  • Ability to use basic hand tools accurately and efficiently
  • Accountable – Teachable – Approachable -team player
  • Conscientious worker with good eye for detail
  • Ability to learn, make decisions, be flexible and problem solve

WHY JOIN US?!

  • 3- or 4-day work week for Full time employees
  • Shift premium for weekends and nights
  • Benefits – Uniforms- Long term disability insurance, for full time employees.
  • Employee referral program
  • Weekly competitive pay!

Salary information:

  • $18.00 - $19.00 per hour depending on position
  • $0.75 shift premium nights
  • 4 hour shift bonus weekends*

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift
  • Overtime

title: Cleaner Operator
description:
Redpath Sugar is located on Toronto’s historic downtown waterfront and has been a part of Canada’s heritage for more than 160 years. Our brand is the oldest food-related trademark in Canada and is recognized across the country. Redpath Sugar is part of ASR Group, the largest cane sugar refiner in the world.


OVERVIEW

Responsible for maintaining cleanliness throughout the refinery and packaging areas in addition to returning scrap product to the raw materials shed. The cleaner position is an entry-level position $21.12/hour and cleaners can bid into other manufacturing positions with a starting rate of $31.77/hour after the probationary period has been completed and new positions are available.


DETAILED ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Responsible for the care and general cleanliness of the packaging and process building floors and equipment.
  • Remove dust from process areas
  • Clean food contact and non-food contact equipment (fans, electrical pans, etc.), structural parts (ceilings, walls, drains, and floors) using specific procedures as directed. Follow specific instructions to clean equipment.
  • Lifting, cutting and emptying scrap sugar bags of up to 20 kg (40kg with a team lift)
  • Be able to maneuver large buggies full of reject sugar.
  • Required to operate powered hand trucks with a full load of sugar.
  • Mop large floor areas.
  • Operate floor washer to clean large floor areas
  • Perform all responsibilities following established GMP Standards, Food Safety, and Health & Safety policies and procedures.
  • Job duties are varied and spread over a number of locations in the plant. Therefore, special assignments may be created on a case-by-case basis based on business needs.
  • Keep Sanitation Supervisor informed of any unsanitary practices that may be occurring in the plant.
  • Follow sanitation procedures
  • Responsible for accurate tracking and record-keeping required for the sanitation department.
  • Perform cleaning assignments as scheduled by Supervisor as well as all other related assignments including assisting and training of other associates as required by the Sanitation Supervisor.
  • Job duties are not limited to the above and other duties may be assigned.


EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • High School or equivalent


ESSENTIAL CAPABILITIES (KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES)

  • Able to follow simple instructions
  • Able to carry out routine but varied tasks
  • Able to operate packaging machinery, powered hand trucks and equipment
  • Able to apply proper cleaning procedures.


Experience, Qualifications, and Educational Requirements:

  • One year of work in a manufacturing or industrial environment is an asset.
  • Knowledge of dry/wet cleaning process and chemical functionality.
  • Understanding of WHMIS & adheres to all safety and good manufacturing practices.
  • Work well in teams.
  • Work in a safe and conscientious manner and independently with minimum supervision.
  • Ability to excel in a fast-paced environment where attention to detail and effective multi-tasking is essential.
  • Oral and written communication skills.
  • manufacturing or industrial environment working: 1 year (Preferred)


Physical Effort:

  • Regular periods during which there is continuous physical exertion required.
  • May be required to lift and/or move up to 20 kg.
  • Must have the ability to stand for extended periods of time.
  • Must have the ability to bend, stoop, kneel, reach and climb stairs.
  • Must have the ability to see and handle product, machinery, and hand tools,


Work Environment:

  • Regularly exposed to allergens such as peanuts, tree nuts, sulfites, soya, dairy, egg, gluten and sesame.
  • Occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions including slippery floors.
  • May be exposed to equipment and processing mediums exceeding several hundred degrees Fahrenheit and noise levels exceeding 85 decibels. Mandatory hearing protection for all employees.
  • The employee may be required to handle chemicals that require PPE to be worn including respiratory PPE.


For more than 100 years, our employees have taken pride in “Making Life a Little Sweeter” by providing our customers and consumers with quality service and sugar products. Our commitment to that principle drives us in all that we do and encourages us to uphold our company’s high ethical standards of business conduct to ensure our continued success

title: newElectrician
description:
CASCADES
Founded in 1964, Cascades produces, converts and markets packaging and tissue products that are composed mainly of recycled fibers. The Company employs 11,000 employees, who work in more than 90 production units located in North America and Europe. With its management philosophy, half a century of experience in recycling, and continuous efforts in research and development as driving forces, Cascades continues to deliver the innovative products that customers have come to rely on.

CASCADES CONTAINERBOARD PACKAGING
The Containerboard Packaging Group, a division of Cascades, is the largest containerboard producer in Canada, and is also a top converter of corrugated products in the country. The Group manufactures a wide range of products made from recycled fibres for its North American customers in the food, beverage and consumer products sectors, among many others. The Division, which employs close to 3,400 people, owns six containerboard mills and nineteen corrugated products plants in Canada and the United States.
Job Description

Cascades Containerboard Packaging - Richmond is located at 3300 Viking Way, Richmond, BC. CCP - Richmond has been offering custom made packaging to the Lower Mainland of BC and beyond for close to 50 years. Currently we are looking for an experienced Industrial Electrician to join our Maintenance Team.

The successful candidate will be able to make use of an exceptional benefit package:

  • The starting rate for the position is $44.99/hour
  • The ability to work with a large organization
  • The ability to work for a company that has sustainable development at the heart of its philosophy
  • A benefit plan that offers heath benefits, dental benefits, STD & LTD benefits, life insurance, critical illness insurance, accident disability insurance, retiree benefits
  • An exceptional Defined Benefit (DB) pension plan
  • A Share Purchase Plan after one year of continuous service
  • Profit sharing that is unique to all other companies
Job Responsibilities

Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, the successful candidate will have the following main responsibilities:

  • Be available for a three-shift rotation including days, afternoons, and graveyards.
  • Be able to work 8- and 12-hour shifts.
  • Maintain, repair, test and install electrical motors, generators, alternators, industrial storage batteries and hydraulic and pneumatic electrical control systems.
  • Read and interpret drawings, blueprints, schematics and electrical code specifications to determine layout of industrial electrical equipment installations.
  • Troubleshoot, maintain, and repair industrial, electrical and electronic control systems and other related devices.
  • Conduct preventive maintenance programs and keep maintenance records.
Qualifications

The successful candidate will have the following qualifications and experience:

  • Completion of Industrial Electrician Red Seal Certificate
  • 5 years Industrial Electrician experience, preferably in a manufacturing environment
  • In depth knowledge and experience with PLCs, AB, and solid understanding of electrical and process instrumentation diagrams
  • Experience in the installation, repair and maintenance of electrical systems and equipment
  • Ability to work within a team environment
  • Demonstrate and maintain a safe working environment
  • Cascades believes in the success of an inclusive organization that values diversity within its team. All qualified candidates will be considered for this position in a fair manner.
Cascades believes in the success of an inclusive organization that values diversity within its team. All qualified candidates will be considered for this position in a fair manner.


Use of the masculine in our communications refers equally to both men and women.


Job Segment: Hydraulics, Electrical, Electrician, Instrumentation, Engineering

title: Manufacturing Manager
description:
Specializing in South Asian baked goods, fried snacks, and condiments.

Plan, organise, direct, control, and analyse the activities of a manufacturing establishment or a manufacturing firm's operations or production department.

Develop and implement strategies for maximising the usage of resources, labour, and equipment to reach production goals.

Plan and manage the budgeting process for your department.

Establish manufacturing schedules and keep track of raw materials and final goods.

Changes to machinery and equipment, manufacturing processes, and labour practises should be planned and implemented.

Establish a quality control inspection system and build reporting processes for production.

Overseeing the employee workforce in the department

Managing scheduling for maximum workforce efficiency

Evaluating, adjusting, and creating new policies and procedures as needed for effective operations

Ensuring that health and safety guidelines are followed

Acting as a liaison between management and workers

Managing risk to minimize losses and maximize profits

Leading and encouraging staff to operate at a high level of effectiveness

Develop new innovative products.

Manage the new concept development and production scale up process.

Participate in the Packaging Validation process.

Liaise with suppliers for new products and ingredients.

Source new ingredients to aid in the innovation process.

The job includes 10 paid vacation days.

vacancies: 2 vacancies

Etobicoke, ON M9W 4M2

Work remotely

Minimum 5 years of experience with South Asian snack and condiment manufacturing required

Schedule:

Education:

  • English (required)

Sunspace Modular Enclosures has current vacancies for

Manufacturing Team Members

Day Shift Monday to Thursday 6am to 4:15pm

Afternoon Shift Monday to Thursday 4:30pm to 2:30am

***New Weekend Shift Friday to Sunday 7am to 7pm

All 3 shifts available and are steady shifts (non-rotating)

· Reporting Directly to the Production Supervisor

Sunspace has become the largest employer in Newcastle, Ontario with a staff of more than 150 valued employees in the summer months. Sunspace is now a leading manufacturer in the United States as well as Canada, with Authorized Dealers covering the entire Eastern seaboard from Maine to South Carolina and reaching as far into the mid-west from Minnesota to Arkansas

Responsibilities of the Manufacturing Team Member

· Assist in the manufacturing/production of sunrooms and other seasonal products

· Assist in the set-up and organization of material locations

· Receive and follow directions from other personnel regarding assistance with operations

· Inspect product & material to ensure compliance with tolerance/quality standards

· Operation of required tools and measuring instruments - tape measure, and other hand/power tools i.e. saws, drills

· Meet daily targets and goals to ensure production requirements are met within the department

· Maintain work area(s)

· Work as a team in a designated department

· Follow health and safety policies and procedures ensuring a safe working environment

The Manufacturing Team Member will possess:

· A High School Diploma (or equivalent)

· Experience in a production/manufacturing/warehouse environment in an asset

· Experience using hand and Power Tools is an asset

Benefits of Working at Sunspace Modular Enclosures as a Manufacturing Team Member

· Opportunity for growth

· Working in a Team Focused atmosphere

· Health and Dental and Life/LTD Benefits

· Annual bonuses

· RRSP

Sunspace Modular Enclosures welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $19.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Profit sharing
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Newcastle, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: newDesigner, MES Recipe
description:
Title: Designer, MES Recipe

Date: Apr 9, 2022
Location: Taro Pharmaceauticals CAN
Company: Taro Pharmaceuticals INC, Canada
Taro Pharmaceuticals is a multinational, specialty pharmaceutical company with a vision of reaching people and touching lives globally as a leading provider of valued medicines. We are dedicated to meeting the needs of our customers and the overall community through the innovation, development, manufacturing and marketing of the highest quality healthcare products.
Established in 1950, Taro’s world class production facility is located in Brampton, Ontario, with a current team of over 600 Canadian employees. Our company’s focus on the dermatology sector has made us a leading manufacturer and supplier of specialized topical products with a diverse portfolio of creams, ointments, liquids, and gels.
With support from our parent company, Sun Pharma, one of the world’s largest specialty generic pharmaceutical companies, we are committed to providing a healthy, safe and rewarding environment for all of our employees.
Our reward packages have been designed to meet the needs of our diverse workforce and their families. For additional information visit: www.taro.com.
What we offer:
A safe and clean; GMP regulated work environment
Opportunities for career growth and development
A competitive wage/salary
Incentive bonus programs that are designed to reward employees for their individual contributions
Benefit programs designed to support our employees and their families, including a comprehensive health & dental benefits package, group RRSP matching program, direct access to healthcare and well-being programs, and paid time off
Employee training and organizational development programs including tuition reimbursement, internal mobility programs, and employee recognition programs
Our Brampton location is presently looking for a Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Recipe Designer to join our team.
Position: Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Recipe Designer
General Summary:
The main responsibility of these positions will be to support the recipe design process and maintain existing electronic batch records using Manufacturing Execution System at the Brampton site.
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Assist with drafting of process flow diagrams from paper based master formulas for loading into MES.
  • Design and assist other designers in the team with filling out predefined templates with data collected from various sources.
  • Create Compounding Master Batch Records (MBRs) working in collaboration with Pharma Technology specialists
  • Create Packaging Generic Master Batch Records (GMBRs) and Parameter Value Lists (PVLs) working in collaboration with QA Documentation specialists
  • Support creation and maintenance of Master data, Library elements, EQM State diagrams etc. on an ongoing basis
  • Support the creation and management of equipment state diagrams and equipment cleaning/calibration specifications (ESP)
  • Work with different types of MES PCS - SCADA, DCS and Historian
  • Perform when required process measurements and analysis in support of process improvements and to identify core issues (Pareto Chart, Process Flowing Mapping, Time Studies)
  • Participate in coordinating system design, build, testing and validation for process improvement and GMP related software solutions
  • Support testing activities by helping with recipe testing in development environment.
  • Assist with electronic recipe approvals, preparing and verifying Tractability Matrices between MES MBRs and Paper Master Formulas
  • Execute tests and qualification protocols to support implementation of new systems and installations if required
  • Provide adequate training to stakeholders pertaining to the implementation and use of MES
  • Prepare reports, user and maintenance manuals, procedures, technical specifications, and qualification protocols
  • Assist business technicians with shop floor support activities with regards to use of MES if required
  • Refine training materials such as SOP’s, training manuals and other documents based on feedback from MES specialists from various departments.
  • Complete all GMP Documentation correctly and in a timely manner
  • Complete all training assignments and maintain personal training records
  • Initiate, and follow through with actions required to close Change Controls
  • Other duties as assigned
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
  • Knowledge of Process Control Systems and solid Project Management skills
  • Strong engineering fundamentals and problem solving skills
  • Strong listening skills and ability to pick-up details from documents
  • Knowledge of process flow and logic diagrams/drawings.
  • Experience working with design or other software applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to communicate and work effectively in a team-based environment.
  • Experience Working knowledge of Kepware’s KEPServerEX, and other OPC servers
  • Ability to learn and utilize new software/ equipment to implement solutions
  • Knowledge of Good Manufacturing Practices
Background and Experience:
  • Recent graduate in an Engineering or Science (Computer, Chemistry etc.) discipline.
  • Solid knowledge of Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES). Werum PAS-X experience required with deep understanding or implementation skills
  • Extensive Programming or computer logic knowledge/experience preferred
  • Experience with documentation or technical writing
  • Working knowledge of database fundamentals and ERP systems
Working Conditions:
  • Main working hours by 8 hours shift (2 possible shifts between 5 p.m. and 9 a.m.)
  • Working in the office with immediate presence on the manufacturing shop floor as required for the support
  • General working hours (9 a.m. to 5 p.m.) may be expected during time of training and special activities.
  • Flexibility to be at site and varying work schedules to implement CPI initiatives at a 24/7 site. Training assignments may involve working rotating shifts.
  • Ability to work under dynamic and evolving business objectives along with emerging constraints
We thank all applicants, but only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No phone calls please.
This position is open to applicants legally authorized to work in Canada.
Taro Pharmaceuticals embraces diversity in the workplace and is committed to achieving employment equity. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. We ensure that our recruitment practices are supportive of this commitment and do not infringe on any characteristics protected by law.
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Taro Pharmaceuticals will provide accommodation throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources of the nature of accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.
NOTE: All employment is conditional upon the completing and obtaining of a satisfactory background check which may include educational, employment, references and criminal records (for which a pardon has not been granted) checks.
AGENCY NOTICE: Please note that Taro Pharmaceuticals does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Services Agreement with an agency / recruiter, Taro Pharmaceuticals will not consider any referrals or agree to payment of referral or recruitment fees. In the event a recruiter or an agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, Taro Pharmaceuticals explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

title: title
description: description

title: Operator
description:
OPERATOR

 

This person will run a production line on a shift to shift basis.

 

Duties include:

  • Day to day operation of all lines in production area.
    • Working safely and ensuring everyone around you is also working safely.
    • Packing, wrapping skids, relieving for breaks, ensuring line is running at peak operating conditions.
  • See job description

 

  • Duties

    • All product ran according to Production Order unless changed by Production Manager or Plant Mgr.
    • Good knowledge of all operating procedures for cast and blown lines and how to maintain at all times.
    • Good knowledge of all quality procedures and ensuring quality of product meets customer’s needs 100% of the time.
    • Packaging (labels, bar codes are applied straight on corrugated)
    • Corrugated boxes are straight and evenly centered on skids before wrapping
    • Skids are properly wrapped and clearly marked with Pallet ticket number, date code and S.O. number
    • Skids stored properly in warehouse and hot room stacked and lined up straight
    • Line stocked up for shift change (cores, corrugated, skids)

Stretch Film Manufacturing

In 1993 a new company set out to change the landscape of the stretch film industry.  The philosophy was simple.  Provide a consistent product at a fair price in configurations that make sense for our distribution partners.  Twenty-six years later that small company with big ideas has grown into 

The Industry Leader.

Starting from a small plant in New Jersey, Sigma Stretch Film added grass roots plants in Kentucky, Oklahoma, California, and Canada and has swelled to over 700 million pounds of capacity.  It doesn’t stop there, however.  Sigma continues to grow faster than the market and knows it is important to continually add new equipment to separate itself from the pack.

At the heart of our manufacturing philosophy is a core belief that our products should be simple to use across a variety of equipment and we must produce all of those items at every location.  We also realize consistency is key.  Every one of our 450 manufacturing employees are laser focused on producing a world class quality product, and it shows in our results.

Benefits:

Benefits paid by Sigma for employees.
RRSP Match.
Paid Sick days.
Employee Family Assistance Program.

description:
Job description

Dynamic Windows & Doors is located in Abbotsford just off highway #1 on Mt Lehman Road where we have our head office and approximately 110,000 square foot. Since its modest beginnings Dynamic Windows & Doors has grown to become North America’s largest custom wood & steel window and door manufacturing company. Dynamic Windows & Doors manufacturers’ custom wood and metal windows and doors for architecturally designed luxury residences and historical replacement. Dynamic Windows & Doors’ manufacturing process involves the use of specialized high-tech processing equipment and proprietary software technologies.

Day Shift: 6:30 am - 3:00 pm
Afternoon Shift: 3:00 pm - 11:30 pm
Night Shift: Mon - Thurs 8:00PM - 6:30AM

An additional shift premium of $0.50/hr for afternoon shift
An additional premium of $0.75/hr for night shift

title: Quality Inspector
description:
DRS Technologies Canada Ltd. (DRS Canada), a subsidiary of Leonardo DRS, is a leading mid-tier Canadian defence electronics company specializing in military voice and data communications systems; electro‑optics (EO) and infrared search and tracking systems (IRST); command, control, communications, computers and intelligence (C4I) systems integration; deployable flight data recorders; and defence/space electronics manufacturing. 

What it is like working at DRS!

  • A motivating team-based environment where your achievements matter
  • A chance to work on industry leading edge technology with exceptional mentors
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Every second Friday off. We care about your work life balance!
  • Flexible hours. Work your hours around your schedule
  • Recipient of Carleton University’s Co-op Employer of the Year in 2018
  • Seasonal company-wide events: free BBQs, Christmas party, Dragon Boat team, Shinny hockey tournament, golf tournament, the Army Run, and more!

To learn more about Leonardo DRS, please visit our website at www.leonardodrs.com.

Purpose:
Inspection of materials and assemblies in accordance with DRS TCL and Customer quality standards.


 

Major Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Conducts inspection to ensure components, hardware and subassemblies are meeting quality standards
  • Responds to queries on the quality of parts
  • Makes decisions based on documented accept/reject criteria
  • Generates detailed nonconformance reports (NCRs) for rejected items
  • Actively manage backlog of rejected items to achieve targeted cycle time
  • Supports Quality Assurance or Customer Inspectors during Source and FAI Inspections
  • Responsible for release of product to stores, verifying that all contractual requirements have been met
  • Reviews test data sheets for compliance to the test requirements, and ensure all signoffs are complete and legible
  • Completes Inspection Checklist when required, requests  and signs off Release Notes, and routes product to shipp Performs assembly and other manufacturing functions as required when time allows
  • This profile reflects the major normal duties of the position.  Other duties and projects may be assigned

Core Competencies:

  • Good time management skills and ability to prioritize and schedule which tasks need to be done first 
  • Flexibility to take on additional tasks and to work outside of core business hours on short notice
  • Work with minimal supervision
  • Work well under pressure
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) with the ability to complete standard reports and documentationpertaining to role
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Team Player, with demonstrated ability to achieve end results through and with others in team
  • Ability to understand industry and quality standards, and to resolve conformance issues

Technical Competencies:

  • Minimum of 3-5 years successful and progressive experience in an inspection role
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Certification and In-depth knowledge of relevant manufacturing standards (such as WHMA-A-620/J-Std-001/IPC-A-610) or common mechanical techniques (such as geometric dimensioning and tolerance practices)
  • Fluent with quality standards, internal documentation and product lines
  • Ability to use various measurement devices (calipers, pin gauges, go/no-go gauges, etc) and microscope to verify mechanical part compliance 
  • Experience reading drawings and able to verify part dimensions against drawing requirements
  • Proficient using  Metric and US/Imperial measurement systems and doing measurement conversions
  • Ability to interpret contractual requirements and to execute them independently
  • Intermediate PC skills and experience using ERP systems
  • Knowledge to implement effective ESD and Moisture Sensitivity practices at all times
  • Knowledge of SPC is an asset
  • Understands the link between assembly, inspection and QA in customer satisfaction
  • Certification (in-house) in Inspection is required
  • Knowledge of types of coatings; i.e. Chemical Filming, Anodizing, Grit blasting etc.

All applicants must be eligible to meet requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Program and to obtain a Secret level security clearance.

Applicants requiring a disability related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process are to advise Human Resources. DRS Technologies Canada Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer.

Applicants may apply to this position online at www.leonardodrs.com careers.

title: Painter
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Perform all functions pertaining to the painting of valves as per the production standards or work instructions provided.
  • Participate in coordinating work schedule for Paint and Prep area.

 Duties Include:

  • Prepare products for painting and paint products as per applicable Production standards and Work Instructions.
  • Sandblast product as required.
  • Ensure adherence to quality control standards.
  • Maintain cleanliness of painting and blasting area.
  • Maintenance of equipment.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications:

  • Two or more years of industrial painting experience (manufacturing environment preferred)
  • Experience using Epoxy coatings
  • WHIMS knowledge and training
  • Forklift and Crane Training
  • Strong interpersonal skills and capable of working with minimal supervision
  • Solid work ethic and the ability to work effectively in a team environment
  • A commitment to workplace health and safety and quality policy and objectives

Master Flo offers a competitive salary, profit sharing and a comprehensive benefit program to prospective employees, as well as the opportunity to work in an entrepreneurial environment, characterized by continued growth and strong business results.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However only those candidates identified for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Tool and Die Maker
description:
Job Purpose:
Supports product manufacturing by constructing and repairing dies; machining parts.

Duties:
* Develops die function and structure by studying blueprints of die, product, and prototypes; applying knowledge of material under stress, machining and assembly methods, and mathematics.

* Machines parts by measuring, marking, and scribing stock; setting up and operating lathe, mill, radial drill, shaper, grinder, etc.

* Confirms parts by comparing measurements to specifications.

* Assembles die by shaping, smoothing, and fitting parts with grinders, files, stones, etc.

* Confirms assembly by verifying dimensions, clearances, and alignment of parts and components with micrometers, thickness gauges, gauge blocks, dial indicators, etc.

* Completes assembly by bolting and doweling parts and components together with hammers, wrenches, etc.; connecting wiring and hydraulic lines.

* Confirms performance of die by installing die; inspecting operation of die; making adjustments; comparing finished product to specifications.

* Resolves assembly problems by altering assembly to meet specifications; notifying supervisor to obtain additional resources.

* Ensures operation of equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements; following manufacturer's instructions; troubleshooting malfunctions; calling for repairs.

* Maintains supplies inventory by checking supplies to determine amount available; anticipating needed supplies; placing and expediting orders for supplies; verifying receipt of supplies.

* Maintains continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs.

* Documents actions by completing logs.

* Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

Skills/Qualifications:
Controls and Instrumentation, Equipment Maintenance, Manufacturing Experience, Mechanical Inspection Tools, Tooling, Safety Management, Problem Solving, Documentation Skills, Power Tools, Judgment, Decision Making

title: Welder
description:
Job Purpose:
Fabricates components by analyzing requirements; welding parts.

Duties:
* Develops welding projects by analyzing work orders, prints, and completed assembly; calculating requirements; studying metals; determining appropriate welding techniques.

* Collects equipment and materials by studying specifications and component requirements; ordering supplies and gases.

* Fabricates components by using equipment to clean, prepare, cut, burn, and weld pieces; setting-up and measuring assemblies; selecting appropriate method.

* Verifies welding results by inspecting and testing welds.

* Documents actions by completing records.

* Maintains safe work environment by following procedures; complying with legal regulations.

* Keeps equipment operating by following operating instructions; troubleshooting breakdowns; maintaining supplies; performing preventive maintenance; calling for repairs.

* Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities.

* Accomplishes manufacturing and organization mission by completing related results as needed.

Skills/Qualifications:
Welding and Fabrication, Supply Management, Documentation Skills, Basic Safety, Equipment Maintenance, Power Tools, Lifting, Analyzing Information , Dependability, Independence, Customer Service

title: Senior Fabricator-Specialist Welder
description:
Senior Fabricator Job Description-Specialist Welder/Instructor

Eligibility Criteria and Requirements:

  • Must be a Permanent Resident or Citizen of Canada
  • If you are not a Resident or Citizen of Canada, then you need to have a Valid work permit to work in Canada
  • Minimum three contactable Professional work references
  • Must be able to communicate in English (written and verbal)
  • Must be prepared to undergo a practical test

If you meet with the above criteria then please continue to apply for the vacant role; failure to meet with the eligibility criteria and responsibilities will automatically deem your application null and void.

Responsibilities:

  • Produce components and weldments that conform to the drawing specifications and are ascetically pleasing by using approved welding and fitting techniques
  • Blue print reading
  • Maintaining ISO quality and safety standards
  • Record keeping including measuring, set up procedures and job instructions
  • Maintaining equipment and tools
  • Customer liaison
  • Off-site project work
  • Supervision as required
  • Apprentice training

Job Duties:

  • Day to day workflow of the shop’s fabrication requirements
  • Plans work including but not limited to blueprint reading, material specifications, tooling requirements, set ups and manufacturing process
  • Using the Hahn and Sons work order, material is checked and put into process or a request is made to management to place an order
  • Programs all CNC equipment including but not limited to brake press, cold cut saw and waterjet
  • Sets up all equipment and fixtures for the most efficient processing of work and overseas all set up by apprentices
  • Verifies machine/material settings by destructive testing and or inspecting first off parts
  • Maintains geometric dimensioning and tolerance values in accordance with the print
  • Maintains safe operations by adhering to Hahn and Sons safety policy
  • Maintains equipment and tooling by inspection, preventative maintenance, trouble shooting and calling for repairs when necessary
  • Maintains continuity amongst workers by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities or continuing needs
  • Documents actions by completing, verifying and signing off work orders as work is completed and maintenance off the ISO calibration documentation
  • Updates knowledge by participating in educational opportunities and reading technical requirements/specifications for machines, tooling and material processing
  • Accomplishing organizational goals by accepting ownership of all work requests and exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments
  • Provide excellent technical reports, job review and judgement in procuring off-site work
  • Load and unload material and equipment from transport trucks as required with forklift and inspect paperwork
  • Inspect and approve parts to be shipped out
  • House-keeping so that the workspace remains clean, organized and safe
  • Any other duties that may be required by management

 

Skills and qualifications:

  • Journeyman Red Fabricator
  • Conceptual skills, process improvement, communication, functional and technical skills, control and instrumentation skills, computer literate, supply management, tooling management, inventory control, attention to detail, measuring and inspection, judgement.
  • Mig welding, tig welding and stick welding are technical requirements
  • Computer aided drawing and design

 

Hahn and Sons is an equal opportunity Employer

title: Micro Deposition Specialist
description:
Stratuscent has digitized the sense of smell. We’ve done for the nose what the camera did for the eyes and the microphone did for the ears. It took six years and some help from NASA, but we did it. Now it’s time for us to bring it to the world.

Who you are:

You are an experienced micro deposition specialist that has deep knowledge on various micro deposition techniques like inkjet printing, aerosol jet printing and other micro droplet deposition methods. You have extensive experience in depositing organic composite materials (active inks) into well defined thin films. Your will work closely with our micro-deposition partners and vendors and help determine the optimal process for depositing our thin film sensors. You will own the deposition process through its entire life cycle i.e., creation, characterization, optimization, and transfer to contract manufacturers.

If you enjoy being part of a team that tackles a range of technical challenges across areas such as synthesis and printing of organic functional inks, development of thin films of sensing materials, scalable manufacturing of printed materials, and performance optimization then this could be the place where you can utilize your experience to have direct impact on the growth and development of our products.

What you will do:

  • Develop a robust inkjet process for thin film deposition of sensor materials for Stratuscent’s proprietary functional inks.
  • Develop operational procedures and print algorithms for industrial inkjet printing systems to achieve high throughput and high yield printing.
  • Design a QC process to assess the printed sensor chips
  • Work collaboratively and iteratively with our inks and composite material team apply constant improvements to the printing process
  • Work with manufacturing partners to validate and transfer the sensor printing and QC process
  • Meticulously document each stage of the process.

What you need:

  • Masters or Ph.D. in Physics / Chemical Engineering / Material Engineering / any other relevant degree
  • 7+ years of industry experience in developing process for ink-jet printing systems or micro-deposition systems
  • In depth knowledge of material printing systems used in volume manufacturing
  • Knowledge in substrate materials and their impact on printing process
  • Knowledge in organic active inks and their relevant properties in printing process
  • Knowledge with flexible electronics manufacturing is an asset
  • Knowledge of MEMS processes and thin film deposition is an asset
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Good communication skills and ability to document work and ideas
  • Ability to function in a fast-paced Startup environment with minimal direction and ability to adjust workload based upon changing priorities

What we offer:

  • The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers
  • A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional growth
  • A competitive compensation and benefits package including employer paid health and dental benefits for regular, full-time employees
  • A generous learning and development budget to attend conferences, classes and other events
  • A bunch of other perks that involve food, fun and travel

We’ve done for the nose what the camera did for the eyes and the microphone did for the ears. It took six years and some help from NASA, but we did it. title: Saw Operator
description:
Primary Duties:

  • Set-up and operate saws and cutting equipment in accordance with work order requirements
  • Receive material and process paperwork
  • Colour code material types
  • Ensure processes and machine operations are performed in accordance with safety regulations and are carried out in a conscientious manner
  • Transfer heat numbers on cut pieces and ends of cut bars
  • Responsible to ensure product quality meets drawing specification
  • Identify non-conformances by separation and/or marking
  • Maintain machines, work station and equipment to an acceptable standard
  • Follow work and order and process traveler requirements and fill out job sheets or record time using ERP system
  • Report all machine, crane and hoist problems in the proper maintenance logs and notify Maintenance and/or Lead Hand of a down-time situation
  • Perform other duties as required or assigned

Preferred candidates will possess a combination of the following:

  • High School Diploma with relevant shop and/or manufacturing experience operating and setting up saws and other cutting equipment
  • Mechanically inclined; basic understanding of hand and power tool functionality
  • Ability to operate a forklift
  • Computer skills using MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook); knowledge of ERP software
  • Good communication (oral and written), interpersonal, organizational, and problem solving skills
  • Well organized with the ability to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced team environment
  • Attention to detail with a high level of accuracy
  • Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize work tasks

Stream-Flo Industries Ltd. is a privately owned and operated Canadian manufacturer of wellhead, production gate valve and check valve equipment.  Since our inception in 1962, we have become a recognized leader for our superior technology, innovative designs and top quality products.

We thank all applicants for their interest. However only those candidates identified for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Industrial engineering technician
description:
UPPER CRUST IS HIRING!

For over 30 years, Upper Crust has been providing premium quality bakery goods for the food service and retail market channels.

Our products are distributed around the world from our manufacturing facilities located in Toronto, Canada. Our brands represent the highest quality and most innovative products available on the market today.

Explore our website to learn about the broad range of artisan bread & rolls, bagels, croissants, Danish pastries, and puff pastries that we produce: https://uppercrust.com/

CURRENT HIRING:
We are currently looking for 5 Industrial Engineering Technicians to join our team! The ideal candidates should be organized, decisive, attentive, and possess a strong understanding of providing technical supporting and services in the development of production methods, facilities and systems, and the planning, estimating, measuring and scheduling of work.

JOB DUTIES:
• Assist in the design of plant layouts and planning and organizing production schedules
• Conduct work measurement or other studies
• Collect and compile operational or experimental data and assist in the development of estimates, schedules, specifications and reports
• Collect and analyze data and samples in support of quality assurance and industrial health and safety programs
• Assist in organizing the repair and routine maintenance of production equipment
• Develop manufacturing and processing procedures and variables, set machine or equipment controls, oversee production and inspect processes
• Ensure that health and safety regulations are met

EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS:
• High School diploma
• At least 2 years of related experience as an Industrial Engineering Technician
• Excellent interpersonal skills, including ability to work collaboratively

BENEFITS AND SALARY:
• Permanent, full-time positions
• $30 per hour for 30 - 40 hours per week
• Overtime may be required and will be paid at 1.5 of your regular hourly rate after 44 hours per week
• Benefits: Group Medical and Dental Plan

LOCATION OF WORK:
55 Canarctic Drive, Toronto, M3J 2N7, Ontario

HOW TO APPLY:
If you comply with all requirements, please send your resumes to uppercrust.jobs@outlook.com and put ‘Industrial Engineering Technician’ in the Subject Line. Please include references and be specific about your previous work experience.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and welcome all submissions from all applicants. However, only those qualified will be invited for an interview.

title: Material Estimator
description:
Our client... is one of North America's premier packaging companies.

The Role:

You will forecast project costs. Gathers details and compile data to estimate all production costs according to specifications. Consider materials, equipment, tools, labor and transportation for estimations. Helps determine necessary resources for projects based on cost estimates and budgetary constraints.

  • Utilize CAD specifications to prepare material estimates and quotes
  • Liaise with design and production teams to ensure optimal layouts and machine routes are being utilized
  • Engage external vendor partner in quote requests for materials and services
  • Maintain detailed and up to date documentation regarding all aspects of an estimate in project management platform
  • Maintain margins and pricing consistency across different accounts
  • Understand the project/program and its requirements from a material standpoint
  • Participate in regular pre-quote and pre-execution meetings
  • Education Desired Degree or Diploma
Nice to have:

  • Knowledge of strategies and tools for controlling and optimizing the factors that lie between the purchase of raw materials and delivery of finished products
  • Knowledge of issues and considerations for effectively managing local or distributed inventories of raw materials, work in progress and finished goods
  • Knowledge of the day-to-day operations of a manufacturing plant or facilities.

title: Electrical Technician
description:
Reference Code: ENG043085

Details and Requirements:

Electrical Technician


Our client is a leader in design and manufacturer of specialized welding equipment. They are currently seeking an Electrical Technician.

Typical Duties Include (but are not limited to):
• Build electrical and electromechanical assemblies per applicable documentation and quality workmanship standards.
• Follow departmental and company procedures to produce the highest quality product.
• Follow work process instructions, schematics, and specifications, both written and verbal.
• Assemble electrical or electromechanical devices or add components to assemblies using a variety of hardware/tools; assemblies may include cable harnessing, panel wiring, and building chassis modules.
• Wire and solder production units and other complex assemblies of unique or unusual design per applicable specifications.
• Operate a variety of equipment to fulfill manufacturing processes.
• Understand and identify defects in accordance with applicable workmanship standard and class.
• Perform verification tests in accordance with assembly instructions.
• May assist in training other employees and provide guidance in following procedures, using equipment and troubleshooting problems. (On-the-Job Training for new hires and other Operators).

Key Skill Requirements:
• Must have good communication skills
• Must be able to work with minimal supervision
• Strong attention to detail required
• Must have experience in use of hand tools and common power tools
• Ability to problem solve
• Working knowledge in quality control such as ISO 9001 and manufacturing processes
• Proficiency in Microsoft office including excel and word is an asset
• Experience in lean manufacturing techniques is an asset

Key Education Requirements:
• Electrical/Electronics/Control Engineering Technician diploma is required
• 1-2 years’ experience in an engineering and manufacturing assembly environment is an asset

title: window assembler
description:
• Full-time
 

Job Description

Primary Duties:

  • Perform manual material handling of product
  • Complete all tasks associated with the assembly, production and packaging of the goods and materials produced in this department
  • Maintain a clean and safe work environment
  • Communicate with Lead Hand and Supervisor(s) on safety or process related issues
  • Adhere to plant safety rules, health and safety policies and procedures

Skills & Attributes:

Details:

  • Position requires standing and walking for prolonged periods of time

  • Salary: $18.35/hour to 18.50/hour
  • NOT on a bus route

Qualifications

  • Previous production experience in a fast paced manufacturing environment.
  • Ability to multitask, work under pressure and work flexible hours when required

title: Junior Production Planner
description:
About StackTeck Systems Limited

StackTeck, with over five decades of mold building innovation, is a leading source of high productivity tooling solutions for the injection molding industry. StackTeck supplies a wide range of injection molds and IML automation used to produce plastic parts in applications such as caps, closures, medical, PET preforms, and thinwall packaging; as well as complete system integrations including IML.  StackTeck has dedicated R&D, testing and part sampling facilities, in addition to plastic part design, prototyping, engineering, and manufacturing capabilities.  StackTeck Systems Ltd. is located 8 km north of Toronto’s Pearson International Airport.

SUMMARY:  The Planner will be responsible for planning and creating routings for components through the shop floor with regard to the best methodology and duration of the of the manufacturing steps.  Further responsibilities include participating in CI activities across the business as well as production scheduling.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Reviewing Engineering drawings or 3D models to create manufacturing routings/component activities, including planned durations for each step in the manufacturing process.
  • Participate in Design-for-Manufacturing (DFM) meetings to share insight on manufacturing process plans and gain input from other members of the Manufacturing Team.
  • Implement best practices and/or develop Process Planning templates/tools to simplify and improve future routings of similar parts.
  • Collaborate with other members of the Operations team (i.e., including machine operators, Mfg Leaders, designers, etc.) to learn more about current StackTeck Manufacturing processes and participate in continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Assist Production BOM coordinator in all aspects of the job including material/parts procurement as well as Inventory management.
  • Review and identify opportunities for improved efficiencies and reliability in work process flow utilizing a structured and data-oriented process to identify root cause and solve problems.
  • Provide back up support to the Planning Team/Scheduling team.
  •  Executes scheduling processes and activities consistent with defined procedures based on sales and operating forecasts and operational constraints.
  • Responsible for determining, communicating and monitoring production lead times based on calculated throughputs and current backlogs. 
  • Monitors performance to the schedule and assists manufacturing in resolving issues affecting schedule attainment.  Provides root cause analysis.
  • Maintain methods for effective/efficient procedures for planning and scheduling in a continuous improvement culture.
  • Maintain System Parameters in ERP systems.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE/EXPERIENCE

  • Post-Secondary education – Process Planning/Supply Chain Management
  • Minimum Two (2) years’ experience in a Production Environment ideally as Production Scheduler or Production Planner.  Experience in a job-shop, machining environment is an asset.
  • Experience as a machinist, especially running various types of machines, would be an asset.
  • Proven knowledge of MRP and manufacturing flow systems.
  • Strong computer skills with advanced level – Excel to develop and manipulate spreadsheets & reports.

BEHAVIOURAL

  • Decision Making: Utilizing effective process to make decisions.
  • Teamwork: Working effectively with others – Project Implementation involvement.
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem solving aptitude. Attention to detail.
  • Interpersonal Skills: Effectively communicating, building rapport and relating well to people.

title: Manufacturing Planner
description:
Schaeffler Group as a world class designer, developer and manufacturer of aerospace and automotive bearings, is seeking a Specialist - Manufacturing Planning to support our Schaeffler Aerospace Canada Inc. production facility located in Stratford, ON. The plant serves the North American aerospace market primarily supplying bearings for aircraft engines, engine systems and helicopter drive train applications.

Key duties include but not limited to:

  • Performing time studies, capacity analyses and layout/product flow analyses
  • Ensure routing quality, on time quotations, accurate SQV costs
  • Complete quotations for customers and support in budget process
  • Perform cost calculations
  • Enter Production Routings into standard cost system
  • Establishing facility headcount needs
  • Implementing special projects
  • Facilitating Lean Process/Six Sigma events
  • General support for I.E. and engineering topics
Qualified candidates will have:

  • Technical diploma in Mechanical engineering, Bachelor's preferred
  • 5 - 7 years of experience with process engineering background
  • SAP experience (routings, BOM, budgeting and capacity)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Access, and Word
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Process improvement experience required
  • Excellent analytical skills for problem solving
  • Organizational and project management skills

Schaeffler is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

Schaeffler Aerospace Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Quality Assurance - Manufacturing Quality Lead
description:
The Manufacturing Quality Lead will support our manufacturing operations to enable success as we manufacture products for our customers worldwide. From supporting our circuit board manufacturing all the way though to manufacturing and service, the Process Quality Engineer will be focused on improvements to other operational disciplines to drive sustainable improvements across multiple product lines and processes.

This is a full-time permanent position.

Who are you?

  • You are highly motivated, independent, attentive to details and have a disciplined approach to problem-solving.
  • You have strong interpersonal skills and can find mutually beneficial outcomes to conflict.
  • You prefer to work on multiple tasks simultaneously and adapt to quickly changing priorities in a high-growth environment.
  • You have a proven track record of driving improvements to internal quality demonstrated by your 5+ years in electronics manufacturing and supported by your Engineering degree.
  • You have 2+ years supervisory experience
  • You have high standards and motivate others to strive to meet them.
  • You are hands-on and prepared to get involved with all aspects of operations with a can-do attitude and collaborative spirit.

Responsibilities

  • Work with other Manufacturing Engineering Team to monitor internal yield and aid in internal improvement projects.
  • Lead cross-functional investigations into product & process defects.
  • Utilize various quality tools to collect, analyze, and identify root-cause(s) of non-conformances and propose solutions.
  • Perform process audits.
  • Develop control plans.
  • Develop and own Quality metrics for manufacturing.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders and prepare and lead 8D reports.
  • Participate in change management reviews and perform change management audits.
  • Review, accept/reject test set data and suitability.
  • Lead a team of Quality Engineers and Inspectors.

Required Skills

  • People management
  • Project Management
  • Exceptional familiarity with industry quality acceptance standards and best practices.
  • Strong project management, time management, and organizational skills.
  • Strong problem-solving skills.
  • Familiar with quality tools like SPC, Gage R&R, DOE, PFMEA, Control Plan, 8D etc.
  • Ability to effectively communicate in English, verbally and in writing.
  • Well-versed with MS Office suite.
  • Experience with gas detection, PCBA manufacturing, injection molding, or metalwork are all assets.
  • Six Sigma accreditation and experience in Lean Manufacturing are assets.
  • Data acquisition and analysis experience using databases is an asset.

Blackline Safety offers:

  • An exciting high-growth environment
  • An experienced, dynamic, and motivated team
  • Supportive, challenging, and collaborative work
  • Competitive salary and vacation
  • Medical, dental and drug benefits
  • Company stock purchase plan

About Blackline Safety

Blackline Safety is a world leader in the development and manufacturing of wirelessly connected safety products. We offer the broadest and most complete portfolio available in the industry. Our products are designed to save lives and we monitor personnel working alone in populated areas, complex indoor facilities, and the remote reaches of our planet. Blackline’s products are used to keep people safe in the event of falls, missed check-ins, man-downs and exposure to explosive or toxic gas. Our design, development, sales, marketing, support, and production are all performed in-house at our headquarters in Calgary, AB. Blackline Safety is a publicly traded company (TSX: BLN). To learn more about our company visit www.blacklinesafety.com

Blackline Safety is powered by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer. We consider all applicants, regardless of age, religion, race, color, ancestry, gender, gender identity or expression, disability, national origin, race, sexual orientation. We enthusiastically encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. Come join our inclusive team and start collaborating with us on exciting projects!

title: Manufacturing Assembler
description:
Spirit Edmonton is looking for multiple Temporary Assembly Technicians. This position will assist in the manufacturing of Cathodic Protection Rectifiers and related products.

Responsibilities

  • Assembly of electrical wiring of all rectifier units used for cathodic protection systems and related products

  • Assembly of components on the electrical panels

  • Assembly of all Junction Box Panels

  • Operate fork lift
  • Organization and cleanliness of the shop floor to ensure that a safe working environment is maintained

  • Manufacturing and assembly of various Corrosion Protection products

  • Efficiently packaging and palletizing magnesium and zinc anodes. Mixing backfill for anodes in proper proportions. 

  • Efficiently packaging and palletizing calcined coke breeze to the desired level

  • Timely assembly of shrink sleeves and related products

  • General warehouse duties including maintaining the condition of the warehouse

  • Picking, shipping & receiving duties as required

  • Proactively follow all Health and Safety rules and legislation while performing job functions

  • Perform general maintenance, repairs and inspections of specific tools and equipment to ensure efficient and safe operation

  • Load & unload trucks

Qualifications

  • High school Diploma or equivalent education

  • 1 yearsâ€™ experience in a manufacturing or warehouse environment

  • Experience operating hand and power tools such as drills, saws and specialized equipment

  • Fork Lift Operator certificate and experience an asset

  • Able to wear a respirator as required

  • Able to lift over 50 lb.

  • Mechanically inclined

Additional Requirements:

  • Able to listen, learn and complete duties efficiently and effectively
  • Able to read, write and communicate effectively in English
  • Able to interact and work effectively as a team
  • Possess a high level of attention to detail
  • Able to regularly stand, bend, lift and move intermittently during shifts

title: Warehouse Operator/Assembler
description:
We have full time job openings for all warehouse workers / general labourers! Are you an automotive enthusiast and want to get back in the automotive manufacturing industry? Have you been into short term jobs or have been changing or hopping on several contract positions for a long time now? Look no further, this warehouse / manufacturing company in Mississauga is offering Permanent Position - Warehouse Opportunity! Immediate Hiring for Production Workers / Machine Operators / Automotive Parts Assemblers for a great manufacturing warehouse in Royal Windsor, Mississauga! Do you have some warehouse machine operation / manufacturing experience? We are looking for you and willing to hire right away! Don't miss out this Warehouse / Manufacturing Job in Mississauga!

Are you an automotive warehouse associate / machine operator ready to take on a new career challenge? Join the team at one of Canada’s leading automotive manufacturers in Mississauga! This is your chance to work for a forward-thinking manufacturing company that puts employees first. This is a great opportunity for production workers who are looking for an opportunity for advancement. We’re looking for experienced production workers with a background in the automotive manufacturing industry. If you have experience doing quality checks or loading and unloading product, you’d be a great fit for this role. We are currently accepting candidates and the client is interviewing this week. Send in your resume now and we will get back to you right away.

Job Title: Warehouse Automotive Parts Assembler / Production Worker

Warehouse Location:
Winston Churchill & Royal Windsor Drive (Mississauga). Please check the location before you apply. This is along the boundary between Oakville and Mississauga.

Shift and Timing:

Day : 6:30AM - 2:30PM (monday - friday)
Night: 11:00 PM - 7AM (sunday - thursday)

Please note that the shifts are not rotating but there is a greater chance of getting hired if you are flexible with any of those shifts! We are accepting applications and we are moving quickly.

Pay Rate:
Base pay rate is $16.94 + straight night premium: 0.65 cents = $17.59 ph


Responsibilities
- Working in a team environment on a production floor
- Loading automotive parts onto a furnace
- Maintain continuous operation of the machines to produce quality parts
- Visually examine and assemble various automotive parts
- Ensure work area is kept clean and free from hazards
- Assist in training and development of new hires
- Checking parts for defects or flaws
- Repetitive Lifting up to 30lbs

Advantages
- Full Time permanent role
- Partial Coverage for Insurance until 1 year
- Full-Time benefits and Pension Contribution after 1 year
- Full time hours with the opportunity for overtime
- Paid breaks
- Bus Accessible

Qualification
- High school diploma or equivalency
- Must have CSA approved safety shoes
- The desire for a long term opportunity
- Minimum 6 months in a production environment, preferably machine operation. Less than 6 months is considered.
- Knowledge of safety procedures
- Excellent communication skills


If you are interested, reach us at meryrose.acero@randstad.ca or text " Production Worker " 437 326 6034


Mery Rose Acero


Advantages
- Weekly pay plus 4% vacation pay
- Full Time permanent role
- 50% Coverage for dental and medical in 3 months
- Full time hours with the opportunity for overtime
- Paid breaks
- Referral Bonus
- Bus Accessible

Responsibilities
- Working in a team environment on a production floor
- Loading automotive parts onto a furnace
- Maintain continuous operation of the machines to produce quality parts
- Visually examine and assemble various automotive parts
- Ensure work area is kept clean and free from hazards
- Assist in training and development of new hires
- Checking parts for defects or flaws
- Lifting up to 30lbs

Qualifications
- High school diploma or equivalency
- Must have CSA approved safety shoes
- The desire for a long term opportunity
- Minimum 6 months in a production environment, machine operation (preferred but not mandatory)
- Knowledge of safety procedures
- Excellent communication skills

Summary
Production worker
All shifts available
Mississauga location
Permanent opportunity


If you meet the qualifications, APPLY IMMEDIATELY as this position fills fast.
• Email: meryrose.acero@randstad.ca
• Apply through this posting!
• Text "PW" to 437 326 6034


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Grinder Operator/ Flame Cutter Operator
description:
Looking to be part of the manufacturing resurgence in North America? At Anchor Danly we know organizational sustainability starts by offering products and services that Customers truly care about ... but we also know that the ability to sustainably execute is a reflection of an organizations Leadership, Culture and People.

Headquartered in Windsor, Ontario and with manufacturing facilities in the U.S. and Canada, Anchor Danly's capabilities have allowed us to successfully partner with our Customers who in turn work with end users around the globe. Our breadth of products, superior quality, industry leading manufacturing speed and deep customer relations have all been key contributors to our success.

Consequently, we are looking for a full-time Grinder Operator/Flame Cutter Operator who would like to join our team. This position requires shift work on days, afternoons, and midnights.

Duties and responsibilities:

Grinder Operator

  • Prepare machine for production by setting up plate on table, hand grinding edges as necessary, selecting and positioning segments and setting controls
  • Prepare and make sure next job is ready for processing
  • Maintaining job specifications by using various types of measuring tools (micrometers, thickness gauges, verniers etc.)
  • Check quality while inspecting parts and troubleshoot issues ensuring production of quality parts
  • Material handling while operating forklift and overhead cranes
  • Maintaining housekeeping standards and assisting with preventative maintenance as required
  • Assisting in other areas as needed

Flame Cutter Operator

  • Set up and operate flame cutting machine
  • Material handle using lift truck and overhead crane and manual lifting
  • Clean-up material as needed using hand grinder and tools
  • Perform preventative maintenance as required
  • Complete operator checklists as required
  • Maintain quality requirements, produce quality products and stay on schedule
  • Work safely and assist in other departments as assigned

Experience / Requirements:

  • Prior Blanchard Grinding, flame cutting, CNC experience, lift truck and overhead crane experience an asset
  • Basic computer and blueprint reading skills required
  • Good communication skills required
  • Attention to detail/quality and a great problem solver
  • Team oriented with ability to take initiative

We offer educational assistance, benefits and pension after 30 days, sign on bonuses, and a gain sharing program.

To apply for the opportunity to join a great company, click on the link provided or go to https://anchordanly.prevueaps.com/jobs/ to review all career openings. Serious candidates must be willing to work any shift, work required overtime, undergo criminal background checks and complete a 90 day probationary period. We appreciate your interest in our company however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Anchor Danly is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation
