title: Tool and Die Maker **New State of the Art Plant**
description:
Company Description

Do you want a position that is poised for career progression? Have you ever wanted to work for a two time winning Canada's top 50 best managed company?  Do you want to experience a new plant build and put your mark from day 1?

If you answered yes, then Techo-Bloc is your next career move. We are opening a new production facility in Ayr, Ontario.  We are looking for a Tool and Die Maker for our new plant...sound exciting?? It is!

Techo-Bloc produces exceptional paving stones and retaining walls. Our facilities are operated by teams of the highest caliber with the latest technology to deliver superior products. Using the 5S and Kanban philosophies, we are dedicated to a manufacturing collaboration that supports running a “whole-minded” production system, and an excellent way to promote improvement. We ensure our products are functional, durable, and astonishingly beautiful.

With soon to be 9 manufacturing facilities (and counting), 30 international patents and over 700 employees, we operate in an exciting and dynamic environment. As we continue to expand, our team members are offered opportunities to professionally develop, learn new abilities and pursue projects that excite them.

If you want to work for a company that listens and is dedicated to your progress this may be your next career move!

Job Description

  • Performs quality assurance inspections of molds paying special attention for any damage or defects to the mold
  • Inspects damaged parts, determines nature of repair and uses repair tools to rework or refinish worn or damaged parts
  • Apply proper mechanical techniques and ability to use power and hand tools to perform repairs, maintenance and/or renovation to molds
  • Completes scheduled cleaning of molds to assure optimum production output
  • Assists maintenance department complete assigned duties as directed.
  • Adhere to all company policies and procedures paying special attention to health and/or safety guidelines
  • Wears personal protective equipment in accordance with training guidelines
  • Perform other related duties as assigned
Qualifications

  • 3 of experience in a similar role in a fast-paced manufacturing environment;
  • Experience with an MIG and Stick welding
  • License/certification as a Machinist, Tool and Die Maker or Mold Maker is an asset


Additional Information

Additional Information

  • A competitive salary with wage progression;
  • This role is designed as a Monday to Friday fulltime position; however, the right candidate has the willingness to work flexible manufacturing schedules including nights, weekends, etc. when needs demand.
  • Full Benefit package
  • Free access to a virtual family doctor through virtual care
  • Technological tools and a safe workplace
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Work for 2020  and 2021 Best Managed Company award recipient
  • Work to keep us the #1 best innovative landscaping products manufacturer
  • Positive work environment with great team atmosphere

Physical Demands:

The employee is regularly required to sit; use hands; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand and climb or balance. The employee is occasionally required to walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

title: Materials Planner
description:
There’s never been a better time to join the team at Tenneco. We are a diverse company that engineers and manufactures components for nearly every major automotive and commercial vehicle brand. We also manufacture and supply technologies under some of the world’s most recognizable aftermarket brand names to manufacturers, retailers, wholesalers, distributors and service facilities. Our products improve fuel economy, reduce emissions and enhance safety. With our vast product portfolio, dedication to quality, global reach, entrepreneurial setting and competitive strength, Tenneco is a great place to build a lasting career.

What does Tenneco have to offer?

  • Excellent compensation and benefits' package
  • Career growth and development, both in the region or internationally: our philosophy focuses on select the best talent, build, and develop our team members.
  • Great people make Tenneco a great company: Our leaders and Company Culture inspire us to do our best.
  • Challenging and Exciting work assignments, at Tenneco your contributions will make an impact on the company's success.
  • We believe in celebrating the differences that make everyone unique, while promoting the inclusivity that makes us all stronger, together.

Tenneco Clean Air is looking a Materials Planner to join our team at our Cambridge, Ontario location. S(He) will coordinate and expedite the flow of work and materials within or between departments according to the production schedule. Our top candidate will have had exposure to the materials area of a manufacturing facility.

What do you get to do in this position?

  • Review and distribute production, work, and shipment schedules.
  • Compile reports on progress of work, inventory levels, costs, and production problems.
  • Interface with manufacturing with respect to schedule controls, inventory management, capacity utilization and customer needs.
  • Plan shipments and arrange for carriers to deliver product to our customers.
  • Order appropriate quantities of raw materials while working within our inventory goals.
  • Monitor flow of goods in and out and correct manufacturing plans accordingly. Communicate any changes to the plan to manufacturing as needed.

This Job Might Be For You If

  • Materials Management Diploma or APICS Certification or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • At least 2 years of experience in a materials function within a manufacturing facility.


Required Skills


Required Experience

title: Machine Operator - Night Shift
description:
Since 1953, ALMAG has built a reputation as an industry leader in extruding high-visual, tight tolerance, complex, thin-walled, lightweight and precision aluminum extrusions. Pushing the limits of industry standards, ALMAG is capable of providing Solutions to some of the most complex designs by combining its skills, knowledge and experience with engineering to deliver best in class, quality Solutions with the industry’s shortest lead times.

We are growing and looking for energetic and dedicated people to join the ALMAG team. If you are energized by a fast pace work environment where every day presents new experiences and challenges, explore a career with ALMAG.

We are looking for Night Shift Machine Operators to work in our Fabrication and Extrusion department’s. As a Machine Operator, you will be exposed to operating various heavy manufacturing machinery and utilizing precision measurements and tools to create, modify and inspect various extruded parts ensuring production quality while manually packing material on work in progress pallets.

This position starts at a base rate of $18.75 an hour with a $1.00 shift premium.

During your first year at ALMAG you have the potential for regular increases after 3 and 6 months of service and an ongoing annual increase during your career. We offer our employees a competitive benefits package after 3 months of service, a health care spending account after 1 year of service and a lucrative profit sharing program after 13 months of service.

What you will be doing

  • Operate various heavy manufacturing machinery, maintaining good quality and safety standards
  • Verify incoming material for weight, number and quality
  • Utilize measuring tools to perform regular quality checks during production for dimensional and visual defects
  • Perform regular checks on manufacturing machinery and report any concerns
  • Partner with your team and supervisor to troubleshoot and solve production and quality concerns
  • Utilize our inhouse software to review and record data as well as print labels for in process routing
  • Take pride in your workspace ensuring good housekeeping throughout your shift
  • Partner with your colleagues and Supervisor to ensure a safe work environment by following safety procedures and reporting concerns immediately

What you bring to the table

  • You have 2 or more years of experience working in a manufacturing or fabrication environment
  • You have some high school education; a high school diploma or GED is an asset
  • You have a technical/mechanical aptitude and like to be hands on
  • You are comfortable using precision measuring equipment (Calipers, Micrometers, Gauges, Measuring Tape)
  • You have a command of basic math skills and an ability to take and read precision measurements
  • You can communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal
  • You are familiar with using computers and computer programs like Microsoft Office
  • You are comfortable lifting up to 50lbs repetitively during your shift

We offer a full and competitive benefits package including:

  • Profit sharing
  • Health care spending account
  • Education assistance program
  • Health and dental
  • Life AD&D
  • Long-term disability
  • Critical illness insurance
  • Gym memberships
  • Wellness programs
  • Monthly social committee activities

title: Welder
description:
Welder

Brampton, ON, Canada Req #4645

Wednesday, April 20, 2022

$2,500 sign-on bonus!

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for skilled Welders!

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, and group pension as well as many others!

Job Description

The Welder is responsible for operating a multitude of welding equipment working primarily on aluminum, steel and galvanneal requiring a high grade of skill.

Job Duties

Read blueprints and weld metals according to customer or employer requirements

Operation of heavy equipment such as saws

Perform set up of machine and preventative maintenance as required

Examine created welds to check for defects/flaws

Ability to learn and perform different methods of welding to obtain certifications

Perform safety and quality checks

Work and adhere to all safety policies

Minimum Qualifications

Basic math, tape measurement and computer skills

Basic experience with hand tools

Able to understand and comprehend measurement

Able to read and interpret blueprints for special applications

High School Diploma or equivalent GED

Must be 18 years old

Preferred Qualifications

Previous experience in manufacturing

Previous experience working on truck bodies

Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly
  • Employment Indicator Hourly

title: Tool & Die Maker
description:
One of our manufacturing clients in Etobicoke, ON is looking for a Tool & Die Maker for their manufacturing facility.
Shift - Afternoon and Midnight
Key Responsibilities
Have the understanding and knowledge of all equipment and machinery related to Tool & Die Making
Ability to build new tooling and fixtures, without supervision
Ability to try out new tooling and engineering changes without supervision
Fully conversant with SPC
Meet scheduled dates set by Toolroom Supervisor or Toolroom Teamleader
Carry a company supplied communication device during scheduled shift to ensure support for production
Commitment to continuous improvement, both in the tools and processes

Train apprentices in all aspects of Tool & Die Making and safety
Exemplary attitude towards housekeeping, safety, company policies and fellow Employees,
Team Player,
TS16949 awareness and adherence
ISO14001 awareness and adherence
Lean Manufacturing and 5S concepts awareness and adherence
Commitment to continuous improvement and work place safety
Qualifications
Licensed Tool & Die maker
5 years of Tool Room experience
A working knowledge (written & verbal) of both English and Mathematics

title: Fitter-Welder
description:
Inland Technologies

Fitter-Welder

Truro, NS

The members of the Inland Group of Companies (Inland Technologies, IDS and Quantem Aviation Services) are highly experienced in environmental management, aircraft de-icing, ground handling and pretty much any other aviation support service you can think of. We operate at over 50 airports in four countries. Inland Technologies core business is the delivery of airport environmental compliance programs. We are continuously innovating the technologies we use to provide our range of services including, spent aircraft de-icing fluid collection and recycling, wastewater management, and aircraft de-icing fluid manufacturing for reuse.

Our business is built on a foundation of excellence in customer service, innovation and continuous improvement and safety is at the forefront of everything we do.  We provide a workplace where respect, integrity and a high degree of ethical behaviour is a minimum expectation.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at:  www.inlandgroup.ca

 

We are currently providing an opportunity for a well-rounded safety focused individual to join our team in the position of Fitter-Welder at our Brookside Manufacturing Facility.

 

About You:

The ideal candidate will be someone who is passionate about safety, doesnâ€™t shy away from a challenge and is comfortable working in an environment where the noise level can be excessive at times.

 

About the Position:

Aside from the excitement of working in a busy manufacturing facility, the essential duties and responsibilities of this position include:

  • Promoting and adhering to our safety and respectful workplace culture and instilling this culture in the station while ensuring safety and regulatory compliance with all Government Labour, Health and Safety laws, regulations and policies.
  • Follow established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s) and HAVE ZERO TOLERANCE FOR UNSAFE ACTS!;
  • Plan and carry out work assignments and handle problems in accordance with instructions, policies, previous training or accepted company practices and procedures;
  • Interprets construction drawings (blueprints and general layouts);
  • Fitting various metals such as carbon, stainless steel and aluminum;
  • Designing and constructing jigs and templates when required;
  • Set up and operation of GMAW, FCAW, SMAW, GTAW welding applications;
  • Keep all Inland owned or managed equipment, tools and materials in good working condition, including keeping clean and returning to assigned storage areas when not in use;
  • Promptly and accurately complete all associated paperwork as required;
  • Perform/complete other additional projects, duties, and assignments as required and/or by management request.

 

Qualifications:

  • 2 year Welding Diploma;
  • Red Seal/Journeyperson considered an asset;
  • 3 â€“ 5 years experience with fitting from blueprints and general layouts;
  • Experience with carbon, stainless steel and aluminum tig welding is mandatory;
  • 3 â€“ 5 years welding experience;
  • Experience with core manufacturing processes (Acetylene cutting, scarfing & welding, plasma arc cutting, hydro testing pipe, etc.);
  • Experience and ability to inspect parts with a focus on best-in-class quality control;
  • Read, write, speak and communicate effectively;
  • Basic computer skills with working knowledge of Microsoft programs including Outlook, Word, and Excel;
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills;
  • Must possess a strong work ethic, positive attitude, with an ability to motivate and work in a team environment;
  • Willing to learn new skills and adapt to change in order to support the growth of the company and meet needs of customers.

 

About Inland: 

At Inland, we offer the following benefits, some of which are subject to eligibility:

  • A rewarding and safe work environment (company provided PPE);
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching;
  • Growth and advancement opportunities for high potential employees;
  • Employee and family assistance program;
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package;
  • Pension plan with employer contribution;
  • Access to group rates and discounts.

 

If you are a self-starter who is committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and your experience and ability meet with the above minimum requirements, please forward your cover letter and resume to the Inland HR Team, quoting posting number 22-28.  Full job description available upon request. 

 

Please apply online.

Inland is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Please note:  All employees working in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 unless provided by Inland with an approved accommodation under Canada's Human Rights Act.

title: Production Scheduler
description:
Job Description:

Weâ€™re a naan traditional companyâ€¦

 

Summary

Reporting to the Planning Leader and Operations Leader, as the Production Scheduler, you will provide timely support on developing, maintaining, analyzing and coordinating the Plant Production Schedule;

 

 

What FGF Offers:

  • FGF believes in Home Grown Talent, accelerated career growth with leadership training.   Unleashing Your Potential  
  • Competitive Compensation, Health Benefits, & a generous flexible medical / Health spending account
  • RRSP matching program
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Discount program that covers almost everything under the sun - Restaurants, gyms, shopping etc.  

 

Primary Responsibilities

  • Develop production plans and schedules for the manufacturing lines following the most up to date Master Planning process used across the manufacturing network
  • Analyze material requirements plan and release orders for all materials locally purchased
  • Constantly review and analyze production variance reports to ensure production plans are in place to meet both customer and deliverables and minimize material obsolescence
  • Review daily production schedule with Operations Manager and make necessary changes
  • Release material requirements (waves) to the Central Distribution Centre
  • Ensure that all locally purchased items are received and processed accurately in the ERP system and send final confirmation to A/P for processing the payments
  • Cross-train with all the other Production Planners / Schedulers to be able to plan / schedule production for any of the manufacturing facilities in the network
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Required Experience

 

  • Experience in Production and Raw Materials Planning for manufacturing would be an asset
  • Excellent analytical skills and understanding inventory planning fundamentals
  • Must be proficient with Microsoft Office and Excel
  • Computer Systems experience include strong PC skills and experience with Material Resource
  • Planning (MRP)/Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems is desirable
  • Post-secondary education in Business, Purchasing or Logistics is desirable

 

What is the recipe for a great career at FGF?

Working at FGF Brands, there is never a dull moment! As a successful company that is continually growing there is always challenging yet rewarding work to be a part of.  We have an entrepreneurial spirit which encourages all our team members to use their own creativity and out of the box thinking to come up with solutions and new ideas.

 

Disclaimer: The above describes the general responsibilities, required knowledge and skills.   Please keep in mind that other duties may be added or this description may be amended at any time.

 

SC

title: Pouch Machine Operator - 2nd Shift
description:
ePac Flexible Packaging is a rapidly growing company with locations across the United States, Canada, Europe, and Indonesia.  Built on break-through digital printing, ePac is at the crossroads of advanced technology and manufacturing. ePacâ€™s mission is to provide locally-based consumer packaged goods companies the ability to compete with large brands with great packaging. Our customers are predominantly locally-based small and medium-sized CPGs, many of whom are focused on creating natural and innovative products for their consumers. Since opening our first manufacturing facility in 2016, our mission has been clear â€“ to help small brands obtain big brand presence, give back to the communities we serve and contribute to the creation of a more sustainable, circular economy. 

 

SUMMARY OF POSITION

The Pouch Operator sets up and operates pouch making machines that convert laminated films into pouches that meet or exceed customer quality specifications by performing the following duties. The position requires shift flexibility. 

Note: The 2nd shift can start anywhere from 12:00 pm until 02:00 am (subject to change). Training hours may be in the morning. Selected candidate should be flexible for both / any shift

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Ensure personal compliance with all company Quality System, Operational, and Human Resource policies, procedures, and practices, including Safety and completes required documentation accurately and timely.
  • Meets or exceeds prescribed job standards for line speeds, scrap and set-up times.
  • Reports any necessary maintenance of the machine to the engineering department using a written work order.
  • Reports any unsafe working conditions to the production supervisor.
  • Participates in on-going training opportunities and supports a continuous quality improvement environment.
  • housekeeping procedures.
  • Reads job specifications and previous run data (if available) to determine machine adjustments and material requirements. Ensures job is in order prior to machine set-up.
  • Sets stops or guides to specified length as indicated
  • Keeps the work area clean.
  • Observes machine operation to detect workpiece defects or machine malfunction. Makes corrections to alleviate out of specification product.
  • Measures workpiece dimensions to determine accuracy of machine operation.
  • Performs required quality testing on products produced, i.e. burst test, drop test, water table test, etc.
  • Performs minor machine maintenance such as changing zipper cloth, dies, seal bars and punches.
  • Assists and works cooperatively with assistant machine operators to stack, mark, pack, and transport finished boxes.
  • Review work instructions and procedures that are applicable to the position.
  • Other duties as assigned by management and supervisors.
  • Perform changeovers
  • Perform PMs on equipment
  • Make recommendations to supervision and management for improvement of production in terms of efficiency and workflow
  • Maintain production reports
  • Oversee daily performance of Pouch Assistant functions
  • Change rolls and cut out splices
  • Quality Control checks and data entry
  • Trash and trim removal

 

NON-ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Could be asked to support other parts of the operations including press assistant, slitting, and lamination

 

JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Possess and foster a positive attitude of learning and respect
  • Ability to understand and follow verbal and written directions
  • Ability to take ownership of work and also work as part of a team
  • Strong verbal communications skills
  • Visual acuity to color consistency
  • Manual coordination and dexterity
  • Ability to use basic hand tools
  • Manual coordination and dexterity while utilizing hand tools, cleaning equipment
  • Be able to work safely around operating machinery

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

  • Experience working in a manufacturing environment is preferred.
  • Basic knowledge of flexible packaging films is a plus.
  • High School Diploma or equivalent.
  • Must be flexible in work schedule.

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT

  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is around, moving mechanical parts and vibration
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs
  • Requires certain Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), such as hairnets, steel-toed shoes, and facility specific uniform requirements
  • ePac believes in a collaborative and cross trained workforce and encourages all employees to learn all facets of production. This role will have the ability to learn and train on operational functions throughout the plants.

 

BENEFITS 

We offer an excellent benefit and compensation package that consists of the following:

  • 15 days (6%) vacation entitlement
  • Statutory holidays
  • Company paid - Health; Dental; Vision Insurance
  • Company paid - Life Insurance & ADD, Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • RRSP Plan with generous company match to 3%

ePac 1

title: General Labourer/Forklift Operator
description:
We are seeking an experienced General Labor / Forklift Operator to work with the manufacturing of flat glass, liquid level gauges, and their associate valves located in Mississauga, ON. Full time, permanent position with growth opportunities. The incumbent will be responsible for providing general support to Production Manager and CNC Operators, able to lift, organize, pack and stack final product on shelves. Provide support to the Shipping- Receiving Manager.
Requirements:
- 2+ years of experience in metal, manufacturing of parts and/or machine shops industries
- Able to operate Counterbalance Forklift (propane)
- High School Diploma
- Strong physical stamina
- Mechanically inclined 


Schedule
DAY, 08:00 am to 05:00 pm; MONDAY to FRIDAY Overtime available and paid after 44 hours per week.



- 2+ years of experience in metal, manufacturing of parts and/or machine shops industries - Able to operate Counterbalance Forklift (propane) - High School Diploma - Strong physical stamina - Mechanically inclined Commissions Reporting

title: Brake Press Operator
description:
There is an immediate opening for a Brake Press Operator at the AWC Manufacturing Tilbury plant for the day/afternoon shift.

Please see below for job duties and requirements:

Duties and Responsibilities
• Setting up and operating manual brake press
• Processing parts by studying job orders and applying knowledge for materials and processes
• Maintaining job specifications by using various types of measuring tools
• Material handle using lift truck and overhead crane and manual lifting
• Checking quality as per work instructions and producing quality products
• Maintaining a clean, organized work area
• Helping in other areas as assigned

Qualifications
• Previous manual brake press experience an asset
• Blueprint reading skills required
• Overhead crane and rigging experience required
• Forklift experience required
• Must be detail oriented and safety conscious
• Knowledge of manufacturing processes required

AWC Manufacturing is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation

title: Quality Control Coordinator - 2nd Shift
description:
ePac Flexible Packaging is a rapidly growing company with locations across the United States, Canada, Europe, and Indonesia.  Built on break-through digital printing, ePac is at the crossroads of advanced technology and manufacturing. ePacâ€™s mission is to provide locally-based consumer packaged goods companies the ability to compete with large brands with great packaging. Our customers are predominantly locally-based small and medium-sized CPGs, many of whom are focused on creating natural and innovative products for their consumers. Since opening our first manufacturing facility in 2016, our mission has been clear â€“ to help small brands obtain big brand presence, give back to the communities we serve and contribute to the creation of a more sustainable, circular economy. 

SUMMARY OF POSITION

The Quality Control Coordinator is responsible for performing daily product inspection for converting finished products. This position is responsible for periodic review of department internal control procedures. Periodically review business processes in order to identify and recommend process improvements that increase efficiency and/or accuracy. Pre pare and maintain accurate audit working papers and files to support audit findings. Take a lead role in working with management to ensure compliance and regulations are being followed, including AIB and SQF-2.

 

The position requires shift flexibility. 

Note: The 2nd shift can start anywhere from 2:00 pm until 02:00 am (subject to change). Training hours may be in the morning. Selected candidates should be flexible for rotating shifts (morning / noon / evening / night) if required.

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Inspect raw material, work in progress and finished goods.
  • Review existing business processes and internal control procedures to identify inefficiencies and evaluate effectiveness. 
  • Coordinate findings of reviews and audits with the training coordinator and/or Quality Manager.
  • Manage projects, including departmental and division initiatives.
  • Remain current on technological and business process trends in the industry.
  • Assist QA manager or Converting Supervisor to investigate customer complaints.
  • Notify any problem or alert regarding converting process to converting supervisor or QA manager.
  • Quarantine nonconforming products and advise supervisor or QA manager for disposition.
  • Document and control quality findings and data in electronic records. 

NON-ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Could be asked to support other parts of the operations including pouch assistant, slitting, and lamination

JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Ethical Conduct.
  • Initiative.
  • Decision Making.
  • Organizational Skills.
  • Communication Proficiency.
  • Technical Capacity.

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

  • Associates degree preferred, plus two years of related experience in Quality Assurance or Document Control. 
  • Experience in identifying existing process improvement.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

  • While performing the duties of this job the employee will be located throughout production and around moving mechanical parts and vibrations
  • ePac believes in a collaborative and cross trained workforce and encourage all employees to learn all facets of production. This role will have the ability to learn and train on operational functions throughout the plant.

 

BENEFITS 

We offer an excellent benefit and compensation package that consists of the following:

  • 15 days (6%) vacation entitlement
  • Statutory holidays
  • Company paid - Health; Dental; Vision Insurance
  • Company paid - Life Insurance & ADD, Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • RRSP Plan with generous company match to 3%

 

ePac 1

title: Flame Cutter Operator
description:
Looking to be part of the manufacturing resurgence in North America? At Anchor Danly we know organizational sustainability starts by offering products and services that Customers truly care about ... but we also know that the ability to sustainably execute is a reflection of an organizations Leadership, Culture and People.

Headquartered in Windsor, Ontario and with manufacturing facilities in the U.S., Canada and Germany, Anchor Danly's capabilities have allowed us to successfully partner with our Customers – who in turn work with end users around the globe. Our breadth of products, superior quality, industry leading manufacturing speed and deep customer relations have all been key contributors to our success. 

Consequently, we are looking for a Flamecutter for our Windsor location.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Operate CNC Flamecutter
  • Operate Overhead Crane and Lift Truck

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience on a Flamecutter an asset
  • Previous experience in a manufacturing environment an asset
  • Good communication skills
  • Team Player
  • Blueprint Reading
  • Problem Solver

Thank you for your interest. Only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Quality Assurance Inspector
description:
Brannon Steel is looking for a Quality Inspector to join the afternoon shift (Monday to Friday, 3pm to 11pm) at its Brampton location. Starting at $22.54 per hour PLUS up to $2 per hour in afternoon shift premiums, you'll carry out traditional quality assurance functions in a busy manufacturing environment with some of the highest standards in the industry.

Responsibilities

  • Read part drawings, production documents, and customer instructions.
  • Perform and document quality inspections.
  • Initiate NCRs and other quality procedures.
  • Participate in root causes analyses, audits, and other quality processes.
  • Work closely with Supervisors and production staff to promote and ensure quality.
  • Prepare and submit reports as directed.
  • Perform minor part adjustments and repairs using hand and power tools.
  • Monitor compliance with calibration procedures.
  • Certificate / diploma in a quality discipline OR equivalent experience.
  • Prior manufacturing experience. Steels / metals experience is an asset.
  • Detailed understanding of the ISO 9001:2015 quality standard.
  • Experience with NCR, RCA, PPAP, PFMEA and similar processes.
  • Skilled in the use of basic and precision measurement tools (i.e. tape, caliper, micrometer, CMM).
  • Fluent in both Imperial and Metric systems.
  • Highly analytical mindset with strong attention to detail.
  • Strong organization and prioritization skills.
  • Computer-proficient including MS Office.
  • Forklift and/or overhead crane operator certification and experience are an asset.
  • Able to work an afternoon shift. (Monday-Friday, 3pm-11pm).
  • $22.54 per hour base pay + up to $2 per hour in afternoon shift premiums.
  • Overtime after 40 hours per week.
  • Extended health coverage including prescriptions, paramedical expenses, and emergency travel assistance.
  • Dental coverage including preventive, diagnostic, and treatment services.
  • Short and long-term disability insurance.
  • Life and AD&D insurance.
  • Free employee assistance program.
  • Group RRSP program with contribution matching up to 5% of regular annual earnings.
  • Service award program including travel vouchers for $3,000, $5,000, and $10,000 for 10, 20, and 30 years of service.
  • Full-time, permanent work at a family-owned company that's 50+ years old.
  • Company-supplied tools & equipment, uniforms, safety boots, and prescription safety glasses.
  • Opportunities to learn and advance.
  • A friendly work environment where people support each other.
  • Comprehensive COVID-19 safety protocols in place.
  • Summer barbeques, annual golf tournament, and more!

title: Materials Planner
description:
Plasman

One Company, One Driving Force.

Plasman is a leading global automotive and manufacturing company with several locations across North America and Europe. With a rich history dating back over 40 years, our collaborative approach, work ethic, and commitment have made us a global leader in automotive components. We believe the only thing that separates the possible from the impossible is perspective.

At Plasman, you will work with the world's best and brightest to shape the future of our global company. Our employees come from rich and diverse backgrounds working collectively together for the success of one company. We believe the most impressive thing we have built is our workforce. And together, we will accomplish more than ever imagined. We are Plasman. And we are One Driving Force.

Plasman Windsor 3 Manufacturing, 635 Sprucewood Ave, Windsor ON, is immediately seeking a new member to join our team as:

Material Planner

The Materials Planner is responsible to ensure timely delivery of materials. The Materials Planner will provide additional support to the Materials Department as required.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

  • Process and analyze supplier releases within T4M System based on MRP demand and communicate these requirements to suppliers.
  • Plan delivery frequency and monitor all inbound materials and components to enable efficient execution of the established production schedule.
  • Provide forecasts to suppliers to allow for appropriate material projections.
  • Verify accuracy of the output and provide root cause analysis to address release issues.
  • Process required system receipts within T4M as well as Customer Portals where required.
  • Maintain inventory levels while adhering to established minimum/maximum levels.
  • Report inventory verses safety stock as required utilizing exception and risk.
  • Provide follow up activities with suppliers and work though on time delivery constraints.
  • Follow in-bound supplier expedites and coordinate in plant delivery as required.
  • Escalate supply and delivery concerns as required.
  • Responsible to participate in planned physical inventories.
  • Monitor inventory levels of customer supplied packaging and ensure adequate supply is maintained to support schedule-assist in working with the customer to resolve issues
  • Requires off shift interaction and consultation with suppliers and plant

MINIMUM EDUCATION/OR DESIGNATION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must possess a secondary school diploma or equivalent, with preference given to those who have Recognized Diploma in related area.

MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must have at least 3-5 years' experience in materials, with preference given to those who have 3-5 years' experience in inventory control
  • Materials experience to include working knowledge of Trans4M an asset
  • Computer skills to include experience in Microsoft Office, Word, Excel.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Ability to perform well in high pressure situations and a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to work excess hours occasional evenings and/or weekends

Plasman is committed to offering a wide range of prospects to our employees, including competitive salaries, full-time permanent positions, benefits, company savings plans, recognition awards, hands-on training, upward mobility, tuition reimbursement, and more.

Plasman values and supports the unique talents and strengths that each employee brings to our organization. We invest in our people and give them the tools they need to achieve success in their career.

We are an equal opportunity employer. If you need an accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process or have any questions, please contact HR.

Thousands of innovative minds. One Driving Force

Visit our website plasman.com to see our capabilities and the culture that creates our one team.

title: Machinist
description:
Burloak Technologies Inc. is a leader in the additive manufacturing industry and provides engineering services for additive manufacturing, materials development, high precision CNC machining and metrology. Burloak works with the most innovative companies in the space, aerospace, automotive and industrial markets to rapidly transition their most challenging part designs to be additively manufactured at scale. We are now hiring a full time CNC machinist to work in our new state of the art Oakville facility.  Successful candidate will work as part of a highly motivated team in an exciting environment using the latest machining technologies that is truly changing the future of manufacturing.

Requirements:

  • Understanding of CNC machine setup- tool setup- machine shop procedures
  • Minimum 3 years experience in precision 3 and 5 axis CNC milling using Fanuc controllers
  • Understanding of blueprint reading, precision measurement and GD&T
  • Knowledge of CNC programming is an asset
  • Experience operating and programming wire EDM in an asset
  • College diploma or engineering degree is an asset
  • Effective problem-solving and high level of time management and communication skills
  • Self motivated and able to work in dynamic team environment
  • Potential for shift work (days/afternoons)

title: Material Scheduler
description:
Material Scheduler ( Job Number: 222932 )
Brand : Estée Lauder Companies
Job : Purchasing/ Procurement/ Materials Management - Supply Chain
Primary Location : Americas-CA-ON-Markham
Schedule : Full-time
Shift : 1st (Day) Shift
Travel : Yes, 10 % of the Time
Job Type : Standard
Description

Key Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate material deliveries to support production, collaborating with Factory Scheduler to align material/ component availability per plan.
  • Responsible to raise alerts weekly from Out of Stock report / Network alerts in partnership with Center of Excellence, and identify material shortages on the 0-8 weeks horizon, and to engage with Material planners to close gaps
  • Responsible for closing material gaps when inventory is available in transit, or in quality hold. Manage logistics improvements in Mode of shipment.
  • Track status of Purchase Orders in TMC and analyze Materials delays alerts to communicate to Production schedulers / Material planners
  • Follow up on past due PO’s, drive logistic delays resolution and balance supply demand by managing exceptions / alerts (de-expedite, cancel or change volume) as instructed by Material Planner to protect service requirements/de-expediting orders to manage inventory.
  • Request planner to maintain accurate planning dates and accurate delivery information in SAP / O9 by enforcing supplier Risk assess and confirm Purchase Requirements and PO and raise supplier ASN (Advanced Shipping Notification) compliance in TMC.
  • Provide recommendation on expedites of orders to Material Planner / transportation
  • Collaborate with Factory Scheduler / TPM Planners / Material planners / SRP Planners to align material/ component availability per plan; provide resolution on unanticipated material related issues (such as quality rejection etc.) and advise any changes to the supplier delivery dates. Escalate supply side disruptions that require support from Material Planner and GSR team.
  • Run materials alignment (Out of Stocks report) and provide root cause analysis and details about all material gaps to production, and propose structural areas where resolution is needed
  • Provide Materials alignment / on hand report on a weekly basis to Materials Management and Category Planning Leadership
  • Control the Quality Notification Process and blocked stock, including SAP task assignment. Communicate with planner for managing returns, rework and supplier charge backs globally.
  • Work with Estee Lauder freight forwarding company and TMC, to ensure appropriate method of shipments is carried out, for overseas component deliveries.
  • Works with quality and logistics to prioritize materials needed for production blocked or not received, closing availability gaps
  • Works with factory schedulers to manage 0-8 weeks plan providing a stable plan, and removing plots that cannot be made due to materials availability
  • Escalate needs to Raise Destruction orders (DAV’s) for excess or obsolete inventory to Material planners for decision and action.
  • Recommend changes to Material Planner on stocks strategies (safety stock / PDT, MLS, LS parameters) to better manage requirement for materials and components at factory, and manage warehouse occupation
  • Build strong working relationships with material/ component planners and suppliers’ operational team, frequently interact to communicate material priorities.

    Qualifications

    Qualifications:

    • Education: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business, Supply Chain, Economics, Operations Research or related field
    • Minimum 2-4 years of related experience in Supply Chain, preferably with experience in manufacturing, supply planning, sourcing / purchasing, supplier management and inventory management
    • Knowledge of, and experience with supply planning and supplier collaboration tools (e.g., SAP, E2Open, Kinaxis, etc.) is preferred
    • Knowledge of, and experience of raw material, packaging for beauty / cosmetic industry products is preferred
    • Knowledge of, and experience with sourcing and supplier management activities for raw material / packaging suppliers within the beauty / cosmetic industry is preferred
    • Experience in the cosmetics, personal care industries preferred

    Capabilities:

    • Knowledge of the interactions and interplays between supply and demand in the executional (0-2 months) and operational (2-12 month) horizons, with focus on scheduling and coordinating supplier activities / deliveries as well as inventory management
    • Strong organizational skills, able to successfully manage multiple accountabilities simultaneously
    • Execution oriented – thrive under pressure with a demonstrated ability to get things done
    • Strong attention to detail – ability to accurately manage, update, maintain large datasets
    • Ability to build strong relationships and tactfully navigate internal and external stakeholders
    • Excellent problem-solving skills and quick to react and respond to changes
    • Strong analytics specifically relating to inventory management and safety stock calculation
    • Ability to work within a cross-functional team, collaborating with Suppliers, GSR, Factory Production, Quality and Planning stakeholders
    We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

title: Mechanical Assembler - Day Shift
description:
Eaton is currently seeking a Mechanical Assembler - Day Shift to join our team. This position is based at our Milton, Ontario location.

Position Overview:

Eaton’s Milton Plant has an immediate opening for a Mechanical Assembler on our day shift. Reporting to the Production Supervisor, this position interprets the manufacturing information documents in order to mechanically assemble, fit and install prefabricated parts or modify basic components, sub-assemblies and structures using hand and power tools for the site's product lines.

In this function you will:

  • Assemble components ensuring proper torque of bus and phase connectors.
  • Read and interpret drawings while ensuring assembly bill of material accuracy.
  • Check parts picked/delivered to parts required. Resolve discrepancies, if any, with supervisor.
  • Escalate drawing concerns via appropriate channel.
  • Repair and modify any errors detected by test/inspection.
  • Work to CSA and UL code.
  • Maintain the accuracy and integrity of the internal KANBAN process.
  • Apply consistency in assembly method for units on the same order.
  • Responsible for visual inspections of material before and after assembly by conducting inspection for conformance to drawings and specifications, functional operation and appearance and making mechanical adjustments as needed.
  • Clean unit and prepare for testing process.
  • Check performance of completed components to ensure compliance to quality standards and make necessary adjustments when required in order to meet quality goals.
  • Perform pack and ship duties.
  • Use various fixtures, gauges and assembly tools to assemble, adjust or repair product.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications

Required (Basic) Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 1 year of experience in a manufacturing environment or six months of assembly experience.
  • Completed High School Diploma or equivalency.
  • No relocation is offered for this position. All candidates must currently reside within 80 KM of Milton, ON to be considered.
  • Must be legally eligible to work in Canada without company sponsorship now and in the future.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in assembly or repair of products.
  • Ability to read and interpret drawings and schematics.
  • Knowledge of Lean manufacturing processes and Six Sigma Tools.

Position Criteria:

  • Working knowledge of mechanical, electrical and safety procedures of a manufacturing facility.
  • Demonstrated experience of utilizing mechanical tools and measuring equipment required for assembly.
  • Good communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.
  • Proficiency in problem-solving, mathematical skills, computer and troubleshooting ability.

Eaton has in place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs.

Accessibility information may be found at:

http://www.eatoncanada.ca/EatonCA/OurCompany/Accessibility/index.htm/

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Manufacturing & Operations

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: No

title: Inventory Control Person
description:
Brandt is currently seeking an Inventory Control Person for our Manufacturing Facility located in Saskatoon. Reporting to the Integrated Materials Manager, the Inventory Control Person is responsible for managing the inventory at the Pinkie Road facility for quantity & location accuracy. The incumbent will also support Production Planning & Shipping with issues relating to inventory. They will have strong organizational and leadership skills and the ability to work individually as well as part of a team.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Generate & manage the quarterly cycle counts list of all whole good bundles on hand.
  • Facilitate/arrange/track parts transfers to and from other Brandt warehouses and/or companies for production and set up crews as needed.
  • Assist Production with inventory issues as they arise.
  • Perform the year end inventory count of all whole good bundles.
  • Complete inventory adjustments based on submitted Inventory Adjustment Forms.
  • Locate & adjust found or missing items in the warehouse/yard
  • Month end adjustments & reconciliation. Filing of paper records in an organized manner.
  • Filing of paper records in an organized manner.
  • Perform the year end inventory count of all whole good bundles.
  • Assist with the management of the year end count team.
  • Work with Manufacturing Engineering to charge materials to projects as required.
  • Other duties as assigned by IMM Manager.
  • Lean manufacturing training and experience.
  • Must have certification to operate equipment
  • High degree of resourcefulness, flexibility, and adaptability.
  • Able to work well under pressure and meet set deadlines.
  • Must be highly motivated, possess excellent communication skills and able to lead by example.
  • Knowledge of Industrial Equipment.
  • Experience with manufacturing Software
  • Written & Oral communication skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office
  • Microsoft Office
  • Shipping/Receiving
  • Material Handling
  • Communications Skills,Oral & Written.

title: Wet Process Operator (2nd Shift)
description:
Overview

OSI Systems companies have a long history of developing innovative solutions to bring a better quality of life to the world. Our OSI Electronics (OSIE) division is a diversified manufacturer of electronic devices and value-added manufacturing services.

 

We provide our customers with the manufacturing capabilities and purchasing power of a global Electronics Manufacturing Services provider. By delivering regional and personalized support best provided by a smaller company, we strive to build lasting relationships and create close and valued partnerships with our customers. Our singular focus is to help security experts, clinical professionals and high-tech developers solve real-world problems and issues.

 

PFC Flexible Circuits Ltd, a division of OSI Electronics, is seeking a full time permanent Wet Process Operator for their Wet Process Department to support their second shift operations (3:30 p.m. - 12:00 a.m.). Must be able to train on first shift (7:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.) for 1-3 months before moving onto second shift.


Responsibilities

  • Operating, maintenance, inspection,replenishment and proper disposal of all department equipment as required such as Chem Clean, Dveloper, Etcher & Film Stripper tanks
  • Proper handling and operation of all Chemcut lines used to clean, develop, etche and strip the panels
  • Regular audits of the equipment to ensure proper operation and handling
  • Enter all jobs into the manufacturing tracking system CIMNET
  • Read and interpret job travelers to verify that all previous operations were completed
  • Verify count, quality or product produced by eht Chemcut lines
  • Receiving routine instructions to ensure optimal conditions of the wet process line
  • Maintaining a safe, neat and organized workplace
  • Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork
  • Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct
  • It is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem
  • Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business.

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent, years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
  • Minimum of 3 years experience working in the printed circuit board industry or any similar manufacturing related industry
  • Understand process travelers, customer specifications and tolerances specified on travelers or drawings
  • Able to work in a team environment and willing to cross-train
  • Ability to read, write, and communicate in English
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time
  • Ability to lift 25 pounds without straining
  • Ability to work overtime and weekends as needed

 

OSI Systems, Inc. has three operating divisions: (a) Security, providing security and inspection systems, turnkey security screening solutions and related services; (b) Healthcare, providing patient monitoring, diagnostic cardiology and anesthesia systems; and (c) Optoelectronics and Manufacturing, providing specialized electronic components and electronic manufacturing services for original equipment manufacturers with applications in the defense, aerospace, medical and industrial markets, among others.

title: Production Assembler/Technician
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking a Production Assembler/Technician to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edgetechnology such as the Cocoon® Platform . The responsibilitiesinclude:removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment

  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping

  • Work within a self-directed team environment

  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety 

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Ability to read technical documentation

  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment

  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role

  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on

  • Computer skills, MS Office

  • Company Quality System Training

  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Warehouse Worker
description:
Overview

Spirit Employment & Training Inc. is looking for Temporary Warehouse Workers to join our team in Edmonton. This 3-6 month term can potentially lead to full time permanent employment.   

 

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for a wide range of duties supporting efficient and safe manufacturing and distribution of corrosion protection products
  • Primarily working in the coke plant, packaging coke materials
  • Manufacturing, assembly, and packaging of various Corrosion Protection products
  • General warehouse duties including maintaining the condition of the warehouse
  • Picking, shipping & receiving duties as needed
  • Proactively follow all Health and Safety requirements
  • Perform general maintenance, repairs and inspections of specific tools and equipment to ensure efficient and safe operation
  • Load & unload trucks as needed
  • Operate forklift as needed

Qualifications

  • High school Diploma or equivalent education
  • 1 years of experience in a manufacturing or warehouse environment
  • Experience operating hand and power tools such as drills, saws, and specialized equipment
  • Able to wear a respirator as required
  • Able to regularly lift over 50 lbs. 
  • Forklift Operator certificate and experience helpful
  • Welding and soldering experience helpful
  • Will need CSTS & WHMIS
  • May need to pass Pre-Employment drug & alcohol testing

title: Production Control & Inventory Lead
description:
Essential Position Functions:

Essential position Functions:

  • Maintain and provide accurate order information to support sales, manufacturing, and scheduling.  
  • Work closely with manufacturing and product teams to maintain effective communications regarding delivery status and procurement problems.
  • Communicate real or potential schedule delays.
  • Work with production supervisor to ensure schedules and priorities are met while utilizing the most cost-effective shipping method.
  • Meet with production team to review and discuss progress of work; discuss and resolve minor to medium complexity schedule issues.
  • Update and maintain production and inventory tracking documents to support purchasing needs, track contractor orders to establish priorities and delivery dates, projection order tracking for adherence to delivery schedule, and CAPEX production ordering as compared to approved CAR.
  • Provide purchasing support for Manufacturing by monitoring raw material and packaging inventories to ensure acceptable and accurate inventory levels are available to cover scheduled production and avoid inventory shortages.
  • Review operation schedules and production requirements for timely order fulfillment.
  • Order raw materials and packaging with emphasis on price, inventory level and availability while ensuring full compliance with company policies and procedures
  • Oversee production coordinator; plan, coordinate and monitor daily work responsibilities
  • Enter production orders as needed to support load and on-time delivery
Position Summary:

This Production Control and Inventory Lead is responsible for planning and monitoring material movement in  production  cycles to ensure continuous operations.

Qualifications:

SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:

  • Knowledge of planning and inventory management
  • Knowledge of MS Office and ERP systems
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Excellent communications skills

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

  • Proven experience as production planner
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree preferred

title: Assembly Technician / Assembler
description:
Description:
Full-time role with one of the biggest manufacturing company in the world. Apply now with Agilus Work Solutions!
Agilus is recruiting for multiple Assembly Technician/Assemblers in the Manufacturing Sector in Mississauga, Ontario.
This is a Full-time permanent role in a ever growing manufacturing company. The assemblers/technicians will be working on the production line to craft, finish and inspect the product.
A day in the life:
  • Prepare, block, edge and assemble product according to job specifications
  • Assist in the basic operation, cleaning and ongoing maintenance of laboratory tools and equipment by in accordance with to established maintenance procedures and calendars

You bring:
  • Minimum 1-year experience of mechanical, electrical or computer/cellphone assembly experience in the industrial or manufacturing sector
  • Ability to read and understand machine schematics is a bonus
  • Experience working in a production/assembly line is highly preferred

What's in it for you:
  • Competitive salary with $18/hour rate
  • Bus accessible location and free parking provided

Let's connect!
Please apply directly online by email jvirtucio@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Advanced Machine Operator
description:
Since 1953, ALMAG has built a reputation as an industry leader in extruding high-visual, tight tolerance, complex, thin-walled, lightweight and precision aluminum extrusions. Pushing the limits of industry standards, ALMAG is capable of providing Solutions to some of the most complex designs by combining its skills, knowledge and experience with engineering to deliver best in class, quality Solutions with the industry’s shortest lead times.

We are growing and looking for energetic and dedicated people to join the ALMAG team. If you are energized by a fast pace work environment where every day presents new experiences and challenges, explore a career with ALMAG.

We are looking for Night Shift Machine Operators to work in our Fabrication and Extrusion department’s. As a Machine Operator, you will be exposed to operating various heavy manufacturing machinery and utilizing precision measurements and tools to create, modify and inspect various extruded parts ensuring production quality while manually packing material on work in progress pallets.

This position starts at a base rate of $18.75 an hour with a $1.00 shift premium.

During your first year at ALMAG you have the potential for regular increases after 3 and 6 months of service and an ongoing annual increase during your career. We offer our employees a competitive benefits package after 3 months of service, a health care spending account after 1 year of service and a lucrative profit sharing program after 13 months of service.

What you will be doing

  • Operate various heavy manufacturing machinery, maintaining good quality and safety standards
  • Verify incoming material for weight, number and quality
  • Utilize measuring tools to perform regular quality checks during production for dimensional and visual defects
  • Perform regular checks on manufacturing machinery and report any concerns
  • Partner with your team and supervisor to troubleshoot and solve production and quality concerns
  • Utilize our inhouse software to review and record data as well as print labels for in process routing
  • Take pride in your workspace ensuring good housekeeping throughout your shift
  • Partner with your colleagues and Supervisor to ensure a safe work environment by following safety procedures and reporting concerns immediately

What you bring to the table

  • You have 2 or more years of experience working in a manufacturing or fabrication environment
  • You have some high school education; a high school diploma or GED is an asset
  • You have a technical/mechanical aptitude and like to be hands on
  • You are comfortable using precision measuring equipment (Calipers, Micrometers, Gauges, Measuring Tape)
  • You have a command of basic math skills and an ability to take and read precision measurements
  • You can communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal
  • You are familiar with using computers and computer programs like Microsoft Office
  • You are comfortable lifting up to 50lbs repetitively during your shift

We offer a full and competitive benefits package including:

  • Profit sharing
  • Health care spending account
  • Education assistance program
  • Health and dental
  • Life AD&D
  • Long-term disability
  • Critical illness insurance
  • Gym memberships
  • Wellness programs
  • Monthly social committee activities

title: Warehouse - Assembler/Inspector
description:
Attention all warehouse / general labourers! Do you want to get back in the automotive / manufacturing industry and want to start this week? Have you been into temporary jobs for a long time now? You better not miss this opportunity, this warehouse / manufacturing company in Mississauga is offering Direct Hire - Warehouse Opportunity! Immediate Hiring for Production Workers / Machine Operators / Automotive Parts Assemblers for a great manufacturing warehouse in Royal Windsor, Mississauga! Do you have some warehouse machine operation / manufacturing experience? We need you for an automotive parts warehouse in Royal Windsor Drive, Mississauga for a Permanent Position! Don't look further and don't miss out this Warehouse / Manufacturing Job in Mississauga!

Are you an automotive warehouse associate / machine operator ready to take on a new career challenge? Join the team at one of Canada’s leading automotive manufacturers in Mississauga! This is your chance to work for a forward-thinking manufacturing company that puts employees first. This is a great opportunity for production workers who are looking for an opportunity for advancement. We’re looking for experienced production workers with a background in the automotive manufacturing industry. If you have experience doing quality checks or loading and unloading product, you’d be a great fit for this role. We are currently accepting candidates and the client is interviewing this week. Send in your resume now!

Job Title: Warehouse Automotive Parts Assembler/Inspector - Production Worker

Warehouse Location:
Winston Churchill & Royal Windsor Drive (Mississauga). Please check the location before you apply. This is along the boundary between Oakville and Mississauga.

Shift and Timing:

Sunday - Thursday
Overnight: 11:00 PM - 7AM

Please note that the shifts are not rotating but there is a greater chance of getting hired if you are flexible with any of those shifts! We are accepting applications and we are moving quickly.

Pay Rate:
Base pay rate is $16.94 + straight night premium: 0.65 cents = $17.59 ph


Responsibilities
- Working in a team environment on a production floor
- Loading automotive parts onto a furnace
- Maintain continuous operation of the machines to produce quality parts
- Visually examine and assemble various automotive parts
- Ensure work area is kept clean and free from hazards
- Assist in training and development of new hires
- Checking parts for defects or flaws
- Lifting up to 30lbs

Advantages
- Full Time permanent role
- Partial Coverage for Insurance until 1 year
- Full-Time benefits and Pension Contribution after 1 year
- Full time hours with the opportunity for overtime
- Paid breaks
- Bus Accessible

Qualification
- High school diploma or equivalency
- Must have CSA approved safety shoes
- The desire for a long term opportunity
- Minimum 6 months in a production environment, preferably machine operation. Less than 6 months is considered.
- Knowledge of safety procedures
- Excellent communication skills


If you are interested, reach us at meryrose.acero@randstad.ca or text " Production Worker " 437 326 6034


Mery Rose Acero


Advantages
- Weekly pay plus 4% vacation pay
- Full Time permanent role
- 50% Coverage for dental and medical in 3 months
- Full time hours with the opportunity for overtime
- Paid breaks
- Referral Bonus
- Bus Accessible

Responsibilities
- Working in a team environment on a production floor
- Loading automotive parts onto a furnace
- Maintain continuous operation of the machines to produce quality parts
- Visually examine and assemble various automotive parts
- Ensure work area is kept clean and free from hazards
- Assist in training and development of new hires
- Checking parts for defects or flaws
- Lifting up to 30lbs

Qualifications
- High school diploma or equivalency
- Must have CSA approved safety shoes
- The desire for a long term opportunity
- Minimum 6 months in a production environment, machine operation (preferred but not mandatory)
- Knowledge of safety procedures
- Excellent communication skills

Summary
Production worker
All shifts available
Mississauga location
Permanent opportunity


If you meet the qualifications, APPLY IMMEDIATELY as this position fills fast.
• Email: meryrose.acero@randstad.ca
• Apply through this posting!
• Text "PW" to 437 326 6034


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Production Assembler
description:
Job Description:

The Production Assembler is responsible for performing operations in the final meter assembly work cells. This includes assembling, testing, and boxing various products while following work instructions. New Hires will undergo training followed by certification while learning Lean Manufacturing concepts.   Assemblers must be able to work in an energetic environment and have passion in achieving daily productivity targets while respecting our Safety, Quality, Environmental and Covid-19 policies.

 

What will you do?

  • Prepare, process, clean, install, assemble, rework, verify, test, solder, and/or inspect electrical and mechanical components, hardware, sub assemblies, and assemblies on single or multiple product lines
  • Operate shop equipment and tools where applicable
  • Adhere to environmental and safety procedures associated with production processes and procedures
  • Use work instructions, drawings, methods, diagrams, workmanship standards or other specifications in accordance with established assembly procedures
  • Monitor and record related documentation to meet quality requirements
  • Follow production build rates, schedules and meet time standards

 

What qualifications will make you successful?  

  • A high school diploma
  • Good written, verbal, reading and math skills
  • Strong manual dexterity and hand/eye coordination
  • Basic computer skills
  • Ability to use manual tools and light power tools
  • Ability to work and contribute in a team environment
  • Familiarity with 5S and Lean Manufacturing concepts
  • Ability to Stand for extended periods of time
  • Flexibility to perform other duties based upon business needs
  • Previous Manufacturing or Electronics knowledge is an asset
  • Must be flexible working either morning shift or afternoon shift (Afternoon shift is eligible for shift premium)

 

Benefits Highlights    

  • Competitive wages
  • Annual bonus based on company performance
  • Annual discounted stock purchase offer
  • Company matched retirement savings program
  • Extended health and dental benefits. Basic and optional life insurance. Disability insurance
  • Paid Time Off: 19-29 days based on length of service. 12 paid stat holidays annually
  • Paid Time Off purchase program
  • Paid Family leave (12 weeks for primary parent, 2 weeks for secondary parent)
  • Employee and Family assistance program
  • Well-being program (training and coaching for healthy habits, and rewards for achievements)
  • Internal mobility
(External) English Qualifications:

 

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

 

(External) English Company Boiler Plate:

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

 

â‚¬25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

 

 

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

 

It is the policy of Schneider Electric  to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.
