title: Lamination Operator - 2nd Shift
description:
ePac Flexible Packaging is a rapidly growing company with locations across the United States, Canada, Europe, and Indonesia.  Built on break-through digital printing, ePac is at the crossroads of advanced technology and manufacturing. ePacâ€™s mission is to provide locally-based consumer packaged goods companies the ability to compete with large brands with great packaging. Our customers are predominantly locally-based small and medium-sized CPGs, many of whom are focused on creating natural and innovative products for their consumers. Since opening our first manufacturing facility in 2016, our mission has been clear â€“ to help small brands obtain big brand presence, give back to the communities we serve and contribute to the creation of a more sustainable, circular economy.

 

SUMMARY OF POSITION

 

The Laminator Operator is responsible for setting up the solventless adhesive laminator, running production of the laminator, cleaning and all related maintenance of the machine.  

 

The position requires shift flexibility. 

The 2nd shift can start anywhere from 2:00 pm until 02:00 am, 8-10 hour shift (subject to change). Training hours may be in the morning. 

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

 

  • Identifies and ensures that proper materials are used for production
  • Ensures mistakes are not made and materials match as necessary
  • Manages pre-run testing of the material to ensure the correct coding weights and bond strength are applied
  • Runs the proper amount of material/footage to the job order
  • Completes proper checking of production and material
  • Prepares for production at the end of each day for the following day 
  • Correctly build up production orders and doctor blade assemblies
  • Perform all required quality checks prior to producing all production orders to ensure a product can be processed at the next stage of the manufacturing process.
  • Load and unload material from the laminators using defined equipment 
  • Install/remove laminator sleeves as required for each production order.
  • Follow the production schedule as issued by production control
  • Set up & Operate specific Laminating Machine according to company laminating procedures and guidelines.*
  • Apply proper adhesive and wind rolls according to specs.
  • Job Order interpretation.
  • Follow equipment and workplace cleaning/sanitation procedures, to complete Sanitation checklist
  • Check first, middle and last piece conformance to specifications.
  • Enter data into Microsoft Dynamics Floorshop Module
  • Perform daily and periodic preventative maintenance duties specified for assigned machines/equipment.
  • Maintain cleanliness of machines/equipment and adjacent work area to AIB standards.
  • Report quality issues to Production Manager for analysis and/or remedy
  • Report all Food Safety Violations to management

 

NON-ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

 

  • Performs other duties as assigned 
  • Turns on auxiliary and other equipment as needed
  • Loads and unloads trucks as needed

 

JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

 

  • Ability to read rulers
  • Ability to read and understand gauges
  • Testing of equipment
  • Ability to use a micrometer
  • Understanding of lamination process
  • Must have good communication skills both personal and via Email 
  • Multiple machine qualifications preferred. 
  • Must have outstanding troubleshooting skills 
  • Must have good judgment with decision making in regards to Safety and Quality. 
  • Ability to complete production related documentation on both computer and paper forms 
  • Must have excellent team skills 
  • Ability to take direction from several individuals 
  • Ability to work additional overtime if required to get the job tasks completed 
  • Self-motivated and ability to make decisions



 

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

 

  • 3-5 years of experience in production, lamination and printing setting
  • Forklift operation
  • High school diploma preferred
  • Responsibility in the area of food safety essentials from AIB international 5.4.1.1 section of adequacy of prerequisite and food safety programs 
  • Ability to pass training tests/methods to become qualified on one or more alternative production machines such as slitting, pouching, and printing.
     

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT

 

  • Mostly on the production floor
  • Occasional meetings in a professional office setting
  • Hearing protection
  • Cut resistant glove
  • Handling of solventless adhesives and cleaning solvents
  • Some mandatory overtime
  • Safety glasses
  • Keep clothes clean and untorn
  • Cleaning area daily to maintain Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPâ€™s)

 

BENEFITS 

We offer an excellent benefit and compensation package that consists of the following:

  • 15 days (6%) vacation entitlement
  • Statutory holidays
  • Company paid - Health; Dental; Vision Insurance
  • Company paid - Life Insurance & ADD, Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • RRSP Plan with generous company match to 3%

title: Manufacturing Production Labourer
description:
Job Details

Job Description

Are you looking for  rewarding work with a dynamic and growing Canadian manufacturer?

Do you take pride in working safely and delivering a quality product to your customer?

Kruger Products - Trenton is growing again and seeking energetic, adaptable candidates with an ability to learn quickly and who thrive in fast-paced environments to join our expanding Production Team

What you will do:

  • Work in conjunction with machine operators to ensure safe and efficient Line Operation in accordance with company processes
  • Review and understand product and packing specification sheets
  • Troubleshoot and make minor adjustments
  • Perform visual review of product
  • Maintain the quality standards of our products and addresses quality concerns with a high degree of urgency
  • Pack and palletize product according to specification
  • Maintain a clean and safe workspace
  • Develop and maintain effective relations with all company employees at various organizational levels
  •  

The successful candidate will possess a/an:

  • Grade 12 Diploma or equivalent
  • Ability to lift up to 50 LBS/27 KG
  • Ability to work a 12 hour continental rotation
  • High degree of attention to detail
  • Strong motivation with the ability to work independently or as a team member

Kruger Products LP is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals.  Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under KPLP’s Accessibility Policy and Multi-Year Accessibility Plan - 1.04.33.  Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

We thank all applicants for their interest in Kruger Products LP but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 Compensation

Fully trained rates from $18.58 to $25.43 plus shift premium.  Total Compensation includes, annual bonus opportunities, DC Pension plan and competitive Group Benefit package

description:
Function as part of a safe and environmentally sound manufacturing team. Comply with all policies, procedures, and rules. Participate in safety committees. Complete timely SAP entries for production and product control. Monitor and record process run data and monitor QC data to ensure product runs within specification.

Complete timely SAP entries for production and product control. Monitor and record process run data and monitor QC data to ensure product runs within specification.

title: Warehouse Associate/Order Picker
description:
In 1983, Choko Motorsports was established and began manufacturing snowmobile clothing. The demand for quality Choko products quickly grew and today, we are designing, manufacturing, and distributing apparel and accessories for the tractor, farming and automotive industries. We are proud of our roots and to be privately Canadian-owned and operated.

We are a team of creative, passionate, and entrepreneurial minds and are excited to grow our team with motivated Warehouse Associates/Order Pickers.

In the warehouse, you will play an integral part in ensuring customer orders are picked, packed and shipped out to customers efficiently and on time.

Responsibilities:
  • Offloading delivery trucks.
  • Picking and packing orders for shipment.
  • Stocking warehouse shelves with incoming merchandise deliveries.

Skills and Qualifications:
  • Warehouse experience is not required however, experience picking orders would be an asset.
  • Must be comfortable completing physically demanding tasks.
  • Enjoy a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to take direction.
  • Safety shoes are a must!

Our working hours are Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. Occasional overtime on evenings and weekends may be required as needed to meet business needs.

We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


About Choko Motorsports:

In 1983, Choko Motorsports was established and began manufacturing snowmobile clothing. The demand for quality Choko product quickly grew and today, we are designing, manufacturing, and distributing apparel and accessories for the tractor, farming and automotive industries. We are proud of our roots and to be privately Canadian owned and operated.

title: C&A Group- Machinist
description:
C&A Group is looking for Journeyman/woman Machinists to join our team of equipment manufacturing and metal fabrication experts in Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada. C&A is a diverse and dynamic business group that specializes in providing custom fabrication, manufacturing, and construction solutions to a large variety of industries across Canada.

Wage: Base Journeyman Rate - $32 - 35/hr

C&A Groups Expertise:
o Food and Beverage Process Equipment Design, Manufacturing & Installation
o Material Handling Systems (Conveyors) Design, Manufacturing & Installation
o Structural Steel Fabrication & Erection - Industrial, Commercial, Pre-Engineered
o Agricultural Equipment Design and Manufacturing - Mobile & Processing Facilities
o Oil & Gas Equipment Design and Manufacturing - Mobile Equipment
o Industrial Plumbing, Process Piping & Mechanical Systems
o CNC Manufacturing – R&D, Repair, Custom and Production Parts/Systems

Required Machinist Expertise:
o CNC Programming – Gibbs Cam Software an Asset
o CNC & Manual Machining – Set-Up & Production – Lathes, Mills, Surface Grinder, Shaper
o Working Knowledge of Tool Holders, Cutting Tools, Boring Bars, Fixtures, Inserts, and Other Machine Accessories and Components Including Precise Measuring Instruments.
o Repair Machine Tools and Parts
o Read and Interpret Engineering Drawings, 3D Models, Charts, and Tables
o Fit and assemble Components and Machine Parts to Close Tolerances
o Safety Conscious - It is our #1 priority
o Passion for learning, self improvement, team work, and team development
o Quality and Safety conscious attitude
o Keen Attention to Detail
o Self-Motivated and Goal Oriented
o Excellent Verbal Communication & Writing Skills
o Class 5 Drivers license – Divers Abstract Recommended

C&A Group of Companies strives to provide the highest level of service and quality to our customers throughout the various sectors of industry. We provide a challenging, stable, and positive work culture. C&A Group offers competitive wages, benefit packages, and the opportunity to work in a rewarding work environment where there is the opportunity for personal and professional growth.

C&A Group thanks all candidates however only successful candidates will be contacted.

Please apply with a resume at outlining your work experience and skillsets or stop into our shop and drop off your resume and meet our team.

title: Paint Repair Operator- Magna Exteriors Sunderland
description:
Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

 

Role Summary

This is a transformational role at the heart of a technology change, which will underpin and assure the company’s success in the future. We are looking for motivated people who believe in continous improvement, putting forward new ideas and designing for the future. As a Spot Repair Operator, you will be responsible for preparing parts and assemblies for painting and polishing.  

Key Responsibilities

•    Responsible for preparing parts and assemblies for painting and polishing
•    Mix paint and other materials according to specification or formula
•    Ensure facility, spray painting & polishing equipment are in good working condition
•    Responsible for the identification and separation of non- conforming parts or materials and report them to supervisors
•    Utilise spray gun and apply paint in conformance with all specification 
•    Employ heat or oven paint drying techniques for special purpose finishes
•    Monitor machine gauges and equipment operation to discover defects/ deviations from standards, and make necessary adjustments
•    Utilise solvents, polish heads, and cloths for cleaning sprayers and power equipment
•    Follow company requirements to select paint, and match colours of paints following specified colour charts
•    Responsible for material and minor maintenance
•    Ensure all safe working procedures are followed
•    Keep plant and site to a high level of housekeeping (5S) and support processes
•    Raise any issues in a timely manner
•    Adhere to all Manufacturing Standards (MAFACT)
•    Adherence to all current Health, Safety and Environmental regulations and guidance including Magna Policies
•    Other duties commensurate to the role.

Essentials

•    Experience of working in a high volume production environment
•    Able to utilise various polishing tools, spray painting tools and equipment such as pressure pots spray guns, hoses, nozzles, gauges, cup guns, conveyor line, paint gun cleaner unit, protective spray painting equipment, paint shakers and high-lifts. 
•    Able to blend paint rework methodology, polishing etc 
•    Able to blend paint, identify and correct paint defects
•    Able to work in a safe manner    
•    Ability to read and follow written and verbal instructions and work to standards

Desirable

  • Practical hands-on approach to problem solving
  • Previous Automotive manufacturing experience
  • Understanding of lean manufacturing, 5S process, and 7 Wastes
  • Understanding of production costs to include waste, downtime, scrap and re-work
  • Good understanding of customer deliverables and the impact of failure / cost of poor quality
  • Ability to work across multiple areas of the assembly process  
  • BTEC Certificate/Diploma in Vehicle Technology levels 2 and 3.
  • City and Guilds Entry Level Award in Vehicle Systems and Body and Paint Maintenance.
  • City and Guilds Certificate/Diploma in Vehicle Body and Paint Operation
  • Institute of the Motor Industry (IMI) awards in vehicle Body and Paint Operations (Refinishing) levels 1 to 3.
  • NESHAP (National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants) Computer literate
skills: ['Institute of the Motor Industry (IMI) awards in vehicle Body and Paint Operations (Refinishing) levels 1 to 3.', 'Previous Automotive manufacturing experience', 'Good understanding of customer deliverables and the impact of failure / cost of poor quality', 'Understanding of production costs to include waste, downtime, scrap and re-work', 'Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.', 'Practical hands-on approach to problem solving']

title: Production Assembler/Technician
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

 

Lonza in Kingston, Ontario is actively seeking a Production Assembler/Technician to help with the assembly and testing of cutting edge technology such as the Cocoon® Platform. The responsibilities include: removing parts from inventory, inspecting parts for quality, prepare required tools, fixtures and test equipment, assemble product, test for performance, and package. Measurements, assembly, record keeping among other activities, will require your continued precision, focus and care.

We are looking for individuals who enjoy the manufacturing/production environment and being hands-on.

 

Key responsibilities:

  • Working hygienically in a controlled environment

  • Maintaining accurate documentation and record keeping

  • Work within a self-directed team environment

  • Precision in: Measurements, Assembly, Testing (as per protocols), Record Keeping, Hygiene, Health & Safety  

Key requirements:

  • Must have High School Diploma or equivalent

  • Ability to read technical documentation

  • Ability to use tools, fixtures, and test equipment

  • Working experience in a manufacturing/operations/production role

  • Must enjoy the manufacturing environment and being hands-on

  • Computer skills, MS Office

  • Company Quality System Training

  • Company specified health and safety training

 

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

 

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

 

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Quality control technician
description:
Welcome to Nortek!

Nortek Air Management is comprised of two individual businesses, Nortek Air Solutions and Nortek Global HVAC. We are a premier HVAC Company offering energy efficient and sustainable products and solutions through employee’s commitment to quality, customer service and operational excellence.

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Collect and analyze data pertaining to products, components, and processes affecting end quality of product while ensuring adherence to procedures.
  • Inspect, test, and evaluate completed piece parts, sub-assemblies, and product for conformance to specifications and drawings.
  • Verify, by audit, that the prescribed processes, the quality system, and plan have been followed.
  • Initiate Material Condition Reports for material parts, or product that does not meet requirements or specifications.
  • Work with design and manufacturing engineers in the development of specifications and standards.
  • Communicate quality standards to suppliers and manufacturing departments.
  • Assist in root cause analysis, solutions to quality problems and in the development of appearance standards.
  • Use and maintain hand tools and maintain established 5S standards. 

 

Requirements:

 

  • Technical school, university training, or suitable work experience.
  • Able to lift to thirty pounds on occasion.
  • Able to read and interpret drawings and Bills of Materials.
  • Work well in a team environment.
  • Able and willing to make decisions regarding product quality.
  • Computer skills (Office Suite; Outlook Suite)

 

Nortek offers:

 

  • Competitive compensation
  • Group Insurance
  • Retirement Plan
  • Training and professional development
  • An engaged and diverse working community

 

Who is Nortek Air Solutions?

Nortek Air Solutions, an innovative leader, is a manufacturer of custom heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) equipment serving North America. As of June 2021, we are owned by Madison Industries based in Chicago, IL.

 

With Madison Industries, we are over 15,000 employees on every continent. We are a leader in ventilation and indoor air control solutions.

title: Master Scheduler & Production Planner
description:
Responsibilities and Duties

Plan and schedule production mix, personnel needs, machine capabilities, material availability to achieve 100% service level. Maintain a thorough understanding of the production process by spending time on the production floor and with production team.

Responsible for the creation, prioritization and maintenance of the master schedule that satisfies customer demand, maintains production stability in terms of material and capacity requirements and maintains appropriate inventory levels of RAW, WIP and finished goods.

Scheduling

  • Coordinate production workflow for multiple products & departments
  • Schedule detailed daily, weekly, and monthly production for each line/area, in an optimal sequence that balances: customer delivery expectations, raw material inventory levels and operational efficiency (minimize changeover duration and frequency; and maximize run time)
  • Develop and maintain the master production schedule to establish sequence and lead time meeting shipping dates according to sales forecasts and customer orders.
  • Understand ERP planning to develop and publish efficient production schedules.
  • Use resources in the most optimized manner, coordinate with sourcing/purchasing team to ensure raw materials are scheduled for maximum efficiency
  • Provide quick & clear responses to internal partners on changes and issues
  • Ensure schedule adherence, investigate deviations, identify root cause & corrective actions
  • Work with managers to assign workers and other staff to particular production operations
  • Review productions schedule to make adjustments to adapt to changing customer's needs
  • Coordinate with shipping to minimize shortages, identify issues, time sensitive products, prioritized orders, etc.
  • Expedite operations that delay schedules and alter schedules to meet unforeseen conditions
  • Provide analytical reports and develop timelines with management
  • Understand shipping processes (INCO terms, shipping charges, their impact on scheduling)

Planning

  • Organize and maintain inventory, manage & control inventory reports
  • Co-ordinate daily cycle counting of inventory and periodical physical inventory
  • Maintain ERP & MRP system data including managing of production orders, time standards, safety stocks, and lot sizing (maintain responsibility for data input and integrity)
  • Maintain adequate inventory levels to meet production objectives
  • Prepares purchase orders for required products to meet production demands
  • Coordinate delivery of raw materials to meet production requirements in a timely fashion
  • Manage effectivity dates, product obsolescence, shortages, and excess inventory
  • Analyze production specifications and plant capacity data and performs mathematical calculations to determine manufacturing processes, tools, and human resource requirements
  • Setup long/short term production plans according to the customer orders, distribution deadlines, production/shipping capabilities and maintenance/sanitation constraints
  • Plan and implement changes to machinery and equipment, production systems and methods
  • Ensuring right consumption of raw material as per the BOM

Work Conditions:

  • Salary 70 K$ to 85 K$ per year depending on experience
  • Day shift - Monday to Friday - 40 hours per week
  • Paid Sick Days
  • Employer Paid Comprehensive Group Benefit Plan – Life/AD&D/LTD/ Extended Health/Dental/Health Care Spending Account
  • Group RRSP with Employer Match

Keyword: planning planner scheduler production manufacturing
Required Experience:
  • Knowledge of key strategic concepts is a strong asset (takt time, pull system, heijunka, JIT, etc.).
  • University degree or College diploma in Supply Chain, Logistics or related field is required
  • At least 5 years experience in Materials Management & Production Planning within a manufacturing environment
  • Understanding of a Make to Order and Make to Stock environment
  • Extensive prior experience with ERP & MRP systems
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • APICS / CPIM Designation is a strong asset
  • Prior purchasing experience is an asset
  • Strong planning, organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to balance and manage changing priorities.
  • Able to multi-task effectively.
  • Ability to weigh up multiple complex factors to make a sound judgement call
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively interact with all levels of external and internal customers.
  • Authorized to work in Canada for any employer


ABOUT US:

Green Belting Industries (Member of the Ammega Group) is a leader company in Teflon / PTFE product quality and service excellence for quality tapes and belts. Our core mission is to fully enable the most dedicated, knowledgeable and creative team in the industry so that we remain the leading innovator in PTFE.

We cultivate passion for R&D, internal talents, tradition of fabrication, and technical expertise to excel in management performance and operational efficiency in order to deliver enduring value to our customers.

Explore our websites to get more information about our company & product categories:

https://www.greenbelting.com/

https://www.ammega.com/brands/

https://www.ammega.com/about-us/global-footprint/

Green Belting Industries is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally protected factors. We foster an inclusive and accessible environment and are committed to providing support to applicants and employees with disabilities.

title: Mid Shift - General Labour / Warehouse - Production Assembler
description:
Calling all hard working warehouse and general labour associates. This is a great chance for you to start immediately in a nice warehouse environment. Have you been aiming for a long term career job? Do you want to start right away in an amazing manufacturing company in Mississauga? We are hiring for a Production Worker to work Monday - Friday Full Time. Be a part of a great production warehouse team environment. We are immediately hiring for afternoon shift for an outstanding automotive manufacturing company in Mississauga! Join the team at one of Canada’s leading automotive manufacturers in Mississauga! This is your chance to work for a forward-thinking manufacturing company that puts employees first. This is a great opportunity for production workers who are looking for an opportunity for advancement. Experience is not required but nice to have some automotive manufacturing industry background or experience. We are currently processing applications and we are looking forward to receive your application!

Great opportunity awaits you! Check out this amazing manufacturing company in Mississauga! They are currently hiring for the position below.

This position gets filled quickly so apply now!

-Maintain continuous operation of the machines to produce quality parts
-Visually examine and assemble various automotive parts
-Complete required paperwork from a safety and quality perspective
-Ensure work area is kept clean and free from hazards
-Assist in training and development of new hires


Qualifications
-Minimum 6 months in a production environment, machine operation (preferred but not mandatory)
-Knowledge of safety procedures
-Excellent communication skills
-Ability to work as part of a team
-Proactive problem solver


Summary

If you meet the qualifications, APPLY IMMEDIATELY as this position fills fast.
• Email: meryrose.acero@randstad.ca
• Apply through this posting!
• Text "PRODUCTION WORKER" to 437.326.6034

title: Quality Control Inspector
description:
About US
In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts. Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23 navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.
Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.
The Job
Reporting to the Corporate Compliance Manager, the QC Inspector will be responsible for the objective validation of all operational process outputs, inspecting in process, incoming, and final product assemblies, inspecting documented records, and recording all findings within quality control records.
Responsibilities:
  • The QC Inspector will be responsible for the overall outgoing quality of all OSI Maritime Systems Products
  • Manufacturing in process inspections carried out in timely manner, analyze production work output for completeness and accuracy against mechanical drawings and cabling specifications
  • Incoming quality inspections of all incoming mechanical parts and cable assemblies including continuity
  • Final QC inspections performed on all outgoing systems and hardware
  • Creates all inspection records, collects photos, and documents evidence of all inspections performed accurately within QMS
  • Compare product and procedures against documented design records, reviewing engineering drawings to identify discrepancies
  • Compare final assembly of goods to all documented BOM, hardware drawings, system drawings, product labeling for accuracy and completeness
  • Conduct quarantine activities on non-conforming products and materials, will support MRB reviews
  • Initiate preventative and corrective action process as required
  • Observe and validate factory acceptance tests on assembled systems
  • Perform outgoing inspections of RMA repaired material, when required
  • Support on configuration and verification audits as may be requested
  • Support of QMS ISO 9001:2015 process documentation, modification and record preservation, and audit.
You Bring:
  • A recognized university degree, technical diploma, or technologist with preference given to direct experience in Quality Assurance, QC Inspections, Methods or Process Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Electronic Manufacturing, or related industry is beneficial.
  • 2+ years’ experience in a Quality Assurance role, QC inspection, or equivalent.
  • QMS auditor’s certification would be beneficial, ISO 9001:2015 or similar ISO Series
  • Key Skills: Vision, attention to detail, highly self-motivated, inspection, proofreading, logic & reasoning, analytical skills, communication skills, interpersonal aptitude, must be able to read and interpret hardware design drawings.
  • The candidate must be able to work autonomously, and can identify QC inspection tasks and manage time effectively.
  • Demonstrated skills and ability to: Identify defects, problems, and communicate QC results, create records of inspection
  • The candidate must be able to negotiate and prioritize time management with various key functional managers, Project Managers and operate in different work areas.
  • Patient, organized, and methodical, excellent team player
  • Must be passionate about quality, and relentless in its pursuit
  • Very good written and verbal communication
  • Highly computer literate, and experience with MS-office suite, adobe, SharePoint, JIRA
  • Able to obtain and maintain the appropriate security clearance
Why OSI?
We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.
At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.
OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.
We also offer great benefits:
Extended healthcare
Dental care
Group Retirement Savings Plan
Emergency Travel Assistance
Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: CNC Machinist
description:
AWC Manufacturing has an opening for a CNC Mill Operator in Windsor. Please see below for job duties and requirements:

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Prepare machine for production by setting up tooling, controls and programming
  • Process parts by studying job orders and applying knowledge of materials and processes
  • Maintain job specifications by using various types of measuring tools such as calipers, micrometers, depth mics, hold gauges, probe and tape measures, etc.
  • Check quality as per work instructions and produce quality product
  • Perform setups and operate the TOS and/or SNK Mills
  • Maintain clean, organized work area and help in other areas as needed.

Qualifications:

  • Prior experience with CNC machining using Fanuc controllers an asset
  • Prior experience with 4th Axis and/or 3+2 Milling Head
  • Familiar with machining of fabrications considered an asset
  • Basic programming skills needed
  • Overhead crane and rigging experience required
  • Blue print reading skills required
  • Basic computer and math skills are required
  • Must be quality/detail-oriented
  • Previous knowledge of manufacturing processes required

Please forward all resumes to Rhonda at: Rmailloux@awcmanufacturing.com


NOTE: Applicants are screened for interviews based on experience, ability, seniority (when applicable), references and locale.


AWC Manufacturing is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: Die Cutter (Swing Shift)
description:
DIE CUTTER

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Kwik Lok has been producing a product that most of us have depended on our entire lives – the clip that closes your produce and loaves of bread to keep it fresh! Kwik Lok is an innovation and engineering organization focused on sustainability. We are in the business of “hacking the package” – innovating clever advantages in packaging to get food to the table faster, fresher, and safer while reducing waste. Kwik Lok is a 3rd generation, family-owned company headquartered in Yakima, WA with 8 offices and 6 plants worldwide.  We are a mid-size company delivering our product to almost 100 countries.

We know that people are looking for jobs that are a better fit in their lives right now. Here are a few pieces of information that might help you decide whether Kwik Lok is a good fit for you:

  • Inclusive culture: Kwik Lok is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion to increase the success of our employees and customers. We want every person to feel part of the team! Our team members come from a variety of backgrounds, and we see value in learning from each other's different perspectives.
  • Innovation: Our goal is to create an environment where employees can be curious and express ideas to identify new and better solutions. We want every employee to be engaged in improving our workplace and work processes. Innovation isn't just for engineers!
  • Meaningful work: We know that every job has things you'll love doing and things you'll love less. Our goal is to engage our employees in our vision for the company and provide them with meaningful work where they can learn, grow, and be part of solutions that improve the lives of our customers and their communities while protecting the health of our planet. No matter what your job entails, we want you to know that what you do makes a difference.
  • Impacting the community and environment: Kwik Lok takes corporate social responsibility seriously, and we appreciate that our position in the industry gives us the ability to help do good in so many areas. We are committed to providing educational and economic opportunity, improving well-being, fostering innovation, and protecting the planet. You can read our most recent Sustainability Report on our website.
  • Work-life balance: At Kwik Lok, we know that in order for you to be your best at work, you need time to recharge as well. Whenever possible, we offer flexibility in start/stop times and even opportunities for remote work. We want you energized at work, and when the day is done, we want you to go home and enjoy your personal life!

ROLE OVERVIEW

We are currently seeking energetic and highly motivated individuals to join our team in our Cambridge production facility. If you are a self-driven, detail-oriented individual with a strong work history, high work ethic and you are someone who likes working in a fun & fast-paced environment, then we are looking for you! The Die Cutter Production Machine Operator position supports Kwik Lok production activities through the manufacture of Kwik Lok closures with a focus on continuing improvement of quality, food safety, and manufacturing processes.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES AND RESULTS

General

  • Run orders as assigned by Production Management in the proper sequence.
  • Follow all company established food safety and quality guidelines and procedures.
  • Monitor product and packaging materials to ensure cleanliness of finished product and food safety for our customers.
  • Ensure the quality of product through constant monitoring, regarding color, thickness of material, and free of any defects.
  • Stock and clean assigned work area daily to ensure a clean and safe work environment for teammates on the following shift, and integrity/safety of our finished product.
  • Monitor the production area to ensure all personnel in the area are authorized to be there, report anything suspicious or anyone without a badge. Immediately, ask the person without a proper badge if they are supposed to be in the building and if they have signed in.
  • Additional functions as assigned and needed for the good of the organization.

Die Cutting

  • Safely operate Die Cutter machine as assigned. Run orders as assigned by Production Management in the proper sequence.
  • Ensure the quality of product through constant monitoring, including observation regarding color of material, thickness, Lok series, opening size, reel size and the tightness of the reel.
  • Monitor product and packaging materials to ensure cleanliness of finished product and food safety for our customers.
  • Stock and clean assigned area daily to ensure the efficient operation by the following shift and the integrity/safety of our finished product.
  • Follow all company established food safety and quality guidelines and procedures.
  • Maintain traceability by tracking roll lot numbers used in production of the finished product. This information must be tracked for every order and written legibly on the job card.
  • Monitor the production area to ensure all personnel in the area are authorized to be there, report anything suspicious or anyone without a badge. Immediately, ask the person without a proper badge if they are supposed to be in the building and if they have signed in.
  • Additional functions as assigned and needed for the good of the organization.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Ability to frequently lift 40 lbs.
  • Ability to pass a pre-employment drug and background screening
  • Occasionally bends, squats, reaches, and kneels
  • Regularly sits, stands, and walks
  • Constantly hearing, seeing, and attention to details
  • Must be legally authorized to work in Canada without sponsorship

KEY SKILLS AND ATTRIBUTES

  • Self-motivated, innovative, takes ownership of position
  • Good work ethic
  • Team player, works well with co-workers and able to take direction from management
  • Strives for continual improvement
  • Seeks and accepts feedback for personal development

ALL THE DETAILS…

    • Salary starts at $18.58/hour for first shift or $19.05/hour for second shift
    • Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription, and Life Insurance plans (60 day probation period)
    • Schedule: Monday – Friday, 7:00am to 3:30pm (1st shift) / Monday – Thursday 3:30pm – 2:00am (2nd shift)
    • Location: Cambridge, Ontario, Canada
    • Work Environment: Manufacturing facility – noise level 85-95 dB, lifting to 40 lbs., intermittent physical activity

      To learn more about Kwik Lok, visit www.kwiklok.com.

      Kwik Lok is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. We value a diverse workforce and provides equal opportunities to all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, genetic information, or status as a veteran. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

      To view labor compliance information, click here.

title: Mechanical Manufacturing Technician (FT)
description:
We are growing and hiring a Mechanical Manufacturing Technician to assemble our customized equipment. The equipment is process-system related (pumps, heaters, valves, vessels, electrical components) mounted on frames.

Responsibilities include:
  • Assembling and installing electro-mechanical components
  • Assembling compression fittings, threaded fittings
  • Building and repairing mechanical aspects of test stations
  • Safely conducting leak and pressure tests, checking quality, and checking build for errors
  • Preparing equipment for shipment
  • Other duties, as necessary

Qualifications:
  • Experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Able to read mechanical drawings
  • Experience in assembling mechanical components
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Excellent time management, prioritization skills, and attention to detail
  • It is an asset to have experience in some of the following:
  • Tubing and pipefitting skills with specific experience with compression fittings
  • Working with pressurized gases and fluids
  • Assembly of automation equipment
  • Electrical and electromechanical subassemblies or electrical panel building
Compensation:
  • Competitive wages
  • Great benefits plan including paid sick leave

title: Shop Labourer
description:
The Shop Labourer is responsible for providing support to Welders and Operators for the manufacturing of Helical piles. This position requires the ability to understand and forsee strategies involved in providing materials that result in flow of materials and completion of work with the highest degree of efficiency. This position may lead into a welding apprenticeship or development towards a machine operating role.

Location: Guelph, ON
Shift Hours: Training on day shift from 6:50am-3:20pm Monday to Friday for the first week before shifting to a night shift 3:20pm-1:50am Monday to Thursday.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Work closely with other Labourers, Welders, Operators and the Manufacturing Supervisor to perform safe and efficient set up of work station, tools, equipment and raw materials for processing by welders.
  • Understand the importance of shop flow; craning, and transporting of milled steel pipe and plate, staging material, maintaining a clean work area, clearing finished work and packaging all finished goods.
  • Operate angle grinders, pedestal grinder, and various clamps and fixtures.
  • Possess strong organizational, time management, and product management skills in handling multiple job priorities, performing a variety of tasks and meeting required deadlines.
  • Read real time production data and contributes to achieving productivity targets and maximize performance by seeking out creative and innovative ways to increase production.
  • Apply required procedural markings to the product, including customer order #’s or traceability labeling.
  • Understand and applying I.S.O. and quality assurance and lean manufacturing principles.
  • Read and interprets work orders and has the ability to keep track of quantities of finished and raw goods.
  • Work with Lead hands and Managers to reduce waste and reduce costs within the welding process.
  • Understand the Hazard Assessment Analysis and commitment to applying safe work practices.
  • Ensure job specific and safety training is current and initiates requests for additional training as needed.

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE

The following are required:

  • High School Diploma
  • Experience in a fabrication or industrial setting preferably as a labourer
  • Basic manufacturing and tool knowledge
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs unassisted

The following would be an asset:

  • Machine Operator experience
  • Forklift License
  • Driver Log Book Training
  • Overhead Crane Training
  • Welding experience

Work Environment:

  • Manufacturing environment
  • Exposure to loud noises
  • Exposure to extreme temperatures
  • Physical elements include bending, twisting, crouching, kneeling, standing for long periods of time, lifting weights up to 50 pounds frequently and in excess of 50 pounds occasionally
  • Fast paced with tight deadlines
  • Shift work
  • Overtime may be required to meet operational needs.
  • Work schedule may vary
  • Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) must be worn at all times

Almita Piling Inc. seeks qualified candidates who share our commitment to equity and inclusion, who will contribute to the diversification of ideas and perspectives, and encourages applications from indigenous (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) peoples, members of racialized communities, women, persons who identify as 2SLGBTQ+, and persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available, on request, for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process including but not limited to a person with a disability.

title: Warehouse Machine Operator
description:
We have a job for all warehouse workers / general labourers! Are you an automotive enthusiast and want to get back in the automotive manufacturing industry? Have you been into short term jobs or have been changing or hopping on several contract positions for a long time now? Look no further, this warehouse / manufacturing company in Mississauga is offering Permanent Position - Warehouse Opportunity! Immediate Hiring for Production Workers / Machine Operators / Automotive Parts Assemblers for a great manufacturing warehouse in Royal Windsor, Mississauga! Do you have some warehouse machine operation / manufacturing experience? We are looking for you and willing to hire right away! Don't miss out this Warehouse / Manufacturing Job in Mississauga!

Are you an automotive warehouse associate / machine operator ready to take on a new career challenge? Join the team at one of Canada’s leading automotive manufacturers in Mississauga! This is your chance to work for a forward-thinking manufacturing company that puts employees first. This is a great opportunity for production workers who are looking for an opportunity for advancement. We’re looking for experienced production workers with a background in the automotive manufacturing industry. If you have experience doing quality checks or loading and unloading product, you’d be a great fit for this role. We are currently accepting candidates and the client is interviewing this week. Send in your resume now!

Job Title: Warehouse Automotive Parts Assembler / Production Worker

Warehouse Location:
Winston Churchill & Royal Windsor Drive (Mississauga). Please check the location before you apply. This is along the boundary between Oakville and Mississauga.

Shift and Timing:

Sunday - Thursday
Day : 6:30AM - 2:30PM (monday - friday)
Night: 11:00 PM - 7AM (sunday - thursday)

Please note that the shifts are not rotating but there is a greater chance of getting hired if you are flexible with any of those shifts! We are accepting applications and we are moving quickly.

Pay Rate:
Base pay rate is $16.94 + straight night premium: 0.65 cents = $17.59 ph


Responsibilities
- Working in a team environment on a production floor
- Loading automotive parts onto a furnace
- Maintain continuous operation of the machines to produce quality parts
- Visually examine and assemble various automotive parts
- Ensure work area is kept clean and free from hazards
- Assist in training and development of new hires
- Checking parts for defects or flaws
- Lifting up to 30lbs

Advantages
- Full Time permanent role
- Partial Coverage for Insurance until 1 year
- Full-Time benefits and Pension Contribution after 1 year
- Full time hours with the opportunity for overtime
- Paid breaks
- Bus Accessible

Qualification
- High school diploma or equivalency
- Must have CSA approved safety shoes
- The desire for a long term opportunity
- Minimum 6 months in a production environment, preferably machine operation. Less than 6 months is considered.
- Knowledge of safety procedures
- Excellent communication skills


If you are interested, reach us at meryrose.acero@randstad.ca or text " Production Worker " 437 326 6034


Mery Rose Acero

- Weekly pay plus 4% vacation pay

- Full time hours with the opportunity for overtime

- Knowledge of safety procedures

Production worker

title: Forklift Operator - Counterbalance, Reach
description:
With Staff Management | SMX, you'll get a weekly paycheck, learn new skills, meet new people, and work with a great management team in a clean and safe environment.


Staff Management | SMX has immediate openings for Forklift Drivers for our Premier Food Manufacturing Client, in Brampton, ON! Shifts: Monday - Friday, Morning 7am - 3pm Afternoon 3pm - 11pm, Night 11pm - 7am


.


Perks & Benefits: Weekly paychecks, Referral Bonus (Restrictions Apply).


Bonus: $150.


Shifts: 2nd Shift, 3rd Shift.


Employment Types: Full Time, Temp to Hire, Long Term.


Pay Rate: $20.00 - $21.00 / hour


Duties:

As Forklift Operator, you will be shipping, receiving, and pick/pack with lift operators. You will also visually inspect product for defects, and quality, so we can continue to meet customer satisfaction!The Forklift operator is accountable for the safe and efficient operation of the vehicle and is required to perform a daily pre-shift checklist. Ship and receive goods in accordance with all routine SOPs and specifications. This includes all aspects within the assigned process and adherence to all company standards of safety, quality, cost and reliability to deliver on the needs of the customer.


.


Position Requirements:

Must have's: Valid Counterbalance and Reach license, and atleast 1 year of driving experience on both. Work 40+ Hours weekly Apply today to join our team! or Call us at Recruitment Phone Number 905-595-0677


Requirements: Stand for Shift Duration, Must be at least 18 years old.Able to Lift 20 pounds., required education: HS Diploma or GED.


Recruiting Center: Staff Management, 5 Precidio Ct, Brampton, ON L6S6B7.


Work Location: Staff Management, Brampton, ON L6S6B7.

title: Production Assembler - ECG Inspector / Packer (Pay: $17.00 - $18.50 an hour + $1000 Sign-On Bonus)
description:
Cardinal Health Canada, with over 1300 employees nationwide, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.

Cardinal Health-Gananoque manufactures many life impacting medical devices that help our customers thrive in a changing world. We are your humble partners, striving each day to make healthcare more efficient and effective and our patients as healthy as possible. We are more than 350 employees with 112 years of Canadian history, a deep understanding of the medical devices we manufacture every day and a passion for innovation.

We are looking for positive and team-oriented individuals to join our Gananoque manufacturing center to support the production department. Join our ECG team to make an impact by inspecting and packaging electrodes produced by machine operators while ensuring quality standards are met.

For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zA4HVn5g5DI) .

Pay: $17.00 - $18.50 an hour + $1000 Sign-On Bonus

_Your Contributions to the Organization will be_ :

Visually inspect, pouch and package electrodes in accordance to a set of guidelines of specifications

+ Ensure use of the proper components for the products in the work cell
+ Visually inspect each electrode to ensure quality, according to a set of guidelines and specifications
+ Insert proper quantity per package and put through sealing machine (referring to packaging specifications)
+ Ensure condition of pouch, printing and codes are legible and match the product being packaged
+ Label cartons with the correct bar code labels as per code and product
+ Grade pouches as required to ensure proper printing/quality requirements and legibility
+ Package pouches from inspection into cartons at various work cells
+ Load cartons onto skids and transport completed orders
+ Remove and bring in skids for release and new order setup
+ Completion and accuracy of target boards (hourly boards)
+ Ensure required documentation is completed during the shift
+ Rework duties as assigned for any product requiring rework and/or re-inspection

Keep working area clean

+ Ensure a clean & orderly work cell by following the 5S standards to improve overall efficiency of operations

_This Job might be for you if:_

+ You preferably have a High school diploma or equivalent
+ You are detail orientated and take pride in producing work with high accuracy while achieving standard goals
+ You enjoy a fast paced environment and being active while working in both a sitting and standing/walking position
+ You are comfortable with lifting up to 10 lbs and work in repetitive motion
+ You are able to visually inspect products for a prolonged period of time
+ You appreciate working in team environment where clear communication and quality control are crucial
+ You have the ability to work in a 24/5 environment (rotating shifts)
+ You have a general knowledge of an industrial/manufacturing environment
+ You have some computer skills

Our Employees all benefit from:

+ Full dental and health benefits including life insurance from day 1
+ Pension plan with employer matching level contribution
+ Incentive plan participation
+ Paid vacation days
+ Tuition reimbursement
+ Paid uniform and safety shoes allowance
+ In-house training on safety measures, production tasks and equipment

_Cardinal Health is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities._

_Cardinal Health is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Our Human Resources team is responsible for working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process._

_Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law._

_To read and review this privacy notice click_ here (https://www.cardinalhealth.com/content/dam/corp/email/documents/corp/cardinal-health-online-application-privacy-policy.pdf)

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Production Welder MIG
description:
Are you actively looking to gain more welding experience?
Do you enjoy working in a team environment?
Are you looking for a permanent job opportunity?

This job is for you and junior welders are welcome! Come and join a team of production MIG welders in a well-known manufacturing company in Brantford, Ontario. This is an opportunity you don't want to pass up, with benefits and career advancement opportunities. This well-known company manufactures racks largely for the automotive industry as well as stores and logistic warehouses.

This position is a direct-hire position. There will be a weld test and a one-step interview process.

Job Title: MIG welder/welding
Location: Brantford, Ontario
Shift: Rotating biweekly days and afternoons
Hours: 8 am to 4:30 pm and 3 pm to 11:30 pm
Starting pay rate: $24.71/hour

Advantages
Why make the job change?

-Working straight shifts - days and afternoons
-Competitive pay rate $24.71 an hour
-Direct-hire position
-Full-time hours
-Overtime available
-Long-term opportunity
-Lots of overtime available
-Health and dental benefits
-Weekly payroll including vacation pay of 4%
-Many career opportunities
-Great team environment
-Participate in company BBQs

Responsibilities
As a welder, you will be responsible for welding metal racks using MIG welding processes in this production environment. This is a team environment and there are opportunities for advancement in a different department or into a supervisory role.

Qualifications
Who are we looking for?

- Experience working as a welder in a manufacturing environment
- Experience only through the completion of welding school is welcomed

Summary
How to apply?

-Call the Brantford office at 519-758-1511 and follow up with Zana or Katie
-Email your resume to katie.carmichael@randstad.ca and successful candidates will be contacted
-Or apply online at randstad.ca
-Or text Katie at 519.717.3892

Are you interested in making your next career move, but this one doesn't sound right? Please give us a call, we have an extensive list of open positions in the Brantford area. We look forward to speaking with you.

Make sure you download our new app called 'myrandstad' in the Google Play Store or the App Store and give us a call so we can set you up with a pin. This is the new way to get all the latest job notifications! If you need help setting up the app just stop by our office or give us a call and we'll be happy to help!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Planner Scheduler
description:
Production Scheduler
Brampton, ON
Manufacturing/Production environment preferred
Multi-site, 60+ machines in operation at once
$70 to $75K
Very Attractive Base Salary + Bonus + Benefits + 2 to 3 Weeks Vacation (depending on experience) + RRSP matching

The ideal candidate will have experience in manufacturing with planning for multiple machines in a fast paced environment.

Fantastic Opportunity! With an amazing company. Internal growth, positive environment, amazing leadership

Have I got the job for you! This is a fantastic business recognized globally, with major partners that are household names.

Please read below. Please ensure that you have the required experience before you apply to the position.

3-5 years experience
Must be able to identify and quickly provide solutions in a fast paced Multi-Site environment

Our client;

Are masters in their field and have an extremely strong and reputable history with their long tenured clients. The pedigree of their well earned client base is a very impressive list of household brand names. They have managed to surpass challenges and be the leader in their industry.

The Production Scheduler ensures that production schedules are created and completed on time, and within budget. Plays a key role in the overall business growth and inventory reduction strategies. Works closely with the functional leaders and site materials teams to ensure best practices are implemented in demand planning, inventory planning, production planning, and supply planning, with linkage to site financials

Essential Functions & Key Responsibilities:
  • Plan, schedule, and coordinate material release to the production scheduling systems based on total demand requirements and capacity availability.
  • Actively monitor impact to material availability and production schedule from customer demand over and above the production plan.
  • Identify, report, and recommend solutions on the production line and capacity restrictions to proactively plan and eliminate bottlenecks that affect capacity planning.
  • Schedule production in coordination with manufacturing, maintenance, machine/tool maintenance, and/or overhaul plans.
  • Identify process improvement opportunities and provide recommended solutions
  • Generate and deliver analysis and presentations as required by management
  • Support the development of inventory strategies and plans per the company goals and objectives.
  • Disseminate inventory strategies to sister divisions.
  • Any other duties as assigned by the Management
Candidate Requirements:
  • Post-secondary education or equivalent experience in production planning.
  • Minimum 3-5 years’ experience within production/demand planning.
  • Experience in plastics manufacturing is preferred.
  • Proficient with various computer applications such as Microsoft, Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and ERP systems.
  • Excellent communication skills and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to prioritize and multitask in a fast-paced environment.
  • Able to develop reports by extracting, manipulating, and analyzing data from various sources.
  • Good understanding of bill of materials structures and demand sources.
  • Able to rely on judgment and experience to plan and accomplish goals.
  • Excellent time management skills.
  • Detail orientated
  • Able to work with minimal supervision

title: Production Technician (AM Shift)
description:
About the Company:

Auxly is a leading Canadian cannabis company dedicated to bringing innovative, effective, and high-quality cannabis products to the wellness and adult-use markets. Auxly's experienced team of industry first-movers and enterprising visionaries have secured a diversified supply of raw cannabis, strong clinical, scientific and operating capabilities and leading research and development infrastructure in order to create trusted products and brands in an expanding global market. Learn more at www.auxly.com and stay up to date at Twitter: @AuxlyGroup;â€¯Instagram: @auxlygroup;â€¯Facebook: @auxlygroup; LinkedIn: company/auxlygroup/.â€¯  

Overview:

Reporting to the Manufacturing Manager, the Production Technician will work in and maintain the standards of a cGMP environment, ensure orders are done accurately and in a timely manner,  process component materials into finished products while maintaining high quality standards.

 

The key candidate will be well organized, have an eye for detail, be a team player, and a good communicator.

AM Shift is 8-430 pm

What can you expect to do:
  • Maintaining process batches within specifications to meet department batch execution targets by ensuring optimal run rates in support of schedule adherence.
  • Completing master batch records, and associated production documentation accurately; Providing Material Safety Data (MSD) sheets for all department chemicals and products.
  • Assisting with processing component martials into finished products while ensuring that quality standards are consistent.
  • Dismantling, cleaning, sanitizing, and assembling manufacturing equipment according to established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s) to ensure GMP compliance and meet department changeover targets in support of department and productivity goals.
  • Setting up and operating machines on trial runs to verify accuracy process.
  • Ensuring the proper selection, care and use of tools, parts and equipment while performing all role-related tasks.
  • Supporting the implementation of initiatives that drive efficiency and increase product yield.
  • Preparing equipment and extracted oils for packaging, and operating packaging and labelling equipment.
  • Cleaning and maintaining packaging equipment and room facilities.
  • Maintaining strict inventory records of all dry materials, chemicals and equipment used in the clean room facility.
  • Washing and sterilizing formulation vessels used for packaging, storing supplies and equipment, disposal of waste according to guidelines, and keeping clean room, storerooms and working areas immaculate.
  • Performing administrative tasks related to packing activities such as word processing, record keeping and filing.
  • Other related tasks as assigned.
What we are looking for :
  • Post-secondary diploma in science, technology, or operations is strongly preferred
  • Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task.
  • Reporting and information management experience; must have proficiency in Microsoft Office and experience with process management, team problem solving, and inventory control.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and evolving deadlines.
  • Experience in production or manufacturing environments in compliance with Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) is strongly preferred.
What will set you apart:
  • Post-secondary diploma in science, technology, or operations is strongly preferred
  • Experience in production or manufacturing environments in compliance with Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) is strongly preferred.

We provide accommodation for job applicants with disabilities during the recruitment process in accordance with applicable laws. Please contact us to request accommodation.â€¯

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
Description


Responsible for safe operation of manufacturing equipment, but will also assist with the handling and processing of warehouse work orders, purchase orders, and sales orders; transporting inventory; and maintaining stock in warehouse.

Key Responsibilities


  • Comply with policies, guidelines, and regulatory requirements per the Franklin Electric Quality System.
  • Follow detailed instructions, processes, and procedures.
  • Report problems with quality, process, equipment, and materials to Supervisor.
  • Maintains a clean and organized work area to facilitate manufacturing functions.
  • Operates a powered industrial forklift to transport inventory, unload and load trucks.
  • Operates manufacturing machinery and follows safety procedures to eliminate injuries.
  • Pulls and stages orders for shipment or production use.
  • Fills and transacts work orders, purchase orders, or sales orders.
  • Performs cycle counts.
  • Performs quality checks on stock items to report defects or damage.
  • Performs other duties as required or assigned.

Skills Knowledge and Expertise


  • Reads and understands documents such as policy manuals, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. 
  • Utilizes common sense understanding in order to carry out written, oral, or diagrammed instructions.
  • Provides accurate work on a consistent basis meeting precise tolerances and standards.
  • Interpersonal skills sufficient to work closely with others on a team.
  • Ability to demonstrate flexibility in work environment performing a variety of frequently changing tasks.
  • Completes some moderately repetitive tasks.
  • High School Diploma or Equivalent (preferred).
  • 6 months or more experience working in shipping or receiving (preferred). 
  • Knowledge of injection mold equipment an asset.

Benefits


Becoming a part of the Franklin Water Treatment Canada team not only provides outstanding benefits, it also opens doors to opportunities for future growth. Enjoy peace of mind with a world-class company. But more importantly, be satisfied in knowing you make a difference.

title: Cutter or Guillotine Operator
description:
Job Title: Cutter or Guillotine Operator

Employee Classification: Full-Time, Hourly

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

Shift: Afternoons

Start Date: Immediate

Are you interested in joining a fast-growing company in the Print industry? Cober is a family owned business operating in the Kitchener-Waterloo area for over 105 years. Our business has expanded to three locations in Ontario and employs nearly 200 people. We are one of Canada’s largest commercial printers and ship over 2 million orders a month! We are proud of our technical innovations and are constantly investing in our manufacturing capabilities.

Why Choose Cober?

  • Eligible for comprehensive Family Health Care after 90 days
  • Stable secure employment at a company that has grown during the pandemic
  • Referral bonus program
  • Lunches, contests and fun events hosted by our Culture Club

Job Summary

The Cutter Operator will report to the Director of Manufacturing. They will be responsible for completing all cutting and trimming operations for press and digital-press in compliance with job specifications and company quality standards. The Cutter Operator works closely with other production staff members to finish any cutting specifications listed on the project. They perform routine maintenance on all cutting equipment to ensure optimum output.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Perform all cutting functions including set up and operation of the cutter with an electronic eye to control timing of cutting blades on the designated cutting spot.
  • Thread ends of material through feed rollers, and align material against machine guides.
  • Perform visual inspection of cut material for defects.
  • Run samples to verify size and ensure the product is straight and any image area is lined up properly, adjusting machine settings when necessary.
  • Monitor the quality of the product on a constant basis. Address malfunctions such as jamming, wrinkling or tearing of material and stop machine to make adjustments as required.
  • Load cut product onto skids to move to the next production work area for finishing.
  • Clean and maintain equipment and work area, sorting rejects as needed.

Minimum Qualifications and Skills

  • High school diploma or vocational/technical certificate.
  • Previous experience working as a Cutter while operating machines.
  • Working knowledge of setup, adjustment procedures, capabilities and limitations of equipment used to cut printed material to complete finished products.
  • Familiarity with different paper weights, sizes, types and colours to identify paper conditions such as excessive moisture or curling that may require special adjustments.
  • Proficient in the use of hand tools to make mechanical adjustments on machinery.
  • Effective team player and independent worker.


If this opportunity sounds like a great fit for you, please apply today!


Cober Printing Limited is an equal opportunity employer and committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, beginning with our hiring process. If, at any time during the evaluation process, you require accommodation, please use the contact information to make arrangements for specialized accommodation. Any information received regarding accommodation will be kept confidential.


We thank all applicants for their interest in Cober however, only candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted.


Monday - Thursday
4:00pm - 2:30am

title: Chemical Operator I
description:
Position Summary:

Responsible for following manufacturing instructions to perform production and shipping related duties to ensure on-time production and shipment of product while adhering to high standards of quality, safety and customer service.

Job Accountabilities:

  • Operates production equipment in a manner consistent with training and work instructions to ensure safety and the
  • highest level of product quality.
  • Prepares mixing vessels, necessary pumps and hoses for unloading.  Inspects all containers prior to filling for cleanliness
  • and integrity.
  • Fills containers as prescribed in the associated batch ticket, pick ticket, and or export order sheet and prepares containers
  • for shipment including labelling, palletizing and wrapping and completes work orders in JDE.
  • Maintains neat, thorough and correct completion of all batch related documentation. Calculates batch yields and responds
  • appropriately.
  • Store and stage inventory in assigned areas for batch preparation, further processing and/or shipping.
  • Assist in tracking material inventory and performing inventory counts, make inventory transfers in JDE.
  • Loads and unloads box trucks and flat-beds, tanker trucks and rail cars, either manually or using proper material handling
  • equipment. Load containerized and bulk raw materials to production vessels.
  • Complete shipping responsibilities including; receive PO’s in JDE, ship items in JDE, communicate late shipments to OTC
  • group, Prepare UPS and FedEx shipments and call trucks for shipment.
  • Maintains a clean and organized work area and strictly adheres to all plant safety policies.  Provides immediate
  • containment, reporting and clean-up/recovery of spilled material or leaks.
  • Operates all types of Forklifts and other related motorized vehicles in a safe and proficient manner.
  • Holds team members accountable for safety and quality procedures.  Routinely participate in site safety committee.
  • Assists in the investigation and resolution of customer complaints. 
  • Others duties as assigned; Responsibilities may vary by work location

Work Environment/EHS/Physical Demands:

Will work in a manufacturing environment and may be exposed to fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals.  The associate is exposed to moving mechanical parts, risk of electrical shock and trip and slip hazards.  The noise level in the manufacturing environment is loud.

Ability to lift bags and other containers up to 50 pounds in a safe manner as directed. Ability to move drums up to 500 pounds with mechanical equipment in a safe manner as directed. May be required to stand for long periods and walk great distances daily.  May be required to work in small spaces and high locations.

Education, Experience, Skills & Competencies:

  • High school diploma or equivalent preferred.
  • This position is the entry level for a new production employee with 0-1 year of experience. 1-2 years of manufacturing experience preferred.
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret batch sheets, SOPs and work instructions
  • Positive team oriented attitude
  • Reliable attendance
  • Demonstrate basic mathematical skills. Precise and accurate in dealing with figures and details.
