title: Machinist II
description:
Job Summary

This is a certified level position, which entails full Machine Shop duties in manufacturing parts for the Wexxar family of products. 

Essential Functions

  • Efficiently utilize all machinery in the machine shop area
  • Troubleshoot and initiate engineering changes
  • Manufacture any part accordingly to the drawings
  • Set up parts on machine shop equipment
  • Trains other machine shop personnel when required

Principal Accountabilities

  • Plant Safety
  • Quality and Quantity of work
  • Communication both written and verbal
  • Attendance
  • Attitude in working well with co-workers

Additional Responsibility

  • Other temporary duties that fall within the employee’s capabilities

Job Qualifications

Minimum Education/ Work Experience:

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Completed 4th year machinist trade apprenticeship program or machinist foundation certificate with completion of CNC operator level 3 or equivalent
  • 4 years working experience in a machine shop environment with CNC machine experience

 Skills/Requirements:

  • Basic knowledge of CNC programming

  • Able to read and interpret engineering drawings
  • Ability to use mechanical hand tools, hand held power tools and mechanical measuring tools
  • Ability to operate manual machine shop equipment
  • Ability to enter shop order data into ERP system
  • Ability to physically lift and move 50lb items
  • Knowledge/ability of manufacturing techniques
  • Knowledge/ability of operating mills, lathes, and any secondary machinery in the machine shop area
  • Ability to do repetitive motions and lifting without limitations

BENEFITS:

As a Wexxar employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, and a generous paid time off program.

Wexxar is committed to providing an accessible workspace. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process please notify the Company.

Wexxar Packaging Inc. designs and manufactures cutting edge case erecting, case sealing, and tray forming machinery for corrugated container packaging. There is a Wexxar machine for any type of container – the only limit is your imagination. Wexxar Packaging Inc. (also known as Wexxar Bel) is located in Richmond, BC and is a Subsidiary company of Pro Mach, Inc. ProMach is a family of best-in-class packaging solution brands serving manufacturers of all sizes and geographies in the food, beverage, pharmaceutical, personal care, and household and industrial goods industries. ProMach brands operate across the entire packaging spectrum: filling and capping, flexibles, pharma, product handling, labeling and coding, and end of line. ProMach is headquartered near Cincinnati, Ohio, with manufacturing facilities and offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and Asia. For more information about ProMach, visit http://www.ProMachBuilt.com.

Experience

Required
  • 4 year(s): CNC Machining
  • 4 year(s): Manual Machining

Education

Preferred
  • Technical/other training or better

Skills

Required
  • Planning Skills
  • Mechanically Inclined
  • Manual Mill
  • Manual Lathe
  • CNC Mill
  • CNC Lathe

Behaviors

Preferred
  • Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
  • Loyal: Shows firm and constant support to a cause
  • Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest
  • Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity

Motivations

Preferred
  • Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
  • Job Security: Inspired to perform well by the knowledge that your job is safe
  • Flexibility: Inspired to perform well when granted the ability to set your own schedule and goals
  • Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
See job description

title: Paint Machine Operator (12 Hour Shifts)
description:
Company Description

Gentek is a leading manufacturer and distributor of vinyl / aluminum siding products, windows and other building products. With 3 manufacturing plants and 23 distribution centers in Canada, we are well positioned to provide our customers with the best products and a superior customer service experience.

Job Description

Rotation - 12 hrs schedule: from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm and from 7:00 pm to 7:00 am

Responsibilities:

The paint machine operator is responsible for all process tasks related to paint application. He must prepare, mix, adjust the viscosity and perform all other actions required by the operating procedures in force.

In addition, he must, together with the team leader, make all the necessary adjustments so that the painted coils comply with the quality standards defined by the quality control department. He will also participate in the quality process by reporting to the team leader any anomaly he has detected on the raw or painted material.

Your responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

  • Prepare and clean the painting machine so that it is in good working order and available as quickly as possible during shutdowns.
  • Ensure that the products necessary for the smooth running of operations relating to the application of paint are available and within reach.
  • Ensure that all rules and requirements related to the handling and storage of flammable materials are respected in his sector.
  • Maintain constant monitoring of the operating process in order to ensure that it is carried out safely.
  • Any other work not necessarily related to his usual duties when assigned.
Qualifications

  • Master French. English is an asset;
  • 1-3 experience as an operator;
  • Punctual, reliable and professional;
  • Work experience in a manufacturing environment;
  • Be sensitive to the importance of Occupational Health and Safety;
  • Have a positive and determined attitude;


Additional Information

  • Have a permanent, full-time and stable position with the possibility of advancement;
  • Have group insurance paid 100% by the employer after 1 month of service;
  • Paid personal days and paid Christmas holidays (from December 24 to January 2);
  • Have a competitive salary of $21.35 per hour;
  • Day premium: $ 2.50 / hour;
  • Night premium: $ 3 / hour;
  • Machine premium: $ 0.67 /hour
  • 12 hrs schedule: from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm and from 7:00 pm to 7:00 am
  • 40 minutes lunch is paid
  • Clean working environment;
  • Easy access location;
  • Free parking.

 

We thank all applicants for submitting their resumes, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

In order to facilitate the reading of this text, we have used the masculine as a neutral gender to designate both women and men.

title: Inventory Scheduler
description:
Posted Position Title

Inventory Scheduler

Role Summary/Purpose

The Inventory & Logistics Specialist will work cross-functionally with operations, supply chain and manufacturing to drive the availability of parts to pump shops.

Essential Responsibilities

  • Ensure demand forecasts are loaded into JD Edwards from field operations
  • Work with distribution center staff to prioritize picking and shipping schedules to ensure parts availability
  • Manage excess inventory and facilitate the moving of inventory from branch to branch.
  • Consolidate excess inventory to a central location for management and redistribution.
  • Lead efforts to optimize and reduce inventory on hand
  • Sucker rod management and logistics planning
  • Work with the Item Master team to ensure accurate inventory records and maintained
  • Coordinates the usage of slow-moving inventory

Qualifications/Requirements

  • 5 yrs experience in the assembly and repair of sucker rod pumps
  • Excellent skills in Excel
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree from an accredited university or college (or high school diploma / GED and at least 5 years of experience in working in a pump shop environment
  • Experience with JD Edwards is an asset
  • Ability to read and follow written instructions, analyze, and interpret working drawings, technical specifications, etc.
  • Must have unrestricted authorization to work in the country in which the position is located
  • Able to follow verbal and written instructions with minimal supervision

Lufkin’s proud past extends back to the early 20th century when the Lufkin Foundry manufactured railroad and sawmill equipment. The company expanded soon after by pioneering oilfield pumping units in the 1920s. Today, Lufkin is a world leader in its field, providing precision-engineered oilfield equipment, products, and services to customers around the globe.

Lufkin Industries is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: C&A Group- Welder/Fabricator
description:
C&A Group is looking for Journeyman/woman and Apprentice Metal Fabricators/Welders to join our team of metal fabrication experts in Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada. C&A is a diverse and dynamic business group that specializes in providing custom fabrication, manufacturing, and construction solutions to a large variety of industries across Canada.

Wage: Base Journeyman/woman Rate - $32.50 - $35.00/hr

C&A Groups Expertise:
o Food and Beverage Process Equipment Design, Manufacturing & Installation
o Material Handling Systems (Conveyors) Design, Manufacturing & Installation
o Structural Steel Fabrication & Erection - Industrial, Commercial, Pre-Engineered
o Agricultural Equipment Design and Manufacturing - Mobile & Processing Facilities
o Oil & Gas Equipment Design and Manufacturing - Mobile Equipment
o Industrial Plumbing, Process Piping & Mechanical Systems

Required Metal Fabricator/Welder Expertise:
o Passion for custom, high quality metal components, equipment, and structures
o Previous fabrication experience with stainless steel, aluminum, and carbon steel
o Knowledge of Brake, Shear and Plate Rolling Equipment considered and asset
o Ability to Read Blueprints
o Keen attention to detail
o Safety Conscious - It is our #1 priority
o Passion for learning, self improvement, team work, and team development
o Quality and Safety conscious attitude
o Self-Motivated and Goal Oriented
o Willingness to travel to job sites in throughout Canada
o Excellent Verbal Communication & Writing Skills
o Class 5 Drivers license – Divers Abstract Recommended

C&A Group of Companies strives to provide the highest level of service and quality to our customers throughout the various sectors of industry. We provide a challenging, stable, and positive work culture. C&A Group offers competitive wages, benefit packages, and the opportunity to work in a rewarding work environment where there is the opportunity for personal and professional growth.

C&A Group thanks all candidates however only successful candidates will be contacted.

Please apply with a resume at outlining your work experience and skillsets or stop in to our shop and drop off your resume and meet our team.

title: Packer
description:
C-P Flexible Packaging is a successful and fast-growing essential manufacturing company that uses an impressive array of digital pre-press and wide-web flexographic printing capabilities and extrusion and adhesive laminators to produce creative flexible packaging solutions for our customers. With a primary focus on serving the food industry, C-P specializes in roll stock, pouches, re-sealable packaging and shrink sleeves. Our headquarters and main manufacturing facility is located York, PA, with additional operations in Bristol, PA, Buffalo, NY, Lakeville, MN, and Aurora, Ontario.

We are looking for Packers to join our Team in Aurora, Ontario.
 

Job Summary:

To inspect and neatly pack product to ensure that bags going to The Customer are of proper quantity and quality.

 

Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities:

  • Visually inspect bag seals, print and position for defaults and quality.
  • Collect pre-determined number of bags and pack into boxes.
  • Seal and properly label filled boxes to prepare for shipping. May include stacking boxes on skids.
  • Construct boxes by folding and taping.
  • Maintain area around machine for cleanliness.

 

Qualifications:

  • Ability to count – counting bags into boxes
  • Ability to read and write English – inspecting bags
  • Manual dexterity – sorting and putting bags into boxes


Other knowledge, skills and abilities:

  • Ability to communicate deficiencies to Operator and Supervisor
  • Must demonstrate the ability to maintain confidentiality of information to Company and Federal standards.
  • Must be able to adapt to changes in the work environment, manage competing demands and be able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.
  • Must be dependable and work within Company conduct standards; consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.

 

Physical Demands:

  • Some light lifting - limited
  • Continuous standing
  • Gripping
  • Manual dexterity
  • Reaching

 

Working Conditions:

  • Working 12 hr. shifts.
  • Work in a manufacturing environment around machinery (concrete flooring).
  • Overtime as required
  • Follow all safety regulations and rules at all times, including wearing all required personal protective equipment (PPE):
    • Eye Protection/ Safety glasses
    • Steel toe shoes
    • Hearing protection
    • Hairnets and beard nets
  • Ability to work in a non-air conditioned environment: hot conditions during summer months and cool conditions during winter months. (consistently)
  • Must be able to prioritize/multi-task, be a team player and able to adapt to change
  • Work around solvents, ink, adhesives, and cleaners used in the manufacturing process.
In addition to the other advantages of working for C-P, we offer a compensation package that includes: competitive wages, as well as, night shift and weekend shift premiums.
 
Benefits Include
  • Employer paid medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage
  • Pension plan with generous company match
  • Bonus program
  • Paid vacation and personal days
  • Paid holidays
  • Life and AD&D insurance
  • Company paid short-term disability coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

title: Machine Operators
description:
Brandt Industries Canada Ltd. is currently looking for reliable and experiencedMachine Operators to start immediately at our manufacturing facilities in Regina, Saskatchewan.

The right candidates will have the opportunity to be trained in-house working alongside our highly specialized team. We are looking for ambitious, hardworking individuals that want to build their career with a company that will provide advancement and security for them for the long haul while gaining all the experience needed to become a highly specialized professional in the industry.

We are an industry leader that employs the very latest technologies and equipment to build the best products out there andpride ourselves on delivering a safe, clean work environment for all of ouremployees.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Efficient operation of CNC cutting machines including plasma and laser as well as the operator related maintenance
  • Responsible for the following machines and operations: punching, drilling, sawing, torching, and bender, roller threader, press, shear, punch press, hand and hand power tools
  • Program simple cuts on the Machines
  • Efficiently operate and maintain plasma and laser cutting equipment
  • Ensure production schedule for machine is adhered to
  • Report any programming /software issues immediately to supervisor and/or programmer
  • Maintain cleanliness and organization of work area up to Brandt standards
  • Must be available to work various shifts as workload requires .Work overtime as required
  • Ensure machine is in optimal working condition at all times.
  • Achieve efficient flow of materials into and out of the machine
  • Follow the Schedule as defines by the manufacturer
  • Accurately filling out process sheets and accurately counting number of pieces completed
  • Required to do minor setup
  • Knows material sizes and specifications of product
  • Required to operate all equipment in machine department when necessary
  • Ability to setup all of the equipment in the machine department
  • Capable of working under minimal supervision
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Must be able to read Shop Drawings and Production Orders
  • Must be able to work in a steel fab and/or manufacturing shop environment
  • Must be able to work independently

  • Familiar with Quality and Lean Principles

  • Motivated to learn and improve
  • Positive attitude with an attitude for problem solving
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Must be knowledgeable in the use and operation of all hand power tools
  • Thorough knowledge of all equipment in the machine department
  • Must be able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Has some knowledge of proper maintenance of equipment
  • Uses measuring instruments
  • A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Fabrication/Machine shop industrial environment experience

title: Manufacturing Technician | Assembler (Mid/Senior)
description:
A Manufacturing Technician is responsible for the preparation and assembly of aluminum framing, guarding, and mechanical products. Guidance and training will
be provided by the Manufacturing Supervisor.

title: Assembly Operator
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

To produce a quality product in a safe and efficient manner.

Responsibilities:
  • Manufactures steel automotive parts using automated and hand transfer presses, robotics welders, and other machinery as assigned.
  • Conducts regular quality checks and reports to Supervisor.
  • Ensure cleanliness of workstation.
Qualifications:
  • Previous factory or related work experience
  • Ability to stand for entire shift, lift moderate weight to shoulder height, carry out repetitive motions with wrists and forearms
  • Familiarity with automotive/manufacturing environment
Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement

title: Stockroom Clerk | Stockroom Clerk
description:
GN Thermoforming Equipment in Chester, Nova Scotia is looking for two Stockroom Clerks for unloading, receiving, stocking, accurate maintenance of stockroom & warehouse inventory, delivery of parts, raw materials to production, shipping, tooling or other manufacturing areas in the facility.

KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  1. Maintain consistent operating procedures.
  2. Receive all incoming Freight, Material and Supplies.
  3. Material unloading of couriers and trucks.
  4. Unpacking and verifying incoming parts, components and raw materials to packing slips.
  5. Visually inspect goods and products for damage and perform in-coming inspection as per quality control guidelines and/or technical drawings where required.
  6. Receive, label/identify material, and move to appropriate location physically and within the computerized inventory system (Syspro).
  7. Prepare outgoing product for shipment understanding all internal and customer requirements.
  8. Accurate system shipment of all products.
  9. Establish and maintain required reports and logs.
  10. Overall maintenance of stockroom and warehouse area including all tools, equipment, material racks and shelves.
  11. Monitor schedule and coordinate picking of all kits to ensure production schedule is supported.
  12. Coordinate shipment of materials being sent out for sub-contract processes.
  13. Receive and close work orders as they are completed.
  14. Work with Production and Purchasing to ensure all non-conformances are properly tagged, recorded and stored in respective non-conformance area in the warehouse.
  15. Other duties or task as assigned or required.

OTHER PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Forklift license or capable of learning how to operate
  • Use of material handling equipment (ie: pallet jacks)
  • Able to work a flexible schedule and can multi-task
  • Adapts to rapid change in a fast paced environment
  • Organized and detailed oriented
  • Has self motivation and initiative/self directed

EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • Computer / data entry experience
  • Valid drivers license with good driving record
  • Basic carpentry skills and use of hand and power tools

ENVIRONMENTAL/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Lift, push, and pull up to 50 lbs
  • Frequent lifting, pulling, pushing, bending, sitting and standing
  • Walk for extended periods of time
  • May work in seated or standing positions for prolonged periods of time, performs sustained manual activities at low to moderate levels of exertion.

title: Production Planner
description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

Responsible to prepare and distribute the completion and MRO maintenance and refurb production planning documents. Incumbent will work from engineering structural and electrical released data indexes and drawings, company Quality Assurance (QA) system, and the customer specification package including signed work authorizations.

A Production Planner's core objective is to support all operational departments involved with aircraft specific work scope by providing all essential planning documents.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

  • Creating and distributing the accurate production planning documents, essential in the maintenance, repair, overhaul, modification, fabrication, assembly and/or installation of aircraft components required for the aircraft specific work scopes.

  • Distributing the approved engineering technical data per the engineering index and/or OEM technical data with the planning documents.

  • Inspecting items, maintenance due items, airworthiness directives, service bulletins, customer reported discrepancies.

  • Planning work flow for each department and operation according to established shop specific sequences, upfront release schedules and Critical Path Tool (CPT) dates.

  • Ensuring quick response time and delivery for any modified planning requirements due to additional work scope, engineering changes and/or miscalculated or shop and planning errors.

  • Communicating and coordinating with the necessary departments, Integrated Product Teams (IPT) representatives and departmental contacts as required including resolution of issues and process improvements concerning production planning.

  • Continuously improving skills, knowledge and production planning products. Receiving feedback from departmental contacts, planners and performance reviews. Incorporating necessary revisions to the planning and associated procedures/training manuals.

  • Develop competencies within the product lines, work centers and/or department that focus on technical skills and process improvement, developing an understanding of our overall business (cost and asset) management objectives, team communication and problem-solving techniques, and personal motivation to achieve requirements established for Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in quality, schedule and cost performance.

  • Monitor changes in Engineering and Production to expedite changes to the manufacturing build schedule along with Production Coordinator.

  • Other duties not specifically covered herein but otherwise assigned.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, LICENSES, ETC:

  • High School Diploma, some college or technical schooling and/or combination of education and equivalent experience.

  • A minimum of 1 year of experience in planning or aircraft environment.

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite. Working knowledge of an MRP (Material Resources Planning) system strongly preferred; Corridor software a plus.

  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints and engineering documentation.


REQUIRED SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

  • Understanding of AS9100 and lean manufacturing principles.

  • Results oriented with the ability to plan and deliver against project deadlines.

  • Basic math functions with whole numbers, decimals and fractions and the ability to know how and when to use them.

  • Key competencies related to working with a diverse group of individuals and departments are desirable.

  • Frequent need to give concentrated attention, with one or two senses at a time, where stimuli are changing.

  • Occasional direct and indirect pressure from deadlines, production quotas, accuracy or similar demands.

  • Willing to travel domestically and internationally when required.


While we appreciate all resumes received,we can only contact directly those applicants under consideration for interview.

Flying Colours Corp. is proud to participate in the Legislated Employment Equity Program (LEEP). We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including candidates representing the four designated groups: Women, member of Visible Minorities, Aboriginal Peoples and Persons with Disabilities.

title: Packer
description:
Perform manual labour duties in a fast paced manufacturing environment while working under tight production deadlines.

Job Duties

  • Examine and inspect product to ensure quality standards are met
  • Remove defective product and record/dispose of it appropriately
  • Place units in plastic bags as per product specification
  • Place packed items in cases/cartons, box/seal the case and apply tracking label
  • Stack cases appropriately
  • Monitor machine for jam-ups or other malfunctions
  • Maintain good manufacturing, good housekeeping and safe operating practices at all times
  • Assist machine operators and other workers
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements

  • 1-3 years of minimum experience working in a fast-paced manufacturing environment
  • Willingness and ability to work 12 hour continental shifts
  • High degree of accuracy and detail orientation is essential
  • Basic reading, writing, and arithmetic skills required Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to maintain the production pace as per production standards
  • Ability to work well with others/in a team environment
  • Demonstrated excellent attendance record
  • Ability to move objects with one hand of moderate weight

Physical Demands

  • Must be able to perform repetitive tasks
  • Must be able to stand for long periods of time
  • Must be able to life up to 50lbs
  • Requires good hand-eye coordination

title: Materials Scheduler
description:
Plasman

One Company, One Driving Force.

Plasman is a leading global automotive and manufacturing company with several locations across North America and Europe. With a rich history dating back over 40 years, our collaborative approach, work ethic, and commitment have made us a global leader in automotive components. We believe the only thing that separates the possible from the impossible is perspective.

At Plasman, you will work with the world's best and brightest to shape the future of our global company. Our employees come from rich and diverse backgrounds working collectively together for the success of one company. We believe the most impressive thing we have built is our workforce. And together, we will accomplish more than ever imagined. We are Plasman. And we are One Driving Force.

Plasman Windsor 3 Manufacturing, 635 Sprucewood Ave, Windsor ON, is immediately seeking a new member to join our team as:

Materials Scheduler

The Scheduler is to coordinate production activities throughout the plant in order to maintain customer requirements at Plasman.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

  • Receiving customer releases through EDI and/or fax.
  • Liaison and customer contact for material related issues
  • Analyzing these releases in order to create an effective production schedule.
  • Communicating production schedules to Purchasing, Maintenance and Plant Supervisors.
  • Determining and maintaining finished goods inventory levels.
  • Communication daily releases to Shipping Personnel to ensure orders are prepared for shipment.
  • With direction from Scheduling & Logistics Supervisor will expedite operations that delay schedules and alter schedules to meet unforeseen conditions.
  • Provides Shipping Coordinators with appropriate information in order to make timely and accurate shipments to the customer
  • Responsible to prepare and administer 5-day assembly schedule

MINIMUM EDUCATION/OR DESIGNATION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must possess a secondary school diploma or equivalent, with preference given to those who have completed some or all of a college level program.

MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must have at least 3-5 years' experience in a related field and those with experience in Scheduling will be given preference.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Ability to perform well in high pressure situations

Plasman is committed to offering a wide range of prospects to our employees, including competitive salaries, full-time permanent positions, benefits, company savings plans, recognition awards, hands-on training, upward mobility, tuition reimbursement, and more.

Plasman values and supports the unique talents and strengths that each employee brings to our organization. We invest in our people and give them the tools they need to achieve success in their career.

We are an equal opportunity employer. If you need an accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process or have any questions, please contact HR.


Thousands of innovative minds. One Driving Force.

Visit our website plasman.com to see our capabilities and the culture that creates our one team.

title: Hiring Welders - Guelph, ON
description:
AWC Manufacturing LP is searching for Welders to join our growing operations in Guelph!

We are a custom steel fabrication centre and a tier one supplier to the mining, construction, and locomotive industries. Are you a hardworking and reliable person looking for long term employment?

We offer:

  • Competitive wages & shift premiums
  • Comprehensive benefit package (Vision, Dental, Medical)
  • Company Pension, Boot Allowance, Prescription Safety glasses allowance, Uniforms supplied
  • A variety of challenging work & stability
  • Overtime available

Responsibilities:

  • Welding of mining and construction equipment
  • Apply Mig welding process for welding plate and structural steel
  • Custom and low production metal fabrication

Qualifications Include:

  • Previous Mig welding and/or Custom Metal Fabrication experience
  • Overhead Crane and Rigging an asset
  • Excellent blueprint reading skills & Weld symbol knowledge
  • Strong knowledge of a variety of measuring devices
  • Safety conscious
  • Quality oriented

Overtime work is available. We appreciate your interest in our company however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

AWC is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.


Thank you for your interest!

title: Machine Operator
description:
Machine Operator-2nd shift
($1,000 Sign on Bonus)


Do you enjoy working as a team and sharing your expertise? Are you someone who shows initiative and isn't afraid to venture into new areas? Do you have a drive to take existing processes to the next level? If so, we’re looking for you!
TC Transcontinental Packaging, Making Impressions Count
TC Transcontinental is a leader in flexible packaging in North America, and Canada’s largest printer. The Corporation is also the leading Canadian French-language educational publishing group. For over 40 years, TC Transcontinental’s story has been one of innovation and transformation to meet our customers’ evolving needs. Our strong family values, entrepreneurial spirit and long-term vision have always been at the heart of our success.  With our 3 business sectors of Packaging, Print and Media, we continue to optimize, transform and grow while making impressions that count!  
TC Transcontinental Packaging brings a distinctive blend of Art, Science and Technology to create flexible packaging that preserves our customers' products and accentuates their brands on the store shelf. The Packaging Sector has over 4,000 employees and 25 facilities worldwide specializing in extrusion, lamination, printing and converting of plastic products.   
We share the Ellen MacArthur Foundation’s vision of a circular economy for plastic, where plastic never becomes waste and have committed, by 2025, for 100% of our plastic packaging to be reusable, recyclable, or compostable. And most recently, we joined the United Nations Global Compact – a voluntary initiative of signatory companies committing to social responsibilities around human rights, labor standards and environmental protection.  You will join a high-performing team that is dedicated to sustainability and passionate about our people, operations, communities, and products.

About this opportunity
The machine operator duties will include setting up machinery and manufacturing product according to specification, checking quality of product produced, packing product which may require lifting boxes up to 50 lbs. over an 8-hour shift. Full-Time, Monday-Friday with occasional required daily overtime.


What you will do
  • Proofread and understand all paperwork.
  • Operates machine to cut out parts of various specified shapes and sizes from different types of materials.
  • Positions dies into machine, inserts shims between die and push plate to set specified gap, and locks dies into position, using wrenches.
  • Places rolls of material in feed holders, turns knobs to synchronize action of feed rolls with die, and threads end of material through feed rolls and die for cutting. Starts machine and inspects sample cuts to determine conformity to specifications.
  • Follow production quality standards, including food safety, product appearance, product cost, and production efficiency in compliance with all Federal, State, and Local guidelines, including:
  • Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP’s)
  • Occupational Safety and Hazard Administration (OSHA)
  • Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP)
  • Safe Quality Foods (SQF)
  • Identify issues and problems within manufacturing and quality processes. Work with Supervisor / Manager to define and resolve problems, as well as recommend improvement processes.
  • Additional duties as required.
  • Support and contribute to a healthy and safe work environment by following all workplace regulations, policies, and initiatives, including reporting all first aid injuries, accidents, and workplace hazards.
What you have to offer
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Good math and reasoning skills
  • High level of mechanical capability
  • General computer PC skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
What we have to offer
  • Opportunity to be part of a dynamic and highly motivating work environment where you can develop your potential and launch an exciting career.
  • Development opportunities where your input makes a difference.
  • A competitive compensation package, 401K plan and flexible benefits that are customizable to you and your family needs
  • Employee perks such as discounts from suppliers on various products and services such as insurance, wireless bundles, travel, and much more.
Learn more about us: https://tctranscontinental.com/en-us
#INDUS#LI-TH1Sector'
TC Transcontinental Packaging

title: Warehouse - Parts Machinist
description:
We have a job for all warehouse workers / general labourers! Do you want to get back in the car/automotive manufacturing industry? Do you want to start next week? title: Quality Assurance Technician, Red Table
description:
Job Description

Red Table Foods is currently looking to for Full Time Quality Assurance Technician for our Production kitchen located at the head office in South Edmonton (3790 98 St NW). Reporting to the Quality Control Manager, the Quality Assurance Technician is responsible for responsible for the daily monitoring/auditing requirements for all outbound products and materials made in assembly area. At all times, ensure the adherence of all policies and procedures with respect to quality are maintained, and report all non-conformance's to the Quality Control Manager. Also, assigned as designate in the absence of Shift Leader. Please note that this position will support a 7-day operation, including weekends.

Key Responsibilities:

The responsibilities of a Quality Assurance Technician include, but are not limited to:

  • Examine and inspect containers, materials, and products in order to ensure that packing specifications are met.
  • Conduct package quality inspections and audits, and isolate any product that does not meet standards.
  • Perform sanitation verification and validation testing.
  • Ensure non-conforming material is properly identified and reported in a timely manner.
  • Conduct pre-operational inspections to ensure sanitation compliance standards are maintained.
  • Identify issues of concern to QC Coordinator or QC Manager.
  • Follow and practice GMPs and HACCP protocols. Ensure GMPs are maintained by production and warehouse employees.
  • Ensure all standards for sanitation & housekeeping as per Company Standard Operating Procedures' (SOP) are met.
  • Adhere to all quality policies/procedures and regulatory compliance procedures.
  • Measure, weigh, and count products and materials.
  • Record product, packaging, and order information on specified forms and records.
  • Laboratory (physical and chemical) testing of food product.
  • Maintain and update all related records, ensure verification as required.
  • Perform calibration checks of lab and processing/packaging equipment such as thermometers and weighing scales.
  • Ensure that all outbound products consistently meet quality specifications and adhering to sampling and testing procedures.
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable legislation and codes in all areas of the manufacturing plant including WCB, HACCP, WHMIS, & Workplace H&S.
  • Report potential hazards and unsafe work conditions.
  • Other duties as assigned by QC Coordinator or QC Manager.

Shift Leader:
  • Lead the day-to-day operations of the assembly area, coordinating the work and shift priorities to meet the production goals.
  • Organizing assembly lines and allocating employees on lines to achieve target attainments.
  • Prepare production reports.
  • Train staff in job duties and general procedures.
  • Ensure timely availability all raw materials/packaging required to meet the production plan (as appropriate).
  • Monitor processing activities against production schedule and update QC, Maintenance and Supervision on progress as needed.
  • Daily verification and entry of employee timekeeping in the workforce management system.
  • Maintain or exceed production goals on yields and efficiencies.
  • Carry out timely and effective line handover between shifts, including the completion of proper documentation and accurate briefing on progress/issues.
  • Assist in training as required to ensure proper production SOP's, GMP's, equipment and Health & Safety Standards are met.
  • Inspect equipment & initiate appropriate sanitation protocols as per the Company's SOP's.

Qualifications:
  • High School Diploma, certificates and classes related to Food Science, Food Engineering or similar field is an asset.
  • Relevant experience in the food industry or monitoring activities in a manufacturing environment an asset .
  • Understanding of food regulatory requirements in Canada and Good Manufacturing Practices.
  • A minimum level of Advanced Food Safety Certification that is valid in the province of Alberta is mandatory and must be maintained throughout the course of employment.
  • Must be a great team player with outstanding interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to multi-task and manage multiple priorities simultaneously in order to meet deadlines
  • Excellent organizational and decision making skills.
  • Ability to work effectively and prioritize jobs in a very fast paced work environment.
  • Ability to understand and follow a variety of guidelines and work procedures.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to work with a high degree of accuracy.
  • Effective investigation and technical writing skills.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment to facilitate and resolve issues.
  • Outstanding computer skills, with applications such as MS Office Word, Excel and Outlook is preferred.
Red Table is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.

title: Steel Quality Control Technician (FT)
description:
About us:
Our team is growing, and Marcon Metalfab (www.marconmetal.com) is hiring an entry-level Quality Control Technician to join our dynamic team based in Delta’s Tilbury Park. This is a company and department with great growth potential for the right individual. Our fast-paced steel fabrication shop works on high-profile projects for delivering around the world. Inspections occur in an un-heated facility.

For over 30 years, Marcon Metalfab has supplied custom fabricated steel and rubber products required for infrastructure, and other projects in the transportation, building construction, utilities, mining, marine, oil, and gas sectors. Equipped with leading manufacturing technologies that allow for efficient handling and processing of materials, Marcon’s 22,000 square foot facility can support even the largest fabrication projects. 

Coupled with an unconditional commitment to providing expert customer service and a rigorous quality management system, Marcon consistently delivers better quality products within tight time frames at prices that are competitive within any industry. 

We have many long-serving employees here, competitive wages, and excellent benefits.  Some places say they have a family atmosphere, but it is truly the case here at Marcon. 

We are located in Tilbury Industrial Park in Delta BC, with four ways to get here –  the Massey Tunnel, Alex Fraser Bridge, South Fraser Perimeter Rd., and Hwy 99.


Our Vision, Mission, and Values: 
Our vision is to partner with like-minded companies to develop leading infrastructure solutions, and in the process, contribute to building strong communities.

Our mission is to be North America’s leading supplier of joints, bearings, railing systems, custom–fabricated steel, and rubber products for the transportation sector and beyond. 

To achieve this, we must embody Marcon’s four values:
  • Service, provided at the highest level to our clients.
  • Excellence, in the quality of products we manufacture.
  • Innovation, in our products, technologies, and skills.
  • Integrity, in our responsibility to clients and fellow employees.

About the Position:
Shift: Regular shift is 7:30 am to 4:00 pm, but can accommodate. Potential for overtime and weekends.

Responsibilities:
  • Inspect in-process and finished fabricated parts for defects and to confirm specifications.
  • Measure flat, formed, and processed plates and materials.
  • Document information.
  • Take instructions from the Quality Manager.
  • Maintain a neat, safe, and organized working environment.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
  • Experience with precision measurement using tools in Imperial and Metric.
  • Physically able to stand for extended periods and lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Solid grasp of basic math skills – addition, subtraction, and fractions.
  • Competent computer skills and communication both verbal and written are required.
  • English reading, writing, speaking, and comprehension are required for understanding instructions and writing numbers and text legibly.
  • Understanding metal fabrication and the ability to read shop drawings would be an asset.
  • Working previously with steel is an asset.
  • An entry-level technical position requiring basic knowledge of the steel fabrication industry.

What You Bring to Marcon:
  • Thirst for learning and a desire to master your role.
  • Commitment to personal and professional growth within the company.
  • A real team player, you know what you know and what you do not know and are not afraid to say so.
  • A passion for excellence and pride in your work.

What We Offer:
  • Competitive hourly wage.
  • Overtime opportunities and commitment to personal and professional growth.
  • Excellent family culture and a supportive team.
  • An organization that has a trusted reputation and is stable within the manufacturing community.
  • Marcon provides gloves, ear, and eye protection, but employees must also wear CSA-approved safety boots with toe caps, shanks, and soles.
  • Ongoing training, opportunities for growth.

Marcon Metalfab is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial, and local laws. We are also committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected will be contacted.




    About Marcon Metalfab.:

    For over 30 years, Marcon Metalfab has been Western Canada’s partner of choice for custom–fabricated steel and rubber products for the transportation, building construction, utilities and other industries. Equipped with leading manufacturing technologies that allow for efficient handling and processing of materials, our facility can support even the largest fabrication projects. Coupled with an unconditional commitment to providing expert customer service and a rigorous quality management system, we consistently deliver quality products within tight timeframes at prices that are competitive within any industry.

title: Paint Associate (FT)
description:
Position Purpose:
This position will assist in all aspects of the painting process and will assist with pre-finishing, sanding, cleaning, material transfer, paint mixing, and other duties as required. This job is for a reliable, hard-working individual that has a high level of attention to detail with the ability to work independently and efficiently while being focused on Safety and Continuous improvement aspects. 
 
Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Working in a safe manner and following all safety rules.
  • Prepare parts for paint by masking, sanding, and cleaning.
  • Properly load parts on racks or tables in order to achieve desired paint results.
  • Maximize paint loads while ensuring quality standards are maintained.
  • Properly identify and tag parts
  • Identify and gather all paint supplies needed for each paint load
  • Be prepared to lift 25 to 50 pounds as part of your daily activities
  • Ensure the flow of work orders is maintained as directed by following schedule and proper staging of jobs.
  • Complete assigned work within a given timeframe and according to specifications.
  • Assist in maintenance, cleaning, and repair of equipment and booths as required.
  • Keep all work areas including the staging area clean and organized, emptying scrap and garbage containers as necessary.
  • Maintain all quality standards in accordance with the specifications for each job in order to meet customer requirements.
  • Performs additional duties as deemed necessary.
  • Takes initiative and is a self-starter.
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple duties/projects at one time, work independently with minimal supervision, and resolve conflict in a professional manner.
  • Maintains open communication and a team-oriented work environment with all departments and all levels of personnel.
  • Demonstrates flexibility and professionalism throughout the day.
  • Adhere to all start/end times including break and lunch schedules.
  • Willingness to work in other areas of the facility as required.

Qualifications / Experience / Required Skills:
  • Preferred: High school diploma or GED from an accredited school system or program.
  • Preferred: 6 months of related experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
  • Possess knowledge of and ability to identify and work with components and paint material/equipment.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Position requires physical requirements including lifting, pushing/pulling, lifting, bending/stretching, and standing.

Benefits:
  • Dental care.
  • Disability insurance.
  • Extended health care.
  • Life insurance.
  • On-site parking.
  • RRSP match.

COVID-19 considerations:
Eastside ensures all protocols are followed for the safety of our employees, their families, and our customers. 
  • Personal protective equipment provided or required.
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place.
  • Social distancing guidelines in place.




    About Eastside Industrial Coatings and Composites :

    Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fibreglass and metal components for local OEMs.As the coatings business continued to grow with a focus on “A” Finish coatings, Eastside Industrial moved to a larger location (our current space), committed to diversifying into composites manufacturing and expanding our customer base throughout the continent.Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.We remain a family owned business focused on growing our team and developing our team to have a successful future with Eastside or a member of the Eastside Group.

title: Production Supervisor - Engineer Mississauga
description:
Are you an Engineer that has been Supervising Production in an Automotive or related operation? If yes then please apply, our Automotive HVAC client has partnered with us in the search for their new supervisor.

Title - Production Supervisor - Engineering
Location – Mississauga, ON
Shift - Night shift 11:30 am - 7:30
Salary - ($27-$35) + Overtime after 40 hours
Industry – HVAC Automotive

Must be a Degreed Engineer to Supervise in an advanced manufacturing operation.

If you are interested please share your resume with Sucheta Nagendra at sucheta.nagendra@randstad.ca



Advantages
Paid overtime after 40 hours
Group benefits 100% company paid
RRSP DPSP Matching

Responsibilities
• Proven experience as Production Supervisor in a manufacturing company.
• Experience in Radiator manufacturing/ Automotive / equipment / sheet metal manufacturing
• Experience in using various types of manufacturing machinery and tools
• Knowledge of machine repairs / Die changing / Tooling change
• Ability to prioritize, plan and schedule work effectively with a production team in a fast paced environment
• Supervise, establish and coordinate the production schedule in the manufacturing environment
• Ensure the flow of material, parts and assemblies between or within departments
• Lead and participate in lean manufacturing, 5-s, kaizen project and six sigma project
• Supervise hourly work force and control overtime
• Participate in hiring, discipline and appraisal process for subordinates
• Assist the assembly manager in employee performance management, disciplinary action and employee complaint
• Control production line expenses
• Submit necessary paperwork in an accurate, timely manner
• Provide work instructions to lead hands and workers
• Maintain, repair and perform preventative maintenance on capitol equipment in the facility to support production
• Ensure assembly machine major calibrations are taken care
• Train team leaders and leadhand on the most updated knowledge and skills they required
• Provide team leaders with necessary tools and equipment to conform to systems
• Conform to recognized safety procedures including osha rules and regulations, iiazcom, and normal shop safety
• Hold regular communication meetings with work group to review progress against objectives
• Acquire p.o. authorization to purchase equipment and supplies to support production (limit/ceiling $1000)
• Lead subordinates in the attainment of product line objectives
• Lead hourly work force to achieve specific production goals
• Provide subordinates with necessary training and equipment
• Implement methods and procedures by manufacturing engineering and quality
• Engineering system conformance
• Identify and correct off-standard conditions
• Communicate with all support departments
• Communicate production line goals to subordinates-share results and develop appropriate correction plan
• Maintain a safe and clean work environment, continuous improvement in housekeeping
• Manufacture product in conformance to quality standards
• Communicate internally with all departments
• Identifying off-standard conditions and develop corrective action
• Understanding and communicating product line goals and objectives to hourly employees
• Training of hourly work force
• Implementing pre-determined plans; responds positively to changing conditions of the production floor to attain schedules while conforming to various manufacturing systems
• Implementing procedures as defined by manufacturing engineering and quality engineering
• Be in continuing contact with other members of product line team, team leaders, and support departments
• Contact with any customer/supplier of this product line who visits the facility
• Provide training and direction to hourly work force of various product lines
• Train staff
• Enforce company policies & practices
• Additional tasks & responsibilities as required


Qualifications
• Degree in Engineering
• 2-3 years of Previous Supervisor experience in a manufacturing environment strongly.
• Great leadership and exceptional time management skills
• Strong organizational skills with good command in Microsoft Office and written communication.
• Ability to handle pressure and to adapt and formulate new plans as contingencies arise
• Self-motivated and energetic with a high level of integrity.
• Proven health and safety orientation

Summary
If you are interested please share your resume with Sucheta Nagendra at sucheta.nagendra@randstad.ca

title: Production Worker 19 dollars per hour
description:
Production Assembler
Victoria BC
$19.00 per hour




The Production Assembler is responsible for performing operations in The Final Meter Assembly Cells. This includes assembling, testing, and boxing various products while following work instructions. New Hires will undergo line specific training followed by certification while learning Lean Manufacturing concepts.
Assemblers must be able to work in a fast-paced work environment and have passion in achieving daily productivity targets while respecting our Safety, Quality, Environmental and Covid 19 policies



Production Assemblers must be able to work in a fast-paced work environment and have passion in achieving daily productivity targets while respecting our Safety, Quality, Environmental and Covid 19 policies.


Advantages
•Training provided
•Great work environment with a strong emphasis on safety
• Weekly pay
•Monday to Friday, two shifts must be available for both 6am-2pm and 2-10pm



Responsibilities
• Prepare, process, clean, install, assemble, rework, verify, test, solder, and/or inspect electrical and mechanical components, hardware, sub assemblies, and assemblies on single or multiple product lines
• Operate shop equipment and tools where applicable
• Adhere to environmental and safety procedures associated with production processes and procedures
• Use work instructions, drawings, methods, diagrams, workmanship standards or other specifications in accordance with established assembly procedures
• Monitor and record related documentation to meet quality requirements
• Follow production build rates, schedules and meet time standards

Qualifications
• A High School Diploma
• Good written,verbal reading and math skills
• Strong manual dexterity and hand/eye coordination
• Basic computer skills
• Able to use manual tools and light power tools
• Ability to work and contribute in a team environment
• Familiarity with 5S and Lean Manufacturing concepts
• Able to Stand for long periods of time
• Flexibility to perform other duties based upon business needs
• Previous Manufacturing or Electronics knowledge is an asset
• Must be flexible working either morning shift or afternoon shift (Afternoon shift is eligible for shift premium)



Summary

title: Assembly Technician
description:
Assembly Technician (Richmond)
 
At Dynamix Agitators, we specialize in engineering and manufacturing agitators and mixers for industrial process markets worldwide. Our customers include some of the world's leading energy and natural resource companies, as well as some of the largest chemical manufacturing companies. Due to continual growth, we are in need of a dynamic and outgoing individual to join our Production Team in the role of an Assembly Technician.

About the job:
  • Hands-on assembly of mixers, comprising electric motors, shafts, and other components while using basic tools and machinery.
  • Attention to detail in following Quality Control measures related to the assembly of components is essential.
  • Our facilities are organized and clean, and the staff is supportive.
  • The office hours are 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 pm Monday - Friday with 1 hour for a lunch break.
 
About you:
  • A good mechanical aptitude.
  • You have strong attention to detail relating to hands-on assembly processes.
  • A good understanding of basic quality control requirements.
  • Able to continually produce a quality assembly.
  • Experience in a fast-paced manufacturing or assembly-related environment.
  • Physically fit and able to handle some minor lifting while assembling components.
  • Committed to working safely at all times.
  • Good verbal and written English communication skills
  • Reliable team player with good customer service abilities.
 
Nice To Have:
  • Shipping/Receiving experience.
  • Forklift operator certificate.
  • Basic proficiency in Microsoft Office.

We recognize that our employees are the cornerstone of our accomplishments and we pride ourselves on being people of passion and integrity. We've created a collaborative work environment with growth opportunities. While high-quality standards are our priority, we do recognize the importance of a healthy work/life balance. Dynamix Agitators offers attractive compensation and benefits, on-the-job training, and a welcoming work environment. If this sounds like you and you match most of our requirements, we would love to hear from you! Please send your resume and cover letter explaining why you want to join our team.

Note: Office is not easily accessible by Transit.

To read more about us please visit www.dynamixinc.com.

title: Saw/Mill Operator
description:
Job Responsibilities

  • Consists of setup and operation of milling/saw process in a manufacturing plastics environment.
  • Mill Operator/Saw Operator is responsible for measuring all dimensions of the parts being produced and completing first article and in process inspections.
  • Milling/sawing process consists of a conveyor belt and digital controller to set the machines required thickness.
  • Operators mill/saw sheets in passes to achieve the desired finish and gauge.

Qualifications/Requirements

  • Strong mechanical skills
  • Problem solving abilities
  • Ability to learn and mater machinery and troubleshooting maintenance
  • Enjoyment of hands-on-work with production machinery
  • Perform and analyze quality control monitoring and accurate reporting of production
  • 1 year experience in a continuous process manufacturing environment
  • Forklift experience/certification
  • Able to lift up to >50 lbs, push, pull, stand on a concrete floor

$19.64 - $23.40/hr (Depending on knowledge, skills, abilities, experiences both work and education)

Shifts

  • Permanent, Full Time Position
  • 12 hr continental day shifts
  • Averaging agreements in place
  • 84 hrs biweekly
Location- Orangeville, ON

title: Inventory Control Clerk
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">**Company Overview:**
 

 
If a culture of excellence, innovation and ownership is what you’re searching for, consider putting your experience in motion at Flowserve. As an individual contributor, or as a leader of people, your enterprise mindset will ensure Flowserve’s position as the global standard in comprehensive flow control solutions. Here, your opportunity for professional development and industry leading rewards will be supported by our foundational commitments to the values of people first, integrity and safety. Thinking beyond opportunity and reward, at Flowserve, we are inspired by working together to create extraordinary flow control solutions to make the world better for everyone!
 

 
**Role Summary:**
 

 
Inventory Control Clerk is responsible for all inventory related functions at Woodbridge. This includes receiving POs, cycle counts, shipping and receiving stock, pulling parts for jobs, assigning and editing stock locations and all data entry associated with these functions.
 
Inventory Control will work with Quality team to confirm material certifications (CMTR’s) are correct prior to releasing materials and/or components to manufacturing.
 
Inventory Control will work with Quality team to successfully record and file CMTR’s and other documentation accordingly.
 

 
This position is for the day shift, from 7 am to 3:30 pm.
 

 
**Responsibilities & Requirements:** **Responsibilities:**
 

 
+ Responsible for receiving and put away accuracy for all items received in the warehouse.
 
+ Ensure all receipts are processed the same day, they are delivered on the dock and all transactions updated in the system.
 
+ Applies in depth proficiency in running all inventory reports in support of daily operations as required. Reconciles the cycle count daily.
 
+ Responsible for the storage and accuracy of all inventory to increase efficiency which will increase productivity and quality.
 
+ Professionally and effectively works with Quality team with regards to all quality related documents.
 
+ Professionally and effectively advises both internal and external customers on the status of orders and assists in tracking shipments until delivery is completed. Ensures changes in an order’s status are communicated in a timely manner and assists in trouble-shooting order issues to maintain on time delivery.
 
+ Closely monitor PO due dates and expedite on the status for PO deliveries
 
+ Maintain and replenish stocks for consumables
 

 
**Requirements:**
 

 
+ High School diploma or equivalent
 
+ Must have excellent communication skills
 
+ Must have solid computer skills
 
+ 3+ years’ experience in inventory order entry, processing and / or handling
 

 
**Preferred Experience / Skills:**
 

 
+ Flexibility to perform other tasks: moving materials to machines, cleaning up, painting.
 

 
**Job Advertising Title:** Inventory Control Clerk
 

 
**Primary Posting Location:** Woodbridge, Canada
 

 
**Job Posting Category:** Supply Chain
 

 
**Employment Type:** Full time
 

 
**Auto req ID:** 55695BR
 

 
**Country:** Canada

You can request a reasonable accommodation by sending an e-mail to employment@flowserve.com. title: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Encapsulation Operator $22.47 per hour
description:
Position Summary

Reporting to the Department Supervisor, this position either: (a) produces Gel, Fill, and cleans equipment in Utility. This role involves verifying and dispensing and compounding raw materials, cleaning of equipment and operating equipment in accordance with master production batch records, standard operating procedures, and safety requirements to produce quality products ensuring compliance with Good Manufacturing Practices OR (b) set-up and operate the encapsulation machines, as per standard operating procedures and safety requirements, producing consistent, good quality product in accordance with masterbatch production records and Standard Operating Procedures ensuring compliance with Good Manufacturing Practices

Shift - The shift of this role would be rotating:

Week 1) 8am-8pm - Monday, Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

Week 2) 8am-8pm - Sunday, Tuesday, Thursday

**Every 4 weeks - rotating to night shifts 8pm-8am

Pay:

Starts at $22.47/per hour

The Role

  • Verifying and dispensing of raw materials, using the appropriate scales and verifying and or performing scale logs for completion

  • Sets up, operate, and cleans appropriate equipment as instructed in the MBPR and standard operating procedures, producing good quality product and drain into appropriate tanks or receivers

  • Weighs and transports tanks/receivers to their staging area as dictated by the area production schedule

  • Manufactures gelatin according to MBPR and confirms process parameters for temperature, colour, batch number, and receiver sequences for the order ensuring appropriate quantities as required

  • Disassembly, clean, and assemble equipment as per SOPs. Equipment includes but not limited to: receivers, tanks, lids, stainless steel pots, tumbler baskets, encapsulation parts, packaging parts

  • Sets up the encapsulation machines and operates them according to SOP, producing good quality product. Required activities involve (but are not limited to) checking fill and shell weights, measuring seam integrity, changing fill and gel tanks/receivers and performing any necessary corrective adjustments

  • Spreads capsules on trays, checking capsules as spreading for defects, compiles trays of product in to stacks, labels and transfers the stacks to the assigned drying tunnel

  • Confirms all gelatin and fill tanks conform to temperature, color, batch number, and receiver sequences for the order before placed on machine, following corrective actions if necessary

  • Monitoring encapsulation machine and capsules though out the shift for any issues and correcting as needed

The Candidate

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent

  • Additional education would be considered an asset

  • Two (2) years of experience in a manufacturing, pharmaceutical and/or GMP facility an asset.

  • Knowledge of workplace safety and safe lifting and handling procedures.

  • Maintains the equipment used and ensures working areas are clean and organized at all times

  • Trains team members in processes and procedures

  • Follows all Safety, Quality, and Production procedures and policies

Why You Should Join Catalent

  • Comprehensive Benefit Package (Health, Dental, Vision, & Life Insurance);

  • Group Retirement Savings – Registered Pension Plan (RPP) with employer contributions

  • Paid Time Off Programs incl. vacation, banked time & personal time

  • Employee Reward & Recognition programs

  • Opportunities for professional and personal development & growth incl. tuition reimbursement.

Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career!  Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference. 

Catalent is committed to the health and safety of its employees, visitors and the customers and patients we serve. As a result of the global pandemic, we have modified many of our recruitment and on-boarding processes to maintain everyone’s safety. The Human Resources teams will communicate all necessary safety processes and procedures throughout each stage.

   

personal initiative. dynamic pace. meaningful work.

Visit Catalent Careers to explore career opportunities.

Catalent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on any characteristic protected by local law.

If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your request by sending an email, and confirming your request for an accommodation and include the job number, title and location to DisabilityAccommodations@catalent.com. This option is reserved for individuals who require accommodation due to a disability. Information received will be processed by a U.S. Catalent employee and then routed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure appropriate consideration in the application or hiring process.

    

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives: Catalent Pharma Solutions (Catalent) is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Catalent employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Catalent. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

title: Injection Molding Technician
description:
TG Minto is a tier-1 automotive manufacturing organization with plants located in Palmerston and Stratford, Ontario.  We manufacture a wide range of high-quality interior and exterior components including grills, spoilers, consoles, and more for customers that include Toyota, Lexus, and Honda.

Position Summary

The successful candidate will assists the lead technician and supervisor with daily operations of the injection and injection assembly systems. Maintain production schedules by executing mold and colour changes on machines ranging from 300lbs to 21 tons. Safely operate over-head cranes, forklifts and trouble shoot injection problems as they arise. Must be able to work independently as well as a part of a team. Flexible work hours are required as the shift will vary from time to time. Along with the following duties followed under the Health and Safety Guidelines.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Set up and change molds, schedules vary
  • Fill in on injection machines for breaks coverage
  • Dump garbage (how often)
  • Trouble shooting machines as needed
  • Meet hourly quotas
  • Document daily production
  • Ability to be cross trained in other areas
  • Understand Kanban system (scheduled manufacturing system)
  • Work in a safe manner within Health and Safety guidelines
  • Any other duties as assigned

 

Qualifications and Competencies

  • Ability to operate forklift and crane
  • Experience in the manufacturing industry is considered an asset
  • Must be able to add, subtract, multiply and divide.
  • Ability to occasionally switch shifts
  • Ability to work overtime

Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to lift and/or manually move up to 75 pounds

title: Mechanical Designer
description:
About the Company:
Redwood Plastics and Rubber, https://www.redwoodplastics.com/, manufactures and distributes many grades of industrial plastic and rubber. We have in-house engineering and fabrication to produce custom components that often replace steel, aluminum, and wood for longer wear life, decreased downtime, increased production, lighter weight, cost effectiveness and increased safety.

About the Job:
We are growing and hiring a Mechanical Designer to liaise with Technical Sales, Manufacturing and our customers to create fully detailed models and manufacturing drawing packages of customer parts using SolidWorks and provide CAD support to sales and estimating departments.

Responsibilities include:  
  • Perform mechanical design including concept development, detailed design, and creation of manufacturing and assembly drawings using SolidWorks.
  • Design molds for rubber compression molding, urethane casting, and other processes.
  • Develop design documentation, technical specifications, and other project-related documentation. 
  • Create detailed BOM material take-offs for steel and aluminum molds once designed.
  • Participate in the development process of mechanical parts prototypes to include designing, reviewing, testing prototypes, and making rapid relevant changes to improve features and performance while meeting customer demands, schedule, and budget.
  • Other duties as required.

Skills and Experience:
  • Some design experience with proficiency in SolidWorks including modelling and assembly aids. 
  • Strong spatial visualization ability and skill designing for manufacturability.
  • Experience with PDM (product data management) an asset. 
  • Strong attention to detail to ensure error-free designs.
  • Efficient time management and prioritization skills.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • CSWA or CSWP credential would be an asset.

title: Production Assistant
description:
Position Summary:

Follows processes and procedures to assist in the manufacturing process.  Assists with maintaining a clean and safe work environment and general plant up keep.

Job Accountabilities:

  • Assists Chemical Operators in the chemical manufacturing process including assisting with the production of chemical batches under the guidance of a Chemical Operator.
  • Follows manufacturing processes and procedures to ensure safety and quality.
  • Maintains a clean and organized work area and strictly adheres to all plant safety policies. 
  • Stages inventory in assigned areas for batch preparation, further processing and/or shipping.
  • Assists in projects for general plant up-keep.
  • Operates all types of Forklifts and other related motorized vehicles in a safe and proficient manner.
  • Assists with loading and unloading box trucks and flat-beds either manually or using proper material handling equipment.
  • Assists with the preparation of containers for filling and shipping.
  • Others duties as assigned; Responsibilities may vary by work location

Work Environment:

Will work in a manufacturing environment and may be exposed to fumes or airborne particles and toxic or caustic chemicals.  The associate is exposed to moving mechanical parts, risk of electrical shock and trip and slip hazards.  The noise level in the manufacturing environment is loud.

Ability to lift bags and other containers up to 50 pounds in a safe manner as directed. May be required to stand for long periods and walk great distances daily.  May be required to work in small spaces and high locations.

Education, Experience, Skills & Competencies:
Key Education or Certification Required:

High school diploma or equivalent required. Ability to lift bags and other containers up to 50 pounds in a safe manner as directed.

Required Minimum Number of Years of Relevant Experience:

This position is the entry level for a new production employee with 0-1 year of experience.

Required Skills and Competencies:

  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret work instructions
  • Positive team oriented attitude
  • Reliable attendance
  • Demonstrate basic mathematical skills. Precise and accurate in dealing with figures and details.
