title: Quality Control
description:
- Are you someone who is detail oriented?
- Are you interested in starting a quality control job in the field of manufacturing and distribution?
- Do you live in the West Island of Montreal and want to work in the Vaudreuil-Dorion area?
- Have you been looking for an over night shift?

If you answered yes to all of the above, then we have the job for you!

We are currently looking to hire several quality control associates for our manufacturing and distribution center located in Vaudreuil-Dorion, just a few minutes off the Island of Montreal. We create and distribute high-quality packaging materials for perishable foods, beverages and healthcare.

jessica.lovelace@randstad.ca
emilie.armstrong@randstad.ca
514-695-7388

Advantages
Quality control associates receive:
- Permanent position
- $19.92/h + $1.50/h night shift prime ($21.42/h)
- Night shift, Monday-Friday 11pm-7am
- Retention bonus!! $500 after 3 months, $500 after 6 months & $1000 after a year!!
- On-site training
- Full insurance coverage (medication, dental, eyewear, travel, life)
- Pension (7%)
- 2 weeks vacation
- Friendly work environment
- Growing company
- Located in Vaudreuil-Dorion, 5 minutes from the West Island! In a rapidly developing location!

Responsibilities
As a quality control associate, you will:
- Inspect materials
- Ensure product quality
- Product packaging
- Use a computer to process orders
- Operate the machinery
- Supply the raw material to the machine if necessary
-Ensuring a clean work environment

Qualifications
- Experience as a quality control clerk or machine operator (an asset)
- Ability to speak and read in French - required!
- Have good manual dexterity and attention to detail
- Available for the NIGHT shift from 23h-7 (8hr shift) OR 19h to 7am (12hr shift)
- Hard working
- NO SENSITIVITY TO SMELL!!

Summary
If this Quality Control job in Vaudreuil-Dorion just off the West Island of Montreal is of interest to you, we would love to hear from you!!

Please reach out to us as soon as possible at 5146957388 and ask for Jessica or Emilie
Or you can send your CV by email to:
jessica.lovelace@randstad.ca
emilie.armstrong@randstad.ca

If you know someone who would be perfect for this role, take advantage of our referral program. You might be eligible to receive a $75 bonus!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: General Labourer
description:
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited is a recognized industry leader in manufacturing standard and custom designed resistance welding, spot welding, arc welding and metal working equipment. We apply state of the art technology to the design and manufacture of robotic weld lines, configurable fastener welders, welding electrodes, welding guns, welding cylinders, and other welding accessories. CenterLineâ€™s vertical integration provides resistance weld gun manufacturing, electrode / weld cap manufacturing, equipment manufacturing, all integrated into our custom machinery. Our people are our key competitive advantage in todayâ€™s global market. Celebrating our 60th Anniversary, CenterLine (Windsor) Limited continues to evolve and diversify to remain a valued partner to its customers and a respected member of industry. Our success is built on the foundation of innovation, efficient design management, excellence and the guarantee of quality service.

 

CenterLine is looking for a self-motivated, reliable individual to fill the position of General Labourer.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Organizing and prioritizing work
  • Clean/lubricate equipment
  • Keep manufacturing areas free of debris and dirt
  • Follow instructions to operate machines, hold or supply materials and tools and load and unload items from machines and assembly lines.
  • Locate parts as required
  • Other miscellaneous duties as required

 

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Secondary School diploma
  • Manufacturing experience an asset
  • Mechanical aptitude preferred 
  • Time management
  • Manual dexterity to use tools and machines
  • Blue print reading an asset

 

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS

  • Air-conditioned manufacturing facility
  • Health, dental, vision care
  • Life insurance
  • Company pension plan
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Employee Assistance Plan
  • Retirement benefits
  • Wellness committee

 

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Centerline Windsor Limited will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, Selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Manual Machinist
company: The Wohl Group - Recruitment Made Easy!
description:
Our client is a leader in the Greater Toronto Area for the supply and repair of hydraulic equipment. They are seeking a skilled
general machinist to grow their hydraulic cylinder manufacturing and repair business unit.

Job Description

• Performing machining tasks by using engineering sketches or verbal instructions
• Computing dimensions within tolerances to lay out work for fabrication
• Making precision measurements using precision measuring instruments and techniques
• Disassembly and assembly of components, fit aligning and adjusting components to precise tolerances
• Setting up jigs, fixtures or machine attachments required for complex precision parts and equipment
• Determining tooling requirements, setup procedures and control settings based on requirements
• lathe, mill, grinder operation
• Usage of material handling equipment
• Inspects work pieces at beginning of and throughout production run to insure part meets tolerance requirements
• Inspects and understands when to replace cutting tools
• Demonstrates ability to effectively use all necessary measuring tools in order to assure conformance to print
• Maintain a safe working and good housekeeping practices
• Works effectively in a fast-paced manufacturing environment
• Flexibility and Communication skills are very important
• Works well in a team as well as independently

Qualifications

• Community college graduation plus completion of a recognized machinist apprenticeship program and Ontario Machinist Certificate of Qualification
• Thorough knowledge of machining methods and shop mathematics
• Ability to compute dimensions, tapers, cutting angles, tool settings, feed rates and machine speeds
• Ability to operate manual equipment with a minimum of three years of experience
• Ability to mulitask
• English verbal and written communication
• Willingness to work Overtime, weekends, or Flexible Work Schedules as needed

Additional Information
  • We thank all applications for showing an interest in this position.
  • Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies or phone calls.
  • Thank you and Good Luck. Only candidates we feel are qualified will be contacted for interviews!

title: QUALITY CONTROL INSPECTOR - DIMENSIONAL
description:
Company Description

Chantier Davie Canada Inc. is Canada’s largest shipbuilding and repair yard. Based on values such as success, dynamic, accountability and relationship.

You have a taste for adventure and want to start an exceptional career in an environment where you will have the opportunity to grow.

Come support the nation with us. We build and repair Canadian ships for the Department of National Defence, Transport Canada and the Canadian Coast Guard.

Job Description

Reporting to the Quality Control Director, the primary mandate of the Quality Control Inspector - Dimensional is to verify the conformity of parts, assemblies and subsystems of a ship under construction or repair according to the quality control plan. To do so, he/she will obtain the relevant documentation, verify the procedures and equipment to be used during dimensional inspections and manage the documentation attesting to their compliance. In the event of non-compliance, the Inspector is responsible for documenting and coordinating the root-cause analysis and implementation of corrective and preventive actions. More specifically, you will : 

  • Review and analyze specifications for new constructions and ship repairs to prepare the necessary inspection plans, including a checklist of inspection points to be covered during critical phases of the work;
  • Conduct inspections during new constructions and ship repairs to ensure compliance of production facilities with drawings, specifications, quality processes and other applicable norms and standards;
  • Carry out specific inspections on materials, equipment, and construction/installation activities on the site;
  • Understand specific project requirements, monitor and control the quality of constructions and/or repairs to ensure that work is carried out in accordance with specification requirements, regulations, standards and internal procedures;
  • Identify and document any non-compliance following an inspection, and assist in remedying it;
  • Perform final inspections with the customer to ensure the compliance of the product with standards, requirements and contractual agreements;
  • Carry out all relevant continuing controls;
  • Perform visual inspections and dimensional measurements;
  • Perform functional tests of calibrated tools;
  • Verify special processes and qualifications of workers involved;
  • Ensure proper implementation of the approved inspection test plan;
  • Review specifications, drawings, procedures and technical standards required for each project;
  • Participate in and/or prepare a wide variety of documents (such as specifications, inspection reports, quality assurance audits, training plans, technical system documentation and the company’s internal inspection procedures: determine what information should be included and ensure its validity; these documents may become part of the engineering files).

 

Qualifications

  • A minimum of 5 years of work experience in manufacturing quality control;
  • Hold a diploma of vocational studies (DVS) in machining techniques or a diploma in mechanical engineering or shipbuilding;
  • Ability to communicate efficiently in both French and English;
  • Thorough knowledge of quality control procedures, record keeping and systems;
  • Ability to interpret drawings and technical specifications;
  • Knowledge of high precision dimensional instruments including 3D laser, 3D scan and CMM;
  • Knowledge of the regulations of the classification society;
  • Knowledge of measurement data acquisition concepts used for process capability analysis (Cp & Cpk)
  • Comfortable using the Microsoft Office suite;
  • Proven ability to work effectively with clients and as a team.


Additional Information

In order to be selected, it is mandatory that you successfully undergo and pass the investigation and security clearance process required by the Federal Government’s Contract Security Program.

title: General Production Worker
description:
We are hiring a General Production Worker for day-to-day support in manufacturing including fabrication, finishing, assembly, packaging, or shipping of kitchen cabinets and parts.

Duties include:
  • Read and understand work orders and other production paperwork.
  • Daily preventative maintenance of tools, work area, and equipment.
  • The Finishing department includes loading/unloading parts on the finishing line, and sanding solid wood doors in preparation for stain.
  • The Fabrication department includes dovetail and operating machines such as panels and chop saw.
  • The Assembly department includes assembling prefabricated parts on an assembly line, or at workbenches using screw guns, staple guns, operating clamp machines, and other hand tools.
  • The Shipping department includes loading/unloading finished goods off conveyor parts, and organizing them for shipment.
  • Opportunities to perform other duties as delegated by management.

Skills and Requirements:
  • Some warehouse experience.
  • Able to lift 50 pounds and stand, walk, bend, etc. for 8 hours a day.
  • Effective English reading, writing, and comprehension skills.
  • Time management, prioritization skills, and attention to detail.
  • Self-motivated and can work without direct supervision.

We offer competitive wages along with a comprehensive benefits package including extended health care, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, vacation, company RRSP, free on-site parking, work-life balance (no weekend work), and much more.

Starting wage: Hourly wage $15.20

All team members will be provided training and cross-training in a variety of roles throughout the Merit's manufacturing process.

We are proud to be an inclusive workplace committed to building a team culture. Merit Kitchens provides opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, persons with disabilities, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Press Operator
description:
Overview

OSI Systems companies have a long history of developing innovative solutions to bring a better quality of life to the world. Our OSI Electronics (OSIE) division is a diversified manufacturer of electronic devices and value-added manufacturing services.

 

We provide our customers with the manufacturing capabilities and purchasing power of a global Electronics Manufacturing Services provider. By delivering regional and personalized support best provided by a smaller company, we strive to build lasting relationships and create close and valued partnerships with our customers. Our singular focus is to help security experts, clinical professionals and high-tech developers solve real-world problems and issues.

 

PFC Flexible Circuits Ltd, a division of OSI Electronics, is seeking a Press Technician Operator for the afternoon shift. Must be able to train on the day shift for 2-3 months.


Responsibilities

  • Layup layers for material stackup (covercoat & stiffener) for flexible & rigid flex boards.
  • Set up, operate & maintain pressing machine.
  • Remove and clean panels and parts after pressing and move to next process.
  • Document job completion by completing Producation log book.
  • Maintain safe operation by obeying safety measures and regulations.
  • Material preparation (cutting covercoat & releasing materials).
  • Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork.
  • Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct.
  • It is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem.
  • Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business.
  • Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork.
  • Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct.
  • It is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem.
  • Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business.

Qualifications

  • Minimum high school diploma, years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
  • Preferred knowledge and experience in flexible or rigid board industry.
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to perform highly repetitive task.
  • Ability to perform data collection and keep accurate records consistently.
  • Ability to multitask with minimal of supervision.
  • Must be able to read, write and verbally communicate in English.

OSI Systems, Inc. has three operating divisions: (a) Security, providing security and inspection systems, turnkey security screening solutions and related services; (b) Healthcare, providing patient monitoring, diagnostic cardiology and anesthesia systems; and (c) Optoelectronics and Manufacturing, providing specialized electronic components and electronic manufacturing services for original equipment manufacturers with applications in the defense, aerospace, medical and industrial markets, among others.

title: Industrial Meat Cutter
description:
Maple Leaf Foods - Brandon

EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY


POSITION(S): Industrial Meat Cutter, NOC: 9462 (Permanent, Full Time)
LOCATION: 6355 Richmond Avenue East Brandon, Manitoba
STARTING WAGE: $15.70 – $22.20 /hour
  • + Production Bonus of up to $1.00/hour
  • + Attendance Bonus of up to $1.00/hour
  • + Further increases as per Collective Agreement
Maple Leaf Foods is a leading Canadian food processing company committed to delivering quality food products to consumers around the world. We are looking for Industrial Meat Cutters to join us at our Brandon, Manitoba plant.
POSITION SUMMARY:
Positions include slaughtering livestock and removing viscera and other inedible parts from carcasses, cutting pork for further cutting, processing and packaging. Positions are available in a variety of departments including Cut and Kill areas.
A 100% company paid Benefits package is provided including Major Medical, Dental, Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, as well as enrollment in the Maple Leaf Pension Plan.
Responsibilities:
  • Participate as part of a team in the processing of hogs to produce fresh and frozen product
  • Assist with various tasks in the department assigned
  • Keep up to production line speed
  • Most jobs in the Barn, Dressing, Cut and Packaging floors include assembly line work
  • Knife and other equipment use will be required
Required Skills:
  • Graduate of High school; post-secondary education is considered an asset
  • Two (2) years verifiable experience as a Butcher/Meat Cutter
  • Previous industrial / manufacturing plant experience is considered an asset
  • Ability to work in a wide range of environmental conditions from cool to warm and wet to dry
  • Ability to perform repetitive physical tasks and stand for long periods of time
  • Experience working with and committed to Good Manufacturing Practices is an asset
  • Experience in food manufacturing within a fast-paced environment is an asset
  • Comfortable being part of a multi-cultural, unionized environment
  • Must be committed to safe work practices
  • Must have good communication and interpersonal skills and be focused on continuous improvement
  • Use knives and other equipment to disassemble hog product for further processing
  • Ensure safe and hygienic practices are applied to all tasks performed as per Company policies
APPLICATION PROCESS:
If you are willing to step into a new and exciting career, please submit your resume and cover letter via https://careers.mapleleaffoods.com/email:

hrbrandon@mapleleaf.com



Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws. We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Production Operator - General Labourer
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

AGS Automotive Systems is a full-service automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and supply of complex high value-add automotive metal components, including in particular front and rear impact assemblies, principally for pick-ups and the heavy truck market. AGS offers full range of in-house capabilities including design and engineering, high tonnage metal stamping, light weighting solutions, innovative multi-material joining, high performance coatings including chrome plating and automated manufacturing processes.

AGS is committed to delivering high quality, high value products to our customers, who include several of North America's largest automakers. For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork.

Reporting to the Production Supervisor the Production Operator is responsible for, but not limited to, the unloading of parts at the end of the lines as well as the safe operation of manual stamping presses.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

Adheres to Technical System Procedures and Instructions.

Must be capable of repeated standing, bending and lifting.

Must have good communication skills and be capable of learning same as it applies to Statistical Process Control.

Load and unload parts from front and rear of press, placing finished parts in racks or bins.

Must be able to work and operate machinery in a safe and efficient manner. Ensure machine guards are in place and material handled in a safe manner. Must wear appropriate safety equipment as specified.

Inspection to be visual or as required with gauges, die models, etc. Charting may be required.

Always maintain a clean and organized work area.

Be able to detect faulty operation of equipment being used as well as faulty material.

Be able to adjust air and mechanical lockout devices and determine when dies need sharpening on manual stamping presses.

Complete any paperwork that pertains to the job.

As required, sort and rework defective material, repack and dispose of scrap.

Ensure the standards of Section 28 of the OHSA are met.

Perform other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Ability to read and write English.

Grade 12 Diploma preferred.

AGS Automotive Systems is proud to support the full inclusion of persons with disabilities as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At AGS we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request by contacting AGS Human Resources at

HR@agsautomotive.com

.

title: Quality Control Supervisor - Amico Clinical Solutions
description:
Quality Control Supervisor – Amico Clinical Solutions
Richmond Hill, Ontario

Are you looking for an opportunity to join a growing team with a strong reputation of success?

Amico Group of Companies is the market leader in the medical product industry with 9 manufacturing facilities employing over 750 people across North America. With innovative thinking and world-class technology, Amico is an organization where individuals are able to advance their careers and abilities.

We are currently looking to hire a team lead for our QC team!

Duties to include but not limited to:
  • Lead a team of QC Inspectors and manage workflows.
  • Oversee and monitor the inspection and testing of materials parts and products to ensure adherence to quality standards.
  • Determining equipment and protocols to be used in the testing process.
  • Work under direction of the Quality Manager as necessary.
  • Assist in formulating and revising quality control processes and policies.
  • Hands on inspections and recommending changes and improvements in specifications of materials, parts and products based on inspection results
  • Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • Successfully able to lead a team (previous leadership experience is highly desired).
  • Experience in manufacturing is an asset.
  • At least 3-5 years experience in Quality Control
  • Strong communication and time management skills.
  • Accuracy and attention to detail.
For more information, visit us at www.Amico.com.
 
*Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Production Supervisor - Welding
description:
Overview:

CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company. Driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground, which centers on Innovation, Sustainability and Productivity, the Company provides the strategic direction, R&D capabilities, and investments that enable the success of its five core Brands: Case IH, New Holland Agriculture and STEYR, supplying 360 ° agriculture applications from machines to implements and the digital technologies that enhance them; and CASE and New Holland Construction Equipment delivering a full lineup of construction products that make the industry more productive. Across a history spanning over two centuries, CNH Industrial has always been a pioneer in its sectors and continues to passionately innovate and drive customer efficiency and success, driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground. As a truly global company, CNH Industrialâ€™s 35,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world.

 

We are currently seeking a Production Supervisor - Welding to join our team in Saskatoon.   This position plans, coordinates and manages the effective utilization of people, materials, equipment and manufacturing processes within the Weld Department to meet safety, production schedule, quality, inventory, cost and delivery objectives as well as detecting any issues and striving to improve as needed.

Responsibilities:
  • Ensure a safe and clean work environment by adhering to and carrying out CNH Industrial safety programs, policies and regulations.
  • Lead all aspects of area for abnormalities from standard in personnel, material, machine and method and to take appropriate actions in a timely manner. This includes abnormalities in the standard processes, standard machine operation, product quality, and logistics management.
  • Supervises hourly employees in the production of parts, components and finished products to meet established efficiency targets and when missing these targets to apply appropriate mitigation plans.
  • Producing quality parts and finished goods that meet established quality goals.
  • Coordinates operating budgets and evaluates results to assure departmental objectives are achieved.
  • Maintain required levels of inventory and develop and implement corrective action plans when required.
  • Perform continuous improvement activities intended to improve safety, efficiency, quality and costs.
  • Develops and maintains positive employee relations within the guidelines of company policy.
  • Human resource activities such as employee selection, pay administration, employee counseling, training, performance management, and the administration of policies and agreements.
  • Monitors and coordinates the maintenance of equipment in the department to meet work schedule.
  • Administers and facilitates time standards in conjunction with Manufacturing Engineering to maintain fair and accurate standards throughout the department.
  • Implements company strategies and process changes at the operational level of the organization.
  • To lead and direct Kaizenâ€™s and Continuous Improvement projects.

The annual salary for this position is $63,000-91,000 (Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as skill, experience and qualification for the role.)

Qualifications:

The qualified candidate will have:  

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree plus 2 or more years of work experience in a manufacturing, agricultural or technical role OR
  • Associates degree plus 5 or more years of work experience in a manufacturing, agricultural or technical role OR
  • High school diploma /GED plus 7 or more years of work experience in a manufacturing, agricultural or technical role.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Previous supervisory/leadership experience
  • Multi-functional experience (Quality, Materials, Engineering, Human Resources, Safety)  
  • Experience participating and leading continuous improvement activities.
  • Proficient in the use of the  Microsoft Office suite of programs.

Compensation & Benefits: We offer competitive compensation with multiple benefit (medical/dental/vision) options to meet your individual needs. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include: paid parental leave, life insurance, volunteer time off and much more!

EEO:

US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here. CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.

 

If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please call 1-800-889-4422 option 1 and then option 5, or contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.

 

Read about our companyâ€™s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice.

 

Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Production Worker / Production Labourer (Hiring Bonus $1,000*)
description:
Hiring Bonus: total amount of $1,000*

  • $500 after completion of the Probationary Period (90 working days)
  • $500 after One Year of continuous employment (365 days)

*Note: New Hires referred by current employees of Tree Island will not be eligible for the Hiring Bonus.

 

What Youâ€™ll Do:

The Production Workers in our Operations Department act as junior Machine Operators within our heavy industrial manufacturing facility. They have an important role in providing verification of the quality of the product being produced and maintaining safety while operating equipment related to manufacturing, while supporting the wider site operations and senior Machine Operators.

Production Workers report to the Department Shift Supervisors or designate. The role involves significant physical exertions such as having to move up and down stairs, bend, lift, carry items, push and pull, gripping, etc. Safety is our # 1 priority.

Shift Premiums are provided for the required shift rotation. All applicants will be required to follow the shifts outlined below which rotate every 2 weeks:

Shift

Times*

Day Shift

6:00am to 2:30pm

Afternoon Shift

2:30pm to 10:30pm

Night Shift

10:30pm to 6:00am

*Note that some departments are on a staggered shift schedule due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Examples of Duties:

  • Operation of production machinery
  • Operation of an overhead crane
  • Operation of forklift
  • Assisting senior Machine Operators at assigned work stations (i.e. lifting / moving product up to 50 lbs.)
  • Warehouse / manufacturing work (i.e. moving up and down stairs, bending, lifting, and carrying items)
  • Production department housekeeping (i.e. sweeping, machine cleaning, shoveling, painting, vacuuming, etc.)
  • Participate in all site specific training as required
  • Perform other related duties to support the overall success of the operation

What Youâ€™ll Bring:

  • Physically fit, able to lift 50lbs
  • Able to follow all safe work practices
  • Must have CSA approved steel-toed safety boots with non-slip sole
  • Mechanically inclined
  • Able to follow direction
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Access to a readily available vehicle is preferred
  • Previous manufacturing experience in an industrial environment is considered an asset
  • Sit down counterbalance (SDCB) forklift experience is considered an asset
  • Overhead crane experience is considered an asset
  • Transportation of dangerous goods (TDG) is considered an asset

Whatâ€™s In It For You:

Starting Wage of $22.14 

Potential to earn between $31-$36 per hour

Comprehensive Benefits (Health, Vision, Dental)

Retirement â€“ Matching RRSP

Safety & Service Recognition Awards

About Tree Island:

Tree Island Steel Ltd.  (â€œTree Island Steelâ€ or the â€œCompanyâ€) is a publicly listed company whose shares are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol TSL.  Headquartered in Richmond, British Columbia, since 1964, Tree Island Steel, through its four operating facilities in Canada and the United States, produces wire products for a diverse range of industrial, residential construction, commercial construction, agricultural, and specialty applications.

Its products include bright wire; a broad array of fasteners, including packaged, collated and bulk nails; stucco reinforcing products; concrete reinforcing mesh; fencing and other fabricated wire products. The Company markets these products under the Tree IslandÂ®, HalsteelÂ®, True-SpecÂ®, K-LathÂ®, TI-WireÂ® and Tough StrandÂ® brand names. Tree Island Steel operates in Canada under Tree Island Industries Ltd and in the United States under Tree Island Wire (USA) Inc.

title: Production Control Planner
description:
Our client in Kitchener is currently looking for a Production Control Planner to join their team. The ideal candidate will have at least 7 years of experience in production control and have a full understanding of material requirements planning, bill of materials, inventory levels, purchase requisitions and job travels and customer requirements. Advanced computer skills and full understanding of ERP Software is a must. Please note this an onsite position. (NOT REMOTE).

Advantages
- 100% company paid benefits
- Flexible vacation
- Match pension contributions and Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan
- Annual performance and wage reviews

Responsibilities
- Review Engineering Change Requirements and Process Routing Requests for Material impact. and provide appropriate feedback
- Review and schedule all new sales orders in the system
- Review material requirements in MRP
- Create Job Traveler packages (requesting manufacturing process, ensure correct authorization) and ensure serialization is maintained as per procedures (when required)
- Issue Job Travelers, monitor and report on work in process, review and complete Job Travelers
- Create and maintains the production plan in MRP system based on available production capacity (Machine & labor)
- Coordinates client requirements with internal teams i.e. Procurement, Production, Engineering, Sales, and Quality
- Organize data and information for weekly production meetings
- Have an understanding and assist where needed with annual physical inventory and cycle counts
- Other duties as assigned
- Thorough understanding of materials management and product life cycles
- MRP Experience (Epicor MRP is considered an asset)

Qualifications
- Ability to pass an Enhanced criminal record check is a must
- Post-secondary education in Materials Management or demonstrated equivalent work experience
- Minimum 7 years’ progressive experience in production control
- Minimum 5 years’ experience in all aspects of Material Requirements Planning to include a complete understanding of the interaction between Bill of Materials, inventory levels, planning, purchase requisitions, Job Travelers and Customer requirements
- Understanding of machine shop/assembly environment
- Intermediate to advanced computer skills in, Microsoft office (Excel and Outlook), ERP Software
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Summary
If this is something you are interested in please submit your resume or email it to Denver Barr at denver.barr@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Materials Planner (3 positions) (Montreal Dorval, QC, CA)
description:
Materials Planner (3 positions)-MON18344

Description

BOMBARDIER

Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy efficeincy, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

In your role, you will:

- Coordinate the internal flow of material with expeditors and production employees, participate in the material planning process and provide a contingency plan for missing parts;

- Participate in daily morning meetings (DMM) and provide visibility to the natural team regarding planned and unplanned shortages;

- Manage and plan the work of internal suppliers;

- Prepare and validate documentation at different workstations;

- Participate in various improvement plans of internal material flow management with different stakeholders such as Operations, Engineering, Methods and Quality;

- Ensure improvement of business processes and solutions within the team to ensure on-time delivery of parts to production positions;

- Actively participate in improvement projects (ex. Achieving Excellence System, 5S, Lean manufacturing, cost reduction, etc.);

- Develop positive relationships with internal stakeholders.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

- You have a Bachelor’s degree in Operation Management, Logistics and/or Supply Chain Management (or equivalent) in a recognized University;

- You have 3 to 5 years of working experience in operations or logistics in a manufacturing environment;

- You have the ability to work with minimum supervision, be a team player, self-motivated, and demonstrate initiative as well as leadership, and good interpersonal skills;

- You are able to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities;

- You have good organizational & planning skills;

- You have excellent communication skills in French and English (written and oral);

- You are proficient with the Microsoft Office suite.

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigation status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.

Whether your candidacy is moving on to the next step of the hiring process or not, we will keep you informed by email or by phone.

Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Your ideas move people.

title: Fiber-Electronics Assembler
description:
In this role, the successful candidate will assembly and test fiber optic sensor assemblies. Assembly and test fiber optic feed thru assemblies, assembly and test box build assemblies, Assembly and test air gap sensor assemblies, pack and ship finished product.









+ With the use of a Microscopic, Manufacture and alignment of electronic-optical assemblies according to Manufacturing Work Instructions



+ Builds Fiber-Optic assemblies using fine materials, such as; optical fibers, lenses, glass tubes, metal parts, epoxy adhesives, and other related materials.



+ Preparation of Fiber-Optic Cable and add Terminations when Required



+ Configure & Test Electronic/Fiber-Optic Modules.



+ Able to follow all work instructions and procedures



+ Maintains the working environment in clean and proper arrangement.



+ Adherence to departmental and company policies and procedures. Including the 5 “S” Principles, ISO, misc. quality system procedures



+ Carry out other miscellaneous duties as may be assigned by Management




The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:





+ Minimum high school diploma



+ Must be fluent in English.



+ Working knowledge of Microsoft office (Word, excel outlook ETC)



+ Read and understand drawing and assembly procedures



+ General mechanical aptitude/assembly experience is an asset.



+ Able to lift 50 lbs.



+ 2 years of experience in a Fiber Optic assembly/test role would be preferred but is not required.




Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.



We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.



We are a diverse team 17,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.



At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference.



At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone.



At Fortive, we believe in growth. We’re honest about what’s working and what isn’t, and we never stop improving and innovating.



Fortive: For you, for us, for growth.


QUALITROL (https://www.qualitrolcorp.com/) manufactures monitoring and protection devices for high value electrical assets and OEM manufacturing companies. Established in 1945, QUALITROL produces thousands of different types of products on demand and customized to meet our individual customers’ needs. We are the largest and most trusted global leader for partial discharge monitoring, asset protection equipment and information products across power generation, transmission, and distribution. At Qualitrol, we are redefining condition-based monitoring.







Excellent Pay and Benefits!



Qualitrol employees receive competitive Salaries, great Healthcare benefits, Pension Plan with company contributions, generous vacation/sickness plans, Life Insurance and more. We are a family friendly workplace with Flexible Working Hours, and some remote, work from home opportunities. We have annual reviews and career development planning to help get you to the next level in your career.



You will love working with colleagues who have a genuine desire to innovate and seek out complicated problems. We believe in absolute inclusion and diversity. Qualitrol associates enjoy the autonomy, breadth of responsibility, and creativity that are typical in a medium-sized company, while sharing resources, standard methodologies, and growth opportunities that are found in a Fortune 500 company like Fortive.

title: Quality Control Technician
description:
Inland Aggregatesis currently looking for a responsible, safe, and dependable Quality Control Technician - Seasonalto join our local team in Villeneuve, AB. As a QC Technician you will be responsible for aggregate sampling and testing as well as process control as part of the production team ensuring appropriate product quality.

Who We Are:

Inland Aggregates is part of the Lehigh Hanson group of companies. Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.

With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects.

We offer:
  • Secure, long-term employment
  • Competitive wage and benefits package
  • Training and development
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • OT available
What You Will Get to Do:
  • Sample on-site aggregate at various stages of production
  • Test raw materials according to specification
  • Calibrate, clean and maintain production tools and testing equipment
  • Record and report test results to management
  • Sample aggregate shipments
  • Work in conjunction with production personnel to evaluate problems with quality
  • Position is based out of Villeneuve but will also work out of remote locations periodically to support the mobile plant QC requirements & special projects
  • Back-up for scale staff
  • Perform drone survey's of stockpiles and mining areas
Who We Are Looking For:
  • 2 years post secondary or relevant experience
  • Clean Class 5 drivers license
  • Quality control, manufacturing, or production experience is an asset
  • Demonstrated basic math skills
  • Knowledge of software Excel and Auto CAD will be considered an asset
  • Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team
  • Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision
  • Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions
  • In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to50 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain
  • Ability to work a flexible work schedule including different shifts and overtime when needed

title: Production Planner
company: The Wohl Group - Recruitment Made Easy!
description:
The Production Planner is a critical member of our Operations team and is responsible for: planning, scheduling, coordinating, and monitoring Circuit Card Assemblies (CCAs) and box assemblies through the complete production cycle

  • This position reports directly to the Operations Leader
  • Success in the role includes a positive, proactive approach to daily work along with strong communication and organizational skills.
  • Act as a “gatekeeper” for Operations to ensure adherence to standard procedures regarding job release
  • Convert planned supply orders to executable work order/jobs per the ERP/MRP planning – maximum 2 weeks before start date for both CCA and Final Assembly production
  • Plan and create Daily/weekly/monthly production schedules for each area of the CCA operation (SMT, TH, CCA Final Assembly) to ensure optimum flow of jobs through the CCA process as an input to the Tier 1 and Tier 2 processes
  • Follow “Clear to Release”(no part shortages) requirements for all daily production planning
  • Monitor critical process bottlenecks and adjust job scheduling (Batch Sizes) to minimize excess WIP levels
  • Identify and recommend feasible solutions to plan scheduling issues and bottlenecks
  • Primary point of contact for all CCA manufacturing related ECO’s – responsible for all updates to work orders/jobs and finished goods
  • Generate, track and distribute standardized reports, both internal and external for CCA product scheduling: 1) On time to start, 2) On time shipment – delivery to customer and/or delivery to final assembly cell, 3) Aged work order/job tracking
  • Timely forward flushing of inventory during job production
  • Oversee and facilitate daily production scheduling meetings, support planning for T1/T2 boards with CCA Team Leaders.
  • Make recommendations to Planners on order changes based on inventory availability and capacity constraints
Salary Range: $75-90k

***Only qualified candidates who meet all of the requirements will be contacted for interviews. Thank you and good luck with your search.

title: Mechanical Quality Assurance Inspector
description:
Your Employer

Englobe has more than 2,900 employees who, on a daily basis, care about the environment, contribute to sustainable engineering projects, process soil and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

Englobe is currently looking for an On-Site Mechanical Quality Assurance Inspector to join its turbine-generator manufacturing quality department. The position offered is temporary and the site location is in British Columbia (Site C project).

The Site C project is the biggest hydroelectric generating station currently under construction in Canada. The project will be completed in 2024. It is located 7 kilometers from Fort St-John (BC).

The candidate will stay in camp on-site and will be working on turnaround schedules (generally 14/7).


Your Contribution

As an on-site Inspector in mechanical discipline will be responsible for the following: 

  • Conducting routine quality surveillance of the contractor’s production on-site, including witnessing the contractor’s inspection and testing activities established in the inspection and test plans to verify that the contractor’s quality control is effective, and the work meets the specification requirements.
  • Identifying and raising non-conformity reports, reviewing contractor’s non-conformity reports and verifying corrective actions.
  • Reviewing quality records and release hold points established in the inspection and test plans.
  • Reviewing contractor’s quality reports.
  • Preparing daily reports summarizing contractor’s quality performance and quality issues.
  • Performing quality surveillance of hydropower generating station mechanical equipment installation including turbines, hydraulic gates, hoists, cranes, fire protection and detection systems, water treatment and distribution systems, wastewater systems, oil water separation systems, compressed air systems, heating ventilation and cooling systems, piping systems, plumbing systems and instrumentation.
  • Reviewing contractor’s special procedures and processes including alignment of rotating equipment, on-site machining of embedded steel parts, coatings, welding, bolting, Victaulic grooving and assembly, passivation, hydrostatic pressure testing and non-destructive examination.
  • Witnessing assemblies and testing of installed mechanical equipment as established in the inspection and test plans.


Your Profile

  • High school, college, technologist diploma or mechanical engineering degree or any other experience deemed equivalent;
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar position;
  • Knowledge of QA/QC activities;
  • Possess a valid driver's license;
  • Bilingualism, French and English;
  • Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite;
  • Knowledge of mechanically welded structure;
  • Knowledge of geometric tolerancing;
  • Knowledge of machining (asset);

title: Associate - Quality Control
description:
We are seeking a Quality Control Associate. In this role, you will have responsibility for maintaining a Quality Plan with our customers to cover an inspection process of materials and/or products for conformance to specifications. You will also has responsibility of quality control processes, covering support for customers’ non-conformity investigation and solution, as well production processes, including the eventual support to customers related to testing techniques


Responsibilities:


Description:


+ Obtain the quality control requirements based on customer's documents, as well applicable to industry standards, to assure the quality of products the first time.

+ Verify product/material meets requirements of CSA specifications and customer’s unique specifications. Compares products with work order and drawing for conformance.

+ Maintain all testing/calibration of equipment.

+ Maintain up-to-date records of required third party inspections and calibrations of testing equipment.

+ Examine product/material for defects. Reject defective product/materials and records type of defect.

+ Monitor performance in required areas and according to agreed-upon standards.

+ Work with customers and suppliers where quality issues are impacted and/or affected.

+ Process sales orders and pulls inventory. Package and protect product, as required.

+ Maintain database (MS Excel).

+ Develop/improve internal and external processes and procedures.

+ Host internal and external audits to meet ISO 9001 std.

+ Other duties and tasks, as assigned


Qualifications:


+ High School Degree or Equivalent required; Bachelors Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering preferred

+ 2+ years of industry experience preferred

+ 2+ years of quality assurance / control experience preferred

+ ISO 9001 Auditor experience preferred

+ Working knowledge of a computer-based ERP systems preferred

+ Working knowledge of quality management systems preferred

+ Knowledge of 6 Sigma and or Lean Manufacturing Principals preferred

+ Strong working knowledge of medium and high voltage electrical components preferred

+ Ability to read and interpret drawings, datasheets and technical documentation

+ Ability read test reports and make appropriate and accurate recommendations

+ Excellent knowledge of MS Office (e.g. Excel, Word, Outlook)

+ Excellent English written and oral communication skills

+ Demonstrated experience knowledge of Supply Chain processes, such as Sales and Operations Planning, MRP, Forecasting, Demand and Supply Planning, Indirect Procurement, Materials Management and Logistics.

+ Experience with supply chain applications for Planning, Inventory Optimization and Network Design (Blue Yonder, JDC, Tools Group, O9, Oracle, SAP, SAS, APO)

+ Excellent communication and support skills. Ability to explain complex concepts and analytics to non-technical audience. Translate user requirements into actionable data.

+ Aptitude for blending quantitative and qualitative data to tell relevant story

+ Excellent multi-tasking skills, ability to prioritize and handle many projects at once with ever shifting priorities and deadlines with ability to track and manage progress.

+ A flexible, dynamic, self-demanding and proactive individual; able to motivate him/herself and others; easily accepts constructive input from others and can lead cross functional teams to drive for best results in environment with competing objectives.


_EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER_

_WESCO International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates ("WESCO"), is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of WESCO to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination._

title: Quality Inspector
description:
TRIGO Global Quality Solutions has several immediate openings for Quality Inspectors on Day, Afternoon and Night shifts in Windsor, ON.

Overall Purpose of the Quality Inspector

Provide Quality services and support for all missions assigned to a manufacturing or warehouse site while ensuring a healthy and safe work environment.

Reports to

Site Supervisor/Site Leaders

Responsibilities

(To include but not limited to the following)

Client Relationship & Business Development

  • Act as an impartial third party between the production source and the customer facility to ensure the product meets set criteria

Operations

  • Check/inspect manufactured parts or products for defects
  • Read and follow work instructions and general processes
  • Use measuring or testing equipment as needed
  • Ensure products meet quality standards
  • Display excellent customer service
  • Must comply with local and company Health & Safety legislation, laws, and policies

Organization & Management

  • Collect and record data

Technical

  • Utilize company portal for time recording and policy acknowledgements

Other

  • Any other duties as assigned

Knowledge, skills, abilities

Hard skills

  • Must be able to speak and read in the English language
  • Good communications skills
  • Must be able to multi-task
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to handle sensitive and confidential material
  • Ability lift /move 50 pounds
  • Must have reliable transportation

Values & attitudes

Global team spirit

  • Team player
  • Caring for people
  • Open-minded

Excellence

  • Reactive
  • Resilient to pressure
  • Rigorous

Customer focus

  • Client oriented
  • Reliable & trustworthy
  • Flexible

Initiative

  • Autonomous
  • Innovative
  • Daring

Work experience

  • No experience necessary
  • Ability to read blueprints a plus

Education background

  • High School Diploma or Equivalent recommended or comparable work experience

About TRIGO Global Quality Solutions

Founded in 1997, TRIGO is a multinational company providing operational Quality Management solutions for the manufacturing sector, especially in the automotive and aerospace industries. With a team of more than ten thousand professionals present in 20+ countries across 4 continents, TRIGO offers a comprehensive portfolio of Quality Assurance services ranging from inspection to expert auditing, consulting and training.

The unrivaled expertise, industrial mindset and extensive global footprint that TRIGO has built up over the last 3 decades has made TRIGO the leading quality solutions provider using the latest innovative and reliable digital systems and standard processes, delivering results in the most demanding industries. TRIGO has recently started to expand its clientele by offering quality services to the medical, chemical and food industries.

TRIGO Global Quality Solutions is committed to the core values of equal employment opportunity. We are committed to treating people fairly, and with respect and dignity. We offer employment opportunities based upon an individual's qualifications and performance, free from discrimination or harassment because of race, ancestry, place of origin, ethnic origin, color, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, family status, and disability.

title: Production Line Worker/Operator
description:
Looking for a great place to enhance your career?  A place where a vibrant culture means empowerment, teamwork and a passion for what you do? Premier Tech is the place to be! 

Premier Tech Growers and Consumers is currently seeking various equipment operators.

Beingan operator in our team means operating a forklift and/or operating light or automatic machinery in a safe and efficient manner to facilitate the screening process of our raw materials.

BEING AN OPERATOR WITH PREMIER TECH MEANS:

  • Performing various manual labour tasks involved in the bagging of horticultural products.
  • Working in a production facility operating forklifts and/or operating light or automatic machinery.
  • Working on different production lines and perform different tasks to support production.
  • Observing safe material loading, handling and unloading methods.
  • Working inside and outside of the facility moving palletized material.
  • Picking order for customers.
  • Loading and unloading trucks.
  • Using different equipment such as automated fillers, scales, sealers, box tapers and more.
  • And of course, working safely every day, along with keeping the safety of others at the forefront!

IS THIS ROLE FOR YOU?

  • You’re a true team player, who places a high value on safety.
  • You enjoy working in outdoor and indoor areas, in a fast-paced environment.
  • Thanks to your good shape, you enjoy performing manual work with repetitive motions and occasional lifting items.
  • If you have experience in a manufacturing environment, it’s an asset.
  • You have a valid forklift operator certificate or are willing to obtain one.

YOUR FUTURE WORK ENVIRONMENT:

  • You will be located in our plant in St-Isidore, 40 minutes away from Montreal or 40 minutes away from Ottawa: goodbye traffic jams!
  • This is your chance to combine a career in an international company while enjoying the quality of life offered by the region. No need to choose between quality of life and career! You can have it all!

Being a Premier Tech team member means playing with a global and diverse team. We celebrate team wins, big and small, by valuing the role that everyone has played in it.

If you are ready to take on this exciting opportunity, please bring your drive, ambition and talent to Premier Tech, and let’s partner together!

title: Forklift & Baler Operator
description:
Job Summary:
Seaside is looking to hire a Forklift/Baler Operator to help with our material handling and paper recycling. The primary responsibility is to move raw goods to machine centers, finished goods away to be shipped, as well as move paper from bins into a compacting machine. Secondary responsibilities include helping out various areas of the production facility in a general laborer capacity. This can include but is not limited to strapping or boxing of product, shrink wrapping and clean up.
 
Skills and Qualifications:
  • Must have 1 year of Forklift experience
  • Physically able to stand for long periods and comfortably lift 30-40 lbs repeatedly.
  • Comfortable reaching from shoulder height and above repeatedly.
  • Works well cooperatively with others.
  • Initiative to stay busy and to help others during slow periods.
  • Reasonable English speaking and comprehension for understanding instructions and safety orientation.
  • CSA-approved steel-toed boots are required.
 
Shift:  Friday, Saturday, Sunday & Monday 8:00-6:30 (4 X 10-hour shifts. 40 hours per week averaged over 4 days)
 
Compensation:
  • $21 per hour starting wage
  • Benefits after 3 months

Interview invitations will be sent by EMAIL!
Please ensure the email you provide is correct. Please make sure you check your email & spam folders regularly after applying. We thank all interested candidates but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.




    About Seaside Paper Products:

    For more than 40 years, Seaside Paper Products has been leading the industry as an innovative custom converter of specialty paper products for a diverse range of industries across North America. Seaside Paper operates from a 90,000-square-foot state-of-the-art manufacturing facility located in Delta, BC.*No Recruitment or Placement Agency calls please*

title: Assembly & General Laborer
description:
Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is looking to hire an Assembly/General Labour ASAP!
Job Description:
  • Assemble parts, general clean up, inventory counts, deliveries and pickups as needed. Immediate start!
  • Hours: 8-4:30 pm Mon-Fri.
  • High-pressure team environment.

Company Description:
  • Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is a locally owned manufacturing and distribution company operating out of Edmonton, Alberta since 1966.
  • We manufacture and distribute products for oilfield production, pipeline maintenance, construction and gas, and water distribution.
  • We have an in-house engineering department and a full-service manufacturing facility that enables us to respond efficiently to customer and industry needs.

Habits:
  • Adherence to Plainsman Mfg quality standards.
  • Thoroughness and pride at ANY task assigned by supervisor.
  • Adhere to the safety program.
  • Keep work area tidy and organized.
  • Initiate and complete small projects/improvements.

Skills or Experience Requirements:
  • *Must have mechanical aptitude.
  • High School Diploma or student.
  • Ability to read and write English.
  • Physically able.
  • Must have a valid driver's license.
  • Must be able to quickly learn and be willing to ask.
  • Follow written and verbal procedures as well as be able to clearly document their own work.
  • Able to prioritize and make decisions using lean, risk, customer needs, and Plainsman core values.
  • Work with a team (conflict resolution, collaboration).
  • Able to assemble multiple Plainsman product categories without supervision.
  • Troubleshoot small issues and make corrections.

title: Senior Weld Manufacturing Engineer
description:
Overview:

CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company. Driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground, which centers on Innovation, Sustainability and Productivity, the Company provides the strategic direction, R&D capabilities, and investments that enable the success of its five core Brands: Case IH, New Holland Agriculture and STEYR, supplying 360 ° agriculture applications from machines to implements and the digital technologies that enhance them; and CASE and New Holland Construction Equipment delivering a full lineup of construction products that make the industry more productive. Across a history spanning over two centuries, CNH Industrial has always been a pioneer in its sectors and continues to passionately innovate and drive customer efficiency and success, driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground. As a truly global company, CNH Industrialâ€™s 35,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world.

 

We are actively seeking a Senior Weld Manufacturing Engineer to join our team in Saskatoon.   Working with the Manufacturing Engineering Manager, this position is responsible for improving manufacturing efficiency, cost, product quality, and worker safety by analyzing current methods, new methods, new technologies and cost reduction activities in the area of Welding.

Responsibilities:

Position Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for analyzing and providing technical support of the current Manufacturing system in order to provide: safe methods, optimal production capabilities, cost reduction opportunities, process control methods and plans, and manufacturing layouts.
  • Analyzes, documents and provides recommendations for individual part or process failures from a technical and operations standpoint.
  • Analyzes information and prepares reports for management review in such areas as capital budgets and capital acquisition requests.
  • Designing and developing a wide range of welding systems.
  • Using the latest welding techniques like shielded metal arc welding, gas metal arc welding, and flux-cored arc welding, when required
  • Support product engineers to define welding machining and tooling; choose welding materials, set up welding machines and develop welding procedures for new projects
  • Continuously improve existing welding processes for enhancing welding efficiency and reducing downtime
  • Work on critical welding processes to solve welding quality problems
  • Support quality engineers to investigate the root cause of weld quality issues from customers and develop corrective action plans
  • Analyzing engineering blueprints and designs for welding requirements
  • Reviewing proper implementation of welding procedures
  • Explaining metal properties to Welders to ensure accurate utilization of welding techniques
  • Works with operators, vendors and tool designers to develop tooling designs and actual tools within provided quality and cost constraints. When assigned they are also responsible for implementing the tooling with the operators.
  • May accumulate, develop and apply data for purposes of establishing labor standards on process data, including attaching routings in workflow, and establishing costs of engineering changes and introductions.
  • Responsible for providing technical support to install new systems and capital equipment on time, within cost constraints, established procedures and the production forecast.
  • Provides assistance to the plant in all areas related to quality documentation and/or ISO compliance where applicable.

The annual salary range for this role is $84,000-$129,000 (Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as skill, experience and qualification for the role.)

Qualifications:

The qualified candidate will have:

  • Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering with emphasis in mechanical, industrial, manufacturing, or welding disciplines plus a minimum of six years working experience in welding in manufacturing settings.
  • High school diploma/GED plus 11 or more years of experience in welding in a manufacturing setting will be considered in lieu of Bachelor's degree.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Experience conducting analysis of weld quality through sectioning and cut & etch process to determine penetration, leg lengths etc.
  • Able to conduct weld training/auditing to ensure accurate gun angle, weld size, machine parameters and defect free production for defects such as undercut, porosity, burn-through etc.)

Compensation & Benefits: We offer competitive compensation with multiple benefit (medical/dental/vision) options to meet your individual needs. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include: paid parental leave, life insurance, volunteer time off and much more!

EEO:

US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here. CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.

 

If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please call 1-800-889-4422 option 1 and then option 5, or contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.

 

Read about our companyâ€™s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice.

 

Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Forklift Operator
description:
Are you hungry to innovate? To do things differently? To work with a company that's real, thoughtful and very forward-thinking?

Meet Riverside. We are an organic, “better for you” snack company, manufacturing award-winning, nutritious, allergen-free snacks. Your kids know us as MadeGood, tasty school-safe snacks. Your workout buddies grab GoodTo Go Keto certified bars. And your pup begs for a Cookie Pal treat, our human-grade, vegan dog treats.

At Riverside, we make delicious snacks that are good in every way. From our ingredients to our manufacturing practices, we've raised every bar on every aspect. We're friendly and focused on creating foods that are good for you and good to the planet as well. Riverside Natural Foods is B-Corp certified, Triple-Bottom Line, Zero Waste, and Canadian owned and operated.

Come work with a new Canadian leader! We value teamwork, humility, respect, ownership, adaptability, passion and fun. Our amazing culture is reflected in our recent employee engagement score of 92%!

You can learn more about us at www.riversidenaturalfoods.com

We continue to grow and today are looking for a committed, talented, star to join our team as our Forklift Operator.

Job Description

Reporting to the Warehouse Supervisor, this person will be responsible for the successful operation of the night shift Warehouse teams in our allergen free facilities.

Position Summary/Objective: 

The Forklift Operator primary responsibility is for the accurate and timely loading and offloading of trailers as per the shipping and receiving SOPs. Picking and Staging of raw materials & packaging as per daily picklists. Wrapping of pallets, moving of equipment and any odd jobs as required by the Warehouse supervisor or lead hand. Always follow the Warehouse SOPs and operate in a safe and responsible manner.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Demonstrate and uphold Riverside's core values
  • Operate equipment, verify inventory and update and scan to system
  • Support co-workers, identify unsafe practices or safety violations and escalate as required
  • Receive goods based on existing SOP's, making judgements on whether a shipment meets quality standards escalate as required
  • Communicate effectively with co-workers and drivers
  • Ability to work as a TEAM with production coordinating replenishment and picking.
  • Consistently demonstrates PASSION in evaluating continuous improvement opportunities and safety
  • Operating safely in a fast-paced environment. Accurate picking and shipping, verifying paperwork
  • Occasional support for the team offloading and picking
  • Constant standing and walking with lifting and packing and sorting as required
  • Some computer work including operating scanners and material handling equipment.
  • Must always adhere to the company's Health and Safety and GMP policies and procedures  
  • Keeps the work atmosphere FUN by keeping it light and welcoming
  • Other duties as assigned

KEY Objectives:

  • Pallets picked/ received / moved
  • Loading / Picking errors
  • Material Handling Accuracy

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS:

  • 1-3 years of experience in a similar role
  • Experience in the Food industry preferred
  • Previous experience with ERP systems & RF scanning (SAP considered an asset).
  • Experienced with both reach and counterbalance a must.

REQUIRED SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:

  • Proven proficiency in material handling as well as picking orders & receiving
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills, self-starter with a high level of initiative and ADAPTABILITY
  • Demonstrates HUMILITY throughout the company on a daily basis
  • Basic MS Office skills
  • Strong interpersonal and OWNERSHIP skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • High attention to detail
  • The ability to work cooperatively in a team environment
  • Ability to work effectively under minimal supervision
  • Strong time management skills with an ability to work in an environment with shifting priorities
  • Willingness to learn and teach others, be self-directed and motivated
  • Strong aptitude and inclination to learn
  • Candidate must be business, results and values oriented, work as part of a functional team and be an exceptional fit with our Riverside Natural Foods Ltd. values.
  • Aptitude to exhibit, RESPECT and protect Riverside's Core Values in a changing environment 

How to Apply:

If you have the commitment to excellence, the energy, the attitude and experience we need, then please submit your resume to careers(AT)riversidenaturals.com with the subject line Forklift Operator or click the apply button!

Riverside Natural Foods is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you have a disability and require accommodation in the interview process, please let us know when you apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to volume, please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Depending on the nature of the role, you may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by your hire date to be eligible to start the role. In this case, proof of vaccination will be required by your start date. Riverside will consider and review accommodation requests based on protected human rights grounds for qualified candidates.
