title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
The Opportunity | Manufacturing Engineer


Under general direction, performs various analyses, design and/or assembly related to manufacturing or industrial engineering projects. Develops, implements, maintains methods, operation sequence, and processes in the manufacture or fabrication of parts, components, sub-assemblies and final assemblies. Interfaces with design engineering in coordinating the release of new products. Estimates manufacturing cost, determines time standards and makes recommendations for tooling and process requirements of new or existing product lines. Maintains records and reporting systems for coordination of manufacturing operations.


Your Challenge


+ Establishes Manufacturing process flow and work instruction. Create and update manufacturing standard procedure, which defines specific manufacturing processes

+ Performs various operational or methods analyses related to labor standards and reviews product/project flow data, equipment and labor requirements for use in conducting manufacturing operations, increasing productivity and reducing production unit cost

+ Assists in the evaluation of engineering changes and/or other specifications requirements and performs as technical liaison with other engineering personnel such as program management, finance, design, quality, procurement, inspection, and production

+ May interface with design engineering in coordinating the release of new products and conduct review of engineering drawings prior to release

+ Solid modelling and drawing creation - Solidworks

+ Perform product troubleshooting and root cause and corrective action investigations

+ Perform assembly and test work as required to support production


Your Expertise


+ Bachelor's Degree, Manufacturing/Industrial Engineering or equivalent

+ 3 years' experience in a mechanical assembly environment

+ Knowledge of basic electronic and mechanical assembly principles

+ Solidworks tool design and familiarity is desired

+ Ability to read and understand drawings and specification, and MS Office suite or products


This position may require exposure to export-controlled information and subject to additional security screening. In the event information provided during the security screening reveals ineligibility to access export-controlled information, any offer of employment may be reconsidered or withdrawn.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition (TA_COE@curtisswright.com) and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

title: Welder
description:
Welder
Waterloo, ON (north)
Manufacturing/Fabrication
Competitive Hourly Rate and Benefits
Day and Afternoon shifts available

Our client, a national telecom services provider is currently looking for Welders for their facility north of Waterloo.

Qualifications:
  • 4+ years experience as a fabrication welder working with various metals
  • Ability to read technical documents/drawings, as well as identifying weld symbols
  • Pipe Fitter experience is an asset
  • CWB FCAW certified (if not, we will help you get certified)
  • Excellent English skills, both oral and written
  • You excel working in a team environment and bring a positive attitude
  • You are in good physical condition
  • Clean Drivers Abstract

About this role:
  • Plasma cutting & welding
  • Some fitting, using Jigs & Fixtures
  • Checking and fitting flange/Plate /ports and antenna mounts
  • Follow safe work practices and procedure

All qualified candidates are invited to apply.

Keywords: Kitchener, Welder/Pipefitter, Elmira, Fabrication welder, Fergus, Guelph, Arthur, Milverton, Cambridge, Palmerston, Ayr, Listowel, Tavistock, Acton, Erin, Toronto, Brampton, Mount Forest

title: Production Associate
description:
Starting Rate $18.00 Per Hour before shift differential
TC Transcontinental is a leader in flexible packaging in North America, and Canada’s largest printer.  Our strong family values, entrepreneurial spirit and long-term vision have always been at the heart of our success.  TC Transcontinental Packaging brings a distinctive blend of science, technology, and art together to create flexible packaging that preserves our customers' products and accentuates their brands on the store shelf. The Packaging sector has over 4,000 employees and 29 production facilities worldwide. We specialize in extrusion, lamination, flexographic printing and converting of plastic and paper products. You will join a high-performing team that is passionate about creating the perfect package, no matter what industry.

About this opportunity
This position is responsible for assisting manufacturing areas with packaging orders correctly, ensuring all materials are available, and following all quality check requirements and HACCP/SQF procedures. It is an entry level position that is the first step in a line of potential progression where there are abundant opportunities to move into higher level positions currently paying up to $31.68/hour.

What you will do
  • Assist Slitter Operators with staging production materials; being available to move product in a manner that is safe and in keeping with quality/food safety standards
  • Be vigilant - monitor for quality 
  • Maintain good housekeeping in all work areas
  • Become an expert and train new employees
  • Assist with troubleshooting minor machine problems
What you have to offer
  • Manufacturing experience 
  • Willing and able to work 7am-3pm, 3pm-11pm or 11pm-7am shifts with OT as needed
  • Detail oriented and able to read, write and measure using a tape or ruler
  • Basic computer capabilities 
  • Able to efficiently handle a variety of tasks with minimal supervision 
  • Able to lift up to 50 pounds and walk/stand for extended periods of time
  • Successful pre-employment background and reference check, physical and drug testing 
What we have to offer
  • Opportunity to be part of a dynamic and highly motivated work environment where you can develop your potential and launch an exciting career
  • A competitive compensation package and benefits that fit your family needs
  • 401k with 50% matching dollars (of first 6% contribution) 100% vested upon participation (after 30 days of work)
  • 8 hours work shifts with paid breaks and lunch periods
Learn more about us
https://www.facebook.com/tc.transcontinental/
https://www.youtube.com/user/1Transcontinental
#INDUS
Talent@tc.tc

title: Packers and Machine Operators
description:
Large manufacturing company with multiple locations requires

Packers and Machine Operators

High wages and good benefits :

Pay rate 23-25 per hour
40 hours per week / shift work


The employer will also support Immigration process for the right Candidates

Duties :
  • Set up and operate machine tools to perform repetitive machining operations, such as turning, milling, drilling, boring, planing, honing, broaching, grinding or other machining operations
  • Verify dimensions of parts machined using micrometers, callipers and other precision measuring instruments
  • Prepare etching solution and immerse metal parts or workpiece in etching solution to remove unwanted portions
  • Perform routine maintenance on equipment and machinery
  • May enter codes specifying speed, feed and cut of the toolpath for computer numerical controlled (CNC) machine tools.
Some experience required / will train the right candidates

title: Manual Machinist
description:
Manual Machinist

Under general supervision, performs routine and semi-routine assignment planning, layout, set up, operating and making tool adjustments for various types of manual machines and shop equipment, general supervision, works from blueprints, process sheets and sketches to perform production tasks, which may include the cutting and shaping of metal to precision dimensions. May communicate directly with engineers to understand the purpose of a part assembly. Checks and inspects machining operations against specified tolerances. May identify and repair minor machine malfunctions.



Location: Edmonton, AB



Your Challenge:


* Manufacture and inspect detailed parts and tools from blueprints, sketches, drawings and verbal instructions
* Extensive lathe 4-jaw use with special attention to concentricity and parallelism
* Knowledge of manual milling, radial arm drill, and other manual machining tools as required.
* Machining parts from castings and/or bar stock from a variety of materials including stainless steel, carbon steel, exotic alloys, plastics, and hard facing (Stellite).
* Machining repair of valve and components for daily repairs as well as rush shutdowns
* Meeting company established safety, quality, and productivity goals
* Other duties as required.

Your Expertise:


* 2-3 years of manual machining experience
* Previous experience manufacturing and repairing valve components is an asset
* High School diploma or equivalent required.
* Ability to read and interpret process worksheets, inspect parts and maintain acceptable quality and efficiency level.

Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request. #IND

title: Machine Operator (Second Shift) - Langley, BC
description:
Overview:

Master Halco, North Americaâ€™s leading manufacturer/distributor of fencing and perimeter security products is seeking an experienced Machine Operator to work at our Langley, British Columbia manufacturing facility.

This position will work under limited supervision operating moderately complex equipment in the continuous-operation manufacturing of strand wire into woven chain link fence.

The associate will be responsible for the set-up and operation of one or more weaving machines, inspecting for quality, and troubleshooting problems.

The Machine Operator will complete training to become a weaving machine operator for 2nd Shift (Monday - Friday from 1:30PM to 10PM).  
Qualified candidates must live within a reasonable commute to Langley, BC.

 

Working With Us Has Its Rewards:

  • Competitive hourly wage at $25+ per hour (CAD) plus $1 shift differential
  • Monday through Friday: 1:30PM to 10PM
  • Extended Healthcare
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan
  • Life Insurance
  • Generous paid-time off package and more!
  • Eligible for a wage progression plan with pay increases every 6 months over a 3 year period.

 

Master Halco offers advancement opportunities at every level. We are always looking for people with the drive to learn and determination to succeed.

 

This is a very exciting time to join our company. We are continuing to grow, introducing new products, making technological investments, and implementing innovative marketing strategies.

We are also focused on our people -- our most important resource.

At Master Halco, we believe in transparency, open communication, and rewarding success with a path to fully develop your potential while building a career.

Responsibilities:

â€¢ Set-up weaving machine for correct height and selvage of wire fabric and threads machine with wire ends.
â€¢ Using verbal instructions or manufacturing order forms, retrieves specific gauge and finish of raw material with forklift.
â€¢ Starts, stops and monitors weaving operation on multiple weaving machines.
â€¢ Corrects minor problems such as tangles and misweaves and reports major problems to Supervisor or maintenance dept.
â€¢ Performs visual inspection on finished material and material in-process for misweaves, poor quality raw material, etc.
â€¢ Monitors roll length counter and removes woven wire from take-up roll.
â€¢ Drive forklift to move wire to staging area.

Qualifications:
  • Able to physically lift 75+ lbs. regularly
  • Desired experience with metal forming machines such as extrusion presses and/or CNC.
  • Ability to work overtime (including weekends) as needed

If you enjoy a fast-paced work environment and the opportunity to challenge your mechanical skills on our manufacturing equipment, this is the right place for you!

title: Quality Control Technician
description:
Company Description

Do you want a position that is poised for career progression? Have you ever wanted to work for a two time winning Canada's top 50 best managed company?  Do you want to experience a new plant build and put your mark from day 1?

If you answered yes, then Techo-Bloc is your next career move. We are opening a new production facility in Ayr, Ontario.  We are looking for a Quality Control Technician for our new plant...sound exciting?? It is!

Techo-Bloc produces exceptional paving stones and retaining walls. Our facilities are operated by teams of the highest caliber with the latest technology to deliver superior products. Using the 5S and Kanban philosophies, we are dedicated to a manufacturing collaboration that supports running a “whole-minded” production system, and an excellent way to promote improvement. We ensure our products are functional, durable, and astonishingly beautiful.

With soon to be 9 manufacturing facilities (and counting), 30 international patents and over 700 employees, we operate in an exciting and dynamic environment. As we continue to expand, our team members are offered opportunities to professionally develop, learn new abilities and pursue projects that excite them.

If you want to work for a company that listens and is dedicated to your progress this may be your next career move!

Job Description

Reporting to the quality assurance manager, the technician ensures constant monitoring of the quality of our products. He will also be highly involved in the development, implementation and monitoring of the various quality processes. He will also be responsible for the following tasks:

  • Ensure an active presence on the production sites;
  • Know the quality system in place and maintain the quality system;
  • Apply quality assurance procedures at all levels of the production line;
  • Ensure effective treatment of non-conformities, from the identification of causes to the deployment of corrective actions;
  • Use measuring equipment and laboratory equipment;
  • Ensure that measuring equipment and devices are calibrated and compliant;
  • Participate in the optimization and processes’ continuous improvement;
  • Develop and complete various reports related to quality activities, ensuring compilation in the computer system and transmission of results;
  • Participate in the development and updating of technical documents;
  • Achieve quality objectives;
  • Perform any other related tasks assigned.
Qualifications

  • DEC / AEC in civil engineering and/or experience in quality control in the Concrete industry or Civil Industry;
  • Knowledge of a quality management system;
  • Ability to write technical reports;
  • Ability to manage projects with rigor;
  • Flexibility, adaptability and judgment;
  • Autonomy, proactivity, organization and problem solving;
  • Proficiency in computerized management tools (ERP) and the Microsoft Office suite.


Additional Information

Techo Bloc offers its valued employees a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. Here are a few of our perks:

  • Leaders who are invested in your success;
  • Have a dynamic job and evolving career path;
  • Develop your skills and grow;
  • Epic barbecues and Christmas parties;
  • Generous bonus program;
  • Free parking;
  • Considerable referral bonuses;
  • Employee discounts on Techo-Bloc’s products;
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP available 24/7);
  • English and French language courses available (if it’s a work requirement)
  • Free access to a virtual family doctor through virtual care

Physical Demands:

The employee is regularly required to sit; use hands; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand and climb or balance. The employee is occasionally required to walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

title: Planner/Scheduler
description:
The Planner/Scheduler is responsible for the development of planning and scheduling of tasks relative to repair and conversion projects. Key responsibilities include developing integrated master schedules incorporating material, engineering and productions plans, resources profiles and schedules, development and upkeep of department templates, Standard Operating Procedures and metrics.

Duties/Accountabilities

  • Using P6 to create and maintain contracts' level 3/4 integrated schedules for the Project Management Office (PMO)
  • Develop the detail planning and scheduling template to provide a consistent format for use in a variety of areas (e.g. engineering, production) that will feed into the integrated master schedule
  • Ensure that a process to regularly update information is developed and communicated across the various functions
  • Create and maintain individual and integrated resource profiles for all Programs (by program and trade) to provide forecasting information to all functional areas for preplanning activities
  • Prepare and distribute regular update reports that provide program resource status, schedule performance and identify variances to performance plans
  • Provide planning and scheduling analysis and forecasting to senior leadership to develop management information that will provide the basis for future actions and decision making about the program
  • Support the preparation of Earned Value Management System (EVMS) reports that identify program status, cost, and schedule performance
  • Build and maintain P6 templates for the project plans bases on functional requirements
  • Provide quality control of the plans that are produced by other planner schedulers
  • Maintain department Standard Operating Procedures and department metrics
  • Support the team of planner’s and schedulers on Seaspan methodology of planning scheduling

Education and Experience

  • A bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Business is preferred. Trades certificated combined with sufficient employment experience may be considered
  • 5 years planning/scheduling experience preferably in surface ship/submarine refit
  • Certification by an accredited society in Planning, Production Control and/or Project Management is highly desirable

Skills, Knowledge and Required Competencies

  • Extensive knowledge of shipbuilding operations with a detailed understanding of the relationship between procurement, design, production and test operations
  • Proficiency working with independent planning systems including Primavera P6 and Microsoft Project
  • Experience using an ERP system in a large manufacturing environment
  • Knowledge of EVMS principles and their application in monitoring, reporting and controlling work activities
  • Strong problem solving skills, analytical abilities and interpersonal skills
  • Strong customer service focus
  • Proven initiative, creativity and integrity
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Excellent digital literacy including Word/Excel/PowerPoint
  • Proven ability to multi-task, prioritize and problem solve
  • Good judgment and reasoning skills
  • Ability to work with limited direction and to function as a crucial team member
  • Eligible for Canadian Secret Security and Controlled Goods clearance

title: Manufacturing Quality Engineer
description:
Location: Saskatoon, SK, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 3/17/2022Job ID: SN370666317Category: Engineering & Technical
If you are a talented and experienced Quality Engineer, David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you! Our Saskatoon-based client is expanding their team to meet the growing demand for their industry-leading products. 

This role will identify risk and evaluate deficiencies while working with internal departments/business units to appropriately remedy them; facilitate internal training on quality assurance requirements, processes, and procedures; perform audits and risk assessments; and, ensure high quality and reliability levels are achieved for internal/purchased parts by checking the quality of all incoming and outgoing material and products as well as work in progress.

Perks & Benefits: 
  • Competitive compensation
  • Flexible and comprehensive benefits package
  • Innovative work environment
  • A positive company culture with a people-forward approach
Responsibilities:
  • Perform visual and dimensional inspection along with functional and parametric testing according to documented policies and procedures, and create QA/QC standards where necessary
  • Read engineering drawings, datasheets and product work instructions to identify the quality expectations for finished product and assemblies, individual components and general supplies
  • Document non-conformances as per quality procedures, support efforts to root cause the sources of those non-conformances and participate in the decision-making process relating to the disposition of non-conforming material
  • Create, review and revise processes, procedures and work instructions to achieve efficiency and effectiveness
  • Operate various test and measurement equipment. Ensure QC equipment is secure from damage or loss
  • Participate in the internal audit program e.g. plan, execute, report, verify actions and close internal audits
  • Develop, implement and conduct training to improve QC and QA knowledge and methodologies
  • Assist Manager, Quality and Op-Ex with meeting department objectives and external QMS certification/recertification e.g. QMS revisions, NC implementation, follow-ups
Qualifications:
  • University degree in engineering (Mechanical, Electronics, Quality, or Industrial); P.Eng certification
  • 5-7 years of experience in Manufacturing Quality Assurance relating to plastics, metal, and electronics
  • ISO9001 standard knowledge is a must, internal auditor training
  • Experience reading engineering documentation, including but not limited to schematics, mechanical engineering drawings, datasheets etc.
  • Familiarity with quality testing machines and systems
  • Computer skills, including Microsoft Word, PDF and Excel, ERP system experience
  • Experience working within a Quality Management System (QMS)
Job ID: SN370666317

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Manual Machinist
description:
Manual Machinist


Under general supervision, performs routine and semi-routine assignment planning, layout, set up, operating and making tool adjustments for various types of manual machines and shop equipment, general supervision, works from blueprints, process sheets and sketches to perform production tasks, which may include the cutting and shaping of metal to precision dimensions. May communicate directly with engineers to understand the purpose of a part assembly. Checks and inspects machining operations against specified tolerances. May identify and repair minor machine malfunctions.


Location: Edmonton, AB


Your Challenge:


+ Manufacture and inspect detailed parts and tools from blueprints, sketches, drawings and verbal instructions

+ Extensive lathe 4-jaw use with special attention to concentricity and parallelism

+ Knowledge of manual milling, radial arm drill, and other manual machining tools as required.

+ Machining parts from castings and/or bar stock from a variety of materials including stainless steel, carbon steel, exotic alloys, plastics, and hard facing (Stellite).

+ Machining repair of valve and components for daily repairs as well as rush shutdowns

+ Meeting company established safety, quality, and productivity goals

+ Other duties as required.


Your Expertise:


+ 2-3 years of manual machining experience

+ Previous experience manufacturing and repairing valve components is an asset

+ High School diploma or equivalent required.

+ Ability to read and interpret process worksheets, inspect parts and maintain acceptable quality and efficiency level.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition (TA_COE@curtisswright.com) and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request. #IND

title: Warehouse Mover - Level 1 - CAD
description:
Warehouse Mover
Saint-Laurent, QC, Canada
12 Months Extendable contract

Job Description:
Receive, label, and put away inbound inventory shipments. Generate picklists, update Prism with applicable transactions, pull inventory and deliver to support production schedules. Pull outbound orders, stage pallets, and load outbound shipments. Perform cycle counts. Responsibilities General Duties Warehouse Apprentice Follow GMP guidelines and SOPs while performing all assigned tasks Accurately and timely perform Prism/MTS/DCS transactions as applicable Supply components and raw materials to the Packaging and Manufacturing departments, which includes movement of Bulk Portable Totes and SuperSacks Operate forklift truck, pallet jack, and other equipment required for the safe loading, unloading, and transfer of supply components, raw materials, and finished goods Conduct daily safety checks of associated equipment (forklift truck, pallet jack, and other material handling equipment) according to established procedures Accurately input and search for data and information concerning all material movements and associated functions in computerized material tracking systems including PRISM and DCS Coordinate availability of components and resources for current and oncoming shift. Utilize computerized Material Tracking System or Prism to locate components and maximize warehouse space Conduct daily inventory of warehouse/line side locations to ensure inventory accuracy Coordinate housekeeping tasks including the removal of waste/cardboard, sweeping, product consolidation and other associated tasks required to maintain an organized, clean, and safe work area Log and deliver non-inventory items within the Oak Hill facility Participate in site Operational Excellence program to identify continuous improvement opportunities (i.e. 5S, Standard Work, Performance Management, waste reduction and Gemba) Utilize radio frequency scanners, computers, and other equipment (i.e., bar code printers, copiers) Experience 3-5 years (recent/consistent) working in a fast-paced, high speed production environment. Demonstrated ability to translate production schedule into material movement. Additional Skills/Experience: Must have the ability to lift, push, and pull up to 50 pounds Must have the ability to stand, bend and walk for long periods of time Ability to wear respiratory protection to perform specific tasks Ability to work as a team, treating other associates with dignity and respect Commitment to safety Responsibility for quality Ability and willingness to learn new things (e.g., hand tool use, use of manuals, etc.) Willingness to train others Ability to adjust quickly to new responsibilities and tasks Generate ideas for improvement Demonstration of positive and reliable work attitude Ability to work effectively with team/work groups Available to work overtime is required Flexibility in shift assignments Demonstrated computer skills (data entry, email, file access, Microsoft Office and Excel). Computer literacy ability to input and search for data. Good communication skills (verbal and written). Excellent reading and math skills. o Able to read, understand and apply information from SOPs, batch sheets, etc. o Confident in the use of basic math calculations, percentages, fractions and decimal notation o Familiar with different measurement schemes, e.g. kilograms vs. pounds; fluid ounces vs. liters o Able to effectively communicate with supervisor, co-workers, Quality, Manufacturing, Packaging, and other departments Attention to detail and ability to record information clearly and accurately is required Must follow cGMPs and associated department/site SOPs Flexibility to work up to 12 hour days (including weekends) on all shifts and overtime is required Ability to operate electric pallet jack or forklift to move materials Prior Material Movement experience required Previous Manufacturing and Packaging experience will be considered Knowledge of GMP procedures. Experience working in a FDA regulated environment Experience with machine changeovers and use of hand tools strongly preferred Demonstrated proficiency in PRISM and/or DCS computer software applications Education Minimum High School Diploma or equivalent Preferred 2 year Technical degree, prefer Mechanical/Machine Maintenance related. Other non-production/manufacturing mechanical experience will be considered

title: Press Brake Operator
description:
Brannon Steel is looking for an experienced hydraulic Press Brake Operator to work at its Brampton manufacturing location. From $24.40 per hour and up depending on experience PLUS up to $2 per hour in afternoon shift premiums and $4 per hour in night shift premiums, tell us what your experience is worth and we'll see if we can make a deal!

Duties

  • Setup, operate, and troubleshoot hydraulic CNC press brakes in a safe, efficient manner.
  • Perform material handling activities (i.e. locating material, loading/unloading machine) using an overhead crane or other material handling equipment.
  • Organize equipment and materials to minimize downtime.
  • Complete all required documents in an accurate and timely manner.
  • Complete assigned housekeeping activities and contribute to overall shop cleanliness and organization.
  • Assist other Forming staff when work schedule permits or as assigned.
  • 3+ years of experience operating hydraulic press brakes OR completion of applicable metal fabrication program.
  • 1+ years of overhead crane experience.
  • Able to read and interpret part drawings and production documents.
  • Able to complete production and quality documents accurately.
  • Understanding of carbon steel grades and characteristics.
  • Able to perform manual material handling up to 36 kgs (80 lbs).
  • Proficient with basic and precision measuring tools.
  • Proficient with hand and power tools.
  • Speak, read and write English at a conversational level.
  • Service award program including travel vouchers for $3,000, $5,000, and $10,000 for 10, 20, and 30 years of service.
  • Group RRSP program with contribution matching up to 5% of regular annual earnings.
  • Shift premiums up to $4 per hour on nights and $2 per hour on afternoons.
  • Overtime after 40 hours per week.
  • Full-time, permanent work at a stable, family-owned company.
  • Company-supplied tools and equipment, uniforms, safety boots, and prescription safety glasses.
  • Extended health coverage including prescriptions, paramedical expenses, and emergency travel assistance.
  • Dental coverage including preventive, diagnostic, and treatment services.
  • Short and long-term disability insurance.
  • Life and AD&D insurance.
  • Free employee assistance program.
  • Opportunities to learn and advance.
  • A friendly work environment where people support each other.
  • Summer barbeques, annual golf tournament, and more!

title: Production Technician
description:
Mitrex, an Integrated solar and construction solution provider, is looking for a experienced Production Technician/Stringer to operate highly automated machines in a manufacturing setting to reach the production goal
At Mitrex, we develop and manufacture solar construction materials for buildings and large structures (Mitrex
com)
As the world's first manufacturer to develop customizable solar solutions, we are revolutionizing the construction industry, while helping to move the world toward clean, sustainable energy production
We are an equal opportunity employer with great company culture
The successful candidate will join our production team in Etobicoke, and report to the Production Supervisor
COMPETENCIES Minimum 2 years Technical College Diploma or equivalent training and experience, Minimum of 5 years experience in a similar production role within an automated high-volume manufacturing environment, Able to read and understand production assembly drawings, Must have a good mechanical aptitude and be detail-oriented, Must have experience developing best quality practices, analyzing quality testing/inspection data, and developing test procedures, Proven proficiency with computers and statistical software packages, Able to work efficiently both independently and as a team
RESPONSIBILITIES Read, interpret, and execute production schedules and assembly drawings, Perform work and quality practices as per Standardized Work Instructions, Monitor the creation of scrap/non-conforming material – Trouble-shoot scrap generating issues, perform root cause analysis and implement corrective actions, Support training of new staff, audit existing work instructions, and participate in Continuous Improvement initiatives/projects, Facilitate material movement within the plant and adhere to inventory control practices, Perform shipping/receiving functions as directed, Perform all other duties as assigned by Supervisor/Management WHAT WE OFFER Salary of $25+/hour based on experience, plus an annual bonus based on performance
Extended medical and health coverage (including vision, dental, and life) Wellness program including free healthy foods, medicinal provisions, and discounted gym and fitness class memberships Competitive RRSP Matching for tenured employees Free charging and reserved parking for electric vehicles Collaborative and diverse culture, open concept modern office space Unlimited room for advancement and growth Backed by 20 years of experience through our parent company, GCAT Group Full-time and permanent position AODA Considerations Mitrex Inc
welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities
Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process
Process We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes all candidates from diverse backgrounds
Candidates who are legally entitled to work in Canada (without employer sponsorship) and can commute to the office every day are welcome to apply
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in our company
However, due to the number of applications we receive, only qualified candidates will be contacted
No phone calls (except for accommodation requests) or unsolicited agency calls, please

title: Material Planner
description:
Job Title: Material Planner

Job Location:Markham, ON

What we offer

Are you curious? Come challenge yourself, innovate and learn in your everyday work - supported by an exceptionally talented Team. Join our journey. Mobility is changing - and Veoneer is a part of driving this change towards safe mobility solutions.

You will have access to exciting and emerging technologies. We focus on your professional and technical growth within advanced driving assistance systems (ADAS), collaborative and autonomous driving. We empower our teams to move technology forward in this fast-paced and challenging industry.

Are you ready to contribute to this change? Veoneer has around 9,000 purpose-driven employees in 13 countries around the world. Come join Veoneer as we lead the way in Creating Trust in Mobility.

What you’ll do

  • Coordinate & implement engineering changes within Enterprise One, utilizing the engineering system PLM (Product Lifecycle Management).
  • Control obsolescence by supporting engineering changes, balance-outs and resourcing actions.
  • Manage and ensure accuracy of BOM (Bill of Material) setups.
  • Maintain department inventory objectives.
  • Ensure accurate issuance of production and service part releases to suppliers.
  • Analyzing inventory levels and following up to ensure timely delivery to support production lines.
  • Investigate and address root cause of inventory issues.
  • Resolve supply issues through various carriers and customs brokers.
  • Interface with production and local third party warehouse to ensure processes are maintained and establish new ones as necessary.
  • Interface on material supply issues with Purchasing, Design and Manufacturing Engineering, Production, Scheduling and the Supply Base.
  • Maintain internal/external pull system.
  • Support customer prototype orders.
  • Drive continuous improvement through root cause and corrective action (RCCA) analysis.

What you'll bring:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering or a related field or college diploma with a minimum three years of manufacturing, planning and logistics experience.
  • One or more of the following APICS Certifications: CPIM, CSCP and CLTD
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail with an ability to identify risk, problem solve, effectively communicate and execute solutions
  • Intermediate to advanced experience with Microsoft Office
  • Experience with Product Lifecycle Management software and MRP/ERP systems (JDE an asset)
  • Programming ability in Crystal Reports and Visual Basic for Applications
  • Experience with creating visualizations in PowerBI, Tableau and/or other data visualization/analysis tools


We thank all applicants for their interest. Veoneer is an equal opportunity employer andis committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Accommodations may be made available upon request from candidates throughout the hiring process.

title: Stamping Press Operator
description:
Group Description

 

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

 

 

Division Summary

Maple Stamping, a Division of the Cosma International Group of Magna International Inc., is a long-standing automotive stamping and assembly shop that has a great story and a rich history as part of the Magna Family.

 

An amalgamation of two prior shops dating back to 1978, the modern Maple Stamping as we now know it was formed in 2008 here in Concord, Ontario, Canada. We are proud to celebrate our employee base of more than 400 hard working people, that together represent a diverse and multi-disciplined team - many of whom have worked loyally for Magna for more than 30 years. Accordingly, we are eager to continue building on our narrative in the 2020's and we want you to become a part of our story too.

 

We offer professional hard and soft skill development for all of our team by empowering our veteran employees to educate and lead the new; and, in turn, we wholeheartedly embrace the spririt of Kaizen or continuous improvement in part by embracing change and encouraging new employees to be impactful with their ideas and talents. Our employee experience is family-oriented and specifically focused on offering a degree of work-life balance that is rarely found in the facilities of our competitors. Our continuous improvement programs are reflective of the creative and dynamic work envrionment we offer to our people, rewarding those seeking to disrupt the status quo and engage in changing for the better.

 

The best technologies come by challenging the status quo. At Magna, we foster an environment where your ideas can electrify vehicles, make full autonomy a reality and build smarter, more connected cities. We can help you do it.

 

Let’s create the future of mobility, together. Dream big. With us.

Role Summary

As a Stamping Press Operator, you are an integral member of a clost knit Press Shop Team that aspires on a daily basis to meet production targets, produce material of the utmost production quality, support team development through technical learning and continuously improve processes such as die change-overs and setting up jobs. Our Facility is home to a vast array of die sets, and consequently a large production catalogue of jobs that can be run on our multiple heavy presses. Our Press Operators are both technically strong, but also excel at working with people and promoting skills development among the supporting staff that help each press job run successfully.

 

As a Press Operator, your goal is to both achieve production targets to meet customer demand, while supporting a small team of employees assisting you at the end of the assigned press. A number of our presses are also equipped with automated transfer systems. The successful candidate will bring a sense or urgency and dutifulness in their pursuit of the perfect shift. Concerns or production issues must be escalated quickly to the Toolroom and other resources in order to get back on track as soon as possible. Your eye for detail enables you to detect quality-related problems before they have an opportunity to spiral out of control or risk shipment of defects to customer facilities. Lastly, it is key to note that Press Operators are expected to demonstrate the qualities that make for a great leader - accountability, a safety mindset, patience, empathy, the ability to coach others and the tenacity to get the job done right every shift.

Key Responsibilities

• Perform changeovers, die protection controls and related equipment for all progressive/transfer operations.
• Capable of training others to perform related tasks using SWI process.
• Lift, move, stack, pack visually monitor parts through an established process on Progressive and transfer dies according to SWI.
• Capable of understanding and completing paperwork accurately.
• Meets or exceeds production, quality and delivery outputs as prescribed by established 
• Complete Pre-Shift Press Safety Inspection ensuring compliance with all required Health and Safety procedures.

Minimum Requirements & Qualifications

• Previous experience in a manufacturing environment that employs the use of heavy mechanical stamping presses, ideally 2-3 years.
• Physically capable of performing essential duties of the job, including regular physical lifting of up to 30-35 lbs.
• Background in manufacturing with press experience including quality and safety initiatives.
• Working knowledge of the English language both written and oral.
• Thorough understanding of production quality standards and defects common to a press shop.

Core Competencies

• Procedure oriented – able to follow procedures and requirements for start-up, Standard Work Instructions, completing paperwork accurately, etc.
• Strong work ethic – through a thorough understanding of automotive quality and delivery requirements, meets production targets, quality and delivery goals as prescribed by established standards.
• Willingness to learn new ways of doing things – through an understanding of TWI, capable of learning SWI for multiple machines within Press department.
• Organized – prefers and keeps a clean and orderly work environment.

Additional Information


Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

 

Please be advised that in-person interviewing is currently not possible due to COVID-19. Successful candidates selected for next steps will instead be invited to join a video interview using WebEx.

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Material Handler
description:
Material Handler 

This is a great full-time opportunity in a fast-paced manufacturing setting. The Material Handler is a critical role; we are looking for at least 2 years of experience coordinating incoming materials, working the machine operator teams, shipping team, purchasing teams to ensure the supply needs across the plant for are met. 

Responsibilities

  • Gather raw material for production associates
  • Bring finished product to shipping
  • Help shipping offload trucks
  • Put incoming raw material away; quality check all incoming materials
  • Identify product codes
  • Identify supply needs across the plant floor
  • Coordinate with machine operators for delivery of product
  • Coordinate with Purchaser
  • and Shipping Supervisor regarding inventory control - low stock
  • Receive raw materials and ensure proper labeling

Full-time, $18-$19 to start. We require someone with experience on a counterbalance forklift truck, inside or outside certified.

title: Production Technician
description:
Interested in joining a cause-driven, customer focused company dedicated to positively impacting the health of animals, people and the planet? Search our job listings below.


 

Position Description:

To produce veterinary biologics according to a defined production schedule following cGMP guidelines and specific outlines of production to meet market demands for Aquaculture products.

Functions, Duties, Task:

  • Adhere to the principles of “Safety first, Quality always”
  • Perform biologics recovery and purifications using process scale TFF unit, columns and chromatography system.
  • Operate and maintain production instruments and equipment, such as  pH Meters, Conductivity meters, spectrophotometer, TFF equipment, Peristaltic pumps , rotary pumps , chromatography systems/
  • Perform column packing using packing skids, integrity testing on various types of filters and process analysis using spectrophotometer
  • Write and review batch records, SOPs, qualification documents for the downstream operations.
  • Purchase raw material/ production items and make required updates in SAP.
  • Comply with safety requirements, cGMP, SOP and manufacturing documentation.
  • Collaborate with other departments involved in GMP manufacturing for planning production, testing and product release in a timely manner resulting in successful completion of projects.
  • Work cross functional with the upstream manufacturing group to provide resources as needed.
  • Perform tasks under minimal supervision, and within tight time lines to meet production schedules.
  • Assist in the maintenance of production equipment in good condition as per manufacturer’s specifications
  • Responsibilities include cleaning and sterilizing items used in  down streaming applications
  • Maintain the cleanliness of the production areas and assist in disinfection procedures as needed

Minimum Qualification (education, experience and/or training, required certifications):

  • Bachelor’s  Degree in a life sciences (e.g. Biochemistry, Chemistry)
  • 1-3 years of pharmaceutical/biological manufacturing experience in GMP environment
  • 1-3 years of experience in purification of biologics using large scale TFF and chromatography.
  • Process knowledge of TFF filtration and chromatography
  • Experience with operating Unicorn software is required.  

Additional Preferences:

  • Intermediate/Expert computer software skills: MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point), SAP and control systems.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, both communications and written. The candidate in this position must be able to communicate effectively with Management and staff.

Other Information:

  • Must be able to work shift work (12 hour daytime shifts, 3-4 days/week including some weekends) and overtime as required
  • Required to assist in disinfection procedures involving hazardous chemicals requiring the use of a respirator.
  • Must be able to lift, move and maneuver small-medium sized equipment – up to 25lbs.
  • Requires ability to stand for long periods of time
  • Requires frequent ladder or stair climbing
  • Must be able to read, write, understand, and comply with appropriate standard operating procedures.

Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status

title: Machine Operator
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Machine Operator at our 591 Arvin facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Machine Operator is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to, loading and packing customer product. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the TS16949 Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Wages starting at $17.15

Shift premium and shift incentive available for 11 pm shift.

Shifts Available:

  • 7:00am - 3:00pm
  • 3:00pm - 11:00pm
  • 11:00pm - 7:00am

Responsibilities:

  • Operate and supervise machine operation.
  • Produce product according to customer specifications, ensuring that all product is handled in a proper, safe manner at all times, no partial boxes are shipped, similar parts are packaged together and boxes are properly labeled.
  • Visually inspect ongoing product for defects, ensuring non-conforming product is segregated from production line.
  • Maintain and document production records.
  • Maintain clean and orderly work area both throughout and after their shift.
  • Notify supervisor immediately of any equipment or production problems.
  • Comply with company safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined in the quality system.
  • Duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent work experience
  • Manufacturing experience preferred
  • Demonstrated communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to follow work instructions
  • Demonstrated organizational skills

Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

hr@tiercon.com

.

title: Welder
description:
If you’re looking for a special place to build or grow your career, you’ve found it. Whether you’re an experienced professional, a recent college graduate or somewhere in between, IDEX is a place where you can apply your existing skills and learn new ones in an environment where you can make an impact. With interesting opportunities in engineering, marketing, sales, supply chain, operations, HR, finance, and more across more than 40 diverse businesses (https://www.idexcorp.com/our-businesses/business-segments/) around the globe, chances are, we have something special for you.

Position Summary

:

Fitting, welding, straightening of stainless steel components. Following engineering design/drawings to weld customized parts. TIG and SMAW welding.

Reports To

: Polishing & Welding Supervisor

Hours of Work:

Monday to Thursday (7am to 4pm) and Friday (7am to 3pm)

Essential Functions:

Position requirements include, but are not limited to: + Fitting, welding and straightening of weldments, + Production of sheet metal parts, as well as the layout and development of templates or patterns as per engineering drawings, + Rough polishing of parts when required, + Weld according to pre-set parameters as well as correcting any deficiencies found. + Other duties, as assigned

Organizational Relationships

: + Must interface effectively and regularly with: All employees

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience:

+ 2-5 years of related experience in welding + The ability to fit, weld, and straighten weldments + Ability to operate manual or semi-automatic welding equipment + Ability to read and interpret blue prints or welding process specifications

Language Skills

:

+

English

Computer Skills

:

+

N/A

Other Qualifications:

+ Ability to multi-task within a fast paced environment + Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills + Ability to rough polish + Knowledge of welding processes (SMAW & GTAW)

Physical Demands:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to: + Stand, Walk and/or Sit 100% of the time + Use hands to handle, reach and feel: 100% of the time

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to the following environmental conditions: + Manufacturing environment _Quadro Engineering Corp. is committed to providing a barrier-free workplace. If accommodation is required during the selection or interview process, it will be available upon request. This job posting is available in an accessible format upon request._ Are you ready to join a different kind of company where our people, our culture, and our commitments are centered around providing trusted solutions that improve lives around the world? IDEX is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action Employer. IDEX gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other consideration or protected category made unlawful by federal, state or local laws (Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled).

Business Unit:

Quadro

Job Segment:

HST Health & Science Technologies

title: Production Sanitizer
description:
Position Summary:
The Production sanitizer ensures all Manufacturing Equipment is cleaned and sanitized following the proper processes.

 

Role and Responsibilities:
 

  • Clean and Sanitize manufacturing equipment as required - in accordance with procedures provided/SOP.
  • Dismantle, clean - in accordance to procedure provided, and re-assemble all related production pumps.
  • Maintain/ Prepare sanitizing solution in sanitation tanks - as required.
  • Fill out all appropriate documentation and follow sampling plan for Chemistry and Micro lab adequately.
  • Perform or do validations on filling equipment and lines when required.
  • Always maintain a clean and safe work area (mopping and sweeping production areas and around the fillers)
  • Must keep Sanitization Room clean and safe as well.
  • Comply with plant Safety Standards, Good Manufacturing Practices, Standard Operating Procedures, and all other plant policies.
  • Participate in Continuous Improvement activities.
  • Assist line operator and mechanics clean filler parts (12 hr. procedure)
  • Must have knowledge of GMP and customer requirements
  • Perform any other duties as assigned from time to time.

 

Qualifications and Education Requirements:
 

  • High School diploma would be an asset.
  • Must be able to operate independently  
  • Must be able to operate a forklift and pass KIK’s forklift test as per job demand.
  • Must be able to easily move 45 Gallon drums during shift, stand, lift, bend, crouch, and reach consistently throughout the shift.
  • Must be able to read and write English (read and understand Production daily schedules).
  • Must be able to work in accordance with all Health and Safety and GMP Regulations.
  • Must be able to work overtime where necessary.

 

Working Condition:

·         Constant interaction with a variety of chemicals and chemical products.

·         Working with unpleasant odours and fumes.

·         Working in various temperature changes.

·         High noise levels.

·         Regular work with moving machinery increases potential hazards.

·         Working in small areas with WHMIS regulated chemicals.

·         Possibility of rotating, midnight, afternoon, or continental shifts.

·         Constant contact with water.

 

 

Voyant Beauty provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, Voyant Beauty complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training

title: Production Glass Cutter
description:
Are you looking for a long-term career in a production and manufacturing environment? Let Randstad help you start with your new job.

We are looking for a production glass cutter to work in a busy window manufacturing plant in southeast Calgary. We are looking for candidates who are ‘handy’ with great manual dexterity and have experience as a glass cutter.

The pay is very competitive at $18 to $19 per hour. The shift is from 7:00 am to 3:30 pm day, Monday to Friday. Transit accessible in southeast Calgary.


Advantages
• Very competitive pay of $18 to $19 an hour, paid weekly
• Monday to Friday shift pattern
• Optional benefits are available through Randstad from your first payday
• Transit accessible location in southeast Calgary


Responsibilities
• Reading a production plan including tickets and labels
• Assembling and checking products parts
• Building and putting glass materials for windows and doors
• Can safety operate a glass cutter machine
• Lifting up to 50 lbs
• Working with your teammates to ensure the job is done in a timely manner


Qualifications
• At least 12 months of experience in an industrial setting. It will be an asset if you have worked in a glass manufacturing plant, but other industrial settings such as manufacturing will also be considered.
• Able to stand and walk for an 8-hour shift
• Able to lift 50lbs, and use simple hand/ power tools
• Able to follow instructions
• Able to communicate well with colleagues
• A positive attitude, ready to work in a team as well as independently



Summary
If you have the relevant experience, we want to chat with you immediately! If you are interested please choose one of the options below!

** Online: Apply directly to this job advert or register yourself online at www.randstad.ca

** Email: send your resume directly to the following consultants, stating the job role in the email subject line: marygrace.mendoza@randstad.ca


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Manufacturing Positions
description:
Recognized as one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies, Brandt provides top quality products to its customers worldwide. As a result of continued growth and expansion we are currently seeking Assemblers, Welders, Fitters, Machinists, Machine Operators, Powder Painters, Production Planners, Material Handlers, Kitting Technicians, Labourers, Lead Hands and many more for our manufacturing facilities located in Regina and Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

Take your place in a strong stable company that offers long term employment and a comprehensive benefit program. At Brandt, you'll get the challenges that you've been looking for and your hard work will be rewarded. Join our team of experts and see for yourself on how far you can go. Please visit the career page on brandtjobs.com for a full list of job opportunities.

title: Machinist Foreman
description:
Brandt is currently seeking Machinist Foremen for our Saskatoon Manufacturing Facility. Responsibilities include:

  • Reading and understanding blueprints
  • Operating lathes
  • Milling machines and boring mills
  • Assessing work pieces and determining appropriate repairs
  • Standard maintenance procedures on lathes, milling machines and boring mills
  • Organize the staff so that each leadhand has the required amount of manpower to meet the schedule
  • Help with the setup of products that supports flow and safety of work cells
  • Other duties may be assigned.
  • Understanding of manufacturing operations and fabrication
  • Must be able to read and understand shop drawings
  • Knowledgeable in the use and operation of all hand power tools
  • Must be able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Has knowledge of proper maintenance of equipment under this classification
  • Capable of working independently
  • Motivated to learn and improve
  • Positive attitude with an attitude for problem solving.

title: Packer - Food Manufacturing Seasonal Position
description:
You already LOVE us and the SNACKS WE MAKE

Chips, Cookies, Crackers, Wafers, Cheese Curls, Popcorn, Tortilla Chips... yeah, we make them ALL! Shearer's is the company behind all your favorite snack brands.

We have over 5,000 associates in 12 state-of-the-art manufacturing and warehouse sites in North America that produce over 800 million pounds of snacks per year. Did you know that we buy 20% of all the potatoes grown in the US? WOW!

And we know what you're thinking…how can I get my hands on some free goodies? Our team members can take home oodles of free snacks – everyday!

Seasonal Packer Positions - Guelph, Canada

All Shifts Available: Day, Afternoon, Night 

NEW Hourly Pay RATES!

Starting Pay $19.19/hour

(in addition, 0.30 shift premium on afternoons and 0.45 shift premium for Nights)

Your seat at the table

  • Required to visually inspect the flow of product through various stages of the packaging process.
  • Place proper quantities of product in each box; Check code dates, prices, fold and tape box
  • Stack correct number of boxes appropriately on skids using correct stacking pattern.
  • Required to rotate through the various packaging workstations on all packaging lines.
  • Perform general housekeeping duties such as sweeping, light equipment cleaning as required

What you bring to the table

  • Strong communication skills – must be able to accurately express information concerning production quality and safety
  • Require good hand, eye coordination
  • Responsible for ensuring that the work they perform meets the Company's finished product "Quality" expectations
  • Individual must be self-motivated, detail-orientated, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and have good time management & organizational skills
  • Work well within a team environment
  • Physically capable of heavy lifting (25 lbs)
  • Self-starter, working with minimal supervision
  • Must follow all safety regulations while working

Please note: we have the following allergens in our facility:  Peanuts, Wheat, Whey, Dairy and Soya

You will be considered for employment in our inclusive workplace

Shearer's Foods Canada, Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please advise us if you require accommodation during the recruitment process.

This is your invitation to apply now!

#zp

#GUE

title: Quality Inspector (FT)
description:
To be successful in this role, you should be familiar with various inspection procedures. Part of your responsibility will be to perform audits for all of our internal systems identifying issues and recommending solutions. If you want to improve your skills and develop in the QA field this is a great opportunity for you to work with a strong team and expand your knowledge in this area.

QA  Inspectors are responsible for identifying all issues and getting to the root of the problem, proactively recommending solutions that’ll improve product durability and overall performance.

Responsibilities:
  • Monitor the entire production cycle and perform regular tests to identify potential malfunctions as early as possible.
  • Inspect in coming and out going product for defects and durability.
  • Prepare reports on non-conformance and corrective actions.
  • Review current quality documentation on production floor and create new documents as needed for consistence.
  • Work with internal teams to increase customer satisfaction by improving the quality of the products.

Requirements:
  • Previous work experience is an asset.
  • Great attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
  • Team spirit.
  • Good analytical skills.
  • Familiar with Microsoft applications.
  • Additional certification in Quality Assurance is a plus.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent.

COVID-19 considerations:
Eastside ensures all staff follow all safety protocols to prevent the spread of COVID-19




    About Eastside Industrial Coatings and Composites :

    Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fibreglass and metal components for local OEMs.As the coatings business continued to grow with a focus on “A” Finish coatings, Eastside Industrial moved to a larger location (our current space), committed to diversifying into composites manufacturing and expanding our customer base throughout the continent.Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.We remain a family owned business focused on growing our team and developing our team to have a successful future with Eastside or a member of the Eastside Group.

title: Production Planner
description:
Company Description

At Techo-Bloc, we aren’t just paving patios – we’re paving the way for great careers! Founded on a culture of innovation, we manufacture landscaping products focused on design, durability and flair. Our growing team is seeking passionate people, ready to make an impact. Intrigued? Come grow with us. 

Why work for us

We love to brag. Techo Bloc offers its valued employees a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package. Here are a few of our perks:

  • Leaders who are invested in your success;
  • Have a dynamic job and evolving career path;
  • Free access to a virtual family doctor through virtual care;
  • Develop your skills and grow;
  • Epic barbecues and Christmas parties;
  • Possibility of remote work;
  • Generous bonus program;
  • Snack filled kitchens;
  • Free parking;
  • Considerable referral bonuses;
  • Employee discounts on Techo-Bloc’s products;
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP available 24/7);
  • English and French language courses available (if it’s a work requirement).
Job Description

Reporting to the Production Planning Manager, the Production Planner will be responsible for short and mid-term production planning to ensure that corporate customer service and inventory targets are achieved. The primary focus is the daily planning of production priorities, and preparation and update of the production schedules in a multi-plant environment. Duties include reviewing and distributing production work, and shipment schedules; conferring with plant supervisors to determine progress of work and completion dates; monitoring inventory levels and problem solving.

  • Work closely with the Production Planning Manager to review product demand from sales and forecasts and develops production schedules based on the planning system inputs;
  • Coordinate closely with the Plant Manager/Supervisor to be aligned on the execution of the production schedule;
  • Evaluate days of supply to ensure proper quantity, sequencing and prioritizing of production runs;
  • Create and maintain the production batches in the ERP system with production schedule dates and quantities;
  • Communicate the production schedule to the different stakeholders (Plant Manager, Production Supervisor, Yard Manager, Replenisher, Customer Service etc.);
  • Review shortages and respond to changing requirements in a timely manner, to satisfy customer needs;
  • Communicate and update any changes to the initial schedule;
  • Follow-up with the Plant Manager/Supervisor on the production output for each day to look for errors or omissions on the production data including production output, labor times, raw materials and down time of the plants;
  • Review the ERP’s production summary report and verify that the production data has been entered properly - have the inventory verified in the yard to ascertain that the quantities reported as produced match the physical count in the yard.  Report as finished the production jobs and end the production batches after validation; 
  • Respond to Customer Service, Operations requests in a timely manner;
  • Enter all month end production reporting into the ERP system;
  • Perform ad-hoc analysis as needed;
  • Participate in continuous improvement initiatives.
Qualifications

  • University degree preferred in a related field;
  • Minimum of 2 - 4 years’ experience in a manufacturing multi-site environment preferred;
  • Ability to communicate well both orally and in written English/French;
  • Fundamental knowledge of Supply Chain (planning and scheduling, production process and capabilities, inventory planning etc.);
  • Experience in using MRP system preferred;
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Advanced knowledge in Excel is a plus)
  • Analytical and Mathematical skills;
  • The ability to work independently with strong decision-making skills.
  • Possess strong communication and organizational skills;
  • Sets and achieves challenging goals, demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles;
  • Reacts well under pressure, treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position;
  • Detail oriented, ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks with strict deadlines;
  • Thrives in a fast-paced team environment and results oriented.


Additional Information

Techo-Bloc is growing at a rapid pace; your ideas and talents are needed to contribute our dynamic and passionate team as we continue the development of the prestigious brand image that Techo-Bloc has developed over the years. 

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Lead Operator - Paint T7/8
description:
Toyoda Gosei is a leading global manufacturer of rubber and plastic automotive components, safety systems and LEDs. With a network of 64 group companies in 17 countries and regions, the Group brings its extensive range of products to customers all over the world. In the Americas, we have more than 30 years of proven excellence in automotive manufacturing. Our 25 locations throughout Canada, the United States, Mexico and Brazil aim to deliver the highest levels of quality, innovation and satisfaction to the industry.

Together, we are looking toward a future of strong, sustainable growth.

General Description:

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Cover daily absenteeism and PPL
  • Must be able to perform all FTM duties
  • Ship trucks when requested
  • Must be a strong performer in current role
  • Train and 4M team members
  • Operate material handling equipment, lift truck & tugger
  • Identify Kaizen opportunities
  • Inventory Counts
  • Maintain excellent 5S condition
  • All of the duties must be performed within Health and Safety guidelines
  • Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • Must be able to add, subtract, multiply and divide.
  • Must have an excellent attendance record
  • Must be able to work overtime when required
  • Must have strong performance in current role
  • Heavy lifting is required – maximum 44 lbs
  • Demonstrated ability to follow all policies and procedures

Experience an asset, but not required
