title: Forklift Operator - Cambridge, ON
description:
Job ID:  398960

 

Permacon, a CRH Company, is a leader and pioneer in the manufacturing of concrete masonry and landscaping products.  Permacon is a division of Oldcastle APG and operates 9 plants in Ontario and Quebec. 

 

We are currently looking for  Forklift Operators at our Cambridge Plant. The forklift Operators must be available to work in the yard and in the tumble room.

 

This is a dayshift position, Monday to Thursday

 

Main Duties and Responsibilities:
•    Load, unload, sort, check, move, wrap, package, store and/or pile different products, material, raw material (pallets, skids, plates, blocks, paves)
•    Perform yard and plant clean-up and Plant housekeeping. Employee must keeps his work area clean.
•    Participate in production as requested.
•    Participate in preventive maintenance of equipment or products change as requested.
•    Communicates to competent persons any quality, abnormalities or faulty situations in regards to the product, batch, quality, machine, equipment, workplace or other.
•    Work as a team.
•    Wear safety personal protective equipment as required for this position, work safely and observes all safety procedures such as lockout procedure, etc..
•    Learn basic machine function.
•    Performs all other related tasks requested by his superior
 

Qualifications and requirements
•    High school diploma
•    Forklift Licence
•    Team work oriented, initiative; responsible, able to react, to be precise; methodical
•    Organized, must be able to work with established procedures, guidelines, people and under immediate supervision  
•     Must be able to learn quickly and have capacity to safely physically handle weight up to 20kg
•     Must have judgement and communication aptitude
•     Must be able to react efficiently and to operate equipment safely and efficiently
•     Must have an excellent attendance record

 

Why work at Permacon ?
•    We offer a competitive salary and group insurance plan
•    We offer a retirement saving plan with employer’s contribution (RRSP/DPSP) 
•    Permacon continuously strives to create a secure, respectful and inclusive work environment 
•    Opportunity of career

APPLY NOW!

 

At Permacon, diversity is one of our main assets! We therefore invite visible minorities, ethnic minorities and people living with a disability to apply.

title: Production Planner (Hybrid)
description:
Hybrid Model

This position offers remote work of one day per week. Selected candidate will be required to complete their 90-day probationary period onsite for onboarding purposes and will then move to this hybrid model.

Position Summary:  Reporting to the Supply Chain Manager, the Production Planner isresponsible for determining production priorities and setting the production schedule to support customer requirements, monitoring kanbans/blanket orders, and purchasing materials.

Primary/Essential Responsibilities: 

  • Develop production plans and set production schedules in support of customer delivery requirements and manufacturing capacity
  • Purchase order releases against established “blanket” or “kanban” orders in the ERP system; collaborate with the buyer/senior buyer on the transition of expiring blankets and agreements
  • Responsible for the transactional process of production planning in the ERP system to ensure accurate production orders and purchase releases based on customer required date; collaborate with manufacturing to manage capacity constraints, collaborate with engineering on new item introduction processes
  • Monitor kanbans for assigned products; develop and execute improvements to focus on inventory reduction and elimination of material shortages
  • Responsible for ensuring timely completion of manufacturing work orders
  • Plan for and process procurement of raw material from domestic and international suppliers using MRP (JDE)
  • Expedite and complete routine past due purchase order follow up to ensure timely receipt of material to support the production schedule
  • Generate work orders using JDE and create production packages
  • Release work orders to manufacturing per the production schedule
  • Develop and execute improvements to focus on inventory reduction and material shortages
  • Responsible for gathering and reporting established planning metrics in support of the overall supply chain metrics. Metrics may include material shortages, late orders, unplanned orders, inventory by planner and inventory reduction
  • Exercises initiative and independent judgment in adapting and applying procedures to address day-to-day activities
  • Regular interactions with functional department staff heads and other internal stakeholders, as well as external relationships with suppliers, customers and other G&W employees as required
  • Consults with manager when making decisions regarding complex or unusual circumstances
  • Manage engineering drawing change notices within the supply base and manufacturing as required
  • All other duties as required

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Post-Secondary Education in Business, Operations Management, Supply Chain or related field
  • APICS Certification in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM) or Certified Supply Chain Professional (CSCP), SCMP designation, or similar designation a strong asset
  • Working knowledge of ERP systems required, JDE Oracle a strong asset
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a production planning role within a make to order/engineered to order  manufacturing environment
  • Excellent computer skills, including advanced skills in MS Excel, Word, Access, Project, etc.
  • Ability to multi-task under pressure in a high-paced environment
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written English
  • Results-oriented, self-motivated individual with a sense of initiative
  • Ability to work independently and as a team player while solving problems and multitasking in a deadline-driven environment
  • Ability to independently identify and develop solutions to problems that may arise in the course of work
  • Ability to respond effectively to inquiries or comments from internal clients

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Capable of working on concurrent projects or supporting portions of larger, more complex projects following established guidelines
  • Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing tools and principles
  • Working knowledge of manufacturing systems

Physical Demands / Working Conditions: 

  • This role is located in the general office environment, with regular visits to manufacturing
  • PC use

Why G&W?

We have established a long lived reputation for product quality and innovation. We believe our greatest asset is our employees and look for highly motivated, self-driven individuals who thrive in a fast-paced challenging environment. Our business is growing and if you are looking to grow and continue your development and reach success, you’ll find it at G&W Electric.  Be a part of keeping the lights on for critical infrastructure needs; hospitals, manufacturing, schools, retail spaces and much more.

To learn more about our company view this video: https://youtu.be/pX1axYRSpYQ

G&W offers the following benefits:

  • Generous Profit Sharing with RRSP Program paid quarterly
  • 17 paid days including Christmas shutdown and vacation
  • Annual performance increases
  • Comprehensive Benefit Package including life insurance, health, dental and paramedical services (all paid by employer)
  • Education Tuition Assistance
  • Job Security
  • Succession Planning
  • Air-conditioned/heated state-of-the-art manufacturing facility
  • Wellness and Gym Reimbursement Programs
  • Training and Developmental Opportunities
  • Continuous Performance Feedback
  • Fun social events, holiday party, bowling nights, and many more.

G&W Canada Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, G&W Canada Corporation will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform G&W Canada Corporation's Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Quality Control Level II Inspector (Site)
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

The Western Industrial Region delivers solutions to a diverse customer base in Oil & Gas, Mining, Hydro, and Manufacturing across Canada’s four Western Provinces. Our business line includes Construction, Turnarounds & Maintenance, Commissioning, Fabrication and Engineering Services.

If you are a committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you.

We are seeking to fill a few QC Level II Inspector positions to be based at the CNRL Horizon Site in Northern Alberta. This is a temporary position to support an industrial construction turnaround project this May & June 2022. It will be a rotation of 10 days on & 4 days off at 10 hour days pre-shutdown and 24 days on & 4 days off at 12 hours per day through the Turnaround. Charter flights from Calgary or Edmonton and camp will be provided.

The Quality Control Level II Inspector is responsible for performing visual inspections, ensuring compliance with client specifications and the applicable codes & standards. The Quality Control Inspector will report to the Quality Control Lead. Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Ensure quality systems, processes and documentation employed on site comply with Corporate Policy
  • Understand and implement the Quality Management System on site and in the field
  • Assist Superintendents with addressing nonconformities by developing correction and/or corrective action plans and conducting root cause analyses as required
  • Maintain welder qualifications per ASME Section IX
  • Develop and Implement Inspection and Test Plans (ITP)
  • Provide support to mechanical completion and preparation of turnover packages
  • Coordinate third-party inspection activities
  • Review and sign off NDE Reports
  • Planning and conducting surveillance inspections in accordance with scheduling requirements
  • Document manufacturer’s production and quality processes; review required production tests, including methods, equipment used and calibration of equipment
  • Document compliance and non-compliance found during the inspection, and raise RFI to client for proper resolution
  • Reading and interpreting engineered drawings
  • Prepare clear, comprehensive records and reports as required
  • Oversee Non-Conformance Reports (NCRs) and Corrective Action Requests (CARs), and rework reporting from field to project management
  • Maintain suitable and accurate records for the welding, coating and other quality control requirements
  • Liaise with client inspectors on quality related issues
  • Liaise with the warehouse and Project Controls teams as required
  • Review awarded Construction Work Packages (CWPs), identify any deficiencies
  • Review scope of work and client documentation and raise Requests for Information (RFIs) as required.
  • Assist with development of Field Installation Work Packages (FIWPs) for projects
  • Check availability and application of correct welding procedures
  • Make random checks on welding procedure parameter; i.e. preheat, cool down procedures, travel speed, welding consumables, equipment output and records the result within your daily reports
  • Check that weld identification is occurring properly in accordance with the project approved Weld Numbering Procedure
  • Monitor visual inspections on finished welds
  • Inspect work for compliance with the contract plans and specifications, point out deficiencies and explain and take any corrective action needed

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable
  • Values and Respects Others

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • Certification as a CSA W178.2 Level II or III Welding Inspector
  • Certification as an API 510 / API 570 Inspector
  • CSTS-09/CSO/BSO/PST/SCOT
  • Fall Protection
  • Confined Space

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of Quality Control & Quality Assurance experience in the Industrial Construction industry
  • Trade certification as welder, pipefitter or boilermaker or technical (2 year college program in related discipline), 5 years of which will be in QA/QC or P. Eng. with 8 years’ experience in industrial construction, 5 years of which will be in QA/ QC
  • 3+ years’ experience working in Shutdown/Turnaround projects
  • Development of ITP’s
  • Maintain quality records and documents
  • Coordinating NDE, NDE requests and report review
  • Develop Hydrostatic test packages
  • Monitoring welding activities including interpass temperatures and parameters

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Organization and time management
  • Strong background in welding & fabrication is required
  • Experienced with ASME, API, ABSA and Alberta pressure equipment safety regulations
  • Extensive experience in development and implementation of ISO 9001 Quality Management Systems
  • Strong knowledge in CSA & ASME codes and standards is required​
  • Intermediate user of MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point)
  • Ability to drive a vehicle for work related purposes
  • Valid class 5 drivers' license (with clean 3-year abstract)

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Material Handler
description:
Woodbridge is a privately-owned company offering innovative material technologies for applications in automotive, commercial, recreational, packaging, healthcare and building products. In addition to manufacturing operations, the company also offers a full array of services including: chemical research and development, product and process engineering, tooling, technical support and accredited laboratory testing. Woodbridge operates more than 50 facilities across 10 countries—employing over 7,500 teammates and serving more than 600 customers worldwide.

 

MIDNIGHT SHIFT: Sunday - Thursday 11pm-7am

AFTERNOON SHIFT: Monday-Friday 3pm-11pm

GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB: Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Material Handler is responsible for servicing all manufacturing areas by bringing in and/or removing all materials, goods, products, equipment and/or devices as required ensuring a smooth and uninterrupted production flow.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: include the following, other duties may be assigned.

· Services work cells by bringing and removing production bins, removal of scrap material and retrieval of production supplies from warehouse.

· Responsible for general housekeeping including clearing of aisles, trailer dock areas, outer areas of production, the compactor, bailer and the removal of plant garbage.

· Operates all lift trucks and tugger in a safe manner with extra caution to be taken in regards to all other personnel as well as building structures, machinery, and equipment.

· Performs pre-operational checks of forklifts and tugger to ensure good operating condition.

· Sets priorities and organizes workload, keeping in mind efficiency as well as cleanliness and orderliness.

· Completes all necessary paperwork.

· Assists with production work, packaging and shipping/receiving as required.

· Adhere to all H&S, environmental laws and procedures

· All other duties/assignments required to support internal and external customers

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Strong attention to detail

Good hand-eye coordination

Must be well organized

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

Grade 12 diploma or equivalent

Previous forklift operation

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: From $18.91 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
Entrance screening protocols, mask requirement, handwashing/sanitizing, social distancing. Regular cleaning of surfaces throughout the day.

 

Explore your future. Apply today.


Woodbridge is committed to fostering a diverse workplace. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider employment applicants without regard to race, colour, ancestry, creed, place of origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other protected status. Please let us know if you require any special needs requirements. We will do our best to accommodate in accordance with local legislation.

title: Mold Maker/Tool and Die Maker
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

The Mold Maker is responsible for injection mold maintenance, repair and mechanical function. The successful candidate will be able to work in a team environment and have good problem solving skills. You will be able to handle multiple tasks on a daily basis with well-developed organization and time management skills

Responsibilities:
  • Disassembly & assembly of molds to repair and/or perform preventive maintenance.
  • Welding and spotting, micro and laser welding knowledge helpful.
  • High polish knowledge helpful
  • Perform daily/monthly trouble shooting, improvements,  PM, repairs, modifications on molds and auxiliary equipment;
  • Read and verify all critical information on the Work Order and on the drawings;
  • Able to operate lathe, milling machine, surface grinder, welding equipment, radial drilling machine independently;
  • Assemble and maintain hot runner systems;
  • Ensure that all the tools and fixtures are present at the workplace & ensure that the maintenance is done properly;
  • Experience in design and manufacturing End of Arms Tools;
  • Knowledge in robots, injection molding machines and their auxiliary equipment;
  • Ability to do repairs to texture surfaces.
Qualifications:
  • Must hold a ticket in Mold Making;
  • Must have experience in an injection molding facility;
  • Must have forklift and crane license;
  • Electrical/hydraulic and hot runners experience, an asset;
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills;
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment and able to work within tight deadlines.
Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Machine Operator
description:
C-P Flexible Packaging is a successful and fast-growing essential manufacturing company that uses an impressive array of digital pre-press and wide-web flexographic printing capabilities and extrusion and adhesive laminators to produce creative flexible packaging solutions for our customers. With a primary focus on serving the food industry, C-P specializes in roll stock, pouches, re-sealable packaging and shrink sleeves. Our headquarters and main manufacturing facility is located York, PA, with additional operations in Bristol, PA, Buffalo, NY, Lakeville, MN, and Aurora, Ontario.

We are looking for Weber Operators to join our Team in Aurora, Ontario.

 

Job Summary:

To produce excellent quality bags going to The Customer, following guidelines, provided by The Customer and to meet efficiency targets with minimal waste.

Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities:

  • Load rolls of material on to the bag making machine
  • Adjust machine for efficiencies and quality
  • Record daily production
  • Enter finished goods into the system
  • Responsible for own work plus co-ordinates the work of others, but without supervisory responsibilities.   
Other responsibilities include;
  • Run machine and fine tune
  • Checking score mark positions, drum finger pressure, position of drum finger, back clamp opening cam, cut-off speed, print movement
  • Set timing on gripper release cam, set tail bar timing, draw rollers, forwarding rollers, score blades, gusset wheels, P.I.V. for proper length
  • Set-up liner and laminator, bag carrier
  • Quality check
  • Production report
  • Make bags by hand
  • Understanding the concepts of Lamination
  • Complete tasks in adequate time limits, as to meet daily goal and schedule needs.
  • Complies with all general Company-wide standard operating procedures (SOP’s) and any job or department specific SOP’s.
    • SOP’s may cover the areas of (but are not limited to)
      • Employee Health and Safety
      • SQF (Safe Quality Food packager) and GMP (good manufacturing procedures) focused on eliminating contaminates in all packaging manufactured.
      • SGP (Sustainable Green Printer) environmental regulatory procedures and SOP’s
  • Must work within productivity standards and completes work
  • Special Projects & other duties as necessary
Qualifications:
  • Excellent math skills – mandatory (formulas)
  • Documentation (production, quality sheets)
  • Computer
  • Mechanical skills – mandatory
  • Trouble-shoot
  • Multi-task
  • Leadership
  • Attention to detail

Other knowledge, skills and abilities:

  • Ability to work well in a team environment.
  • Must demonstrate the ability to maintain confidentiality of information to Company and Federal standards.
  • Must be able to adapt to changes in the work environment, manage competing demands and be able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.
  • Must be dependable and work within Company conduct standards; consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.
  • Ability to effectively communicate with crew members and supervision, and delegate tasks accordingly.

Physical Demands:

  • Frequent lifting of 40 lbs avg.
  • Continuous standing
  • Very little sitting
  • Twisting – slightly
  • Back movement – constantly, continuous motion
  • Carrying – frequent, regular motion with pauses
  • Pulling –  on occasion, regular motion with pauses
  • Pushing – rare, regular motion with pauses
  • Ladder and stair climbing – frequent, regular motion with pauses, up to a maximum of 4 steps.

Working Conditions:

  • Concrete floors
  • Exposure to solvents during wash-ups– with use of proper PPE (minimal)
  • Noise – mandatory use of appropriate PPE
  • Ability to work in a non-air conditioned environment: hot conditions during summer months and cool conditions during winter months. (consistently)
  • Follow all safety regulations and rules at all times, including wearing all required personal protective equipment (PPE):
    • Steel tip boots or shoes
    • Gloves
    • Back Belt
    • Hearing protection
    • Safety glasses
    • Cut resistant gloves/solvent gloves
    • Hairnets and beard nets
 
In addition to the other advantages of working for C-P, we offer a compensation package that includes: competitive wages, as well as, night shift and weekend shift premiums.
 
Benefits Include
  • Employer paid medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage
  • Pension plan with generous company match
  • Bonus program
  • Paid vacation and personal days
  • Paid holidays
  • Life and AD&D insurance
  • Company paid short-term disability coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

title: Packaging Operator
description:
Responsible for packaging product and the loading/unloading of vans.

 

Core Functions:

Expectations of the EOF Packaging Operator:

  • Full knowledge of and compliance with all safety policies and procedures. 
  • Full knowledge of and compliance with related Good Manufacturing Practices.
  • Full knowledge of and compliance with the EOF Work Instructions Manual.
  • Ensure that equipment is kept clean and in good working order to achieve highest efficiency.
  • Fill and seal containers as required.
  • Load and unload packaged and other product from and into vans.
  • Inspect vans, supplies, ingredients, and finished product.
  • Rotate in packaging group as required.
  • Clean in EOF according to assigned cleaning duties.
  • Perform minor maintenance on equipment as assigned.
  • Perform any other related duties as required ie: overtime or extra shifts
  • Report any non-compliance to supervision immediately.

 

Team Responsibilities:

  • Communicate effectively with operations supervisor, operators, logistics, laboratory and maintenance personnel.
  • Display positive image and maintain customer focus when dealing with outside groups such as carriers, suppliers, etc.

 

Skill/Experience Requirements:

  • Grade 12 education or equivalent.
  • Forklift driver’s license.
  • Good mechanical aptitude.
  • Good computer / keyboard skills
  • Able to consistently lift up to 22.7 kg.
  • Valid class 5 Manitoba driver’s license.
  • Must be able to work from heights and in confined spaces.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both oral and written.

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

 

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Production Assembler
description:
Resolution Staffing Inc. is looking for 2 reliable and dependable Assemblers. These positions are located in the Peterborough. We are currently seeking individuals that can work a straight days shift. Energetic team players who are detail-oriented and have a great attitude are encouraged to apply.

Qualifications:

  • Detail-oriented
  • Previous experience using power tools would be an asset
  • Ensuring product meets quality standards
  • Ability to work in a team
  • Able to work in a fast paced environment
  • Good hand dexterity
  • Previous manufacturing experience would be an asset
  • Must be able to read a tape measure

Excellent opportunity for full time permanent work with a great company located in Peterborough.

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$19.00 per hour

title: Brake Press Operator
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Machine Operator for our Saskatoon Manufacturing Facility.This position is responsible for efficient operation of CNC cutting machines including plasma and laser as well as the operator related maintenance.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Program simple cuts on the Machine
  • Efficiently operate and maintain plasma and laser cutting equipment
  • Ensure production schedule for machine is adhered to
  • Report any programming /software issues immediately to supervisor and/or programmer
  • Maintain cleanliness and organization of work area up to Brandt standards
  • Must be available to work various shifts as workload requires
  • Work overtime as required
  • Ensure machine is in optimal working condition at all times.
  • Achieve efficient flow of materials into and out of the machine
  • Follow the PM Schedule as defines by the manufacturer
  • Ability to read drawings / blueprints
  • Must be able to work in a steel fabrication shop environment
  • Must be able to work independently
  • Fluent in English
  • Familiar with 5S / lean principles
  • Motivated to learn and improve
  • Positive attitude with an attitude for problem solving
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Grade 12 or equivalent
  • Experience operating CNC plate and tube cutting equipment in a metal fabrication plant.
  • Preference to Trumpf and Messer equipment.

title: Machine Operator
description:
Machine operator, Brake and Sheer, bending metal parts into shape. Position is with a steel manufacturing company in Richmond Hill. It's a tight knit company with leadership that cares. We are looking for people with experience working with metal or using a press brake machine.

Job Title: Machine Operator
Location: Richmond Hill (close to Elgin Mills and Yonge)
Shift: Straight Days, Monday to Friday
Pay: $20-$22

Advantages
- Permanent opportunity
- Uniform provided at 3 months
- Health allowance: $1,000
- Free Parking
- Day shifts
- Transit accessible (Newkirk Rd between Elgin Mills and Crosby in Richmond Hill)

Responsibilities
- Press Brake Machine operation
- Sheet metal forming
- Accurately measure
- Completing daily production
- Other duties

Qualifications
- 1-2 years experience with metal manufacturing or press brake operator experience
- Good with measurements
- Mechanically inclined
- Lift up to 50 lbs

Summary
If you're interested in this Machine Operator position, please apply directly or call/email with the subject line: "Steel"

Lead recruiter contact information:
Jordan Dewit
jordan.dewit@randstad.ca
416-557-4018

This fabrication job is located in Richmond Hill, but we have other similar roles in Markham, North York, Concord, Auora and New Market. Please get in touch if you are looking for a job in production, manufacturing, or fabrication.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Manufacturing Technician
description:
Today, as many as 25 million medical professionals globally don’t have access to medical imaging, which is proven to improve patient care and reduce healthcare costs. That’s why we’re on a mission to make medical imaging accessible everywhere by delivering high-performance, affordable, and easy-to-use solutions powered by artificial intelligence and connected to the cloud.


By making Clarius your next career move, you’re joining a team of 130+ people who are talented, innovative, and highly collegial. You’re also joining a community that includes thousands of physicians worldwide who use Clarius to deliver better patient care – nearly two million high-definition exams have been performed using Clarius! And you’re joining a remarkable team that’s hitting it out of the park.


As our Manufacturing Technician, you will have the opportunity to help build ultrasound scanners for medical professionals. This includes performing a variety of repetitive and non-repetitive assembly operations in the production of our medical devices. Your work includes building the assemblies which require the use of small hand tools, microscopes and other measuring equipment. 


You will

  • Assemble components of ultrasound scanners and transducers 
  • Inspect as per the engineering specification 
  • Ensure all training requirements are in a current status 
  • Comply with ISO and other standards with regard to material labeling, SOPs and proper segregation of material in the production process 
  • Demonstrate an understanding of the Quality System 
  • Adhere to production schedules and report material shortages 
  • Clean and maintain work area properly turn off equipment when not in use 


You bring

  • Some experience in assembly involving small components
  • Ability to read and understand assembly drawings, procedures and part lists 
  • Familiar working in ISO accredited facilities 
  • Soldering skills are desirable 
  • Some basic experience and ability to routinely use a microscope 
  • Great hand to hand and hand to eye coordination 
  • Good attention to detail 
  • Excellent team player willing to pitch in to help wherever needed 

Requirements:

None

title: Injection Packer
description:
Here at KP Building Products, our employees are at the forefront of everything we do. We are the leading Canadian manufacturer and distributor of vinyl siding and strive to be the best in customer experience. We are a company rich in history and proud to be Canadian owned and operated. The goal is to produce high quality parts and materials by programming machines to perform the right operations.

The Injection Packer packages injected molded product for customer delivery.

Shifts: 12h continental shifts

We offer:

  • Health and Dental benefits
  • RRSP
  • Ongoing training initiatives
  • Yearly Safety Boot Allowance
  • Prescription Safety Glasses Allowance
  • Vacation & paid time off

Responsabilities:

  • Operating plastic injection molding machines and inspecting product
  • Degate, trim, or do additional secondary operations
  • Package product to customer requirements, label product containers with proper ID labels identifying molding problems, and notify Molding Technician for corrections
  • Perform assembly of product as directed, complete daily production activity log, maintain stable mold cycle, and maintain a clean work area
  • Participate in training as required by the company
  • Adhere to all applicable company policies and procedures, including quality and health and safety
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements:

  • High school diploma or GED equivalent preferred
  • One (1) year relevant experience, ideally in plastic manufacturing
  • Attention to detail
  • Good hand/eye dexterity and ability to cross-train into other areas
  • High level of integrity and work ethic
  • Ability to follow instructions from supervisor
  • Ability to work in a team environment

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who fit the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Welder - 2
description:
Interested in working for a well-established company, leader in its field, where you will have access to unique career opportunities and skill development? If so, this opportunity could be for you!

 

Workland is excited to present you with a great opportunity to work in the manufacturing sector for one of our clients located in the Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu area.

Based on the South Shore of Montreal, our client is in full expansion and is looking for a Welder, passionate about assembling metal products, to join their team.

 

WHY SHOULD YOU BE INTERESTED IN THIS OPPORTUNITY? 

  1. Work for a well established company, leader in its industry 
  2. Dynamic & engaged team
  3. Being part of a creative and growing company
  4. Quicker access to career opportunities
  5. Continuous training and development of your skills
  6. Enjoy a good work/life balance
  7. A family business culture where you will feel at home
  8. Enjoy a relaxed and friendly work environment

 

YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE:

Under the supervision of the team leader of his department, the incumbent is responsible for the realization and the assembly by welding of components and manufactured products. He/she is accountable for the quality of his/her work and productivity in order to deliver high quality products on time while applying the procedures and policies established by the company.

  • Produces compliant products according to the requirements of the job to which he/she is assigned and the applicable welding standards;
  • Applies metallurgical concepts (torsion, temperature distribution, etc.);
  • Interprets, plans and specifications to produce assemblies of average complexity;
  • Performs visual inspection of parts before sending them to the thermics;
  • Uses the different shaping equipment;
  • Participates in the maintenance and repair of welding machines;
  • Ensures the efficiency of his work in order to meet the required deadlines;
  • Raises any problems encountered during the course of his/her work with his/her immediate superior;
  • Works in a manner that respects the premises, individuals and tools;
  • Keeps his/her work area clean at all times;
  • Respects the rules of health and safety at work.

 

REQUIREMENTS FOR THIS POSITION ARE:

  • DEP in welding or equivalent experience;
  • General knowledge of our products and manufacturing methods;
  • Have a minimum of 3 to 8 years experience in welding or other related field;
  • Hold a CWB in aluminum and/or steel welding with a minimum of 2 GF;
  • Read blueprints and drawings ;
  • Demonstrate execution skills with minimal supervision;
  • Ability to work in a team environment.

 

Skills/Competencies

  • Reliability, being trustworthy, dependable and responsible to one's obligations;
  • Self-control, in difficult situations, being able to keep one's temper and emotions;
  • Stress tolerance, effective in dealing with stressful situations.

 

******

ABOUT WORKLAND

Workland's mission is to solve recruitment and job search challenges through the judicious combination of technology and human creativity. The ultimate goal is to accelerate and facilitate the match between the best talents and the right organizations, through an approach supporting diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace.

title: Raw Materials Scheduler
description:
Company Description

Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We’ve built something great, something special – an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. Our purpose-based platform HUMANATURE and philosophy that humans are a part of nature and nature is a part of us informs everything we do. From the materials we use to the products we make, everything is meticulously crafted and built to last. At Canada Goose we endure any condition, observe every detail, and take the long view in order to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm.

Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities:

  • Establish RM Shipping Schedule to contractors and in-house factories on a monthly basis. Coordinate changes in the schedule with Supply Chain, Logistics and QA to align with business needs
  • Coordinate with Replenishment Planning, Inventory Control and QA for RMs that will potentially cause MPO delays if not available/ released on time.
  • Maintain the RM Backorder files and ensure that RM balances are fulfilled within the required period
  • Review the weekly Status Report from CMTs and identify potential risks and delays due to RM issues
  • Attend MDI, Production and weekly CMT status meeting
  • Responds to contractors on material queries
  • Responds to requirements of materials and trims for both in house and contractors
  • In coordination with Production Analysts, verify with PD/PE material consumptions, BOM issues and revisions/changes
  • Follow-up material issuance of PPS. Ensure that the PPS Tracking Log is maintained, and that Contractors get their cut-goods and materials for their pre-production samples.
  • Inform Planning team on any material availability issues that will affect production and finished goods delivery, and help provide information on Styles/ MPOs/units potentially affected
  • Performs other duties as required by her superiors.

Experience, Education and Designations:

  • Degree in Engineering  or other related course
  • 2 to 3 years  experience in production planning and materials control in a garment manufacturing

Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:

  • Excellent MS Office skills
  • ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) software experience
  • Excellent written and verbal English skills (other languages an asset)
  • Highly detail-oriented, organized and able to multi-task
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Ability to prioritize, multi-task, operate proactively, work as a team and handle challenges.
  • Excellent common sense, decision-making abilities, interpersonal and analytical skills.
  • Ability to evaluate options and generate solutions.
  • Confident, articulate, organized, detail oriented, goal oriented, self-motivated and hard working.

Working Conditions:

  • Office and Manufacturing Environment

title: Technician in quality control
description:
roles and responsibilities

The holder of this position:

  • sees the application and compliance with procedures and controls of programs HACCP and SQF on production areas to maintain food security;
  • Complete HACCP and SQF registers (pre-operational inspection, departments temperatures, CCP surveillance, etc.);
  • Check the application and compliance with product specifications compared to contaminants and non -conformities;
  • perform the organoleptic assessment of products;
  • check Products and trailers before shipping;

  • New employees on good manufacturing practices and HACCP / SQF procedures and performs training monitoring already in place
  • collaborates A Vec different stakeholders internal and external to the prevention and regulation of DACs and ensures the application of the action plan on production areas;
  • informs and supports supervisors and ensures a relationship of Confidence with ACIA;
  • All other related tasks.

    Food transformation or other relevant training;

aptitudes

title: Electronics Mechanical Assembler (Temporary)
description:
One team. Global challenges. Infinite opportunities. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.

Job Responsibilities

As an Electronics Mechanical Assembler you are responsible for technical functions in support of production and repair activities such as electro-mechanical assembly. You will utilize schematics, engineering drawings, verbal instructions, change notices, and parts lists to inspect for updates and verify assembly revisions. Another facet of your work will be completing Electro-Mechanical assembly and refurbishment of complex communication equipment, stand-alone chassis, and cable harness assemblies.

Requirements
•1 to 2 years electronic assembly/rework experience in a manufacturing/repair environment or equivalent education 
•Experience working with top-level chassis assemblies and circuit card modules  
•Experience with coaxial, ribbon, and discrete wire and cables. 
•Ability to read and process work orders, assembly instructions, assembly drawings and bill of materials. 
•Good mechanical skills, knowledge of hand tools, crimp tools and torque tools and ability to use power screw drivers, torque driver and other assembly tools 
•Excellent written and verbal communication skills
•Proficient computer skills 
•Knowledge of ESD procedures 
•High School or GED
•US government position. US citizenship required.


To learn more about this site and other office locations, please click here!

title: Quality Technician (FT)
description:
To be successful in this role, you should be familiar with various inspection procedures. Part of your responsibility will be to perform audits for all of our internal systems identifying issues and recommending solutions. If you hold a degree or certification in engineering or quality assurance and have a great attention to detail, this is for you!

QA Technicians / Inspectors are responsible for identifying all issues and getting to the root of the problem, proactively recommending solutions that’ll improve product durability and overall performance.

Responsibilities:
  • Monitor the entire production cycle and perform regular tests to identify potential malfunctions as early as possible.
  • Inspect in coming and out going product for defects and durability.
  • Identify the root cause issues and recommend fixes.
  • Prepare reports on non-conformance and corrective actions.
  • Review current quality documentation on production floor and create new documents as needed for consistence.
  • Work with internal teams to increase customer satisfaction by improving the quality of the products.

Requirements:
  • Previous work experience as a Quality Engineer/ inspector or similar role.
  • Hands-on experience with Quality Management Systems (QMS) and testing methodologies.
  • In-depth understanding of technical documentation.
  • Great attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
  • Team spirit.
  • Good analytical skills.
  • Familiar with Microsoft applications.
  • BSc in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering or relevant field.
  • Additional certification in Quality Assurance is a plus.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent.

COVID-19 considerations:
Eastside ensures all staff follow all safety protocols to prevent the spread of COVID-19




    About Eastside Industrial Coatings and Composites :

    Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fibreglass and metal components for local OEMs.As the coatings business continued to grow with a focus on “A” Finish coatings, Eastside Industrial moved to a larger location (our current space), committed to diversifying into composites manufacturing and expanding our customer base throughout the continent.Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.We remain a family owned business focused on growing our team and developing our team to have a successful future with Eastside or a member of the Eastside Group.

title: CNC Machine Operator (FT)
description:
About the Company:
Redwood Plastics and Rubber, https://www.redwoodplastics.com/, manufactures and distributes many grades of industrial plastic and rubber. We have in-house engineering and fabrication to produce custom components that often replace steel, aluminum, and wood for longer wear life, decreased downtime, increased production, lighter weight, cost effectiveness and increased safety.

About the Job:
We are growing and hiring CNC Operators to work on our CNC machining and turning equipment in our plant in Langley. Responsibilities include: 
  • Read and interpret drawings, work orders and other written instructions.
  • Operate CNC machines and other production tools and equipment.
  • Maintain quality and safe work practices
  • Other duties as required.

Shifts: We have 2 shifts available, permanent not rotation. Day Shift: Monday through Thursday: 5:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Afternoon Shift: Monday through Thursday: 3:00 p.m. to 1:30 a.m.

Skills and Experience:
  • 2+ years of manufacturing experience.
  • Experience operating CNC machines.
  • Physically fit and able to lift, stand for extended periods, bend, etc.
  • Good knowledge of quality controls and occupational safety standards.
  • Skilled at reading drawings and following manuals.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
The Norwood Sawmills team is growing! We’re looking for a positive, enthusiastic, reliable person to fill a full-time Warehouse Associate role at our Canadian head office just south of Orillia, Ontario. The Warehouse Associates have a variety of roles and may be expected to receive, package and/or ship our sawmills to our resourceful customers around the world.


Norwood is looking for an energetic, conscientious individual who:

  • enjoys working in a team,
  • values delivering a high-quality product to the customer on time, and
  • appreciates working efficiently hands-on in an active environment in a continuous state of growth
  • has an infallible positive and energetic attitude
  • is someone of high integrity and honesty
  • takes pride in the quality of their work
  • works constructively in a team environment and independently


About Norwood
Norwood is an outdoor equipment lifestyle brand company and leading designer and manufacturer of portable sawmills sold throughout North America and in over 100 countries worldwide. Our mission is to empower resourceful people everywhere to build their best futures through wood and their natural environment. For more information visit www.NorwoodSawmills.com and 
www.FrontierSawmills.com   

Available shifts

Monday to Friday 7 am - 4:30pm


Responsibilities

  • Adhere to, and promote, the Norwood Values.
  • Interact fellow Norwood team members, customers and suppliers in a positive, constructive, courteous, timely and professional manner.
  • Always work in a safe manner and consistently be mindful of safety owed to yourself, fellow team-members and to visitors.
  • Efficiently and accurately place parts in bags and/or boxes, bags into bins, and boxes onto pallets.
  • Keep warehouse organized and consolidate parts to ensure optimum use of bins and racking.
  • Pick parts for the production lines in an orderly and timely fashion to keep the lines fed. Put parts away in correct location when production runs are complete.
  • Ensure all bins and skids are labelled correctly.
  • Remove empty skids and bins as necessary.
  • Ensure all skids are wrapped and secure prior to putting away up in the racking.
  • Pay attention to detail to consistently ensure the correct parts, and quantity of parts, are packaged.
  • Always handle parts and finished goods carefully to ensure they suffer no damage.
  • Look for new ways to improve efficiency, packaging quality, inspections/quality-control, preservation of part quality and improve safety, and communicate to superiors your suggestions.
  • Keep clean and tidy your workspace, and contribute to keeping clean all common areas including production, storage and corridor/movement areas, shipping office, kitchen and bathrooms.
  • Learn, respect and follow instructions, procedures and guidelines.
  • Perform such other duties that may be assigned as required.


The successful candidate will be expected to:

  • Always work in a safe manner and consistently be mindful of their safety and the safety of fellow team-members,
  • Multi-task in a busy environment
  • Maintain a good attention to detail when performing repetitive tasks
  • Handle heavy and awkward items
  • Work closely with the Supervisor and Purchaser to monitor supply levels and advise of irregular amounts of inventory.
  • Keep the work, storage and production areas clean and organized at all times.
  • Look for new ways to improve efficiency, packaging quality, inspection and preservation of part quality and improve safety, and communicate to superiors your suggestions.
  • Learn, respect and follow procedures and guidelines.


Qualifications:

  • Experience working in packaging and distribution environments
  • Grade 12 education
  • Experience working in environments that actively practice LEAN manufacturing, an asset
  • Forklift Certification, an asset


  • Competitive starting wage
  • Benefits, including health and dental


We thank you for your interest in our position! Only those applicants who are selected for interviews will be contacted. We are committed to providing equal opportunities for persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process, at the 'candidate's request.

title: CNC Operator
description:
Brannon Steel is looking for an experienced CNC Operator to join the afternoon shift (Monday to Friday, 3pm to 11pm) at its Brampton manufacturing facility. Starting from $22.54 to $25.38 per hour depending on experience PLUS up to $2 per hour in afternoon shift premiums, you'll operate one or more CNC vertical machining centers in a busy production environment processing large runs of carbon steel parts for world-class OEMs.

Responsibilities

  • Setup, operate and troubleshoot one or more Mazak CNC VMCs based on assigned schedule.
  • Monitor machine functions and act promptly to correct errors.
  • Perform part prep and machine loading / unloading.
  • Handle steel parts manually and using hoists.
  • Read and interpret drawings, machine programs, and production documents.
  • Perform thorough visual and dimensional checks to ensure parts meet specifications.
  • Perform basic machine maintenance such as cleaning, monitoring fluid levels and emptying chip collector.
  • Complete production and quality documents.
  • Successful completion of a Mechanical Engineering Technologist or similar program.
  • 3+ years of practical experience operating CNC VMCs.
  • Easily read and interpret technical drawings and specifications.
  • Skilled in the use of basic and precision measuring tools.
  • Fluent in both imperial and metric systems.
  • Carry out written instructions accurately and consistently.
  • Read and interpret G-code.
  • Perform intermediate math.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs).
  • Speak, read, and write English at a conversational level.
  • Able to work an afternoon shift (Monday-Friday, 3pm-11pm).
  • Service award program including travel vouchers for $3,000, $5,000, and $10,000 for 10, 20, and 30 years of service.
  • Group RRSP program with contribution matching up to 5% of regular annual earnings.
  • Up to $2 per hour in afternoon shift premiums.
  • Overtime after 40 hours per week.
  • Full-time, permanent work at a stable, family-owned company.
  • Company-supplied tools and equipment, uniforms, safety boots, and prescription safety glasses.
  • Air-conditioned CNC room with well-maintained machines.
  • Extended health coverage including prescriptions, paramedical expenses, and emergency travel assistance.
  • Dental coverage including preventive, diagnostic, and treatment services.
  • Short and long-term disability insurance.
  • Life and AD&D insurance.
  • Employee & family assistance program.
  • A friendly work environment where people support each other.
  • Annual golf tournament, summer barbeques and more!
  • Comprehensive COVID-19 safety plan in place.

title: Packaging Associate
description:
With Staff Management | SMX, you'll get a weekly paycheck, learn new skills, meet new people, and work with a great management team in a clean and safe environment.


IMMEDIATE OPENINGS! We are hiring night shift packing associates for our Premier Chocolate Manufacturing Client in Newmarket! Earn up to $18.00 an hour, get paid weekly. Join our amazing team in a clean, safe environment!


.


Perks & Benefits: Weekly paychecks, Sign on Bonus (Restrictions Apply), Climate Controlled Environment.


Shifts: All Shifts, 3rd Shift.


Employment Types: Full Time, Part Time.


Pay Rate: $17.00 - $18.00 / hour


Duties:

As a packaging associate, you'll have direct impact on customer satisfaction. This is light assembly work that requires you to count with accuracy and do repetitive motions with your arms and hands. You will also follow Good Manufacturing Practices to ensure our sweet, savory product has been packed in a safe and sanitary manner.


.


Position Requirements:

To join our team, you must be able to lift up to 35lbs, have CSA safety boots and stand for the duration of a 12 hr shift. You also must be 18 years or older and have reliable transportation. Come see how it's made with Staff Management and Apply today! Apply at office0904@staffmanagement.com today!


Requirements: Background Check, Stand for Shift Duration, Must be at least 18 years old.Able to Lift 49 pounds., required education: No Education Requirement.


Work Location: Staff Management, Newmarket, ON L3Y7B3.


Job Types: General Labor, General Production, General Warehouse, Hand Packaging, Manufacturing, Picker/Packer, Warehouse.


Industry: Manufacturing.
SM | SMX is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, sexual orientation, age, gender identification, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Welder
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

Welders are responsible for completing the physical construction of structural steel components related to the manufacturing of modular buildings, primarlily steel frames, decks and roof sections. 

Reporting to the Welding Supervisor, Welders are expected to have the ability to perform the following job functions:

  • Gas metal arc welding (GMAW)
  • Shielded metal arc welding (SMAW)
  • Flux-core arc welding (FCAW)
  • Grinding, cutting, priming, etc..
  • Other duties as required
  • The Welder works in safe manner to meet production schedules with a high degree of quality workmanship.  
Qualifications

  • Minimum high school graduation diploma required.
  • Completion of a post-secondary program in welding will be considered an asset.
  • The ability to follow directions with a minimum of supervision
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time in hot conditions
  • Welders must undergo periodic testing by a recognized source such as the CWB in order to maintain certifications in all-position welding.

Continuing education and apprenticeships are encouraged to increase knowledge base.

Note:  all candidates must be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. 



Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.']

title: Vessel Welder/Fitter
description:
VESSEL WELDER/FITTER

Startec Compression & Process Solutions is a thriving privately owned company headquartered in Calgary that produces custom mission-critical compression and refrigeration systems for various industries. Startec devotes its industry-leading expertise in refrigeration & compression technologies to solving its clientsâ€™ most technically challenging needs.  We create reliable solutions for extreme operating conditions and provide exceptional service, a cornerstone of our business.

REPORTS TO:

Vessel Supervisor

 

SUMMARY:

As a Vessel Welder/Fitter, your responsibilities include fitting and welding metal pressure vessels based on drawings provided, using techniques that adhere to all specifications for vessels, piping, and welding assembly.

 

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:     

  • Must have experience with fabrication and welding of pressure vessels
  • Read prints, layout, fit, and weld as required
  • Experience with SMAW, GMAW, FCAW/CTAW weld processes
  • Maintain a safe and organized work environment.
  • Rigging along with the use of overhead and jib cranes

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Journeyman trades certificate (preferably welding or pipe fitting)
  • 2 years of experience in vessel welding/fitting is required
  • B-Pressure Certificate
  • Previous experience working in a manufacturing environment is considered an asset
  • Ability to pass a pre-employment functional, alcohol, and drug

We offer competitive wages, training, flexible, dynamic, and exciting work environment.

We thank you for your application and interest in our organization. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Jr Quality Engineer
description:
Job Number: 44428 
Group: Magna Seating  
Division: Cam-Slide Mfg. Newmarket 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: NEWMARKET 


Group Description

Magna is an innovative leader in the development and manufacturing of high quality complete seating systems. Our solution includes seating structures, mechanisms and hardware, as well as foam and trim products for global automotive, heavy truck and bus industries. Our capabilities include market and consumer research; full concept development; design and engineering capabilities; testing, validation and world-class manufacturing. Our award-winning seating solutions are developed from consumer research, finding the ease of operation to be comfortable, convenient and connected.

 

Hiring Recent Graduates!

Role Summary

The Jr. Quality Engineer is assigned to a team that will head-up one or more product launches or improvement projects. The Jr. Quality Engineer ensures that all quality requirements are addressed. These requirements include all controls required to monitor the process, relevant documentation, verification, capability studies, and all improvements required to be implemented so that jobs run in accordance with Quality standards. The overall function of this position is to develop stable and controlled Quality processes for implementation in the production process.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conduct various testing as per control plan requirements
  • Assist Quality Engineers preparing APQP documentation
  • Conduct components and assembly measurements
  • Support Corrective Action Reports for customer and internal concerns
  • Assist Quality Engineers to prep control plants and inspection instructions
  • Test lab part analysis
  • Run capability studies using Minitab and report to Quality Engineer
  • Assist Quality Engineers prepare PPAP submissions and maintain documentation in an organized manner
  • Assist Quality Engineers review and disposition supplier PPAP’s
  • Develop Quality Alerts for various customer, internal and supplier issues
  • Assist and support the Quality Engineers with their shop floor support for both internal and supplier issues
  • Update and maintain quality performance charts
  • Take part in quality training functions as required
  • Maintain customer, company and supplier confidentiality
  • Actively participate and support 5S activities and initiatives
  • Other duties as required by the Quality Supervisor
  • Adhering to all IATF 16949 policies and procedures
  • Must comply with all ISO 14001 (Environmental) and OHSAS 18001 (Health and Safety) systems and standards as it pertains to their work
  • Abide by all AODA and C-TPAT procedures that apply to their position

Key Qualifications/Requirements

  • We encourage recent Engineering Graduates to apply!
  • Must be an assertive team player
  • Willing to learn
  • Strong organizational skills
  • SPC knowledge
  • Blue print reading and GDT knowledge
  • Excellent communication skills (Verbal and written)

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: Production Assembly Operator
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

We are currently looking to fill Production Assembly Operator positions for our DAY and Afternoon shfit.  

Day Shift 6:00 am - 2:30 pm

Afternoon Shift 3:30 pm - 2:00 am (3:30 pm - Midnight, Fridays)

 

 

Responsibilities:

â€¢ All work must be performed in a safe, efficient manner in compliance with Company Policy, local, provincial and/or federal rules and regulations;
â€¢ Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed;
â€¢ Produces components by following work instructions to assemble parts;
â€¢ Inspects parts visually for obvious defects and component verification;
â€¢ Install lights, harnesses, and/or other components to molded/painted parts as required;
â€¢ Packs finished products in racks, bags, cardboard boxes, dunnage and totes;
â€¢ Label parts ensuring label accuracy;
â€¢ Maintains work area, cleans and replenishes parts as required;
â€¢ Ensures all parts are labeled properly following plant wide colour coding system.

â€¢ Personnel performing work affecting product quality shall be competent on the basis of on-going training, appropriate education, skills and experience;
â€¢ Performs other duties as required by managers to keep pace with changes in scope of work.

Qualifications:

â€¢ Grade 12 education or equivalent experience in a manufacturing environment

â€¢ Good communication (Read and comprehend instructions)
â€¢ Organizational and dexterity skills
â€¢ Attention to detail
â€¢ Knowledge of components and materials used in the production process
â€¢ Ability to read colour
â€¢ Basic Computer skills
â€¢ Working positions change from standing to bending and lifting up to 30lbs.  
â€¢ Exposure to health hazards: dust, forklift noise with racks
â€¢ Exposure to heat in the summer months

Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€

title: Quality Technician
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Quality Technician at our Stoney Creek facilities.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

  • Reports to Assistant Quality Manager or designate
  • Consistent Communication of Safety, Quality, and Delivery Issues
  • To develop and report out on Quality of Product using statistical techniques
  • Audit and inspect production processes & parts for proper adherence to pre-assigned quality systems
  • To be familiar with and practice and promote all aspects of the ISO9001:2015 and IATF 16949 Quality System and Health & Safety policies.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform Statistical analysis of product and process to drive improvements and reduce scrap.
  • Monthly report out of dimensional Statistical data for all product lines. (CpK/PpK)
  • Complete Process Performance Studies, assist with onsite Gauge R & R Studies, Product Capability studies, assist in mark up prints, etc.
  • Complete and perform Audits of operator process review for following procedures with report out to QE"s and recommended actions on a monthly basis.
  • Complete Audits of work instructions, provide recommendations for improvement in both how they are written and if the operators are following the current work instructions.
  • Assist with the development of new work instructions with Process Engineers and Quality Engineers.
  • Complete Quality Alerts and assist in expanding or developing Quality Alert process.
  • Help in the coordination and facilitation of APQP's activities and prepare all necessary documentation
  • Complete Process Performance Studies, assist with onsite Gauge R & R Studies, mark up prints, etc.
  • Assist with the completion of Shift Reports
  • Assist with reviewing and completing, document and communicate First Offs and In Process inspection when required
  • Support Overtime Needs for Production and launch activities as needed - back up to assist with Quality Auditors
  • Develop and complete MSA on gauges in accordance with customer specific requirements.
  • Assist QE's with Reviewing Supplier PPAP's when needed
  • Work with SQE to assist suppliers to develop new programs
  • Complete special projects, with full reports and submission to management.
  • Review programs for continuous improvement
  • Assist in the initiation and complete Root cause analysis on all verbal and written customer concerns
  • Assist in the development, construction and evaluation of all fixtures and gauges
  • Assist in the maintenance of Quarantine Area
  • Incoming inspection of supplier components when applicable
  • May be required to visit supplier locations
  • Develop and maintain all quality records
  • Other duties as assigned by Assistant Quality Manager or designate
  • ISO9001:2015 AND IATF 16949 duties as required

Qualifications:

Education Required

College Diploma (Mechanical / Industrial / Quality or

Chemical Engineering, C.Q.T.)

Training Required

PFMEA, Control Plan, SPC, and Corrective action process.

Skills Required

Minitab data analysis (CPK/PPK)

Equivalent Experience

Minimum 1 year of experience in a hands-on technical/quality manufacturing role

Exposure to injection moulding, painting and assembly

Exposure to IATF16949 procedures

Experience in computer systems (Windows, Microsoft Office, Macros and Data base)

Experience with working with customers such as Ford, GM, and Chrysler


Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

hr@tiercon.com

.

title: Quality Control Supervisor
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Summary & Responsibilities:

The Quality Control Supervisor will audit the manufacturing and product inspection practices for our various pipe mill processes. This position will interact with the operations department on a daily basis to ensure that a high quality product is produced as efficiently and safely as possible. A part of the job will be to interacting with mill personnel at all levels, but primary interactions will be with shop floor personnel and mid-level management. This person will be involved in team-oriented problem solving efforts as opportunities present themselves.

  • Perform periodic process and product audits (first piece validation, shift change, etc) to ensure conformance with documented work procedures.  Document audit results

  • Monitor audit trends specific to the manufacturing lines and communicate issues to QA and Operations. Specify improvement opportunities.

  • As required, participate in TPG internal and external audit functions (supplier quality)

  • Provide dispositions for coil (Apply and Test, etc), in-process pipe or finished pipe product on quality hold

  • Provide technical assistance for shop floor quality issues relating to bare pipe manufacturing or coating application.  Provide assistance “bracketing” pipe during process upsets

  • Inspect product returns associated with product claims

  • Work with quality management to develop/improve written inspection procedures, as needed

  • Develop recommendations concerning reactions to problems with inspection data and work with the operating department to limit the manufacturing of non-compliant product in each production area

  • Participate, as needed, in quality improvement projects including following trials, analyzing results, collecting shop floor data, etc.

  • Provide leadership in developing and maintaining safe work operating and inspection practices

  • Liaise with QA Management to manage incoming inspection issues and field investigation issues

  • Participate in the development of training literature for quality inspectors

Requirements:

  • 1-5 years of experience in QA or operations within an industrial manufacturing environment

  • University Engineering degree in Metallurgical/Materials or Mechanical disciplines (preferred) 

  • Knowledge of metals based manufacturing processes, including mechanical, metallurgical and Chemical testing procedures an asset

  • Academic training in metallography, metallurgy, heat treating, or NDT an asset.

  • Knowledge of ASTM and API testing requirements is preferred.

  • Must understand API 5CT / API Q1 quality standards and Quality Management Systems (QMS).  Knowledge of quality control planning for new products is a plus.

  • Experience working with interdepartmental teams at all levels of management to accomplish goals

  • Mechanical aptitude, good manual dexterity and good hand eye coordination

  • Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook; ability to learn other software applications

  • Strong interpersonal skills; ability to interact with individuals at various levels within the organization

  • Excellent communication skills, ability to effectively present project results to management team

  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize responsibilities and work independently with minimal supervision

  • Strong attention to detail, close observation and concentration skills

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!
