title: Inventory / Material Handler - Afternoon shift
description:
If you’re looking for a special place to build or grow your career, you’ve found it. Whether you’re an experienced professional, a recent college graduate or somewhere in between, IDEX is a place where you can apply your existing skills and learn new ones in an environment where you can make an impact. With interesting opportunities in engineering, marketing, sales, supply chain, operations, HR, finance, and more across more than 40 diverse businesses (https://www.idexcorp.com/our-businesses/business-segments/) around the globe, chances are, we have something special for you. Job overview: Responsibilities will include order picking, work order tracking and closing, cycle count, material handling, order fulfillment and packaging. Hours of work: Afternoon shift Monday - Thursday (3:45pm to 1:45am) Specific responsibilities will include: + Receive shipments from delivery couriers, and ensure their accuracy + Enter packing slips into our ERP system to document the receipt of each shipment and maintain adequate records for reporting and tracking + Package parts for shipping using a variety of supplies, including metal band cutting and Flash Packer + Pick parts from stock for shipping. + Communicate with planners / production associates to maintain & replenish supermarket inventory levels + Pre-picking machine projects & creating shortage reports + Receiving and reconciling completed work orders + Stocking inventory + Cycle counting + General housekeeping of warehouse area The successful candidate will possess the following education and competencies: + Grade 12 diploma or equivalent experience is required + 2-3 years of related inventory control experience + Previous experience in a warehouse or manufacturing environment is an asset + Strong computer skills including the proficiency of Microsoft Office. + Strong organizational skills with the ability to work in a fast paced environment + Strong attention to detail with a commitment to quality and safety + Good interpersonal skills with the ability to work well with others + Possess a continuous improvement mindset + Previous experience working with an ERP system (Visual) is a definite asset A competitive wage is only a part of your overall compensation package at Quadro. We provide our employees with a number of additional benefits. We offer a range of

group benefits

including extended healthcare (vision, prescription drugs, etc.), dental, life and dependent life insurance, short term and long term disability insurance. We also provide our employees with a group RRSP plan with the company matching your contributions.

About us:

IDEX Corporation ( www.idexcorp.com ) is a

leading manufacturer of highly engineered diversified products

in industries ranging across health, science, safety, fire and fluidics. Operating in 24 countries, IDEX is an innovative and rapidly growing company, focused on delivering excellence through diverse, winning teams. IDEX lives the values of Trust, Team and Excellence. The

Waterloo Material Processing Technologies (MPT) group

within IDEX Corporation is comprised of the following business units: + Quadro Engineering Corp. ( www.quadro-mpt.com ) + The Fitzpatrick Company ( www.fitzpatrick-mpt.com ) + Microfluidics International Corporation ( www.microfluidics-mpt.com ) + Steridose ( www.steridose.com ) These companies are leading brands within

Pharmaceutical, Food, Cosmetic, Personal Care and Chemical markets

where they engineer and manufacture technologically superior equipment for material processing (solid, semi-solid and liquid). Significant investments in capital, new positions and development of existing people are being made at the Waterloo, Ontario site which houses the headquarters (all functions) for Quadro Engineering, Fitzpatrick and operations for Microfluidics and Steridose. _Quadro Engineering Corp. is committed to providing a barrier-free workplace. If accommodation is required during the selection or interview process, it will be available upon request. This job posting is available in an accessible format upon request._ Are you ready to join a different kind of company where our people, our culture, and our commitments are centered around providing trusted solutions that improve lives around the world? IDEX is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action Employer. IDEX gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other consideration or protected category made unlawful by federal, state or local laws (Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled).

Business Unit:

Quadro

Job Segment:

HST Health & Science Technologies

title: Junior Inventory Coordinator
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

AGS Automotive Systems is a full-service automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and supply of complex high value-add automotive metal components, including in particular front and rear impact assemblies, principally for pick-ups and the heavy truck market. AGS offers full range of in-house capabilities including design and engineering, high tonnage metal stamping, light weighting solutions, innovative multi-material joining, high performance coatings including chrome plating and automated manufacturing processes.

AGS is committed to delivering high quality, high value products to our customers, who include several of North America's largest automakers. For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork.

AGS is looking for a Junior Inventory Coordinator to join our dynamic organization. This role is located in our plant in Cambridge, Ontario.

BASIC FUNCTION:

Reporting to the Maintenance Superintendent, the Junior Inventory Coordinator is responsible for monitoring and maintaining high level of inventory accuracy and integrity. The Junior Inventory Coordinator will also monitor inventory levels and material movement and contributing to a safe and orderly working environment.


PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

  • Responsible for performing physical inventories/counts/random or receipt audits/reconciliations
  • Researching inventory discrepancies and making necessary corrections and reporting
  • Coordinate and Integrate efforts across operational departments to enhance inventory accuracy
  • Issue materials/supplies to the operations/maintenance team as required and perform consumption in the ERP/EAM System
  • Receive incoming goods, verify receipt quantities with packing slip, check for damage, and stamp with receiving stamp, sign and date. Monitors for short shipments and items on back order
  • Notify the Department / Requisitioner for pickup When Received
  • Communicate all the Shipment/Order related Issues to the Procurement Department
  • Maintain the adequate Inventory levels by monitoring the consumption of the items
  • Closely monitor the Inventory of Critical Spare Parts, PPE, Maintenance Spares and Cleaning Supplies
  • Make sure the stock items are properly labelled and identifiable
  • Responsible for archiving the packing slips and sending them to the procurement for good receipt in the system
  • Prepare packaged goods to be sent out to suppliers for repairs, returns, etc.
  • Request Procurement to setup new parts as required / requested
  • Performing Weekly audits to make sure Tool Crib complies with Health and Safety and Environmental guide lines
  • Work with Operations and Maintenance Teams to identify opportunities and develop strategies to build a system of continuous Improvement in the Tool Crib (Cost Savings, Maintaining Physical Stock Accuracy, Eliminating obsolete stock and 5S Implementation)
  • Work closely with maintenance team to identify the redundant / obsolete inventory
  • Perform other duties as directed


QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs. as part of job function
  • Must have good MS Office Skills (MS Excel, MS Word etc. etc.)
  • Previous experience on ERP/EAM system is a plus
  • Forklift Certification is a plus.
  • High School Degree with 1-3 years of Experience in the Role Or Diploma in Supply Chain / Inventory Management with no experience in the Role

AGS Automotive Systems is proud to support the full inclusion of persons with disabilities as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At AGS we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request by contacting AGS Human Resources at HR@agsautomotive.com.

title: Machinist
description:
Motion Canada, a leading distributor of industrial MRO (maintenance, repair and operation replacement) parts, and the largest Bearing and Power Transmission Company in NA is currently recruiting for a Conventional Machinist for our service shop in Montreal.  Working in the repair and machine shop, the candidate will be primarily involved in the repairing and maintenance of valves, pumps, cylinders and gearboxes. This exciting and challenging position will report into the Shop Foreman.

Motion Canada is an industry leader with approximately $500 million in sales and with over 50 branches across Canada. With a national platform, a track record of success, an entrepreneurial executive team, and the backing of a multi-billion dollar parent company (Motion Industries) Motion Canada is positioned for strong growth across Canada. The company is a provider of more than 4.8 million parts and services.

Responsibilities:
  • General turning of small to large bar stock for the manufacturing of hydraulic cylinder components
  • General machining of mechanical components including boring, broaching and keyway cutting
  • Machining of hardened materials
  • Threading
  • Ability to measure (and machine) as per sample components
  • Maintain tight tolerances as per requirements
  • Read and interpret detailed engineering drawings and blueprints
  • Verify all measurements using standard instruments
  • Miscellaneous shop duties
Qualifications:
  • Machinist trade certification (or equivalent) preferred
  • Minimum of 3-5 years industry experience
  • Must be experienced in the use of Manual Lathes, milling machines, horizontal boring mills, and general shop equipment
  • Advanced manual machining skills
  • Knowledge of safety practices and safety consciousness
  • Ability to follow instructions and work without close supervision
  • Willing to put in overtime hours as required
  • Reliable, organized, punctual
  • Ability to work with little supervision
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints and schematics
  • Basic computer skills including Microsoft Excel and Outlook
  • Team player with solid troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to assess and estimate times for rebuild work
  • Strong mechanical aptitude

The work experience at Motion Canada includes
  • Comprehensive flex benefits
  • Competitive salary 
  • An attractive pension plan
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Great company culture with a strong leadership team
  • Open and frequent communication

title: Press Brake Operator
description:
Press Brake Operator opening with steel manufacturing company in Richmond Hill. We are looking for people with experience working with metal or using a press brake machine. If you feel strongly about your ability to learn and are looking to start your career with a company that has room for growth, please do not hesitate to apply.

The company is located in Richmond Hill, and is convenient for residents of Vaughan and Markham as well.

Job Title: Press Brake Operator
Location: Richmond Hill (close to Elgin Mills and Yonge)
Shift: Straight Days, Monday to Friday
Pay: $20-$22

Advantages
- Permanent opportunity
- Health allowance: $1,000
- Uniform provided at 3 months
- Free Parking
- Day shifts
- Transit accessible (Newkirk Rd between Elgin Mills and Crosby in Richmond Hill)

Responsibilities
- Press Brake Machine operation
- Sheet metal forming
- Accurately measure
- Completing daily production
- Other duties

Qualifications
- 1-2 years experience with metal manufacturing or press brake operator experience
- Good with measurements
- Mechanically inclined
- Lift up to 50 lbs

Summary
If you're interested in this Labour position, please apply directly or call/email with the subject line: "Press Brake Operator"

Lead recruiter contact information:
Jordan Dewit
jordan.dewit@randstad.ca
416-557-4018

This fabrication job is located in Richmond Hill, but we have other similar roles in Markham, North York, Concord, Auora and New Market. Please get in touch if you are looking for a job in production, manufacturing, or fabrication.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Robotic Paint Operator
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Robotic Paint Operator at our 591 Arvin facility.

Shift requirements - Day shift (starting from 3 to 8 am).

Additional wage shift premiums may apply.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Paint Superintendent, the Robotic Paint Operator visually monitors robots using the established parameters to the required specifications, check parts before and after robot application to ensure quality are achieved.

  • Paint parts as per production schedule to the required specifications
  • Perform and document pre- and post production tasks
  • Monitor robotic paint application of automotive parts
  • Monitor robotic functions during colour change and set up processes looking for intricate details.
  • Ability to move robots using a joystick type controller.
  • Inspect parts before and after painting for quality of the paint application.
  • Comfortable with basic computer skills and programs (Microsoft Office)
  • Ability to follow a schedule and pay attention to minor details.
  • Set up Robots/Spray Applicators at the start of shift and clean / teardown at the end of shift.
  • Communicate observations on irregularities to the Process engineering team.
  • Comfortable with information flowing from a variety of computer monitors / screens that provide information on multiple processes at the same time.
  • Comply with all company health and safety regulations, reporting accidents, incidents, and known or potential hazards, and ensuring a safe work area at all times.
  • Adhere to the ISO9001:2015 AND IATF 16949 Quality system and ISO14001 policies and procedures at all times.
  • Adhere to all Health & Safety policies; working in a safe and responsible manner, ensuring work place is clean and free of debris and dirty solvent emptied.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined such as safe booth entries, lock outs, clean room procedures, assist minor booth cleaning equipment.
  • Practice continuous improvements; or identifying any process or procedures that can be improved and a result in company performance.
  • Rotate between shifts as required.
  • Rotate between all paint kitchen and booth positions are required.
  • Perform duties as assigned from time to time by the supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or Equivalent Applicable. Post-Secondary Education Preferred.
  • GHS, Safe Booth Entry, Hazardous Energy Control, Bounding and grounding
  • Demonstrated Strong Communication Skills
  • Demonstrated Mechanical aptitude and Advanced Manual Dexterity (Fluent with Joysticks)
  • Basic to Intermediate computer skills
  • Minimum 3 years' experience in manufacturing environment
  • Experience to paint processing an asset

Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at hr@tiercon.com.

title: Production Coordinator
description:
Company Description

Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We’ve built something great, something special – an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. Our purpose-based platform HUMANATURE and philosophy that humans are a part of nature and nature is a part of us informs everything we do. From the materials we use to the products we make, everything is meticulously crafted and built to last. At Canada Goose we endure any condition, observe every detail, and take the long view in order to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm.

Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.

Job Description

Job Purpose:

The Production Coordinator main responsibility is to ensure the plant doesn’t run out of work and Production Orders are delivered complete and on time.  Accurate and timely report preparation, comprehensive record keeping and smooth flow of work within or between departments. This role is aligned with Raw Materials, Production Planning, and Inventory Control and requires attention to details, high degree of accuracy and data integrity. Concise monitoring and advisement of production status are considered essential.

Qualifications

Key Responsibilities:

  • Communicate daily with the Senior Production Manager, Supervisors, Industrial Engineers, and other internal departments to address and resolve any issues from pre-production up to post shipments.
  • Closely follow up the WIP status to ensure on-time delivery MPO.
  • Receive Finished Goods into D365, help resolve issues if needed.
  • Coordinate with Replenishment Planning, Logistics, Inventory Control and QA for MPOs that can’t be “started” due to missing material or back orders.
  • Follow up and coordinate the availability of materials with Replenishment Planning and/or Logistics. Follow up on back orders.
  • Coordinate with CGS2/ logistics the preparation, picking and issuance of Raw Materials.
  • Collaborate with Production Analyst for a successful and accurate Inventory Sweep.
  • Updates Production Schedule daily using leadtec, D365 data.
  • Attend weekly Production Status Meeting to discuss status of each MPO. Inform Planning Team of any issues that will affect MPO delivery dates.
  • Coordinate with Cutting Supervisor/ Coordinator for any cut goods, re-cuts, or fabric required for the plant to continue with our daily production without any interruptions.
  • Coordinate with RM and procurement down requirements and help with inventory sweeps.
  • Issues Raw Materials requests for additional requirements due to changes in BOMs, shortages, or any other cause such as missing, defective, or damaged during production.
  • Issues Raw Materials request, check manuals and materials availability for Pre-production Samples requirements.
  • Help and respond on finished goods and packing issues.
  • Coordinate with finances for cost roll up issues.
  • Coordinate with Central Storage issuance of materials, inventory, WIP, Raw materials and shortages.
  • Other departmental tasks as required.

 

Experience, Education and Designations:

  • At least 1 year of experience in Production Planning and Control or Inventory Control.
  • Relevant education related to manufacturing is an asset

 

Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:

  • Excellent MS Office skills
  • ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) software experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft Dynamics D365
  • Excellent written and verbal English skills (other languages an asset)
  • Highly detail-oriented, organized, and able to multitask
  • Ability to prioritize, multi-task, operate proactively, work as a team and handle challenges
  • Excellent common sense, decision making abilities, interpersonal and analytical skills
  • Ability to evaluate options and generate solutions
  • Confident, articulate, organized, detail oriented, goal oriented, and self motivated.

 

Working Conditions:

  • Office and manufacturing environment

title: CMM/Quality Technician – Night Shift
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

AGS Automotive Systems is a full-service automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and supply of complex high value-add automotive metal components, including in particular front and rear impact assemblies, principally for pick-ups and the heavy truck market. AGS offers full range of in-house capabilities including design and engineering, high tonnage metal stamping, light weighting solutions, innovative multi-material joining, high performance coatings including chrome plating and automated manufacturing processes.

AGS is committed to delivering high quality, high value products to our customers, who include several of North America's largest automakers. For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork.

AGS is looking for a Night Shift CMM/Quality Technician to join our dynamic organization. This role is located in our plant in Cambridge, Ontario.

BASIC FUNCTION:

The CMM Quality Technician is responsible for programming and running a Coordinate Measuring Machine, Faro Arm and/or other inspection equipment to be used. In addition, the CMM Quality Technician will ensure quality controls are in place during shift, working side by side with production supervisors to react to any concerns.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

  • Execute detailed inspection control plans and part/assembly layouts utilizing GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing) to assure parts meet design specifications. Measure parts using hand gages (micrometers, calipers, height stands, protractors, etc). Based upon measurement results, prepare detailed layout reports that will provide engineering, supplier, assembly, and fabrications shops the data required to make the necessary process adjustments.
  • Responsible for programming simple, complex, prismatic, and non-prismatic parts into Coordinate Measuring Machines and Faro Type Inspection equipment.
  • Performs advanced inspection and analysis of results with regards to fabricated, assembled parts and weldments using a wide range of gages tools and equipment. Capable of determining inspection set-up of complicated parts.
  • Use 3D inspection software, Microsoft Excel, and other general computer software.
  • Executes unit and process inspection and evaluation as directed by Quality Engineer / Manager.
  • Assist Production in training and implementation of all quality standards throughout the plant.
  • Provides statistical and graphical analysis of data.
  • Plans and performs work accurately and in a cost-efficient manner.
  • Work with Program Managers (internal and external) on adjustments required to product or tooling based on CMM
  • Maintains appropriate documentation to meet company QMS requirements.
  • Perform to an established methods and standards; meeting or exceeding the departments quality and productivity goals. Job performance will be strongly measured in these areas. Individual is responsible for initiation of communication to Quality Engineer / Manager in these areas as well as when quality results are below standards or management expectations.
  • Ensure Quality Alert, and Corrective Action procedures are adhered to by the team as issues / complaints are processed.
  • Ensure all First Offs and other quality inspections are properly done by production
  • Work with supervisor to ensure Non-Conforming material is contained.
  • Work with limited supervision.
  • Communicate well with others and work in a manner to support a team environment.
  • Perform to company 5S standard.
  • Ability to work overtime as required and ability to be on call in as required.
  • Responsible for maintaining communication to appropriate management and support personnel concerning safety, quality, and any issues as they arise.
  • Performs other duties within the scope of job assignment as assigned by Team Leader, Quality Engineer or Manager.
  • Must perform duties in compliance with all safety rules and regulations required by the Company, Local, State and Federal provisions.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Associate or Technical Degree or engineering support experience in automotive preferred.
  • Minimum 3-5 years' experience in Quality Assurance or related area.
  • Minimum 3-5 years' experience in the use of GD&T.
  • Must be an accomplished CMM/FARO Arm programmer with 2-3 years of programming experience (simple, complex, prismatic and non-prismatic parts).

AGS Automotive Systems is proud to support the full inclusion of persons with disabilities as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At AGS we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request by contacting AGS Human Resources at

HR@agsautomotive.com

.

title: Machine Operator/Quality Assurance Assistant
description:
About Us:

Intercity Packers is the largest meat/seafood distribution company in Western Canada and part of Gordon Food Service (GFS) Canada group of companies, who has been recognized by Forbes magazine to be among Canadaâ€™s Best Employers in 2021. As our innovative business continues to rapidly grow, we are seeking a full time Quality Assurance Assistant/Machine Operator at our Richmond location. Reporting to the Director of Quality Assurance, the Quality Assurance Assistant/Machine Operator is responsible for setting up and calibrating the metal detector machine, ensuring frozen products are run through, and accurately document the entire process. If you are able to work in a cooler, fast paced environment and keep a detailed-oriented focus, we would love to hear from you!

 

Responsibilities & Qualifications:

Duties & Responsibilities:

 

  • Run frozen products through the metal detector machine
  • Assist with Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) pre-operation check to ensure no hazards exist before production starts each day
  • Safely load, unload, and transfer product to and from conveyors or pallets
  • Set up, adjust and re-calibrate machine settings when required
  • Accurately complete daily metal detector calibration check logs
  • Perform daily metal detector checks at the beginning and end of day, when products change, and every hour for longer runs of the same product
  • Commitment to Food Safety by adhering to HACCP and CFIA hygiene rules / sanitary work practices
  • Other duties as assigned

 

Requirements:

 

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Detail-oriented focus
  • Working knowledge of machine operation and measurement tools
  • Comfortable working in a cooler/freezer environment
  • Ability to lift up to 55 lbs
  • Knowledge of workplace safety and safe lifting and handling procedures
  • Ability to operate required equipment in a safe and responsible manner
  • Hours: Tuesday to Friday 6:00am-2:30pm, Saturday 5:00am-1:30pm

 

 

What We Offer:

 

  • Flexible benefits program including dental, vision, prescription drugs, disability, and extended health coverage
  • Company matched retirement program  
  • In-house certification, training, and career advancement opportunities
  • Special employee discounts on all meat and seafood products
  • Employee appreciation events and social club activities all year round
  • Positive employee culture and rewards for performance
  • Annual steel toe boot allowance (50% up to $100)
Our Commitment:

At Intercity Packers Meat & Seafood, we believe in good food and good people. Over the past 5 decades, we have cultivated a rich history of bringing customers high quality, innovative and carefully sourced meat and seafood products along with the best customer service. Our unwavering mission to provide customers the best is reflected in our motto,  â€œYes, we do!" As part of GFS Canada group of companies, Intercity Packers offers an excellent remuneration package, which includes Competitive Salary, Comprehensive Medical Insurance, Attractive Retirement Plan and Great Career Opportunities throughout North America.

 

 

To apply, please visit our career site https://careers-intercitypackers.icims.com/ or directly email your resume and cover letter to

icpvanjobs@intercitypackers.ca

.

 

 

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further review.

 

 

*This position has been posted internally and externally*

Intercity Packers is an equal opportunity employer

title: Press Set-Up Operator - Afternoons
description:
Job Number: 40812 
Group: Magna Exteriors  
Division: Mytox Mfg. 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: Woodbridge 

 

Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

QUALIFICATIONS NECESSARY TO DO THE JOB:

•    Ensure that at all times prior to set–up, safety checklist is followed, completed and recorded
•    Must have knowledge of First and Last Off  Procedure
•    Must have knowledge of loading, unloading and storing of tooling equipment in appropriate safety area
•    Must have knowledge to set all tooling for all presses
•    Must have knowledge of operating presses  for both  manual and  progressive dies
•    Must have knowledge of all Inspection Records,  SPC Charts and checking fixtures
•    Must have knowledge of measuring equipment, such as; micrometer and  vernier, and caliper 
•    Must be able to organize,  properly prepare  and have foresight to be fully equipped to set-up  
utilizing a quick die change system
•    Must have experience in starting and shutting down of all equipment necessary to run appropriate press
•    Knowledge on how to inspect press and tooling at the beginning of the shift
•    Good English (both written and verbal) communication skills
•    Basic Mathematical skills
•    Must be able to work overtime when required and willing to help out when necessary as per customer demands

DESIRABLE ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

•    Valid forklift license and ability to operate 6000 lb. to 12000 lb. lift trucks
•    Ability to follow written set-up instructions and fill out proper set-up papers/maintain tool work order

MAIN DUTIES AND ACTIVITIES OF JOB:

•    Knowledge  of press controls and tooling protection or other pieces of equipment to run a press
•    Must be able to communicate issues/problems to area leader
•    Ability to order or to have in stock all necessary equipment and parts required for quick die change
•    Must be able to coordinate with other departments i.e. maintenance, toolroom, etc.
•    Must be able to maintain operation of “two” simultaneously running presses
•    Must be  able to keep “one” press cycling while doing set-up on the other press
•    Must be able to communicate with area leader, maintenance, toolroom , etc. concerning any problems/requirements affecting operation of two presses, tooling problem solving
•    Knowledge of how to use die cart and die tables
•    Ability to operate safely 10 to 40 ton cranes with appropriate sling or chain. Must have training certificate
•    Must have knowledge to properly set  counter balance air according to tool weight
•    Experience in tooling set-up with roll feeders and die protection
•    Ability to load coils on uncoilers, preparation for use, and start strip through  die
•    Ability to input production data into the system and follow required schedule
•    Able to complete a Forklift Safety checklist
•    Must be organized  and clean up before and after set-up, including moping of the floor
•    Knowledge of WHMIS/GHS
•    Good organizational skills, ability to work well without supervision
•    Attend training based on Mytox Internal Training Matric
•    Utilize effective Housekeeping Practices
•    Adhere to all safety rules and regulations as outlined in the Mytox Employee Handbook
•    Follows all applicable Mytox BOS procedures
•    Any other reasonable request made by Management 

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Shop, Fabricator
description:
A Day in the Life

Flynn Group of Companies is currently looking for skilled metals assembler to assist in the manufacturing of Trims and Architectural Panels for Commercial Buildings

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Operate metal forming equipment – Shears and press brakes
  • Operate CNC router table, pneumatic drills, chop saws and riveters
  • Maintain equipment and work areas
  • Transport raw materials, finished products and equipment throughout plant manually or using powered equipment
  • Read and interpret fabrication drawings
What We Are Seeking
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Ability to Read a Tape Measure
  • Brake Press Operator experience (1 year preferred)
  • Ability to work independently
  • Detail Oriented
  • Can stand for 8 hours a day
  • Has worked with various hand tools
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Can interpret drawings, calculate angles, measure, and mark up material
  • Has 1 year of Manufacturing Experience (preferred)
  • Familiar with 5S pillars
Position Summary

Location: Winnipeg

Employment Type: Full-time

Job Functions: Assembly, Fabrication

Industry: Manufacturing

title: Mechanical Assembler
description:
WHO WE ARE:

As the leading distributor of public works equipment, Joe Johnson Equipment (JJE) provides mobile infrastructure-maintenance equipment to municipalities and contractors across Canada and the US.  Through our branch network, we sell, rent, lease, service and support vacuum trucks, refuse & recycling collection vehicles, street sweepers, sewer cleaners, and inspection cameras.

JJE is a leading manufacturer of code vacuum equipment under the Westech Vac Systems brand. JJE and Westech also share a sense of pride in our work, our employees’ development and success, and building exceptional lifetime relationships with our customers.

JJE is a dynamic and growing organization, focused on maintaining an “employer of choice” culture. We have a stable, team-based, and collaborative work environment that drives our organization to be best-in-class within our industry. We offer opportunities across Canada and the U.S. and are committed to providing challenging and rewarding career paths for our employees. JJE provides very competitive compensation packages, robust group benefits and an opportunity to grow professionally.

JJE is a proud subsidiary of Federal Signal Corporation.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Mechanical Assembler

LOCATION:                Nisku, AB

TYPE:                          Full-Time

SUMMARY:

This role possesses the knowledge of the structure and function of production equipment and is able to identify problems and malfunctions with the machinery and equipment. 

POSITION REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Certification and licensing to operate forklift is strongly preferred
  • Previous experience in factory or warehouse setting is recommended
  • Demonstrates ability to interpret equipment gauges and monitors on factory equipment
  • Possesses knowledge of the structure and function of production equipment
  • Is able to identify problems or malfunctions with machinery and equipment
  • Demonstrates analytical thinking and problem-solving skills necessary to troubleshoot production issues
  • Exhibits ability to work cautiously but efficiently in potentially hazardous conditions
  • Is familiar with all factory safety procedures and guidelines
  • Demonstrates ability to use power tools safely and effectively
  • Works efficiently and manages time effectively

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Starts assembly and production machinery at beginning of shift
  • Monitors & maintains equipment to ensure there in proper working order
  • Makes sure that workstation is clean and free of hazardous materials
  • Cleans equipment
  • Assembles product parts by hand, power tools
  • Use of power tools such as a band saw, drill press, iron worker
  • Inspects assembled products to ensure they are up to quality standards
  • Keeps factory floor clean
  • Light manufacturing assembly
  • Adheres to all safety guidelines dictation the production and handling of materials in the factory
  • Ensures that all production deadlines are met
  • Reports issues or problems with production to immediate supervisor

SAFETY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Employees must:

  • work in compliance with the appropriate safety legislation/regulations/safety policies
  • report any known workplace hazard or safety violations
  • cooperate with their workplace’s Safety Committee or health and safety representative
  • use any safety equipment, protective devices or clothing required
  • not remove or make ineffective any protective device required by the Company or by the regulations

OTHER DETAILS

  • Possesses physical strength and stamina required to stand, walk, and lift for long periods of time
  • Possesses physical dexterity necessary to assemble small and delicate product

WHY WORK AT JJE?

  • Talented, dedicated and passionate team to work with
  • Exceptional best-in-class products and service offerings for our customers
  • Market-competitive compensation package with annual increase opportunities
  • Robust Group Benefits that are 100% paid for by the Company – inclusive of Health, Dental, Life, Disability and Travel coverage
  • Paid Personal Days
  • Charitable Giving Program
  • Educational Scholarship Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Employer Matching Retirement Savings Plan
  • Federally recognized as a certified Employment Equity organization
  • Member of multiple provincial safety programs and COR certified
  • Our Core People Values: Leadership, Customer Excellence, Integrity, Inspiration, Teamwork, Innovation and Ambition

____________________________________________________________________________________

If you are looking for a new opportunity, then we at Joe Johnson Equipment welcome your application. We encourage applications from all qualified persons, however only those who are being considered for the position will be contacted.

If you are contacted for an interview and require any accommodation, please notify HR in advance and we will provide applicable accommodation.

Joe Johnson Equipment is an Essential Business due to the products and services we provide to our customers. We continue to fully operate during these challenging times while remaining steadfastly committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of our employees.

title: Order Picker Forklift Operator
description:
Our warehouse client in Calgary is getting busy and they are hiring! If you are looking for a new role working in a warehouse, we’d love to hear from you – long-term roles, along with multiple shifts available!

Responsibilities:
  • Safe use of Order Picker forklift (Cherry Picker)
  • Responsible for maintaining a clean and orderly work environment
  • Palletize and stack goods, label and wrap
  • Experience using  MHE would be an asset, Forklift certification would be well regarded
  • Picking and packing heavy product
  • Assist in other areas as needed

Qualifications/ Requirements:
  • Previous experience in a warehouse is an asset
  • Team player, adaptable, and energetic with a positive attitude
  • Ability to work in a high-paced environment
  • Good time management skills
  • Able to repetitively lift loads of 50 lbs
  • MUST have steel-toed boots

If you are looking to work in a fast-paced environment with a great team – don’t wait, we’re hiring now!


About Equation Staffing Solutions Inc :

Equation Staffing Solutions is a successful, award-winning Calgary based staffing and recruitment agency specializing in the placement of candidates on a temporary, contract or permanent basis. The industries we serve include oil and gas, warehousing & transportation, finance & accounting, banking, health care, educational institutions, engineering & technology, manufacturing, construction, agriculture and all levels of government. The job families we place people in comprise of general office & admin support, human resources, customer support, warehousing, trades, machine operators, production, accounting, records management, business management & information management.

title: Plastics Fabricator (FT)
description:
About the Company:
Redwood Plastics and Rubber, https://www.redwoodplastics.com/, manufactures and distributes many grades of industrial plastic and rubber. We have in-house engineering and fabrication to produce custom components that often replace steel, aluminum, and wood for longer wear life, decreased downtime, increased production, lighter weight, cost-effectiveness and increased safety.

About the Job:
We are growing and hiring 2 Plastics Fabricators to operate machines, measure, cut, shape, fit and assemble plastics materials to produce our products.

Responsibilities include: 
  • Use precision instruments, hand tools, power tools, machines, and equipment.
  • Read and interpret blueprints, work orders, and related documentation.
  • Layout cut material to size, using shears, knives, cutters, scissors, router, or saw.
  • Mix ingredients, like resins, catalysts, and colors, according to formulas, manually or using a mixer.
  • Set up and operate forming machines and presses and operate oven to cure parts.
  • Verify dimensions using precision instruments like micrometers, and calipers.
  • Finish parts to specifications.
  • Other duties as required.

Shift: Day Shift: Monday through Thursday: 5:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Skills and Experience
  • Some experience in a manufacturing facility operating machinery.
  • Experience with hand, power, and measuring tools.
  • Physically able to lift up to 40 pounds.

title: CNC 5-Axis Machinist
company: The Wohl Group - Recruitment Made Easy!
description:
We are a leading supplier of high quality precision machined parts.

Job Description

· Reports to the Lead Hand & Production Supervisor
· Experienced set-up Operator for Mazak or DMG 70 Evolution with good knowledge of Heidenhain Mazatrol controls
· Must be able to work with minimal supervision and work to close tolerances (up to 0.0005)
· Verify dimensions of products for accuracy and conformance to specifications using precision measuring instruments
· Verify dimensions of machined parts or tooling using micrometers, verniers, calipers, height gauges, optical comparators, co-ordinate measuring machines (CMM) or other specialized measuring instruments
· Must be able to interpret drawings and work to close tolerances
· May modify tooling and fixtures to turn out best quality parts
· Responsible for loading parts, operating controls, setting offsets, simple edits, deburring and inspection of quality parts for conformance to requirements.
· Studies and interprets drawings, manuals, specifications or sample parts to determine dimensions and tolerances of finished work pieces, sequence of operations and setup requirements.
· Within the scope of the job requirements, will be required to adhere and comply with the Company ISO Quality Program and procedures, Company policies and Safety and Environmental Regulations.
· Set up, operate and maintain a variety of machine tools including computer numerically controlled (CNC) tools to perform precision, non-repetitive machining operations such as sawing, turning, milling, boring, planning, drilling, precision grinding and other operations
· Follow quality management system policy and procedures as per AS 9100 International Standard
· Sets-up and operates machine that cuts metal sheets according to specification.
· Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.
· Relies on limited experience and judgement to plan and accomplish goals.
· Certain degree of creativity and latitude is expected.
· Follow quality management system policy and procedures as per AS 9100 International Standard
· Sets-up and operates machine that cuts metal sheets according to specification.
· Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.
· Relies on limited experience and judgement to plan and accomplish goals.
· Certain degree of creativity and latitude is expected.
· Fill out records, work orders or production related records, as required.
· Follows work orders and performs duties as per customer specification.
· Follow appropriate work instructions, control plan and/or inspection instructions
· Perform all in-process, final inspection and mark results in appropriate records.

Qualifications and Skills
  • At least 2 years on-the-job or Co-Op CNC Machine experience preferred but not required.
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints
  • Must have knowledge of CNC Programming techniques
  • Successful candidate will be asked to perform simple task associated with running a CNC milling machine
  • Intermediate knowledge and application of precision measuring instruments and the application of such instruments. Instruments should include but not limited to calipers, ID and OD micrometers, depth gages, indicators and scales.
  • Knowledge of reading drawings and specifications with an intermediate understanding of geometric tolerance and dimensions.
  • Intermediate knowledge of tool holders, cutting tools, boring bars, fixtures, inserts and other accessories used on various machines.
  • Familiarity with AS9100 quality standards and AS14001 Environmental Standards
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude.
Additional Assets:

· Experience in the aerospace and manufacturing industry

Salary Range: $20-40/hr

***We thank all applications for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies or phone calls.Thank you and Good Luck.

title: Quality Inspector - Raw Materials
description:
Palliser Furniture is one of the leading furniture manufacturers in North America! We value our clients; providing the best customer experience possible, our surrounding communities, and our natural environment. At Palliser Furniture, we believe in being extraordinary and producing quality furniture. Join our ever-growing team, where we provide comprehensive on the job training and professional development.

We are seeking individuals to join our Quality Team. We have positions available for our day shift (7:00 AM â€“ 3:30 PM). These positions are located at 40 Furniture Park, Winnipeg.

What Would You Do?

The duties and responsibilities of this position would include:

  • Inspect raw material.
  • Determine if material is in conformance with specification.
  • Test material, components, and mechanisms.
  • Operate machinery, equipment, and inspection tool.
  • Identify non-conformance material and take appropriate corrective action.
  • Report critical issues to Supervisor(s) or Manager(s).
  • Ensure all materials meet specification before handing them off to Consumer care.
  • Coordinate workload and ask for assistance when required.
  • Organize material that requires 3rd party testing, including testing at Matamoros lab.
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Follow all safety procedures.
  • Willing to perform related tasks as required.
  • Maintain a clean and safe workplace.
  • Contribute to producing high-quality, luxury furniture.

What Do You Bring?

  • Previous quality testing and reporting experience.
  • Basic computer skills, Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, Adobe, Outlook.
  • Basic tool handling, screwdriver, caliper, multimeter, exacto blade, measuring tools (metric and imperial).
  • Read and write English, strong verbal and written communication.
  • Understanding to read Internal and Vendor drawings.
  • Understanding of the manufacturing process and quality standards.
  • Organizational skills required.
  • Able to prioritize.
  • Responsible and practice safe work habits.
  • Show positive attitude and initiative.
  • Solid teamwork skills.
  • Effective communication skills enabling cross training.
  • Ability to use Power Jack, Forklift, and Reach Lift considered an asset.
  • Physical requirements of the job include standing, walking, bending, squatting, lifting (10-50lbs).

 

Work Life at Palliser?

  • Company that supports work-life balance with paid time off and flexibility.
  • Great benefits packages.
  • Employee discount program for products, wellness plans, and more.
  • Surround yourself with a community that supports professional development and collaboration.

COVID-19 Precaution(s)

  • Personal protective equipment (PPE) provided or required.
  • Temperature screenings.
  • Social distancing guidelines in place.
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, and/or cleaning procedures in place.

CLOSING DATE: If you are interested in the position, please submit your cover letter and resume by April 29, 2022.

We thank all interested applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Production Associate
description:
PRODUCTION ASSOCIATE

Full Time / Part Time Position

 

WHO WE ARE

  • Vari-Form Manufacturing Inc. is a leader in advanced tube hydroforming technology for the development and manufacture of products used by the automotive industry. Vari-Form Manufacturing Inc. has three facilities in Strathroy, Ontario.

 

THE POSITION                     

  • Operate a variety of production equipment and meet production requirements through a variety of physical tasks
  • Participates in preventative and regular maintenance
  • Maintains work area and equipment in a safe operating condition
  • Fully complies with all safety rules and procedures
  • Produce high quality parts with zero defect
  • Shares responsibility with other team members for continuous improvement projects
  • Meet all other Company requirements

 

WHAT WE OFFER:

Vari-Form prides in our employee programs that include:

  • Paid $19.26 hourly
  • Shift premiums
  • Full-time Hours (up to 48 hours a week) / Part-time hours (upto 20 hours a week)
  • Opportunity for permanent placement
  • Opportunity to make $27.51 houlry upon permanent placement
  • Provided safety equipment including gloves, safety glasses, ear plugs
  • Air Conditioned Building
  • Social events

 

WHAT YOU OFFER

  • Ability to work rotating shifts â€“ days, afternoons, nights
  • Must be comfortable lifting up to 40lbs, and work at steady pace
  • Physical ability sufficient to competently perform the essential elements of the job
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Successful completion of high school / GED 

 

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

title: Quality Technician
description:
Description:
Agilus Work Solutions is currently recruiting for Quality Technicians for our client, located in Brockville, a multi-national organization considered a leader in the manufacturing sector.
Agilus is recruiting for a Quality Technician in the Manufacturing Sector in Brockville, Ontario.
The quality technician is required to support manufacturing and R&D therefore the candidate will be expected to work closely with engineers and research scientists. Familiarity with quality assurance procedures will be considered an asset.
Responsibilities:
  • Test and release of incoming materials for production
  • Conducting a large variety of physical tests on a hard-goods product
  • Maintaining complete test data records and enter test data electronically
  • Conducting performance checks / calibration verification and basic maintenance of laboratory equipment
  • Support internal and external audits as required
  • Other duties as assigned

An ideal candidate has:
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • High attention to detail
  • Ability to quickly adapt to new software packages or pieces of lab equipment
  • Will work in a cross-functional team
  • Ability to prioritize various requests
  • Quality and quantity checks via measuring equipment as defined by specifications
  • Software Knowledge needed: Microsoft Office: Excel, Word, Powerpoint, and any experience with statistical software packages (i.e. Minitab, ISO, GMP). Knowledge of SAP an asset.

Successful candidates will have:
  • College Diploma for Laboratory Technician, or University Degree in Science, Engineering or related degree
  • Controlled goods clearance is a requirement for this position, requires Canadian Citizenship
  • A criminal background verification is required
  • Minimum 2 years in a regulated manufacturing environment
  • Strong analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills

Total compensation:
  • $21-$26/hr based on experience
  • Weekly pay including 4% vacation pay
  • Preferred rates for benefit coverage available

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email mchapman@agilus.ca or by text 613.865.8695
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Production Worker/Labourer
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

EVRAZ has multiple openings for Production Workers/General Labourers at our Red Deer facility.  The Production Worker/Labourer is an entry level role working on various production lines in a heavy industrial manufacturing environment.  Production workers/labourers are expected follow safety rules, perform work tasks in  accordance with standard operating procedures and also perform physical labour throughout the shift.  Production workers/labourers are scheduled to  work 12 hour shifts with varied shift start times.   

Position responsibilities include:

  • Comply with all safety rules and procedures
  • Operate equipment to manufacture steel pipe
  • Use various hand and power tools, gas torches, measuring devices
  • Visually inspect product produced at station
  • Cleaning of work area
  • Computer data entry
  • General labour duties

Production workers/Labourer is an entry level role.  Successful incumbents will have the opportunity to bid on positions within the plant in accordance with the collective agreement and as they become available.

  • Requirements
  • Minimum High school diploma required
  • Commitment to safety rules, wear full protective personal equipment
  • No experience necessary but previous work experience in a manufacturing and/or production environment will be considered an asset
  • Ability to meet the physical demands of the position including standing, walking, sitting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, bending, moderate to heavy lifting and pushing and pulling up to 50 pounds throughout the shift
  • Mechanically inclined, ability to follow instructions
  • Communication and teamwork skills
  • Willing to work 12 hour day & night shifts. These are a rotational shifts
  • Reliable transportation, work location is outside of public transit
  • You must pass a drug, alcohol & physical test
  • You must pass a criminal record check

  • Compensation starting at

           $26.00 an hour

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: B Welder
description:
Are you looking for an exciting and challenging opportunity in a fast paced, growing manufacturing company?  If so, this could be the ideal role for you!

Active Exhaust Corp. is a leader in the design, test and manufacture of exhaust systems for a broad range of global customers. With more than 550 employees worldwideâ€”many of whom have been with our company for over 30 yearsâ€”our global footprint ensures we can execute through state-of-the-art processes within North America and South and East Asia.

We offer competitive compensation, group benefits, RRSP matching and plenty of advancement opportunities.  If you are an ambitious, self-motivated and driven individual looking for an ideal company to launch your new career and/or to yearning to continue to grow and develop in your current role, you are encouraged you to apply!

SUMMARY:   B-Welders report to the Supervisor of the department and are responsible to ensure that product is welded to process, quality & required efficiency levels.  

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:                               

  • Performs the running of the equipment set up by others or by themselves
  • Performs required quality checks to insure product is in compliance and in specification
  • Notifies Group Leader and/or Supervisor(s) of product defects or other serious occurrences
  • Documents and records all necessary information/data as per work cards and other company requirements
  • Performs equipment operational checks
  • Performs proper housekeeping, clean-up and 5 S requirements
  • Performs all duties according to safety standards and company policies
  • Any other responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Able to weld all B category test welds
  • 2 year of MIG welding experience
  • Able to set-up and maintain own equipment
  • Strong mathematical skills
  • Able to repair weld
  • Min. grade 12 or equivalent education
  • Fluent in English
  • Conscientious and punctual
  • Willing to learn

Preferred Experience

  • TIG & stainless steel experience an asset
  • Pressure vessel MIG welding would be an asset
  • Computer literate
  • Blue print reading
  • Capable of finishing welding

 Qualified candidates will be required to complete an on-site weld test as an initial screening for this position.

Hourly Rate: $25.00 while on contract (6-month term), $20.42 plus benefits if hired on full-time.

title: Day Shift Press Operator
description:
Day Shift Second Print Operator
12 hour, 8a-8p on a 2-2-3 rotation
TC Transcontinental, Making Impressions Count

TC Transcontinental is a leader in flexible packaging in North America, and Canada’s largest printer. The Corporation is also the leading Canadian French-language educational publishing group. For over 40 years, TC Transcontinental’s story has been one of innovation and transformation to meet our customers’ evolving needs. Our strong family values, entrepreneurial spirit and long-term vision have always been at the heart of our success.  With our 3 business sectors of Packaging, Print and Media, we continue to optimize, transform and grow while making impressions that count! 
TC Transcontinental Packaging brings a distinctive blend of Art, Science and Technology to create flexible packaging that preserves our customers' products and accentuates their brands on the store shelf. The Packaging Sector has over 4,000 employees and 25 facilities worldwide specializing in extrusion, lamination, printing and converting of plastic products.  
We share the Ellen MacArthur Foundation’s vision of a circular economy for plastic, where plastic never becomes waste and have committed, by 2025, for 100% of our plastic packaging to be reusable, recyclable or compostable. And most recently, we joined the United Nations Global Compact – a voluntary initiative of signatory companies committing to social responsibilities around human rights, labor standards and environmental protection.  You will join a high-performing team that is dedicated to sustainability and passionate about our people, operations, communities and products.

About this opportunity

This position will report to the Shift Supervisor. Assists Operator in performing machine set-up for orders, safety works with machine to production target, waste, and quality standards, and assists in trouble shooting machine when it is down or not performing to standard.    


What you will do
 
  • Must follow safety guidelines, wear designated personal protective equipment, and meet OSHA safety requirements.
  • Must be able to identify and understand customer requirements.
  • Assists in preparing press and all job components for print job (loading specified anilox, sleeves,  ink, film, etc.)
  • Ensures work area is kept clean according to facility/corporate standards
  • Ensures all environmental standards and requirements are met
  • Responsible for maintaining ink levels, viscosity an pH levels
  • Responsible for ensuring non-used ink decks are under pump circulation with pH water to ensure proper pump performance
  • Supports the change-over of each job under the direction of Operator
  • Assists in trouble shooting machine when it is down or not performing to standard
  • Assists maintenance with machine repairs and preventive maintenance
  • Responsible for ensuring that the day-to-day operation of the machine is consistent with the policies and procedures which make up the Quality System.
  • Continuously improve the process as an individual and as a team member
  • Supports and maintains all activities related to Food Safety Management system
  • Ability to sight ink formulas and distinguish between all color matches during the printing process through direct visual inspection.
  • Responsible for managing and handling hazardous waste. 
  • Maintain an understanding of the materials used in production and their specific differences.
  • Other responsibilities and duties as assigned

What you have to offer
  • High School Diploma 1 + years, preferred of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Ability to read and understand simple written materials.  Ability to write simple statements and numbers. Ability to perform arithmetic calculations with fractions and decimals.
  • Average dexterity and coordination. Ability to climb stairs and lift up to 50lbs.
  • Frequent mental/visual attention to monitor press operation. Ability to distinguish colors.
  • Must be able to work in a team environment.   Must adhere to plant safety and housekeeping standards.


What we have to offer
  • Opportunity to be part of a dynamic and highly motivating work environment where you can develop your potential and launch an exciting career.
  • Development opportunities where your input makes a difference. A competitive compensation package, 401K plan and flexible benefits that are customizable to you and your family’s needs];
  • Employee perks such as discounts from suppliers on various products and services such as insurance, wireless bundles, travel, and much more.

title: Welding Quality Control Technician (6 Month Limited Term, Afternoon Shift)
description:
The Welding Quality Control (WQC) Technician is responsible to support in-process and formal inspections for all specific trade systems at any stage of construction. The position ensures specifications, class rules, standard operating procedures (SOPs), and work instructions are followed/met at each stage of construction. The WQC Technician oversees the Inspection and Test Plan for the specific trade area or system. The successful candidate will perform daily in-process quality control inspections to identify non-conformities with contract requirements, develop corrective actions and communicate requirements to shop personnel. The incumbent will also attend formal inspections with owners and regulatory bodies. NDT coordination between production, WQC and NDT service provider might be part of the WQC Technician's daily responsibilities. This is afternoon shift position with possibility to be requested to support morning shift team when required.

Duties/Accountabilities

  • Reviews specifications, class rules, work instructions and SOPs to determine trade specific quality requirements for each contract.
  • Develops new construction and repair projects’ Inspection and Test Plans for trade specific systems.
  • Ensures Inspection and Test plans are implemented in accordance with contract requirements.
  • Performs daily in-process quality inspections of work. Documents and communicates results to responsible supervisors.
  • Attends formal inspections with customers and regulatory bodies. Documents all non-conformities and provides results to responsible supervisors and the Quality Department.
  • Works with trade and area supervisors/managers to improve in-process quality.
  • Performs gap analyses of work instructions and SOPs for trade specific systems. Communicates results to respective area and assists in modifying or adding work instructions and SOPs as required.
  • Performs periodic audits of suppliers to ensure compliance with contract requirements.

Education and Experience

  • Current valid CWB CSA W178.2 level 1 or 2 Welding Inspector certification is required (or AWS CWI to receive CWB certification).
  • Minimum 5 years detailed experience working as a Welding QC inspector/coordinator – Structure and Piping.
  • Current valid CGSB MT and/or UT Level II Certification is highly desirable.
  • Relevant trade experience is desirable.

Skills, Knowledge and Required Proficiencies

  • Detailed understanding of the fabrication, installation, commissioning and testing of trade specific systems.
  • Solid understanding of quality control and inspection procedures.
  • Exhibited ability to develop Quality Plans and Inspection and Test Plans.
  • Proven ability to read and understand manufacturing/shop drawings.
  • Strong technical skills including an understanding of quality techniques and their application.
  • Technical understanding of NDT techniques and their application to meet contract, regulatory and statutory requirements for trade specific systems.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Strong technical writing skills.
  • Customer service focus.
  • Demonstrated initiative, innovation, and integrity.
  • Excellent computer proficiency including Microsoft Word/Excel/Outlook/PowerPoint.
  • Demonstrated ability to multi-task, prioritize and problem-solve.
  • Discernment and reasoning skills.
  • Ability to work with limited direction.
  • Ability to acquire Industrial Security.

title: Tool and Die Maker
description:
Plastic staffing and the Perfect Fit are working together to find someone interested in joining an organization with endless possibilities, above-average salary, paid benefits and more. If you are interested, please read on all enquiries made with Plastic Staffing. If you contact The Perfect Fit, you will not be concerned about the position!

Job Overview
The Tool and Die Maker will help customers design a die from the drawings they provide for the profile they are looking to have extruded. The Tool and Die Maker will also validate the die and assist production as required to improve efficiencies.

Responsibilities may include:
  • Use of various equipment/tools to create and repair tooling,
  • Maintain and operate lathe, milling machines and grinders accurately and efficiently.
  • Troubleshoot and repair existing tools as required.
  • Maintenance of the existing tools.

Qualifications:
  • Ability to work with Cad files, Mastercam and related software.
  • Proficient with EDM wire cutting, preferably Fanuc EDM.
  • Experience within manufacturing.
  • Knowledge of manual machining equipment (lathe, milling machine, and horizontal grinder) (preferred but not required).
  • Knowledge of vacuum and sizers (preferred).
  • Tool and Die Maker Trade Certification (preferred).
  • Red Seal in Tool and Die Making (preferred).
  • Experience with Vinyl Extrusion (preferred).
  • Experience with die polishing (preferred).

What you can expect:
  • Excellent workplace environment.
  • Variety in your day-to-day Experience.
  • Competitive base salary.
  • Build interpersonal relationships with friendly and professional staff.

title: Production Planner
description:
Voyant Beauty is currently seeking a Production Planner at its Etobicoke location.

Position Summary:

In conjunction with others develops production schedules for finished goods and component items based on equipment, labor and raw material availability.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with the Customer Service teams to align both changes to firm order requirements as well as forecasted demand spikes, while finding effective solutions to short and long-term issues.
  • Plans and establishes short term and long-term production schedules to meet customer demands, sales forecasts, and customer delivery requirements.
  • Plans and establishes production schedule for any replenishment models.
  • Lead daily planning meetings to obtain as much information as possible to ensure an achievable build plan in the short-term schedule.
  • Provides necessary information and support to the Operations Manager, Purchasing, Inventory Control, and Accounting departments.
  • Estimates production time for each order giving consideration to the availability of machines, material and tooling, number of operations involved, manufacturing backlog, order quantity, complexity of product (i.e. assemblies), previous history, outside operations, etc.
  • Examines the status of each order by reviewing work-in-process, open orders, material status, over-dues, etc. and checks with schedulers and expediters.
  • Audits work-in-process for potential short yields, order closing, abnormal delays, and progress, and advises schedulers and production supervisors of problems and requests corrective actions.
  • Develop schedule to minimize overtime and changeovers to maximize efficiency.
  • .Maintains long-range strategy keeping customer service and purchasing in mind. Develops long term capacity outlook for customers.
  • Tracks towards targeted schedule adherence
  • .Present a weekly status report on projected on time performance and the available units in future fiscal periods.
  • Participates (as required) on customer calls pertaining to historical attainment, future attainment, and future capacity outlook.
  • Other tasks as assigned


Skills and Qualifications:

  • Exceptional organizational, interpersonal and presentation skills.
  • Excellent computer skills.
  • Self-starter with the ability to work independently and as a team player.
  • Bachelor (or higher) required in area of discipline.

Working Conditions:

  • Combination of office, plant, and occasionally outdoor work environment.
  • Some exposure to chemicals, chemical products, and high noise levels in the plant.

To Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our company does not accept unsolicited CVs or applications from agencies. We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs or applications and explicitly reserve its right to contact candidates presented in such unsolicited CV or application.

Our company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, disability or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, Voyant Beauty complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Control Panel Technician
description:
Overview:

Exile Automation is a Control System Integration and Automation company located in Calgary, AB. We offer Control System Design, Manufacturing, and System Integration services specializing in Industrial Automation, Communication, and Power Systems. We offer our customers a line of standard and custom built control panels to suit Energy, Manufacturing, Process, Agriculture, Medical, Material Handling, and Food and Beverage Industries.  

 

Exile Automation provides an excellent working environment and believes strongly in cultivating an outstanding Team Culture. We proudly provide our clients with the highest quality products and services, and are looking for talented and customer minded people to join our team! We offer competitive wages and paid benefits.

   

The successful candidate(s) will work closely with the Manufacturing Manager, and be responsible for a high quality of assembly and wiring of control panels. Work schedule will be Monday - Thursday 6:30am - 5pm.

Please apply directly through this job job add. We would like to thank all interested candidates, however only those short listed shall be contacted.  

Responsibilities:
  • Working from customer drawings and specifications.
  • Lay out and wire components on the back plate based on the bill of materials. PLC's, VFD's, relays, switches, transformers, power supplies, wire duct, terminal blocks, etc.
  • Drill, tap and mount components.
  • Test control panels based on the Engineered schematics and layouts.
  • Additional duties may include maintenance, housekeeping of the panel shop, shipping and receiving.
Qualifications:
  • 1-3 years previus control panel wiring experience.
