title: Mold Maker
description:
WE ARE HIRING!

Omega Tool Corp is the global leader in the engineering and manufacturing of plastics tooling. We offer solutions for complex tooling and plastic part challenges to world-class OEM and Tier 1 clients for over 40 years. As we continue to expand our footprint, we are recruiting top talent to join our team.

Mold Maker

The Mold Maker is responsible for creating and repairing molds. This individual will comply with provincial and federal legislation, company and health & safety policies and ISO quality program and procedures.

Job Details:

  • Full-time, regular rotational shift
  • Total comprehensive benefit and pension package
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Signing Bonus

Required education, skills and abilities:

  • Erolled in OYAP and/or Completion of post secondary education or Completion of secondary school and a four-year apprenticeship or college diploma in a manufacturing field or a related discipline
  •  Proficient in computers with the ability to use various computer applications depending on skill level such as Microsoft Office, etc.
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints, diagrams, schematics, drawings, manuals and specifications
  • Knowledge of arithmetic, geometry and their applications
  • Capable of recognizing and solving problems
  • Time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks
  • Ability to adapt and welcome change in a positive manner
  • Capable of operating heavy equipment such as a forklift and crane

How to Apply:

Interested candidates are encourage to submit a resume via email.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are contacted by Omega Tool Corp. regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if you require accommodation. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: Warehouse and logistic coordinator
description:
NanoXplore is a graphene company, a manufacturer and supplier of high-volume graphene powder for use in industrial markets. The Corporation provides standard and custom graphene-enhanced plastic and composite products to various customers in transportation, packaging, electronics, and other industrial sectors. NanoXplore is headquartered in Ville Saint-Laurent, Quebec, with nearly 400 employees supporting manufacturing facilities across Canada, the U.S. and Switzerland. NanoXplore is a publicly traded Company (TSX : GRA and OTCQX: NNXPF)


Job purpose

The Logistics and Warehouse Coordinator works closely with the Buyer to ensure the supply of raw materials to production, the delivery of samples and orders to customers and to ensure inventory accuracy.

He/she provides quality service that is proactive, courteous, structured and organized. He/she adheres to the vision, mission and values of the company.

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for the accuracy of the raw material and finished goods inventory;
  • Responsible for inventory counts following internal procedures;
  • Respect ISO procedures by aiming for continuous improvement;
  • Organize the transportation of finished goods and shipping papers;
  • Organize the shipment of finished goods and shipping papers;
  • Perform shipping of customer orders via the ERP system and manual shipping documents, as required;
  • Participate in the planning and daily management of freight activities;
  • Contact carriers as required;
  • Ensure that loading procedures are followed;
  • Respect Canadian and international transportation standards;
  • Follow up and evaluate the annual performance of the carriers;
  • Ensure perfect communication and coordination with the logistics team and the sales team;
  • Validate customer orders and confirm purchase orders to customers;
  • Ensure that the products shipped are in accordance with the customer's order;
  • Manage customer complaints related to transportation and work with all teams involved to find solutions;
  • Verify and record shipping documents on the ERP system;
  • Coordinate the activities of the warehouse clerk;
  • Participate in all other related tasks.


Benefits offered

  • Group insurance program;
  • Tele-medicine program;
  • Free gym on site;
  • Regularly scheduled social events;
  • Free coffee;
  • Free on-site parking;
  • Dynamic work environment.

Education and experience

  • AEC or DEC in operations management
  • Minimum of 5 years experience in a similar position;
  • Comfortable with the Office suite and ERP.

Skills

  • Good communication skills in both French and English;
  • Team player;
  • Ability to analyze and solve problems;
  • Well organized;
  • Professionalism.

title: Machine Operator( Filler Operator)
description:
With Staff Management | SMX, you'll get a weekly paycheck, learn new skills, meet new people, and work with a great management team in a clean and safe environment.


The Packaging Machine Operator is responsible for producing pouches within standard production efficiencies while verifying they meet customer expectations. They are responsible for the machine operation from set-up to manufacturing as well as maintenance and quality


.


Perks & Benefits: Paid Training, Weekly paychecks.


Shifts: 2nd Shift.


Employment Types: Full Time, Temp to Hire.


Pay Rate: $16.00 - $18.00 / hour


Duties:

-Set-up and operate the Filler/Circle and MDC/Hooper machine within acceptable production, quality and safety standards - Visually inspect the pouches to ensure customer standards and quality requirements are met - Fill out all the appropriate processing parameters and product inspection documentation -Trouble shoot equipment. -Maintain a clean work environment -Follow GMP/HACCP and department safety rules.


.


Position Requirements:

Requirements: Minimum 0.5-1 year experience as a Machine Operator, Good communications skills Assets: Operating Packaging Machinery Food Industry Experience


Requirements: Stand for Shift Duration, Must be at least 18 years old.Able to Lift 20 pounds., required education: HS Diploma or GED.


Work Location: Staff Management, 5 Precidio Ct, Brampton, ON L6S6B7.


Job Types: Food Production, Machine Operator, Machine Packaging, Production, Warehouse.


Industry: Warehouse/Distribution.

title: 25/hr Machine Operator - Beverage Manufacturing
description:
We have openings for Machine Operator - Beverage Manufacturing in Mississauga.
Work for the largest bottlers in North America and gain valuable experience for your career.

if you are an experienced Machine Operator with at least 3 years of experience, apply now!

Position: Machine Operator - Food & Beverage industry
Duration: SEASONAL with potential of permanent hire

Salary: 25/hr ($0.60 afternoon premium, $0.70 night premium)

Location: Viscount Road - Orlando Drive (near Airport Road)

Shift Schedules available:
Day - 7:00 am- 3:00pm
Afternoon - 3:00pm - 11:00 pm
Night - 11:00 pm - 7:00 am

Advantages
Competitive pay @ 25/hr
Established Organization
Clean working environment
Opportunity to be hired permanently after contract
Monday to Friday
Full-time hours, with opportunity for Overtime and weekends
4% paid vacation

Responsibilities
Machines may include the ff: Labeller, Filler, Depalletizer, Mead, Palletizer, Harkness, etc.
Must have an in-depth, operational knowledge of the machine being operated and other related equipment.
Adhere to the production schedule and communicate with the Lead Hand, regarding problems or changes that may be necessary.
Constantly monitor the line when running for down bottles/cans, low fills, faulty packaging, damage, missing or out of registration labels as applicable.
Monitor finished product and/or cases for proper closures/seams, date and product codes and damaged or out of specification packaging.
Follow all Quality Assurance and Production line standard operating procedures.
Perform changeovers as efficiently and carefully as possible. Ensure that the correct settings and parts are installed and that no mechanical defects exist, that may cause damage to the equipment or product.
Record all necessary information for production and quality records. Keep accurate downtime reports and documentation.
Keep equipment and the surrounding area clean and free of debris at all times, including the end of the shift. Garbage and recycling containers must be emptied at the end of the shift.
Work closely with all departments to improve quality, increase efficiencies, increase yields and eliminate out-of-specification or damaged products.
Perform any other duties assigned by a Lead Hand, or Management

Qualifications
High School Certification
3-5 years of relevant work experience in a manufacturing environment
Experience in a fast-moving packaged goods environment, beverage production experience preferred
Good interpersonal & communication skills, both written and verbal
Able to work quickly and accurately under pressure
Formal training in areas such as WHIMIS, HACCP, Hygiene etc. preferred
Forklift certification may be required

Summary
If you or anyone you know is interested in this Machine Operator - Beverage role in Mississauga --- APPLY THROUGH THIS POSTING!

You may also email your resume to Anna and Melanie. Subject: Machine Operator
anna.ongtengsiem@randstad.ca / melanie.turchiaro@randstad.ca

For QUESTIONS regarding this job posting, you can EMAIL US or TEXT 365-4402230, include the job name, and we will try to get back to you as soon as possible.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Receiver/Inventory control clerk
description:
We are HIRING!!! We have an incredible opportunity with a great local company. The tenure among the staff is over 20+ years. It must be a great company if their staff are there that long.

We are looking for someone here in Burlington who has inventory control with administrative and on the floor work. This is an awesome career for someone who likes to work hard but play harder.

We want you to submit your resume for consideration. If you have any experience batching in food or chemicals, we are looking for you!

Advantages
$20/hour
Weekly pay
Great company culture
Fun, and easy-going team
Full benefits after probation
Accessible Burlington area
Bus route accessible
Day shift- 7:30-4 and they even have summer hours! Finish at 1pm on Fridays in the summer!

Responsibilities
There are two components of the role.
Inventory Control AND Receiver (reach truck license)

Inventory Control:
• Assist in product and inventory control investigations
• Assist in organizing the raw material inventory warehouse, performing stock rotations etc.
• Assist in identifying and quarantine defective and/or expired material

Receiver:
• Receive/inspect incoming finished and raw materials
• Collect all relevant shipping/receiving documents from delivery company and/or supplier
• Count and verifying received material are accurate to packing slips and PO’s
• Tag, scan & store received finished goods and raw materials in designated storage area
• Enter relevant data into the inventory control system for received goods


Qualifications
• Education: Grade 12 or equivalent
• Experience: 2+ Years of previous manufacturing/warehouse inventory control experience, TDG Certification, Chemical Handling Experience, Counterbalance and Reach Truck Certified, ERP systems and RF scanners
• Skills: Microsoft Word, Excel, Good Math Skills, attention to detail

Summary
If interested please send your resume to laura.ogrady@randstad.ca or michal.wilczewski@randstad.ca or call us at 905-637-3473

title: Forklift Operator - Graveyard Shift (FT)
description:
Our Canadian client is looking for an experienced and certified forklift operator to join their growing team at their Surrey facility! They are getting busy and are looking to bring on a brand-new operator for the graveyard shift. If you would like to work for a company that values hard work, teamwork and a “get-it-done” attitude, with a solid track record of safety for their employees, then read on!

Qualifications,
  • Current forklift certification, with proven proficiency on the Counterbalance forklift.
  • 2 - 3 years of warehouse experience, ideally with cross-docking.
  • Experience loading, unloading and maneuvering heavy loads.
  • Must be a good communicator and proficient in speaking, reading and writing in English.
  • Must have good math skills and be accurate.
  • Accountable and responsible to proactively and effectively resolve issues in a timely manner.
  • Steel toed boots in good repair.

Responsibilities:
  • Loading and unloading heavy product, some hand bombing required.
  • Identify and prepare orders for shipment, inspecting for any flaws or damage.
  • Regular safety inspections of the forklift, communicating any issues directly to the supervisor.
  • Work the overnight shift, 11 pm – 7 am with weekends off, and at times the opportunity of OT.

This is a great opportunity with a growing company starting at $23.00/ hour with the opportunity for pay raises based on performance and ATTITUDE! Great team, great company, great location - Why wait? Apply now!!




    About Equation Staffing Solutions.:

    Equation Staffing Solutions is a successful, award-winning Calgary based staffing and recruitment agency specializing in the placement of candidates on a temporary, contract or permanent basis. The industries we serve include oil and gas, warehousing & transportation, finance & accounting, banking, health care, educational institutions, engineering & technology, manufacturing, construction, agriculture and all levels of government. The job families we place people in comprise of general office & admin support, human resources, customer support, warehousing, trades, machine operators, production, accounting, records management, business management & information management.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
We are hiring a Warehouse Associate for day-to-day support in manufacturing including fabrication, finishing, assembly, packaging, or shipping of kitchen cabinets and parts.

Duties include:
  • Read and understand work orders and other production paperwork.
  • Daily preventative maintenance of tools, work area, and equipment.
  • The Finishing department includes loading/unloading parts on the finishing line, and sanding solid wood doors in preparation for stain.
  • The Fabrication department includes dovetail and operating machines such as panels and chop saw.
  • The Assembly department includes assembling prefabricated parts on an assembly line, or at workbenches using screw guns, staple guns, operating clamp machines, and other hand tools.
  • The Shipping department includes loading/unloading finished goods off conveyor parts, and organizing them for shipment.
  • Opportunities to perform other duties as delegated by management.

Skills and Requirements:
  • Some warehouse experience.
  • Able to lift 50 pounds and stand, walk, bend, etc. for 8 hours a day.
  • Effective English reading, writing, and comprehension skills.
  • Time management, prioritization skills, and attention to detail.
  • Self-motivated and can work without direct supervision.

We offer competitive wages along with a comprehensive benefits package including extended health care, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, vacation, company RRSP, free on-site parking, work-life balance (no weekend work), and much more.

Starting wage: Hourly wage $15.20

All team members will be provided training and cross-training in a variety of roles throughout the Merit's manufacturing process.

We are proud to be an inclusive workplace committed to building a team culture. Merit Kitchens provides opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, persons with disabilities, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




    About Merit Kitchens:

    It was 50 years ago that Merit Kitchens was founded by craftspeople in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, and began providing Western Canada with high-quality kitchen cabinets. The company has long since grown into a world-class supplier of beautiful cabinetry, representing superior quality and extraordinary value. Today, Merit’s product can be found in homes throughout Canada, the United States, and parts of Asia. Our Mission it to profitably manufacture cabinets of uncompromising quality while delivering a unique and positively branded experience to our customers, team members and stakeholders alike.

title: Machine Operator / Production Worker – NIGHT SHIFT
description:
IKON Complete Inc. is a Recruitment & Search Firm specializing in identifying, & sourcing top performers for our clientele. Our clients include industry leading organizations who partner with us to be an extension of their HR & Recruitment function.
 
Position: Machine Operator / Production Worker – NIGHT SHIFT
Location: Brantford, ON
Pay Rate: $18.82 - $20.00 per hour
Industry: Automotive Manufacturing
Employment Term: Full Time / Permanent
 
Our client, a leader in the automotive industry, is currently seeking  Machine Operator / Production Workerto join their team in Brantford, ON on the Night Shift. 
 
Duties & Responsibilities:
 
  • Assemble parts, off load and transfer parts
  • Operate high tech machinery and assist machine operators
  • Perform & Document in Process Quality inspections/quality checks
  • Ensure daily production requirements are met
  • Maintain 5S
  • Other duties as required
 
Qualifications:
 
  • Experience working in a fast-paced manufacturing environment
  • Stamping/Press & Die Experience an asset
  • Visual inspection experience is an asset
  • Knowledge and experience with 5S & Kaizen systems preferred but not mandatory
  • Must be able to work a straight MIDNIGHT shift
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Attention to detail in all areas of work
  • Must be able to take direction comfortably, able to multi-task, managing time efficiently to obtain optimum results
  • Manual dexterity, hand-eye coordination and standing for extended periods required
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
 
Pay Scale:
 
·       $18.82 per hour
·       $20.00 per hour after 3 months
 
IKON Complete Inc. is committed to providing accessibility to qualified candidates with disabilities. Requests for accommodation can be made at any time at ikoncomplete.com/accessibility-policy-aoda/

title: Universal Grinder (Day & Afternoon Shift)
description:
Reporting to the Manufacturing Manager of Finishing, the Universal Grinder will accurately set up and operate manual and/or CNC machines to specifications, and tight tolerances. 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Determine machining requirements, dimensional specifications, and set up requirements from drawings and/or component drawings
  • Perform set up and operation of Manual or CNC Cylindrical Grinder(s)
  • Check blueprints to verify machining dimensions to machine a product to the final desired dimension.
  • Studies blueprints, sketches, drawings, specifications, or sample parts to determine dimensions and tolerances for their specific operation, sequence of operation, and setup requirements.
  • Calculates and sets controls to regulate machining factors such as speed, feed, coolant flow, and depth and angle of grind.
  • Matches and identifies stack components and records pre-loads.
  • Through the use of precision measurement tools to ensure quality, the machinist verifies conformance of finished work piece to specifications and all tolerances as low as /-.0002" to /- .001", and signs off on required document.
  • Confers with Supervisor, Production Personnel, or others to resolve any problems they may encounter.
  • The proper maintenance of their machine and housekeeping of their work area.

QUALIFICATIONS:

TECHNICAL SKILLS/EXPERIENCE

  • Post-Secondary education - Diploma or Certificate in General Machining/CNC Programming preferred
  • 3 to 5 years' experience in a similar role with experience working with grinders
  • Knowledge of CNC and Manual set up of grinding machines

title: Welder/Fabricator (FT)
description:
Advanced Material Handling brings over 40 years of combined experience as well as a true team approach to every opportunity we undertake. We are continually developing new conveyor chain and accessories while developing creative solutions and constructing high quality products to meet each customer’s unique requirements.

Currently, we are looking for a Welders/Steel Fabricators at our Abbotsford facility. Position available for both Weekday and Weekend shifts.

Job Description:
  • Flux core Welding
  • Assemble components and parts as required.
  • Ability to read and understand drawings and specifications.
  • Build welding jigs.
  • Use and maintain tools and shop equipment.
  • Ability to read work orders and ensure instructions are being followed.
  • Maintain a clean and organized workspace.
  • Demonstrate safe work practices and procedures.
Requirements:
  • Flux core Welding Experience
  • C and/or B Ticket (Advantageous).
Why join our team?
We offer great company benefits as follows:
  • Competitive wages
  • Clean, modern, safe, and reliable working environment.
  • Job security – we are growing and getting busier.
  • Extended health benefits plans
  • Boot allowance
  • Coveralls
  • Competitive hourly wages
  • Vacation & paid time off
  • Signing bonus after three months employment
Skills/Experience required for this position:
  •  Understanding of mechanical equipment required.
  •  Math and measuring skills.
  •  Ability to multitask.
  •  Ability to work independently.
  •  Problem-solving skills.
  •  Ability to stay organized.
  •  Overall professionalism.
  •  Ability to work in a team environment.
  •  Positive attitude.




    About Advanced Material Handling Ltd:

    Advanced Material Handling Ltd. specializes in the manufacturing of material handling equipment for several industries, i.e.:* Pulp and paper * Mining * Oil and gas* Cement and co-generationWe are continually developing new conveyor chains and accessories while developing creative solutions and constructing high-quality products to meet each customer’s unique requirements.We support the needs of businesses across many industries throughout the globe with our extensive portfolio of technical expertise. We work successfully with medium to large businesses to implement and maintain the best product solutions that generate real value. We bring over 40 years of combined experience as well as a true team approach to every opportunity we undertake. We work with business leaders to help them make informed choices and wise total cost of ownership investments that create real value. Our ideal client understands the role that reliable material handling equipment plays in their business performance and is ready to invest in the right solutions, supported by the best service in the industry.We have built our reputation as carefully as our products.https://advancedmaterial.ca/

title: Quality Control Technician
description:
Are you hungry to innovate? To do things differently? To work with a company that’s real, thoughtful and very forward-thinking?

Meet Riverside. We are an organic, “better for you” snack company, manufacturing award-winning, nutritious, allergen-free snacks. Your kids know us as MadeGood, tasty school-safe snacks. Your workout buddies grab GoodTo Go Keto certified bars. And your pup begs for a Cookie Pal treat, our human-grade, vegan dog treats.

At Riverside, we make delicious snacks that are good in every way. From our ingredients to our manufacturing practices, we’ve raised every bar on every aspect. We’re friendly and focused on creating foods that are good for you and good to the planet as well. Riverside Natural Foods is B-Corp certified, Triple-Bottom Line, Zero Waste, and Canadian owned and operated.

Come work with a new Canadian leader! We value teamwork, humility, respect, ownership, adaptability, passion and fun.

You can learn more about us at www.riversidenaturalfoods.com

We continue to grow and today are looking for a committed, talented, star to join our team as our Quality Assurance Technician.

Job Description

Reporting to the QA Supervisor, this person will be responsible for the successful operation of the Quality Control and inspection of products manufactured. Candidates should be flexible working a rotating shift, Morning, Afternoon, and Night before they can be considered for this role

Position Summary/Objective:

Reporting to QA Supervisor, you will be responsible for monitoring manufacturing and processing activities to ensure that our products are made in compliance with organization and customer specifications and to meet and exceed regulatory requirements. At the end of the day you will be responsible for ensuring our products are made defect and risk free.

Key Accountabilities and Activities:

  • Demonstrate and uphold Riverside Natural Food’s core values
  • Keeps the work atmosphere FUN by keeping it light and welcoming
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Assist in implementing Riverside and BRC Food Safety standards on the floor
  • Provide clear and effective training to Operators for conducting Critical to Quality and CCP checks.
  • Conduct routine pre-operational inspection duties to assure compliance to sanitation standards
  • Document procedures and records such as CCP, critical limits, monitoring and deviation procedures or steps to be taken in the event of non-conformance
  • Takes OWNERSHIP to undertake random hygiene and housekeeping audits
  • Communicate test results and provide recommendations for operations personnel to ensure finished products are within specifications
  • Ensure complete and accurate records of all testing and evaluations are maintained and verified for compliance to specifications
  • Sample and perform Sensory evaluation of incoming ingredients and finished products
  • Verify packaging artwork to ensure they meet company specifications; conduct qualitative and quantitative testing of finished goods
  • Perform glass inspections, environmental and sanitation swabbing as per schedule
  • Maintain highest possible housekeeping standards to prevent microbial contamination
  • Maintain all related records, ensure verification as required
  • Support/participate in completing document and process reviews and audits

Reporting Relationship:

  • The position reports directly to the QA Supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • 1 year of working experience within the food industry
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to work with a high degree of accuracy
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills, self-starter with a high level of initiative and ADAPTABILITY
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to convey complex information to a non-expert audience
  • TEAM player with a positive attitude
  • Good computer skills with intermediate level Microsoft Office Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Analytical, with problem-identification and problem-solving capabilities;
  • PASSIONATE and positive attitude with a desire to learn and collaborate;
  • Aptitude to exhibit, RESPECT and protect Riverside’s Core Values in a changing environment
  • Demonstrates HUMILITY throughout the company on a day to day basis

How to Apply:

If you have the commitment to excellence, the energy, the attitude and experience we need, then please submit your resume to careers(AT)riversidenaturals.com with the subject line Quality Assurance Technician or click the apply button!

Riverside Natural Foods is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you have a disability and require accommodation in the interview process, please let us know when you apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to volume, please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Depending on the nature of the role, you may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by your hire date to be eligible to start the role. In this case, proof of vaccination will be required by your start date. Riverside will consider and review accommodation requests based on protected human rights grounds for qualified candidates.

title: Mechanical Designer, Automation
description:
About StackTeck Systems Limited

StackTeck, with over five decades of mold building innovation, is a leading source of high productivity tooling solutions for the injection molding industry. StackTeck supplies a wide range of injection molds and IML automation used to produce plastic parts in applications such as caps, closures, medical, PET preforms, and thinwall packaging; as well as complete system integrations including IML. StackTeck has dedicated R&D, testing and part sampling facilities, in addition to plastic part design, prototyping, engineering, and manufacturing capabilities. StackTeck Systems Ltd. is located 8 km north of Torontoâ€™s Pearson International Airport.

SUMMARY: Working with a small team of designers/engineers/service technicians, the Mechanical Designer will play a critical role in the design and implementation of robotic automation systems in the injection molding industry. The right candidate will possess extensive knowledge and experience from conceptualizing, to designing, manufacturing, assembly, and support of such systems. This individual may have had experience working for other machine builders, notably in the plastics packaging industry.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work closely with the Quoting/Mechanical & Controls Engineering/Procurement/Service teams to design, and support automation cells in the plastics injection molding industry
  • Generate automation cell layouts, detail drawings, shop drawings, BOMs, material selection, and technical documentation packages (Such as user manuals, spare parts lists, etc.)
  • Able to autonomously select, size, design, and implement pneumatics, induction and servo drive systems based on dynamic analysis
  • Participate in design reviews
  • Some travel may be required

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE/EXPERIENCE:

  • Post-Secondary education â€“ Completion of College or University in Mechanical Engineering/Design including Mechatronics, Industrial, and Electromechanical disciplines
  • Minimum 2-5 yearsâ€™ experience as a Mechanical Designer
  • Extensive experience in SolidWorks, (Both 2D and 3D)
  • Experience in SolidWorks PDM
  • Injection Molding knowledge is an asset
  • In Mold Labelling knowledge is an asset
  • Strong communication and computer skills

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, (AODA), StackTeck will provide accommodation, accessible formats, and communication supports for the recruitment process upon request.

title: Operations Associate / General Labour
description:
INTRODUCTION:

AGS Automotive Systems is a full-service automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and supply of complex high value-add automotive metal components, including in particular front and rear impact assemblies, principally for pick-ups and the heavy truck market. AGS offers full range of in-house capabilities including design and engineering, high tonnage metal stamping, light weighting solutions, innovative multi-material joining, high performance coatings including chrome plating and automated manufacturing processes.

AGS is committed to delivering high quality, high value products to our customers, who include several of North America's largest automakers. For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork.


BASIC FUNCTION:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Operations Associate is responsible for, but not limited to, the operation of the various production stations on the e2z Coatings Production Floor including, E-Coat Load and Unload, assembly weld and robotic weld stations, repack, and polishing operations. Each associate is responsible to work safely in compliance with all company rules and policies and ensure the production of quality parts.

This is a permanent full-time job opportunity to start as soon as possible. The position offers comprehensive dental and health benefits.

Straight shift work, non-rotational, but must be open to all shift types.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

  • Adheres to System Procedures and Instructions.
  • Capable of independently setting up and operating the various work stations as assigned to efficiently produce good quality parts to the standards as specified.
  • High attention to detail and able to seek assistance, as necessary, to make a quality part.
  • Responsible for the safe and proper operation of each job, work station or piece of equipment.
  • Responsible to maintain quality standards and ensure production standards are met.
  • Completes accurately all paperwork that pertains to the job.
  • Maintain a safe and tidy work area at all times.
  • Ensure the standards of Section 28 of the OHSA are met.
  • Adheres to their scheduled shift start and end times and lunch and break schedules.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Previous experience in a manufacturing facility.
  • Ability to read and write English.
  • Experience driving lift truck will be considered an asset

AGS Automotive Systems is proud to support the full inclusion of persons with disabilities as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At AGS we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request by contacting AGS Human Resources at

HR@agsautomotive.com

.

title: Manufacturing Engineering - Electro/Mechanical (Peterborough, ON, CA)
description:
At BWXT Nuclear Energy Canada Inc. we are committed to excellence in every business initiative. BWXT Nuclear Energy Canada (BWXT NEC) has achieved an enviable international reputation for excellence in the supply of nuclear fuel and fuel handling systems and service for CANDU reactors in both domestic and international markets. Our success is the result of our commitment to our employees, customers, quality & EHS initiatives.

 

Manufacturing Engineering Specialist - Electro/Mechanical

 

We are looking for a Manufacturing Engineering Specialist - Electro/Mechanical for our Peterborough, Ontario site.  BWXT NEC's Fuel Handling and Engineered Solutions group is involved in the design, manufacture, development, testing, parts supply, and service of on-power refueling, reactor maintenance, and nuclear medicine delivery tooling sold around the world. We are the original designer of the automated systems that allow 24/7 on power refueling of CANDU reactors and aim to solve some of the Nuclear Industry’s most challenging problems. Today, BWXT’s equipment is being used in most of the nuclear power plants in Canada and is critical to delivering carbon free energy production and lifesaving medical isotopes.

 

Check out the YouTube video of an innovative product we recently designed and manufactured in partnership with Bruce Power, called the Bruce Reactor Inspection and Maintenance System Channel Access Device. Go to YouTube and search for video: “Bruce Unveils new BRIMS Tool”. There are exceptional opportunities to learn and grow with a career in the nuclear industry in Ontario.

 

The Peterborough community invites you to take a deep breath, relax and enjoy life. We have an abundance of recreational opportunities, festivals, and entertainment that is fueled by culture, nature and homegrown culinary experiences. Friendly people, inspiring landscapes and incredible lakes are waiting for you in the heart of cottage country. The region is home to 140,000 people (approx. 83,000 in the City of Peterborough) in addition to the charming towns, townships and villages that make up the County. We offer the best of all worlds here and we’d like you to get to know us a bit better. http://peterboroughed.ca/why-peterborough/live/

 

JOB SUMMARY:

 

Reporting directly to the Manufacturing Engineering Manager, the Manufacturing Engineering Specialist - Electro/Mechanical is responsible for the estimating, planning and execution of a broad range of projects to manufacture custom-engineered electro-mechanical equipment for nuclear customers.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

  • Prepare detailed cost estimates for custom-engineered manufacturing projects including electro-mechanical automation, tooling, welded fabrications, machining, field services, testing.
  • Provide manufacturing inputs to the design process, participate in manufacturability reviews to identify manufacturing cost or schedule improvements during product design.
  • Plan and lead jobs through manufacturing including machining, welding, mechanical and electrical assembly and test.  Write instructions (shop travelers) for in-house activities, manufacturing sketches, weld map records, assembly/test specs, etc.  Identify, design and procure fixtures and required tooling.
  • Prepare Manufacturing Bills of Material from engineering BOM’s, on JD Edwards MRP system. Perform make vs buy evaluations.  Requisition purchased parts and materials for in-house manufactured items.
  • Manage design changes and maintain configuration of the design during manufacturing.
  • Lead and participate in project meetings related to schedules and budgets, including meetings with customers.
  • Prepare schedule inputs for projects, including task planning to optimize lead times.
  • Troubleshoot production problems with design and manufacturing teams, including recommending dispositions for non-conformances.
  • Lead or participate in teams carrying out work at customer sites.
  • Drive continuous improvement of manufacturing activities.

      

QUALIFICATIONS:

 

  • College/University graduate in an Engineering discipline.
  • Knowledge and experience with machining (conventional + CNC/CAM), fitting/welding, assembly and materials including stainless steels, Al-bronze, nickel alloys, zirconium, etc.
  • Knowledge and experience with assembly and testing of complex electrical and mechanical equipment.
  • Knowledge or experience with metrology, Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerances (GD&T), blue print reading.
  • Experience in cost-estimating multi-disciplined equipment and facility projects.
  • High level of proficiency with data analysis and management including spreadsheet tools, MRP systems, etc.
  • Demonstrated ability in project planning / execution, including development of processes / procedures and process improvements.
  • Very strong communication and interpersonal skills.

 

DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS:

 

  • Manufacturing planning experience in custom engineered equipment industry.
  • Experience working with ASME Code rules for identification and traceability of materials, manufacturing processes, testing etc.
  • Knowledge/experience with instrumentation and control equipment, PLC systems, cable assemblies, panels, industrial automation.  Familiar with wiring diagrams, electrical schematics.
  • Basic knowledge of common non-destructive examination (NDE) techniques.
  • Technical writing experience including procedures, customer proposals, technical reports.
  • Experience with Primavera (P6) project scheduling software.
  • Experience in the nuclear industry.

 

If you see yourself in a challenging, rewarding career at an extremely diverse, innovation-driven company, this is the perfect place to ramp up your career.  BWXT's supportive environment and free flow of information will encourage you to imagine, build, solve and lead.

 

We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.

 

BWXT Nuclear Energy Canada Inc. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, a conviction for which a pardon has been granted or a record suspended or any other category protected by federal law.

title: Production Operator- Magna Exteriors Sunderland
description:
Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

 

Role Summary

This is a transformational role at the heart of a technology change, which will underpin and assure the company’s success in the future. We are looking for motivated Production Operators who believe in continous improvement, putting forward new ideas and designing for the future. As a Production Operator, you will assist in the daily production requirements in a high volume fast paced assembly line, carrying out manual and automated tasks in a highly automated environment.  

This role is currently working a 2 shift pattern. 

Hourly Rate starting at £10 p/h + 12% shift allowance

Key Responsibilities

•    Operate production line equipment such air power tools, riveter guns, torque drivers and automated punch machines.
•    Load and unload assembly work
•    Carry out visual checks to ensure high quality standards
•    Interact with the touch screens (MES) systems
•    Assemble goods on a production line, carry out cleaning and basic maintenance of work areas and machinery
•    Report equipment faults to direct team leader 
•    Set and operate hand-controlled or computer-controlled machines  &
•    Carry out random quality control checks on products. 
•    Ensure products are to the correct tolerances and meet customer and internal standards and specifications
•    Ensure all standard Operating procedures (SOPs) are followed
•    Ensure all safe working procedures are followed
•    Keep plant and site to a high level of housekeeping (5S) and support processes
•    Raise any issues in a timely manner
•    Adhere to all Manufacturing Standards (MAFACT)
•    Adherence to all current Health, Safety and Environmental regulations and guidance including Magna Policies
•    Other duties commensurate to the role.

Essentials

•    Experience of working in a high volume production environment
•    Able to work as part of a team and on own. 
•    Able to work on own initiative when necessary  
•    Able to work to within tight cycles/deadlines and with minimum supervision
•    Able to work in a safe manner    
•    Ability to read and follow written and verbal instructions and work to standards
•    Good Manual dexterity  
•    Experience of working with assembly’s
 

Desirable

  • Practical hands-on approach to problem solving
  • Previous Automotive manufacturing experience
  • Key Skills Level 1
  • Understanding of lean manufacturing, 5S process, and 7 Wastes
  • Understanding of production costs to include waste, downtime, scrap and re-work
  • Good understanding of customer deliverables and the impact of failure / cost of poor quality
  • Ability to work across multiple areas of the assembly process
skills: ['Previous Automotive manufacturing experience', 'Good understanding of customer deliverables and the impact of failure / cost of poor quality', 'Understanding of production costs to include waste, downtime, scrap and re-work', 'Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.', 'Practical hands-on approach to problem solving']

title: Day Shift Machine Operator (FT)
description:
Vitacore Industries
8518 Glenlyon Pkwy, Burnaby, BC V5J 0B6, Canada

Job Position: Day Shift Machine Operator (Full Time Position)

About the Company:
Vitacore Industries Inc. manufactures personal protective equipment for Canadian frontline workers, available on demand. Our facility houses state-of-the-art equipment to produce millions of respirators every month. Vitacore is committed to serving Canadians. All of our current and future PPE is made using a Canadian supply chain and quality Canadian materials.
We are growing and hiring machine operators to run our automated machinery, change material rolls, troubleshoot jams, and inspect the final product. Our South Burnaby plant is located near Marine Way and has ample parking available.

Job Details:
  • Machine Operator - Day Shift (Mon-Thurs)
  • Wage: $22/hr
  • Schedule: (Mon to Thurs Day Shift).
Shift Hours:
  • The role is a regular full-time position for 10 hours 4 days a week shift.
  • Monday through Thursday: 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. – includes a 30-minute paid break
  • Full benefits after successful completion of a 3-month probation period.
Responsibilities include:
  • Follow Team Leader instructions and company procedures.
  • Inspect components and materials.
  • Attend to details, ensuring safe work practices.
  • Other duties as required.
Skills and Qualifications:
  • Experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Mechanical aptitude, able to quickly learn new tasks.
  • Physically able to sit, stand, walk, bend, etc., and able to occasionally lift or move up to 40 pounds.
  • Manual dexterity and visual abilities for close-up detailed work and color distinctions.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Level 1 first aid would be an asset.
  • Speaking, reading, and comprehension skills.
Application Details:
  • While we sincerely appreciate all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Tool & Die/Mouldmaker Maker
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

The successful candidate will be able to work in a team environment and have good problem solving skills. You will be able to handle multiple tasks on a daily basis with well-developed organization and time management skills.  

Responsibilities:
  • Perform daily/monthly trouble shooting, improvements,PM, repairs, modifications on moulds and auxiliary equipment;
  • Read and verify all critical information on the Work Order and on the drawings;
  • Able to operate lathe, milling machine, surface grinder, welding equipment, radial drilling machine independently;
  • Assemble and maintain hot runner systems;
  • Ensure that all the tools and fixtures are present at the workplace to ensure that the maintenance is done properly;
  • Experience in design and manufacturing End of Arms Tools;
  • Knowledge in robots, injection moulding machines and their auxiliary equipment;
  • Ability to do repairs to texture surfaces.
Qualifications:
  • Graduate of a Mechanical / Industrial Engineering Program or equivalent;
  • Must hold a ticket in Mould/Tool and Die Making;
  • Must have experience in an injection moulding facility;
  • Must have forklift and crane license;
  • Electrical/hydraulic and hot runners experience, an asset;
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills;
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment and able to work within tight deadlines.
Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Production Technician
description:
A production technician may be responsible to fill a position to complete a variety of tasks throughout the manufacturing facility. These may include forklift operation (certification provided), machine operation, formation works, assembly and final inspection. Equipment operation and safety training is provided for applicable roles.

Duties specific to this role include:

  • verifying condition and weights of materials and products
  • cleaning work areas and equipment as well as performing other labouring and elemental activities

Preferred ticket /experience

  • Forklift experience an asset
  • WHIMIS or First Aid tickets, (asset, however training will be provided)
skills: ['Preferred ticket /experience', 'WHIMIS or First Aid tickets, (asset, however training will be provided)', 'Forklift experience an asset']

title: Tool & Die Maker
description:
Description
Our client provides a comprehensive range of automotive parts to all of the major OEM. Through their robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, they continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.
 
Role Summary
To ensure that the assigned task is performed safely, efficiently and in an organized manner in accordance with the plant rules and production schedules.  It is expected that there is a commitment for never ending improvements and a positive relationship to fellow employees and supervisors.

Key Responsibilities
•    Have the understanding and knowledge of all equipment and machinery related to Tool & Die Making
•    Ability to build new tooling and fixtures, without supervision
•    Ability to try out new tooling and engineering changes without supervision
•    Fully conversant with SPC
•    Meet scheduled dates set by Toolroom Supervisor or Toolroom Teamleader
•    Carry a company supplied communication device during scheduled shift to ensure support for production
•    Commitment to continuous improvement, both in the tools and processes
•    Good interpersonal skills and results oriented
•    Train apprentices in all aspects of Tool & Die Making and safety
•    Exemplary attitude towards housekeeping, safety, company policies and fellow Employees,
•    Make educated decisions based on production demands, and the companies best interest
•    Work within the guidelines of the Employee Handbook
•    Team Player,
•    TS16949 awareness and adherence
•    ISO14001 awareness and adherence
•    Lean Manufacturing and 5S concepts awareness and adherence
•    Commitment to continuous improvement and work place safety
•    Other duties as may be required
 
SAFETY PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS: 
  • Accepts personal responsibility to plan and conduct their work safety in compliance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act as well as company policies and guideline
  • Responsible for Good House Keeping in your area
 
Key Qualifications/Requirements
•    Licensed Tool & Die maker
•    5 years of Tool Room experience
•    A working knowledge (written & verbal) of both English and Mathematics
•    Physically capable of performing the essential duties of the job
•    Ability to perform all assigned tasks related to Tool & Die
•    Making in a timely manner while maintaining quality standards
•    Flexible on work hours and shifts
•    Proficient in the use of all Toolroom equipment and related measuring equipment
 
Additional Information
Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request
skills: ['Accepts personal responsibility to plan and conduct their work safety in compliance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act as well as company policies and guideline', 'Responsible for Good House Keeping in your area']

title: Assembler
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Assembler at our 352 Arvin Ave. location.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Assembler is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to: assembly, training, inspecting, problem solving, machine operator as well as communicating manpower and scheduling issues with supervision. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the IATF Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Responsibilities:

  • Assemble customer supplied automotive parts to meet specified quality standards.
  • Record daily production ensuring accuracy and submit to Supervisor.
  • Handle product properly at all times, and assemble according to specifications.
  • Ensure that materials or equipment required be kept in a clean manner before and after shifts and report any maintenance issues to Supervisor.
  • Conduct a final inspection before customer product is packed and/or labeled.
  • Handle product properly at all times and package according to specifications.
  • Ensure that work area is clean and orderly throughout and after the shift.
  • Comply with company work and safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and potential hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined.
  • Perform duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent preferred.
  • Experience in manufacturing environment is preferred.
  • Effective communication skills, verbal, and written
  • Interpret technical drawings and specifications
  • Ability to work rotating shifts, 1 week day shift (6:00am-3:00pm) and 1 week afternoon shift (3:30pm-12:15PM)

Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources athr@tiercon.com.

title: Material Handler - $1000 SIGNING BONUS!!
description:
We are currently seeking new members to join our manufacturing team! If you have a positive attitude, a strong work ethic and are interested in working for a growing, dynamic company then we may have a position for you. We offer an exceptional health & dental package and the opportunity to be a part of a company that designs and manufactures building enclosures for amazing projects across North America.

This key position within our material handling department and manufacturing facility will be responsible for operating a forklift to move, locate, relocate, stack and inventory raw material and finished product. The operator will be accountable for the safe and efficient operation of the vehicle and will be responsible to ensure the working order of the forklift at all times.

In addition, this position will assist with general labour duties as assigned by the supervisor.

1. Follow direction set by the Manager or Supervisor.
2. Unload, load and transport inbound and outbound material and finished goods.
3. Organize and store raw material and supplies in the designated areas within the production facility and yard.
4. Supply assembly lines with infills and the saw / CNC department with raw and cut material for processing.
5. Safely utilize a forklift, scissor lift and telehandler.
6. Participate in clean-up and maintenance, as required.
7. Maintain a clean and organized work area at all times.

Requirements:

  • High school diploma. 
  • Previous inventory based / manufacturing experience is an asset. 
  • Lift truck certification and 1-3 years' experience in a material handling based role is preferred. 
  • Overhead Crane experience is an asset. 
  • Basic knowledge of mathematics, hand and power tools and measuring implements is a strong asset.

title: Senior Inventory Control Specialist
description:
Purpose:

  • Lead the daily operations of the Inventory and distribution Departments; to include maximize labour and equipment utilization.
  • overseeing inventory control, managing deliveries, receiving, and inspection, maintain inventory records, and ordering products.
  • to track items, parts, and products for a company, reporting inventory levels and issues to management, looking for any discrepancy with inventory, and creating reports that show available inventory or issues with inventory counts.

Role:

  • Plan, organize, schedule, and supervise the day-to-day inventory department operations, which encompass all receiving, pick lists and shop orders
  • Monitor completeness, accuracy, and compliance during inventory transactions.
  • Oversee data entry for inventory control, shipping, and receiving.
  • Lead and supervise inventory team, resolving problems, conducting training, and setting schedules.
  • Track, audit, and ensure adequate supply of inventory throughout the organization
  • Lead, manage, develop, train, and monitor performance of staff
  • Ensure all employee issues and concerns are addressed in a timely manner; encourage involvement from all staff, and foster a positive team environment
  • Implement plans and work processes which minimize shipping costs
  • stocking and receiving timelines, through effective utilization of manpower and equipment
  • Ensure each department meets their scheduled delivery deadlines
  • Review the shipping reports; prioritization and completion of orders ensuring incoming/outgoing orders do not remain on the report for more than three business days
  • Review shipping documentation, following domestic, USMCA and international regulations
  • Manage and evaluate inventory control and performance, for all stock locations
  • Lead the annual inventory count process.
  • Lead the inventory cycle count implementation, utilizing the ABC cycle count methodology
  • Manage all receiving, and completeness of tasks in a timely manner
  • Ensure the department employees follow company policies, procedures and work processes and Health & Safety regulations as per the OH&S Act and D&V PPE policy
  • Supervise and foster a healthy and safe work environment ensuring all safety rules and guidelines are followed and maintained
  • Maintain good housekeeping in all inventory dept, as per the 5S program
  • Liaise with the scheduler/planner, purchasing and shipping, maintaining an open line of communication and commitment to the completion of daily tasks
  • Report and address material shortages and employee issues to the Operations Manager
  • You are responsible for keeping the distribution, inventory stockroom and surrounding areas clean and clear of garbage.
  • Responsible for the Manufacturing Shop Order
  • Manager shop order process included creating, picking, checking, monitoring, closing, and correcting any discrepancies on all Shop
  • Responsible for generating all Inventory Month End KPI reports.
  • Must join Joint Health and Safety committee and attend all meetings.
  • Lead the monthly JH&S inspection and provide the report details to HR/JH&S secretary

Education and Experience:

  • Grade 12 diploma, Undergraduate degree or CPIM preferred
  • 5 + Years of progressively responsible, industrial and/or plant experience in: shipping, receiving and inventory control
  • 1-2 years' experience in a supervisory capacity, preferably in a manufacturing environment
  • Licensed to operate a Raymond Reach Lift Truck
  • High energy level required
  • Strong leadership skills required
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required
  • strong organizational and planning capabilities required

D & V Electronics values their employees. We encourage life-long learning and foster employee personal growth. If you're someone who enjoys working in a creative and innovative work environment, and would like to join our team, please submit your resume and covering letter to:

careers@dvelectronics.com

We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization, however; only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Quality Technician
description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

This role is responsible to conduct quality verification protocols to ensure that all finished products meet with Mars Quality and Food Safety Specifications. Quality Technician associates enable conformance to specification through the verification of execution in quality control protocols and/or monitoring of sampling and testing plans applied to packaging and product.

This resource also enables the reduction of food safety incidents and non-quality costs by the immediate escalation of any out of conformance condition detected during verification activities. Also, this role supports the maintenance of quality knowledge and skills required in operation associates for proper execution of quality control protocols and proper data documentation and records keeping. Operational non-quality related activities are out of the scope of this role such machine operator's reliefs.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • Responsible for shift-based quality verification or monitoring activities for packaging and finished product (based on the site size this might be extended to raw materials)
  • Verify conformance of finished product and/or in-process for sensory attributes and participate in site sensory panels.
  • Verify conformance of finished product attributes and product defects following quality approved standards and procedures.
  • Verify proper execution of packaging GRD and Code dates monitoring protocols to ensure correct packaging is used and product traceability is not compromised.
  • Verify scale calibration accuracy.
  • Initiate PRIMPS and Nonconformance's in Nexus.
  • Ensures that only nexus approved documents are used in the packaging line for quality related activities and archives quality related records for further analysis or auditing purposes.
  • Provides quality related information to operators to enable quality control activities.
  • Escalate to process areas any out of conformance incidents and collaborate in trouble shooting providing all information needed on product quality attributes until process and product are back in control and this will include sending out daily report on quality verification checks and primp entered to Leads and Quality managers.
  • Identify and isolate out-of-specification materials, including placing product on hold, initiating non-conformances and escalating to the correct associates. They are expected to collaborate closely with Material Handling area to ensure all non-conforming products are captured in house.
  • Support/lead calibration program activities to ensure overall QMP compliance.
  • Perform off-line metal detector screening for suspected product from metal detector rejections.
  • Verifies that procedures to complete quality related documentation are properly executed and information in the records is complete.
  • Sign off all quality check paperwork if Lead is not present for all packaging lines, Industrial Product (IP) and Chocolate Plant within 48hours of the production shift and shift release.
  • Provides coaching and training to associates to ensure proper QMP understanding, execution of quality control protocols, data accuracy and proper record management control.
  • Quality conformance associates may be required to be part of the HACCP team and Internal Auditors group to support quality and food safety continuous improvement program and CAPA's execution.
  • QCC to assist on quality investigate on hold product and expire raw material, and document information in Nexus with concessions. Conduct validate metal detectors on each bar line. SWAB testing after equipment has been cleaned and sanitize

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

  • High school diploma, or equivalent
  • Experience within a manufacturing environment and/or previous quality control experience in a food-related industry.
  • Excellent written and oral communications skills are essential as these associates often serve as coordinators of information between functions and across levels of the business
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds repetitively
  • Must be able to work at elevated heights
  • Must be able to adapt to temperature and environmental extremes from hot to cold, dust, dirt and chemicals
  • Computer/Technical savvy
  • Works proficiently in: Excel, Nexus, Win SPC, Microsoft Office, Outlook, etc.
  • Ability to establish good peer relationships

Operational non-quality related activities are out of the scope of this role such machine operator's reliefs.", 'Provides quality related information to operators to enable quality control activities.', 'Must be able to adapt to temperature and environmental extremes from hot to cold, dust, dirt and chemicals', 'Must be able to work at elevated heights', 'Sign off all quality check paperwork if Lead is not present for all packaging lines, Industrial Product (IP) and Chocolate Plant within 48hours of the production shift and shift release.', 'Identify and isolate out-of-specification materials, including placing product on hold, initiating non-conformances and escalating to the correct associates. title: Warehouse Worker/In House Production
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">At Amarr we strive to be the best. And to be the best, we have to provide the best quality, the best service, and employ the best people. We have a warehouse associate opening in Abbotsford, and are looking for the best to join our team. We are looking for someone who: * Is a motivated, hard worker * Is not afraid of heavy lifting * Is always treating our customers the way they deserve to be treated * Believes in working together as a team and doing what needs to be done * Will be with us for the long haul In this position you will: * Unload and inspect incoming product (this can be between 50-75lb) mostly by hand * Pull, stage, and load product for customers, while providing excellent service * Assist in post-production activities including glazing doors * Assist with inventory and damage control Requirements and Qualifications: * Must be at least 18 years old and have a valid driver's license * Requires heavy repetitive lifting (50-75lb) and constant movement * Demonstrated history of steady employment The Details: This position is Monday - Friday from 7:30am - 4:30pm with occasional overtime. The pay rate starts at $20 based on experience. In business for over 60 years, Amarr is one of the world's leading brands in design, manufacturing and distribution of residential and commercial garage doors. We offer benefits, including 401k. Our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our vision is to build a great company through people, products, and service. Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled</section>

title: Packer Inspector-11:00 PM - 7:00 AM
description:
The Company

PET Power Containers, a TricorBraun company, is a global packaging leader, with more than 1,100 team members working from 50 locations throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia.

As North America’s largest distributor of primary packaging, we provide innovative solutions to customers from a wide variety of industries. Our award-winning Design & Engineering team provides creative, custom packaging solutions, for cutting-edge start-ups to the world’s most iconic brands. And as one of the largest purchasers of packaging in the world, we leverage our global supply chain expertise to provide cost-effective solutions for our customers.

Since our company was founded in 1902, we have continually evolved to meet our customers’ needs. Our substantial growth, both organic and through strategic acquisitions, enables us to provide unlimited opportunities for team members to develop and succeed.

We are focused on being the Best Place for the Best People in Packaging—it is the foundation of our strategy and of our success. Join us as we work together to build the undisputed global packaging leader.

The Role

The Packer Inspector will be responsible for safe handling of all duties to include keeping work area free from debris and clutter with no trip hazards. Area must be clean & well-organized while applying Good Manufacturing Practices. Monitoring to ensure the blow molding machines are operating properly and notify Shift Supervisors of any irregularities/defects. Visually inspect preforms and bottles during the manufacturing/packaging process and inform Shift Supervisors of any irregularities/defects. Packaging bottles in the format specified by the Company while assisting with the setup of packaging line and follows packaging specifications in packing bottles in either a box or a tray. This position is not limited to other duties as needed by the Shift Supervisor, Production Manager or the Plant Manager.

The Requirements

To be a good fit for this opportunity you will have:

  • Previous experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • High School Diploma.
  • Ability to read and write, as well as comprehend instructions, correspondences and memos.
  • Ability to regularly lift and move up to 25 pounds frequently. Regularly standing, walk, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl.
  • Ability to work in fast paced environment safely.


Why TricorBraun

Career Opportunities -- We are a stable and growing company offering a product that is widely recognized and useful. That means that across our organization we have plenty of ways to help people who are looking to grow and succeed. If you’ve got the drive to get out there and grab it, you’ll find lots of opportunity here.

Training and Development -- Our commitment to your career development helps to set us apart as an employer. We want to enhance your potential, both for your personal development and as a contributor to our firm. That’s why we provide every opportunity to expand your skills, knowledge, and experiences through formal education, leadership development opportunities, and informal one-on-one coaching and mentoring from your TricorBraun colleagues.

Stable Industry -- The packaging industry is a particularly stable one because, no matter how the economy is doing there is always a need for containers to carry consumer products. With our long history, exceptional experience, and wide range of offerings we’re the industry leader in this niche industry.

Strong Culture -- We strive to create and sustain a great work environment in which we are able to achieve and exceed personal and professional goals. Our people focus on service and consistently drive for results. Our company works and lives by a set of core values which include integrity, service, passion and value add which are the roots of our success.

Industry Recognition -- TricorBraun has won many national and international packaging awards recognizing excellent design, function, economy and sustainability

Excellent Compensation -- in addition to a competitive salary and benefits options, we also offer a RRSP plan with employer match, paid time off plus holidays, tuition reimbursement, and more.

TricorBraun is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Manufacturing Worker (FT)
description:
Alexandria Moulding is a leading moulding manufacturer and distributor of wood and wood composite mouldings in North America & the world and is currently comprised of five distinct facilities within Canada and the United States.
12-Hour Rotating Night Shift: 6:00pm-6:00am
Afternoon Shift: Monday to Friday 3:30pm-11:30pm

Job Duties and Essential Functions:
  • Tasks to be performed at various equipment and work stations, i.e:
  • Feed/tie.
  • Receive.
  • Quality assurance.
  • Apply bar codes.
  • Strap bundle, etc.
  • Able to lift 50 pounds unassisted.
  • Candidates must be of a serious nature and have a work record of regular and punctual attendance.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements:
  • Must have high school diploma.
  • At least one-year experience operating a forklift.
  • Distribution/Supply Chain experience an asset.
  • Must be able to do basic math functions such as adding, subtracting, and dividing.
  • Must be able to read orders for picking and staging of products.
  • Must be able to complete the pre-shift inspection forms.
HOW TO APPLY:
Moulure Alexandria Moulding Incis an equal opportunity employer and will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities during the selection process.

title: Programmer Scheduler
description:
The programmer Scheduler is responsible to ensure of the accuracy and completeness of the information feed to the CNC equipment within the metal processing division. This information must be available to ensure the equipment and raw materials are best utilized while ensure the needs of the customers are being meet.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Programing and scheduling of the various pieces of CNC equipment within the metal processing area. Including, plasma torch, Laser, Press brakes and Rolls.
  • Focus on manufacturing products in the most efficient manner while increasing factory throughput and output.
  • Focus on continuous improvement and Lean initiatives.
  • Work closely with programming and scheduling manager to ensure an accurate short and long term plan to meet the needs of the metal processing customers.
  • Ensure material utilization is better than the prescribed requirement, if not must raise issue to the manager
  • Generate reports indicating machine performance and material utilization
  • Follow standard operating procedures as defined by manager and give input and suggestions on ways to improve
  • Monitor loading on each piece of equipment and shift work between work centers to maintain a level load, shortest lead time and effective use of raw materials.
  • Other duties, relevant to the position, shall be assigned as required.
  • Very good organization and team collaboration skills
  • Self-starter who is results oriented with a strong work ethic
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Ability to learn software programs very quickly
  • Can read drawings

Required Experience

  • Technical training such as mechanical technologist diploma or engineering degree would be an asset
  • Preference given to individuals Planning and Scheduling Professional (PSP) accreditation
  • Experience in programing and operating CNC equipment, including lasers, press brakes, plasmas, rolls, saws and mills.
  • Experience with nesting software with preference to experience in Sigmanest and Trumpf software.
  • Proficient in CAD software with preference to experience in Solidworks.
  • Basic knowledge of MRP systems and inventory management
  • This is a shift work position
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds

title: Auxiliary Production Associate
description:
Job Number: 44421 
Group: Magna Mechatronics, Mirrors & Lighting  
Division: Windsor Modules 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: WINDSOR 

 

Group Description

The Mechatronics, Mirrors and Lighting group specializes in automotive technologies that are driving the future of mobility. Combining a deep systems knowledge to develop unique vehicle access experiences, intelligent visions systems and advanced automotive lighting technologies, MML's expertise light the path to innovation, safety and styling.

 

Role Summary

This position involves working as a member of a team in the day-to-day manufacturing of assembling products and includes meeting all quality, safety, and productivity objectives as set out by Windsor Modules.

Key Responsibilities

•    Operate various machines involved in the assembly and testing of parts by inspecting and inserting appropriate components, activating machine, receiving and inspecting assembled parts, and placing it in  the appropriate location
•    May rotate to and operate all machines in assembly
•    May be required to hand assemble pieces or components as required
•    Carries out quality control inspections on all assembled parts by machine or other methods as instructed
•    Follow ODS described at required work stations
•    Uphold 5S standard for continuous improvement
•    Performs all duties in accordance with  TS16949 and ISO 14001
•    Performs other duties as required

Key Qualifications/Requirements

Grade 12 or equivalent; Good written and mathematical skills; Good communication and team working skills; Ability to work in a team environment; Computer literate.  Good communication and organizational skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment; Physical Demand-standing in a manufacturing environment, medium lifting and pushing of material and equipment

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Combining a deep systems knowledge to develop unique vehicle access experiences, intelligent visions systems and advanced automotive lighting technologies, MML's expertise light the path to innovation, safety and styling."]
