title: Quality Control Operator
description:
As a team member of the Order Fulfillment and Quality Control department, you will be challenged with inspecting electronic equipment while processing against customer purchase orders.

Responsibilities:

  • Inspecting electronic equipment configured for customer systems
  • Verifying product meets latest hardware and software standards
  • Scanning barcode information in an AS/400 system
  • Function as a member of the production team
  • Comply with OSHA, SDS standards and Evertz H&S Safety Policies and Procedures
  • Any other duties as required.

Requirements:

  • High school Diploma, technical education an asset but not required
  • Experience working in a manufacturing environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, problem solving ability, time management skills and interpersonal skills.
  • Comfortable using a computer, familiar with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel
  • Positive attitude and able to work in a fast paced environment
  • Results oriented
  • Self-motivated

What we offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social events and sports teams

About Us:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: Paint Line Associate – Day Shift
description:
Eaton’s Electrical Sector is currently seeking a Paint Line Associate – Day Shift to join our team. This position is based at our Milton, ON facility.

This position is responsible for operating the production site’s paint line, which includes loading and unloading of parts, as well as operating, troubleshooting and preventative maintenance of the Powder Coat painting system.

Position Overview:

  • Adhere to detailed specifications, work instructions, manufacturing information and written or verbal instructions from supervision.
  • Run and operate Dynamic Machine Management software (DMM).
  • Run and operate drawing search software (Enovia, Vault etc.) to view and print drawings for fabrication purpose.
  • Perform titration test & trouble shoot chemical concentricity (mix) and pH level variations.
  • Monitor & troubleshoot the automated guns and spray systems to ensure effective coverage to a variety of sized and shaped products.
  • Replace Wash System Chemical as required. Maintain the integrity of the Pre-Treat system and ensure the waste solution does not exceed environmental limitations.
  • Maintain Powder in proper containers and storage requirements. Prepare requisition for buyer to procure required powder paint supply. Keep supervisor informed on powder paint and related supply inventory.
  • Load and Unload product from the paint line and ensure conveyor to part continuity.
  • Manually paint all non-standard colours.
  • Inspect final product for cosmetic, coverage, cure, adhesion and thickness.
  • Perform tasks specific to the Wastewater Treatment including monitoring operation, system start-up/shut-down.
  • Prioritize jobs per required date and/or based on supervisor direction.
  • Regularly maintain equipment as per Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) sheet (Powder Booths/Pre Wash/Waste Water Treatment/or General Systems).
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Required (Basic) Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma required.
  • Ability to lift up to 25 pounds to shoulder height.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in Canada without company sponsorship.
  • No relocation benefit is being offered for this position. Only candidates within an 80 km radius of Milton, ON will be considered.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Basic knowledge of mechanical, electrical, and safety procedures of a manufacturing facility.
  • Ability to read and interpret drawings and schematics is an asset.
  • Ability to perform standard work procedures and processes.
  • Demonstrated experience of utilizing mechanical tools and measuring equipment required for assembly.
  • Good problem solving, mathematical skills and troubleshooting ability.

Eaton has in place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs.

Accessibility information may be found at:

http://www.eatoncanada.ca/EatonCA/OurCompany/Accessibility/index.htm/

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: No

title: Process Engineering Technician
description:
We are currently seeking a Process Engineering Technician to join our team at our Brantford facility.

Reporting to the Process Engineering Manager, this role works independently and with cross-functional team.  This position will lead or support projects and activities to launch new and/or improve current manufacturing processes.   

 

Responsibilities:

  • Process design for vacuum, compression forming and water jet cutter processes
  • Specifications for tooling, forming equipment, assembly equipment
  • Vendor quote and selection activity
  • Work with equipment vendors to review design and ensure timelines are met
  • Cost reduction initiatives affecting equipment layouts, work-flow, change overs, material usage, throughput, productivity, quality
  • Problem investigation to discover root cause
  • Capital installations of new equipment
  • Development projects to improve current or next generation equipment and processes
  • Create, manage, or update timelines for projects, or in support of program launch or change management activity
  • Robot Programming
  • Develop work instructions and training
  • Process responsibilities as assigned – Vacuum Forming/Compression Forming/Assembly.
  • Projects work as assigned – lead/manage/support.
  • Initiate and/or lead improvement activity to meet targets
  • Integrate changes with plant functional groups – communication/documentation, training
  • Upgrade and maintain technical standards 

 

Requirements:

  • Four (4) year university engineering program or relevant program with experience
  • Practical knowledge of manufacturing processes, equipment, materials, tooling, presses, pneumatics, hydraulics, controls
  • Strong interest and demonstrated accomplishment in technical improvement activity
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with functional groups and at multi-level

 

Preferred / Assets:

  • Working familiarity with TS16949/ISO14001, APQP, DFMEA, PFMEA
  • Experience in sheet thermoforming processes – vacuum/compression
  • Familiarity with teach pendant programming, Fanuc, Yaskawa
  • CAD skills
  • 2 - 4 years manufacturing experience
  • Mechanical Engineering
  • PLC knowledge / programming experience

title: Material Planner
description:
Job Code: #214129
Title: Material Planner - Electrical Manufacturing Plant
Date Posted: 04/29/2022
Job Type: Full time
Job Location: Edmonton AB

Job Description:

Currently we are seeking individuals for the following position, please take note that this position is time sensitive, and we advise you to apply immediately and express your skills and abilities that pertains to the job description.

 

If you are a Materials Planner with 2-3 years of similar experience and 2 years of using an ERP system looking for a contract position with a leading company, Bartech can help!

 

Materials Planner

Min 6 Months Contract (Long-term Project)

Edmonton, AB

 

Vaccination Requirement

  • Must bedouble vaccinated
  • Must provideproof of double COVID vaccination

 

On-Site Requirement

  • Work shall be done on-site
  • Candidates must have steel toe shoes

 

Role

  • The primary function of this role is to ensure an acceptable level of material availability to support the master production schedule.
  • Part of this role will analyze, establish, and execute the planning, ordering, scheduling of material, including internally and externally sourced parts.
  • Also, provide material support for the manufacturing and sales of products for site and satellite facilities.

 

Required (Basic) Qualifications:

  • College diploma or university degreespecializing in Business or Material ManagementMinimum of 3-5 years of experience working in a material planning (or related) role
  • No Sponsorship. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in Canada on an ongoing basis without company sponsorship.
  • No Relocation.
  • Experienced with Oracle, Excel, and Access
     

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 2 years of experience using an ERP system
  • 1 year experience of working in design-for-manufacturing or an Engineered-to-Order environment

 

Position Criteria:

  • Strong knowledge of purchasing techniques and supplier management
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment as part of a team.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.
  • Strong analytical aptitude and complex problem-solving skills.
  • Intermediate knowledge of MS Office (including Excel and Access).
  • Strong proficiency using MRP software, Oracle knowledge is an asset.
  • Strong technical aptitude of electrical distribution and control systems.
  • Effective time management, prioritization, and project management skills

 

When you join The Bartech Group you launch a career. The Bartech Group, one of North America's largest and fastest-growing staffing firms, continues to elevate the staffing industry to a higher level of thinking. Bartech Enterprise Staffing specializes in temporary and direct placement of Engineering, IT, Technical, Finance & Accounting, and Professional staff.

Bartech values diversity and inclusion in its workforce. Candidates that are legally eligible to work in Canada are invited to apply. Candidates must be legally eligible to work in Canada. We thank all applicants, but only suitable applicants will be contacted. If you are currently in a part time, project, temp work, please advise us with your availability of start date.

Our client is committed to providing accommodation for people with accessibility needs due to disabilities in all aspects of the hiring process. If you request an accommodation, our client will work with you to meet your accessibility needs due to disability.

title: Quality Inspector (Canada)
description:
Join the Stratosphere Quality Team!


Stratosphere Quality cultivates a positive organizational work environment, where employees are compelled to perform their best.


Our team enjoys rewarding and meaningful work in a wide range of manufacturing work environments.


Begin a rewarding career today and envision yourself at work with Stratosphere Quality.


Top 10 Reasons to work for Stratosphere Quality:


Free Training


No Experience Necessary!


Vacation Time


2 weeks paid vacation


Paid Holidays


9 Paid Holidays a year!


Advancement Opportunities


After just 90 days of Employment


Referral Program


Earn $200 per referral!


SQ Rocs and President's Club


Be rewarded for your hard work


Shutdown Savings


Save wages for a rainy day


Reimbursement Program


New PPE On Us!


New Tech


Learn and Work with our newest Technology Platforms


Travel Opportunities


Customer sites from coast to coast


Quality Inspector Job Summary


Quality Inspectors perform various sorting, inspection, production, and data capture. Quality


Inspectors work in partnership with our customers to contain and improve quality issues the


most efficient way possible. Stratosphere Quality’s vision is to be the Leading Global Provider


of Premium Inspection and Quality Assurance Services.





We create an atmosphere where we recognize the individual, work together to solve


problems and foster an environment for employee growth.





Quality Inspectors work in manufacturing plants, warehouses or other locations where our


customers parts are being produced or stored. The location may vary day to day depending on


the needs of our customers.





Stratosphere Quality teams work collectively to ensure that we are responsive, accountable, and accurate in all


aspects of our work. It’s important and our people are key to our continued success.





Quality Inspector Job Responsibilities & Duties



+ Performs various sorting, inspection, production, and data entry


+ Reads and follows work instructions, work rules and directions


+ Maintains organization and cleanliness of work area


+ Uses inspection, measuring and test equipment as required


+ Completes required training classes


+ Follows all employee policies and other duties as assigned



Quality Inspector Job Qualifications & Skills



+ Flexibility and adaptability


+ Positive attitude and self-motivated


+ Detail orientated









Job Posting Title: Quality Inspector (Canada)

Requisition ID: 2022-3059

External Company URL: www.stratospherequality.com

title: Plasma/Beamline CNC Machine Operator
description:
About us:
Our team is growing, and Marcon Metalfab (www.marconmetal.com) is hiring a Plasma/BeamlineCNC Operator to join our dynamic team based in Delta’s Tilbury Park.

Marcon is equipped with a plasma beamline, plasma plate tables, tube laser, plate laser, water jets, and robotic welders.

For over 30 years, Marcon Metalfab has supplied custom fabricated steel and rubber products required for infrastructure, and other projects in the transportation, building construction, utilities, mining, marine, oil, and gas sectors. Equipped with leading manufacturing technologies that allow for efficient handling and processing of materials, Marcon’s 22,000 square foot facility can support even the largest fabrication projects.

Coupled with an unconditional commitment to providing expert customer service and a rigorous quality management system, Marcon consistently delivers better quality products within tight time frames at prices that are competitive within any industry.

We have many long-serving employees here, competitive wages, and excellent benefits. Some places say they have a family atmosphere, but it is truly the case here at Marcon.

We are located in Tilbury Industrial Park in Delta BC, with four ways to get here –  the Massey Tunnel, Alex Fraser Bridge, South Fraser Perimeter Rd., and Hwy 99.

About the Position:
Weekends: Friday to Sunday (Three 12-hour shifts, paid for 40) - 5:15 am to 5:45 pm).

Skills/Qualifications:
  • 1+ years of experience in either laser or plasma cutting of steel.
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret shop drawings and other documents such as safety rules, maintenance instructions, and procedural manuals.
  • Ability to work independently and in conjunction with other team members.
  • Good communication abilities, in written and spoken English. 
  • Ability to work in a dynamic fast-paced environment requiring multi-tasking and prioritizing.
  • Ability to operate a forklift, an overhead crane as well as precision measurement equipment. 
  • Commitment to customer service, excellence (attention to detail), innovation (proactivity, continuous improvement), and integrity.

What We Offer:
  • Competitive wages based on experience.
  • Amazing Extended Health and Dental benefits - no out-of-pocket cost.
  • Mentorship and training for professional growth and career advancement.
  • Excellent family culture and a supportive team.
  • Opportunities for advancement within the company.
  • Overtime opportunities.
  • Boot allowance.
  • An organization with a trusted reputation and stability within the manufacturing community.

Our Vision, Mission, and Values:
Our vision is to partner with like-minded companies to develop leading infrastructure solutions, and in the process, contribute to building strong communities.

Our mission is to be North America’s leading supplier of joints, bearings, railing systems, custom–fabricated steel, and rubber products for the transportation sector and beyond. 

To achieve this, we must embody Marcon’s four values:
  • Service is provided at the highest level to our clients.
  • Excellence, in the quality of products we manufacture.
  • Innovation, in our products, technologies, and skills.
  • Integrity, in our responsibility to clients and fellow employees.

Marcon Metalfab is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination based on age, colour, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial, and local laws. We are also committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected will be contacted.


About Marcon Metalfab.:

For over 30 years, Marcon Metalfab has been Western Canada’s partner of choice for custom–fabricated steel and rubber products for the transportation, building construction, utilities and other industries. Equipped with leading manufacturing technologies that allow for efficient handling and processing of materials, our facility can support even the largest fabrication projects. Coupled with an unconditional commitment to providing expert customer service and a rigorous quality management system, we consistently deliver quality products within tight timeframes at prices that are competitive within any industry.

title: Paint Line Machine Operator
description:
Are you looking for a new job?
Are you ready for new challenges?
Are you passionate about painting operations positions? Our industry needs you to lend it a hand!

We are looking for several candidates to work in our warehouse in Pointe-Claire.
We have several permanent vacancies to fill and we count on your help!

Do you have a great motivation?
Do you have experience as a machine operator?
Do you have a minimum of 1 year of experience as machine operator?


Who are we?
We are in the field of home building products. We are a manufacturer of door and window house coverings. Join our dynamic team! We work 40 hours a week. We are in the field of home building products. We are a manufacturer of home coverings, doors and windows. We work 40 hours a week. We offer you 12 hour schedules from 7:00 am to 7:00pm and from 7:00pm to 7:00am. In the span of two weeks, you must complete 7 shifts of 12 hours. Every week, the rotation switches from either day to night.

Main tasks:
-Operate the paint line
-Set-up the machinery
-Load and unload the merchandise
-Ensure the production line doesn't miss supplies
-Be sure to strictly follow health and safety rules
-Perform various production related tasks as required

Qualifications:
-Master French. English is an asset
-Experience in operating production machinery
-Able to lift up to 50 pounds
-Punctual, reliable and professional
-Work experience in a manufacturing environment
-Importance on health and safety rules
-Positive and determined mindset

Advantages:
-Permanent full time position with the possibility of advancement.
-Group insurance paid 100% by the employer after 1 month of work
-Paid personal days and paid Christmas holidays (from December 24 to January 2)
-Competitive salary of 19.40 an hour PLUS premiums
Premiums are: $2.50/hour day premium and $3/hour night premium
-40 minute lunch paid
-Clean working environment
-Free parking

If this job opportunity is interesting to you or you’re looking for any Industrial work, we would love to hear from you!!

We have many great opportunities such as:

Let us help you find the job that you’ve been looking for!

Ashley Pannese – ashley.pannese@randstad.ca
Eileen Kantel – eileen.kantel@randstad.ca

Premiums are: $2.50/hour day premium and $3/hour night premium

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. title: Machine Operator-Nights
description:
Group Introduction

Transforming mobility. Making automotive technology that is smarter, cleaner, safer and lighter. That’s what we’re passionate about at Magna Powertrain, and we do it by creating world-class powertrain systems. We are a premier supplier for the global automotive industry with full capabilities in design, development, testing and manufacturing of complex powertrain systems. Our name stands for quality, environmental consciousness, and safety. Innovation is what drives us and we drive innovation. Dream big and create the future of mobility at Magna Powertrain.

 

Role Summary

A Machine Operator is responsible for the production of all product within the quality standards.

Key Responsibilities

  • Ensures production rates are met on daily basis.
  • Reads job instructions for assigned job and check work stations for safety, housekeeping and proper function. Reports any discrepancies to Team Leader/Supervisor
  • Ensures that machine log sheets at each workstation are filled out properly
  • Ensures that QA information is collected and recorded in proper manner
  • Willing and able, with proper training, to operate related equipment in the machining department in a safe and efficient manner
  • Responsible for cleanliness of tooling equipment and housekeeping in general work area
  • Responsible for part quality through visual and dimensional inspection, including CMM as required
  • Responsible for identifying part containers with appropriate tags (i.e.: Sample, Hold, Production)
  • Produces and submits proper production reports

Key Qualifications/Requirements

  • High School diploma or equivalent plus manufacturing experience
  • Ability to communicate
  • Working knowledge of English (both written and oral)
  • Basic level arithmetic
  • Basic knowledge of machining and assembly equipment

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

07--Operations  A--Contractor/Temporary Worker

title: Material Processing Lead Hand
description:
As a result of continued growth, Brandt is are currently seeking a Material Processor Lead Hand for our Agricultural Products Facility in Regina, SK. The successful candidate will require a minimum of 3 years practical experience.They will have strong organizational skills and have the ability to work individually as well as part of a team. The selected candidate will have a positive attitude, be a fit with the Brandt team, and be able to lead by example.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for all aspects of the machine shop.
  • As a working lead hand you are responsible for supervision within the area as well as working to provide the product to the shop floor.
  • Scheduling manpower and meeting production demands.
  • Machine parts to specifications using machine tools such as automated saw, sheer, roll, and drill
  • Measure, examine, and test completed units in order to detect defects and ensure conformance to specifications, using precision instruments
  • Set up, adjust, and operate all of the basic machine tools and many specialized or advanced variation tools in order to perform precision machining operations
  • Align and secure holding fixtures, cutting tools, attachments, accessories, and materials onto machines
  • Monitor the feed and speed of machines during the machining process
  • Study sample parts, blueprints, drawings, and engineering information in order to determine methods and sequences of operations needed to fabricate products, and determine product dimensions and tolerances
  • Select the appropriate tools, machines, and materials to be used in preparation of machinery work
  • Lay out, measure, and mark metal stock in order to display placement of cuts
  • Observe and listen to operating machines or equipment in order to diagnose machine malfunctions and to determine need for adjustments or repairs
  • Check work pieces to ensure that they are properly lubricated and cooled
  • Ensure department is consistently producing a high quality product and inspect quality and procedures on an ongoing basis
  • Ensure safe work practices are followed at all times and all workers know and understand the Brandt safe work practices including their responsibility to ensure all Brandt employees are working in a safe manner
  • Identify and support opportunities to eliminate waste and lead initiatives to improve plant efficiency and quality
  • Utilize the appropriate tools and methodologies of lean manufacturing to inspire continuous improvement and operating excellence
  • Work with operations and shop management to establish areas and needs for continuous improvement
  • Enforce all Brandt policies that are in place including safety
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Must be able to perform all machinist functions at an acceptable standard level
  • Must be able to read and understand shop drawings and blueprints
  • Must be knowledgeable in the use and operation of all hand power tools
  • Must be able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions
  • Must be capable of working under minimum amount of supervision
  • Able to effectively communicate in both technical and user-friendly language when appropriate, with all types of staff, including technical, professional, and upper management
  • Flexibility to adjust to shifting priorities and deadlines
  • Must have excellent attention to detail.

title: Precision Assembler
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">**Company Overview:**
 

 
If a culture of excellence, innovation and ownership is what you’re searching for, consider putting your experience in motion at Flowserve. As an individual contributor, or as a leader of people, your enterprise mindset will ensure Flowserve’s position as the global standard in comprehensive flow control solutions. Here, your opportunity for professional development and industry leading rewards will be supported by our foundational commitments to the values of people first, integrity and safety. Thinking beyond opportunity and reward, at Flowserve, we are inspired by working together to create extraordinary flow control solutions to make the world better for everyone!
 

 
**Role Summary:**
 

 
The Precision Assembler will disassemble, clean, inspect, and reassemble mechanical seals during the repair process.
 

 
The position is **first shift (8:00am to 4:30pm)** , with consistent overtime required. The position is located in Edmonton.
 

 
**Responsibilities:**
 

 
+ Use mechanical aptitude to disassemble, clean, and reassemble mechanical seals as part of a quick-response repair process.
 
+ Correctly and safely use hand tools to repair and assemble seals.
 
+ Read blueprints and drawings accurately to assemble seals.
 
+ Inspect and verify quality of finished work with precision measurement tools. Interpret data from optical flatness reports. Conduct air tests.
 
+ Enter data as needed to track process steps, parts, materials, and time.
 
+ Adhere to all safety procedures, and wear required personal safety equipment.
 
+ Communicate clearly to peers and supervisors about jobs and issues.
 
+ Focus on improvement by participating in continuous improvement team activities.
 

 
**Requirements**
 

 
+ 1+ years of general mechanical experience. Trade school training acceptable in lieu of experience.
 
+ Able to read blueprints and shop drawings.
 
+ Able to use various hand and machine tools.
 
+ Basic understanding and ability to use precision measuring tools, such as micrometers, calipers, and gauges.
 
+ Must have effective reading and listening skills to understand work instructions, safety procedures, and company policies. Must be able to clearly report and explain information to others.
 
+ Must show a customer-service mindset at all times.
 
+ Have a basic computer aptitude to learn data entry systems, and to use Microsoft Word and Outlook.
 
+ Able to work overtime and weekends as required on short notice.
 
+ Demonstrated track record of reliable, dependable work ethic with a personal commitment to quality workmanship.
 
+ Be able to stand for long periods of time, and frequently lift seals up to 40 lbs. Must have a full range of hand and upper-body motion to work with tools and parts.
 

 
**Preferred Experience / Skills:**
 

 
+ Rigging experience.
 
+ Experience in a manufacturing environment.
 
+ Clean shaven, so as to get a safe fit on respirators, which are occasionally required.
 
+ High School diploma.
 

 
**Responsibilities & Requirements:** **Primary Posting Location:** Edmonton, Canada
 

 
**Job Advertising Title:** Precision Assembler
 

 
**Job Posting Category:** Operations
 

 
**Employment Type:** Full time
 

 
**Auto req ID:** 55744BR
 

 
**Country:** Canada

Flowserve is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability or protected veteran status. Click here to learn more. Flowserve will also not discriminate against an applicant or employee for inquiring about, discussing or disclosing their pay or, in certain circumstances, the pay of their co-workers Click here to learn more.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access www.flowserve.jobs as result of your disability. You can request a reasonable accommodation by sending an e-mail to employment@flowserve.com. In order to quickly respond to your request, please use the words "Accommodation Request" as your subject line of your email. For more information, read the Accessibility Process.</section>

title: Advanced Manufacturing & Tooling Engineer
description:
Requirements and Qualification

  • Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or Manufacturing Engineering strongly preferred

  • Minimum 5 years of experience required in Automotive Manufacturing or equivalent

  • Experience in Exterior Products a plus

  • Experience in Lean Manufacturing Techniques

  • Working knowledge of PFMEA (APIS), QS / ISO / TS / IATF, GD&T, APQP and PPAP.

  • Proficiency in AutoCAD, CATIA or NX Inventor 3D CAD is a plus.

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Microsoft Project and Minitab is a plus

  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills (8D or Six Sigma training a plus)

  • Self-motivated, team player with the ability to lead a team.

  • Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or Manufacturing Engineering strongly preferred

  • Minimum 5 years of experience required in Automotive Manufacturing or equivalent

  • Experience in Exterior Products a plus

  • Experience in Lean Manufacturing Techniques

  • Working knowledge of PFMEA (APIS), QS / ISO / TS / IATF, GD&T, APQP and PPAP.

  • Proficiency in AutoCAD, CATIA or NX Inventor 3D CAD is a plus.

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Microsoft Project and Minitab is a plus

  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills (8D or Six Sigma training a plus)

  • Self-motivated, team player with the ability to lead a team. 

 

      Job Description

  • Develop GRFQ for tooling including Injection & Compression Molding tools.
  • Develop RFQ for CAPX investment according to business plan.
  • Support new business quotes with part molding & assembly feasibilities, along with costing and press size allocation.
  • Basic knowledge in plastic engineering & properties.
  • Estimate injection molding tonnage requirements, run and interpret Moldflow simulations.
  • Lead new quotation activities by providing detailed Cost Estimates to include process flows, capital investments, plant layout, tooling, work holding, gaging, perishable tooling, cycle times, planning and launch costs along with developing master timing charts for achieving manufacturing milestones
  • Attend and follow Injection Molding trails at remote locations.
  • Lead Design to Cost, evaluate product specifications of components and assemblies in close coordination with Product Engineering and Purchasing
  • Drive the development and improvements of standard manufacturing cells, processes and concepts for assembly system including Logistics and Quality
  • Develop the Production Concept during the Quotation and Serial Development Phase:
    • Definition of production site, production technologies (new or innovative), equipment, and “Make or Buy” concept 
    • Manufacturing and Assembly concept (equipment, clamping and tooling concepts, measuring concept, level of automation) and operational quality
    • Production infrastructure, equipment, and floor layout concept
    • Execution plan for all Process Engineering Work Packages (Manpower, Resources, Cost and Timing)                                            
  • Develop the Production Process during the Quotation and Serial Development Phase including:
    • Required process flows for In-House Components and Assembly.
    • Development and verification of new or innovative technologies
    • Required process instructions for In-House Components and Assembly Design.
  • Develop the Production Equipment during the Quotation and Serial Development Phase including:
    • Required equipment for manufacturing of Purchased Finished or In-House Components.
    • Develop a virtual assembly review.
    • Required equipment for Injection Molds
    • Required equipment for Assembly of products
    • Required equipment for Automation and handling or transfer 
    • Required equipment for Quality Control activities on shop floor
    • Required Tooling for Assembly of products
  • Develop the Production Infrastructure and Layout during the Quotation and Serial Development Phase including:
    • Existing site infrastructure and layout
    • Detailed shop floor layout including material flow, production equipment and assembly lines
    • Required existing and new infrastructure (including expansion of buildings, floor, electricity, and air supply) and specifications, cost, timing, and potential suppliers
    • Early Process Flow Charts for quoting and engineering concept.
    • Lessons Learned applied to all new programs quoted & developments.
  • Provide Manufacturing Engineering leadership to floor manufacturing engineers, expertise and support while maintaining a broad knowledge of product design, manufacturing, and assembly processes
    Support Business Planning activities.

Resumen de la función

Responsabilidades clave

Calificaciones/requerimientos clave

Información adicional

title: Mechanical Assembler (FT)
description:
Garaventa Lift, a leading accessibility manufacturer has positions available for Mechanical Assemblers to become an integral part of our team. This is a full-time day shift position, Mon-Fri with some overtime available Saturdays.

Responsibilities:
  • Work with a team to assemble mechanical products or components.
  • Rotate through tasks-specific production processes.
  • Conduct quality inspections on products and parts.
  • Maintain a clean and orderly work area.
Qualifications:
  • Ability to read and interpret assembly drawings.
  • Previous experience in manufacturing, assembly, or other related fields is an asset.
  • Familiarity with assembly tools and equipment.
  • Ability to handle physical workload.
  • Ability to work well in teams and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Benefits
  • Employer Paid Benefits Program
  • Extended Health
  • Extended Dental
  • RRSP Program




    About Garaventa Lift Canada:

    At Garaventa Lift, we believe and work to guarantee accessibility and mobility to everyone. Since our start, we have been obsessively passionate about it and our mission is to help people achieve it.The roots of the company go back to 1928 in the beautiful Swiss Alps where Karl Garaventa built his very first of many cable cars.Since then, Garaventa Lift has grown into a global leader with a strong presence worldwide.The Garaventa Lift Group is now a prominent reality in America, Asia, Europe and Oceania standing for reliability, security and innovation of accessibility products to create an accessible world.We work to deliver custom lift solutions for commercial and residential applications and bring our engineering expertise and high-quality standards to remove architectural barriers for millions of people worldwide.

title: CNC Operator $$$
description:
Our client is looking for a CNC Machinistwith Mitsubishi Control knowledge. Working knowledge of Tool Presetters measuring the cutting edges of tools to assure they precisely match job specifications.

Requirements
  • Setup and operate horizontal CNC Machine to include 5-Axis machine with rotary tables.
  • Responsibilities
  • Set-up and operation of horizontal and vertical CNC Machining Centers to include two 5-Axis machines in the manufacturing of blown film dies.
  • Expected to perform cutter adjustments either by tool offset or physical sizing of boring bars at the machine and will also have experience in light editing at the machine control
  • Experienced reading and interpreting blueprints and setup sheets
  • Skilled at making program edits, using gauges, micrometers, calipers and indicators
  • Experienced in working with tight tolerances

What We offer
  • Above average industry compensation
  • 100% company paid benefits (after probationary period)
  • 3 paid sick days per calendar year
  • PaidVacation (2 weeks/3 weeks after 5 years/ 4 weeks after 10 years)
  • LTD
  • RRSP with company match at 2%

Plant works day shift only
Monday to Thursday 6:50am to 3:50pm
Friday 6:50am to 12:50pm








Mississauga, Brampton, Toronto, Milton, North York, Markham Scarborough, Boring Machine Operator, Boring Mill Operator, Lathe Operator

Job Posting # 14870857
Consultant: ScottSimpson
TSSHP

title: Manufacturing Engineer - Sheet metal
description:
Our client is an industry-leading manufacturer of Automotive HVAC Equipment. The client has partnered with Randstad Engineering in their search for a Manufacturing Engineer to add to their Engineering team.

Title - Manufacturing Engineer
Location – Vaughan, ON
Shift - Day Shift
Salary - Depends on experience
Industry – HVAC Automotive

If you are interested please share your resume with Sucheta Nagendra at sucheta.nagendra@randstad.ca



Advantages
The position is eligible for 2% RRSP matching, and medical/dental benefits in 3 months
Group benefits 100% company paid
RRSP DPSP Matching

Responsibilities

BRIEF JOB DESCRIPTION:
•Must be proficient in hands-on process troubleshooting. Proving current production with “fast response”
troubleshooting
•Must have demonstrated track record of initiating and implementing process cost reductions in Lean
Manufacturing environment.
•Set up and maintain all work cell and/or department standardized work instructions/procedures for assigned
process/cell.
•Assist in training production personnel on operating new or existing tooling, equipment and processes.
•Improve current production part process capability and repeatability through the optimization of existing
manufacturing processes
•Ability to work independently and draw from experience in all aspects of the job assigned
•Work closely with Project Management Team to support new product launches, engineering changesimplementation and product / process continuous improvement initiatives and related activities.
•Completing all required APQP-related activities, ECR processes, 8D, 5 Why, and all other Quality Management
System requirements as needed
•Conduct time studies, identify capacity constraints and opportunities to improve efficiencies and reduce
manufacturing costs
•Support in the development of Process Control Plans and Process Flow Charts
•Development and maintaining documentation for PFMEA, Operator Instructions, Rework, Change-over
procedure and instruction, Manufacturing Engineering Open Issues, and Continuous Improvement Program
•Co-ordinate, lead, and participate in various multi-disciplined teams in addressing and fulfilling various
corporate objectives associated with, manufacturing process, productivity, volume outputs, scrap/rework,
quality, safety, and delivery commitment
•Providing quote direction for new business related to tooling, new materials and processes as required
•Writing specifications, competitively quoting, negotiating, managing program timelines and budgets, buy-off,
and commissioning in our facility.
•Reviewing part designs and provide feasibility input for ease of manufacturing and cost reduction
•Reviewing fixture/jigs/gauges designs to ensure they are built to meet customer/standards requirements
•Reviewing facilities and equipment requirements with relevant internal and external customers/suppliers

Qualifications
EDUCATION:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical or Industrial Engineering
• Not required but asset: OACETT, CCT, CQE, P. Eng.
YEARS OF EXPERIENCE:
5 – 10 years of experience in manufacturing engineering.
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE:
• Professional (5-7 years of experience): Specialized knowledge & know how. Conducts analysis.
• Prioritizes tasks to take action, works with partial responsibility and minimal supervision
• Ability to read Blueprints and GD&T experience
• Excellent problem solving skills with ability to lead a team
• Requires advanced level of reading, writing, and speaking
• Strong technical knowledge, particularly in the areas of manufacturing and assembly preferred
• Ability to effectively use MS Office Programs to edit or create detailed work instructions
• Previous electric engineering experience an asset
• Sound understanding of Project Management, Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma techniques.

Summary
If you are interested please share your resume with Sucheta Nagendra at sucheta.nagendra@randstad.ca


Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Trainee Machinist
description:
Job Number: 27255 
Group: Cosma International  
Division: Autolaunch 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: BAGENALSTOWN 

 

 

Group Description

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

 

Role Summary

Magna international Autolaunch Ireland Ltd is a leading global manufacturer of stamping tools and producer of class A panels for some of the biggest original equiptment manufacturing companies in the automotive industry. Magna international Autolaunch Ireland Ltd is a subsidary of a multi-national corporation called Magna International Inc. who have over 338 manufacturing facilities and 89 product development, engineering and sales centres in 28 countries worldwide. We are focused on delivering superior value to our customers through innovative processes and World Class Manufacturing by supporting and developing our employees through education and fostering creative thinking. For more information please visit www.magna.com. 

Carlow Chamber Business of the Year 2018

Key Responsibilities

The successful candidate will be trained to complete the following tasks

  • Read and interpret blueprints and smirt solid models accurately
  • Process work to be performed 
  • Set up, program and operate CNC milling machines accurately and efficiently 
  • Perform quality checks on an ongoing basis to ensure product is within tolerance 
  • Fill out machine/job book on a daily basis and communicate necessary information to leadhands and fellow co-workers 
  • Operate overhead crane

Additional Information

Rotating shift work and overtime may be required

Day or overnight travel may be required

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Kitting Technician
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Kitting Technician for our Saskatoon Manufacturing Facility.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Keeping inside & outside facilities clean and orderly
  • Reporting any and all damaged goods received and any and all damages to finished products
  • Working closely with fabrication and assembly teams, ensuring parts are where they need to be when they need to be
  • Operating all equipment for loading and unloading materials safely and efficiently
  • Helping with work cell layout in plant
  • Assisting department personnel when required
  • Other duties as assigned.
  • Minimum 1 years’ experience in forklift and tractor operating
  • Familiar with safety procedures
  • Must have some knowledge of year layout in regards to storage of raw goods
  • Physically fit to manually handle all goods, steel and products as required
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Must have knowledge of steel dimensions and terminology
  • Team player
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Good reading and writing skills
  • Have some knowledge with receiving goods and inspection
  • Capable of working under minimal supervision
  • Able to understand and carry out written and verbal instructions regarding departmental operations including material requisitions.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
Warehouse Associate

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection alarm, communications security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

Under the supervision of the Warehouse Supervisor, the Warehouse Attendant will be responsible for the storage, movement, receiving, preserving and staging of materials, while providing the highest quality of service to all customers. The Warehouse Attendant will also be responsible for the day-to-day monitoring of physical security in the warehouse, reporting of all security-related issues to management and any other warehouse functions that may be assigned. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Print/Read picking slips from the system.
  • Follow procedures on RF picking slips or verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed
  • Pick, prepare and move customer orders and related material to checking stage for shipping process
  • Use an RF scanner to perform a cycle count daily and report any discrepancies to the Supervisor.
  • Package shipments securely on pallets, label and provide transportation documents, load trucks.
  • Receive and store all finished goods from final assembly or delivery carriers in a timely manner using the RF scanner system
  • Ensure the accuracy of shipments; confirm the quantity and part number(s) are accurate.
  • Sort out material by POs and process QC orders
  • Receive materials in the system and stamp paperwork with date and signature.
  • Assist Supervisor with highlighting, collecting, and filing paperwork
  • Operate warehouse mobile equipment including forklifts
  • Sort pallets and perform inventory checks
  • Perform safety checks and preventive maintenance; update logs when machinery is used
  • Maintain a clean and organized work area at all times while adhering to all health and safety policies/procedures
  • Perform any other related duties as required by the Supervisor

 

Requirements and Skills: 

  • Completion of a High School Diploma or Vocational Equivalent
  • Forklift Safety Training Certificate required
  • Comfortable working in a computer based work environment including Microsoft Office
  • Ability to lift up to 75Ibs frequently
  • Work requires walking, sitting, standing, bending/crouching, reaching, climbing ladders
  • Able to be detail oriented following precise instructions when processing orders
  • Knowledgeable of all shipping/receiving procedures applicable in Canada, USA and Internationally
  • Experience using RF scanners preferred
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow instructions/picking slips
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal written English) skills
  • Familiar with touch screen data entering and scanning
  • Three years’ of experience as a warehouse attendant is an asset
  • Familiarity with ISO standards is an asset
  • Forklift experience an asset

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

 

Interested applicants please forward a copy of your cover letter and resume to HR.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Materials Planner
description:
Group Description

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

 

Group Summary

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

Role Summary

The Materials Planner position requires strong working knowledge of the planning function within Modatek and an in depth knowledge of Materials Management.

Key Responsibilities

• Promotes and develops carriers to ensure continuous improvements
• Support engineering change by providing impacts from logistics
• Prepare all required Request to Ship (RSR) forms and quote out shipping requirements to approved carriers
• Work with customs broker to ensure Modatek is compliant with international trading regulations
• Help maintain shipping information such as tariff codes, country of origins, and ship to information in SAP/CMS system
• Creates load schedules to coincide with customer and vendor releases with established logistics routings
• Audits load schedules to reduce transportation costs where possible
• Reviews item master, BOM,  RDF’s, customer releases (requirements)
• Schedules/routing to supply material on a timely basis to meet production schedules
• Customer contact for releases and shipments for service part orders:
• Reviews load schedules for shipments to ensure routing is accurate
• Communicate customer schedules and forecasts
• Performs root cause analysis on inventory discrepancies to maintain accurate financial records
• Manages and coordinates year end, quarterly, and daily inventory counts to ensure system and financial accuracy
• Monitors and responds to customer delivery performance ratings by reviewing status of shipments
• Resolves supply chain constraints to ensure internal and external customers are satisfied
• Communicates and resolves transportation constraints with third party transportation company
• Practices and promotes continuous improvements of materials processes and takes advantage of cost reduction opportunities
• Communicates with all departments to ensure production/logistics plans are properly executed
• Creates service parts packaging specifications which adhere to customer standards
• Assist in developing the approved carrier list for miscellaneous shipments
• Analyzes Special Material Requests (SMR) and coordinates schedules to satisfy customer demands
• Work with the Service Part Packaging and SMR Team Members to facilitate the shipments of goods
• Reviews EDI and manual requirements from the customer
• Reviews production history for planning purposes, including line schedules, reject, scrap and rework
• Performs other duties as required
 

Key Qualifications/Requirements

• Community college diploma in Materials Management/ Supply Chain and Operations Management
• Five (5) years experience in the Production and Material Planning field within a manufacturing environment, preferably automotive with JIT systems
• 5 years of direct experience working with CMS System in the role of planning required
• Strong attention to detail and excellent problem solving skills
• Good customer relations skills
• Strong computer skills
• Ability to meet deadlines, multiple demands and support multiple production planning programs
• Ability to uphold confidentiality
• Demonstrate the ability to work effectively in a team environment
• Ability to work overtime to meet customer needs
 

Additional Information

Our people are our greatest asset. As a valued Modatek Team Member, we offer you:

  

  • A great work experience with a dedicated and diverse workforce
  • A focus on safety, health and wellness, including a corporate wellness program, fitness membership discounts, and a subsidized cafeteria with health concious options
  • Competitive extended health benefits
  • A group RRSP with company matching
  • Partipation in the Employee Equity and Profit Sharing Plan
  • Staff apprecation events
  • Continuous training and development, including an educational reiumbursement program

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

13--Materials Management F--Permanent/Regular
skills: ['A great work experience with a dedicated and diverse workforce', 'Competitive extended health benefits', 'Continuous training and development, including an educational reiumbursement program']

title: Manufacturing Engineering Coordinator
description:
Job Number: 39090 
Group: Cosma International  
Division: Presstran Industries 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: ST. THOMAS 

 

 

Group Description

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

 

Role Summary

Works closely with staff specialists, customers, and suppliers to lead and assess requirements for new and existing manufacturing processes within the plant. The Coordinator establishes process requirements regarding machine, material and methods in the quoting stage, launch stage, as well as engineering changes and continuous improvement to new and current production. The Coordinator utilizes standard processing tools to evaluate new and existing processes to design the best equipment to meet our business needs. The Engineering Coordinator is responsible for all aspects of the project from its inception, through PPAP, production, and service.

Key Responsibilities

  1. Prepare capital quotation packages for approval as required.
  2. Capable of processing customer product through the entire production process.
  3. Develop, plan, manage, and implement various projects for safety, quality, ergonomic, and production improvements
  4. Supplies any bill of material/assembly tooling process changes to Program Team.
  5. Supplies cost and timing of assigned engineering changes to Program Team and/or Sales Coordinator.
  6. Capable of managing and leading projects from inception to completion – timing, concept, feasibility, design, construction, try-out, launch, buy-off, budget, prototyping, programs engineering changes and the cross functional review of projects.
  7. Responsible for PFMEA development and maintenance for assembly process, including cross functional review of related control plans
  8. Prepares reports, charts, and other documentation such as combination tables, periodic and standardized work charts
  9. Participate as required in all ISO/IATF-16949 activities related to area of responsibility

Key Qualifications/Requirements

  1. Degree or Diploma in Mechanical, Electrical or Manufacturing Engineering with a min of 2 years of experience.
  2. Must have strong organizational, interpersonal and communications skills.
  3. Experience in Manufacturing Assembly.
  4. Experience in processing equipment from inception to launch.
  5. Experience with various welding processes (e.g. Mig, Spot, Projection, etc.)
  6. Knowledge and experience in TPS or other Lean Manufacturing systems is preferred.
  7. Ability to use CAD software such as AutoCAD and Solidworks.
  8. Must be knowledgeable in APQP, PDP, GD&T, PPAP, & PFMEA documentation and processes
  9. Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines.
  10. Knowledge of and familiarity with Tooling Build Standards, Machine Build Standard and Check Fixture Standards
  11. Must have a track record of building relationships with internal and external sources which are founded on trust, collaboration and cooperation.

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

EQUIPMENT and/or PRODUCT FAMILIARITY:

Software:   Must be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office and other Windows based environments. Ability to use CAD

software such as AutoCAD and Solidworks.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Under the general direction of the Department Manager: must be able to work independently, conferring regularly with plant personnel and outside contractors. Works in an office environment but may be exposed to some elements such as working in confined/awkward positions with exposure to noise/temperature/heights.  A valid driver’s license and passport are required, as day travel is a requirement of the job; overnight travel occasionally. 

Benefits

 Overtime after 44 hours per week.

Vacation: 2 weeks of paid vacation (3 weeks after 3 years) + 3 Personal Paid Holidays (PPH)

Benefits: Medical and Dental Coverage. Plant wide Incentive Program – based on a number of factors, all members of our team receive an Incentive Bonus, if requirements are met. Magna Profit Sharing. Matched GRRSP. Company paid life insurance and AD&D coverage. Educational Assistance program.  Work boot, safety glasses and custom molded earplug allowances.

Weekly pay via direct deposit. Barbecues and Children’s Christmas Party.

Roger’s cell phone plan available to Presstran Team Members,  month Employee discounts (new vehicle, amusement parks etc.)

title: Machine Operator - Metcalfe, ON
description:
Job ID:  366519

 

Permacon, a CRH Company, is a leader and pioneer in the manufacturing of concrete masonry and landscaping products.  Permacon is a division of Oldcastle APG and operates 9 plants in Ontario and Quebec. 

 

We are currently looking for Machine Operators for rotating day/night shift, and weekend shift,  at our Metcalfe plant.

 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

 

  • Operates Rekers machine (dry side) ensure its good functioning.
  • Operate the strapping and wrapping machines and ensure its good functioning.
  • Operates all the equipment related to the machine.
  • Follow quality manual.  Complete quality and production reports.  Look after the curing of the products to ensure a good curing of product
  • Perform set-up changes.
  • Performs operations and necessary adjustments for machine start up.
  • Programs equipment in accordance to the product requested.  Make and save product recipes to optimize product change over.
  • Perform preventive maintenance of equipment.
  • Participate in maintenance work
  • Participates machine clean-up.  Clean up tasks as required, like cleaning Press / Mixer.
  • Participates to the Rekers department housekeeping.  Keep his work area and toolbox clean.
  • Communicates to competent persons any abnormalities or faulty situations in regards to the product, quality, machine, equipment, workplace or other.
  • Work as a team
  • Wear safety personal protective equipment as required for this position and work safely.

 
REQUIREMENTS

 

  • High school diploma
  • wielding, mechanic, hydraulics and pneumatic knowledge will be an asset.
  • At least 2 years experience in the manufacture industry operating equipment.
  • Team work oriented, Mechanical aptitude, initiative; responsible, able to react, be precise.
  • Shall pass the mechanical aptitude test to validate mechanical aptitude.

 

Why work at Permacon ?

 

•    We offer a competitive salary and group insurance plan

•    Pension fund

•    Insurance and benefits plan

•    Permacon continuously strives to create a secure, respectful and inclusive work environment 
•    Opportunity of career


Schedule

Rotation shifts every two weeks:
Weekend shifts consist of three twelve hours shifts scheduled between Friday and Sunday.  Rotation: 2 weeks on day 6:00am – 6:30pm and 2 weeks on night 6:00p-

 

APPLY NOW!

 

At Permacon, diversity is one of our main assets! We therefore invite visible minorities, ethnic minorities and people living with a disability to apply.

title: Lid Line Packer
description:
Overview:

Pactiv Evergreen Inc.(NASDAQ: PTVE) is a leading manufacturer and distributor of fresh foodservice and food merchandising products and fresh beverage cartons in North America and certain international markets. It supplies its products to a broad and diversified mix of companies, including full service restaurants and quick service restaurants, foodservice distributors, supermarkets, grocery and healthy eating retailers, other food stores, food and beverage producers, food packers and food processors. To learn more about the company, please go to the company website at pactivevergreen.com.

 

 

Pactiv Evergreen is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.   Pactiv Evergreen is an Equal Opportunity Employer.   All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, religion, creed, age national origin, physical or mental disability, genetic information, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, veteran status or other characteristics or statuses protected by law.   For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please  call (847) 482-4320 or email TalentHelp@Pactiv.com.

 

 All information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines and applicable laws.

 

 

Responsibilities:

POSITION SUMMARY:

To ensure the machine is in good repair and is safe to operate to manufacture the standard output in the required time and achieves our quality specifications.

 

JOB DESCRIPTION:

  • Pack finished product in box according to the shop docket, push box through the taper, place on skid and prepare another box.
  • Follow company policies and procedures, relating to safety, quality, good manufacturing practices, and regulatory requirements.
  • Comply with all EHS policies, procedures, and safe work instructions in place.
  • Ensure that the right quantity of sleeves are packed in the box, following the specs.
  • Ensure the quality of production, if quality is poor draw issues to the Lead Operator and team lead.
  • Ensure, if any issue observed surrounding, inform to the Lead Operator and team lead.
  • Housekeeping, keep area clean and organized.
  • Cleaning the workstation at end/beginning of every job or whever needed.
  • Participate during the cleaning of the machine at every Preventive Maintenance or when needed.
  • Responsible for compliance with all aspects of GMP, food safety and quality initiatives.
Qualifications:

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School

SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:

  • Manual Dexterity.
  • Hand/eye coordination.
  • Attention to detail.

Shift: Evenings (3 to 11 pm, Mond-Frid)

Hourly Rate: $17.48 (evenings)

 

#IND1P #CB1

title: Order Picker/Packer
description:
Goodfood has one main mission: to simplify meal planning and grocery shopping for all. Today, Goodfood unites a team of 3,000 people dedicated to delivering delicious meals, carefully curated groceries and farm fresh ingredients across Canada every week. At Goodfood we’re looking for people who are up for their next challenge and ready to help us build and revolutionize the future of food. What you do here matters, and together, we’re making good things happen. We’re a group of passionate and proud Goodfoodie’s on a mission to make more good, everyday. If this sounds like you, and the career opportunity below excites you, we’d love to hear from you.

Location:6080 Indian Line, Mississauga, ON L4V 1G5 - Please check the location of the job and make sure that you can access the location before applying. There may or may not be public transit options available to you to get home from work.

Schedules:
FULL TIME (AM)
  • Sun-Wed, 8am to 6pm
  • Wed-Sat, 8am to 6pm

FULL TIME (OVERNIGHT)

  • Fri-Mon, 8pm to 6am
  • Mon-Thurs, 8pm to 6am

Salary: $18.00/hour + $1 night shift premiums between 11pm and 7am

If you want to be part of a growing company that’s changing how Canadians eat, now is a great time to put on your steel-toe shoes and join!

What you’ll be doing: Changing the way Canadians eat every week!

Under the direction of the Shift Coordinator, and Operations Supervisor, the Fulfillment Associate position is responsible for helping us prepare, package, and ship each order according to the needs of our customers. Our Fulfillment Associates use their attention to detail and care to ensure our customers receive the highest quality product and have a seamless customer experience. If you enjoy an active and fast paced environment, we have multiple shifts available to suit your schedule!

Responsibilities:

  • Assemble customer orders from storage racks and coolers
  • Carefully and efficiently prepare and pack customer orders for same day delivery
  • Ensure Goodfood customers receive the highest quality product, every time
  • Take direction from Supervisors and ensure key performance targets are met (especially around quality)
  • Proactively monitor and report inventory levels to Supervisor
  • Follow all food safety regulations
  • Foster an environment where teamwork and inclusivity is prioritized
  • Contribute to a culture of innovation, ownership, and continuous improvement
  • Maintain a clean and safe working environment at all times


#ON-PROD

  • A High School diploma or equivalent
  • 4 months + experience in a warehouse/manufacturing industry is required
  • Strong English written and oral communication skills
  • Well developed attention to detail skills
  • Ability to take direction/ coaching and put into action
  • Strong work ethic and professional attitude
  • The ability to regularly lift up to 35-40 pounds
  • Ability to work in a refrigerated environment for the duration of shift (0-4 degrees celsius)
  • Experience in and preference for working in a fast-paced environment

What Goodfood can offer you:

  • Protective gear and COVID-19 measures to keep you safe;
  • Permanent role in a competitive job market;
  • Ability to start a new and exciting role immediately;
  • To be part of a growing company with passionate colleagues;
  • Free coffee & parking with shuttle service from the bus stops to the bulding;
  • The possibility to move up the ranks and build your career.

title: Inspecteur, assurance qualité / Quality Assurance Inspector
description:
English to follow

quart de soir lundi au jeudi, 12h30 ou 23h OU quart de nuit , lundi au jeudi, 18h à 4h30

Prime de quart de 1,50$/h

Poste permanent, à temps plein

Assurances collectives + régime de retraite après 3 mois

40 heures flexibles par année, payées

 

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d'une personne motivée, axée sur le travail de terrain afin de combler un poste d'inspecteur, assurance qualité.

 

Ce que vous ferez

  • Procéder aux tournées d’inspections quotidiennes, faire la vérification aléatoire des pièces en production pour valider leur qualité.
  • Documenter et analyser les non-conformités internes (RNC).
  • Faire le suivi de l’outillage en production et s’assurer de leur conformité. Faire les demandes de correctif au besoin.
  • Assurer une présence active sur le site de production ; connaître et maîtriser toutes les étapes de fabrication et effectuer les ajustements machines nécessaires à l’atteintes des critères qualité.
  • Agir comme référence qualité auprès des employés de production et répondre aux appels de soutien technique.
  • Participer à l’amélioration continue et à la résolution de problèmes reliés à la qualité.
  • Inspecter et évaluer la matière première dès son arrivé en usine dans les délais prescris, remplir le formulaire de non-conformités le cas échéant.
  • Participer au maintien des indicateurs de performances qualité (KPI)
  • Participer à la formation continue des employés de production tant au niveau des méthodes de travails qu’au niveau qualité.
  • Effectuer la création, la mise à jour, l’enregistrement et la distribution des procédures qualité et instruction de travail (inclus l’élaboration de procédure spécial pour le support de nos usines sœurs)
  • S’assurer que les équipements et les appareils de mesure sont conformes et étalonnés.
  • Collaborer au suivi et à l’investigation des plaintes clients, bâtir les rapports d’inspection et assurer l’implantation des correctifs.

Votre profil

  • Habiletés technique développé
  • Aptitude à travailler en équipe
  • Faire preuve d’initiative et de flexibilité
  • Bon esprit de synthèse et d’analyse
  • Bonne capacité de communiquer
  • Bonne gestion du temps
  • DEC ou équivalent ou expérience pertinente
  • Expérience d’au moins 2 ans dans le domaine manufacturier
  • Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (Parler et écrit)
  • Posséder une excellente connaissance au niveau de la plateforme OFFICE de Microsoft

MAJOR valorise la diversité au sein de son équipe et considérera de façon équitable toutes les personnes qualifiées pour ce poste.

L'emploi du genre masculin a pour but d'alléger le texte et d'en faciliter la lecture.

------------------------------------------------------------------

evening shift Monday to Thursday, 12:30 pm or 11 pm OR night shift, Monday to Thursday, 6 pm to 4:30 am

Shift premium of $1.50/hr

Permanent, full time position

Group insurance + pension plan after 3 months

40 flexible hours per year, paid

We are currently looking for a motivated, field-oriented individual to fill the position of Quality Assurance Inspector!

What you will do

  • Carry out daily inspection rounds, randomly check parts in production to validate their quality.
  • Document and analyze internal non-conformances (NCR).
  • Follow up on tooling in production and ensure their conformity. Make corrective action requests as needed.
  • Ensure an active presence on the production site; know and master all the manufacturing steps and make the necessary machine adjustments to reach the quality criteria.
  • Act as a quality reference for production employees and respond to technical support calls.
  • Participate in the continuous improvement and resolution of quality related problems.
  • Inspect and evaluate raw materials as soon as they arrive in the plant within the prescribed time frame, fill out the non-conformance form if necessary.
  • Participate in the maintenance of quality performance indicators (KPI)
  • Participate in the continuous training of production employees in terms of work methods and quality.
  • Create, update, record and distribute quality procedures and work instructions (including the development of special procedures to support our sister plants)
  • Ensure that equipment and measuring devices are in compliance and calibrated.
  • Collaborate in the follow-up and investigation of customer complaints, build inspection reports and ensure the implementation of corrective measures.

Your profile

  • Developed technical skills
  • Ability to work in a team
  • Show initiative and flexibility
  • Good synthesis and analysis skills
  • Good communication skills
  • Good time management
  • DEC or equivalent or relevant experience
  • At least 2 years experience in the manufacturing field
  • Fluency in French and English (spoken and written)
  • Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft OFFICE platform

MAJOR values diversity within its team and will give fair consideration to all qualified individuals for this position.

title: Warehouse Clerk
description:
Vaporus Laboratory, one of Canada's fastest growing electronic cigarette e-Liquid manufacturer, is searching for a full-time warehouse clerk to assist in preparing orders and assisting in various warehouse related tasks. 

We will be filling this position in the coming weeks and are looking for a dedicated, punctual and dependable warehouse clerk to help our expanding business! The hours are from 8:40 - 16:40, Monday - Friday.

 

Task Description

  • Pick and Pack outgoing orders ensuring goods are securely packaged, labeled properly and an accurate fulfillment of said order.
  • Ensure safe work practices and environment in the shipping/receiving areas
  • Maintain a neat and tidy warehouse
  • Assist in Physical warehouse duties
  • Maintain the highest level of confidentiality regarding all company information
  • Assist the Warehouse manager in all various tasks


Requirements

  • Good Manual Dexterity
  • Able to work in a team
  • Able to work Standing
  • Computer literate
  • Demonstrate integrity and honesty


Experience:

  • shipping/receiving experience in a warehousing/manufacturing environment


Job Type: Full-time
