title: CNC Machinist
description:
CNC Machinist

Responsible for the operation of CNC equipment within a given manufacturing department. The individual shall be able to perform simple set-ups on this equipment with minimal assistance from supervision. The individual shall perform these activities in compliance with Company procedures and quality requirements. The individual shall be able to perform quality inspections to own work and make adjustments as required working with minimal supervision.

Location: Edmonton, AB

Your Challenge:


* Ability to operate CNC equipment within a given manufacturing department, including tool offsets and compensations.
* Ability to perform simple set-ups with minimal supervision.
* Responsible to maintain quality and productivity standards.
* Blueprint reading
* Ability to use inspection equipment and inspect own work.
* Additional responsibilities as assigned by Supervisor.
* General good housekeeping practices within work area.
* Review work center for maintenance compliance.
* Maintain correct time reporting and accurate entries on applicable manufacturing documentation.
* Comply with Company quality and safety requirements
* Shop Math and Trigonometry

Your Expertise:


* 2 years of experience working in a CNC Machinist Role.
* High School Diploma or equivalent

This position may require exposure to information which is subject to US export control regulations such as the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must meet eligibility requirements of the ITAR and of the Controlled Goods Directorate (CDG) and/or a Canadian government security clearance.

Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request. #IND

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Manufacturing Weld Engineering (Cambridge, ON, CA)
description:
BWXT Canada Ltd. is a world leader in design, engineering, manufacture, construction and service of nuclear power generation equipment.  As a supplier of innovative, high-quality nuclear components and services we cater to a worldwide customer base.  We take great pride in supplying highly engineered solutions that allow our customers to compete within the complex nuclear power generation industry.

 

We are recruiting for a Manufacturing Weld Engineering position for our facility in Cambridge, Ontario.

 

JOB SUMMARY:

 

Establish and refine manufacturing and welding procedures, prepare and maintain shop documentation conforming to ERP system requirements and assess and resolve non-conforming conditions that affect the product. Support shop facilities and equipment maintenance, upgrade or installation.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

Shop Documentation

  • Prepare shop routings for each component reflecting the sequence of shop activities, identify shop resources and fixtures/jigs required and provide time standards for the scope of work, as well as provide material allocation and identification of applicable shop operating procedures and quality assurance standards.

 

Non-Conforming Products

  • Resolve non-conforming conditions identified by Quality Control, assess each case relative to control drawings, specifications, customer expectations and quality standards, produce supplementary documents (i.e. work orders, repair drawings, condition reports, etc.), as well as liaise with appropriate personnel (i.e. sales personnel, suppliers, etc.) to arrive at technically sound and commercially viable resolutions.

 

Weld Process Support

  • Develop and support welding process. Includes preparation of ASME Procedure Qualifications (PQR) and shop Weld Procedure Specifications (WPS). Development of welding and cladding process and equipment for new applications as required.

 

Scheduling

  • Maintain realistic time standards as a target for shop performance and to provide realistic durations for shop schedules, review historical data for past performance for similar parts, as well as conduct time studies.

 

Database Maintenance

  • Maintain database of machine shop tooling, consumables and gauges as well as maintain information (i.e. pictures, sketches, and written instructions) to provide record of past practices.

 

Product Reviews/Estimating

  • Conduct pre-manufacturing product reviews, identify tooling and fixtures needed to support the work to ensure shop is adequately equipped to perform job, as well as make adjustments to design or concept sketches for needed tools, procurement of items, etc. as required.

 

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

 

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (preferably in Manufacturing Engineering, Welding Engineering, or Mechanical Engineering).
  • Fully qualified professional engineer (P.Eng).
  • Five years experience in metal fabrication and welding.
  • Experience in a manufacturing environment (preferably heavy metal manufacturing).
  • Working knowledge of welding procedures, general manufacturing principles, and material properties.
  • General knowledge of NDE Testing and ASME codes.
  • Excellent communication skills as well as computer skills (CAD, CAM, MS Word, Excel).

 

WHY JOIN BWXT?:

 

  • Work within the growing and exciting nuclear industry as well as with highly skilled employees!
  • Competitive salaries
  • Employer-paid pension plan
  • Profit sharing plan
  • Bonus plan
  • Competitive Health and Dental benefits
  • Educational Refund Program
  • Optional compressed work week schedule (get every other Friday off!)
  • Life insurance… and so much more!

 

Come join us… we’ve been waiting for you.

 

We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

 

BWXT Canada is committed to fostering an accessible, fair, and inclusive environment where all employees are able to access goods and services while being respected and supported. If you require accommodations during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require information in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources.

 

BWXT Canada Ltd. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status or disability, or any other category protected by provincial law.

title: Process Engineer, Mechanical
description:
Process Engineer, Vaughan, ON

A stable Canadian manufacturing client is seeking a Mechanical Process Engineer. This is a fast paced, high volume manufacturing plant experiencing fast growth.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Responsible for managing the production process, from raw material through to the finished part.
  • Perform startups, monitor machine performance, product quality and ensure the machine is producing at standard rates, sheet gauge, etc.
  • Perform and document process checks, at the prescribed frequency.
  • Adjust process to maintain consistent smooth operation.
  • Responsible for some regular machine checks and minor preventative maintenance.
  • Perform tooling changeovers, and maintenance activities.
  • Identify equipment maintenance deficiencies that require attention and communicate key issues
  • Be fully capable of performing all aspects of machine operation and be prepared to provide break relief and support to other personnel in the plant. 

 

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3-5 years recent hands-on experience within a manufacturing facility
  • Post-secondary education, preferably in Mechanical Engineering or similar
  • Strong hands-on experience working with machinery and plastics processing, minimum of 3 years
  • Good knowledge of the applications of statistical tools in process control and product monitoring
  • Excellent reporting skills required

title: General Labourer
description:
S3 Manufacturing's hard working team has earned the respect of customers for their ability to respond quickly to changing market demand, and for the consistent quality of the product. Every team member is ready to do what it takes to get the job done.

Why Work at S3 Group?

For all your hard work, we offer:

  • Competitive wages
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • RRSP matching and bonus programs
  • On-the-job training and continued education options
  • Safety and wellness allowances
  • Advancement and cross-training opportunities
  • Fast-paced, respectful and teamwork environment

Job Overview:

  • Clean up worksite from hazardous or obsolete material
  • Assist welders, assemblers, fabricators, painters, warehouse and other employees and departments with functions as defined by Production Supervisor or his designate
  • Handle and transport materials and manufactured internally
  • Use hand tools, power tools and machinery (e.g. forklifts) when needed
  • Follow instructions from Production Supervisor or their designate to perform manual labour tasks
  • Report issues with equipment or unsafe conditions
  • Ability to work safely
  • Punctuality and maintain good attendance

Skills and Abilities:

  • Previous work experience in a manufacturing environment is preferred
  • Mechanical aptitude
  • Ability to meet the physical demands of the job
  • Ability to take direction and work efficiently
  • Team player
  • Ability to communicate effectively and respectfully with others in English
  • Forklift Operator Certification an asset

title: Custom Machine Builder
description:
Custom Machine Builder
Location: Mississauga, ON


Do you have a background in custom large machine building and are a Certified Engineering Technician/Technologist OR a Licensed Industrial Mechanic Millwright /Assembler in Ontario OR a Certified Tool and Die Maker? If you answered yes to one of these, our client wants to talk to you! Come join their ever growing team!

About this Position:
  • Assemble, debug, modify and install custom designed machinery according to the schedule, the company quality standards and to meet or exceed customer expectations
  • Responsible for the integration of purchased mechanical and pneumatic components, manufactured details and sub-assemblies to construct automated machinery for custom applications
  • Perform critical precision alignments and set-ups of mechanical components and systems and take measures to ensure integrity of set-up
  • Responsible for installing pneumatic components and sub-systems as per supplied schematics and specifications, plumbing.
  • Perform machining tasks when required (grinding, milling, lathe etc.)
  • Responsible for testing, pre-commissioning and optimizing system performance and equipment durability concerns, adhering to all applicable codes and standards.
  • Participate in equipment tear down, packaging, rigging and transporting and installation as required
  • Must identify all tools, fasteners, miscellaneous items and equipment required to complete tasks efficiently and work with plant manager to secure all required material in a timely manner.
  • Perform plant related maintenance and maintenance on plant equipment as required.
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Experience:
  • 10+ years experience in custom machine building field (preferably wire & cable industry), experience in high speed lean manufacturing environment is an asset
  • Demonstrated experience in building equipment utilizing the following technologies: robotic systems, high speed index transfer (dial, indexing chain, walking beam etc..), pneumatic actuators, servo motors and actuators
  • Familiarity with modern electrical controls technologies as they apply to automated equipment (e.g. PLC’s, HMI’s, safety devices, and instrumentation)

Desired Skills:
  • Read and interpret AutoCAD (2D) and SolidWorks (3D) drawings and understand tolerances & critical dimensions.
  • Perform dimensional & quality inspections using measuring devices (micrometers, Vernier’s, measuring tapes, etc.).

Ability to use the following machine shop equipment safely and efficiently to complete tasks;
  • milling machine, lathe, surface grinder etc. (CNC milling, sink or wire EDM experience would be an asset)
  • Ability to weld common metals (MIG/TIG) encountered in machine building is an asset
  • Understanding of basic machinery rigging principles and the ability to operate rigging equipment including, cranes and forklifts etc. AND
  • Good working knowledge of pneumatic/hydraulic control circuits
  • Good working knowledge of bearing installation and press fits.


Must Haves:
Ability to work overtime as required and travel worldwide on short notice (valid and current Canadian passport is required) is a must
Experience with machine start-up and commissioning activities.
Valid Ontario Driver’s License and access to insured vehicle for travel within the G.T.A. and surrounding areas is a must

Excellent compensation and benefits will be offered and will be based on experience

All qualified candidates are invited to apply

Keywords: hydraulics, assemblies, industrial automation, electromechanical engineering, Brampton, Toronto, North York, Vaughan, Woodbridge, Etobicoke, Halton, Caledon, Bolton, ON,Oakville, Georgetown, Bolton, Acton, Milton, Mechanical Assembler, Custom Machine Assembler, Mechanical Machine Assembler, Machine Builder

title: Inventory Associate
description:
NEW HOURLY RATES!!

Salary: $19.00/hour + night shift premiums between 11pm and 7am

Location: 6080 Indian Line, Mississauga, ON L4V 1G5 - Please check the location of the job and make sure that you can access the location before applying. There may or may not be public transit options available to you to get home from work.

Schedules:

Full Time

  • Mon-Thurs, 8am to 6pm
  • Mon-Thurs, 8pm to 6am

Part Time

  • Sat/Sun, 8am to 6pm
  • Sat/Sun, 8pm to 6am
  • Fri/Sat, 8pm to 6am

About Goodfood: Goodfood is Canada’s leading online grocery company, delivering fresh meal solutions and grocery items, directly to members’ doorsteps, making it easy for members from coast to coast to enjoy delicious meals at home every week.

Goodfood’s mission is to make the impossible come true, from farm to kitchen, by enabling members to do their weekly meal planning and grocery shopping in less than 1 minute. Goodfood members have access to a unique selection of products online as well as exclusive pricing made possible by its world class direct to consumer fulfilment ecosystem that cuts out food waste and expensive retail overhead.

What you’ll be doing: Changing the way Canadians eat every week!

Reporting to the Shift Coordinator, and Operations Supervisor, the Inventory Associate position is responsible for monitoring inventory supplies and ensuring that we have enough ingredients and grocery products for customers' orders and business' needs. Inventory associates also manage order sheets and record inventory reports, check items for possible defects, inspect delivered inventory supplies, return damaged items, and organize shelves. Our Inventory Associates must have strong analytical and data entry skills to input inventory records in the system efficiently and accurately. If you enjoy an active and fast paced environment, we have multiple shifts available to suit your schedule!

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for moving ingredients from shipping/receiving spaces throughout the warehouse
  • Weekly, monthly, yearly inventory counts
  • Move supplies from shipping to production areas
  • Maintain constant and clear communication with the warehousing team and other operations departments
  • Take direction from Supervisors and ensure key performance metrics and quality targets are met
  • Follow all food safety regulations
  • Foster an environment where teamwork and inclusivity is prioritized
  • Contribute to a culture of innovation, ownership, and continuous improvement
  • Maintain a clean and safe working environment at all times

If you want to be part of a growing company that’s changing how Canadians eat, now is a great time to put on your steel-toe shoes and join!

  • A High School diploma or equivalent
  • Ability to work in a refrigerated environment for the duration of shift (0-4 degrees celsius)
  • Experience in and preference for working in a fast-paced environment
  • 6 months + experience with inventory management in a warehouse/manufacturing industry is required
  • Forklift experience is a plus but not required
  • Willingness to undergo in-house Forklift Training
  • Strong English written and oral communication skills
  • Well developed attention to detail skills
  • Ability to take direction/ coaching and put into action
  • Strong work ethic and professional attitude
  • The ability to regularly lift up to 35-50 pounds

What Goodfood can offer you:

  • Protective gear and COVID-19 measures to keep you safe;
  • Permanent role in a competitive job market;
  • Ability to start a new and exciting role immediately;
  • To be part of a growing company with passionate colleagues;
  • Free coffee & parking with shuttle service from the bus stops to the bulding;
  • The possibility to move up the ranks and build your career.

There may or may not be public transit options available to you to get home from work.', 'Experience in and preference for working in a fast-paced environment', 'Free coffee & parking with shuttle service from the bus stops to the bulding;', 'What you’ll be doing: Changing the way Canadians eat every week!', '6 months + experience with inventory management in a warehouse/manufacturing industry is required', 'Follow all food safety regulations', 'Responsible for moving ingredients from shipping/receiving spaces throughout the warehouse', 'Full Time', 'Contribute to a culture of innovation, ownership, and continuous improvement', 'Foster an environment where teamwork and inclusivity is prioritized', 'Move supplies from shipping to production areas', 'Protective gear and COVID-19 measures to keep you safe;']

title: Machine Operator/Forklift Driver
description:
Who We Are?

At Cascadia Metals, we have never wavered from the original drive that has founded our business. Our success is rooted from the continued commitment of our owners and can be seen through the rapid growth of our organization. We invest not only in land and machinery, but also in our people...our employees. Still strong and unrelenting, we will continue to become more efficient and progressive in our thoughts moving forward. Through our optimistic view of the future, we believe there will always be room for creative, innovative distribution in the future.

Who We're Looking for?

Cascadia Metals Mississauga is looking to hire a Machine Operator/Forklift Driver for our warehouse. We are looking for a driven team member, who shares our champion mindset and values

Dutiesand Responsibilities:

  • Adhere to proper procedure and safety regulations for working on assigned machines and equipment, ensuring correct personal protective equipment is used at all times
  • You prepare, set up, and clean the machines before starting work, after completing work, and as required.
  • You review, troubleshoot, and repair any quality control issues with the Quality Control Inspector and your team leader and/or supervisor
  • You facilitate effective and productive communications within the team to maximize productivity and efficiency.
  • You follow Company regulations and procedures in order to uphold the Company's quality and safety standards.
  • Unload/loading trucks outside in the elements
  • Operating a forklift to move material within the warehouse and yard
  • Organizing and sorting material for loading and space optimization
  • You perform other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications:

  • Must be reliable and punctual
  • Forklift certification is mandatory
  • Machine Operating experience is a must
  • Technical Skills: working with tools, saws and drills to customize customer requirements for orders
  • Flexibility; able to multi-task and work as part of a team
  • You have previous manufacturing experience or exposure to fast-paced environments
  • Ability to work outside in the hot/cold temperatures
  • You have high attention to details.
  • You have the ability to work well independently and efficiently without direct supervision and to work effectively as a team.
  • You have excellent organizational skills and flexibility
  • Able to read orders and complete basic paperwork
  • CSA approved safety shoes are required

Why Work for Us:

  • Company paid benefits package, including Extended Medical, Dental, Life Insurance and Vision
  • 2 weeks' vacation to use in your first year, 3 weeks on your 2nd anniversary
  • Taxable Spending Account
  • 3 Personal Days to do whatever you like with
  • 4% RRSP matching program after 3 months
  • http://www.cmetals.com

title: Machine Operator 1/Drilling Operator
description:
Overview

OSI Systems companies have a long history of developing innovative solutions to bring a better quality of life to the world. Our OSI Electronics (OSIE) division is a diversified manufacturer of electronic devices and value-added manufacturing services.

 

We provide our customers with the manufacturing capabilities and purchasing power of a global Electronics Manufacturing Services provider. By delivering regional and personalized support best provided by a smaller company, we strive to build lasting relationships and create close and valued partnerships with our customers. Our singular focus is to help security experts, clinical professionals and high-tech developers solve real-world problems and issues.

 

PFC Flexible Circuits Limited, a division of OSI Electronics, is seeking a CNC Drilling Machine Operator.


Responsibilities

  • Set up, operate and maintain CNC drilling and routing machines.
  • Prepare and set up materials and drills as per work instructions for drilling/routing purposes.
  • Remove and clean panels and parts after drilling and routing process.
  • Maintain job requirements by observing drilling/routing while detecting and trouble-shooting malfunctions.
  • Update and complete Production Log.
  • Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork.
  • Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct.
  • It is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem.
  • Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business.

Qualifications

  • High school diploma desired.
  • 1+ years of experience operating CNC drilling and routing machine.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to perform highly repetitive tasks.  
  • Ability to perform data collection and keep accurate records consistently.
  • Ability to read blueprints and drawings.
  • Ability to multitask with minimal of supervision.
  • Must be able to read, write, and verbally communicate in English.
  • Afternoon shift from 4pm - 12:30am.

 

 

OSI Systems, Inc. has three operating divisions: (a) Security, providing security and inspection systems, turnkey security screening solutions and related services; (b) Healthcare, providing patient monitoring, diagnostic cardiology and anesthesia systems; and (c) Optoelectronics and Manufacturing, providing specialized electronic components and electronic manufacturing services for original equipment manufacturers with applications in the defense, aerospace, medical and industrial markets, among others.

title: CNC Lathe Operator - Hard Turning (Afternoons)
description:
Are you looking to join a stable and growing organization that has employees with 20, 30 and even 40 years of experience?  StackTeck Systems Ltd. is a leader in the plastic injection mold-making industry and we're looking for good people to support our continued growth.  If you're looking to advance your career then look at this opportunity and apply now to explore it further.  

The position of Lathe Operator (Hard Turning) is responsible for set up and operation of CNC lathe machine to machine internal and external diameters and forms on hardened steel injection mold components.  The incumbent will demonstrate experience machining components to tight tolerances. This position will report to the Manufacturing Manager, Finishing department

Please note this position is for afternoon shift - Monday to Thursday from 4pm to 2:30am.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Interpret engineering drawings to determine specifications, set up and operating requirements
  • Complete first run inspection and complete spot checks for conformance to specifications
  • Ensure effective production of quality parts by completing in-process and final checks using gauges and measuring equipment
  • Set up and operate a CNC Lathe to produce finished components/parts
  • Work to defined tolerances
  • Write, edit and load CNC programs
  • Observe numerical displays on control panel and compare with data on process sheets to verify dimensional adjustments, feed rates and speeds or machining cuts.

TECHNICAL SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:

  • 3-5 yearsâ€™ of relevant hands-on machining experience, preference in a machine shop setting
  • Preference given to completion of post secondary education or apprenticeship in General Machining or CNC programming
  • Ability to understand and interpret engineering drawings, sketches and verbal instructions
  • Strong in math and computer skills
  • Ability to use precision measuring tools to ensure specifications and tight tolerances are met.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, (AODA), StackTeck will provide accommodation, accessible formats, and communication supports for the recruitment process upon request.

We thank all who apply and will respond to those who most closely match the requirements.

title: Machine Operator - 3rd Shift
description:
Job Title: Machine Operator
Location: Burlington, ON
Schedule: 3rd Shift : 10PM- 6AM
 
Mission:
  • To function as a contributing member of the personalization team to ensure that equipment maintenance, productivity, yield and quality objectives are continuously improved and achieved in a manner that promotes development and empowerment in a secure and Lean environment.
 
Responsibilities:
  • Maintain and operate Personalization and/or Fulfilment equipment as required
  • Produce jobs in accordance with customer, company and/or industry specifications.
  • Meet shift targets as defined by the shift Coach and track them on daily basis
  • Perform all quality checks and follow established procedures
  • Perform Preventive Maintenance as scheduled and document work performed
  • Participate in team meetings and with team review past performances and promote a culture of continuous improvement and waste reduction
  • Promote team harmony, assist in working towards High Performance team status and achievement of the levels of empowerment through Career Path
  • Communicate instructions and information to other team members
  • Participate in program continuous improvement, reduction of waste, error proofing and other Lean Six Sigma initiatives
  • Support team in all safety and security policies/procedures.
  • Other duties as necessary
 
Skills:
Requirements:
  • Must be flexible to work 1st and 2nd shifts as needed verbal notice would be provided by manager of the change in shifts
  • Manual dexterity, ability to work without constant supervision, ability to multi-task
  • Ability to work in primarily a stand-up environment
  • Ability to follow written and verbal instructions
  • Experience with electro-mechanical equipment in a fast-paced manufacturing environment and prior experience working in teams
  • Experience with computers and Microsoft Office products (Excel, Word, etc.) is an asset

title: Manufacturing Equipment Operator
description:
We are assisting a well known manufacturing company by looking for a talented and experienced Junior Machine Operator who has had experience in an Automated Manufacturing environment as well as has the experience or knowledge in Electrical/ Mechanical or Robotics.

This role is a contract role that does to permanency

Rate : 18/hr

Shift: 8am – 4pm Monday - Friday


Advantages
- Day shift, full time, stable hours
- Opportunity for long term
- Great team based environment
- Premiums available for night or evening shifts that will be offered
- Training will be provided
- Free Parking


Responsibilities
- Operate and maintain the machine and equipment in the facility
- Set up the materials needed to produce the materials (including adding the raw material)
- Inspecting the quality of the material and products and ensuring that the standard if the materials are up to standard
- Inputting information, codes and calibrations into the machine
- Performing any maintenance and repairs to the machine as needed
- Providing support to the senior technician
- Completing all necessary reports (sheets, updating databases) as required
- Moving materials from one area to another


Qualifications
- Experience in an Automated Manufacturing environment is a must
- Experience in Machine Operation
- Ability to clearly communicate. Both written and spoken
- Must have a good understanding of machines and automated equipment
- Must have experience working in a blue collared environment
- Quick, willing to learn, and reliable


Summary
If you or anyone you know is interested, please apply by:

Visit www.randstad.ca and apply through the posting
Apply by e-mail at indus.gl@randstad.ca

Call 613.726.0220 ext 2 and ask for Amantha, Jyoti and Josee
We appreciate all applications; however, only those who meet the requirements for the position of Junior Installer located in Ottawa will be contacted.
Did you know Randstad has a Facebook group for Light Industrial opportunities in Ottawa? Add yourself to the group and be the first to find out about our latest opportunities!

https://www.facebook.com/IndustrialSupportOttawa

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Buyer/Planner
description:
Company:  Virtek is a high technology company based in Waterloo, Ontario. We are the worldâ€™s leader in providing laser and vision-based projection and inspection solutions. Virtek has a dominant product position in the aerospace, prefabricated construction and industrial fabrication markets.

Virtekâ€™s solutions support manufacturers world-wide in a variety of specialized industries to assist with assembly processes. Our solutions project laser light onto a 3D work surface with high accuracy, speed, and precision for applications such as composite fiber ply layup, paint masking, placement of components or materials, quality inspection and reverse engineering.

For more information, please visit www.virtekvision.com or Virtek Vision on YouTube

Role:

Reporting to the Supply Chain Manager, your main objective is to ensure uninterrupted supply of material to support manufacturing while ensuring customer requirements are met

Responsibilities:

  • Action all purchases and exceptions generated by MRP.
  • Manage supplier relationships including supply, negotiations, consolidation. Provide forecasts to suppliers to ensure proper mix and availability.
  • Place purchase orders as required based on demand, reschedule and expedite as schedules change.
  • Place purchase orders for all non-production and services requirements.
  • Conduct price/economic order quantity analysis and compare multiple quotes including piece cost, freight, duty, performance systems.
  • Monitor inventory levels and adjust parameters according to demand and supplier capability.
  • Assist with cycle audits and physical inventory, monitor inventory levels and adjust accordingly.
  • Manage the item master within the ERP (Macola) system maintaining proper source, costs, lead times, reorder points and safety stocks.
  • Develop, implement and track a supplier scorecard to monitor performance and mitigate supply risk.
  • Establish a second source of supply for all critical components.
  • Resolve parts shortages and quality issues with suppliers.
  • Support shipper receiver in the receipt, verification and put away of incoming shipments.
  • Distribution of all non-conforming purchased material. Work with ME (Manufacturing Engineer) to obtain corrective action and closure
  • New Product Introduction. Ensure timely deployment of new product developments (NPI) into manufacturing. Work closely with engineering and configuration management to proactively source and cost all new items and include them in future forecast.

Qualifications & Competencies:

  • Demonstrated experience or education in purchasing/Materials Management and the responsibilities of this role.
  • Experience in MRP functionality including forecasting, planning, purchasing.
  • Designation, Certification, or completed courses in PMAC, SCMA, APICS (CPIM).
  • Working knowledge and understanding of all applicable software.
  • Ability to manage multiple expectations while collaborating with cross functional teams.
  • Ability and drive to take on increased levels of learning and accountability with responsibility, good judgement, and exceptional service attitude.
  • Works effectively with and build relationships with all core groups and suppliers.
  • Self-motivated and positive attitude.
  • Ability to work independently to get the task completed on time.
  • Works well under pressure and is very assertive with suppliers and internal customers.

 

Virtek encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available upon request.  Should you need an accomodation at any stage of the recruitment process please contact us at 519-746-7190 ext. 202.

title: Journeyperson B-Pressure Welder
description:
Complete Energy Innovations Inc. (CEI)

B-Pressure Welders with Fab Shop/Roll Welding/RMD/Fluxcore Experience

Pipe Shop - Nisku – Day Shift & Night Shift

Complete Energy Innovations Inc. (CEI)

Rate of Pay $44.50/hour + $3.00/hour Alloy Welder Premium when welding specialized alloys

Night Shift Premium $4.00/hour

To join our fast-growing team, the following key competencies are essential:

  • Strong work ethic & positive team attitude
  • Attention to detail & high degree of accuracy
  • Ability to engage & problem solve
  • Versatility to work in field or shop & be a motivated self-starter
  • Eagerness to learn, develop current skillset & grow with the company

Job Summary

CEI specializes in the design and fabrication of pressure piping, fittings and vessels. Our expertise includes a wide range of alloy materials and specialized fabrication and welding processes. We pair engineering and manufacturing capabilities to deliver tailored solutions for our clients. We understand quality begins on the inside and we deliver excellence through value-based relationships and unwavering execution. We cater to the Oil & Gas, Energy, Petrochemical, Forestry, Mining and Refrigeration sectors.

We are seeking experienced Journeyman B – Pressure Welders for our Pipe Shop in Nisku, Alberta.

The successful candidates will be responsible for cutting and welding work in connection with the construction, repair and maintenance of company pipelines and related facilities.

MUST HAVE FAB SHOP EXPERIENCE, RMD AND FLUXCORE EXPERIENCE WITH CARBON & STAINLESS STEEL.

Responsibilities

  • Develops patterns for projects or follows directions in given layouts, blueprints and work orders
  • Cleans, checks for defects and shapes component parts, sometimes using a cutting torch
  • Welds parts and may also build up worn parts by welding layers of high-strength hard-metal alloys onto them.
  • Experience with hydrotesting is required
  • Mentors and coaches Apprentice Welders
  • Operates manual or semi-automatic welding equipment to fuse metal segments using processes such as gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW), gas metal arc welding (GMAW), flux-cored arc welding (FCAW), shielded metal arc welding (SMAW)
  • Performs pipe welding and must be capable of rolling pipe and/or position welding
  • May perform other related duties assigned
  • Must possess a valid B-Pressure ticket
  • Must be experienced with small and large bore
  • CWB ticket will be an asset
  • Must be able to provide drug and alcohol testing
  • Must have previous welding experience in an industrial setting
  • Must have previous welding experience in a fabrication shop
  • Must have RMD Fluxcore experience
  • Must possess valid government issued photo identification
  • Candidates with COR safety experience an asset
  • Candidates with skid steer experience & overhead crane experience an asset

Work Conditions

  • Applicants that reside near Nisku, Beaumont, Leduc, or Edmonton and area. Only local candidates will be considered due to the location of this project and no travel allowances are provided.
  • 4 and 3 rotation - 10 hour days, overtime @ 1.5x after 44 hours
  • Work will be primarily inside Fabrication facility, however some field work may also be required


CEI offers a safety focused, team based environment, a good work/home life balance schedule and competitive industry wages.

Rate of Pay $44.50/hour + $3.00/hour Alloy Welder Premium when welding specialized alloys.

title: CNC Machinist
description:
CNC Machinist


Responsible for the operation of CNC equipment within a given manufacturing department. The individual shall be able to perform simple set-ups on this equipment with minimal assistance from supervision. The individual shall perform these activities in compliance with Company procedures and quality requirements. The individual shall be able to perform quality inspections to own work and make adjustments as required working with minimal supervision.


Location: Edmonton, AB


Your Challenge:


+ Ability to operate CNC equipment within a given manufacturing department, including tool offsets and compensations.

+ Ability to perform simple set-ups with minimal supervision.

+ Responsible to maintain quality and productivity standards.

+ Blueprint reading

+ Ability to use inspection equipment and inspect own work.

+ Additional responsibilities as assigned by Supervisor.

+ General good housekeeping practices within work area.

+ Review work center for maintenance compliance.

+ Maintain correct time reporting and accurate entries on applicable manufacturing documentation.

+ Comply with Company quality and safety requirements

+ Shop Math and Trigonometry


Your Expertise:


+ 2+ years of experience working in a CNC Machinist Role.

+ High School Diploma or equivalent


This position may require exposure to information which is subject to US export control regulations such as the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must meet eligibility requirements of the ITAR and of the Controlled Goods Directorate (CDG) and/or a Canadian government security clearance.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition (TA_COE@curtisswright.com) and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request. #IND

title: Quality Specialist I
description:
Title: Quality Specialist I
Location: Toronto, CA M6J 3L9
Duration:  12 months
 
Schedule: The Quality Specialist will rotate on Continental 12-hour shifts.
Work Hours - 6 AM to 6 PM
 
Description:
Under the direction of the Quality Supervisor, this role will be responsible for performing scheduled and unscheduled quality audits, inspection and testing of products, as well as audits to the building and equipment infrastructure for the purpose of achieving manufacturing goals, Food Safety and quality standards, consumer/customer expectations and Regulatory requirements.
 
The Quality Specialist is required to cover for absences/vacation so may occasionally have to change shifts to support the Quality Team.
 
The primary responsibilities of the position are:
 
• To continuously tour the manufacturing lines auditing the documentation and testing done by production operators following the internal procedures in order to release the product to the market. This documentation includes: HACCP records, GMP records, net content control, hold and release, specifications, traceability records.
• Interact with operators and Production Supervisor to troubleshoot, escalate and take corrective actions if any quality of Food safety deviation is found during the walks.
• Fill out and file checklists with the information gathered during the shift.
• Spot checks product in warehouse or returned goods.
• Tests metal detectors and check weighers to ensure correct function.
• Verifies incoming packaging materials against specifications.
• Any other duties as assigned by the Department Supervisor.
• Use the plant’s internal database to obtain current forms and work instructions.
 
Qualifications:
• The successful candidate must be a responsible and reliable self-starter who is capable of working effectively with little supervision.
• Diploma/Degree/Certificate in Quality Assurance.
• 2+ years industry experience in Quality Assurance preferred.
• Experience in the Food Manufacturing industry preferred.
• Exposure to Quality Systems is preferred, e.g. HACCP, ISO, FSSC22000, etc.
• Strong computer skills (Proficient in Word and Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)
• Strong communication skills coupled with the ability to read and write English proficiently.
• Demonstrated interest and concern for quality and keen observation skills.
• A keen desire to learn.
• Ability to work independently
• Must be a strong performer who demonstrates reliability, an excellent attendance record, excellent team work and strong self-directed individual and group work ethic.
• Team player with a positive attitude, working well with others.
 
Job specific requirements and working conditions:
• Ability to work in a manufacturing environment with varying levels of noise and temperatures and with requirement to wear PPE such as safety shoes, ear plugs, hair net and safety glasses.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment and capable of the defined physical activities (walk long distances and climb stairs several times a day).
 
Competencies/Abilities:
These are key observable/measurable skills, knowledge and behaviors required that contribute to successful performance in the position.
• Flexible with an exceptionally high ability to prioritize tasks and daily work activities in a fast-paced environment
• Demonstrated ability to make decisions, work independently and deal with multiple issues at any one time.
• Organized, able to handle pressure and can react quickly to changes, and demonstrates ability to “think-on-your-feet”.
• Strong communication and employee relations skills
• Good diplomacy & conflict management
• Demonstrated analytical and planning skills
• Leadership and teamwork skills.
• Results orientated.

title: Estimator
description:
With stocking service centers located in all corners of North America, and distribution partners worldwide, Connexus Industries is a leading provider of chain and industrial manufacturing solutions.

We aregrowing and hiring an estimator to work with the sales team, create proposals and track the costs of projects.

Responsibilities include:
  • Look at customer requirements.
  • Analyze labor, material, and time requirements for a job.
  • Estimate, prepare, and present cost reports to the sales team members.
  • Work with the sales team to prepare proposals.
  • Input cost data into the ERP.
  • Upon completion calculate and report on differences between the estimated cost and actual cost.
 
Skills and Requirements:
  • 2+ years experience estimating in a manufacturing environment.
  • Experience reading technical drawings.
  • Review and fact-checking skills, with a high degree of accuracy in numerical calculations.
  • Previous experience in a technical role such as engineering, welder, machinist, etc. would be an asset.
  • Excellent organization and time management skills.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
 
Connexus offers a competitive salary, good benefits, and a spacious clean work environment.

title: Plasma Cutting Machine Operator
description:
Brannon Steel is looking for an experienced CNC Plasma Cutting MachineOperator to join the team at its Brampton manufacturing location. Pay from $22.54 and up depending on experience. Day, afternoon, or night shift available. Straight or bevel-cut machines. Apply now and let's make a deal!

Duties

  • Setup, operate, and troubleshoot one or more straight or bevel-cut CNC plasma cutting machines.
  • Move large steel parts and plate using overhead crane.
  • Read part drawings and production documents.
  • Check finished parts against specifications.
  • Perform and document quality inspections.
  • Document work completed.
  • Experience operating straight or bevel-cut CNC plasma cutting machines.
  • Experience operating overhead cranes, preferably with valid record of training.
  • Perform manual material handling up to 23 kgs (50 lbs).
  • Perform repetitive work including bending, twisting, lifting, and stair climbing.
  • Read, write, and speak English at a conversational level.
  • Perform basic math.
  • Base pay from $22.54 to $33.46 per hour depending on experience.
  • Up to $4 per hour in night shift premiums OR up to $2 per hour in afternoon shift premiums.
  • Overtime after 40 hours per week.
  • Extended health coverage including prescriptions, paramedical expenses, and emergency travel assistance.
  • Dental coverage including preventive, diagnostic, and treatment services.
  • Short and long-term disability insurance.
  • Life and AD&D insurance.
  • Free employee assistance program.
  • Group RRSP program with contribution matching up to 5% of regular annual earnings.
  • Service award program including travel vouchers for $3,000, $5,000, and $10,000 for 10, 20, and 30 years of service.
  • Full-time, permanent work at a family-owned company that's 50+ years old.
  • Company-supplied tools & equipment, uniforms, safety boots, and prescription safety glasses.
  • Opportunities to learn and advance.
  • A friendly work environment where people support each other.
  • Comprehensive COVID-19 safety protocols in place.
  • Summer barbeques, annual golf tournament, and more!

title: Material Handler/Kitter - Amico Corporation
description:
MATERIAL HANDLER/KITTER - Amico Corporation
Richmond Hill, Ontario

JOB OVERVIEW:
In support of Production, this role will handle all the warehouse and material handling support required to complete the assembly of projects scheduled in Production.
This includes ensuring the flow of production from material handling, kitting to returning excess product from manufacturing back into the warehouse. Other warehouse duties they must perform are cycle counting, pallet wrapping, staging of product and quality assurance of raw material and finished goods.
FUNCTION:

  • Kitting of materials. Locates materials and supplies by pulling and verifying materials and supplies listed on the Bill of Materials (BOMs). Kitting is divided into three group of Parts:
    • Metals
    • Aluminum Extrusion
    • Electrical Components & Loose Parts
  • Schedule Kitting based on the Production Schedule.
  • Put Away the Materials to its proper location and arrange the location.
  • Maintain a proper identification and labels of materials on the shelves.
  • Perform regular cycle counts of parts.
  • Report the rejects and quality issues on materials received. Ensure that the rejected/damaged materials are disposed accordingly.
EXPECTATIONS:
  • Understand the production schedule and Kit materials based on the schedule.
  • Confirm SAP work orders after Kitting. Identifies missing items/low inventory items/out of stock items during the process.
  • Assist in reviewing picklist based on actual production drawings and reporting the issues to the Material Planners.
  • Receive and put away materials to its proper location – if the location changes, update the SAP Material Master with the new location.
  • Group the Storage Locations of materials per Product Family.
  • Conduct regular cycle counts @ 3 cycles per year.
  • Report low inventory count of materials to Planners
  • Report scraps/quality issues of materials to Planners.
  • Maintain material-handling equipment by completing inspection checklists; making minor repairs if necessary and reporting major issues with the machines/tools.

MEASUREMENT OF SUCCESS:
  • Parts are grouped per product family.
  • All skids are labeled with the required information.
  • Storage Location of each part on the shelves are correct and updated.
  • Materials received are put away to each designated located within 1 week of receiving the parts.
  • Work Orders are kitted as per schedule
  • Raw materials for Sub Assembly and Cutting Room are kitted per work order and completed as scheduled.
  • Loose Parts are prepared as scheduled with pictures.
For more information, please visit us at www.amico.com

*Only selected candidates will be contacted.

Ensure that the rejected/damaged materials are disposed accordingly.', 'Maintain material-handling equipment by completing inspection checklists; making minor repairs if necessary and reporting major issues with the machines/tools.', 'Put Away the Materials to its proper location and arrange the location.', 'Understand the production schedule and Kit materials based on the schedule.', 'Perform regular cycle counts of parts.', 'Raw materials for Sub Assembly and Cutting Room are kitted per work order and completed as scheduled.', 'Receive and put away materials to its proper location – if the location changes, update the SAP Material Master with the new location.', 'Report scraps/quality issues of materials to Planners.', 'Confirm SAP work orders after Kitting. title: Quality Assurance Associate
description:
Reporting to the Quality Assurance Supervisor, the Quality Assurance Associate creates a culture of quality compliance and continuous improvement, which meets the government, customer and business requirements. The focus is on prevention rather than detection of quality issues.

The role includes the final product audit for product release, coaching and training operators and supervisors on proper documentation practices and cGMP requirements.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Performs in-process document auditing and product quality checks in production and ensures all issues are communicated to production employees, production management and QA management.
  • Performs Final Release auditing of batch documentation ensure all product has been manufactured in compliance with cGMP’s and SOP’s. This includes performing all duties required to release the final product.
  • Assists in the investigation of manufacturing issues and manufacturing deviations as reported by the production departments
  • Performs in-process product quality checks and documentation review
  • Reviews and approves event reports, as assigned.
  • Performs weekly compliance audits/monitoring in all production and packaging departments and prepares result reports for QA management.
  • Acts as QA representative on shift in decision-making and issue resolution, escalating serious issues to production management and QA management as required.
  • Performs line clearance verifications of equipment and processing areas during changeovers from one type of product to another type of product – may include testing/verification of vision equipment.
  • Participates in special projects as required in other areas of Quality and Compliance.
  • Coaching and training operators and supervisors on cGMP practices.
  • Assists in the writing and revision of SOP’s
  • Prepares product assessment Protocols and Reprocessing directives
  • Responsible for the filing, archiving and review of Quality documents such as equipment logbooks, cleaning logs, and inter-company transportation documentation
  • Performs sampling for Environmental Monitoring Testing, as directed by QA Specialist/QA Supervisor.
  • Perform daily checks of temperature humidity charts in the QA areas, stability chambers, and retain rooms, as directed by QA Specialist/ QA Supervisor.
  • Performs managing (e.g. sampling, testing/analyzing, and releasing) of packaging components, as directed by QA Specialist/ QA Supervisor.

Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Engineering (Chem., BioChem.) or related field

Experience:

  • No previous experience required.
  • Prior experience in a manufacturing, pharmaceutical and/or GMP facility would be an asset.

Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Extremely detailed oriented
  • Excellent prioritization and time management skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Excellent communication skills – verbal and written
  • Able to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Advanced computer skills in MS Excel and Word

Working Conditions:

While performing the responsibilities of the job, these work environment characteristics are representative of the environment the employee will encounter. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate.

Position located in Strathroy, Ontario.

Regular working hours: 12 hour rotating continental shifts as defined by rotation schedule.

Shifts of: day (7:00 AM – 7:00 PM) or night (7:00 PM – 7:00 AM).

Physical Demands:

These physical demands are representative of the physical requirements necessary for an employee to successfully perform the essential duties of the job.

While performing the responsibilities of the job, the employee is required to walk, talk and hear. The employee is often required to sit and use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel and to manipulate keys on a keyboard. Use of manual dexterity is required. The employee is  required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, bend or twist, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Walking/entering between GMP and office area interchangeably throughout the working hours. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision.  There is also the minimal, but potential exposure to chemicals.

Reasonable accommodation can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions of the job.

Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career!  Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference. 

Catalent is committed to the health and safety of its employees, visitors and the customers and patients we serve. As a result of the global pandemic, we have modified many of our recruitment and on-boarding processes to maintain everyone’s safety. The Human Resources teams will communicate all necessary safety processes and procedures throughout each stage.

   

personal initiative. dynamic pace. meaningful work.

Visit Catalent Careers to explore career opportunities.

Catalent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on any characteristic protected by local law.

If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your request by sending an email, and confirming your request for an accommodation and include the job number, title and location to DisabilityAccommodations@catalent.com. This option is reserved for individuals who require accommodation due to a disability. Information received will be processed by a U.S. Catalent employee and then routed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure appropriate consideration in the application or hiring process.

    

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives: Catalent Pharma Solutions (Catalent) is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Catalent employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Catalent. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

title: Warehouse Operator
description:
Sazerac Company Overview:

Build your career at Sazerac! With almost 400 years of rich history, Sazerac Company has thrived as an independent, American family-owned company with operations in the United States and around the world. Since the 2000s, Sazerac has averaged double digit growth every year! Sazerac Company produces and markets the most award-winning bourbons and whiskeys in the world, including Buffalo Trace, Pappy Van Winkle, Eagle Rare, Blantonâ€™s, and Sazerac Rye. Additionally, Sazerac owns many popular brands across a range of spirits, including Fireball, Southern Comfort, Seagramâ€™s V.O., Myersâ€™s, GoldschlÃ¤ger, Parrot Bay, 99 Brand, and Platinum Vodka.  

 

Weâ€™re proud of our award-winning culture and distilleries. Our Louisville office has been named one of the â€œBest Places to Work in Kentuckyâ€ four times, and our Buffalo Trace Distillery has earned the title of â€œworldâ€™s most award-winning distilleryâ€ through the dedication of our craftsmen for well over 200 years. Whether youâ€™re a recent graduate or an experienced professional, Sazerac provides extraordinary opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, entrepreneurial industry.

Job Description/Responsibilities:

The incumbent will report to the Warehouse and Processing Manager and will be responsible for executing processes for the barrel filling, storage, aging, shipping and receiving processes.   The aging function is critical to the quality of the whisky product.   The ideal candidate will be required to work effectively with co-workers to maintain a high level of safety, quality, productivity and cooperation.   The selected candidate will have the opportunity to gain extensive knowledge of the spirits manufacturing process. Furthermore, they will actively engage with leadership and colleagues to strive for improvements in our processes.

 

We are committed to protecting the health and safety of all of our employees. Safety is our number one priority.

 

Responsibilities Include (But Not Limited To):  

  • Operates Barrel Drain/Fill equipment
  • Drives forklift truck bringing full barrels to and from barrel line and maturation warehouses.
  • Participates on TPM teams.
  • Acts as shipper/receiver as required.

This is a full time position with a current work schedule of Monday - Friday, 8 hours/day.   Some overtime may be required.

 

We are an inclusive employer and welcome all applicants who have the key skills identified above.

 

Salary: $24.79/hour, with future increases based on length of service.    

Benefits:  

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

 

COVID-19 considerations:

To keep our employees and visitors safe, we have strict site access policies, have implemented daily temperature and symptom checks, as well as site-wide social distancing and mask-use policies.

 

 

 

 

 

Qualifications/Requirements:

Must Requirements

  • Secondary school diploma
  • Previous experience in manufacturing or warehouse environment
  • Ability to operate Industrial equipment as required.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks at one time
  • Must be at least 18 years old

PREFERRED

  • Ability to communicate with all levels of an org
  • Ability to pick up and/or move objects up to 50 pounds without assistance.
  • Previous experience in manufacturing, landscaping or warehouse environment
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Good vision and manual dexterity.
  • Good physical health. For example; capable of working on your feet, sitting, climbing stairs and ladders, bending, kneeling, and squatting.

title: Inspecteur, contrôle de la qualité (électrique) / Quality Control Inspector (Electrical)
description:
Inspecteur, contrôle de la qualité (électrique) / Quality Control Inspector (Electrical)



Description



Rôles et responsabilités



Le/la titulaire de ce poste vérifie les matériaux, voit à ce que les procédés de fabrication soient conformes aux spécifications et s'assure de la qualité du produit à toutes les étapes de sa fabrication. Il/elle vérifie qu'il n'y ait aucune incompatibilité entre les dessins, les devis et les fiches de contrôle. En outre, il/elle complète tous les documents relatifs à la disposition du matériel.



Roles and responsibilities



The incumbent verifies materials, sees that manufacturing procedures are in accordance with specifications and verifies the quality of the product at all stages of manufacturing. He/she verifies that drawings, blueprints and technical documents are compatible with each other and completes all necessary documents regarding material disposition.



Qualifications



Exigences requises




* Diplôme d'études secondaires et six (6) ans d’expérience pertinente.




* Connaissance des systèmes et procédures de l’assurance de la qualité.




* Bonnes relations interpersonnelles.




* Connaissance fonctionnelle du français et de l'anglais.



Required qualifications




* High School Diploma and six (6) years of pertinent experience.




* Knowledge of Quality Assurance Systems and Procedures.




* Good interpersonal skills.




* Functional knowledge of French and English.



Job Quality



Primary Location CA-Quebec-Mirabel



Recruiting Company Bell Textron Inc.



Schedule Full-time



Job Level Individual Contributor



Shift First Shift
Req ID: 300770

title: Mechanical / Electrical Assembler
description:
UTV International is a leading manufacturer of off-road utility vehicles

Since 1995 UTV International has been manufacturing Achiever off road tracked vehicles, Hercules digger derricks and Pioneer snow vehicles for the power, utility, telecom, forestry, mining, and ski industries.

Responsibilities/Tasks:

  • Assemble vehicle components, connect hydraulic system, drill, tap and repair heavy equipment
  • Detailed work requiring continuous fine motor skills and repetitive motion
  • Assemble machines according to customers' requests
  • Assist with electrical assembly as required
  • Installing any mechanical components
  • Maintain tools and keep your working environment clean and functional
  • Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations
  • Respect quality standards
  • All other related tasks

Who we’re looking for?

  • DEP in industrial mechanics or any other relevant degree (asset)
  • Minimum1 year experience in machining environment is preferred
  • Electrical experience (asset)
  • Ability to read and interpret mechanicals plans/drawings (asset)
  • Proficient communication skills
  • Be versatile, independent, and resourceful
  • Organized, detail oriented & meticulous when executing tasks
  • Capacity to manage stress and work well under pressure
  • Have interpersonal skills and a positive attitude

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Full benefit package after 3 months
  • Stable, solid company
  • Room to grow

UTV International is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: Material Analyst / Planner
description:
Posted Date:4/26/2022
Job Category:
Position Title:Material Analyst / Planner
Salary Range:
Location:Vaughan, Ontario, Canada
Desired Skills:
Description:CLIENT SUMMARY:
Our client is a GTA leading supplier of specialized, automotive parts and assemblies to the global, automotive OEM market. Due to growth and increased business, they are looking to add a talented Material Analyst / Planner to their team.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
Opportunity to work for a very well respected, world class manufacturer that has enjoyed many years of success and stability.
Paid additional training and development.
Excellent growth and advancement opportunities.
An excellent compensation package including:
- Competitive hourly rate with the opportunity for overtime
- Excellent benefits
- RRSP matching
- Profit sharing

Minimum requirements:
- Post-Secondary education in related Operations, Supply Chain or Logistics field. Preferably CPIM.
- Minimum 3 years related experience in automotive manufacturing environment managing the smooth supply of material to production.
- High degree of knowledge and understanding of a variety of manufacturing and automotive processes and components and good understanding of supply chain management
- Understanding of supplier relationships and experience with expediting from local and overseas suppliers.
- Computer literacy in MRP / ERP scheduling systems, supplier releasing and & cycle-count systems, as well EDI and ASN’s.

Responsibilities include:
- Responsible for inventory management of part numbers assigned, including optimization of inventory levels on the floor for a JIT environment, & on an ongoing basis reviewing the parameters to ensure optimization that the inventory levels as well as the supply of the components are in a timely manner
- Responsible for ensuring that cycle counts are done daily and submitted for approval. Cycle counts at the suppliers are done on a regular basis (weekly / bi-weekly) and submitted for approval with adequate analysis with detail explanation to the variance.
- Responsible for ensuring the integrity of inventory listed in CMI, including any follow-ups to resolve disagreements between physical inventory confirmations and CMI system
- Responsible for resolving any reported “negative” inventory listings of purchased items and ensures that, in coordination with production that the finished good inventory is accurate.

CONTACT and RESUME SUBMISSION:
If you feel you are an excellent candidate and have the required skills and experience indicated above, please send your attached resume and any important details to HCR Permanent Search, care of the consultant listed below. Only qualified candidates who can work in Canada without restrictions will be contacted. Please ensure that you indicate the name of the position you are applying for in the subject heading. Thank you for your interest.

Aaron Berger
Sr. Account Manager
HCR Permanent Search
Ph: 905.669.2400 x2239
aberger@hcr.ca
www.hcrpermsearch.com

title: Machine Operator II
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Responsibilities:

Weatherford is hiring for Machine Operators in our Edmonton manufacturing facility. This is a hands on, rewarding role where you will be producing quality and efficient products and tools for the oil and gas industry. As an Machine Operator, you'll be working within a supportive, inclusive team in a fast-paced, progressive environment. Weatherford provide full training, excellent benefits and fantastic career progression.  

 

Consistently producing quality and efficient products performing machine operations.

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: (not listed in any particular order)  

  • Review shop order packet for procedural instructions.
  • Perform and assist own setups.  
  • Check dimensions of parts and holds tolerance of plus or minus .001.  
  • Know and understand Weatherford Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  
  • Work assignments carried out to the highest quality level.  
  • Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.  
  • Use of most types of inspection gages.  
  • Ability to perform and execute skills as a mentor.
Qualifications:
  • High School Education or equivalent  
  • 2+ years' experience as a Machine Operator II preferred  
  • Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence and memos in English.  
  • Ability to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions.  
  • Ability to deal with problems involving a few variables in standardized situations.
  • Must be able to read and interpret work order and engineered drawing requirements.  
  • Must be able to make machine setups  
  • Good working knowledge in the use of calipers and micrometers.  
  • Must be able to safely operate material handling equipment including forklifts and overhead cranes.  
  • Ability to maintain a clean, organized and safe work environment

title: Food Manufacturing Machine Operator - Afternoon Shift
description:
You already LOVE us and the SNACKS WE MAKE

Chips, Cookies, Crackers, Wafers, Cheese Curls, Popcorn, Tortilla Chips... yeah, we make them ALL! Shearer's is the company behind all your favorite snack brands.

We have over 5,000 associates in 12 state-of-the-art manufacturing and warehouse sites in North America that produce over 800 million pounds of snacks per year. Did you know that we buy 20% of all the potatoes grown in the US? WOW!

And we know what you're thinking…how can I get my hands on some free goodies? Our team members can take home oodles of free snacks – everyday!

 

URGENTLY HIRING! NEW PAY RATES!

Snack Food Machine Operator - Guelph, Canada

Afternoons Shift Start Times

3:00 PM - 11:00 PM

$20.48/hour, then $21.48 (after 1041 hours worked)

(in addition - .30 shift premium)

 

Your seat at the table

Our Oven Room (Machine Operator) Team Members work as Batter and Crème Operators, as well as Spreaders, preparing batches following precise recipes. Each of these roles are integral in the creation of our bakery products. 

  • Required to perform all duties required within the Baking Department. This would include, but may not be limited to Cream Spreader Operator, Batter System Operator, Crème System Operator
  • Lift bagged ingredients with a weight of ~23kg to an opening of mixing vessels. (example: bagged sugar, bagged flour, and bagged dextrose)
  • Measure ingredients following batter and crème recipes
  • Maintain records of material use and production
  • Assemble, disassemble, and clean tooling as required by production while keeping the work area clean
  • Respond to machine faults
  • Break, re-grind, push into a grinder and change re-grind buckets as required
  • Perform general housekeeping duties such as sweeping, light equipment cleaning as required
  • Follow all work instructions
  • Follow all company policies and procedures while working
  • Completing all other duties as assigned

 

What you bring to the table

  • Strong communication skills – must be able to accurately express information concerning product quality and safety
  • Responsible for ensuring that the work they perform meets the Company's product "Quality" expectations
  • Responsible for knowing Ovenroom lockout procedures
  • Must have basic computer skills
  • Must be able to perform simple calculations
  • Individual must be self-motivated, detail-orientated, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and have good time management & organizational skills
  • Work well within a team environment
  • Physically capable of heavy lifting (50 lbs)
  • Self-starter, working with minimal supervision
  • Must follow all safety regulations while working

Please note: we have the following allergens in our facility:  Peanuts, Wheat, Whey, Dairy and Soya

We Offer a Feast of Benefits

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Retirement Savings Plan with Match, Short Term Disability, Employee Assistance Plan and the opportunity to work with some great people.

You will be considered for employment in our inclusive workplace

Shearer's Foods Canada, Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please advise us if you require accommodation during the recruitment process.

 

This is your invitation to apply now!
