title: Electrostatic Painter - Will Train
description:
WE ARE CLASSIFIED AS AN ESSENTIAL BUSINESS!!!


Apex Aluminum Extrusions Ltd. is a state-of-the-art aluminum extrusion factory located in Langley, British Columbia. Production of aluminum profiles began in early 2011, making Apex the most recent addition to the aluminum extrusion market. With a 170,000 square foot facility and some of the most modern equipment in its industry, we believe in the extensive use of technology and in the ongoing investment and development of our processes and people. 

As a market leader, we are always on the lookout for exceptionally talented individuals to join our team. Currently we require a next level player to join our Paintline as an Electrostatic Painter. Our goal is to strive for perfection and to provide the quality our customers deserve!

 

 

Job Summary:

As an Electrostatic Painter, your responsibilities and duties include:

  • Utilize instrumentation to measure painting parameters to ensure compliance with OEM specifications
  • Reading & completing work orders
  • Sanding and preparation of surfaces to be painted
  • Hanging profiles and parts
  • Picking/prepping stock for paint and/or distribution
  • Utilize instrumentation to measure painting parameters to ensure compliance with OEM specifications
  • Applying paint in the desired color and amount, using hand held electrostatic spray guns
  • Ensuring the quality of the job is up to company standards and customer requirements
  • Maintaining a clean work environment including the work area and equipment
  • Packaging coated products for shipping.
  • Inventory tracking.
  • Assist in other parts of the plant including loading/unloading as required.
  • Communicate clearly and timely with the Lead-hand about job specific issues or requirements.
  • Detail oriented and able to follow a process to completion

 

Experience:

  • One-year experience desired;but we are willing to train the right person
  • Fundamental knowledge of concepts in electrostatic procedures
  • Experience with air assisted/airless/electrostatic hand held spray guns in a booth required
  • Knowledge of painting with pressure pots is an asset.
  • Capable of reading and writing in English
  • Able to safely lift to 50lbs
  • First aid and forklift certifications are an asset

 

Own Tools/Equipment:  Steel-toed safety boots required (CSA approved).  All other necessary PPE will be fitted and supplied
    
Work Site:  Manufacturing environment

 

Transportation/Travel Information:  Public transportation is available   

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities:

  • Repetitive tasks
  • Handling heavy loads
  • Physically demanding
  • Manual dexterity
  • Attention to detail
  • Hand-eye co-ordination
  • Standing for extended periods

 

Personal Suitability:

  • Team player
  • Safety oriented
  • Dependability
  • Fast learner
  • Reliability
  • Punctuality
  • Organized & detail oriented

 

Benefits:

  • Life insurance
  • Disability insurance
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Work-boot allowance
  • Annual company events
  • Internal advancement opportunities
  • Attendance & referral bonuses

 

Qualified, ambitious candidates are invited to submit their application.  Thank you to all interested applicants, however only those short listed will be contacted for an interview.

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
About us

Adaria Vending Services is a Vaughan based company specializing in logistics and fulfillment services for unattended retail outlets such as vending machines. Our clients range from offices to manufacturing plants to public areas - pretty much anywhere you'll ever find a vending machine. We're a young, dynamic team dedicated to providing industry leading fulfillment to vending machines and clients located in southern Ontario.

 

Adaria Vending Services is looking for a Warehouse Associate to join our team. This position works on the warehouse floor, processing orders by picking and filling boxes/containers. He/she will send and accept shipments while keeping the warehouse clean, organized, and safe at all times. He/she will be required to drive an 18 ft box truck for inter-warehouse transfers.

Responsibilities:

  • Pick and assemble orders on skids and product totes accurately and efficiently
  • Loading of company vehicles
  • Receiving deliveries and restocking pick line
  • Maintain clean and organized warehouse
  • Load and unload products manually by hand and with material handling equipment (pallet truck)
  • Maintain and organize inventory with first-in first-out rotation
  • Inter-Warehouse Transfers (operate 18 ft box truck)
  • Other duties as required

Requirements:

  • Prefer at least 1 years of prior warehouse work experience
  • Clean driving record and is comfortable driving box truck
  • Ability to lift 50lbs repeatedly throughout work day
  • Responsible, self starter, and able to complete tasks as needed
  • Able to multi task and work well under time constraints
  • Able to work well with others and independently in the workplace
  • Detail oriented and well organized
  • Fluent (written and verbal) English

Why work for us?:

  • Growth and advancement opportunities. We are the fastest growing company in our industry and we are always looking for hardworking employees to join our management/supervisor team.
  • Bonus available after probation
  • Comprehensive health and benefit package (dental, vision, disability, drugs, paramedical, etc) for full-time employees
  • Fun, friendly, and dynamic team. (Team events and BBQ)
  • We are the market leader and innovator of technology within our industry
  • Opportunities to execute your own ideas and improvement

title: Demand Production Buyer/Planner
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Kingston is hiring demand production buyer/planner.  This individuals primary responsibilities are planning and procuring the raw materials and supplies necessary for the production our finished goods. This role supports operations in the R&D, Engineering, Biology Lab, Manufacturing, MSAT and Supply Chain.  The incumbent is also responsible to work closely with the Purchasing and Supply Chain management team local at the Kingston Site. 

Key responsibilities:

  • Procures materials components, equipment, supplies and services necessary for the operation of the company
  • Plan, schedule, and monitor goods and services to meet the production requirements of the company employing such techniques but not limited to JIT, Kanban, Blanket POs, and Reschedules
  • Check requisitions and MRP requirements, contact and evaluate sources
  • Set-up and maintain material, supplier and planning system data in the MRP/ERP system
  • Exercise a good working knowledge of goods, services, and sources of supply to make purchases at prices consistent with quality and quantity requirements
  • Determine material requirements from Biology, Engineering and production schedules and coordinate the efficient movement of materials through production cycle
  • Identify and evaluate sources of supply consistent with quality and quantity requirement of the company
  • Evaluates bids consistent with the total cost of ownership
  • Establish goals and objectives that support the department and company objectives. Follow up on objectives to ensure compliance
  • Take on special assignments as warranted; such as projects to resource commodities
  • Work with receiving, finance and suppliers to reconcile discrepancies in receiving and invoicing
  • Develop, Implement and Support sourcing and supplier management initiatives
  • Negotiate pricing, delivery, lead-time, etc., with suppliers and partner; Ensure that the highest quality standards are maintained in all functions & responsibilities of the job as well as executed in a manner, which supports companies quality standards
  • Maintain Metrics, Support Lean activities and initiatives and Support EHS activities and initiatives
  • Perform other duties/special projects as assigned

Key requirements:

  • Bachelors degree is required – preferably in purchasing.
  • 5-10 years of purchasing experience
  • 0-4 years of planning experience is preferred

Every day, Lonza's products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
We have an opportunity available for a Quality Assurance Engineer located in Winnipeg MB. The company is a leader in the development of complex machinery and equipment.

Quality Assurance Engineer

Location: Winnipeg MB

 

Implementation of quality engineering systems for complex machinery and equipment. Provide corrective /preventative action plans, failure reporting, analysis and corrective action and field data collection. Chair Material Review Board and ensure timely status updates and reporting. Interaction with manufacturing to ensure process and quality control. Determine and implement mandatory inspection point plans and ensure identification and traceability of parts and materials used in deliverable products. Implement and control quality data collection procedures to ensure that product, procedures and processes are in compliance with relevant regulatory requirements. Identify, analyze and monitor key performance indicators and conduct process and product audits. Previous experience with quality assurance procedures and planning for electrical /mechanical systems. Working knowledge of implementing quality management system (QMS), quality procedures, cause and effect, SPC, lean manufacturing, six sigma, (APQP) advanced product quality planning, (PPAP) production part approval process and 8D methodology. Experience with Material Review Board (MRB) and non-conformance /corrective action systems. B.Sc. /M.Sc. Mechanical /Electrical or related Engineering with demonstrated experience. Green / Black Belt training an asset.

 

Send a copy of your resume to: hr@prime-source.com

 

Prime Source Management Inc.

Engineering Recruitment | Staffing

 

100 King St. W., Suite 5700, Toronto, Ontario, M5X 1C7

 

Fax: 416-362-4506

 

Email: hr@prime-source.com

 

Prime Source represents a diverse portfolio of companies offering engineering professionals the opportunity to apply their skills within top-level organizations and some of the most exciting programs. Learn how we can help you achieve your goals.

 

Check our Engineering Career Listings at:

http://www.primesourcemanagement.com

title: Tool & Die Maker - North Division - Mon-Thurs 4x10 hour shifts, $37.75+
description:
Tool & Die Maker - North Division - Mon-Thurs 4x10 hour Shifts

NEW RATE: $37.75/hour plus premiums!!

Location: Tillsonburg, ON

Shifts Available: Rotating Day Shift 6:00a-4:00p & Afternoon Shift 4:00p-2:00a - 4 weeks Days, 2 weeks Afternoons

Why Join Marwood

Who We Are:

  • Marwood International Inc. is a full service, award-winning, Tier I and 2 automotive OEM structural components and modular assembly supplier, that focuses on waste elimination and light-weighting initiatives from prototypes to full volume products to end of life service partsthroughout Canada, US and Japan.
  • Marwood is also a well-established Canadian-owned manufacturing company which have been in the industry for 30+ years!
  • We are community-oriented, and focused on health and wellness.

We are happy to have you join our team!

We offer:

  • Competitive Pay plus Premiums
  • GREAT Benefits and Perks: dental, medical and vision coverage, as well as outstanding pension plan and more
  • Also, company provided uniforms!
  • Due to Marwood's growth you will have an opportunity for over-time after 40 hours!

Apply today to speak with our recruiter!

Your Role and Responsibilities

Responsibilities:

  • Read and interpret engineering drawings, component prints, assembly part/product drawing
  • Perform calculations for tool and die procedures
  • Set up, operate, adjust, repair and maintain tool room equipment
  • General maintenance on dies, sharpening, polishing, replacing broken and worn parts
  • Troubleshooting to produce quality parts by assessing new tooling and broken tooling
  • Design new tools to replace broken/worn out tools through machining, heat treating, finish grinding and trial fitting
  • Machine and fabricate improvements to dies to suit engineering changes to parts based on direction from the Engineering Department
  • Machine and fabricate parts for other departments ex. quick check gauges for Quality, press parts for Maintenance
  • All other relevant duties

Key Requirements:

  • Grade 12 Diploma
  • Recognized Tool & Die License
  • 2 - 5 years' related experience in Tier I Automotive manufacturing

We are committed to giving people with disabilities an equal opportunity to provide feedback, and access any information they may need.Please advise if you require accommodation.

We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Pre-employment screening will be required.

For more information, please visit our website: www.marwoodinternational.com

title: General Labour - Pickering
description:
We are looking for talented, reliable and hard-working people. With multiple opportunities on packaging production lines. The current opportunities are available in several production areas of the facility but are not limited to Packing Packaging and Operating Packaging Machines. All production openings are permanent. 

Responsibilities and Duties:

Operating state of the art equipment to manufacture various types of food and beverage packaging.
Visually inspect the finished product prior to placing it into the shipping box.
Make boxes, load product belts, replenish materials around machines such as tape, boxes, and bags.
Complete hourly quality checks and assist with quality inspections as needed.
Ensure housekeeping standards are followed.

Experience:

Prior manufacturing or industrial experience is an asset but not required.
Excellent attendance is essential.
The ability to perform repetitive tasks with high attention to detail.
Works well within a team-based environment

What will help you perform the job?

Ability to comfortably stand for extended periods of time.
Ability to comfortably walk, sit, bend, and crouch.
Able to lift up to 30lbs (occasionally may be required to lift up to 50lbs)

For more details, call now: 905-971-8384 / 905-276-4040

title: General Operator
description:
Overview:

12 month contract

 

Axalta Coating Systems Ltd. ("Axalta," or the "Company"), is a leading global manufacturer, marketer and distributor of high performance coatings systems.   With over a 150-year heritage in the coatings industry, Axalta is known for manufacturing high-quality products with well-recognized brands supported by market-leading technology and customer service.

Axalta operates its business in two operating segments: Performance Coatings and Transportation Coatings, serving four end markets, including:   Refinish, Industrial, Light Vehicle and Commercial Vehicle, across the following four regions: North America, EMEA, Latin America and Asia-Pacific.

For more information please visit our website www.axalta.com or follow us on Twitter @axalta and on LinkedIn.

Primary Responsibilities:

We are currently seeking Batch Makers (Loaders and Fillers) with experience operating a  forklift to work  at our plant in  Ajax. The position  is for full-time shift work (40 hours per week) and will be for a one-year contract assignment.

Minimum Requirements:

 

  • Previous experience operating motorized equipment (id. Forklift, hand-truck)
  • A minimum high school or equivalent diploma is required
  • Ability to lift and move up to 50 lbs. is required
  • Excellent reading, writing and comprehension skills is required
  • Basic math skills (including arithmetic, and metric conversions) is required
  • Previous experience in manufacturing or chemical industry is preferred
  • Basic computer skills is beneficial (Word, Excel, SharePoint, SAP, etc.)
  • Ability to adapt to flexible shifts, work schedules and job duties
  • Strong team player with positive attitude
  • Fast learner who is self-directed and adaptable to change
  • Work in a fast-paced environment with frequently shifting priorities
  • Keen focus on safety

title: Production - Bread Packaging Machine Operator Morning/Afternoon shift
description:
Wonderbrands (Formerly Weston Foods) Aldergrove, BC 

WAGE: $22.00 / hour plus $2.00 Shift premium for hours worked between 9:00pm and 6:00am 

SHIFT: Afternoon/Night shift - 6:30am/2:30pm Start time MUST BE AVAILABLE FOR BOTH SHIFTS (flexibility with working overtime, and on weekends, as necessary) 

Location: 5345 275 St, Aldergrove, BC

Must have reliable transportation as there is no ride share or public transit

Wonderbrands, is a leading North American bakery (formerly Weston Foods, fresh and frozen businesses) with 140 years of experience in baking packaged breads, artisan breads, and donuts.  We are one of the largest bakeries in North America and makers of Wonder Bread, Country Harvest, D’Italiano, Gadoua, and Casa Mendosa.

Wonderbrands, a division of FGF Brands, is unlocking an incredible opportunity for growth through a focus on production innovation capabilities, through a leading edge supply chain practice and investing deeply in communities where we bake.  We are hiring to build a robust  Talent and Development team to support our bakeries and Team Members.

Our bakery team is the heart of our company and plays an important role in keeping North America’s food supply going. Our machine operators are essential to our success, and ensure our production equipment is operating smoothly to produce delicious, premier baked goods for our customers.  

We are not just a job, we are an extended family, committed to elevating everyday moments and feeding communities and families across the country. Join us and find fulfillment and purpose in your work. 

In a typical day, you’ll:  

 

  • Be responsible for equipment set-up and change overs and running production lines as needed for various food products  

  • Read work orders and specifications to define prescribed setup operation(s) 

  • Help troubleshoot equipment problems, and support preventative maintenance activities to reduce equipment issues and forced production stoppages 

  • Provide input to shift action plan for their equipment area  

  • Collaborate with engineers, supervisors and process engineers to enhance processes, procedures and training methods 

  • Work closely with all production team members to ensure product quality  

 
About You:  

 

  • A lover of bread and baked goods! 

  • You have strong people skills—you’re approachable, a good listener, and empathetic  

  • You have previously worked in a manufacturing environment (even better if it was food manufacturing!) 

  • You’re dedicated to the health and safety of yourself and your colleagues  

  • You digest constructive feedback as an opportunity to listen, and improve your skills, abilities, and performance 

  • You are someone who listens to comprehend a situation first, asking questions to clarify your own understanding, instead of listening to be able to reply quickly  

  • Must have reliable transportation as there is no ride share or public transit

 

We offer a competitive benefits package for full-time employees, including strong benefit and pension plans, paid vacation and holidays, overtime opportunities, and a growth path to line leader and supervisory roles. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity and love baked goods, we invite you to apply! 

 

#INDWPBR

title: Junior Mold Setter
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Junior Mold Setter at our 591 Arvin facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Mold Maintenance Manager, the Junior Mold Setter is responsible for mold changes, machine troubleshooting and repair. They will be responsible for, adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the ISO9001:2015 AND IATF 16949 Quality System and practicing continuous improvement wherever possible.

Responsibilities:

  • On a three shift rotation, Perform mold changes based on schedule and prepare/setup the machine for production. Ensure the work environment is safe to perform the mold change and communication to all impacted employees is clear.
  • Ability to learn to operate a 40 Ton overhead crane
  • Understand and follow Standardized work instructions
  • Provide input into efficiency improvements regarding Mold changes
  • Assist maintenance technician/electrician with machine maintenance including mechanical, hydraulic and pneumatic troubleshooting and repair.
  • Assist mold maker with injection mold tool troubleshooting, repair and maintenance.
  • Support the production team priorities of Safety, Quality and Delivery.
  • Assist in monitoring process conditions to ensure they are in control.
  • Assist in trials on new programs
  • Assist in trials on new technology
  • Perform duties as assigned from time to time by Supervisor.

Qualifications:

Education Required

Grade 12 at minimum. Applicable Post-Secondary schooling or trade an asset, not required.

Skills Required

Demonstrated mechanical aptitude

Demonstrated experience with various hand tools

Ability to support significant physical demands of assignment

Equivalent Experience

Experience in a manufacturing environment an asset


Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

hr@tiercon.com

.

title: Industrial Fabrication Specialist (FT)
description:
Reporting to Production/CI Manager the Industrial Millwright will be a full time position. They will be responsible for supporting production requirements on a daily basis as well as building, installation and maintenance of equipment, fixtures, Jigs, tooling. Repairs of existing equipment required to support production. Must have a good working knowledge of hand tools and industrial equipment. The position will be a key support for facilitation Continuous improvement projects. The potential candidate should exercise strict adherence to safety and company policies.
Qualifications:
  • Certified Industrial Millwright/Industrial Mechanic or Tool and Die Maker.
  • 5-10 years welding experience and equipment fabrication.
  • Experience working in a large fast paced equipment manufacturing environment.
  • Certified Welder (experience in welding, MiG and Stick).
  • Experience building/fabricating equipment to support production and improvements.
  • Assembling, testing, troubleshooting of machines/equipment to ensure they are working.
  • Certified for operating cranes for moving large parts/equipment.
  • Experience using a variety of hand power tools and industrial equipment.
  • Forklift certification ( an asset).

Job Details:
  • Shift - Day shift Monday to Thursday 6:30 am to 4:00 pm.
  • Friday 6:30 am – 3:00 pm.
  • Occasional overtime.
Experience:
  • Minimum 5-10 years relevant work experience in an industrial environment.
  • Flexible, good interpersonal skills.
  • Able to communicate effectively verbally and in writing.
  • MiG and Stick Welding.
  • Ability to work independently without supervision and meet tight deadlines.
  • Working knowledge of safety standards for equipment.
  • Able to communicate with diplomacy and tact.
  • Safe and professional working attitude.

Benefits** available at 3 months**

title: Material Handler
description:
Mauser Packaging Solutions is a global leader in solutions and services across the packaging lifecycle, providing large and small metal, plastic, fiber and hybrid packaging worldwide to companies in industries from food, beverage, personal care and pharmaceuticals to chemicals, petrochemicals, agrochemicals and paints. Bringing together the very best of its four legacy companies— BWAY, MAUSER Group, NCG and ICS—Mauser Packaging Solutions offers its customers true sustainability at scale.

Earn up to $750 through our retention program!

Our Mauser Packaging Solutions Retention program is a way for us to show you our appreciation for the talents and expertise you bring to our company.

GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
As directed by Warehouse Manager, responsible for the flow of finish goods from the production and printing roller to the warehouse. Must also be fully familiar with all the packaging specifications and be able to perform all Operator and Operator II duties. Must ensure that working conditions and work habits are conducted in a safe manner.
 
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Must possess good verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be a licensed qualified experienced forklift operator.
  • Must be prepared to work in a co-operative environment.
  • Must be willing and physically able to fulfill the job requirement.
  • Must have basic computer knowledge. 
  • Must be able to work in high pace environment 
  • Must be able to work 12 hour shifts that rotate to night shift every 2 months

WORKPLACE SAFETY:
  • Wears all approved PPE as required in the area of work
  • Takes responsibility and is accountable for safety by complying with company rules, regulations, policies, safe practices, and good housekeeping in all production-related activities.
  • Acts in a manner of demonstrating and supporting a safe behavior 
  • Brings forward unsafe conditions/situation by communicating immediately to the on-site supervisor and completing a work observation
  • Shares safety great catches and safe conditions/situations by completing a work observation
  • Ensures all required safety training (both online and in-class) are completed by the due date
  • Conducts safety risk assessment before entering a work station and/or performing a task - leverages the “Stop,             Think, Act” model

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Perform all work in compliance with company policy and within the guidelines
  • To unload production and printing conveyor lines of finished goods and safely store them in the warehouse.
  • Must be able to understand the general operation of the warehouse requirements.
  • Correctly placing finish goods on correct pallets and safely storing them in the warehouse. 
  • Ensure that all products are stored in an organized, efficient, and safe manner.
  • Arrange for the repair of damaged packaging of the product.
  • To transfer finished goods to the storage area and maintain production entry sheets.
  • To assist in coffee & lunch break relief at the machine. Receive, ship, store, and transfer material for use in manufacturing
  • Perform the related transactions for the stocking of material
  • Break down, clean, organize, and prep for manufacturing in accordance with procedure and warehouse requirements
  • Assist with a broad range of warehouse tasks, utilizing forklifts, pallet movers, dollies, and carts. Transport materials to and from production and warehouse areas. 
  • Assist with loading and unloading trucks. Assist Operators with various material handling duties. Repackaging of materials.
  • Understands and applies FIFO principles

title: Jr. Mechanical Engineer
description:
Samuel, Son & Co. is growing! If you're looking for a rewarding career opportunity with a family run, industry leading organization, bring your experience and motivated attitude to Samuel, Son & Co.

Due to our continued success, we are seeking a Jr. Mechanical Engineer in Vaughan, ON. 

Here are some of what we have to offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Paid vacation and an annual bonus
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Pension plan with company match
  • Opportunity for fast advancement and career growth 

Samuel Packaging Systems Group – Equipment Division, a leading manufacturer of automated strapping machinery and material handling equipment, is looking for a Mechanical Designer to join our team, beginning with a position at our Vaughan facility.

RESPONSIBILITES (include but not limited to):

  • Work alone or with the engineering team to develop new machines and material handling equipment.
  • Design hydraulics and pneumatics systems.
  • Selection of mechanical components such as actuators, motors, fasteners, bearings, etc...
  • Design and detail mechanical components and assemblies for manufacturing purposes.
  • Create assemblies, designs, BOMs, etc. using SolidWorks and/or AutoCAD.

The qualified candidate will possess the following skills and experience:

  • Knowledge of engineering principles, practices and procedures.
  • An understanding of manufacturing and machining processes.
  • Able to perform and work both independently and as part of a team.
  • Ability to create designs and details using SolidWorks and AutoCAD 2D.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication.
  • Experience in the material handling industry.
  • Demonstrated ability to write organized engineering documents.
  • Experience with weldments and sheet metal design.

title: Production Assembler
description:
Working in production, you will be part of the manufacturing group that assembles our products. 

Responsibilities:

  • Printed circuit board, chassis and cable assembly
  • Read assembly drawings
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications:

  • Experience with electronic components in an electronic manufacturing environment would be an asset
  • Hand soldering experience would be an asset
  • Strong attention to detail is required
  • High School Diploma

What we offer:

  • Employer funded benefits program
  • Competitive total compensation package
  • Work-life balance
  • Employee Assistance plan
  • Employee Discount Platform
  • Career progression
  • Casual work environment
  • Social events and sports teams

About Us:

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery.

Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertzâ€™ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers.

With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.

Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

Thank you for considering a career with Evertz!

title: Machine Operator Hamilton
description:
This is a leading and long-standing industrial manufacturer based in Hamilton with a stable ledger of long-term customers. We are looking to expand in order to keep up with a growing market. Subsequently, we require the services of a Machine Operator with some experience in a manufacturing environment.  

The right candidate will be trained to set up and operate trimming machines to reduce brushes to the final required diameter.  

We have both a full-time day shift and a full-time afternoon shift open. We can additionally adjust this to suit a co-op position and summer employment. 

The successful applicant will have the following responsibilities:

  • Operate equipment to trim wheels, sections, sectional assemblies, and helically wound brushes to a specified diameter. Required to make all necessary adjustments, while exercising a thorough knowledge of machine capabilities and limitations in order to achieve results as specified on the job work order.
  • Using required lifting devices to load brushes onto appropriate drive mandrels.  
  • Leads the completion of production work orders.
  • Appropriately marks, packs, labels, and secures certain wheels, sections, sectional assemblies, and helically wound brushes in cardboard cartons or wood boxes. 
  • Removes dull/used trimming tooling.
  • Keeps the work area clean and organized and lubricates machinery.
  • Work autonomously in an environment where safety is a priority 
  • Maintain a high level of energy and commitment


Your Qualifications and Capabilities:

  • High school education
  • Attention to detail and ability to understand and follow written and verbal instructions, including those of a production work order. 
  • Ability to lift up to 75 pounds.
  • Understands and executes activities necessary to provide consistent and accurate output, satisfying the needs of QMS, customers and other interested parties. 
  • Must be alert and observant to details during setup and operation of machinery.
  • Must be able to operate various power hand tools.
  • Reliable and conscientious work ethic. 
  • Good communication skills (verbal and written)
  • A strong drive to succeed, self-motivated, and able to promote a safety-conscious environment.

Additional Information

  • Permanent, full-time employment
  • Day-shift hours are from 7:00 am – 3:30 pm, Afternoon shift is 4 pm to 12:30 am.
  • $18.00 to start- review after 3 months, additional shift premium for the afternoon shift.
  • Benefits after 3 months probation.

If you have what it takes to be a successful addition to our team, we want to hear from you!

title: Production Engineer
description:
Reports to:                Director of Operations
Position Type:           Full-time, Permanent

Summary:

As a Production Engineer, you are responsible for the transfer of new products from development to Production. You will work with the Production team to troubleshoot technical issues through the production process and review technical changes with the Engineering team. 

Responsibilities:

  • Assisting in the transfer of designed products to manufacturing
  • Review production procedures and update for accuracy and improved efficiency
  • Complete first article inspection for new components and provide feedback to Engineering
  • Initiate engineering change orders and update designs for Engineering approval
  • Work with Production Technicians to troubleshoot component failures
  • Continuously improving our products/process through time and cost reduction
  • Other duties assigned

Qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree or post-secondary diploma in Electronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Electrical Technology required;
  • 3 years of experience with high frequency/RF testing preferred;
  • Experience with production systems, including MRP and ECOs;
  • Exposure to:
    • ISO 90001 manufacturing standards
    • production documentation
    • mechanical and electrical assemblies
    • electrical components
    • ESD control
  • Understanding and experience in Lean Manufacturing an asset

Security Screening Requirement:

Norsat is a secure facility; thus, all employment is contingent upon the selected candidate’s successful clearance from federal security screenings, including Criminal Record Check.


No recruiters please.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Production Worker
description:
COMPANY BACKGROUND

Tree Island Steel Ltd.  (â€œTree Island Steelâ€ or the â€œCompanyâ€) is a publicly listed company whose shares are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol TSL.  Headquartered in Richmond, British Columbia, since 1964, Tree Island Steel, through its four operating facilities in Canada and the United States, produces wire products for a diverse range of industrial, residential construction, commercial construction, agricultural, and specialty applications. Its products include bright wire; a broad array of fasteners, including packaged, collated and bulk nails; stucco reinforcing products; concrete reinforcing mesh; fencing and other fabricated wire products. The Company markets these products under the Tree IslandÂ®, HalsteelÂ®, True-SpecÂ®, K-LathÂ®, TI-WireÂ® and Tough StrandÂ® brand names. Tree Island Steel operates in Canada under Tree Island Industries Ltd and in the United States under Tree Island Wire (USA) Inc.

 

POSITION SUMMARY
General Helpers may be required to move up and down stairs, bend, lift, carry items and pull wire. As a Machine Operator they are responsible for providing verification of the quality of the product being produced. General Helpers are required to work the shift rotation associated with the area where they are working.

Shift work is required, including days, afternoons, and nights. Weekends may be required as part of the shift rotation.

The work is physical, and is done in a heavy duty industrial manufacturing setting. Fitness and safety awareness is a must.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Operation of a forklift,
  • Production department housekeeping -- sweeping, machine cleaning, shoveling, painting, vacuuming, etc.
  • Warehouse work -- lifting up to 50 lbs.; moving up and down stairs, bending, lifting, and carrying items.
  • Assisting machine operators at a machine (lifting / moving product).
  • Previous lift truck experience a must, in a lift truck over 8k capacity.
  • Will also be required to operate Overhead Crane.
  • Experience using metal strapping and tools.
  • Must be able to take direction from Machine Operator and work independently.
  • Must be able to work 24/7 shifts.

 

PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS 

  • Previous manufacturing experience in an industrial environment,
  • Ability to speak, read and write English, and
  • Must have steel-toed safety boots with non-slip sole.


General Helpers must have their own transportation to and from work to reliably attend work for all shifts. The position rate of pay is $19.73, and includes benefits. The position may also receive shift premiums. Shift work is required.

We thank all applicants, however, please note only short listed candidates will be contacted. No agencies please.

title: Heat Treat/Metallurgical Inspector
description:
Schaeffler Aerospace Canada , is seeking a Heat Treat/Metallurgical Inspector to support our Stratford, Ontario location. The position will support the production/heat treat operations.

Duties and Responsibilities include:

  • Inspect a variety of parts and/or purchased material dimensionally and/or visually to prescribed quality standards and practices.
  • Use Quality Control sampling tables, production blueprints, and other written instructions necessary to perform assigned task.
  • Perform heat treat inspection.
  • Perform inspection operations requiring judgment and/or interpretation.
  • Conduct setups or adjustments on certain standard gages or equipment.
  • Record routine data and count parts as directed.
  • Maintain good housekeeping in immediate area.
  • Perform other comparable or related duties as assigned.
Qualified candidates will have:
  • High school diploma or equivalent required
  • 2 - 3 year post secondary education in Metallurgy or Mechanical Engineering Technology preferred
  • Minimum of two years in manufacturing environment
  • Be proficient in a use of a variety of basic gages, such as: mechanical, pneumatic, optical, and electrical.
  • Be proficient in, and be required, to perform several different operations requiring skill and judgment to take inspection from start to finish
  • Exposure to heat and acid fumes scrap potential is high
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to read blueprints
  • Maintain good housekeeping in all areas

Schaeffler is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

title: Steel Finisher / Grinder
description:
No experience required! Start at up to $23.25 per hour on the night shift! Brannon Steel is looking for full-time, permanent, entry-level production workers to clean steel parts at its Brampton manufacturing location. Day Shift (7am-3pm, $19.25/hr to start), afternoon shift (3pm-11pm, up to $21.25/hr to start) and night shift (11pm-7am, up to $23.25/hr to start) available.

Responsibilities

  • Use hand and power tools to clean steel parts.
  • Read part drawings and production documents.
  • Handle steel parts manually.
  • Check finished parts against specifications.
  • Perform and document quality inspections.
  • Document work completed.
  • Read, write and speak English at a basic level.
  • Count large quantities.
  • Perform basic math.
  • Follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Lift up to 23 kilograms (50 pounds).
  • Standing and repetitive work.
  • Construction, landscaping, manufacturing, or other heavy general labour experience is preferred.
  • Able to work a day shift (Mon-Fri, 7am-3pm) or afternoon shift (Mon-Fri, 3pm-11pm) or night shift (Sun-Thurs, 11pm-7am).
  • Service award program including travel vouchers for $3,000, $5,000, and $10,000 for 10, 20, and 30 years of service.
  • Group RRSP program with contribution matching up to 5% of regular annual earnings.
  • Shift premiums up to $4 per hour on nights and $2 per hour on afternoons.
  • Overtime after 40 hours per week.
  • Full-time, permanent work at a stable, family-owned company.
  • Company-supplied tools and equipment, uniforms, safety boots, and prescription safety glasses.
  • Extended health coverage including prescriptions, paramedical expenses, and emergency travel assistance.
  • Dental coverage including preventive, diagnostic, and treatment services.
  • Short and long-term disability insurance.
  • Life and AD&D insurance.
  • Free employee assistance program.
  • Opportunities to learn and advance.
  • A friendly work environment where people support each other.
  • Comprehensive COVID-19 safety protocols in place.
  • Summer barbeques, annual golf tournament, and more!

title: Press Supervisor
description:
C-P Flexible Packaging is a successful and fast-growing essential manufacturing company that uses an impressive array of digital pre-press and wide-web flexographic printing capabilities and extrusion and adhesive laminators to produce creative flexible packaging solutions for our customers. With a primary focus on serving the food industry, C-P specializes in roll stock, pouches, re-sealable packaging and shrink sleeves. With 10 current locations across North America and growing, C-P Flexible Packaging is one of the top 25 flexible packaging companies in the U.S..

We are looking for a Press Supervisor to join our Team in Aurora, Ontario.

Job Summary:

This is a supervisory position, responsible for the management of C-P Flexible Packaging’s manufacturing shifts in the Press Department.

 

Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities: (includes, but not limited to)

  • Oversee and direct all activities of the personnel assigned to their shift by walking the production floor consistently throughout the shift
  • Ensure achievement of quality, production, productivity and safety goals for department
  • Maintain the accuracy and documentation of production reporting
  • Assist the Scheduling Department in defining and maintaining work flow through the department
  • Ensure adequate supply of materials for your shift’s operation
  • Oversee department manning requirements including vacation planning and coverage
  • Oversee employee training
  • Other duties as assigned by Management
  • Approve colour and quality of all jobs

 

Supervisory Responsibilities:

  • Direct supervision of personnel on your shift
  • Conduct employee evaluations
  • Oversee disciplinary action, as require
  • Oversee vacation coverage planning
  • Direct staff personal development and training

 

Qualifications:

  • Previous manufacturing supervision desired, or extensive knowledge of the printing process
    • Knowledge of flexographic/web handling and converting processes including printing, lamination (adhesive and extrusion) and slitting processes required
  • Strong knowledge of colour cert systems and spectro photometers
  • Ability to colour match both solvent and waterbase ink systems
  • Strong PC skills including experience with MS Office required
  • Excellent written/oral communication skills & strong presentation skills
  • Excellent organizational/time-management skills
  • Ability to define/solve problems with many variables and limited information

 

Physical Demands:

  • Lifting up to 50 lbs.
  • Ability to work 12-hour continental, rotating shifts

Working Conditions:

  • Infrequent travel may be required for maintaining certifications, seminars, training sessions, vendor site visits, etc.
  • Exposure to chemicals (inks, solvents), moving mechanical parts, extended noise, etc. may require the use of personal protective equipment; ear-plugs, safety glasses, gloves, etc.
  • Position may require interaction with customers for production checks, and suppliers/vendors



In addition to the other advantages of working for CP, we're offering premium pay on top of a very competitive base pay, and bonus opportunities.


Benefits

  • Employer paid medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage
  • Pension plan with generous company match
  • Bonus program
  • Paid vacation and personal days
  • Paid holidays
  • Life and AD&D insurance
  • Company paid short-term disability coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

title: General Production Labour- Packer (Afternoon & Morning Shift)
description:
ACE Bakery, Scarborough/Ontario  
WAGE: $17.00 / hour  
SHIFT: 6:00am- 2:00pm and 2:30pm - 10:30pm availability required for both shifts (flexibility with working overtime, and on weekends, as necessary) 

We are a premier North American bakery company and we’ve been in business for 135 years. Our team is passionate about baking the foods your family and friends love to eat, including breads and rolls, donuts, pies, cakes, cookies and more!  

Weston Foods proudly serves communities through our ~35 bakeries across North America, and every day, our team strives to elevate moments for our customers and your loved ones by producing high quality baked goods. 

Our bakery team is the heart of our company and plays an important role in keeping North America’s food supply going. Our Packers and General labourers are an integral part of the baking process, ensuring our delicious baked goods are packaged, and safely end up on grocery store shelves and at your favorite restaurants across North America. 

We are not just a job, we are an extended family, committed to elevating everyday moments and feeding communities and families across the country. Join us and find fulfillment and purpose in your work. 

 

In a typical day, you’ll: 

  • Pick, pack, sort, and package fresh products into bags and boxes 

  • Work in production/packaging area to make and stack boxes onto pallets  

  • Inspect filled packages to ensure product is packaged according to specifications. 

  • Work closely with production team members to ensure product quality  

  • Assist machine operators/mixers/oven captains and crew with other duties as assigned.  

  • May assist sanitation crew in the cleanliness of production equipment and area   

  • Ensure all Food Safety and Health & Safety policies and procedures are followed   

About You: 

  • A lover of bread and baked goods! 

  • You have strong people skills—you’re approachable, a good listener, and empathetic  

  • You have previously worked in a manufacturing environment (even better if it was food manufacturing!) 

  • You’re dedicated to the health and safety of yourself and your colleagues  

  • You digest constructive feedback as an opportunity to listen, and improve your skills, abilities, and performance 

  • You are someone who listens to comprehend a situation first, asking questions to clarify your own understanding, instead of listening to be able to reply quickly 

 

We offer a competitive benefits package for full-time employees, including strong benefit and pension plans, paid vacation and holidays, overtime opportunities, and a growth path to line leader and supervisory roles. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity and love baked goods, we invite you to apply! 

Weston is committed to fostering a work environment with strong core values that support diversity through various policies, programs and activities that encourage sensitivity and accommodations. Weston offers employment regardless of race, colour, gender, national origin, religion, age, disability, or sexual orientation. Diversity is integral to our success as an organization and we will use diversity as a model to help identify and develop the best talent, create effective teams, and achieve overall excellence. 

Weston Foods is an equal opportunity employer. M/F Disabled and Vet EEO/AA Employer

title: Material Handler
description:
Group Description

 

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

 

 

Role Summary

The Material Handler is responsible for the movement of all Materials items as required to ensure the efficient flow of production through the use of various lifting equipment, manual application and completing all paperwork as required including pre-shift equipment inspection forms. 

Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for the coordinated movement of containers to and from locations within plant (trucks, machines, outside storage) as well as ensuring load / containers etc. are balanced and secure before moving:
    • Movement of all containers to various locations inside and outside the plant
    • All scrap removal from machines
    • All cardboard movement to and from machines
    • Movement of totes through decanting to and from work cells to support in process inventory
  • Accurately completes all paperwork as required including Pre Shift Equipment Inspection forms
  • Support maintenance of inventory through identifying, verifying, labelling and placing material. 
  • Ensure accuracy of inventory through use of RF Gun
  • Pick, wrap and stage orders to be shipped
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed

Key Qualifications/Requirements

  • High school/GED or equivalent with previous experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Background in manufacturing with experience in quality and safety initiatives
  • Must hold a valid counter-balance forklift certificate
  • 1 year related experience
  • Dealing with Complexity, Deadline-Oriented
  • Physically capable of performing essential duties of the job
  • Working knowledge of the English language both written and oral.

Core Competencies

  • Must follow and enforce C-TPAT internal processes
  • Demonstrates clear and respectful communication skills in all situations.
  • Understands the key processes and systems within the organization related to their work flow ensuring work flow is conducted efficiently while consistently seeking ways to improve outcomes and enhance results
  • Must be able to be capable of assuming duties as backup shipper when required
  • Demonstrates enthusiasm for and commitment to the position and accepts responsibility for personal actions.

Physical Demands

  • Works under general supervision of Production Supervisor or Designee.
  • Required to carry out routine, repetitive tasks such as reaching, pushing, pulling, standing, walking, lifting, packing, stacking and bending, must be capable of lifting 25 – 30lbs repetitively. Lifting may be required up to 50 lbs with assistance.
  • Regular exposure to noise/temperature and/or adverse weather conditions, depending upon season.
  • Regular exposure tolubricants and vibration.
  • Works rotating shift with occasional overtime if Customer requirements.
  • Wears all PPE including company provided uniforms.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

13--Materials Management F--Permanent/Regular

title: Shipper/Receiver Night Shift $24.50/hr
description:
Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

Role Summary

The Shipper/Receiver reports to the Shipping Supervisor and is responsible for verifying incoming goods against packing slips and purchase orders and is responsible for shipping customer requirements accurately as per pick list. The Shipper/Receiver is responsible for ensuring that parts are shipped to proper location via the shunt trucks.  They are responsible to ensure that the JIT truck is loaded with the correct parts and packaging as per the plating turn schedule. They are responsible to keep the trucks on schedule.  The Shipper/Receiver is responsible for housekeeping & organizing the plant/shipping area.

This is a night shift position working on a very small team in our warehouse. Pay is on a progressive scale and will increase with experience.

Key Responsibilities

•    Maintain all shipping records in conjunction with the office staff including the preparation of shipping papers for customers, and the files for outgoing materials and products.  Prepares and scans bar coded labels for outgoing finished products. 
•    Unload and load shunting truck moving from Frontenac to Centre and milk runs going from Frontenac to subcontractors. 
•    Perform accurate scanning to all locations for inventory movement.
•    Perform accurate scanning of all customer shipments, and prepare shipping paperwork. 
•    Complete daily aisle/rack/location audits. 
•    Complete daily pre-shipment verifications. 
•    Ensure all shipments meet customer shipping specifications. 
•    Stage components to be shipped to Centre St. using Min/Max sheet. 
•    Unload and sign for received goods.  Check incoming goods against packing slips and or Purchase Order and report of any shortages. 
•    Enter received packing slips into Trans4M and forward copy to accounting.  Log items received in the shipping /receiving database. 
•    Responsible for moving incoming raw material to designated and/ or required area.  Ensure proper storage and flow of material, for work in process and finished products as per schedule and/ or customer demand. 
•    Generate, send, and monitor advanced shipment notifications (ASN’s). 
•    Generate and send NAFTA documents for required shipments. 
•    Book GM shipments online. 
•    Book Tesla shipments online via the Tesla Portal. 
•    Book Schneider shipments via the Schneider Portal. 
•    Operate forklift to move materials from one area to another within the Shipping Department, in a safe and efficient manner. 
•    Conduct forklift and dock inspections. 
•    Keep storage areas in a neat, clean, and safe manner.  Cooperate with Safety Committee and adhere to all safety rules and policies including working in a safe manner and wearing all Personal Protective Equipment. 
•    Contact carriers for pick-ups. 
•    Ensure that stock is consumed and finished goods are shipped on a “FIFO” basis. 
•    Complete aisle and location audits 
•    Complete pre-shipment verifications. 
•    When products are received from the supplier, the quantities must be verified as per the prescribed frequency (Coils – 100%, Extrusions – 20%, Resins – 100%, Others – 10%).  
•    All received products must be immediately scanned (no manual entries) into RST inventory system. 
•    Responsible for the flow of returnable packaging between Centre and Frontenac. 
•    Comply with all Rollstamp Health and Safety policies and procedures. 
•    Comply with all Rollstamp IATF 16949 policies and procedures. 
•    Comply with all Rollstamp ISO14001 policies and procedures. 
•    Perform any other reasonable request by management. 
 

Key Qualifications/Requirements

•    Grade 12 education or equivalent with good mathematical aptitude
•    Minimum 2 years manufacturing or production shipping/receiving experience, preferably in an automotive environment.
•    Working knowledge of MS Office.  
•    Strong skills in Trans4M required.
•    Knowledge of Tesla Portal for online booking and labelling preferred. 
•    Forklift license is required. Counterbalance and Reach preferred.      
•    Must be able to stand or walk for up to 8 hours, must be able to lift and move boxes weighing up to 25 kgs.    
•    Good verbal and written English communication skills                 
•    Good organizational and interpersonal skills 
•    Must be able to differentiate between all products produced
•    IATF 16949, ISO 14001 and CTPAT management awareness
 

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: Production Machine Operator (FT Rotating 24/7 Shift-work)
description:
The primary role of the Production Machine Operator, position is to safely and efficiently operate the dryer in order to process, dry, and package dairy products required for the manufacture of safe and high-quality food products. The Production Machine Operator is a member of the Vitalus team and as such, participates in team efforts to achieve department goals, and provides support to other roles within the dairy operations as required.

This position is a shift-work position (days/graveyards/afternoons), including: weekends and holiday rotations in a 24/7 operation.

JOB LOCATION: 3911 Mt. Lehman Road, Abbotsford, BC

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Production
  • Quality Assurance
  • Safety & Enviroment
  • Continuous Improvement

COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills, Ability)

  • Experience working with machinery, preferably within food processing/manufacturing;
  • Able to understand and follow detailed instructions (solid English language skills);
  • Able to lift 25kg several times a day;
  • Have operated manual, power pallet jacks, and/or forklifts;
  • Results oriented;
  • Contributes to achieving team goals;
  • Solid work ethic;
  • Willing to work shift work;
  • Someone with safe work record – you care about keeping yourself and co-workers safe;
  • Able to work independently without ongoing directions.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • High school diploma and minimum 1 years' experience in a manufacturing environment related to food or a similar industry. Dryer operation and/or dairy plant experience an asset.
  • Experience with HACCP or other quality systems an asset.
  • Experience in operating manual and power pallet jacks and forklifts.
  • Mechanical aptitude.
  • Fluent English (verbal and written communication skills) with the ability to follow and give clear instructions.
  • Highly detail oriented.
  • Able to lift 25 kg (55 lbs.)
  • Capability to work independently without constant supervision.
  • Basic proficiency in MS Word, MS Outlook, and spreadsheet/database (MS Excel).

title: Machine Operator
description:
Position Summary: 

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the Machine Operator is responsible for operating the soft capsule machines to manufacture soft gel capsules and for utilizing the printing machines to print soft gel capsules. As a result of properly following the relevant SOP’s, the incumbent will also monitor and maintain the quality of capsules produced. 

Pay: $23.36/per hour

The Role:

Roles and Responsibilities: 

Encapsulation activities: 

  • Confer with operator from previous shift - during shift change, regarding necessary facts and current events related to the daily operation of the soft capsule machine. 

  • Operate encapsulation machines and complete all documentation involving encapsulation operation in accordance to manufacturing directions (Encapsulation Master) and standard operating procedures. 

  • Spread capsules on trays; stack trays, label, and transfer the stacks to the assigned drying tunnel. 

  • Check caps, for quality, weight, proper seams, and dimensions if required and record findings. 

  • Maintain all necessary operating records. 

  • Confirm all gelatin and fill tanks for temperature, colour, batch number, and receiver sequences for the order.  Ensure that there is back up for all gel and fill tanks. 

  • Trouble shooting, correcting problems, repairs or issuing repair orders on soft capsule machines and related equipment. 

  • Perform changeover activities as required 

  • Ensure proper housekeeping including cleaning machines, floors, tumblers, handling scrap net and garbage’s. 

  • Ensure all setups are ready for use for the incoming shift, change and clean machine parts as required (depending on type of changeover). 

Capsule Printing Activities: 

  • Operate printing machines and complete all documentation involving printing operation in accordance to manufacturing directions (Print Master) and standard operating procedures. 

  • Check capsules for quality and record results. 

  • Trouble shoot, corrects problem, repair or issue repair requests on printing machines and related equipment as required. 

  • Maintain materials/supplies as required for printing. 

  • Maintain accurate inventory of design rolls, printing links, and ink. 

  • Ensure proper housekeeping including cleaning printing machines, floors, handling and reporting of scrap, and completion of necessary information in the equipment log books. 

Common Duties: 

  • Comply with all SOP’s and GMP’s. 

  • May be asked to work extended hours (overtime), especially when problems occur or when deadlines must be met. 

  • Assist with training of employees 

  • Participate in cGMP Self Inspection Audits as required. 

  • Perform other duties as required 

The Candidate:

 

Education: 

  • High School Diploma or equivalent 

Experience: 

  • 1-3 years of experience in a manufacturing, pharmaceutical and/or GMP facility. 

Skills Required: 

  • Strong mathematical skills in order to compute simple calculations (adding, subtracting, multiplication, division, percent and averages). 

  • Ability to stand for long periods of time. 

  • Possess a high degree of attention to detail and accuracy. 

  • Good communication (written and verbal), and interpersonal skills. 

  • Knowledge of automation systems an asset. 

Working Conditions:

12 Hour Continental Shifts (days and nights)

Catalent. More products. Better treatments. Reliably supplied. ™
Visit www.catalent.com/careers to apply online and explore career opportunities.

Catalent is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin or disability. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodation for interviews or other meetings, please advise Human Resources as soon as possible.

Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career!  Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference. 

Catalent is committed to the health and safety of its employees, visitors and the customers and patients we serve. As a result of the global pandemic, we have modified many of our recruitment and on-boarding processes to maintain everyone’s safety. The Human Resources teams will communicate all necessary safety processes and procedures throughout each stage.

   

personal initiative. dynamic pace. meaningful work.

Visit Catalent Careers to explore career opportunities.

Catalent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate based on any characteristic protected by local law.

If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your request by sending an email, and confirming your request for an accommodation and include the job number, title and location to DisabilityAccommodations@catalent.com. This option is reserved for individuals who require accommodation due to a disability. Information received will be processed by a U.S. Catalent employee and then routed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure appropriate consideration in the application or hiring process.

No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

description:

title: Grinder/Parts Associate
description:
Position Purpose:
This position will assist in all aspects of the grinding process which includes gauging, marking, cutting, sanding and drilling of the components per applicable standard procedures and work instructions including other duties as required. This job is for a reliable, hard working individual that has a high level of attention to detail, excellent hand eye coordination with the ability to work independently and efficiently while being focused on Safety and Continuous improvement aspects. 
 
Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Working in a safe manner and following all safety rules.
  • Ability to wear full face Respirator while performing work tasks.
  • Collect parts and required trimming jigs from storage location / racks and place on workstation for processing.
  • Inspect parts to ensure part meets required specifications to process. Utilizing jigs and go/no-go gauges, mark off the part with required scribe lines and drilling requirements.
  • Utilizing pneumatic tools, cut, sand, drill the part to designated scribe lines, part thickness or other designations on the part.
  • Transport completed parts to the next work station or holding area.
  • Ensure the flow of work orders is maintained as directed by following schedule and proper staging of jobs.
  • Complete assigned work within given timeframe and according to specifications.
  • Keep all work areas including part storage area clean and organized, emptying scrap and garbage containers as necessary.
  • Cleaning and maintaining work tools such as grinders, cutting wheels and go/no-gauges.
  • Cleaning and maintaining safety equipment such as respirators and dust masks.
  • Maintain all quality standards in accordance with the specifications for each job in order to meet customer requirements.
  • Performs additional duties as deemed necessary.
  • Takes initiative and is a self-starter.
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple duties/projects at one time, work independently with minimal supervision, and resolve conflict in a professional manner.
  • Maintains open communication and a team-oriented work environment with all departments and all levels of personnel.
  • Demonstrates flexibility and professionalism throughout the day.
  • Adhere to all start / end times including break and lunch schedules.
  • Willingness to work in other areas of the facility as required.

Qualifications/Experience/Required Skills:
  • Preferred: High school diploma or GED from an accredited school system or program.
  • Preferred: 6 months of related experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
  • Possess knowledge of and ability to identify and work with FRP components and machining tools / equipment.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Comfortable with repetitive tasks.
  • Position requires physical requirements including lifting, pushing/pulling, lifting, bending/stretching and standing.

BENEFITS:
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • RRSP match

COVID-19 considerations:
  • Eastside ensures all protocols are followed for the safety of our employees, their families and our customers. 
  • Personal protective equipment provided or required.
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place.
  • Social distancing guidelines in place.




    About Eastside Industrial Coatings and Composites :

    Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fibreglass and metal components for local OEMs.As the coatings business continued to grow with a focus on “A” Finish coatings, Eastside Industrial moved to a larger location (our current space), committed to diversifying into composites manufacturing and expanding our customer base throughout the continent.Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.We remain a family owned business focused on growing our team and developing our team to have a successful future with Eastside or a member of the Eastside Group.

title: Plant Operator Technician
description:
Job Description

Job Title: Plant Technician/Quality Control Unit Member

Summary: Operates N2O plant including start up and shut down; performs lab tests and some maintenance work. As Quality Control Unit member you ensures that GMP requirements are adhered to for manufactured and distributed medical gas products and reports to the Quality Control Unit Designee.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Operates plant equipment in accordance with established operating procedures and good manufacturing practices.
  • Performs preventive maintenance in accordance with established guidelines.
  • Repairs equipment throughout the facility.
  • Documents maintenance performed and maintains machinery history files.
  • Monitors instruments during plant operation. Maintains proper logs and records related plant operations.
  • Loads trucks with product for shipping.
  • Replaces chemicals in towers.
  • Analyses and tests product using analytical instruments including gas chromatograph and detector tubes.
  • Participates in Quality Improvement Process.
  • Interacts with internal and external customers; continuously strives to increase customer satisfaction.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.
  • As Quality Control Unit member the associate is charged with the responsibility and authority to approve or reject all components of N2O production. They are responsible to review production records to assure no errors have occurred. QCU members must review the Nitrous Oxide Drug Manual on an annual basis. Quality Control Unit members may be designated by the QCU Designee to perform certain tasks.

Requirement

  • Required to hold a valid Compressor Ticket issued by TSSA.


Qualifications

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

We will accommodatethe needs of applicants under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with DisabilitiesAct (AODA) throughout all stages of the recruitment and selections process. Applicants are required to provide their accommodationneeds in advance and submit adequate documentation to support their request for accommodation in the assessment process and/or to perform the essential duties of the posted position. Please advise the Human Resources Department to ensure your accessibilityneeds are accommodated throughout this process.
skills: ['Performs preventive maintenance in accordance with established guidelines.', 'Monitors instruments during plant operation. Maintains proper logs and records related plant operations.', 'Required to hold a valid Compressor Ticket issued by TSSA.', 'Performs other related duties as assigned.']

title: Shipping, Receiving & Logistics Coordinator
description:
WE ARE HIRING!

Omega Tool Corp is the global leader in the engineering and manufacturing of plastics tooling. We offer solutions for complex tooling and plastic part challenges to world-class OEM and Tier 1 clients for over 40 years. As we continue to expand our footprint, we are recruiting top talent to join our team.

Shipping, Receiving & Logistics Coorindator

This Shipping/Receiving & Logistics Coordinator is responsible for ensuring seamless processing of outgoing and incoming shipments. Inventory management and vendor relations with suppliers are essential functions for this position. This individual will comply with provincial and federal legislation, company health and safety policies and ISO quality program and procedures.

Job Details:

  • Full-time, day shift, Monday-Friday (7:00 A.M.- 4:00P.M.)
  • Total comprehensive benefit and pension package
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Signing Bonus

Qualifications:

  • Completion of secondary school and or GED
  • At least 1-2 yearsâ€™ work experience in a Manufacturing setting with a background in shipping, receiving and logistics
  • Proficient in computers with the ability to use various computer applications such as Microsoft Office, Master Planner, Visual, ERP etc.
  • Knowledge of arithmetic, with the ability to weigh and measure items accurately
  • Working knowledge of safe packing methods
  • The ability to communicate, read and understand information and ideas presented both verbally and written
  • Capable of forecasting, recognizing and solving problems
  • Time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks
  • Ability to adapt and welcome change in a positive manner
  • Capable of operating heavy equipment such as a forklift and crane

How to Apply:

Interested candidates are encouraged to submit a resume via our career page.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are contacted by Omega Tool Corp. regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if you require accommodation. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
