title: Order Picker - Afternoon Shift (FT)
description:
Order Selector
Our client is looking for help in their expanding NE warehouse, picking and shipping orders to their corporate clients. This is a permanent opportunity- they are looking for reliable and dedicated associates who are looking to prove themselves and build a career!

Responsibilities:
  • ​Operate the pallet jack and the RF Scanner
  • Picking orders of auto parts and preparing for shipment
  • Use of a computer to prepare packing slips, create labels, and deal with invoices
  • General warehouse activities

​Qualifications and Requirements:
  • ​Previous warehouse experience is beneficial, but not required
  • Pallet jack and RF scanner experience an asset
  • Good attention to detail
  • Physically capable of lifting 20 - 30 lbs. repeatedly
  • Must have steel-toed boots

What is Offered:
  • Full-time and permanent, Monday - Friday shift of 2:00PM - 11:30PM in North East Calgary 
  • Free parking
  • Wage increases after 3 months
  • Benefits package after 6 months as well as Pension Plan with employer contribution
  • Staff discount after 6 months

If you are looking for a great company where you can build a career, come join our team and apply now!




    About Equation Staffing Solutions.:

    Equation Staffing Solutions is a successful, award-winning Calgary based staffing and recruitment agency specializing in the placement of candidates on a temporary, contract or permanent basis. The industries we serve include oil and gas, warehousing & transportation, finance & accounting, banking, health care, educational institutions, engineering & technology, manufacturing, construction, agriculture and all levels of government. The job families we place people in comprise of general office & admin support, human resources, customer support, warehousing, trades, machine operators, production, accounting, records management, business management & information management.

title: Quality Coordinator
description:
The Role

The Quality Coordinator supports the Alberta manufacturing and QA team.


What You Will Do

  • Ensures that the QMS complies with ISO 9001:2015 Standard and ISO/IEC 80079-34. Reviewing the quality program regularly with the goal of continually improving its effectiveness and enhancing customer satisfaction by meeting customer requirements
  • Assists with the Management Review on the QMS for effectiveness, continuing suitability, addressing risk and need for continual improvement.
  • Responsible for liaising between the company and all Certification and/or Notified Bodies with respect to all Ex products manufactured in Edmonton and support external audits.
  • Maintaining an effective internal quality audit containing elements of the QMS pertaining to ABSA, ISO/IEC/CE (ATEX) & examines the quality system annually.
  • Overseeing documents & records and ensuring control is maintained. Including corrective actions and non-conforming records are maintained. Ensuring compliance with current regulations.
  • Developing internal auditing tools and conducting internal audits and reports.
  • Determining data-driven solutions and implementing quality improvement plans.
  • Assisting with the development of company policies, processes, and procedures.
  • Conducting or assisting with regulatory and quality training sessions.
  • Approve Certificates of Conformities for applicable products.

Knowledge & Qualifications/What You Bring To This Role

  • At least 2+ years of comparable experience in a manufacturing environment with experience working in Quality Control or Assurance.
  • Certificate in Quality Management as asset.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and quality management systems.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and public speaking skills.
  • Excellent decision-making and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong organizational skills.

title: QC Inspector (FT) - Night Shift
description:
Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is looking to hire a Night shift QC Inspector.

Important: Apply in PDF formatting. Also, no phone calls or drop-ins due to COVID.

Job Description:
  • Hours: Mon-Thurs ; 3:15pm-1:45am

Company Description:
  • Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is a locally owned manufacturing and distribution company operating out of Edmonton, Alberta since 1966.
  • We manufacture and distribute products for oilfield production, pipeline maintenance, construction, and gas, and water distribution.
  • We have an in-house engineering department and a full-service manufacturing facility that enables us to respond efficiently to the customer and industry needs.

Job Duties/Responsibilities:
  • Inspect orders
  • NCR, CAR, & PAR
  • Scan MTR's
  • Verify traceability
  • Monitor calibration for all measurement devices
  • Check calibration
  • Apply lean principles to the manufacturing process to increase quality and reduce waste.
  • Adhere to the Quality Management program.
  • Adhere to the Safety program.

The above responsibilities are the basic expectations, any actions above and beyond will be looked at favorably at review time.
Secondary Responsibilities:
  • Miscellaneous tasks as requested by supervisor or manager.

Skills/Experience Requirements:
  • QC training/QC experience
  • Good communication
  • Recordkeeping/management
  • Troubleshooting and corrective action (5 whys, root cause analysis, DMAIC, etc.)
  • Quality at the source
  • Intermediate ERP functions

Important: Apply in PDF formatting. Also, no phone calls or drop-ins due to COVID. **

title: Project Scheduler
description:
ABOUT US:

Since 1934, E.S. Fox Limited (ESFL) has set the standard for Safety and Quality Assurance. With over 3 million person-hours annually, we self-perform Structural, Mechanical, Electrical, Sheet Metal and Refrigeration services. E.S. Fox Nuclear Services have been providing fabrication and construction services to OPG and Bruce Power generating stations, along with their associated nuclear Waste Management facilities, for over 50 years. ESFL Nuclear Services aims to be the provider of choice. Our focus on Safety, Excellence, Continuous Learning & Improvement, Respect, Relationships and our Corporate Social Responsibility continues to keep us close to our clients.

ESFL Nuclear Services has offices in Oshawa and Kincardine along with on-site locations at the OPG and Bruce Power Nuclear Generating Stations. ESFL Nuclear Services provides a full spectrum of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services, in addition to maintenance and manufacturing services, fit to meet the growing requirements of the global nuclear power industry.

With over 800 weld procedures and 45 certifications that are audited by ISO, CSA, ASME, TSSA and CWB, ESFL continues to be a leader in the supply of quality nuclear fabrications for projects all over the world. As nuclear power generation evolves and transitions to Small Modular Reactors (SMRs), ESFL will retain the capability to provide design support for manufacturing, factory fabrication, shipping and logistical solutions, technical services and field construction.

With a strong commitment to health, safety and the protection of the environment, ESFL Nuclear Services has earned a reputation as a people-first, environmentally conscious and socially responsible nuclear services provider.

The Darlington project site is looking for an organized, results-oriented and professional Project Scheduler to join our Project Team.


SUMMARY OF THE ROLE:

The Project Scheduler is responsible for developing and maintaining the project schedule. They are responsible for recording and tracking contract and scope changes. The Project Scheduler will be responsible for supporting the Project Team with various project related activities throughout the project life cycle.



KEY CUSTOMERS SERVED:

  • Owner
  • Project Management Team
  • Construction Managers, Company Managers
  • Site Employees

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work with project management team, planners and estimators in developing project plans (cost, schedule, and risk, scope and change management plans)
  • Work with project management team in developing project's internal controls processes and procedures
  • Track and evaluate cost and schedule trends and variances and adjust forecasts as required
  • Manage and maintain project risk register
  • Conduct analysis and prepare progress reports on costs, schedule and risks
  • Support project close-out reporting and documentation activities as required

KNOWLEDGE AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor's Degree, Diploma, or related experience

SPECIFIC EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:

  • Minimum of 5 years scheduling mid to large size projects
  • Security cleared with Ontario Power Generation (OPG)
  • Analytical, able to work with database and prepare reports
  • Required knowledge of Primavera P6
  • Proven understanding of project management, engineering and construction processes preferred
  • Experience in cost and schedule development and monitoring practices and procedures preferred
  • Nuclear experience and Project Management Professional (PMP) credential considered an asset

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:

  • Strong interpersonal, communication, organization and analytical skills

E.S. Fox Limited is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. We will accommodate applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please advise Human Resources to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.

title: Electrical Control Panel Estimator
description:
Overview:

Exile Automation is a Control System Integration and Automation company located in Calgary, AB. We offer Control System Design, Manufacturing, and System Integration services specializing in Industrial Automation, Communication, and Power Systems. We offer our customers a line of standard and custom built control panels to suit Energy, Manufacturing, Process, Agriculture, Medical, Material Handling, and Food and Beverage Industries.  

 

Exile Automation provides an excellent working environment and believes strongly in cultivating an outstanding Team Culture. We proudly provide our clients with the highest quality products and services, and are looking for talented and customer minded people to join our team! We offer competitive wages and paid benefits.

The Electrical Control Panel Estimatorreports to the Lead Estimator and is responsible for the preparation of all Electrical estimates and bid packages including the material take offs, and overall budgets. The Electrical Estimator is also accountable for reviewing and presenting estimates internally with Senior Management and externally with clients.

Responsibilities:
  • Creating, Preparing, and Coordinating the preparation of full cost estimates for the Electrical Control Panels.
  • Review Estimates internally with Project Managers, Managers and externally with clientâ€™s.
  • Procure the materials to manage various electrical projects
  • Generate project budgets, manage change orders & close out projects when complete.
  • Reviewing specifications and design drawings to determine the total scope of work to be performed, material requirements and associated costs to be included in the final estimate price
  • Examining and analyzing estimate packages to ensure accuracy and completeness of work pricing Preparing bid packages, conceptual estimates and analysis of potential sub-contractor bids for projects
  • Determining cost recovery strategies
  • Maintaining files of working documents to be used as backups for estimate figures as well as maintaining current and accurate information on supplier prices, price lists, unit prices and quantity estimates
  • Collaborating with other estimators, project managers and Procurement Managers and contractors to determine costs related to RFIâ€™s and extra work orders.
Qualifications:
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Project, Word, and Excel
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints and isometric drawings
  • 2-5 years estimating experience

title: Production Associate
description:
Job Description

  • The ability to lift, bend, push, pull, and move materials up to 50 lbs.
  • The ability to stand or walk an entire shift (can be 8-10 hours)
  • The ability to read measurements, work or calculate numbers, use handheld tools, including but not limited to handheld pallet jacks, pneumatic staple guns, industrial hot glue guns, and power drills.
  • Must be 18 years of age, have reliable transportation, and the ability to work overtime as needed.
  • ​​​​​​Previous experience working in a warehouse or manufacturing environment
  • Previous experience in assembly or a production-oriented environment

BENEFITS

  • All the Insurance coverage you’d expect including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, wellness programs, plus generous Paid Time Off and Holidays
  • Associate appreciation/recognition programs
  • Individual incentives to recognize your attendance
  • Scholarship program for children of employees
  • Other benefits offered dependent upon plant location, please check with HR for details
Qualifications

ABOUT THE JOB
Together with your teammates, you will manufacturer or assemble cabinets or cabinet components to meet or exceed production goals while keeping our Four Basics in Mind

  1. Safe and Clean Workplace
  2. Quality at or above expectations
  3. Complete on-time delivery
  4. Fashionable products at a fair price 

YOUR ROLE:

  • Aligned- Make sure you and your team know the goals and objectives that need to be met!
  • Agile- Our demand and structure can change quickly, so make sure you are able to flex when needed.
  • Accountable- It takes YOU showing up to work each day for us to be a successful team and to meet our customer needs.


Additional Information

MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. offers a wide spectrum of cabinetry products designed to satisfy every budget and lifestyle. With a large North America footprint and diverse team of nearly 13,000 employees, we help people fulfill their dreams of a comfortable, inviting home through innovations in fashion and functionality that bring family and friends together. We invite you to visit www.masterbrand.com to learn more about how we build employee opportunity, purpose, and reward into everything we do.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY 
MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

REASONABLE ACCOMMODATIONS
MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to staffing@masterbrand.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

title: Production Technologist
description:
LMI Technologies, recognized as one of Canada’s Best Workplaces, is a medium-sized technology company built on a culture of openness, respect and professional excellence. At LMI our staff work passionately toward the common goal of designing and delivering innovative 3D machine vision solutions to OEMs and System Integrators working in industrial factory automation around the world. The result of this teamwork is high-performance, easy-to-implement and cost-effective 3D sensor technologies that deliver the best results in even the most challenging 3D inline inspection applications.

What will you do as a Assembler/Manufacturing Technologist?

Working under the guidance of the Production Lead, the Assembler/Manufacturing Technologist diligently performs product assembly, tests, alignment, calibration, and verification as well as repair activities ensuring conformity of products to determined requirements. Scope of work includes all processes from initial inventory handling through to finalization and packaging.

This position is flexible to be either dayshift or afternoon shift. 

Typical duties, responsibilities and activities include:

  • Prepares components, assembles, aligns, calibrates, verifies and tests product in accordance with the manufacturing documentation to ensure product is manufactured to quality requirements.
  • Strictly adheres to detailed instructions, drawings, specifications, and bills of material to accurately process components into finished products.
  • Performing work in accordance with quality standards and safety procedures.
  • Adheres to ESD policy and ensures proper handling of product and its components.
  • Participates in continual training and development.
  • Manages time to ensure product is built and repaired to satisfy standard times.
  • Accurately documents status, labour and parts on the electronic traveller.
  • Posts assembly and material transactions in NetSuite database.
  • Promptly segregates and reports non-conforming parts and products.
  • Escalates all issues or concerns immediately to the Production Leads and/or Production Manager.  Clearly communicates and clarifies details about assembly issues.   
  • Maintains a clean and tidy work area.
  • Adheres to LMI Employee Policy Manual. 
  • Performs additional duties as assigned 

What do you need to be successful?

  • High School Diploma.  
  • Experience working in an electro-mechanical assembly/test is highly preferred.
  • Proficient with computers.
  • Soldering experience to IPC 610 class 2 standards is an asset.
  • Cleanroom experience is an asset.
  • Good written and oral communication skills.
  • Proven track record of quality and performance.

How to submit your interest?

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity and working for a fast-growing global technology company with an inspiring and engaging workplace environment, please submit your application to our Human Resources team in confidence by clicking the “Apply Now” button.

While we appreciate your interest in LMI very much, we are only able to respond to candidates selected for further consideration. We look forward to talking to you about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career!

Why being inclusive is important to us?

At LMI Technologies, we are an Equal Opportunity employer and we value the diversity of the people we hire and serve. We strive to build and grow our team that fosters variety in backgrounds, perspectives, experiences and skills. We embrace inclusiveness in our workplace, so we can utilize each person’s talents and strengths.

If you are interested in working for a fast-growing global technology company with an inspiring and engaging workplace environment, we invite you to apply and talk about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career.

#LMISJ

We ensure you, once you complete your application, your information is safe with us. To learn more about how we use your personal data, please review our Privacy Policy (https://lmi3d.com/privacy-policy).

title: Production Supervisor
description:
Our client is currently seeking a Production Supervisor to be based in Woodbridge, Ontario manufacturing facility. This individual will be responsible for the operations and production, including leading a team, ensuring the quality of product, achieving production goals, and ensuring on time delivery, labor and safety.

Responsibilities:
  • Plan and assign daily tasks to area employees to achieve the daily schedule and departmental goals, while maximizing production efficiency.
  • Ensure customer orders are filled efficiently, correctly, and on time.
  • Collaborate with all departments daily to assess needs that support current and future production.
  • Train, motivate, monitor and evaluate performance of staff, ensuring their ability to safely perform their functions; take disciplinary actions as required.
  • Create and report prescribed Metrics daily, weekly and monthly.
  • Identify and proactively raise productivity issues and trends; recommend alternatives for improved performance.
  • Actively participate in process improvement projects to achieve cost savings in labour and materials.
  • Promote positive employee relations, communication and teamwork across all shifts and levels.
  • Ensure compliance with Company standards for cost control, waste reduction, quality, health & safety, inventory management, and Company employment policies including the Code of Conduct; ensure compliance with provincial and federal regulations.
  • Fill in for other managers/supervisors when required.
  • Perform other duties as required.
Qualifications:
  • Degree in Engineering, Manufacturing or in a related field
  • Minimum of ten (10) or more years of manufacturing supervision or management with a demonstrated ability to lead people
  • Union experience an asset
  • Demonstrated experience in lean manufacturing techniques and process improvement
  • Experience with work planning and production scheduling
  • Proven Leadership ability, excellent interpersonal skills and the proven ability to develop relationships within the organization.
  • Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.
  • Excellent communication skills (written & verbal) with the ability to conduct presentations to all levels.
  • Strong documentation skills, reporting skills and computer skills including Microsoft Office and ERP systems.
  • Proven ability to give clear direction, handle difficult situations in a mature manner and function positively under pressure
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Working knowledge of CNC equipment and programming
  • Experience with metal forming, related fields or door components is a plus

title: Assembler
description:
Grow with us as a General Assembler within our Production Department at Stage Windows & Doors! 

Company Overview:

Stage Windows & Doors is a manufacturer of custom products tailored to meet client needs. With a facility located in Vaughan, we offer a variety of options and features that are designed to make our windows and doors ideal for residential replacement and custom home markets. Our focus is on providing our customer's value through on-time delivery, quality, and superior service.  We strive to build a work environment where safety, respect, commitment, success, and fun are driving principles. 

Position Summary:

The General Assembler will play a vital role by providing parts assembly support by performing hands-on duties to ensure workflow and daily production goals.  The qualified candidate will work under the direction of department leadership to assemble components onto PVC using hand tools and manual dexterity adhering to assembly protocols, company rules, quality standards, and health and safety laws. 

This is a full-time position that requires the ability to perform repetitive tasks and stand for extended periods of time. The successful candidate will be disciplined, punctual, reliable, and a strong team player. 

Key Responsibilities: 
  • Perform general assembly of parts and components to form final products 
  • Ensure high quality work is completed with each step in accordance with company quality standards 
  • Inspect manufactured items for defects and conformance to specifications 
  • Utilize hand tools to assemble final products ensuring safe and proper usage 
  • Clean final products of any debris 
  • Load products onto skids according to customer orders 
  • Adhere to health and safety standards 
  • Contribute to general housekeeping duties to ensure the cleanliness of the department 
  • Other tasks as required  

Skills: 
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills 
  • Understanding of metric and imperial measurements 
  • Ability to perform physically demanding and repetitive tasks 
  • Ability to follow direction 
  • Attention to detail and hand-eye coordination 
  • Strong team player 
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs  

Education & Experience: 
  • Previous experience within a manufacturing environment, windows and doors experience is considered an asset   

We thank all interested candidates for applying. Successful candidates will be contacted to participate in the interview process.  

Stage Windows & Doors is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: MTB - Manufacturing Engineer
description:
MTB - Manufacturing Engineer

Bolton, ON, Canada Req #3991

Wednesday, January 19, 2022

COMPANY BACKGROUND:

Morgan Truck Body, LLC is the largest manufacturer of medium duty freight and refrigerated van and truck bodies in North America. Founded in 1952, as a small welding shop in Morgantown, Pennsylvania, on the site where Conestoga wagons were manufactured through the late 1800s, we have experienced tremendous growth and continue to look for additional expansion opportunities around the world. With a total of fourteen manufacturing and six service facilities strategically located across the U.S. and Canada, Morgan is able to provide the quality, service, and prompt delivery our customers expect.

A subsidiary of J.B. Poindexter, a privately held diversified manufacturing company, Morgan offers a vast variety of career opportunities, internally as well as within the J.B. Poindexter family of companies. We offer competitive salaries and progressive benefits including health, dental, vision, life insurance, disability plans, 401K, paid time off, tuition reimbursement and more. We pride ourselves in team member development, performance, recognition, and a culture of diversity and respect. Whether you are taking the next step of your career or just beginning, joining Morgan's winning team means being part of a great home away from home. You will be challenged. You will be proud.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Manufacturing Engineer will develop, implement and maintain safe, optimal and cost-effective manufacturing processes and methods in accordance with product specifications and quality standards. This role will recommend and implement improvements to production processes, methods and controls.

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Supports research, design and the development of safe manufacturing processes, including production flow, assembly methods, welding processes and production equipment
  • Prepares and maintains detailed layouts of the facilities property, buildings and equipment
  • Prepares and maintains work instructions, setup instructions, and other related process documentation for shop floor use
  • Supports and may lead the manufacturing launch of new/revised products including establishing goals, training team members and evaluating results
  • Designs, develops and tests and/or sources and cost-justifies various tools, machinery and equipment for the safe manufacturing of truck bodies and components
  • Performs continuous improvement activities using lean tools for cost reduction, quality improvement, improved efficiency, and improved material flow
  • Prepares capital projects for new equipment and processes
  • Safely launches machines, process, methods and/or tooling technologies with >99% effectiveness
  • Documents lessons learned and communicates among the Mfg. Engineering discipline
  • 10. Provides technical process expertise for plant and supplier quality issues
  • 11. Assists Quality Engineering with developing robust quality control plans
  • 12. Assists with defect, rework, and scrap reduction related to the manufacturing processes
  • 13. Represents manufacturing on cross-functional teams
  • 14. Performs other related duties as assigned

  • EXPERTISE REQUIRED/MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

    • Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical, Industrial or Manufacturing Engineering
    • 5+ years of professional experience in a manufacturing environment
    • Experience with existing manufacturing technologies, including but not limited to: welding, joining, metal working, manual assembly, and painting; certification in a field is a plus
    • Practical Lean principles experience with proven success using the tools
    • Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, AutoCAD, Minitab
    • Proven ability to facilitate change and knowledge of lean tools and techniques
    • Planning - an ability to think ahead and plan during a 3-6 month timespan
    • Strong leadership experience and strong team player
    • Project Management: the ability to organize and manage multiple projects
    • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral
    • Quality orientation and attention to detail
    • Problem analysis and problem resolution; Green Belt certification, Black Belt a plus
    • High level of mechanical aptitude and desire to work in a hands on manufacturing environment for extensive periods of time

    PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

    The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

    This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift and carry objects up to 30 pounds.

    #LI-AL1

    Other details

    • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
    • Job Function Continuous Improvement
    • Pay Type Salary

title: Mould Maker - Afternoon shift
description:
Posted Date:4/28/2022
Job Category:
Position Title:Mould Maker - Afternoon shift
Salary Range:$36.00 - $38.00
Location:Vaughan, Ontario, Canada
Desired Skills:
Description:Our client, a large and successful Tier 1 automotive parts manufacturer is currently looking to add a Mould Maker to their team. They have a night shift or afternoon shift available. The Mould Maker will troubleshoot, repair and maintain moulds along with participate in continuous improvement projects.

What's in it for you:
- A great work experience within a world class manufacturing environment
- Extended Health Benefits
- Employee Profit Sharing Plan
- Group RRSP with employer contribution
- Educational reimbursement program
- Employee appreciation events
- A focus on safety, health and wellness

Qualifications:
Mould Maker Certificate
Minimum of 5 years of experience
Must possess strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to determine root cause and recommend countermeasures
Ability to read and understand complicated blueprints; good working knowledge of GD&T
Must be available to work overtime
Operates Toolroom equipment (lathe, grinding machine, milling machine, etc.) effectively and safely
TIG welding experience a must

Responsibilities:
To assist in the tooling process as assigned, performing all the general functions of a Mould Maker as listed below, while meeting the established customer requirements. Modify, repair and troubleshoot injection moulds and check fixtures, while working to very close tolerances from blueprints, sketches and samples.
Set-up and operate machine tools to cut out and finish parts for plastic injection moulds used for form products from plastics or other materials according to project and customer requirements.
Studies drawings and specifications, visualizes product and computes dimensions and tolerances for machining moulds
Maintains tools and check fixtures to provide quality components at peak efficient levels.
Inspects and troubleshoots new moulds.
Cleans machines and moulds.
Performs bench work and skilled fitting to very close tolerances.

Contact and Resume Submission

If you feel you are an excellent candidate and have the required skills and experience indicated above, please send your attached resume and any important details to HCR Permanent Search, care of the Recruitment Consultant listed below. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Please ensure that you indicate the name of the position you are applying for in the subject heading. Thank you for your interest.

Dennis Bossé
Director of Operations
HCR Permanent Search
Email: dbosse@hcr.ca
905 669 2400 EXT 2236
Website: www.hcrpermsearch.com

Job Description:
• Perform Setup Technician Standard Work
• Perform job changeovers for production equipment as per Setup Instructions / Procedures
• Respond to requests for process / cavity related parameter changes
• Perform machine / robot resets as required

title: Analyst, Quality Assurance (Montreal Dorval, QC, CA)
description:
Analyst, Quality Assurance-MON18653

Description

BOMBARDIER

Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency, reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

In your role, you will:

- Perform quality reviews, write reports, raise requests for supplier action and follow up.

- Perform onsite internal and external customer technical investigations at the manufacturing site.
- Provides daily visibility on supplier issues to Manufacturing team.
- Technical investigation to assure concrete Liability.
- Provide fully detailed documentation / report on Supplier issues.
- Establish Containment plan in Manufacturing (short term).
- Supplier visit Support in Manufacturing site

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

- You have 5 years of comparable work experience in Aircraft manufacturing

- College technical degree in Aerospace of the equivalent

- You have project management skills
- You have knowledge of quality management system
- You have change management skills
- You have experience in problem resolution techniques
- You are functionally bilingual, written and spoken (English and French)
- You have computer literate, and specifically well versed in Excel and PowerPoint
- Experience with SAP
- Systems, process or product auditing
- Experience with supplier interventions Internal and external
- Work experience as a team lead with excellent negotiation skills

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Your ideas move people.

title: Machine Operator (FT)
description:
The Machine Operator is a full-time position and operates our takeout box machinery. Employees must follow This machine requires a detail-oriented operator who can think quickly to keep up with the fast pace required. You must be able to retain instructions and use attention to detail and accuracy to set up, clean, and operate machinery.

Skills and Qualifications:
  • Legally entitled to work in Canada, and able to attend a virtual first interview - invites will be sent by email.
  • Hands-on experience operating physical machinery.
  • Mechanical aptitude.
  • Ability to problem solve production errors and to make manual adjustments to the machines.
  • Experience in a production environment.
  • Physically able to stand for extended periods and repeatedly lift 25 to 30 lbs.
  • Reasonable English speaking and comprehension, understand instructions, and safety orientation.
  • CSA-approved steel-toed boots are required. The company provides hearing protection.

Additional Information:
  • Our facility is located in an industrial area and so own transportation is recommended.
  • The hourly rate for the position is $19-$20 per hour depending on experience.
  • The schedule of work is Monday through Friday 6:30 am to 3:00 pm.

Interview invitations will be sent by email, Tuesdays through Thursdays. Please ensure the email you provide is one you check regularly. Please also check your spam/junk folder.

title: Quality Control Supervisor - Amico Clinical Solutions
description:
Quality Control Supervisor – Amico Clinical Solutions
Richmond Hill, Ontario

Are you looking for an opportunity to join a growing team with a strong reputation of success?

Amico Group of Companies is the market leader in the medical product industry with 9 manufacturing facilities employing over 750 people across North America. With innovative thinking and world-class technology, Amico is an organization where individuals are able to advance their careers and abilities.

We are currently looking to hire a team lead for our QC team!

Duties to include but not limited to:
  • Lead a team of QC Inspectors and manage workflows.
  • Oversee and monitor the inspection and testing of materials parts and products to ensure adherence to quality standards.
  • Determining equipment and protocols to be used in the testing process.
  • Work under direction of the Quality Manager as necessary.
  • Assist in formulating and revising quality control processes and policies.
  • Hands on inspections and recommending changes and improvements in specifications of materials, parts and products based on inspection results
  • Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • Successfully able to lead a team (previous leadership experience is highly desired).
  • Experience in manufacturing is an asset.
  • At least 3-5 years experience in Quality Control
  • Strong communication and time management skills.
  • Accuracy and attention to detail.
For more information, visit us at www.Amico.com.

*Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Quality Control Technician - Anticipatory Hiring 1 (Ottawa, ON, CA)
description:
BWXT Medical Ltd. provides its customers, who conduct life-saving medical procedures for patients around the world, the benefit of decades of experience in the development, manufacturing, packaging and delivery of medical isotopes and radiopharmaceuticals. Headquartered in Kanata, Ontario, BWXT Medical Ltd. employs over 300 highly-skilled people in Kanata and Vancouver, British Columbia. BWXT Medical Ltd. is part of the BWXT nuclear power segment (NPG) of BWX Technologies, Inc.


Quality Control Technician - Anticipatory Tc-99m Commercialization Hiring
 
We are recruiting for 13 Quality Control Technicians in anticipation of Tc-99m commercialization for our facility in Kanata, Ontario.
 
*Please note:  Current Tc-99m project employees who are successful in obtaining a permanent role, will commence their QC Role once the project transitions to a commercial process. The effective date, as such will be deferred, however temporary employees’ status will change to permanent upon singing the offer letter and therefore will be entitled to all permanent employees benefits.
 
 
Job Summary:

Reporting to the Manager, Quality Assurance, the Quality Control Technician will perform quality control analyses of raw materials to finished products.
 
Responsibilities:

• Perform quality control analysis of raw materials and final products.
• Perform routine monitoring of controlled systems and facilities.
• Perform specific administrative duties such as maintaining accurate records of observations, results and data evaluations.
• Follow ongoing production processes for conformance to operating procedures, product specification, GMP regulations and ISO standards.
 
Qualifications:

• Normally, Technologist Diploma (3 yrs.) or B.Sc. in a science discipline plus 2 - 5 years of relevant experience in chemistry or microbiology.
• Must possess effective communication and interpersonal skills and be a dedicated team player.
• Must be able to work a variety of shifts as per the collective agreement, which includes regular scheduled weekend shifts.
• This position is classified as a Nuclear Energy Worker.
 
Additional Requirements:

• Work with manipulators: therefore the candidate must have good grip strength to move materials around behind a lead glass window on a frequent basis and full range of motion of fingers, wrists, elbows and shoulders.
• Be able to push and pull hand carts with an initial and end force of up to 25kgs on and occasional basis.
• Be able to lift up to 5kgs on a frequent basis and 10kgs on an occasional basis.
• Have good vision either corrected or uncorrected.
• Be able to stand for up to 3 hours at a time. 
• Must be able to work with arms extended (in fumehoods/gloveboxes while manipulating lab equipment) for up to 15 - 20 minutes at a time.
• Must be able to remain in a clean room for potentially up to 3 hours at a time.
• There are shift work and overtime requirements.
 
 

BWXT Medical Ltd. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, a conviction for which a pardon has been granted or a record suspended or any other category protected by federal law.

title: Production Operator
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview

 

The Production operator works as part of an integral team responsible for the cement manufacturing process in an automated heavy duty industrial facility.  The position must act as a key player within the Production Team. Ensure the equipment is functioning properly, operated safely and efficiently. Ensure that all the necessary raw materials and fuels are fed correctly. Ensure that the products produced meet the quality requirements defined in the applicable standards.

Responsibilities

 

  • Ensure the raw materials, intermediate products and fuels are fed correctly through the right place at the right time
  • Inspect, troubleshoot and optimize the operation of the plant’s manufacturing equipment.
  • Perform quality control sampling, analysis and reporting for cement and intermediate products produced
  • Ensure the safety of our people and the safe operation of the plant's equipment
  • Ensure production department operations comply with the applicable environmental requirements and regulations
  • Follow standard operating procedures to guarantee safe operations and meet product quality requirements
  • Perform safety field level risk assessments and pre-use inspections on different equipment
  • Report any safety incident, near miss, accident, unsafe conditions, unsafe behaviors and take the proper immediate actions if required
  • Operate mobile equipment such as: skid steer, forklift, tele handler and articulated dump truck
  • Actively participate in the installation, replacement and/or repair of thermal insulating lining on different equipment when required

  • Relationship with Others

     

    • Control Room Operator – Coordinate and receive instructions. Report operation and equipment conditions, share quality analysis results, and report any safety incident or condition.
    • Maintenance Operators – Coordinate and help to accommodate the equipment under the necessary conditions when required
    • Labour Operators – Coordinate and help to accommodate the equipment under the necessary conditions when required
    • Production coordinator – Receive instructions, training, provide operation and safety reports, require equipment, materials and/or tools
    • Production Manager – Receive instructions, training, provide operation and safety reports, require equipment, materials and/or tools
    • Quality Supervisor – Receive instructions, training, provide quality and safety reports
    • Quality Manager – Receive instructions, training, provide quality and safety reports

     

    Specific Accountabilities:

     

    Field Operator:

     

    • Feed correctly the raw materials, intermediate products and fuels when they are needed.
    • Inspect equipment during operation to ensure is working properly
    • Troubleshoot equipment failures and work together with the control room operator to troubleshoot process issues.
    • Perform inspections in different points of the production line and provide feedback to control room operator
    • Move material rejects and/or spills when needed
    • Haul and dump Kiln dust to the dumpsite
    • Load kiln dust to trailers to send to customers
    • Report any safety incident, near miss, accident, unsafe conditions, unsafe behaviors and take the proper immediate actions if required
    • Actively participate in the installation, replacement and/or repair of thermal insulating lining on different equipment when required
    • Report any relevant information or conditions regarding the plant operations to the production coordinator and/or manager

     

     Lab Operator:

     

    • Collect samples from different parts of the process and prepare them to be analyzed
    • Run different lab equipment to perform tests to determine the product quality
    • Adjust certain process variables to meet the quality defined parameters provided by the quality department
    • Provide analysis results to the control room operator to adjust process conditions or take any actions if required
    • Fill up quality control and report files
    • Clean the lab equipment and tools used
    • Perform housekeeping in the lab working area
    • Help the field operator with certain tasks when required and/or possible
    • Report any safety incident, near miss, accident, unsafe conditions and/or unsafe behaviors and take the proper immediate actions if required
    • Actively participate in the installation, replacement and/or repair of thermal insulating lining on different equipment when required
    • Report any relevant information or conditions regarding the plant operations to the production coordinator and/or manager, quality supervisor and/or manager
    DimensionsProduction operator reports to the production coordinator

    Qualifications

     

    • Technical diploma from a Post-Secondary program (Mechanical, Electrical or similar)
    • Thrive in a highly participative work environment with minimal supervision
    • Have a team player attitude and excellent interpersonal and leadership skills
    • Have strong decision making skills and are able to prioritize and resolve issues in a timely manner
    • Ability to work independently and alongside a team in a fast-paced production environment
    • Proven work experience in an industrial facility
    • Mechanical and/or electrical aptitude, including experience working with tools and/or equipment
    • Must be safety–oriented
    • Must be able to follow instructions, rules and regulations is essential
    • Must be able to work rotating shifts, and any mandatory weekday/weekend
    • Must be willing and able to perform work that includes manual lifting, carrying and moving tools and equipment; continuous walking and standing; regular bending
    • Must participate in all contractual, legislative or corporately mandated training
    • Must be able to use power/hand tools, hoists, and other equipment and machinery
    • Be able to work rotating shifts

     

    Physical Demands:

     

    • Must be able to perform medium to heavy tasks such as lifting, pushing, pulling on a frequent basis
    • Must be able to perform constant standing and walking
    • Vision ability to see near and far distances

     

    Lominger Competency

     

    • Action oriented
    • Problem solving
    • Technical learning
    • Time management
    • Timely decision making
    • Functional or technical skills

    LafargeHolcim

     

    As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

    Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

     

    We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

     

    Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

     

    Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Quality Coordinator
description:
The Role

The Quality Coordinator supports the Alberta manufacturing and QA team.


What You Will Do

  • Ensures that the QMS complies with ISO 9001:2015 Standard and ISO/IEC 80079-34. Reviewing the quality program regularly with the goal of continually improving its effectiveness and enhancing customer satisfaction by meeting customer requirements
  • Assists with the Management Review on the QMS for effectiveness, continuing suitability, addressing risk and need for continual improvement.
  • Responsible for liaising between the company and all Certification and/or Notified Bodies with respect to all Ex products manufactured in Edmonton and support external audits.
  • Maintaining an effective internal quality audit containing elements of the QMS pertaining to ABSA, ISO/IEC/CE (ATEX) & examines the quality system annually.
  • Overseeing documents & records and ensuring control is maintained. Including corrective actions and non-conforming records are maintained. Ensuring compliance with current regulations.
  • Developing internal auditing tools and conducting internal audits and reports.
  • Determining data-driven solutions and implementing quality improvement plans.
  • Assisting with the development of company policies, processes, and procedures.
  • Conducting or assisting with regulatory and quality training sessions.
  • Approve Certificates of Conformities for applicable products.

Knowledge & Qualifications/What You Bring To This Role

  • At least 2+ years of comparable experience in a manufacturing environment with experience working in Quality Control or Assurance.
  • Certificate in Quality Management as asset.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and quality management systems.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal, and public speaking skills.
  • Excellent decision-making and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong organizational skills.

title: Fitter - Metal Fabricator
description:
Our busy client located in Ajax is seeking a Fitter - Metal Fabricator to join their growing team! If you have experience in metal fabrication, like working on a straight DAY shift, enjoy working in a shop/manufacturing setting, then this could be the role for you! Continue reading below if you are interested in working with an industry leader in their manufacturing process.

Advantages
Straight days Monday to Friday
Hourly wages starting from $23 - $26 to start
Bus accessible and close to the 401
Weekly pay including benefits
Opportunity for overtime $$$
Clean and safety-oriented environment

Responsibilities
Fabricating, and assembling structural components
Follow blueprints and schematics
Working with hand tools and measuring equipment
Read and interpret drawings
Other duties assigned

Qualifications
Fitting experience
Welding capabilities – MIG and SMAW (no tickets required), an asset
Creative, open-minded, and willing to learn
Familiar with blueprints
Experienced with other machine shop equipment such as Brake press, Grinders, Drill press


Summary
Interested applicants are invited to apply by:

Sending your resume to shannon.simpson@randstad.ca
Apply directly through randstad.ca
Give me a call to discuss at 905-213-1772

If this job is not for you, but you’re interested in a career change, please call/email and let me know what you’re looking for! I've been recruiting in Durham Region for the past 8 years and have assisted hundreds of individuals to find temporary and permanent work. At times I may not have your desired position available but new positions open up all the time so don't hesitate to let me know what types of positions you are seeking or to reach out for more information so that I can inform you as they arise. I specialize in Skilled Trades and Industrial Management roles all around Durham Region such as Millwrights, Electricians, Welders, Machinists, and Supervisors to name a few.

title: Quality Assurance Technician
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Quality Assurance Technician located at our Saskatoon Manufacturing Facility. This position ensures the products produced at Brandt adhere to Brandt’s quality standards and/or the customer’s applicable quality standards. It is also responsible for the development and implementation of procedures related to inspection activities, the detection and resolution of NCR’s, and ultimately the delivery of conforming product to all of Brandt’s customers.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Create and Implement Product Quality Plans
  • Create Inspection & Test Plans, SOP’s, and other Quality Assurance documents as necessary
  • Train new and existing staff on Quality Expectations & Processes
  • Facilitate the NCR process, which includes efficiently resolving all NCR’s and ensuring effective corrective and preventative actions are implemented.
  • Achievement of assigned Quality Goals
  • Work with other QA department staff and Brandt manufacturing locations
  • Audit processes/procedures to confirm conformance and present results
  • Maintain location specific Quality Metrics as identified by the QA manager
  • Present a monthly Quality Report for your corresponding manufacturing location
  • Investigate warranty claims and customer complaints as requested & communicate back to Operations
  • Identify warranty trends and implement preventative measures as requested
  • Perform tool and equipment calibrations as required
  • Utilize metrics to continuously improve enterprise performance
  • Assist in development of QA standards and procedures
  • Work with a focus on QA, not QC
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Impartial people skills with an open mind to drive/assist stakeholders into seeking quality
  • Positive attitude aimed to maintain a high customer satisfaction level (internal and external)
  • Required familiarity with QA principles and concepts
  • Able to accurately interpret codes, standards, specifications, and drawings
  • Have an understanding of continuous improvement
  • Familiar with Microsoft Office
  • Superior Microsoft Excel knowledge and abilities
  • Ability to work quickly, accurately, and thoroughly on multiple initiatives
  • Organized, diligent, and detailed
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are required

title: Manufacturing Supervisor
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

The Manufacturing Supervisor is responsible for supervising operations to ensure production is operating in a safe, efficient, and timely manner. Responsible for productions schedules and posting of daily work assignments based upon production needs and individual strengths. Must be shop floor orientated and provide â€œhands-onâ€ product/process support for all reports on a daily basis. This individual will be the driver behind product/process safety, quality, delivery and morale.  Accountable for continuous improvement of assigned department as well as training and development of direct reports.

Responsibilities:
  • All work must be performed in a safe, efficient manner in compliance with Company Policy, Local, Provincial and/or Federal rules and regulations and if applicable Collective Agreement.
  • Communicates, trains, guides and coaches employees to achieve operational initiatives that optimize team efforts in the manufacturing of high quality products.
  • Schedules and assigns personnel to work according to the demand of the manufacturing schedules.
  • Measures performance and quality.
  • Drives positive results in operational Key Process Indicators.
  • Performs other related tasks as assigned.
    • The incumbent is responsible for the awareness, understanding, specific responsibilities and management of the Environmental Management System (EMS) as stated in EMS policy CEVPL.00005.
    • The incumbent is responsible for the awareness, understanding, specific responsibilities and management of the Quality Management System (QMS) as stated in
Qualifications:
  • 1-3 yearsâ€™ related work experience in Injection Moulding  
  • Knowledge of Occupational Health and Safety Act, and Labour Laws.
  • Conflict Resolution Management and Time Management.
  • Strong communication, presentation, organizational, problem solving, teamwork interpersonal and leadership skills.
  • Proficient computer skills.
  • Effective use of technology, instruments, tools and information systems.
  • Ability to seek a team approach.
Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?

â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!

title: Quality Assurance Technologist
description:
PharmEng Technology, one of the leading pharmaceutical consulting firms in the world with offices in USA, Canada and Asia, is hiring a full time, experienced Quality Assurance Technologist . This is a full-time position of 40 hours per week and available immediately.
Responsibilities:
• Develop Quality Assurance Programs
• Collect and compile operational or experimental data such as preparation of the URS/IQ/OQ/PQ protocols, execution & reports for the Facilities & Utilities;
• Oversight of change controls, NCs and deviations from initiation to close out, execution of all commissioning / qualification / validation protocols and CAPAs;
• Work cross-functionally with manufacturing/design engineers, quality engineers and production technicians to resolve the root cause of non-conformance and propose corrective and preventative action;
• Develop Commissioning & Qualification (C&Q) leveraging strategy and I/O/PQ execution on bioprocess equipment;
• Prepare Functional and Design Specifications, Development and Testing, Equipment and Systems, Risk Assessment, Source Code Review, 21 Part 11 ERES Assessment, Qualification Need Assessment, Design Qualification, Validation Plan, Traceability Matrix and Validation Summary Report
• Participate in Production Readiness Reviews, perform review of parts, drawings, bill of materials and work instructions for assembly/manufacturability;
• Identify requirements, schedule calibration, verify, and validate production tools and jigs for efficient manufacturing process
Qualifications:
• Completion of a two- or three-year college program or equivalent in industrial engineering technology;
• Familiar with Malaysia and ASEAN quality guidelines and requirements;
• Minimum 10years of experience in similar role in the Pharmaceutical and Biopharmaceutical industries;
• Experienced Quality Assurance Validation, Commissioning, Qualification, and Validation (CQV), Change Management (Quality Management Systems), Project Management, Risk Assessment, GMP Training, GMP Compliance Audit and Process Engineering
• knowledge of cGMP, PIC/s, GAMP, ISO, EMA, FDA and JP regulatory requirements.;
Salary
49.06 /hr

Location:
23 Lesmil Road, Toronto, ON, M3B 3P6

Position:
Permanent, Full-Time
Benefits:
You will also be enrolled in all Company benefit programs after the probationary period has been successfully completed.
• Life Insurance
• Accidental Death
• Long Term Disability
• Dental and Healthcare
• RRSP Group Savings Program (After 12 months of Service)
How to apply
By email
tracy.g@pharmeng.com

title: Manufacturing Engineering Specialist
description:
Company Overview:

Our Company is built on employee mutual commitment and respect, enthusiasm and progress. Teledyne Digital Imaging is a subsidiary of Teledyne Technologies Inc., a U.S. publicly listed enterprise, and specializes in the manufacture, design, research and development of high performance image sensors and modular expandable cameras.

Teledyne Digital Imaging's products are used worldwide in machine vision, document scanning, image capture, surveillance, process monitoring, manufacturing inspection, medical imaging, and multi media.

 

As part of our continuing growth in this high technology market, Teledyne Digital Imaging is recruiting for a Manufacturing Engineering Specialist to join our team in Waterloo for a FT 18 mos contract.

Position Summary and Responsibilities:
  • Works closely with the project team during the development of new products and manufacturing processes.
  • During development phase, defines and evaluates best processes with the R&D team for new products and transfers these into production line.
  • Manages the design for manufacturability for product designs ,identifying opportunities for manufacturability and efficiency.
  • Works with project and design team, developing product transfer plans and schedules, product upgrades, and engineering changes.
  • Provides consistent and accurate documentation of manufacturing processes, inspection processes, product configuration management, and bill of material.
  • Writes assembly procedures / protocols / work instructions.
  • Reviews and evaluates new, innovative processes, and methods to reduce costs, improve quality, efficiency, and sustainability.
  • Drives process development to optimize efficient process flow, reduce process or product variability and improve process capability.
  • Initiates process-, equipment- and efficiency actions to improve yield, cost and supports production till the expected yield and cost targets are achieved.
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor Degree or College diploma in Mechanical, Electrical, Manufacturing or Industrial Technology required.
  • A minimum of 5 years experience related to new product introduction in a high-tech manufacturing environment.
  • Familiarity with design for manufacturability, considering a balance of cost, serviceability, manufacturability, reliability, assembly time and quality.
  • Excellent cross-functional team leadership skills.
  • Strong analytical skills, familiar with failure mode and effects analysis and statistical programs.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills commensurate with a technical audience.

title: General Machinist Apprentice (429A)
description:
JOB POSTING

429A General Machinist Apprentice Opportunity

in Kitchener/Cambridge, Ontario

 

 

 

A well-established, successful manufacturing company in the Kitchener/Cambridge area, is looking to hire a General Machinist Apprentice   with  one to two years experience.  This is an excellent opportunity to work in a great team atmosphere.

 

As a General Machinist Apprentice, your key responsibilities are:

 

  • Read and interpret engineering drawings, blueprints, charts and tables or study sample parts to determine machining operation to be performed, and plan best sequence of operations
  • Compute dimensions and tolerances and measure and lay out work pieces
  • Set up, operate and maintain a variety of machine tools including computer numerically controlled (CNC) tools to perform precision non-repetitive machining operations such as sawing, turning, milling, boring, planning, drilling, precision grinding and other operations
  • Fit and assemble machined metal parts and subassemblies using hand and power tools
  • Verify dimensions of products for accuracy and conformance to specifications using precision measuring instruments
  • May set up and program machine tools for use by machining tool operators.
  • Study job orders or interpret blueprints to determine machining operations to be performed
  • Verify dimensions of parts machined using micrometers, calipers and other precision measuring instruments
  • Prepare etching and immerse metal parts or workpiece in etching solution to remove unwanted portions
  • Perform routine maintenance on equipment and machinery
  • Practice excellent general housekeeping, including but not limited to, his/her work area, chip removal, floor areas, benches, storage areas to ensure a safe work environment.
  • May enter codes specifying speed, feed and cut of the tool path for computer numerically controlled (CNC) machine tools.
  • Use and Knowledge of CAD Software (Mastercam)

 

Qualifications:

  • One to two years experience
  • Ability to lift to 50 lbs
  • Strong analytical and decision-making skills
  • Able to work in a team and to handle priorities under pressure
  • Strong understanding and conscious of safe work practices
  • Available to attend schooling and attain Journeymen certification within a specified time period
  • Strong analytical and decision-making skills

What The Employer Offers:

  • Full-time employment with opportunities to grow and learn within a team environment in a sustainable and growing economic environment.
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Full benefits package

You are applying to a position that has been posted through Support Ontario Youth. It is an organization that screens apprentices for employers. 

How to apply:

Click on the link to complete an online application AND assessment: https://bit.ly/3sgRsZV

We will ONLY be in touch with candidates who qualify for the positions.  We wish all applicants success.

title: Machinist
description:
DESCRIPTION

  • Machining of metal parts to be used in the assembly of packaging equipment;
  • Respect machining time budget and materials;
  • Meet and where possible, exceeds established specifications;
  • May need to do some welding and buffing as well from time to time.

REQUIREMENTS

  • College diploma in machining;
  • 3 to 5 yrs experience in conventional machining (lathe and milling), machining of stainless steel an asset;
  • experience as a tinsmith, an asset;
  • French as a working language. Bilingual, English and French, an asset
  • Attention to detail

BENEFITS:

As a Pro Mach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, a pension plan and a generous paid time off program.

Due to the high volume of incoming resumes, only candidates chosen for interview will be contacted. Pro Mach is committed to providing an accessible workspace. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process please notify the Company.

ABOUT NJM PACKAGING:

The world’s proven, trusted, single-source provider of automated packaging machinery for pharmaceutical, nutraceutical, and personal care products, NJM offers both stand-alone solutions and integrated systems for packagers of solid dose and liquid pharmaceuticals, biopharmaceuticals, vitamins, and food supplements. As part of the ProMach Pharma business line, NJM helps our customers protect and grow the reputation and trust of their consumers. ProMach is a family of best-in-class packaging solution brands serving manufacturers of all sizes and geographies in the food, beverage, pharmaceutical, personal care, and household and industrial goods industries. ProMach brands operate across the entire packaging spectrum: filling and capping, flexibles, pharma, product handling, labeling and coding, and end of line. ProMach is headquartered near Cincinnati, Ohio, with manufacturing facilities and offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and Asia. For more information about ProMach, visit http://www.ProMachBuilt.com and for more information on ProMach Careers, visit http://www.ProMachCareers.com.

PMCA01

Experience

Required
  • 3 - 5 years: conventional machining with lathe and milling

Education

Preferred
  • Technical/other training or better

Skills

Preferred
  • Manual Mill
  • Manual Lathe

Behaviors

Preferred
  • Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well

title: General Labour/Manufacturing
description:
Palliser Furniture is one of the leading furniture manufacturers in North America! We value our clients; providing the best customer experience possible, our surrounding communities, and our natural environment. At Palliser Furniture, we believe in being extraordinary and producing quality furniture. Join our ever-growing team, where we provide comprehensive on the job training and professional development. 

We are seeking individuals to join various areas in our Manufacturing facility. We have positions available for our day shift (7:00 AM â€“ 3:30 PM) and evening shift (3:30 PM â€“ 12:00 AM). These positions are located at 80 Furniture Park, Winnipeg. 

WHAT WOULD YOU DO? 

  • Learn to be a part of the Furniture Manufacturing process! 

  • Opportunities available in areas such as Cushion Filling, Foam Shop, Framing, Mech Install, Woodshop. 

  • Work with team members to reach production requirements. 

  • Inspect all material and orders before and after to ensure the quality of the product. 

  • Maintain a clean and safe workplace. 

  • Contribute to producing high-quality, luxury furniture. 

WHAT DO YOU BRING? 

  • Previous experience in manufacturing or construction environment is an asset. 

  • Ability to use measuring equipment (measuring tape for both Imperial and Metric systems). 

  • Self-motivated, with a very positive attitude and strong work ethic. 

  • Excellent attention to detail. 

  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints, specification sheets, photos and other instructions. 

  • Experience with hand tools, power tools and similar equipment is an asset. 

  • Solid teamwork skills. 

  • Dependable and reliable. 

  • Physically able to stand for 8 hours a day, lift and manipulate objects ranging from to 2-35 kg (5-77 lbs). 

WORK LIFE AT PALLISER 

  • Company that supports work-life balance with paid time off and flexibility. 

  • Great benefits packages. 

  • Employee discount program for products, wellness plans, and more. 

  • Surround yourself with a community that supports professional development and collaboration. 

COVID-19 PRECAUTION(S): 

  • Personal protective equipment (PPE) provided or required. 

  • Temperature screenings. 

  • Social distancing guidelines in place. 

  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, and/or cleaning procedures in place. 

 

CLOSING DATE: Open until all positions are filled. 

We thank all interested applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Manufacturing Process Intern
description:
We are currently looking for a Manufacturing Intern to join our busy and growing production plant. 

Company Overview: 
Stage Windows & Doors is a manufacturer of custom products tailored to meet client needs. With a facility located in Vaughan, we offer a variety of options and features that are designed to make our windows and doors ideal for residential replacement and custom home markets. Our focus is on providing our customer's value through on-time delivery, quality, and superior service.  We strive to build a work environment where safety, respect, commitment, success, and fun are driving principles. 

Position Summary:
The Manufacturing Intern will be engaged in elevating the department and company to the next level. The Intern will support the development and optimization of innovative manufacturing processes and work design, including generating ideas, issuing tests, performing analysis, conducting research, and providing input to the production team on best practices, efficiencies, and cost control strategies. The successful candidate will be forward-thinking and thrive in a culture of continuous improvement.

The incumbent is a self-starter who is driven to achieve results while maintaining clear lines of communication with management and can adopt a flexible approach in a dynamic and agile environment. This position requires discipline, a positive attitude, and a desire to grow professionally.

This is an approximately 3-month full-time paid internship position that requires strong organizational, and interpersonal skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work in a fast-paced and high-volume environment.

Key Responsibilities: 
  • Provide the production leadership team support in the research of engineering solutions that can be developed into feasible projects for improving the efficiency of current manufacturing equipment, tools, and process. 
  • Perform a technical analysis of possible technological developments that can improve manufacturing efficiency. 
  • Provide production departments support to meet targets, and production requirements, and to troubleshoot and resolve technical problems. 
  • Perform analysis of internal processes and make recommendations to increase efficiencies, introduce automation, and streamline procedures. 
  • Evaluate and review machinery issues as well as to conduct root cause analysis on equipment failures with projected solutions to minimize downtimes. 
  • Investigate and implement design and process revisions to reduce quality costs associated with production scraps. 
  • Assist with various lean and six sigma initiatives. 
 
Skills: 
  • Strong computer skills (AutoCAD, Outlook, MS Office). Experience with ERP systems would be an asset. 
  • Effective communication skills and interpersonal skills, presentation skills, are considered an asset. 
  • Strong attention to detail in design and problem resolution is required. 
  • Ability to collaborate with multiple departments and effectively manage projects from start to successful execution ·        
  • Excellent planning and organizational skills 
  • Detail-oriented and organized  

Education and Experience: 
  • Graduate education or currently enrolled in a recognized engineering, manufacturing, or production-related program with an accredited institution. 
  • Some working experience in a manufacturing or engineering setting would be considered an asset. 

We thank all interested candidates for applying. Successful candidates will be contacted to participate in the interview process.  

Stage Windows and Doors is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.
