title: Paint Line Team Lead (12 hrs shifts)
description:
Company Description

Gentek is a leading manufacturer and distributor of vinyl / aluminum siding products, windows and other building products. With 3 manufacturing plants and 23 distribution centers in Canada, we are well positioned to provide our customers with the best products and a superior customer service experience.

Located in Montreal West Island, in Pointe-Claire, our plant is looking for a Paint Line Team Lead to join our amazing team. The team leader will have to ensure the smooth running of the operations of the line to be painted and the application and compliance with the manufacturing and health and safety procedures in place.

Permanent full-time position. Excellent working conditions, competitive compensation, group insurance plan, pension plan. Free parking is available.

Job Description

Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:

  • Ensure that all coils produced meet the requirements defined by the quality control department (color, adhesion, appearance, etc.) by performing all the prescribed tests.
  • Manage the various parameters of the manufacturing process, at his disposal, in order to maximize the performance (quality & productivity) of the facilities for which he is responsible.
  • Enter the operating parameters on the computer at the time of manufacturing, report any anomalies using the appropriate tools and prepare the necessary daily reports.
  • Participate to the operating process of the painting machine in order to maximize its use and ensure constant supervision (lunch, break, etc.).
  • Take responsibility for all process tasks related to the following equipment: -Cleaning basins, -Dater, -Pre-treatment machine, - Ovens & coolers, -Accumulators and centering systems.
  • Any other work not necessarily related to his usual tasks when assigned.
Qualifications

  • French, written and spoken; English is an asset.
  • 1 to 3 years of experience in the manufacturing environment as a team lead.
  • Good communication skills both verbally and written.
  • Good organizational, time management and prioritizing skills.
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude.
  • Understanding of computers and how to navigate through programs
  • Paint experience in a manufacturing environment an asset
  • Working knowledge of safe work procedures
  • Able to work efficiently as a part of a team as well as independently.
  • Able to teach/train others

Core Competencies

  • Communication
  • Teamwork
  • Quality Assurance
  • Ethics and Integrity
  • Dependability
  • Positive Attitude
  • Adaptability
  • Planning and Organizing
  • Problem Solving
  • Critical Thinking
  • Workflow
  • Standard Operating Procedures


Additional Information

Working for Gentek is:

  • Have a permanent, full-time and stable position with the possibility of advancement;
  • Have group insurance paid 100% by the employer after 1 month of service;
  • Paid personal days and paid Christmas holidays (from December 24 to January 2);
  • Have a competitive salary of $22.16 per hour;
  • Day premium: $ 2.50 / hour;
  • Night premium: $ 3 / hour;
  • Team Lead premium $ 2 / hour;
  • 12 hrs schedule: from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm and from 7:00 pm to 7:00 am
  • 40 minutes lunch is paid
  • Clean working environment;
  • Easy access location;
  • Free parking.

We thank all applicants for submitting their resumes, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

In order to facilitate the reading of this text, we have used the masculine as a neutral gender to designate both women and men.

title: Shipping Operator
description:
Description

 

Contribute. Grow. Lead...with OxyChem. Looking for a challenge? Desire to achieve your true potential? OxyChem is a growing, action-oriented, safety driven chemical manufacturing company continually striving to be the best in the business while staying focused on environmental protection. The secret to our success has and will continue to be our people.

Occidental Chemical Corporation (OxyChem) is a leading North American manufacturer of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) resins, chlorine and caustic soda – key building blocks for a variety of indispensable products such as plastics, pharmaceuticals and water treatment chemicals. Other OxyChem products include caustic potash, chlorinated organics, sodium silicates, chlorinated isocyanurates and calcium chloride. OxyChem's market position is among the top three producers in the United States in 2017 for the principal products it manufactures and markets. Based in Dallas, Texas, the company has manufacturing facilities in the U.S., Canada and Latin America.

In a fast-paced industry that demands precision, we create a supportive workplace where the safety and well-being of our employees are paramount. We are committed to rewarding top performers, offering very competitive pay and benefits, and providing tremendous career development opportunities. We are looking for three (3) experienced and self-motivated individual to fill the position of Shipping Operators with our Chemical Plant located in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • To perform loading/unloading and shipping/receiving duties as required throughout the resin plant.
  • This position also provides vacation/illness relief for the Vehicle Operator/VCM Unloader. 
  • Conduct daily work activities in support of HSE objectives and policies. Use personal accountability to assist with carrying out duties, responsibilities and authority as defined in HSE programs, practices and procedures.
  • Understand HSE policies and programs. Work safely, with respect to health and environmental requirements.
  • Perform bulk loading duties. 
  • Transfer product from storage silos to the shipping silos. Maintain full inventory in shipping silos.
  • Take silo readings regularly. Take samples and transport them to the lab for testing. Required to complete bulk storage status sheet on all silos.
  • Load trucks & railcars to capacity with correct product.
  • Weigh trucks in and out. Fill out appropriate documentation indicating gross weight, truck number, and lot number.
  • Bulk loader is responsible for the truck until it leaves the plant.
  • In addition to above must ensure vehicle is clean and cannot release the truck until four samples of its cargo have been approved by the lab.
    All vehicles must be loaded safely and efficiently. Key Procedures must be followed.
  • Issue permits as a Qualified Permit Approver.
  • Raw materials receiving, storage and delivery.
  • Receive both bulk and boxed raw materials (antistat and initiator), unload as required, i.e. pump, blow off, using a tow motor or manual off-loading of initiator bottles.
  • General housekeeping duties. Maintaining a clean work area, dump garbage, empty garbage bins. 

Qualifications

 
  • Successful completion of a college diploma - preferred to have a technical emphasis (Science, Math, Engineering or Technology programs).
  • Relevant work experience preferred (e.g. shipping, production, loading, or unit maintenance) in a chemical plant or manufacturing environment.
  • Proficiency in math, reading comprehension, and mechanical reasoning with strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to work a rotating shift; weekends; holidays; overtime; and respond to callouts.
  • Ability to read, write and speak in English.
  • Proficient in Microsoft applications
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills including the ability to work as part of a team.
  • Must possess valid driver’s license.
  • Must be able to perform the physical demands required for this position including climb ladders and stairs, walking, bending and stooping. Must be able to wear personal protective equipment including the use of a respirator.
  • Must be able to respond to visual and audible alarms.  

 

Occidental is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, marital status, political preference, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or disability status.

title: Machine Operator (Central)
description:
About Us:

Fresh Start Foods Canada Ltd. was founded in 1993 to provide Food service Customers with a fresh alternative. An outstanding supply network, efficient distribution through our three regional locations, and our thoroughly modern processing plant are all part of our commitment to provide the freshest fruits and vegetables possible.  

 

Fresh Start Foods is currently hiring a full time â€‹Machine Operatorâ€‹ who is eager to work in a fast paced team oriented work environment in our Richmond, BC location.  

 

  • Day Shift â€“ 8:00AM -4:30PM  
  • Hours of Operation: Monday - Friday, Must be able to work on weekends and holidays
  • Employment Type: Full Time
  • Reporting directly to the Lead Hand or Supervisor  
Responsibilities & Qualifications:

Duties and Responsibilities:  

  • Accurate completion of documentation when required - blade sheet  
  • Works in a safe manner and follows all safety procedures  
  • Set up and operate machines - slicers, dicers, peelers  
  •  Perform testing procedures to ensure machines are working optimally  
  • Plant floor person responsible for functions related to processing - washing the food products  
  • Able to read the recipes (weight, cut size, volume)  
  •  Monitor and troubleshoot basic machine problems/perform regular safety checks  

 

Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:  

  • Previous manufacturing experience in food processing facility  
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment  
  • Ability to be flexible with regards to working in production areas where needed the most  
  • Ability to work in a refrigerated environment  
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs  
Our Commitment:

Fresh Start Foods offers a range of benefits, including:  

  • Team based work environment  
  • Permanent full time hours  
  • Training provided  
  • Annual Safety Boot Program (up to $85)  
  • Group Health Care Benefit Program  
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) Program,  
  • Opportunity for advancement

title: FlameCutter Operator
description:
Anchor Danly Inc., manufactures die sets and steel plates and distributes components to customers globally. Anchor Danly has manufacturing facilities in both the U.S., and Canada.

Our team members are our greatest asset and as such, we are committed to providing competitive hourly compensation and a comprehensive benefit package, training opportunities, gain sharing, extended time off over the holidays, flexible schedules and so much more!!

We seek to provide a challenging and energized workplace where everyone is a part of the team, works in a safe environment, takes pride in their work, and has balance in their lives so they may live life fully with their families and community.

We are looking for individuals in the skilled trades discipline for our Flamecutting Machines in Cambridge, Ontario. We have multiple shifts available at this time.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Set up and operate flame cutting machine
  • Material handle using lift truck and overhead crane and manual lifting
  • Clean-up material as needed using hand grinder and tools
  • Perform preventative maintenance as required
  • Complete operator checklists as required
  • Maintain quality requirements, produce quality products and stay on schedule
  • Work safely and assist in other departments as assigned

Qualifications

  • Previous experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Flamecutting experience, lift truck and overhead crane experience an asset
  • Basic mechanical, computer and blue print reading skills required
  • Good organizatioons skills required
  • Attention to detail/quality and effective problem solving skills required
  • Team oriented with ability to take initiative
  • Knowledge of manufacturing processes and/or technical background required

Anchor Danly supports training and development to grow your career. We provide free courses through the NTMA (National Tooling & Machining Association) for team members in a number of areas like blueprint reading, safety, math, GDT, and more. Additionally, in Canada we support Red Seal Apprenticeship Programs and offer funding.

To apply for the opportunity to join a great company, click on the link provided or go to https://anchordanly.prevueaps.com/jobs/ to review all career openings. We appreciate your interest in our company however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Anchor Danly is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

We thank you for your interest.

title: Production Lead Hand (FT)
description:
Production Team Leader
Afternoon Shift 

Kemflo Canada Inc, Richmond Hill ON Canadian Owned and Operated, established in 1988, has a solid reputation for the design and manufacturing of quality injection molded products.

Experienced in processing a wide range of thermoplastic resins, our capabilities enable us to work with a wide range of industries, molding parts that fit their needs. We are known for the designing of tools, pro-to-typing molding designs including post molding designs, allowing, us to provide our customers with a single complete service to see them from inception through to delivery to market

Our employees have been the driving factor of our success though team work collaboration and conviction that Kemflo Canada delivers on our commitment to be the best at what we do

Come joint our inspiring team

Position Overview:
The production Team Lead will organize and perform a full range of duties, of a complex nature, that requires a thorough understanding of departmental organization, functions, policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
  • Prepares the production floor for daily production
  • Monitors daily production and adjust production based on inventory.
  • Review production set-ups for accuracy and quality requirements.
  • Assist troubleshooting of machines, dies, jigs.
  • Train/maintain training of team members in the process
  • Monitor Team members/Machines for improvements.
  • Assist in quality investigations
  • Report issues/problems to immediate supervisor.
  • Conduct periodic audits of the processes.
  • Perform inventories as needed.
  • Ensure document control is being completed properly.
  • Communicate with other departments
  • Other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities:
  • Production system knowledge
  • Communicate effectively, clearly, and concisely, both orally and in writing
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Ability to achieve success and generate results both on their own as well as through teamwork
  • Proactive thinker and self-starter
  • First Aid and CPR training
  • Ability to Interpret Product Drawings
  • Ability to work other shifts as required

Supervisory Responsibilities:
  • Manufacturing Team Leader will implement responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable laws.
  • Responsibilities include training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

Working Conditions:
  • Ability to work in a high noise level area standing/ walking for the majority of shift.
  • Multitasking is an essential job function for this role.

Minimum Qualifications:
  • High School Diplomas or Equivalent.
  • 2-3 years previous leadership/supervisor
  • exceptional problem-solving abilities.
  • Must be able to work independently.
  • Detail oriented and organized.

Personal Protective Equipment:
  • Safety Glasses must be worn at all times, Employee must provide their own corrective Safety Glasses
  • must ware a face mask
  • Steel toed shoes a must in the plant at all times
  • Follow all Safety policies and procedures, work safe
  • Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted

Open to Canadian Citizens
Kemflo Canada supports a full vaccination policy.
All employees are expected to be vaccinated as a condition of employment.

Kemflo Canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and, upon request, will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability.

title: Production Operator
description:
Job Duties & Responsibilities

  • Responsible for operation of various machines/equipment (extrusion lines, slitting operations, ovens, mixers, grinders, shredders)
  • Quality control
  • Basic housekeeping
  • Trouble shooting

Qualifications

  • Strong mechanical aptitude
  • Physical coordination
  • Experience with hand held measuring equipment
  • Good math and computer skills
  • High attention to detail
  • Forklift license/experience
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to work in a fast paced manufacturing environment with continuous processes
  • Benefits (health, dental, life insurance, and disability plans) after 3 months and have past your probation period

Rate of Pay

$18.24 - $27.00 (Depending on knowledge, skills, abilities, experiences both work and education)

Shifts

  • Permanent, Full Time Position
  • 12 hr continental day shifts
  • Averaging agreements in place
  • 84 hrs biweekly
Location- Orangeville, ON

title: EPS Machine Operator I
description:
GENERAL PURPOSE OF THE JOB:

The Machine Operator starts up, troubleshoots, and operates manufacturing equipment safely and routinely while achieving or exceeding standard levels of scrap, timing and output rate a majority of the time in one of the manufacturing areas listed below. There are three Machine Operator levels (I, II, & III). The level will be determined by experience, ability to assume various roles on the plant floor, and demonstrated ability to independently troubleshoot and problem solve machine issues resulting in efficient cycles and minimal downtime.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform work in a safe manner by following all written and verbally communicated safety rules and procedures.
  • Follow standard work procedures to operate and maintain assigned machine(s).
  • Routinely meet or exceed production output rates per standards.
  • Produce product according to tolerances and specifications.
  • Perform routine inspections per quality standards.
  • Read and interpret production instructions.
  • Maintain accurate paperwork.
  • Correctly package, label, and store products.
  • Cross-train on other production functions to provide assistance as business need dictates.
  • Clean and maintain assigned area to ensure proper functionality.
  • Report all quality and mechanical issues.
  • Participate in the continuous improvement process.
  • If appropriate, setup and operate various off-line and secondary equipment.

EDUCATION

  • Less than high school education

EXPERIENCE

  • No prior experience or training.

OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

  • Ability to function effectively in a team setting.
  • Ability to multi-task while maintaining attention to detail
  • Demonstrates reliability, flexibility, and dependability

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

title: General Machine Operator (Afternoon Shift)
description:
General Machine Operator

(Afternoon shift 4:00 PM to 12:30 AM) 

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection alarm, communications security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Responsibilites Duties:

  • Provide general support in the metal shop.
  • Operate machinery such as brakes presses, shears, etc.
  • Load required tooling into the machine.
  • Produce and verify product piece to the drawing specs and identify it as “first off”
  • Perform maintenance as per outlined requirements.
  • Assemble and fit plates and sections to form structures.
  • Weld or bolt sections together.
  • Set up and operate heavy-duty metal-working machines.
  • Stock shelves and move material need it to machine.
  • Unload metal when delivered and store it.
  • Prepare all metal items for painting.
  • Follow Supervisor/Team Lead instructions.

Skills, Experience Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in a metal shop environment.
  • Previous exposure to welding, punch press and brake press would be preferred.
  • Must be able to frequently lift 30lbs and up to 50lbs occasionally.
  • Able to work in a noisy shop environment
  • Must have steel-toed safety boots
  • Able to read blueprints
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Counterbalance forklift certification need it, with minimum 6 months experience

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

Interested applicants please forward a copy of your cover letter and resume to Human Resources.


We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Mircom Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer that considers all applicants regardless of cultural background, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, family status, disability or any other grounds as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code.  In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Mircom is committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive work environment for all individuals with disabilities in a respectful and dignified manner. Accommodations will be made available, upon request, to applicants who have specialized needs throughout the recruitment process. 

Disclaimer: Mircom does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. We will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

title: Controls Technician
description:
One of our manufacturing clients in Etobicoke, ON is looking for a Controls Technician for their manufacturing facility.

Shift -Afternoon and Midnight

Key Responsibilities

Establishes and follows-up full project implementation including timing, concept, feasibility, design, specifications, construction and commissioning

Maintains and upgrades PLC software: assist in training of staff on electronic equipment

Analyses, records and charts documentation required for maintenance records and projects

Services, maintains, repairs, installs and tests new or existing equipment and verifies conformance to specifications

Complete repairs, modifications and installations as required

Troubleshooting of process problems and complete quality improvements as required to maintain part standards of quality

Deals extensively with vendors (both parts suppliers and equipment suppliers)

Department support for testing, repairing and calibrating electric or electronic components

Plant support in troubleshooting / repairs and systems improvements (optimization)

Carries out preventative maintenance procedures as laid out by the manufacturer's specifications

Able to work extended or flexible hours/shifts as required

Prepares drawings, materials specifications to requisition as required by vendors or other departments

Able to understand and CSA-462 and/or NEMA 70-E

Has good interpersonal and communication skills and is results oriented

Has an exemplary attitude towards housekeeping, safety and company policies

Commitment to continuous improvement and work place safety

Team Player

TS16949 awareness and adherence

ISO14001 awareness and adherence

Lean Manufacturing and 5S concepts awareness and adherence

Other duties as may be required


Key Qualifications

Completion of a technical diploma program (2 years+) from an accredited college or university.

Proven of record of PLC programming (Allen Bradley, Siemens) or CNC controls (Fanuc, Siemens)

3 years experience with electronic control systems in a robotic welding or laser field or on CNC machine tools

title: Superviseur Qualité des Opérations / Quality Operations Supervisor
description:
À PROPOS DE MONTEBELLO PACKAGING

Montebello Packaging, fabricant de classe mondiale, produit des tubes et contenants pour l’industrie pharmaceutique, cosmétique et alimentaire. La compagnie est une division de Jim Pattison Group, un conglomérat de 12.7 milliards de dollars canadiens. Montebello Packaging emploie 500 personnes et possède quatre usines en Amérique du Nord.

LES DÉFIS QUI VOUS ATTENDENT

Relevant du Directeur Qualité des Opérations, le Superviseur Qualité des Opérations gère l’équipe AQ de l’usine de Lachine et a pour responsabilités :

  • Maintenir les normes de qualité de l’entreprise pour l’ensemble de l’usine
  • Maintenir et développer les indicateurs de performance des opérations de qualité clés de l’usine
  • Maintenir et soutenir les systèmes de qualité liés à l’usine, tels que, mais sans s’y limiter:
  • Procédures, non-conformités, risques, changements, enquêtes et processus de gestion CAPA.
  • Être un acteur actif au sein de l’équipe de direction de l’usine
  • Fournir un support client en ce qui concerne les produits et services Montebello Packaging
  • Soutenir et contribuer aux initiatives d’amélioration continue de Montebello Packaging

RESPONSABILITÉS ESSENTIELLES

  • Gérer l’équipe AQ de l’usine: spécialistes QA et auditeurs qualité.
  • Fixer des objectifs annuels guidés par les lignes directrices annuelles de l’usine et de l’entreprise, pour le service AQ de l’usine.
  • Coacher et soutenir l’équipe AQ de l’usine en se référant aux procédures et normes de l’entreprise.
  • Suivi quotidien des problèmes de qualité ou des possibilités d’amélioration et des résultats.
  • Examen périodique des résultats des données en cours de traitement et des tendances acquises via la plate-forme SPC.
  • Saisissez les commentaires des clients dans le module ERP Réclamations des clients.
  • Mener des enquêtes pour la gestion des non-conformités internes ou externes et publier des rapports finaux.
  • Émettre des RMA lors du retour ou du crédit lié aux produits finis.
  • Diriger et terminer la résolution des problèmes liés à la non-conformité et s’assurer que la documentation requise est remplie.
  • Diriger et mener à bien les actions CAPA liées à la qualité au niveau de l’usine.
  • Émettre, au besoin, des évaluations de risques.
  • Veiller à ce que les demandes de changement ou de dérogation nécessaires soient dûment documentées et transmises pour examen et approbation.
  • Faire le suivi des rapports de lutte antiparasitaire et revoir le contrat annuel avec la direction de l’usine.
  • Approuver la certification de la norme d’étalonnage.
  • Préparer et héberger des audits d’usine (client ou entreprise).
  • Effectuer des audits internes périodiques de l’usine.
  • Être un membre actif de l’équipe de direction de l’usine.
  • Soutenir et contribuer aux projets d’amélioration continue de l’usine.
  • Diriger les activités d’amélioration continue du service AQ de l’usine.
  • Toute autre tâche assignée par la Direction Qualité des Opérations.

Votre profil et vos compétences

  • Baccalauréat en génie ou en sciences (un atout), ou diplôme d’études collégiales du Québec (DEC général ou technique) en génie ou en sciences.
  • 5 ans d’expérience dans les opérations de fabrication ou de qualité est un atout
  • Connaissance des systèmes informatisés
  • Expérience de la gestion des employés est un atout
  • Expérience dans les industries pharmaceutique, agro-alimentaire, des soins de santé, des cosmétiques et des aérosols est un atout
  • Expérience en extrusion choc aluminium et / ou utilisation de polymères (moulage par injection plastique, nappe stratifiée) dans la fabrication d’emballages, est un atout.
  • Expérience en Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma est un atout
  • La maîtrise du français et de l’anglais est nécessaire.

ABOUT MONTEBELLO PACKAGING

Montebello Packaging is a world-class manufacturer of tubes and containers for the pharmaceutical, cosmetics and food industries. The company is a division of the Jim Pattison Group, a $12.7 (CAD) billion conglomerate. Montebello Packaging employs 500 people and has four plants in North America.

THE CHALLENGES THAT AWAIT YOU

Reporting to the Quality Operations Manager, the Quality Operations Supervisor manages the QA team at the Lachine plant and is responsible for:

  • Maintain corporate quality standards at the plant level
  • Maintain and develop Quality Operations plant KPIs
  • Maintain and support plant related Quality Systems such as, but not limited to:
  • Procedures, Non-Conformance, Risk, Change, Investigations, and CAPA management processes.
  • Be an active player amongst the plant management team
  • Provide customer support in regards to Montebello products and services
  • Support and contribute to Montebello Packaging continuous improvement initiatives

ESSENTIAL TASKS:

  • Manage plant Q.Ops team : QA Specialists and Quality Auditors.
  • Set yearly objectives driven by both plant and corporate yearly guidelines, for the plant Q. Ops department.
  • Coach and support the plant Q. Ops team using corporate procedures and standards.
  • Daily follow ups on quality issues or improvement possibilities, and outcomes.
  • Periodic review of in-process data results and trends acquired through SPC platform.
  • Enter customer feedback in ERP Customer Complaints module.
  • Conduct investigations for internal or external non-conformance management, and issue final reports.
  • Issue RMA upon return or credit related to finished goods.
  • Lead and complete non-conformance related issue solving and ensure required documentation is completed.
  • Lead and complete quality related CAPA actions at the plant level.
  • When required, issue Risk Assessments.
  • Ensure required plant change or deviation requests are duly documented and forwarded for review and approval.
  • Follow up on pest control reports and review yearly contract with plant management.
  • Approve calibration standard certification.
  • Prepare and host plant audits (customer or corporate).
  • Conduct periodic internal plant audits.
  • Be an active member of the plant’s management team.
  • Support and contribute in plant continuous improvement projects.
  • Lead continuous improvement activities of the plant’s Q. Ops department.
  • Any other task assigned by Quality Operations Management.

Your profile and competencies

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Science (is an asset), or Quebec Diploma of College Studies (general or technical DEC) in Engineering or Science.
  • 5 years of experience in Manufacturing or Quality operations is an asset
  • Computerized systems knowledge
  • Experience with employee management is an asset
  • Experience in Pharmaceutical, Food / Beverage, Health Care, Cosmetic, Aerosol industries is an asset
  • Experience in aluminum impact extrusion and/or polymer use (plastic injection molding, laminate web) in manufacturing of packaging, is an asset.
  • Experience in Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma is an asset
  • Fluency in French and English is required.

The advantages of joining our team

  • Being part of a small company with the advantages of a large group;
  • High quality products;
  • Great work atmosphere ;
  • Employee recognition;
  • Full benefits (health, dental, vision, vacations, free parking...)

title: Quality Assurance/ Quality Control Supervisor
description:
Quality Assurance/ Quality Control Supervisor

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection alarm, communications security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

Under the supervision of the Operations-Engineering Liaison Manager, the QA/QC Supervisor will be responsible for addressing all matters relating to Quality including Quality Assurance and Quality Engineering. Responsibilities will include documentation, standardization, providing training and leadership. The QA/QC Supervisor will recommend continuous improvement activities to reduce cost, cycle time and scrap. The successful candidate will also be responsible for eliminating non-value-added activities, increasing efficiency, and improving plant resource utilization.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead with all aspects of Quality Control and Quality Assurance.
  • Manage Corrective Action Requests/Reports (CAR) and apply quality engineering problem-solving techniques to CARS (Corrective Action Requests Standards)
  • Logue and track CAR, HOLD and other database issues.
  • Develop responses and follow up on corrective actions from suppliers and customers.
  • Engage in problem solving as required using various tools and techniques
  • Utilize statistical techniques in problem solving.
  • Develop and Manage containment processes and process/inventory purges when necessary.
  • Respond to any Quality issues as the first line of defense and recommend technical solutions
  • maintain quality standards.
  • Maintain and co-ordinate Quality meetings/ minutes
  • Assist with internal and external audit readiness. (ISO 9001)
  • Conduct Process Audits.
  • Conduct Production 1st OFFs product reviews
  • Interpret design standards, processes and procedures
  • Quality leadership resource, direct and support quality process implementation.
  • Encourage and implement continuous improvement in process.
  • Perform root cause analysis and pursue corrective action if required
  • Participate in Lean/5S/continuous improvement initiatives
  • Maintain, develop, and approve site quality documentation and records.
  • Recommend Improvements to manufacturing workflow.
  • All other duties as assigned. 

 

Requirements and Skills:

  • Internal Auditor Certification is preferred.
  • College Diploma or higher in a related field (Quality, Mechanical or Electronic technician/technologist) or equivalent work experience.
  • 5 years of experience in Mechanical/Industrial Engineering.
  • Previous experience in the Electrical Manufacturing industry
  • Previous experience in Quality Assurance or Quality Control.
  • Exposure to Lean Manufacturing practices.
  • Knowledge in Quality Management System – ISO 9001:2015/ TS 16949/QS 9000 or equivalent.
  • Ability to problem-solve.
  • Ability to read and interpret drawings, specifications, and technical standards.
  • Knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerances, statistics, and measurement techniques.
  • Good interpersonal and communication (verbal written) skills.
  • Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy.
  • Ability to work efficiently under pressure with simultaneous deadlines.
  • Ability to maintain confidential information in a professional manner.
  • Proficiency in MS Office programs, SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics AX, other
  • Ability to work effectively with all levels of management (Inter and Intra Departments)
  • Understanding and compliance with applicable Joint Health and Safety requirements ((WIMIS, other).

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

All candidates are asked to submit their resume to Human Resources.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Disclaimer: Mircom does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or w

title: Quality Assurance/ Quality Control Supervisor
description:
Quality Assurance/ Quality Control Supervisor

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection & alarm, communications & security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation & smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

Under the supervision of the Operations-Engineering Liaison Manager, the QA/QC Supervisor will be responsible for addressing all matters relating to Quality including Quality Assurance and Quality Engineering. Responsibilities will include documentation, standardization, providing training and leadership. The QA/QC Supervisor will recommend continuous improvement activities to reduce cost, cycle time and scrap. The successful candidate will also be responsible for eliminating non-value-added activities, increasing efficiency, and improving plant resource utilization.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead with all aspects of Quality Control and Quality Assurance.
  • Manage Corrective Action Requests/Reports (CAR) and apply quality engineering problem-solving techniques to CARS (Corrective Action Requests Standards)
  • Logue and track CAR, HOLD and other database issues.
  • Develop responses and follow up on corrective actions from suppliers and customers.
  • Engage in problem solving as required using various tools and techniques
  • Utilize statistical techniques in problem solving.
  • Develop and Manage containment processes and process/inventory purges when necessary.
  • Respond to any Quality issues as the first line of defense and recommend technical solutions
  • maintain quality standards.
  • Maintain and co-ordinate Quality meetings/ minutes
  • Assist with internal and external audit readiness. (ISO 9001)
  • Conduct Process Audits.
  • Conduct Production 1st OFFs product reviews
  • Interpret design standards, processes and procedures
  • Quality leadership resource, direct and support quality process implementation.
  • Encourage and implement continuous improvement in process.
  • Perform root cause analysis and pursue corrective action if required
  • Participate in Lean/5S/continuous improvement initiatives
  • Maintain, develop, and approve site quality documentation and records.
  • Recommend Improvements to manufacturing workflow.
  • All other duties as assigned. 

 

Requirements and Skills:

  • Internal Auditor Certification is preferred.
  • College Diploma or higher in a related field (Quality, Mechanical or Electronic technician/technologist) or equivalent work experience.
  • 5 years of experience in Mechanical/Industrial Engineering.
  • Previous experience in the Electrical Manufacturing industry
  • Previous experience in Quality Assurance or Quality Control.
  • Exposure to Lean Manufacturing practices.
  • Knowledge in Quality Management System – ISO 9001:2015/ TS 16949/QS 9000 or equivalent.
  • Ability to problem-solve.
  • Ability to read and interpret drawings, specifications, and technical standards.
  • Knowledge of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerances, statistics, and measurement techniques.
  • Good interpersonal and communication (verbal & written) skills.
  • Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy.
  • Ability to work efficiently under pressure with simultaneous deadlines.
  • Ability to maintain confidential information in a professional manner.
  • Proficiency in MS Office programs, SharePoint, Microsoft Dynamics AX, other
  • Ability to work effectively with all levels of management (Inter and Intra Departments)
  • Understanding and compliance with applicable Joint Health and Safety requirements ((WIMIS, other).

 

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

All candidates are asked to submit their resume to Human Resources.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Disclaimer: Mircom does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or w

title: Nuclear Fuel Bundle Assembly Operator (Peterborough, ON, CA)
description:
At BWXT Nuclear Energy Canada Inc.  we are committed to excellence in every business initiative. BWXT Nuclear Energy Canada (BWXT NEC) has achieved an enviable international reputation for excellence in the supply of nuclear fuel and fuel handling systems and service for CANDU reactors in both domestic and international markets. Our success is the result of our commitment to our employees, customers, quality & EHS initiatives.

 

BWXT Nuclear Energy Canada Inc. is looking for a Nuclear Fuel Bundle Assembly Operator for their operation in Peterborough, Ontario.

 

Are you serious about safety and quality of products?

Are you interested in continuing your career within the nuclear industry?

Do you enjoy working within an automated manufacturing environment?

 

If you answered yes to all of the above, this just might be the opportunity you have been looking for!

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

Safety Awareness

  • Strict adherence to Job Safety Hazard Analysis, Ontario Health & Safety Act & Regulations and all Plant Safety Rules/Protocols.
  • Identify safety issues and concerns.
  • Take corrective action; monitor the corrective action.

 

Quality

  • Strict adherence to prescribed procedures.
  • Ensure high quality output.
  • Take preventative action.

 

Technical and Professional Knowledge

  • Understand technical terminology and developments.
  • Know how and when to apply a technical skill or procedure.
  • Perform complex tasks in area of expertise.

 

Managing Work

  • Prioritize
  • Make preparation
  • Schedule
  • Leverage resources
  • Stay focused

 

Applied Learning

  • Learn to operate machines, equipment and computers.
  • Learn to use a computer to input or retrieve information.

 

Energy

  • Meet demanding productivity goals.
  • Perform repetitive work without losing effectiveness.
  • Keep up with high-speed equipment and/or production demand.

 

Housekeeping

  • Maintain clean work area at all times.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

 

  • Grade 12 Technical graduate.
  • Valid class ‘G’ driver’s license.
  • Demonstrated team player.
  • Basic computer skills to include Microsoft office.
  • Candidates must successfully pass background clearance.
  • Experience in the nuclear industry.
  • Experience with operating machines/equipment in an automated manufacturing environment.
  • Community College Diploma in related technical subjects.

 

You will be required to demonstrate the following Competencies:

  • Quality
  • Safety Awareness
  • Applied Learning
  • Managing work
  • Team work

 

We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.

 

BWXT Nuclear Energy Canada Inc. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, a conviction for which a pardon has been granted or a record suspended or any other category protected by federal law.

Requirements: 
  • Experience Working with CNC Wood Working Machinery.

title: Associate, Manufacturing
description:
Company Profile:

Genevant is a technology-focused nucleic acid delivery company with world-class platforms, the industryâ€™s most robust and expansive lipid nanoparticle (LNP) patent estate, and decades of experience and expertise in nucleic acid drug delivery and development. We leverage our world-class delivery systems to bring new medicines to patients who need them, in collaboration with leading pharma companies. Our laboratories and offices are based in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia.

Role Summary:

Genevant has an opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join our Manufacturing group as an Associate.  The Associate, Manufacturing will produce mRNA lipid nanoparticle (LNP) products for multiple development programs. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Manufacturing and Supply Chain this person will play a key role within an experienced and supportive team.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct the manufacturing activities required to produce research-scale batches of mRNA LNP in the Genevant laboratory
  • Record production activities in batch records, prepare production summary reports and investigation reports, prepare analytical test reports
  • Prepare technical documents including batch records and manufacturing instructions
  • Maintain the laboratory manufacturing space in a clean and organized state
  • Monitor equipment performance and schedule maintenance as needed
  • Monitor and maintain the inventory of production supplies
  • Conduct laboratory analytical testing for particle size, RNA encapsulation, pH, endotoxin content 
  • Prepare and deliver presentations summarizing production outcomes and test results

Qualifications:

  • B.Sc. or similar diploma in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biotechnology or a related discipline
  • A proven record of achievement with at least 2 years of relevant experience in a laboratory environment
  • Analytical experience general lab methods including spectrophotometric and fluorometric analysis
  • Knowledge of nucleic acid-based therapeutics and lipid delivery systems is preferred
  • Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment within a diverse organization
  • Self-reliant and motivated to complete production tasks on schedule without constant supervision
  • Enthusiastic and with an aptitude for laboratory bench work and data analysis   
  • Able to multi-task and effectively manage scheduling
  • Strong written and oral communications skills
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel in particular) for data analysis and graphing

title: Warehouse and Materials Clerk
description:
Job Description:

 

Do you want to work for a stable, growing organization that reaches back more than 130 years?   Our steel tube and pipe products have helped build landmarks and buildings in North America; Come build your career at Zekelman Industries.

 

Z Modular, a division of Zekelman Industries, seeks a Warehouse and Materials Clerk to assist in the overall effectiveness and efficiency involved in the production of modular units.   Frequent communication with production, in addition to purchasing, stockroom, and leadership teams will be required.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Receive materials into the ERP system (inbound deliveries)
  • Work with purchasing team to fix any PO discrepancies in order to receive materials properly into the ERP system
  • Issue materials from inventory to production/projects
  • Assign inventory location descriptions to materials
  • Data entry for various inventory transactions
  • Print labels for inventory items
  • Print and track material requests from production
  • Generate various reports required by the warehouse/materials team in excel,
  • Communicate to the warehouse/material team all parts needed by production for upcoming modular builds.
  • Other duties as assignment by management.
  • Regular, full-time, predictable onsite attendance per the posted schedule is an essential function of this role

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma required
  • Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office, particularly MS Excel
  • General understanding of ERP systems & their effect on business
  • Knowledge of SAP and Kronos is desirable
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Ability to work remotely after being oriented to tasks within the plant
  • Lead and promote health and safety work practices as required by regulatory agencies and company policy

Physical Abilities:

  • Must be able to move objects and use abdominal and lower back muscles to provide support over time without fatigue. Constant movement and use of limbs; this position requires good manual dexterity, coordination and stamina.
  • Must be able to remain in a stationary position for several hours
  • Regular, full-time, predictable onsite attendance per the posted schedule is an essential function of this role
  • Ability to lift, climb, bend, stoop, push and pull.
  • Must be able to lift 60lbs.
  • Must be able to stand for 10-12 hours
  • Ability to perform work in a plant/manufacturing environment
  • Other physical requirements as needed for job

 

 

Zekelman Industries offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits, including high quality medical, dental and vision benefits. In addition, we have an amazing tuition assistance program, and an RRSP with a generous company match.

 

Zekelman is an  Equal Opportunity Employer  compliant with  all Ontario law & Human Rights Code  in providing accommodation to persons with disabilities and to ensuring an accessible environment. Zekelman will accommodate persons with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and persons with disabilities will be accommodated on hiring and during employment.

Should you require accommodation, please do not hesitate to request it.

 

We are Zekelman Industries.

 

We manufacture superior quality tubular and related products and provide outstanding service for our valued customers.

 

We seek to continuously advance the skills and opportunities of our employees, utilizing the latest technology and management tools available to consistently increase profitability and the enterprise value of Zekelman Industries and of our customers.

title: Brunswick Bierworks - Quality Control Lab Technician
description:
Our mission at Brunswick Bierworks is to be Canada's most trusted, best performing brewery and premium beverage partner. Our focus on quality extends to every aspect of the brewery – especially our team members. We attract individuals who are dedicated to outstanding performance and products. In return, we are committed to providing you with every opportunity to reach your highest potential while working under the leadership of the award-winning, world-class Master Brewer, Christian Riemerschmid von der Heide. In addition to a competitive compensation package, we also offer:

• Comprehensive benefits plans

• Bonus pools and incentives

• Opportunities for advancement and career growth

• Training and mentorship from a world class brewing team

To learn more, check out www.brunswickbierworks.com

Key Responsibilities

• Test products at different stages in their lifecycle to assess quality, sensory condition, and

compliance with specifications

• Collaborate with Production to monitor the weekly schedule and ensure products have been QC-released and which products coming down the pipeline will need QC-testing

• Aseptically collect and process micro samples from fermentors downstream to packaged goods

• Calibrate and maintain laboratory equipment. Run lab proficiency samples to ensure our

equipment, procedures, and methods are reliable and accurate

• Identify and raise quality and compliance concerns to the Lab team; monitor as necessary

• Assist in troubleshooting continuous improvement, quality, and innovation projects with members of the Lab and Production teams

• Record, analyze, and summarize quality data for Quality Managers & communicate to necessary team members

• Champion quality-first behaviours & methodologies by providing guidance to Production team members

• Flexibility on shifts; evenings, weekends, holidays as required

    The Successful Lab Tech Will Have:

    • A post-secondary Degree or Diploma in Brewing, Food Science, Microbiology, Oenology, Chemistry, Engineering, Quality Control/ Assurance, or a related discipline

    • Previous experience in a similar role; brewery or food and beverage manufacturing experience is considered an asset

    • Ability to maintain attention to detail while managing competing priorities in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment

    • Flexibility to shift priorities quickly & respond to urgent matters dictated by production needs

    • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to act as a quality ambassador to our brewery partners

    Though not required, it would be great if you have experience with:

    • Established continuous improvement food safety management systems such as GFSI, FSSC 22000, BRC, or SQF

    • ISO 17025 and/or ISO 9001 requirements

    • Sensory training or sensory panel management

    • Analytical chemistry and instrumental analysis in areas such as GC, HPLC, or distillation, with experience in sample preparation and analysis

    • Statistical analysis, data mining, or data visualization techniques on complex datasets

    Brunswick Bierworks is a collective of brewery partners with a focus on collaboration and innovation, while our obsession for quality and freshness means superb craft beer with every pint. Our state-of-the-art, open concept brewery consists of a fully automated Main Brewhouse for larger production, while our pilot system can be utilized for recipe development, one-off brews, and smaller batch seasonal beers.

    Thank you for applying to our position! We are committed to providing equal opportunities for persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process, at the candidate's request.

title: Grinder Polisher
description:
We have an immediate job vacancy for an experienced grinder and polisher near Winston Churchill and Lakeshore in the south Mississauga area with prominent manufacturing production company who specializes in wallboard products that are used around the world.

This opportunity is a direct hire role, not contract or temporary work. In this role as a grinder and polisher, you will be responsible for duties such as grinding and polishing metal parts. If you want to build your mechanical skills and have the opportunity to cross train and progress with a stable career, see below for more details:

Job Title: Grinder and polisher

Duration: DIERECT HIRE

Location: Winston Churchill and Lakeshore Rd W (Mississauga)

Start time:
Mornings SUN-THURS
5AM-3:30PM OR 6AM - 4:30PM
OT available on Friday's (after 40 hours!)

Wage: $20/hr - $25/hr

Advantages
- Working with an industry leader in North America
- Direct hire opportunity
- Excellent training program
- Long term career opportunity
- Cross training available
- Competitive compensation package



Responsibilities
General Duties of a grinder and polisher:
- Grinding and polishing metal parts that are used to make drywall
- Handling fabricated parts that need to be prepped for painting
- Will use hand and power tools for simple assembly
- Inspecting parts to ensure no defects and surface finish is acceptable to industry standards
- Assisting machinists
- Assisting other departments when needed, including shipping/receiving, prep & paint
- Lifting up to 50lbs
- Other duties as assigned

Qualifications
- Previous manufacturing and or production experience
- Auto industry preferred
- Familiar with hand and power tools for assembly
- The ideal candidate should be able to work effectively in a repetitive role
- Junior candidates welcomed to apply!

Summary
If you are interested in this grinder and polisher opportunity, please contact us by:
- Applying directly to this job ad
- Send your resume to charlotte.dcunha@randstad.ca
- TEXT "GRINDER" AT 647 770 6419

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Warehouse Lead
description:
The Warehouse Lead is responsible for tracking, data collection and data entry for raw materials and purchased parts. This role supports various initiatives linked to materials review committee and materials review board activities, including facilitating process changes and development, performing assessments and root cause analysis, lessons learned capture, and application of tracking and data entry into the MRP System in support of new ship construction. Additionally, the Warehouse Lead supports the cycle count management.

Duties and Accountabilities

  • Coordinates tracking, data collection and data entry for raw materials and purchased parts for new ship construction.
  • Partners with Warehousing Teams, Production Control Technicians and Procurement ensuring trade workers have tracked and reported deficiencies, defects or damages to Raw Materials or Parts to complete required processes linked to the Material Review Board activities.
  • Performs assessments, root cause analysis and planning to prioritize workflow and initiates conversations with Production Control to support parts and materials replacements in various stages of construction in potentially at offsite Storage Locations from VSY.
  • Shares and promotes performance improvement methodologies with employees to develop skills and facilitates a continuous improvement culture.
  • Researches, evaluates, and implements current industry best practice methods, procedures, and technology, as relevant to assigned tasks.
  • Works within all Safety, Cost, Quality and Efficiency schedules set forth by VSY Seaspan.
  • Accountable for interpreting, tracking, and reporting specifications and manufacturing information, ensuring Raw Materials and Parts are put through the MRP and Tracked for Engineering, Design, or Damage aspects incurred pre or postproduction.
  • Prepares and provides reporting on daily and weekly production.
  • Performs additional duties as assigned.

Education and Experience

  • College degree or APICS certification is preferred.
  • Lean Green Belt and/or Six Sigma training.
  • Minimum 5 years of post-secondary experience working in an inventory related position preferably in manufacturing environment, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Previous experience in a supervisory role.
  • Previous experience as an Inventory or Warehousing Coordinator preferred.
  • Prior experience in shipbuilding/heavy manufacturing is desirable.

Skills, Knowledge and Competencies

  • Communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Proficient with MS Office products and web-based applications.
  • Organizational skills and the ability to work independently or within a team dynamic.
  • Appreciates and understands the value of diversity within a team.
  • Ability to make mature and timely job site decision.
  • High degree of tenacity, self-motivation, and innovation.
  • Analytical skills to capture and analyze/synthesize data, confirming its accuracy and adequacy.
  • Knowledge of process improvement techniques.
  • Good understanding of organizational change management.
  • Knowledge of manufacturing processes.
  • Knowledge of group technology, lean manufacturing, and process analysis tools and methodologies.
  • Working knowledge of IFS and JD Edwards software.
  • Knowledge in the ongoing operation of warehousing which supports a manufacturing environment.
  • Ability to maintain appropriate and complete documentation regarding regulated products and/or hazardous materials.
  • Knowledge of the application of Controlled Goods and International Traffic in Arms (ITAR) Regulations.
  • Demonstration of outstanding business ethics, integrity, and honesty in all situations.
  • Exposure to a noisy environment and outside weather conditions.

title: General Machine Operator (Afternoon Shift)
description:
General Machine Operator

(Afternoon shift 4:00 PM to 12:30 AM) 

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection & alarm, communications & security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation & smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Responsibilites & Duties:

  • Provide general support in the metal shop.
  • Operate machinery such as brakes & presses, shears, etc.
  • Load required tooling into the machine.
  • Produce and verify product piece to the drawing specs and identify it as “first off”
  • Perform maintenance as per outlined requirements.
  • Assemble and fit plates and sections to form structures.
  • Weld or bolt sections together.
  • Set up and operate heavy-duty metal-working machines.
  • Stock shelves and move material need it to machine.
  • Unload metal when delivered and store it.
  • Prepare all metal items for painting.
  • Follow Supervisor/Team Lead instructions.

Skills, Experience & Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in a metal shop environment.
  • Previous exposure to welding, punch press and brake press would be preferred.
  • Must be able to frequently lift 30lbs and up to 50lbs occasionally.
  • Able to work in a noisy shop environment
  • Must have steel-toed safety boots
  • Able to read blueprints
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Counterbalance forklift certification need it, with minimum 6 months experience

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

Interested applicants please forward a copy of your cover letter and resume to Human Resources.


We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Mircom Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer that considers all applicants regardless of cultural background, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, family status, disability or any other grounds as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code.  In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Mircom is committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive work environment for all individuals with disabilities in a respectful and dignified manner. Accommodations will be made available, upon request, to applicants who have specialized needs throughout the recruitment process.

Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. We will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

title: Profile Plastic Extrusion Operator
description:
Description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Plastic Extrusion Machine Operator for our client who prides themselves on their production based on innovative designs.
Agilus is recruiting for a Plastic Extrusion Machine Operator in the skilled trades in Winnipeg, Manitoba.
This position is a full-time permanent role situated in St. Boniface area. Our client is a well known manufacturing company of quality plastic products and leads in providing the best customer service to its clientele.
Duties:
  • • Select Machine Dies
  • • Synchronize speed of extrusions
  • • Ensure conformance to specifications / adjust as necessary
  • • Set control to regulate vacuum, air pressure, sizing rings and temperature
  • • Troubleshoot and make minor adjustments to equipment
  • • Pack items for shipping and distribution
  • • Monitor and inspect quality of material produced

Requirements:
  • • Must have a forklift operator certification
  • • Must have 1-2 years of extrusion experience in a similar role
  • • Good communication skills, written and verbal
  • • Available to work in evening shift
  • • Must have a valid driver's license and a reliable vehicle

What's in it for you:
  • Competitive salary is offered based on experience.
  • Benefits package and paid vacation

Interested?
Please apply directly online or contact Charmaine by email cpadaoan@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Forklift Operator - Morning/ Afternoon Shift 1307
description:
Are you a â€œfoodieâ€ and love cookies, muffins and pancakes?  Are you are looking for a company where we place high value on teamwork, collaboration, innovation?  Are you looking to gain experience and grow your career with a successful international company?

If you are looking to do the best work of your career, be a part of an extraordinary company and have a passion for what we do, we want to hear from you!

Cerelia Bakery Canada is currently looking to add some awesome new team members to our facility in Mississauga, ON. You will be a critical part of delivering our products to customers everywhere!

About Cerelia Bakery Canada:

We develop and produce exceptionally high-quality products including: Fresh & frozen cookie dough and muffin batter in pre-portion sizes and scoop and bake pails for the foodservice industry as well as in-store bakeries of North American grocery, mass and club stores.

Our baked gourmet cookies and muffins are produced for distribution through multiple channels, including quick service restaurants. Refrigerated products including cookie, pastry and biscuit dough sold to North American Grocery Stores in a variety of formats including canister, chub, break-and-bake and place-and-bake.

Our Research and Development is on-going, aimed at introducing new and exciting products to complement our delectable bakery lines. We are an aggressive, flexible company dedicated to providing quality products that satisfy customer needs and market place demands.

Most importantly, we are GROWING.  As we grow, our team members grow with us.  

About this Position:

The Forklift Operator is responsible for ensuring seamless processing of incoming and outgoing shipments for customers and between company locations. The Forklift Operator understands the impact of this position to other business functions that depend on the accuracy and efficiency of outgoing items and must keep constant communication between production and their department. The Forklift Operator must be prepared to work as a team member with minimal supervision, follow all safety and food safety procedures, and have a high threshold for cold in a manufacturing environment.

Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

  • Work with multiple different teams to move, load, unload, and store our products to be packaged and shipped.
  • Operate forklifts in a safe and prescribed manner keeping the safety of self and others as priority.
  • Operate in tight spaces and manage FIFO to ensure proper product is moving to customers.
  • Float from one production station to another effortlessly to ensure product quality standards are maintained.
  • Adhere to proper GMP and safety procedures and guidelines.
  • Ensure our high-quality standards are being met with every batch we produce by checking each batch for quality and accuracy - delivering a world class finished product each time.
  • Support other departments and functions of production as required.
  • Adhering to all policies, procedures and programs of the company (GMP, Quality, Food Safety and Health & Safety etc) at all times.
  • Other related duties and assigned.

Working Conditions:

  • Weekend work required
  • Overtime as required
  • Ability to lift at least 50 lbs
  • Fast paced environment
  • Physical Demands: Bend, Carry, Lift, Push/Pull, Reach, Standing for long periods
  • Ability to work in a hot/cold environment
  • Valid forklift license (Counter Balance & Reach Truck)

What you will receive in return:

  • Competitive Wage of 21$/hr 
  • Guaranteed Overtime 
  • Two Shifts 6 am to 2:30 pm/ 2:30 pm to 11 pm
  • Fully Employer Paid Medical Insurance includes Dental & Vision.
  • Life Insurance
  • 2 Weeks Paid Vacation.
  • RRSP
  • Comprehensive training program, tailored to each individual - regardless if you're a food manufacturing veteran or new to the industry, we will ensure you receive the training you need to succeed.
  • Clean and safe production facility.
  • Career advancement opportunities.

Cerelia Bakery welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If you are eager and excited to work with a company driven by quality, commitment to excellence, and an awesome product, we want to hear from you!

title: Mechanical designer
description:
• develops concepts or new products according to specific applications;
  • develops study, motion and manufacturing drawings;
  • performs, depending on the need, Design drawings;
  • performs the various necessary models for new products;
  • participates in the collection of the data necessary for the preparation and concretization of new equipment;
  • solves the problems inherent in projects;
  • makes the choice of material, component design and ensure the functionality of the product before manufacturing;
  • chooses the appropriate materials and components on the approval of its superior;
  • ensures that equipment or parts of designed equipment comply with the standards and mechanical standards as established;
  • participates in The search for maximum standardization of the elements on the machinery;
  • completes plans and technical drawings prepared for P Rojets;
  • makes the drawings with the detail plans of the parts of a system;
  • makes assembly drawings;
  • writes and updates The documentation of catalogs and manuals;
  • executes, if necessary, any other related tasks related to its sector of activity.

title: MECHANICAL TOOLING ENGINEER
description:
ABOUT MONTEBELLO PACKAGING

Montebello Packaging is a world-class manufacturer of tubes and containers for the pharmaceutical, cosmetics and food industries. The company is a division of the Jim Pattison Group, a $12.7 (CAD) billion conglomerate. Montebello Packaging employs 500 people and has four plants in North America.

Today Montebello Packaging is looking for a mechanical tooling & automation engineer.

ESSENTIAL TASKS:

-Design and Model in 3D SolidWorks products, tooling, machine components, sub-assemblies and mechanisms

-Hold regular mechanical design project reviews with Engineering Team and compile minutes

-Produce detailed drawings suitable for outside manufacturing

-Prepare as-built documentation for tooling and completed automation machines and projects

-Direct and review technical manuals for all manufactured machines and systems

-Automate CAD drawing processes and administrate PDM drawings and documents revision -control in the vault

-Create detailed BOM for machine component purchasing

-Liaise closely with Manufacturing department to ensure accuracy of prints and efficiency of manufacturing of parts

-Direct, review and approve product or machine design and changes

-Mentor new design or drafting employees, assign and direct their work and provide necessary training to improve their design skills

-Define and report detailed project tasks, timelines and resources

-Support Quality and Sales with Technical evaluations and reports

-Communicate with Customers and update them project milestone status and deliverables

Your profile and competencies:

-Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering

-OIQ membership

-Solidworks CAD, PDM and Simulation experience

-5-10 years or more in relevant tooling design, manufacturing engineering and/or automation projects

-Working knowledge in plastics and mold making materials and tools is an asset

-Tooling design experience (impact extrusion, injection molding)

-Machining understanding

-Control system design and implementation

-Project management and multi-tasking ability

-Motivate people and share the vison as well as details required to lead the Team through the projects

-Complex Problem Solving and Troubleshooting

-Communication skills required for meetings, interviews, issuing directives and rephrasing technical issues to non-technical audience

-Responsibility to technical staff whether it is of corrective or praising nature

-Time Management

-Delegate effectively, by knowing staff’s strengths and weaknesses and to identify necessary training opportunities to the Team

The advantages of joining our team

-Being part of a small company with the advantages of a large group;

-High quality products;

-Great work atmosphere ;

-Employee recognition;

-Full benefits (health, dental, vision, vacations, free parking...) ;
