title: Gerneral Machinist
description:
General Machinist:

Due to growth we are currently recruiting a General Machinist for our customers R&D/Engineering facility located in Cambridge, ON. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a great team with a state of the art facility and work directly with an automation development team, separate from production.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

  • Ability to set up composite parts

  • Manual Machining with both Mill and Lathe

  • Working with Multi-Axis Milling machines

  • Review design & program for potential errors and inefficiencies

  • Setup cutting tools to support machining processes.

  • Observe the machining process and apply corrective measures if needed

  • Accurately Measure parts with appropriate tools

  • Perform all other duties as assigned

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Red Seal Certification or equivalent experience

  • CNC Set-Up experience

  • CNC Milling Experience

  • Ability to multi-axis work as well as program edits

  • Self-motivated with a positive attitude

  • Able to work under minimum supervision

  • CIP focused

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Machinist or Tool and Die License or Apprentice

If you are interested in more details on the General Machinist opportunity please contact Hugh at Steve@itecgroup.ca

itec group Inc . emphasizes the importance of building effective relationships between candidates and industry leading companies. We recruit for the IT, engineering/advanced manufacturing and construction industries. We offer individuals looking for contract or full-time positions desirable career opportunities. Our committed team who are leaders within the recruitment industry have built a foundation of solid working relationships based on quality service, integrity and respect. itec group Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. By applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related to the consideration of employment through itec group and its clients.

In order to stay in touch, we require your consent. Canada' s anti-spam legislation (CASL) came into effect on July 1, 2014, and requires us to obtain the consent of our Canadian applicants to continue to receive electronic communication. On your online application, please include the line " I consent to receiving commercial electronic messages regarding this and other opportunities

title: Production Planner
description:
Production PlannerTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Measurement & Analytics division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers. With thousands of experts around the world and high-performance digital technology, ABB's team is dedicated to making measurement easy for its industrial and energy customers to let them operate more efficiently and profitably.This role involves providing assistance in the development of the planning and fulfillment processes, skills and tools, working to assist in performance improvement projects.You will perform detailed evaluations for planning and fulfillment metrics (inventory, on-time delivery, lead-time, forecast accuracy, resource utilization).
This position reports to
Project Planning & Controls Manager
Your responsibilities

  • Develop and maximize the scheduling of production schedules according to the needs of customers, human and material resources required, and then transmit them to the various parties involved.
  • Follow up daily on the performance of planned productions and advise the persons concerned of delays, if any.
  • Analyze the results of the performance indicators of his section.
  • Write various management reports.
  • Ensure the proper management of the inventories of the assigned cells.
  • Actively participate in organizational efficiency improvement projects.

Your background
  • Graduate in Business Administration GSO or Industrial Engineering
  • Be a good leader and have an excellent team spirit
  • Good analytical and synthesis skills
  • Good time management and work organization
  • Autonomy, adaptability/polyvalence
  • Mastery of good manufacturing business practices
  • Fluency in French (spoken and written) and English (functional)
  • Good time management and work organization

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Shipper/Receiver -- Manufacturing Warehouse
description:
Shipper/Receiver -- Manufacturing Warehouse


Support growing customer base, handle incoming shipments, and ensure all customs documentations and shipments are carried out within the required time lines.


Location: Edmonton, Alberta


Your Challenge:


+ Works to help the flow of shipments both inbound and outbound in the manner that is most cost effective. Works to resolve errors and issues with customers. Files required documentation with trucking companies for corrective action.

+ Routes outbound delivered loads and inbound back-hauls. Utilizes logistics software.

+ Creates required export documentation to support US cross boarder and international shipments

+ Coordinates common carrier activities.

+ Maintains customer delivery time windows. Manages communications associated with shipments.

+ Timely handling of incoming suppliers' shipments and coordination with Quality, Purchasing, and Warehouse departments


Your Expertise:


+ Minimum education requirement: High School

+ 1 years of related work experience, valve experience is preferred.

+ knowledge of FedEx, UPS, Purolator, DHL, and Loomis systems

+ Knowledge in packaging and dealing with international crating


This position may require exposure to information which is subject to US export control regulations such as the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must meet eligibility requirements of the ITAR and of the Controlled Goods Directorate (CDG) and/or a Canadian government security clearance.


Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition (TA_COE@curtisswright.com) and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection alarm, communications security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Responsibilites Duties:

  • Provide general support in the metal shop.
  • Operate machinery such as brakes presses, shears, etc.
  • Load required tooling into the machine.
  • Produce and verify product piece to the drawing specs and identify it as “first off”
  • Perform maintenance as per outlined requirements.
  • Assemble and fit plates and sections to form structures.
  • Weld or bolt sections together.
  • Set up and operate heavy-duty metal-working machines.
  • Stock shelves and move material need it to machine.
  • Unload metal when delivered and store it.
  • Prepare all metal items for painting.
  • Follow Supervisor/Team Lead instructions.

Skills, Experience Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in a metal shop environment.
  • Previous exposure to welding, punch press and brake press would be preferred.
  • Must be able to frequently lift 30lbs and up to 50lbs occasionally.
  • Able to work in a noisy shop environment
  • Must have steel-toed safety boots
  • Able to read blueprints
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Counterbalance forklift certification need it, with minimum 6 months experience

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

Interested applicants please forward a copy of your cover letter and resume to Human Resources.


We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Mircom Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer that considers all applicants regardless of cultural background, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, family status, disability or any other grounds as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code.  In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Mircom is committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive work environment for all individuals with disabilities in a respectful and dignified manner. Accommodations will be made available, upon request, to applicants who have specialized needs throughout the recruitment process. 

Disclaimer: Mircom does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. We will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

title: Quality Agent Non-Destructive Testing
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
In your role, you will:
  • Interpret codes, standards, and other contractual documents,
  • Verify that the preparation of the parts complies with the requirements of the method,
  • Possess the knowledge and skills necessary to prepare and adjust equipment, inspect parts, interpret and evaluate results to determine the acceptance or rejection of components in accordance with procedures,
  • Perform the interpretation and evaluation of specific products, or forms of products,
  • Record inspection results,
  • Interpret standards, codes and specifications and translate them into work instruction for level 3 approval in the method,
  • Propose a technique for a specific inspection,

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You have a D.E.C. or a D.E.P. or an equivalent in the field of Non-Destructive Testing,
  • You have a graduate of a Metallurgical Engineering Technology or Metallurgy Inspection program,or
  • You have an equivalence of a technical field recognized by the Non-Destructive Testing sector,or
  • You hold a certification in Non-Destructive Testing from the Canadian General Standards Office (CGSB), or the American Society for Nondestructive Testing (ASNT), or
  • You have a Level 2 certification in a Non-Destructive Testing method in accordance with National Aircraft Standard-410 (NAS-410), or European Standard 4179 (EN4179),
  • You have a good knowledge of materials, manufacturing processes and defects that may appear in manufacturing.
  • You have fluency in French and English, both oral and written – would be an asset.
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Reports to: Mechanical Engineering Manager
Position Type: Permanent, Full-Time

Summary:

We are looking for a highly motivated and energetic Mechanical Engineer to join our team in Aurora. The successful candidate will be responsible for the full product development cycle of new antenna and filter products (from product research to pre-production) for use primarily with base station systems, vehicles and handheld devices in public safety and mobile communications systems. In addition to short term deployment-driven tasks, you will have the opportunity to develop novel concepts and innovative new designs that satisfy long term product needs of the market and company.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop new antenna and RF filter products by studying customer requirements and regulations.
  • Conduct all mechanical aspects of product development cycle including the conceptual design, DFMEA, FEA analysis, optimization, parts draft, assembly, test, product release, project technical report, material and cost report. 
  • Perform derivative product designs, product performance improvement and error correction.
  • Explore new design technologies, enhance professional job knowledge by tracking and understanding emerging manufacturing technologies and practices.
  • Perform product improvement and cost reduction.
  • Document engineering design by recording engineering design requirements, theory, simulation and test results, material and hours tracking, filling engineering design reports.
  • Specify hardware and material to comply with product specifications, manufacturing requirements and target cost.
  • Create or approve product drawings, release documents, specifications, customer manual, manufacturing assembly and test instructions. 
  • Provide engineering information and support other department to resolve technical problems.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

Personal Attributes:

  • Able to work in a rapidly changing environment, highly proficient in design planning to ensure timely completion of assignments, willing to work in a team environment and having excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Must be able to accommodate multiple projects in a deadline-oriented environment, must be self-directed and willing to take initiative.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in mechanical engineering or equivalent area of study
  • 3 years of industry experience developing and testing products for commercial applications
  • Strong professional experience in mechanical design and product building for high volume and low-cost production
  • Solid understanding of fabrication/manufacturing processes
  • Proficiency in Solidworks with industry experience, including experience with Reference geometry, Hole wizard, Pattern, Multi-configuration and design table, Swept boss, Assembly mates.
  • Knowledge of drawing views and BOM, dimensioning and tolerance labeling
  • Knowledge of product environmental test and qualification
  • Hands-on skills utilizing test equipment such as vibration table and temperature chamber
  • Experience with Ansys Mechanical simulation
  • Knowledge of RF engineering fundamentals and principles is a plus
  • Excellent technical writing skills

We will accommodate candidate’s accessibility needs, on request, during all aspects of the selection process.

No recruiters please.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest; however only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: General Labour - Afternoon shift
description:
Are you a machine operator or general labourer? Are you looking for a position in Manufacturing? Would you like to learn how to operate a spot welding machine?

We are hiring mechanically inclined candidates who have a great attitude, great aptitude, and a willingness to learn.

You will be responsible for working in a manufacturing warehouse where you will take metal components, hold them in place and load them in the machine, step on the peddle to start the spot weld, along with other general labour duties (packaging, prepping materials etc). You will then inspect each part for quality and accuracy.





Advantages
- Straight afternoons Monday to Friday from 4 pm to 12:30 am
- $16.75 /hr to start with room for growth
- Work for a brand name product manufacturer
- Be hired on permanently once you've proven your work ethic, attendance, and reliability

Responsibilities
Your duties will include but are not limited to:
-stripping plastic
-packaging
-sorting, loading
-lifting up to 25lbs
-Light general labour

Qualifications
- 6 months experience working in a manufacturing environment
- Ability to wear steel-toed boots, safety glasses, gloves, and hearing protection
- Strong attention to detail
- Strong focus on attendance and work ethic

title: Control Room Operator (Trainee)
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

 

Overview:

 

This position reports directly to the Production Coordinator. All duties are performed in a work-safe manner; plant safety rules are followed and individual works as a team member. The individual functioning in this position will be proficient in all aspects of cement manufacturing and will continue their progression by working in the capacity of Control Room Operator.

Responsibilities:

 

  • Understand and comply with Environmental Health & Safety (EHS policies to assure that environmental, health and safety are the first priority of the business.
  • Actively support key safety initiatives at the facility and assist the department as needed to improve EHS performance and results.
  • Understands and performs safety responsibilities such as hazard identification, equipment lock-out, emergency response, etc.
  • Control and monitor the equipment run to ensure consistent plant utilization
  • Perform regular checks of all equipment operating trends to ensure safe and optimal operating conditions.
  • Responsible for consistent material flow to produce clinker and cement.
  • Assist field Operators in diagnosing operational deficiencies using instrument indications and identifying the root cause of equipment defects using instrument indications.
  • Troubleshoot process problems and identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.
  • Perform moderate adjustments and repairs to area equipment as necessary.
  • Maintains superior housekeeping standards throughout the plant process and control room areas.
  • Ensure effective communication with operations, maintenance and management staff.
  • Maintain proper documentation including operator log, maintenance records, safety & environment reports, etc.
  • Ongoing performance improvement including job progression, site-specific training, process training, etc.
Qualifications:

 

  • Relevant Technical College degree or diploma (Examples: Mechanical, Electrical, Chemical, Civil) will be required.
  • Must pass a pre-employment aptitude test, scoring at least in the 75th percentile or higher
  • Minimum of one year minimum experience working in an industrial plant.
  • Ability to work shifts (days, nights, weekends)

 

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Must be willing to learn the operating parameters of equipment.
  • Demonstrated communication skills and the ability to function in a team environment.  
  • The selected candidate must be willing to spend time in the field to maintain production technician knowledge.
  • Willingness to pursue additional training to prepare for future advancement.
  • Must have current CRO certification, be actively working towards CRO certification, or have prior experience as a control room operator.  
  • Must be willing to participate in the CRO certification training program.  
  • Must be able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.  
  • Demonstrated ability to work safely and follow all safety and housekeeping guidelines and policies.  
  • Willingness and desire to continually improve skills necessary through on-the-job experience and formal training if required.  
LafargeHolcim:

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.  

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodations are available on request for  candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Product Quality Specialist
description:
Overview:

Are you a self-starter Electrical/Software Engineer with C++ and ASPICE compliance knowledge? Do you have strong communication skills and a software development background in the automotive industry? Are you keen to work on leading edge automotive autonomous technology? If so, we want to hear from you! Apply to our Product Quality Specialist and join Hexagon Autonomy & Positioning's high-tech engineering and manufacturing team that is committed to customer service excellence and continuous improvement. Reporting to our Functional Safety and Product Cybersecurity Manager, you will assure our project teams deliver superior quality products, compliant with ASPICE requirements.  

 

The Company: Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector and mobility applications. Youâ€™ll be joining over 22,000 people in 50 countries on the leading edge of your field.    

 

This position is with Hexagonâ€™s Autonomy & Positioning division, a global technology leader, pioneering end-to-end solutions industry leaders rely on for assured positioning and autonomy on land, sea and air. Our work touches every aspect of life, from sustainability on Earth to enabling autonomy. Within the Autonomy & Positioning division your work will contribute to the operation of our brand(s) NovAtel, AutonomouStuff, VERIPOS and Antcom.

 

The Location: Hexagon is a global company with locations around the world. This position is based in either Morton, IL, Detroit, MI or Ottawa, ON.  

Responsibilities:

As a Product Quality Specialist, responsibilities include:

  • Prepare quality plans
  • Audit work products and projects within ASPICE compliant programs
  • Contribute to assessing software development work products including peer reviews of documents and code reviews to defined processes and checklists
  • Participate in assessing ASPICE process compliance of projects
  • Work with project teams on a daily basis to assist in correct execution of development processes    
Qualifications:

Must-Have:

  • Engineering degree (electrical engineering with software development exposure OR software engineering)
  • 2-3 years of software quality management experience
  • 5+ yearsâ€™ experience in software development in an automotive environment
  • Eligibility to work in Canada or the USA.  

Key Success Factors:

  • Work product quality assurance will require paying attention to details, checking the use of templates,   development standards and checklists.
  • Excellent communication skills will be used to discuss quality non-conformances with the project teams, explaining the findings, providing suggestions to solve the issues and to follow up on the implementation of the corrections

Nice-to-Have:

  • Supported ASPICE assessments up to level 3 (in any role of an automotive project)
  • ASPICE certification as a provisional assessor

title: Production Supervisor
description:
Established in 1979, Toro Aluminum has become the window wall and door supplier for high-rise condominiums, office buildings and hotels, across Canada, the United States and Mexico. At Toro Aluminum, we continue to maintain the highest levels of professionalism and integrity, in our relationships with our suppliers, subcontractors, architects, engineers and envelope consultants.

Over the years, Toro has been committed and focused to ensure the longevity of our company, through repeat and referral business achieved by customer satisfaction in all areas including: applied testing programs, quality control, design innovations, attention to detail, competitive pricing and service minded attitudes.

In order to achieve the highest possible quality standards in our industry we will strive to advocate and provide dynamic leadership in a work environment that encourages employee involvement.

SHIFTS

  • Weekend Shift: Friday, Saturday, Sunday 7:30am to 8pm

RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Establish methods to meet work schedules and coordinate work activities of the plant.
  • Build to schedule, at optimum equipment efficiencies for all production requirements.
  • Responsible for collaborating and working with Supervisors across all shifts.
  • Ensure that Management is informed daily about quality, quantity, personnel, safety and any other issues that require immediate attention.
  • Train and evaluate employees in job duties, safety procedures and company policies.
  • Investigate and deal with personnel issues. Administer progressive disciplinary action when necessary.
  • Maintain a safe working environment and ensure all safety rules are followed.
  • Perform troubleshooting of machines and related equipment.
  • Resolve production errors and disputes.
  • Requisition or request materials and supplies.
  • Prepare production and other reports where required.
  • Attend and contribute to production meetings.
  • inform and follow up with maintenance on all machine/maintenance related issues.
  • Undertake projects as assigned by the Plant Manager to improve plant processes (e.g. implementation of lean manufacturing practices).
  • Maintain professional behavior in all dealings with employees, colleagues and other departments.
  • Perform other duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5+ years production management experience in a manufacturing facility.
  • Completion of University degree or College diploma is an asset
  • Demonstrate strong leadership, problem solving, coaching, technical skills and interpersonal skills.
  • Must possess good verbal and written communication skills.
  • Experience in quality and process improvements in a manufacturing environment.
  • Strong analytical ability and detail orientation.
  • Experience in dealing with personnel issues including discipline, investigations and health/safety compliance.
  • Ability to influence others and effectively work in a team.
  • Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office, Word, and Excel
  • Salary will be commensurate with experience

title: General Labor Packaging operator 18 hourly
description:
Our Amazing Pharmaceutical Client is looking for a Packaging Operator for Day shift and Afternoon shift/Nightshift rotating. We are looking for someone who has experience with production lines and understands the packaging process. This role is full time and training is provided

The company is located by Mississauga RD and 407 intersection

Advantages
What's in it for you?

• Could lead to full time
• Long term ongoing assignment with consistent hours. There is a possibility of permanent based on performance and work ethics
• 24/7 Gym access
• 4% vacation pay added onto every check and weekly pay
• Transit accessible

Responsibilities
What are the responsibilities of the job?

• Operation and maintenance of production equipment and area modifications according to GMP, safety and quality standards.
• Perform all packaging/process activities
• Operate, maintain and adjust process equipment according to established procedures
• Lead the mechanical changeover of equipment according to established procedures
• Participate in the preparation and completion of all documentation applicable to production
• Perform preventative and predictive maintenance programs
• Clean equipment, rooms and general areas for production use
• Train other team members
• Perform related computer tasks: SAP, IMS
• Lead in process improvement initiatives
• Participate in process improvements and SMED
• Trouble-shoot equipment and process related issues
• Work in other Manufacturing/Packaging areas as required

The Machines you will be handling there are:

• Blister Packaging Machine
• Pouching Machine
• Labelling Machine
• Bartelt Machine
• Packaging Machines
• Inspection Machine
• Printing Machines
• Vision System for handling equipment's reading!

Capabilities/Products:

• Automatic cartoning and assembly
• Medical device diagnostic kits
• Hospital and physician sample pack assembly
• Combination pack assembly
• Heat-sealing and carding
• Counter display and dispenser assembly
• Heat sealing and crimping
• Over-wrapping and shrink-wrapping
• Recovery packaging
• Inspection
• Labelling
• De-bulking
• Carton contents recovery
• Bulk product sorting
• Carton structural redesign
• Automated carton replacement

Qualifications
Qualifications

• Training & Orientation provided
• Team-based workplace
• Friendly, clean and safe working environment
• Knowledge of production processes and equipment demonstrated through performance
• Must have experience with Line clearance and equipment set-up
• Strong problem solving skills
• Self-m Level of Job-Related production enviro anaged team player, experienced in working with teams in a Minimum nment Experience required
• Highly motivated, conscientious, innovative and creative .
• Computer skills i.e. Microsoft office (Word, Excel, Outlook)
• Ability to use and understand automation solutions

Summary
If you qualify for the role: please email your resume to paljit.kler@randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Expeditor / Production Expeditor - Immediate Opening
description: Expeditor / Production Expeditor - Immediate OpeningPay Rate: $38 per hourLocation: Newmarket, OntarioArea Code: 647Postal Code: L3Y 8T3Start Date: Two Week NoticeKeywords: #expeditorjobs, #CCAjobs, #Ontariojobs *NewmarketjobsAn Expeditor, or Operations Facilitator, is responsible for ensuring that a business has the supplies and inventory it needs to function according to schedule. Their duties include communicating with suppliers about the status of supplies, problem-solving to reduce the impact of late shipments and submitting purchase orders to vendors. An Expeditor helps enhance the efficiency of business processes, particularly the delivery of supplies: * Work with different heads of department to monitor inventory levels, assess supply vendors and ensure delivered supplies meet quality standards.* Contact vendors, place orders, verify supplies, manage supply requisition and communicate with suppliers to determine expected delivery dates and inform Project Managers of potential delays.* Maintain production schedules for ongoing projects, assign materials and Crew Members to reduce cost, boost productivity and prevent bottlenecks* Ensure interdepartmental communication for improved coordination of productive operations.* Monitor project delivery timelines, check work quality against company requirements and specifications and ensure compliance with regulations.* Collaborate with Project Managers for updates on delivery timelines.* Compile, record and report project performance and progress to management and key stakeholders.Expeditor skills and qualifications * Excellent written and verbal communication skills* Teamwork skills* Attention to detail * Ability to stand for long periods of time* Math and analytical skills* Proficiency in spreadsheet software, inventory management tools and accounting applications* Excellent time management skills Expeditor experience* Contract manufacturing / Circuit Card Assembly (CCA) background is highly desired * Preferred 2 years or more of experience in distribution or a similar field through part-time or internship positions. * Ability to maintain work and production schedules. * Knowledgeable in inventory management, know how to place and track orders, measure inventory levels and inspect supplies for quality and accuracy. * Work involves working with systems and MS office programs.

title: Production Operator
description:

  • Lifting 25 lbs repetitively
  • Run the conveyor line

Qualifications:

  • Must be able to work in a fast paced environment

  • Excellent verbal and written skills

Previous experience as a quality inspector, machine operator, production operator would be considered an asset.

If you have the skills required, please send your resume in confidence. Only qualified candidates will be selected for an interview.

Salary: From $25.22 per hour

title: Material Handler - All Shifts Available
description:
Job Description

Material Handler 

The Material Handler plans and executes the material supply of the designated manufacturing area in an efficient, safe and timely manner with regard of the proper house cleaning practices.

Minimum Qualifications include:

  • Minimum grade 12 education or equivalent.
  • Must have valid forklift driver license.
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in a manufacturing and industrial environment preferred.
  • Ability to read, write, and speak in English.
  • Knowledge of driving a forklift and safety legislation related to material handling.
  • Team player and able communicate well with others.
  • Able to interact with people at all levels and departments.
  • Good planning and organizational skills.
  • Must be helpful to others and open for criticism.
  • Frequent lifting is required.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Ensures the manufacturing process is supplied with all material components and dunnage in a way what would not result any machine downtime.
  • Ensures that the finished product, empty baskets, boxes and unneeded packaging materials are taken away from all designated areas without delay. Knows the various scrap metal types and bin locations. Performs chip dumping as required (doesn’t leave it for the next shift).
  • Drives the Forklift / Tugger safely and gives due consideration to pedestrians: performs Forklift / Tugger inspections and maintenance as required
  • Ensures that all material is handled properly in order to preserve product quality
  • Keeps raw material- and finish product storage area neat, clean and organized
  • Performs inventory counts, monitors inventory of production related products, reports discrepancy immediately to prevent production stoppage
  • Ensures all required documentation is done properly, including labeling needs according to service requirements.
  • Takes action to keep the shop-floor neat and organized, including removal and dumping of wood skids. (Stacks baskets and pallets in a neat way (baskets lined up and stacked to the same height).
  • Responsible for bringing recycle collection bins from designated work stations to the appropriate compactor / box located in the Waste Area.
  • Check contents of each of the chip bins and remove items that do not belong to the chip bins prior to emptying.
  • Reports any problem or concern to the production supervisor in a reasonable time period that reflects the urgency of the problem
  • Keeps up good team spirit with the fellow co-workers: machine operators, team leaders, material handlers, maintenance personnel, shipper-receiver and the members of the management team
  • Performs various other duties as required but not limited to:
    • Making cardboard boxes for the production lines
    • Operating machines if required

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Vision care
  • Disability insurance
  • Profit sharing/share options
  • Bonus scheme
  • Education reimbursement
  • On-site parking
  • Vacation & paid time off
  • Dental care
  • Life insurance
  • Employee assistance programs
  • Wellness programs
  • Company events & social hours


Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $21.00 /hour

title: Production Associate - South Division - 4x10 hour shifts DAY SHIFT
description:
Permanent Full-Time - Production Associate - South Division

Location: Tillsonburg, ON

Shifts Available: Mon-Thurs 4x10 DAY Shift: 6:00a-4:00p

Why Join Marwood

Who We are:

  • Marwood International Inc. is a full service, award-winning, Tier I and 2 automotive OEM structural components and modular assembly supplier, that focuses on waste elimination and light-weighting initiatives from prototypes to full volume products to end of life service partsthroughout Canada, US and Japan.
  • Marwood is also a well-established Canadian owned manufacturing company which have been in the industry for 30+ years!
  • We are community oriented, and focused on health and wellness.

We are happy to have you join our team!

We offer:

  • Competitive Pay plus premiums
  • GREAT benefits and Perks: dental, medical and vision coverage, as well as outstanding pension plan and more
  • Also, company provided uniforms!
  • Due to Marwood's growth you will have an opportunity for over-time after 40 hours!

Apply today to speak with our recruiter!

Your Role and Responsibilities

Responsibilities:

  • Produce parts at established production rates in a safe manner that meet production requirements, shift quota, and hourly cycle counts
  • Product quality parts within specifications as per the quality check sheets
  • Maintain accurate production records at all times
  • Report production issues and down time to Team Leader and suggest corrective action and/or improvement solutions
  • Load parts into containers according to packaging MOS
  • 5S and Kaizen activities as required
  • Adhere to all Health & Safety policies and procedures
  • All other relevant duties

Skills/ Capabilities:

  • Ability to do repetitive tasks in a fast paced environment
  • Ability to stand for extended periods of time
  • Desire to work on a team
  • Open to learning new skills
  • Excellent attendance

Key Requirements:

  • Grade 12 Diploma or GED
  • Mechanically inclined

We are committed to giving people with disabilities an equal opportunity to provide feedback, and access any information they may need.Please advise if you require accommodation.

We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. Pre-employment screening will be required.

For more information, please visit our website: www.marwoodinternational.com

title: Electronics Assembler (afternoon shift)
description:
Electronics Assembler
(Afternoon shift)

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection & alarm, communications & security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation & smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

Under the supervision of the Manager, the successful candidate is responsible for performing any combination of following tasks to assemble electronic components, subassemblies, products, or systems: Reads work orders, follows production drawings and sample assemblies, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform loading of PCB’s in trolley, packing of panels and enclosures, stocking on skids/trolleys and delivering to Raw Material or Finish Goods stock
  • Assemble PCB boards with components as per set-up sheets
  • Inspect PCB’s after assembly
  • Positions and aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jig, fixture, or other holding device
  • Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits, or perform similar operations to join or secure parts in place, using hand tools, power tools, machines, and equipment
  • Mounts assembled components, such as transformers, resistors, transistors, capacitors, integrated circuits, and sockets, on printed circuit boards or chassis panel
  • Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points, using soldering, welding, marettes, or related bonding procedures and equipment
  • Installs finished assemblies or subassemblies in cases and cabinets
  • Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, locks, screws, wires and switches, to assemblies
  • Performs intermediate assembly tasks, such as conformal coating, silk screening, masking, cutting traces, labeling assemblies
  • Tends machines that press, shape, or engrave component parts
  • Adjusts or trims materials from components to achieve specified electrical or dimensional characteristics
  • Performs on-line go-not-go testing and inspection, using magnifying devices and Automatic Optical Inspection(AOI), measuring instruments, and electronic test equipment, to ensure parts and assemblies meet production specifications and standards
  • May perform assembly, soldering or inspections under microscope or other magnifying device
  • Keep immediate work area in clean and orderly condition
  • Advise Supervisor or Lead Hand of any abnormal conditions
  • Offer suggestions for continual improvement

Requirements and Skills

  • Completion of a High School Diploma or Vocational Equivalent
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in a Manufacturing environment is preferred
  • Knowledge of electronic components and assembly of systems is an asset
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow instructions/drawing.
  • Electronic devices assemblers that solder might require accreditation or certification
  • Familiar with ISO and IPC standards an asset
  • Ability to work cohesively with employees and managers as part of a team
  • Good interpersonal and communication (verbal & written English) skills
  • Ability to focus attention on details and a high level of accuracy skills
  • Ability to lift 25-50 Ibs
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure with simultaneous deadlines
  • Ability to maintain confidential information in a professional manner
  • Ability/willingness to learn on the job new skills trough training

    What Mircom Offers:

    • A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement
    • Competitive salary

    Interested applicants please forward a copy of your resume to Human Resources.

    We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

    Mircom Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer that considers all applicants regardless of cultural background, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, family status, disability or any other grounds as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code.  In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Mircom is committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive work environment for all individuals with disabilities in a respectful and dignified manner. Accommodations will be made available, upon request, to applicants who have specialized needs throughout the recruitment process. 

     

    Disclaimer: Mircom does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. We will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

title: Automotive Painter
description:
Automotive Painter

Bolton, ON, Canada Req #4721

Tuesday, April 26, 2022

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for skilled Automotive Painters!

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, and group pension as well as many others!

Job Description

The Automotive Painter is responsible for painting and preparing trucks to customer specifications at a high level of skill and quality.

Job Duties

  • Mix paint/set-up spray guns and paint-required products, e.g. rear frames, truck bodies, chassis, etc. to required performance standards
  • Ability to operate the following tools: Cup Gun, Pressure Pot, Plural System, Airless Sprayer
  • Responsible for spraying all colors as determined by work order/customer
  • Ability to read and interpret blue prints and work orders
  • Set up and preventative maintenance of tools and machines as necessary
  • Complete body work e.g. fixing dents, etc. when needed
  • Perform safety and quality checks
  • Work and adhere to all safety policies
  • Train other employees as required.
Minimum Qualifications
  • Basic math, tape measurement and computer skills
  • Basic experience with paint tools
  • Able to understand and comprehend measurement
  • Able to read and interpret blueprints for special applications
Preferred Qualifications
  • Previous experience in manufacturing
  • Previous experience working on truck bodies
Physical Requirements:
  • This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.
J.B. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

#LI-TK1

  • Job Function Manufacturing

title: Machine Operator
description:
Description:


Candidates will be asked to understand and complete the duties assigned to the 'Mag Welder' and the 'Bolter'.
Typically candidates will rotate between the specific job duties every 2 hours.
MAG WELDER
Workers will be taking parts off the cart provided by the kitter and put them in a specific place on a robotic welder. It will then weld the pieces together. Afterward they check the welds and put the welded pieces together on a cart for the bolter. Pieces weight 1-5 lbs each and they put 2-4 pieces on the machine every 85 seconds.
BOLTER
Workers will take the piece after it goes through the welding station and bolt on the last pieces. The pieces require 6-12 bolts each. The bolts go in a specific sequence posted on a chart above. After all bolts of finished they will put it in a rack beside the station.


Skills:


machine operator, quality inspection, robotic welding, General labor, general production


Top Skills Details:


machine operator, quality inspection,robotic welding


Additional Skills & Qualifications:


MUST HAVE 1: 1+ years of manufacturing experience
MUST HAVE 2: The ability to lift 30 lbs throughout an 8 hour shift
NICE TO HAVES:
1. Previous welding or machine operating experience
2. Experience in an automotive manufacturing environment
3. Experience with a quota/standard that must be met


Experience Level:


Intermediate Level


À propos d'Aerotek:


Notre monde nous tient à cœur. Reconnu Best of Staffing MD par nos clients et le talent que nous recrutons, Aerotek MD Inc. se distingue comme chef de file du recrutement et en de la dotation de personnel grâce à sa grande compréhension des liens entre le talent et les affaires. Étant donné qu'Aerotek est un partenaire stratégique de plus de 18 000 clients et 300 000 employés contractuels chaque année, son approche axée sur les gens lui permet d'offrir un avantage concurrentiel à ses clients et des emplois gratifiants à ses employés contractuels. Aerotek, dont le siège social est à Hanover, au Maryland, exploite un réseau de plus de 250 bureaux non franchisés, comptant plus de 8 000 employés internes dévoués à servir nos clients. Aerotek est une société en exploitation d'Allegis Group, un fournisseur multinational de solutions en matière de talent. Pour en savoir davantage, consultez le site aerotek.com/fr-ca.


About Aerotek:


We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com.


The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Cabinet Parts Assembler with Forklift
description:
We are looking for MOTIVATED and HARDWORKING individuals to join a team of Construction experts as a PRODUCTION ASSOCIATE w/ Forklift License for a facility in MISSISSAUGA (near Oakville)

Location: Lakeshore - Southdown (South Mississauga near Oakville)

Job: PRODUCTION ASSOCIATE w/ Forklift License
Employment: Full-time with the possibility of permanent hire


Salary: $22.50 hour ($18/hr no forklift)
Afternoon shift premium of $0.50 after 5 pm
$500 signing bonus once hired on

Steady Afternoon Shift"


Afternoons
5:00 pm - 1:00 am, 3:00 pm - 1:00 am or 5:00 pm - 3:00 am
Mandatory 48-hour workweeks (including weekends if shipping demands it)
Mon-Friday or Saturday | Tuesday-Saturday | Wednesday- Sunday

Advantages
$22.50/hr Monday to Friday
Full-time hours, lots of opportunity for OVERTIME hours
OVERTIME after 40Hours
Weekly pay
Training for new skills
Opportunity for growth and possible full-time opportunity

Benefits after probation:
Rate increase of 2.5% increase yearly with quarterly bonuses (up to 10% of your gross)
RRSP plan employee puts in up to 6% of gross and we match up to 4%



Responsibilities
Operating on all production lines as scheduled
Operate machinery to assist in the production process
Perform production tasks according to standard operating procedures and manufacturing guidelines
Follow instructions and report to assigned team lead, supervisor
Maintain production reports daily, as required
Guide other associates in their assigned duties when needed
Identify and report unsafe practices and incidents immediately to the team lead, supervisor, and manager
Attend job training related to production and machinery for professional growth and development
Complete daily assigned tasks to meet production volume and schedule
Ensure that the work environment is maintained clean, safe, and organized
Ensure that the manufactured products meet customer specifications
Maintain documentation for production and related activities for reference, tracking, and analysis purposes
Stay up to date with production processes
Assist in analyzing root causes of production issues and help in developing and implementing corrective actions
Operate counterbalance forklifts
Operate floor sweeper machine
Assemble materials and equipment as required
Remove all faulty or sub-standard parts and ensure that their statuses are communicated to the team leader, supervisor, manager
Assist in start-up and shutdown of production machinery/lines as required
Clean all equipment at the beginning, during and the end of each shift as the need arises
Use power tools as required
Assist in monitoring everything from product parts to the assembly itself to ensure quality and safety standards are met
Inspect raw materials to ensure they are free from defects and meet specifications
Inspect finished products for defects to ensure quality standards are met
Preparation and loading/feeding of raw materials to the production lines
Transport raw materials from one place to another
Communicate effectively with coworkers to ensure efficient production and deadlines are met
Conduct inspections and quality control of products
Assist in lifting, carrying, and moving heavy loads as required
Assist other departments as required
Adhere to all company and government policies, SOP’s (Standard Operating Procedures) and other safety policies and training.

Qualifications
Over 1-year experience operating a counterbalance forklift
Valid Forklift License
Willing to work overtime during busy season (September – April)
Preventative maintenance, equipment offline projects etc.
Must be comfortable in using the computer
Able to speak/read/write English
Access to reliable transportation (due to location and timings)
Must have CSA-approved 6" safety shoes
Heavy lifting (50 lbs), loading/unloading trucks, housekeeping
Must possess a positive attitude and can work independently

Summary
If you or anyone you know is interested in this Assembler w/Forklift in Mississauga --- APPLY THROUGH THIS POSTING!

You may also email your resume and forklift license to Anna and Melanie. Subject: Assembler FL

For questions regarding this job posting, you can email us or TEXT 416-8592509, include the job name, and we will try to get back to you as soon as possible.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Shipper/Receiver -- Manufacturing Warehouse
description:
Shipper/Receiver -- Manufacturing Warehouse

Support growing customer base, handle incoming shipments, and ensure all customs documentations and shipments are carried out within the required time lines.

Location: Edmonton, Alberta

Your Challenge:


* Works to help the flow of shipments both inbound and outbound in the manner that is most cost effective. Works to resolve errors and issues with customers. Files required documentation with trucking companies for corrective action.
* Routes outbound delivered loads and inbound back-hauls. Utilizes logistics software.
* Creates required export documentation to support US cross boarder and international shipments
* Coordinates common carrier activities.
* Maintains customer delivery time windows. Manages communications associated with shipments.
* Timely handling of incoming suppliers' shipments and coordination with Quality, Purchasing, and Warehouse departments

Your Expertise:


* Minimum education requirement: High School
* 1 years of related work experience, valve experience is preferred.
* knowledge of FedEx, UPS, Purolator, DHL, and Loomis systems
* Knowledge in packaging and dealing with international crating

This position may require exposure to information which is subject to US export control regulations such as the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must meet eligibility requirements of the ITAR and of the Controlled Goods Directorate (CDG) and/or a Canadian government security clearance.

Curtiss-Wright values diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Talent Acquisition and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.





Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Machine Operator
description:
Job Description:

 

 

Do you want to work for a stable, growing organization that reaches back more than 130 years?   Our steel tube and pipe products have helped build landmarks and buildings in North America; Come build your career at Zekelman Industries.

 

Z-Modular, a division of Zekelman Industries, seeks a Machine Operator for our location in Kitchener, ON. This position will operate an industrial horizontal band saw, supplying the welding department.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Mount, install, align, and secure tools, attachments, fixtures, and workpieces on machines  
  • Measure dimensions of finished workpieces to ensure conformance to specifications    
  • Maintain machines and remove and replace broken or worn machine tools, using hand tools.    
  • Confer with supervisors  to resolve machine malfunctions or production errors or to obtain approval to continue production.    
  • Set up future jobs while machines are operating.    
  • Clean machines, tooling, or parts, using  proper procedures and cleaning agents    
  • Follow all established safety procedures  
  • Other duties as assigned  

 

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent
  • 2+ years of related experience in a manufacturing or production setting
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail, work ethic and positive team player
  • Legally eligible to work in the Canada

 

SKILLS/ABILITIES

  • Ability to work unsupervised  
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints, schematic drawings,  specifications, etc.  
  • Knowledge and usage of measuring and testing devices, hand and power tools  
  • Basic math abilities  
  • Mechanical aptitude  
  • Strong problem solving and organizational skills  
  • Uncompromising commitment to safety  
  • Ability to communicate efficiently and effectively with other team members

 

PHYSICAL ABILITIES:

  • Must be able to move objects and use abdominal and lower back muscles to provide support over time without fatigue. Constant movement and use of limbs; this position requires good manual dexterity, coordination and stamina.
  • Must be able to remain in a stationary position for several hours
  • Regular, full-time, predictable onsite attendance per the posted schedule is an essential function of this role
  • Ability to lift, climb, bend, stoop, push and pull.
  • Must be able to lift 60lbs.
  • Must be able to stand for 10-12 hours
  • Ability to perform work in a plant/manufacturing environment
  • Other physical requirements as needed for job
  • Lead  and  promote health and safety work practices as required by regulatory agencies and company policy

Zekelman Industries offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits, including high quality medical, dental and vision benefits. In addition, we have an amazing tuition assistance program, and an RRSP with a generous company match.

 

Zekelman is an  Equal Opportunity Employer  compliant with  all Ontario law & Human Rights Code  in providing accommodation to persons with disabilities and to ensuring an accessible environment. Zekelman will accommodate persons with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and persons with disabilities will be accommodated on hiring and during employment.

Should you require accommodation, please do not hesitate to request it.

 

We are Zekelman Industries.

 

We manufacture superior quality tubular and related products and provide outstanding service for our valued customers.

 

We seek to continuously advance the skills and opportunities of our employees, utilizing the latest technology and management tools available to consistently increase profitability and the enterprise value of Zekelman Industries and of our customers.

title: Electronics Assembler (afternoon shift)
description:
Electronics Assembler
(Afternoon shift)

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection alarm, communications security, mass notification, nurse call, and building automation smart technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest complexes. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

Under the supervision of the Manager, the successful candidate is responsible for performing any combination of following tasks to assemble electronic components, subassemblies, products, or systems: Reads work orders, follows production drawings and sample assemblies, or receives verbal instructions regarding duties to be performed.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform loading of PCB’s in trolley, packing of panels and enclosures, stocking on skids/trolleys and delivering to Raw Material or Finish Goods stock
  • Assemble PCB boards with components as per set-up sheets
  • Inspect PCB’s after assembly
  • Positions and aligns parts in specified relationship to each other in jig, fixture, or other holding device
  • Crimps, stakes, screws, bolts, rivets, welds, solders, cements, press fits, or perform similar operations to join or secure parts in place, using hand tools, power tools, machines, and equipment
  • Mounts assembled components, such as transformers, resistors, transistors, capacitors, integrated circuits, and sockets, on printed circuit boards or chassis panel
  • Connects component lead wires to printed circuit or routes and connects wires between individual component leads and other components, connectors, terminals, and contact points, using soldering, welding, marettes, or related bonding procedures and equipment
  • Installs finished assemblies or subassemblies in cases and cabinets
  • Assembles and attaches hardware, such as caps, clamps, knobs, locks, screws, wires and switches, to assemblies
  • Performs intermediate assembly tasks, such as conformal coating, silk screening, masking, cutting traces, labeling assemblies
  • Tends machines that press, shape, or engrave component parts
  • Adjusts or trims materials from components to achieve specified electrical or dimensional characteristics
  • Performs on-line go-not-go testing and inspection, using magnifying devices and Automatic Optical Inspection(AOI), measuring instruments, and electronic test equipment, to ensure parts and assemblies meet production specifications and standards
  • May perform assembly, soldering or inspections under microscope or other magnifying device
  • Keep immediate work area in clean and orderly condition
  • Advise Supervisor or Lead Hand of any abnormal conditions
  • Offer suggestions for continual improvement

Requirements and Skills

  • Completion of a High School Diploma or Vocational Equivalent
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in a Manufacturing environment is preferred
  • Knowledge of electronic components and assembly of systems is an asset
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow instructions/drawing.
  • Electronic devices assemblers that solder might require accreditation or certification
  • Familiar with ISO and IPC standards an asset
  • Ability to work cohesively with employees and managers as part of a team
  • Good interpersonal and communication (verbal written English) skills
  • Ability to focus attention on details and a high level of accuracy skills
  • Ability to lift 25-50 Ibs
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure with simultaneous deadlines
  • Ability to maintain confidential information in a professional manner
  • Ability/willingness to learn on the job new skills trough training

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement
  • Competitive salary

Interested applicants please forward a copy of your resume to Human Resources.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Mircom Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer that considers all applicants regardless of cultural background, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, family status, disability or any other grounds as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code.  In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Mircom is committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive work environment for all individuals with disabilities in a respectful and dignified manner. Accommodations will be made available, upon request, to applicants who have specialized needs throughout the recruitment process. 

 

Disclaimer: Mircom does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. We will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

title: Assembler / Machine Operator - Days & Evenings
description:
Job Description

We offer:

  • A competitive starting rate
  • Above average shift premium (Evening Shift) 
  • Plant Incentive Program
  • Competitive group benefits for full-time associates
  • An employer matched RRSP plan,
  • And great company discounts and benefits.

POSITIONS ARE AVAILABLE ON DAYS, and EVENING

Day shift: 7:00 AM - 3:30 PM

Evening Shift: 4:00 PM - 12:30 AM

About Us:

MasterBrand Cabinets (known in Winnipeg as Kitchen Craft Cabinetry, and Urban Effects), is a dynamic supplier of high quality kitchen cabinetry and countertops with facilities and sales throughout North America.  As a growing company we have current and future opportunities in our Manufacturing plant (located on Springfield Road in Winnipeg) for Assemblers, and Machine Operators

·       Assemblersare responsible for the assembly of cabinets, ensuring the assembly meets quality standards.  Applicants must have the ability to read and interpret various gauges and measuring devices, pay attention to detail and have previous experience utilizing various hand tools; ability and willingness to work in a fast-paced and physical environment is mandatory.

·       Machine Operators - Previous experience in operating entry level to complex machinery in the woodworking industry is ideal.  Strong working mechanical knowledge of machines and tools including their designs, uses, repair, and maintenance is required. Must have the ability to read and understand schematics and work instructions. Ability to troubleshoot machine operations and willingness to work in a fast-paced, and physical environment are necessary. CNC experience is considered an asset.   

 

Successful applicants must be eligible to work in Canada, speak, read, write English, have satisfactory math skills, a strong work ethic, ability to work as a functioning member of a team, work in a safe and responsible manner, and display a commitment to quality and safety.  In addition, all positions require the successful candidate to have the physical ability to lift, bend, push, pull, and move material up to 50 pounds, as well as stand for prolonged period of time. All other duties as may be assigned at management's discretion. Reliable transportation is required (Facility is not on a bus route).

 

Additional Information

MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. offers a wide spectrum of cabinetry products designed to satisfy every budget and lifestyle. With a large North America footprint and diverse team of nearly 13,000 employees, we help people fulfill their dreams of a comfortable, inviting home through innovations in fashion and functionality that bring family and friends together. We invite you to visit www.masterbrand.com to learn more about how we build employee opportunity, purpose, and reward into everything we do.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY 
MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

REASONABLE ACCOMMODATIONS
MasterBrand Cabinets, Inc. is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please send an e-mail to staffing@masterbrand.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Must have the ability to read and understand schematics and work instructions. title: Mechanical Assembler
description:
• Manually perform mechanical assembly projects respecting the allowed schedule and budget and meeting the company's quality standards
  • Read plans of mechanical assembly of machinery
  • Perform very precise marking (at 64th)
  • Solve assembly problems
  • Collaborate in preparation for the shipping of assembled equipment
  • Minimize unproductive time

 

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Professional diploma, or equivalent, in industrial mechanics or other related field;
  • Ability to understand mechanical and electrical plans
  • 2-3 years of experience in mechanical assembly, preferably in the packaging industry
  • Good manual dexterity
  • Good knowledge of French language, bilingualism is an asset.
  • Able to work long hours in a standing position and lifting heavy equipment 

BENEFITS:

As a Pro Mach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, a pension plan and a generous paid time off program.

Due to the high volume of incoming resumes, only candidates chosen for interview will be contacted. Pro Mach is committed to providing an accessible workspace. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process please notify the Company.

NJM offers a signing bonus for this position

ABOUT NJM

The world’s proven, trusted, single-source provider of automated packaging machinery for pharmaceutical, nutraceutical, and personal care products, NJM offers both stand-alone solutions and integrated systems for packagers of solid dose and liquid pharmaceuticals, biopharmaceuticals, vitamins, and food supplements. As part of the ProMach Pharma business line, NJM helps our customers protect and grow the reputation and trust of their consumers. ProMach is a family of best-in-class packaging solution brands serving manufacturers of all sizes and geographies in the food, beverage, pharmaceutical, personal care, and household and industrial goods industries. ProMach brands operate across the entire packaging spectrum: filling and capping, flexibles, pharma, product handling, labeling and coding, and end of line. ProMach is headquartered near Cincinnati, Ohio, with manufacturing facilities and offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and Asia. For more information about ProMach, visit http://www.ProMachBuilt.com and for more information on ProMach Careers, visit http://www.ProMachCareers.com.

PMCA01

Experience

Preferred
  • 3 - 5 years: mechanical assembly

Education

Preferred
  • Technical/other training or better in Other
See job description
