title: Mould Maker - Nights
description:
Job Number: 38869 
Group: Magna Exteriors  
Division: Mytox Mfg. 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: Woodbridge 

 

Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

QUALIFICATIONS NECESSARY TO DO THE JOB:

•    Grade 12 education or equivalent
•    Certificate of qualification – Mould Maker
•    Good English (both written and verbal) communication skills
•    Must possess strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to determine root cause and recommend countermeasures
•    Knowledge of Mould design / Function /  Spot in lifters and slides
•    Must be a self-starter, able to work with minimum supervision on large compression Moulds, Direct injection Mould and Hot Runner systems, robotic end of arm tooling etc.
•    Ability to Machine components to tight Tolerances and high surface finish
•    A good understanding of Hydraulic / Electrical and Cooling systems associated with Moulds
•    Read and interpret documents such as blue prints, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals
•    Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry
•    Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, rations and proportions to practical situations
•    Must be available to work midnight shifts and overtime when required
•    Valid Crane Operator license 
•    Knowledge of WHMIS/GHS 

DESIRABLE ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

•    Five years related experience and / or training in an automotive production environment 
•    Tool and Die Maker Certificate of qualification
•    Valid forklift license 
•    Knowledge of CNC equipment and programming
•    Basic understanding of the computer
•    Support Mould trials
•    Ability to program operate sink / wire EDM
•    Familiar with CAD Modeling (Mastercam, SolidWorks, ESPRIT. Inventor)
•    Ability to work well independently without supervision
•    TIG welding experience

MAIN DUTIES AND ACTIVITIES OF JOB:

•    Support shift with completing open action items
•    Production coverage / Change Over’s / Manufacturing Spares / Preventative Maintenance / C.I.’s/ Predictive Maintenance 
•    Carry out daily pre-start Crane and Toolroom inspection sheet
•    Maintain a clean and organized Toolroom / 5S
•    Ensure clear communication of Midnight shift production related issues are passed onto all shifts and outstanding work is prioritized to be continued
•    Maintain good communication with Supervisor and Team Leaders by way of verbal discussions and Email. 
•    Inspects and troubleshoots new Moulds
•    Operates Toolroom equipment effectively and safely
•    Assists in the tooling process as assigned while meeting the established customer requirements
•    Modify, repair and trouble shoot Moulds while working to very close tolerances from blueprints, sketches and samples 
•    Maintains documentation and preventive maintenance requirement of Moulds
•    Manages daily priorities for attainment of customer satisfaction, while also meeting production schedule commitments to achieve business objectives
•    Performs assigned tasks within given timeframes and monitors/reports progress to the Mould Maker Team Leader or designate
•    Actively participates in continuous improvements, dimensional quality concerns and customer issues and supports department goals and objectives 
•    Contributes to a positive work environment by demonstrating and sharing functional/technical knowledge
•    Perform duties to ensure that their department policies, procedures and instructions are followed to satisfy requirements of the IATF 16949 quality management and ISO 14001
•    Attends training based on Mytox Internal Training Matrix
•    Adheres to all Mytox safety rules and regulations 
•    Is familiar with Mytox’s policies and procedures 
•    Any other reasonable request by management

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Labourer
description:
Labourer I with Complete Energy Innovations Inc. (CEI)

Rate of Pay: $18.00 - $27.50 per hour

Job Summary

CEI specializes in the design and fabrication of pressure piping, fittings, vessels and structural fabrication. Our expertise includes a wide range of alloy materials and specialized fabrication and welding processes. We pair engineering and manufacturing capabilities to deliver tailored solutions for our clients. We understand quality begins on the inside, and we deliver excellence through value-based relationships and unwavering execution. We cater to the Oil & Gas, Energy, Petrochemical, Forestry, Mining and Refrigeration sectors.


Responsibilities

  • Perform tasks to support the welding and fitting crews
  • Organize plate & pipe as required
  • Assist with bolt-up & hydrotesting
  • Communicate with delivery personnel
  • Assist with material handling, loading & unload trucks using skidsteer
  • Keep shop, lunchroom & yard clean, tidy and organized including sweeping, emptying garbages
  • Cleans, checks for defects and shapes component parts, sometimes using a cutting torch
  • Welding parts, and may also build up worn parts by welding layers of high-strength hard-metal alloys onto them
  • Understand weld types, welding materials, tools, and equipment
  • Operate small power tools for the preparation or clean up of materials
  • Operate hand tools, band saw, overhead crane
  • Pick up and drop off materials, orders, consumables, inventory etc.
  • Provide general clean up and ongoing monitoring and maintenance of the work area
  • Skidsteer operating experience
  • Must be able to complete pre-access & incident drug and alcohol testing
  • Previous welding experience in a fabrication shop an asset
  • Must possess valid government issued photo identification
  • Training & experience with skid steer & overhead crane an asset

Work Conditions

  • Applicants that reside near Nisku, Beaumont, Leduc, or Edmonton and area. Only local candidates will be considered due to the location of this project and no travel allowances are provided.
  • Work will be primarily inside Fabrication facility, however some field work may also be required
  • This position will be project based
  • Work will be primarily in the shop and outdoors in various weather conditions
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs, work at heights, be agile and able to go on/off equipment


CEI offers a safety focused, team based environment, a good work/home life balance schedule and competitive industry wages.

Rate of Pay: $18.00 - $27.50 per hour

title: Sheet Metal Technician
description:
Position : Sheet Metal Technician
Schedule: Monday to Thursday 7am-4:30pm, Friday 7am-11am
Salary : $25-$27/hour
Overtime: after 44 hours
Vacation: 2 weeks (negotiable)
Location : Ottawa
Industry: Prototype Manufacturing

Do you have experience working in a sheet metal shop? Do you know how to operate and program an Amada laser cutting machine? Do you have experience operating various sheet metal shop machines? Do you enjoy variety in your day and working on one of a kind prototypes and custom projects? If so this could be the next opportunity for you!


Advantages
•Schedule: Monday to Thursday 7am-4:30pm, Friday 7am-11am
•Salary : $25-$27/hour
•Overtime: after 44 hours
•Vacation: 2 weeks (negotiable)
•Benefits and RRSP matching
•Permanent full-time work
•Work on unique custom projects and porotypes
•Onsite training
•Small shop with tight-knit team and very low turnover


Responsibilities
•Act as backup laser operator
•Safely operate various sheet metal machines such as laser cutter, sheer, press, etc
•Upload engineering designs to Amada laser cutting machine and validate specifications
•Work with the team on various custom and prototype projects
•Participate in team meetings as needed


Qualifications
•Previous experience operating a laser cutter and working in a sheet metal shop
•Experience programming PCL AP100 version 7.00.00 by AMADA
•Ability to accurately read and interpret drawings and schematics
•Experience using SOLIDWORKS is an asset
•Leadership experience is an asset


Summary
Does this sound like the next challenge you want to take on? Want to know more about it? Reach out! We want to talk to you!

You can apply to the position of Sheet Metal Technician by:
Visiting www.randstad.ca and apply through the posting
Applying by e-mail at: stimottawa@randstad.ca
Calling us at: 613.726.0220 ext 3 and ask for Natacha

We appreciate all applications, however, only those who meet the requirements for the position of Sheet Metal Technician will be contacted.

We have many opportunities for: Skilled Trades: welders, machinists, mechanics, and millwrights.
Industrial Management: supervisors and managers of warehouse, distribution, inventory, logistics, operations, production, maintenance, and quality in the Ottawa/Gatineau area!
To see all of our opportunities visit www.randstad.ca.

Did you know Randstad’s Skilled Trades and Industrial Management Ottawa/Gatineau Team has a Facebook? Add yourself to the group to get the latest information, articles and job opportunities. https://www.facebook.com/SkilledTradesOttawa

Would you like to sign up for job alerts? It’s quick and easy:
- Go to randstad.ca
- Click on job seeker
- Click on search
- Choose get job alerts for this search
- Select the types of jobs for which you’d like to receive notifications



Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Brake Press Operator (Afternoon Shift)
description:
About us:
Our team is growing, and Marcon Metalfab (www.marconmetal.com) is hiring an experienced Press Brake Operator to join our dynamic team based in Delta’s Tilbury Park. 

For over 30 years, Marcon Metalfab has supplied custom fabricated steel and rubber products required for infrastructure, and other projects in the transportation, building construction, utilities, mining, marine, oil, and gas sectors. Equipped with leading manufacturing technologies that allow for efficient handling and processing of materials, Marcon’s 22,000 square foot facility can support even the largest fabrication projects. 

Coupled with an unconditional commitment to providing expert customer service and a rigorous quality management system, Marcon consistently delivers better quality products within tight time frames at prices that are competitive within any industry. 

We have many long-serving employees here, competitive wages, and excellent benefits.  Some places say they have a family atmosphere, but it is truly the case here at Marcon. 

We are located in Tilbury Industrial Park in Delta BC, with four ways to get here –  the Massey Tunnel, Alex Fraser Bridge, South Fraser Perimeter Rd., and Hwy 99.

About the Position:

Afternoon Shift - Monday to Thursday (10 Hour Shifts) - 3:15pm to 1:45am

Responsibilities:
  • Plan and prepare jobs.
  • Create layouts.
  • Read, analyze and interpret shop drawings.
  • Fabrication and forming of mild steel, aluminum, and stainless steel.
  • Safely rig components for lifting.
  • Assure the quality of work produced is acceptable to company standards and specifications.
  • Maintain a safe work environment.

Requirements:
  • 5+ years of experience operating a CNC machine brake press. 235-ton accurpress that uses vision control software and/or 400-ton Mitsubishi, 40040 diamond elite are the machines that we have.
  • Excellent understanding of steel fabrication techniques as well as steel grades and shapes.
  • Must be able to calculate stretch outs as well as selecting proper dies.
  • Must be able to work with both imperial and metric measurements.
  • Must be able to use a Vernier Caliper working to very tight tolerances.
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret shop drawings.
  • Experience maximizing the utilization of materials and minimize waste of materials.
  • Basic computer skills required to use the in-house job board.
  • Clear communication written and spoken English.
  • Ability to stand for long hours (lots of bending is required).
  • Ability to lift over 50 lbs. 

What We Offer:
  • Competitive wages based on experience;
  • Amazing Extended Health and Dental benefits - no out-of-pocket cost;
  • Mentorship and training for professional growth and career advancement;
  • Boot allowance;
  • Overtime opportunities;
  • Excellent family culture and a supportive team;
  • An organization with a trusted reputation and stability within the manufacturing community.

Our Vision, Mission, and Values: 
Our vision is to partner with like-minded companies to develop leading infrastructure solutions, and in the process, contribute to building strong communities.

Our mission is to be North America’s leading supplier of joints, bearings, railing systems, custom–fabricated steel, and rubber products for the transportation sector and beyond. 

To achieve this, we must embody Marcon’s four values:
  • Service, provided at the highest level to our clients.
  • Excellence, in the quality of products we manufacture.
  • Innovation, in our products, technologies, and skills.
  • Integrity, in our responsibility to clients and fellow employees.

Marcon Metalfab is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination based on age, colour, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are also committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected will be contacted.


About Marcon Metalfab.:

For over 30 years, Marcon Metalfab has been Western Canada’s partner of choice for custom–fabricated steel and rubber products for the transportation, building construction, utilities and other industries. Equipped with leading manufacturing technologies that allow for efficient handling and processing of materials, our facility can support even the largest fabrication projects. Coupled with an unconditional commitment to providing expert customer service and a rigorous quality management system, we consistently deliver quality products within tight timeframes at prices that are competitive within any industry.

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
TC Transcontinental is a leader in flexible packaging in North America, and Canada’s largest printer. The Corporation is also the leading Canadian French-language educational publishing group. For over 40 years, TC Transcontinental’s story has been one of innovation and transformation to meet our customers’ evolving needs. Our strong family values, entrepreneurial spirit and long-term vision have always been at the heart of our success.  With our 3 business sectors of Packaging, Print and Media, we continue to optimize, transform and grow while making impressions that count! 
TC Transcontinental Packaging brings a distinctive blend of Art, Science and Technology to create flexible packaging that preserves our customers' products and accentuates their brands on the store shelf. The Packaging Sector has over 4,000 employees and 25 facilities worldwide specializing in extrusion, lamination, printing and converting of plastic products.  



What you will do
  • Lead process improvements to increase throughputs, reduce waste, and improve quality within all flexible packaging processes (printing, extrusion, laminating, slitting, and other finishing).
  • Work with operators and managers to develop standard machine processes and recipes
  • Perform root cause analysis to troubleshoot manufacturing efficiency, quality, or waste issues
  • Develop corrective action plans and teach operators how to prevent recurring problems
  • Assist with the startup and commissioning of new process equipment
  • Work with Product Development and Sales to develop and qualify new business, including process design and specification development through to qualification by customers.
  • Assist in establishing raw material specifications with Procurement and Product Development.
  • Help manage both raw material and customer product trials and scale-ups.
  • Support and contribute to a healthy and safe work environment by following all workplace regulations, policies, and initiatives, including reporting all first aid injuries, accidents, and workplace hazards
  •  
Requirements and Preferences:
  • Bachelors Degree in Engineering required.   Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Manufacturing Engineering preferred.
  • Experience working in a manufacturing environment preferred, but not required.
  • Project management skills preferred.
  •

title: General Labourer
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a General Labourer at our 591 Arvin facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Production Supervisor, the General Labourer is responsible for performing a variety of production tasks, including but not limited to, loading and packing customer product. Employees will be responsible for adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the TS16949 Quality System and practice continuous improvement wherever possible.

Wages starting at $17.15

Shift premium and shift incentive available for 4am, 1:00pm and 4:00pm shifts.

Shifts Available:

  • 4:00am - 1:00pm
  • 7:15am - 4:15pm
  • 1:00pm - 10:00pm
  • 4:00pm - 1:00am

Responsibilities:

  • Package product according to customer specifications, ensuring that all product is handled in a proper, safe manner at all times, no partial boxes are shipped, similar parts are packaged together and boxes are properly labeled.
  • Load product on production racks and visually inspect ongoing product for defects, ensuring non-conforming product is segregated from production line.
  • Sand product off line when required.
  • Remove product from production racks upon processing and place empty racks into designated buggies.
  • Maintain clean and orderly work area both throughout and after the shift.
  • Notify supervisor immediately of any equipment or production problems.
  • Comply with company work and safety rules at all times and report all accidents, incidents and hazards immediately.
  • Participate in corrective/preventative action when required.
  • Practice continuous improvement; identify processes or procedures that will result in production of non-conforming product, or identifying any processes or procedures that can be improved and result in better company performance.
  • Adhere to all procedures and policies as outlined in the TS 16949 quality system.
  • Perform other duties assigned from time to time by supervisor.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 or equivalent work experience
  • Manufacturing experience preferred
  • Demonstrated communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to follow work instructions
  • Demonstrated organizational skills


Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

hr@tiercon.com

.

title: Electrical Engineering, West Assembly
description:
Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada (TMMC) is a world-class automotive facility with manufacturing plants located in Cambridge and Woodstock, Ontario. Our plants currently manufacture the best-selling Toyota RAV4, RAV4 Hybrid and the Lexus RX 350 and RX 450h vehicles and will also soon be building the popular Lexus NX and Lexus NX Hybrid models. Recognized year after year on the global stage for manufacturing quality by our customers, we are also recognized as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

 

The world-famous Toyota Production System, a philosophy of continuous improvement and ongoing training, enables each Team Member to work towards their highest potential. The results of our company stem from hiring committed, self-motivated team members, with the ability to work together to achieve team goals.

 

What We Offer

  • Competitive compensation package includes overtime pay, annual bonus, flexible benefits program and defined contribution pension plan
  • 19 Paid Days off during the year in which their first anniversary falls, plus 5 Floating Holidays that generally fall between Christmas and New Year
  • Family is important - maternity and parental leave program has Employment Insurance (EI) top-up 5  
  • Career support through reimbursement for professional development and tuition fees
  • Vitality Wellness App that encourages and rewards you for leading a healthier lifestyle
  • Company Diversity and Inclusion business partnering groups
  • Employee & Family Vehicle Discounts
  • Build friendly and long-lasting relationships through social events and an on-site fitness facility

 

We have both a Full Time and Contract (ending January 26, 2024) position available. 

 

In our Electrical Engineering, West Assembly role at TMMC, you will be responsible for project implementation, Key Performance Indicator (KPI) achievement (ergonomics, quality output, and process efficiency/cycle time improvements) and resolving shop problems through root cause analysis and Toyota Business Practice (TBP) problem solving.  Your clear communication skills and cross functional team approach will allow you to work effectively with TMMC team members on continuous improvement initiatives.  In this role you will provide technical leadership and collaborate with operations and maintenance to ensure performance targets are achieved for your assigned process area. Just as the company is known for knowledge and best practice sharing, the Engineering Analysts are also given the opportunity to develop training plans to share their knowledge in an area of expertise.


What you’ll be doing

  • Drive continuous improvement of manufacturing activities through detailed analytical reviews, process automation and fixture/tooling design
  • Work with Production, Maintenance and/or external contractors on kaizen projects with emphasis on cost reduction, cycle time reduction, material flow, quality improvements and efficient manufacturing processes
  • Execute capital investment projects and manage all aspects of implementation (i.e. budget, schedule, install, commissioning and buy-off)
  • Monitor process and equipment performance to identify continuous improvement opportunities
  • Develop and sustain assembly systems (ex. Controls Systems and Drawings, Poka-yoke, Kanban Systems etc.)
  • Evaluate process equipment and tooling requirements, define specifications, lead procurement and successful integration into plant operations
  • Lead troubleshooting and problem-solving activities, provide solutions and support for process, quality, and equipment related issues to prevent defect flow-out
  • Co-ordinate external skilled trades and supplier activities
  • Investigate and address issues to ensure safety and ergonomic concerns are resolved in a timely manner

 

Desired Skills and Experiences

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent degree is required
  • Electrical, Computer, or Controls Engineering degree is preferred
  • Must meet the educational and character requirements for P.Eng. license eligibility
  • Minimum of 1 to 3 years engineering experience (in assembly plant or automotive preferred) with high emphasis on process design, setup improvements or kaizen (industrial engineering type applications) is required
  • Multidisciplinary experience in process or equipment engineering (Mechanics, Pneumatics/Hydraulics and Control Systems)
  • Strong problem-solving skills related to quality and productivity KPIs in assembly (automotive preferred)
  • Strong project management skills related to leading equipment installation and refurbishment
  • Experience applying current manufacturing standards and practices is preferred (Machine Guarding, OHSA, Pre-Start Health & Safety Review (PSR), Electrical Code)
  • Proven track record to drive and implement changes
  • Working knowledge of programmable logic controllers (PLC) and human machine interface (HMI) programming (Ladder Logic, Sequential Function Chart (SFC)) is preferred
  • Willing to support daily and weekend overtime requirements as needed
  • Possible travel to USA and Japan
  • Must be flexible to work in Cambridge and/or Woodstock

 

Additional Preferred Qualifications (may be used for interview selection):

  • Safety System Design and Programming knowledge is considered an asset
  • Experience with robotics (Kawasaki, Fanuc) preferred
  • Working knowledge of Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) preferred (Ignition or Indusoft)


To promote a comfortable, safe and productive work environment, as well as to comply with all federal, provincial and/or local laws, TMMC is a smoke free property.

 

TMMC is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse team. We believe in enabling people of different ages, sexes, sexual orientations, gender identities, gender expressions, colours, races, ancestries, citizenships, ethnic origins, places of origin, and creeds to work together and realize their full potential. TMMC is committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.

title: CNC Operator - Night Shift
description:
Posted Date:4/5/2022
Job Category:
Position Title:CNC Operator - Night Shift
Salary Range:$20.00 - $22.27
Location:Markham, Ontario, Canada
Desired Skills:
Description:HCR Permanent Search is currently working with a top manufacturing company in Markham who needs to hire a CNC Operator. To be considered, you would need experience with CNC Milling equipment and programming MasterCam. Shift for this role would be from 11 pm until 7 am. Training would be on the day shift.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
• At least 2 years of experience as a CNC Operator and experience programming with MasterCam
• Must have experience with CNC mills
• Must be able to read blueprints
• Must have experience using measuring equipment

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Perform first off prior to the start of the operation
• Check parts and place them on the equipment correctly
• Ensure that all quality issues are reported immediately
• Remove parts from the shop floor
• Keep your work area tidy
• Wear necessary PPE

Aaron Berger
Senior Recruitment Consultant
HCR Permanent Search
Email: aberger@hcr.ca
Phone : 905-669-2400x2239
www.hcrpermsearch.com

title: Supplier Quality Engineer
description:
Supplier Quality Engineer 

itec group Inc. is currently recruiting for the position of Supplier Quality Engineer. The successful candidate will be tasked to ensure the supplier parts adhere to quality and health standards while maintaining low costs. This is a great opportunity that provides practical experience and effectively improves technical skills, leading to career growth opportunities. At itec group, we provide candidates with a seamless experience to transition into suitable roles as professionals in their desired fields. 

Key Qualifications include but are not limited to: 
  • Post-secondary in Quality, Industrial, Mechanical Engineering, or Supply Chain Management 
  • At least 5 years of experience in quality management in a manufacturing environment; at least 3 years of experience in retaining suppliers for manufacturing; 
  • Strong communication, organization, time management, and technical skills - Proficiency and knowledge of manufacturing and engineering quality standards, Microsoft Office, ERP systems, engineering design, and project management 

Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to: 
  • Communicate strategies with management and suppliers to reduce quality issues and risks 
  • Maintain, assess and communicate planning of quality improvement, risk assessments, quality reports, and prevention to key stakeholders 
  • Implement quality control inspections for incoming parts and on-site production to ensure manufacturing adheres to standards 

If you are interested in learning more about the Supplier Quality Engineer opportunity and meet the required qualifications, please submit your updated resume directly to lance@itecgroup.ca. 

We are recruitment industry leaders committed to quality service, integrity, respect and equal opportunity. Accommodation is available to all applicants upon request throughout our recruitment process. Please contact us at admin@itecgroup.ca or 1-877-682-8889 x223 if you require accommodation. We will work with all applicants to accommodate their accessibility needs. By applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related to the consideration of employment through itec group and its clients. Should you wish to stop receiving electronic communications at any time, simply let us know at  unsubscribe@itecgroup.ca

title: Production Supervisor
description:
Crown Packaging is dedicated to providing an engaging and positive work environment. Many of our employees have enjoyed working for Crown Packaging for the greater part of their careers; we have many employees with 20, 25, 30, even 35 years of service.

We currently have an opening for a Production Supervisor based out of our location in Richmond, BC. The Production Supervisor is responsible for overseeing the production function of the organization and the supervision of the operations team over a three-shift schedule.

The Production Supervisor will report directly to the Converting Superintendent and will be responsible for the following:

Duties include:
  • Responsible for the leadership of the production crew with regards to safety, quality, efficiency, and consistent application of best practices.
  • Manages any security or safety issues that arise on a day-to-day basis and ensures that issues are dealt with in a timely fashion.
  • Directs, redirects, coaches and trains employees to ensure Company policies, practices and procedures are followed, holding to the Collective Agreement.
  • Ensures that all products produced meet or exceed customer specifications, makes decisions on acceptability of products to hold/release.
  • Ensures that all maintenance issues that could impact safety, quality and efficiencies are brought to the attention of the maintenance department so they can be dealt with in a timely fashion.
  • Communicates regularly with personnel to maintain a high level of engagement.
  • Maintains/manages production recordings.
  • Actively participates in Health & Safety, including conducting safety meetings with crews, upholds safety policies and procedures, safety training, accident investigations and follow up items.
  • Supervises vacation time and makes recommendations to Management on manning levels and possible areas of improvement.
  • Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications and requirements for the position:

Experience:
  • A minimum of 5 years of supervisory experience is required.
  • Experience within a unionized manufacturing environment; manufacturing, packaging or printing experience is appreciated.
  • Manufacturing environment knowledge of safety/safe work procedures, equipment/maintenance, and process/workflow, machine and headcount scheduling.
  • Lean manufacturing experience is an asset.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
  • Extensive knowledge of manufacturing processes & products, preferably in printing or paper converting industries.
  • Strong computer skills with experience in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Excel and Word.
  • Knowledge of Supervisory, coaching, and training practices.
  • Professional, clear communicator.
  • Analytical ability.
  • Highly organized.
This position offers a competitive salary and an excellent benefits package. We are an equal opportunity employer, and as such, will review all qualified applicants for this posted position. If you feel you would be a good fit for this role, we would love to hear from you.

Please note, our location is not situated near public transit, applicants must have their own vehicle.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Logistics Planner / Distribution Planner
description:
Company Description

At Techo-Bloc, we aren’t just paving patios – we’re paving the way for great careers! Founded on a culture of innovation, we manufacture landscaping products focused on design, durability and flair. Our growing team is seeking passionate people, ready to make an impact. Intrigued? Come grow with us.

Why Work for Us?

We love to brag. Techo Bloc offers its valued employees a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.

Here are a few of our perks:

  • Leaders who are invested in your success;
  • Have a dynamic job and evolving career path;
  • Develop your skills and grow;
  • Free access to a virtual family doctor through virtual care;
  • Competitive salary Recruitment commissions program Annual bonus
  • Epic barbecues and Christmas parties;
  • Possibility of remote work;
  • Generous bonus program;
  • Snack filled kitchens;
  • Free parking;
  • Considerable referral bonuses;
  • Employee discounts on Techo-Bloc’s products;
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP available 24/7);
  • English and French language courses available (if it’s a work requirement);
Job Description

Under the supervision of the Demand and Distribution Manager, the Distribution Planner will be responsible for managing the demand and distribution of Techo-Bloc’s products throughout their network. As such, you will work with internal stakeholders to ensure the daily distribution/replenishment of our finished goods from our manufacturing sites to our 18 locations across Canada and the United States.

Essential Functions: 

  • Managing the demand and distribution of our products using our vastly automated Microsoft Dynamics AX ERP system;
  • Based off sales forecasts, in collaboration with the Demand & Distribution Manager, participate in the process of establishing our Min-Max and target inventory levels for the distribution of our finished goods;
  • Responsible for organizing the daily distribution/replenishment of our finished goods from our manufacturing sites to our 18 locations based off orders and safety stock;
  • Collaborate with the production planners to organize timely replenishment of our finished goods that is aligned with our production schedule;
  • Responsible for identifying actual or potential overstock situations in our depots and altering our replenishment strategy accordingly;
  • Collaborate with the purchasing department to organize the replenishment of resale items across our locations;
  • Collaborate with the marketing department to organize the replenishment of marketing merchandise across our depots;
  • Collaborate with the customer service order department to organize the distribution and fulfillment of special orders to our depots;
  • Work with the transport department to establish and maintain the most cost-effective distribution routes to replenish our depots;
  • Ad hoc analysis.
Qualifications

  • College or university degree in a related field;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in a related field;
  • Bilingualism (French/English);
  • Strong computer system skills. Advanced Excel skills (VLOOKUP, SUMIF etc.);
  • The ability to work independently, multi-task and prioritize tasks with strict deadlines;
  • Strong team player and organizational skills;
  • Ability to learn and suggest process improvement through problem solving;
  • Reacts well under pressure and detail oriented;
  • Fundamental knowledge of Supply Chain (planning and scheduling, production process and capabilities, inventory planning etc.) will be considered a strong asset;
  • Experience in using MRP will be considered a strong asset.


Additional Information

The use of the masculine gender has been adopted to facilitate reading and has no discriminatory intent.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Production Shift Leader
description:
Job Description

Assist Distribution Manager with the coordination of production team members engaged in the production of pizza dough in accordance with established company/industry standards and procedures. Be an active participant in the training and coaching of new/tenure team members in job duties, responsibilities and safety.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

(15%)

  • Set up production area prior to making dough
  • Scales and metering equipment must be check weighed equal to its usage and documented
  • Thermometers must be calibrated and checked against a certified thermometer
  • Yeast slurry and mixer timers checked and calibrated at the start of each production day

(60%)

  •  Lead the Production team in the absence of the Distribution Manager
  • Run the floor: Rotate breaks, complete daily dough requirement per sizes
  • Work as a production team member and perform tasks necessary to meet production goals
  • Perform batch setup and mixing of dough production process
  • Remove dough balls from rounder conveyor belt and place into dough tray
  • Stack filled dough trays and prepares for shipment
  • Load tray washer by placing soiled trays onto feeder conveyor
  • Monitors quality of dough product
  • Accurately complete all necessary paperwork

(10%)

  • Become and maintain dough certification
  • Attend and participate in Leadership & Development training sessions
  • Wear and follow Domino’s uniform standards

(15%)

  • Coach and train TMs at all positions as needed
  • Maintain safe and positive work environment in compliance with company standards, Province and federal requirements

 

Qualifications

 

  • High school diploma or GED, some college courses preferred 
  • 1-2 years of manufacturing or bakery experience 
  • One year of shift lead experience with sound effective communication skills
  • Some knowledge of Microsoft Office software

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Ability to stand, climb and walk on a continual basis throughout shift  
  • Ability to lift from floor to above the head, to carry materials weighing up to 50 lbs. frequently, and 75 lbs. occasionally, throughout work shift
  • Ability to work in refrigerated conditions [33-38 degrees], and work in environment with exposure to loud machinery, when necessary
  • Able to work with yeast and flour products


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Composite Technician
description:
Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fiberglass and metal components for local OEMs.

We are a family business committed to developing our team members to grow within our group of companies and develop their skills as much as possible. We enjoy company events whenever possible and are grateful for the wonderful team we have here at Eastside.

Eastside Industrial is committed to diversifying our customer base in class A coatings and composites manufacturing with our expanding our customer base throughout the continent.

Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings, and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.

POSITION PURPOSE:
This position will assist in all aspects of the Composite Technician which includes but not limited to prepping tools for gel coat, placing the fiberglass material load after gel coat and closing tooling, and injecting resin into the closed tool. In addition to this, operate machines or equipment or use hand tools to cut glass mat, shape, splice, and fit materials to form into tools. This job is for a reliable, hard-working individual that has a high level of attention to detail, excellent hand-eye coordination with the ability to work independently and efficiently while being focused on Safety and Continuous improvement aspects. 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Working in a safe manner and following all safety rules.
  • Ability to wear ½ mask face Respirator while performing specified work tasks.
  • Assist with tool movements and prep/cleaning for the gel coat booth.
  • Select and cut fiberglass mat and press / or lay mat over the gel-coated plug/tool.
  • Utilizing electric and pneumatic tools.
  • Seal / close tools and inject resin into tools at appropriate vacuum and injection volume.
  • Demold (Remove) the cured parts from the tool and clear excessive material from the edge of the tool.
  • Be prepared to lift 25 pounds from time to time in this role
  • Inspect tools to ensure it meets required specifications and identify any defects present 
  • Complete assigned work within given timeframe and according to specifications.
  • Keep all work areas including part storage area clean and organized, emptying scrap and garbage containers as necessary.
  • Cleaning and maintaining work tools such as rollers, brushes, grinders, electric tools and other pieces of equipment.
  • Cleaning and maintaining safety equipment such as respirators and dust masks.
  • Maintain all quality standards in accordance with the specifications for each job in order to meet customer requirements.
  • Performs additional duties as deemed necessary.
  • Takes initiative and is a self-starter.
  • Ability to prioritize and handle multiple duties/projects at one time, work independently. with minimal supervision, and resolve conflict in a professional manner.
  • Maintains open communication and a team-oriented work environment with all departments and all levels of personnel.
  • Demonstrates flexibility and professionalism throughout the day.
  • Adhere to all start/end times including break and lunch schedules.
  • Willingness to work in other areas of the facility as required.

QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE / REQUIRED SKILLS:
  • Preferred: High school diploma or GED from an accredited school system or program.
  • Preferred: 6 months of related experience in an industrial manufacturing environment.
  • Possess knowledge of and ability to identify and work with FRP Materials, machining tools / equipment.
  • Ability to follow verbal and written instructions.
  • Comfortable with repetitive tasks.
  • Position requires physical requirements including lifting, pushing/pulling, lifting, bending/stretching, and standing.

BENEFITS:
  • Dental care.
  • Disability insurance.
  • Extended health care.
  • Life insurance.
  • On-site parking.
  • RRSP match.

COVID-19 considerations:
Eastside ensures all protocols are followed for the safety of our employees, their families, and our customers. 
  • Personal protective equipment provided or required.
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place.
  • Social distancing guidelines in place.




    About Eastside Industrial Coatings and Composites :

    Established in 1997, Eastside Industrial started out as a coatings business, preparing and painting fibreglass and metal components for local OEMs.As the coatings business continued to grow with a focus on “A” Finish coatings, Eastside Industrial moved to a larger location (our current space), committed to diversifying into composites manufacturing and expanding our customer base throughout the continent.Today, Eastside Industrial serves dozens of OEMs across North America with tooling prototyping, assembly, coatings and composites manufacturing solutions. Eastside Industrial continues to see growth as we expand our operations to accommodate higher scale and more innovative production methods to continue meeting our current and targeted customer needs.We remain a family owned business focused on growing our team and developing our team to have a successful future with Eastside or a member of the Eastside Group.

title: Production Planning Coordinator
description:
ePac Flexible Packaging is a rapidly growing company with locations across the United States, Canada, Europe, and Indonesia.  Built on break-through digital printing. ePac is at the crossroads of advanced technology and manufacturing. ePacâ€™s mission is to provide locally-based consumer packaged goods companies the ability to compete with large brands with great packaging. Our customers are predominantly locally-based small and medium-sized CPGs, many of whom are focused on creating natural and innovative products for their consumers. Since opening our first manufacturing facility in 2016, our mission has been clear â€“ to help small brands obtain big brand presence, give back to the communities we serve and contribute to the creation of a more sustainable, circular economy. 

 

SUMMARY OF POSITION

The Production Planning Coordinator is responsible for planning and managing production schedules to meet customer delivery requirements and best utilize the companyâ€™s productive capacity as well as managing inventory levels. 

 

The position requires shift flexibility. 

Note: The 2nd shift can start anywhere from 2:00 pm until 02:00 am (subject to change). Training hours may be in the morning. Selected candidates should be flexible for rotating shifts (morning / noon / evening / night) if required.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES 

  • Plans and manages production schedules to meet customer delivery requirements and utilize the companyâ€™s production capacity. 
  • Assists Production Manager with developing and distributing production schedules.
  • Provides updates on order status to sales and sales support.
  • Receives and reviews sales orders against current requirements and work in process using the material requirement planning report. 
  • Releases sales orders and job tickets for production and manages purchases to support plant production. 
  • Understands and follows all safety policies and procedures. Helps support the management team by communicating unsafe practices to ensure compliance with safety policies and procedures. 
  • Commitment, awareness and involvement pertaining to SQF (policy, standards, procedures, etc.) and food safety practices (GMPs, procedures, etc.) are requirements of all employees.
  • Reviews production reports and ensures proper recording.
  • Records and corrects errors. 
  • Motivates and retains critical personnel to meet and exceed internal company goals.
  • Manages inventory levels, schedules, and availability of raw materials to meet production schedules.
  • Oversees monthly inventory physical count and manages adjustments that follow in future
  • Completes shipping information and delivery date input during sale order reviews in future

 

 

JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Problem Solving/Analysis
  • Technical Capacity - must be computer savvy and be able to learn how the ERP system functions and must be able to learn the manufacturing concepts
  • Communication Proficiency
  • Decision Making
  • Attention to Details - must be able to understand the end-to-end customer experience
  • Collaboration Skills

EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

  • Minimum Requirement : 1-2 years experience
  • ERP Systems experience is a plus.
  • Associates degree (A.A.) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school, operations management or supply chain, preferred.
  • Supervisory experience preferred but not required.
  • Experience and training in Continuous Improvement/LEAN principles.
  • Knowledge of Google Suites is preferred.

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT

.  

  • This job operates in a production office environment. The employee is frequently exposed to shop elements such as noise, dust, fumes and odors. This role also uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers, and filing cabinets.


BENEFITS 

We offer an excellent benefit and compensation package that consists of the following:

  • 15 days (6%) vacation entitlement
  • Statutory holidays
  • Company paid - Health; Dental; Vision Insurance
  • Company paid - Life Insurance & ADD, Short Term & Long Term Disability
  • RRSP Plan with generous company match to 3%

ePac 1

description:
Motivated. Detail Oriented. Focused. Driven.


Precision Resource Canada is hiring for a Material Handler to join our Canadian division located in Cambridge, Ontario.


Benefits:



+ Health and Dental Benefits Plan

title: Production Operator
description:
No Experience Necessary. Will Train.
PRODUCTION OPERATOR
Niverville Feed Mill – Full Time Position
Starting Wage: $16.00 – 20.00 per hour

Our company paid benefits package for full time employees includes: Major Medical, Dental, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, as well as enrollment in the Maple Leaf Pension Plan.

Shift premiums paid for hours worked on Afternoon and Evening Shifts

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
The production operator is part of an overall team which also includes maintenance technicians and truck drivers. The overall team is responsible for producing high quality animal feed in a safe and efficient manner.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Working with machines, equipment & computer systems to produce animal feed
  • Completing required paperwork for assigned tasks
  • Following manufacturing practices & safety policies
  • Following housekeeping standards
  • Operation of plant equipment to achieve daily production targets
  • Performing troubleshooting and minor repairs on machines
  • Communicating any changes in product flow, equipment malfunctions, shortages or deviations from specifications to Team Lead or Maintenance
  • Collecting raw material and final product samples and performing tests to ensure raw material and final product meet specifications
  • Measuring & weighing of ingredients
  • Following quality standards and ensuring proper documentation for feed safety

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE, SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND EDUCATION:
  • Willingness and ability to learn; strong team and interpersonal skills
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently with minimal supervision
  • Positive work ethic and attitude, attention to detail
  • Ability to lift 25 kg
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Basic computer knowledge
  • Experience in production/manufacturing environment will be considered an asset
Please submit a résumé to:

Human Resources
E-mail: mlafjobs@mapleleaf.com

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce.  Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our HR Team atmlafjobs@mapleleaf.com.  Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Shipper - Manufacturing Facility
description:
Company Overview
Sherwood Shelving™ is the trade name for the wholesale closet organizer manufacturing division owned by Excel Organizers Ltd. Sherwood Shelving was established just over 16 years ago to manufacture custom-designed closet organizer systems and now distributes using a dealer network across North America.
Company Highlights:
  • Active North American dealer network.
  • Over 16 Years in manufacturing and over 35 years in the industry.
  • Committed, highly skilled staff.
  • Quality products manufactured with high-end machines.
  • State-of-the-art manufacturing techniques and systems.

Responsibilities:
  • Shipping and receiving.
  • Verify that product is labeled and damage-free.
  • Neatly package orders into crates or on pallets.
  • Scan component labels and verify order is complete.
  • Inform coordinator, manager and team of product issues.
  • Help to keep work areas clean and tidy.
  • Prioritize orders for shipping deadlines.
  • Assist other team members in the production area as needed.
  • Other duties assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
  • Shipping and receiving experience an asset.
  • Forklift certification is an asset (will offer training certification if required).
  • Must be a team player.
  • Must be organized and efficiently manage workflow.
  • Have a high attention to detail.
  • Willing to learn all roles within the shipping department.
  • Willing to assist other workers in the production department.
  • Flexible and adaptable.
  • Comfortable in a dynamic work environment.
  • Must have reliable transportation to and from work.
  • Must have an excellent attendance record.
  • Must be willing and able to follow all company policies.
  • Meets productivity, quality and safety goals.
  • Follows directions and completes paperwork correctly.
  • Able to lift, push and pull up to 22.7 Kg (50 lbs) independently and multiple times daily.
  • No back or joint problems due to the lifting requirements.

Compensation:
  • Hourly wage negotiable based on experience.

All interested applicants are welcome to apply; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Visit our website for company details and contact information:

title: Production Operator
description:
Description:
Hiring Summer Students!!
Agilus is recruiting for several Production Operators in the manufacturing sector in Brockville, Ontario.
Workers are active members of a team responsible for daily production of quality product and continuous improvement throughout the client’s manufacturing plant. In this position you will operate and maintain production equipment; be responsible for material handling and production reporting; and maintain a safe work environment.
Responsibilities:
  • This position will require the flexibility to work in numerous areas in the facility
  • You will be expected to operate or work near moving machinery
  • The position requires working a rotating 12-hour shift including weekend work

An ideal candidate has:
  • You are a fast-learner with strong attention to detail
  • Have excellent time-management skills
  • Excellent attendance and attitude required

Requirements:
  • Successful completion of Grade 12 is a requirement for this position
  • A criminal background verification is required
  • Personal protective equipment will be required: hearing protection, safety shoes, and safety glasses
  • Must be available from May to end of August

Total compensation:
  • $19.28/hr
  • Weekly pay including 4% vacation pay
  • Preferred rates for benefit coverage available

Let's connect!
Please apply directly online by email mchapman@agilus.ca or by text 613.865.8695
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.

We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Mechanical Engineer Senior
description:
Sr. Mechanical Engineer with Design and Manufacturing experience
- Creo experience
- Plastic injection molding design, metal casting design, and elastomer design
o Advanced manufacturing techniques a plus
- Mobile device design experience (rugged a plus)
- Knowledge of shock, impact, seal, vibration, temperature, and chemical exposure environments
- Manufacturing processes knowledge and experience
- PCB layout support experience (Keep out drawings in particular)
- Root cause and DFMEA experience
- Tolerance analysis and first article inspection experience
- JDM/ODM design partner experience
- Years of experience
o 10+ years of experience for Sr engineer
o 5+ years of experience for support engineer
- Accredited degree in Mechanical engineering
- Will be based out of a company Design Facility (Holtsville NY, Mississauga CA, Taipei TW) but working remotely from home due to Covid restrictions
Looking for a mechanical engineer with a minimum of 10 years experience for Sr position (5 years of experience for support position) in mechanical engineering with relevant work experience with rugged handheld and fixed mount opto-electronic products and a knowledge of ruggedized packaging for mobile computers and accessories. Experience with company , Moto Solutions, Psion, Client, and/or Symbol devices is a plus.
Experience in designing and an understanding of manufacturing injection molded plastics, Zinc, Aluminum or Magnesium die cast parts, and precision sheet metal is required. Understanding and experience in tolerance analysis, risk assessment, and DFx (DFA/DFM) is required. Creo part/assembly design, and drafting is required as CAD data will need to be reviewed and updated. Knowledge of opto-mechanical design, structural FEA, and working in a JDM design model is desirable.
The position will require working with the mechanical project lead and the cross functional development team both within company as well as with our JDM/ODM partners, on the next generation rugged mobile product from concept phase, through development, analysis, simulation, build and test to release. Responsibilities will include (but may not be limited to) supporting the concepting of the design, requirements review, design and development, building test plans, root cause analysis of failure modes seen in testing, and resolution to issues that arise that are design, manufacturing and process related.

title: DCM Setter Operator
description:
Job Number: 42346 
Group: Cosma International  
Division: Cosma Casting UK 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: TELFORD 

 

Group Description

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

 

Role Summary

Responsible for setting up and adjusting various sizes of dies into Buhler Die Cast Machines and Trim presses to ensure parts are produced within specification. Perform any necessary die adjustments at set ups and to check accuracy during production. You’ll have experience with Buhler Die Cast Machines, Trim Presses and ABB robots and be able to set, configure, adjust and operate DCM machines. Being a core member of the production team and you will support in ensuring a safe working environment, and customer quality and satisfaction expectations are met.

 

Key Responsibilities

This role entails but is not limited to: -

 

  • Ensure that all dies are pre-staged at the machines and set according to the set-up sheets ready to be used for production.
  • Identify where remedial work might be required by support functions or ensure safe return of the dies to dedicated storage location at the end of the production run.
  • Leading planned / unplanned tool changing of Die Cast machines to ensure timely production against the plan.
  • Lead changeover activities and utilising SMED methodology to structure organised reduction of changeover times and provide detailed changeover report with concerns to production supervisor
  • Co-ordinate changeover activities with other stakeholders i.e., toolroom to ensure die availability on pre-heat station against the production plan
  • Conduct daily backup tooling audit to ensure tooling and equipment is available if needed to complete the changeover if primary tooling is unavailable
  • Be competent in running high pressure die casting machines, recovery of ABB robots from an emergency stop position
  • Perform TPM activities as needed and directed, such as, but not limited to cleaning, oiling and lubricating machines.
  • Check machine operation is within expected and set parameters and correct any out of conditions setting and/or report faults to the production supervisor or process engineering team.
  • Engage in CCUK continuous improvement initiatives (MAFACT) through identification and implementation of improvement activities that demonstrates measurable improvements in cycle time, work content reduction or workplace organisation.
  • Promote the companies HSE policies across the department and plant

Key Qualifications/Requirements

Essential: Proven

  • Proven production experience in Die casting machine setting and operating i.e., Buhler DCMs
  • Tool setting experience
  • Knowledge of SMED/QCO and business improvement tools and methodology
  • Experience of practical problem solving
  • 5S and workplace organisation methodology
  • Licensed operation of overhead crane
  • Understanding of KPI’s to drive performance
  • ABB robot operation and basic programming

Desirable:

  • Striko Furnaces experience
  • IOSH Managing Safely Qualification
  • Tier 1 automotive supply chain experience
  • Current FLT license
  • Experience of training of team members
  • Understanding of OEE and TPM

Additional Information

Personal Attributes:

  • Good problem-solving skills
  • Confidence to challenge the status quo
  • Target driven
  • Work collaboratively to achieve project/company goals
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Good communicator both written and verbal
  • Ability to work under pressure
  • Organised and able to multi-task
  • Proactive in approach with a “can do attitude”
  • Valid Driving Licence
  • Self-motivated
  • Analytical approach
  • Ability to challenge/reason their point of view at all level
  • Logical approach
  • Eligibility to work in the UK

Work Environment:

  • Plant conditions necessitate exposure to heat, cold, dust, hot objects, and loud noises within our manufacturing environment. Full Health and Safety training and PPE provided for all conditions.

title: Manufacturing Supervisor
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

The Manufacturing Supervisor is responsible for supervising operations to ensure production is operating in a safe, efficient, and timely manner. Responsible for productions schedules and posting of daily work assignments based upon production needs and individual strengths. Must be shop floor orientated and provide â€œhands-onâ€ product/process support for all reports on a daily basis. This individual will be the driver behind product/process safety, quality, delivery and morale. Accountable for continuous improvement of assigned department as well as training and development of direct reports.

Responsibilities:
  • All work must be performed in a safe, efficient manner in compliance with Company Policy, Local, Provincial and/or Federal rules and regulations and if applicable Collective Agreement.
  • Communicates, trains, guides and coaches employees to achieve operational initiatives that optimize team efforts in the manufacturing of high quality products.
  • Evaluates interpersonal skills, provides feedback and recommends as well as methods to improve interpersonal communications.
  • Schedules and assigns personnel to work according to the demand of the manufacturing schedules.
  • Continually assesses the limitations of equipment capacity and materials supply to directly make adjustments to personal for optimization of manufacturing output.
  • Assesses each employeeâ€™s abilities and skills to match with capabilities required for each area of the manufacturing floor.
  • Continuously monitors and tracks output, manufacturing processes, labour efficiencies, direct operating expenses and quality indicators for assigned cost centers.
  • Measures performance and quality.
  • Drives positive results in operational Key Process Indicators.
  • Establishes and builds working relationships with other departmental personnel, such as Maintenance, Engineering, Finance, Planning and Quality to meet production schedules.
  • Meets regularly on a formal basis with Management Team to review production results and improvement priorities.
  • Performs other related tasks as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • 1 to 3 yearsâ€™ related work experience
  • Knowledge of Occupational Health and Safety Act, and Labour Laws.
  • Conflict Resolution Management and Time Management.
  • Strong communication, presentation, organizational, problem solving, teamwork interpersonal and leadership skills.
  • Proficient computer skills.
  • Effective use of technology, instruments, tools and information systems.
  • Ability to seek a team approach.
  • Ability to give guidance and direction as required.
  • Ability to set direction, make decisions and oversee the line with little to no direct supervision.
  • Solid computer proficiency and knowledge of Microsoft Office software suite.
  • Availability to support/operate on off shifts as required.
  • Ability to deliver business results both independently and through others.
Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Warehouse Worker
description:
We're looking for a Warehouse Worker

Position Location: Fort Erie, Ontario

POSITION SUMMARY

The Warehouse Worker is responsible for receiving, stowing and picking material as well as maintaining inventory integrity within guidelines set out in AHCA's quality control manuals. They will also be required to use specific material handling equipment requiring specialized training in the execution of these duties. After adequate training the Warehouse Worker will also be required to perform "on call duties" in a rotation schedule with all qualified Warehouse Workers.


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

Organize Parts & Materials

  • Review and update automated picklists from Manufacturing Spares DCR - Aircraft
  • Prioritize picking order between departments
  • Create TO's and proceed to pick orders.
  • Read and follow instructions on screen, at the same time ensuring inventory integrity (lot# quantity, FIFO and pick location). If at any point there is a question in any of the above criteria stop and verify the discrepancy in SAP, do not proceed until resolution is reached or the Lead hand or Supervisor gives instruction to do so.

Prepare Work Orders, Parts and Materials for in-House Delivery

  • Ensure picked Work orders and materials are packaged appropriately for delivery and that all parts and materials have the proper Trace identification attached and all packaging is clearly marked with the correct work order number.
  • Work orders, parts and materials are collected in a central area and are generally delivered twice a day on or around 11:30am and 3:30pm. Parts work orders and materials will be delivered to a specific employee or aircraft dependent on how the parts work orders or materials have been requested.
  • Run monthly Timex report, quarantine Timex product and scrap out following the procedure

Remove Stock from Vendors

  • Receive delivery from vendor making sure to inspect each package to ensure correct number of packages and their condition. Ensure shipment belongs to AHCA.
  • Open package and remove parts and paperwork to ensure they have part number, value, expiry date, and serial number and receive into SAP as per procedure
  • Stow parts in designated location.
  • Issue parts to open Sales order or open Work order as per AHCA Policies and Instruction and AHCA Quality Program Procedures
  • Raise QN in SAP for non-conforming parts found during the receiving function
  • Perform daily cycle count

Maintain and Update incoming RMA's

  • Update the RMA in SAP and send info to the appropriate department via email

Shipping

  • Package parts for shipping/stock
  • Ship parts to customers using waybills also fill out customs invoices and B13's
  • In the Ship as per procedure in SAP for domestic, international, dangerous goods protocol.
  • Ensure that parts being shipped are checked off against the TO, to ensure accuracy.
  • Run delivery report daily to ensure all shipments are complete.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS

  • Post-Secondary Diploma in Operations - Materials/Inventory Management or related discipline
  • Ability to multi-task and set priorities in a fast paced environment
  • Effective communication (written and oral) and organizational skills
  • Ability to work and think independently and under general supervision
  • Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines sense of urgency and customer satisfaction
  • Ability to lift and bend repetitively
  • Accuracy and attention to detail in data entry, paperwork and all other aspects of the position
  • Warehouse experience picking/packing/receiving of orders/shipments considered an asset
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office 2010 pack
  • Bilingualism (French-English) an asset
  • Experience with SAP considered an asset
  • Must be able to work 10:30 am to 7:00 pm every 4 weeks



We would like to thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Chief Boiler Engineer
description:
Manage the staff and physical assets of the steam, ammonia, utilities, fire suppression, water treatment, and effluent treatment systems at Rexdale. As a member of the plant management team, the Chief Operating Engineer has ownership of the Utilities department performance, organizational decisions, continuous improvement, and safety culture.

With focus on the boilers and chillers, the Chief Operating Engineer will ensure safe and efficient operation of steam generation, ammonia cooling system, preparation and implementation of capital and expense projects, and collaboration with all plant departments.  Implementation of safety procedures and programs designed to ensure regulatory compliance and the minimization of industrial injuries and illnesses, property damage and general liability losses at the Rexdale plant.

 

Core Functions:

  • Lead, supervise and develop Operating Engineers
  • Manage maintenance and operating safety and regulatory requirements associated with TSSA regulated equipment with production and maintenance teams
  • Provide reliable generation of steam for plant processes
  • Ensure total safety, care and control of the ammonia refrigerated system
  • Operate and maintain water treatment systems for the boiler and cooling towers.
  • Operate and maintain effluent treatment systems for the plant including dissolved air flotation equipment, aeration equipment, and retention tanks.
  • Maintain plant water supply, compressed air, nitrogen distribution, sewer systems, HVAC systems and fire protection system.
  • Provide supervision and training for the production operators
  • Planning of annual maintenance shutdown work related to boiler, ammonia & compressed air equipment reliability and regulatory compliance, fire protection maintenance, sewer and water systems maintenance, water & effluent treatment equipment service.
  • Participate in project planning for equipment replacement, upgrade, rebuilds and repairs and work towards reducing overall site energy costs.
  • Full knowledge of and compliance with related Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) as part of the Food and Feed safety programs.
  • Co-operate with other supervisors, operations staff, management, and outside contractors as required.
  • Ability to read and understand written manuals, drawings, work orders, etc.
  • Willingness to learn new procedures and participate in training.
  • Prepare and forward month end report.
  • Ensure compliance with Bunge safety policies by all employees, contractors, and visitors.
  • Update emergency measures plan, safety, ammonia, and boilers manuals as necessary.
  • Maintain adherence to divisional and corporate environmental policies and procedures.
  • Keep management informed of changes in policies both governmental and within Bunge along with keeping management informed of issues within the plant.
  • Participate in the Supervisor on call schedule to provide off shift and weekend supervision to the entire Rexdale facility.
  • Duties assigned or requested by management.

 

Work Hours: Monday – Friday 40 hours/week.  Must be able to work overtime as required. The Company reserves the right to alter the starting and quitting times as well as the working schedules for the efficient operation of the business.

 

Skill/Experience Requirements:

  • TSSA approved 4th Class Operating Engineer Certificate or higher.
  • Demonstrated success in the application of safety standards, compliance with safety regulations, and the promotion of a safe working environment.
  • Proven and demonstrated leadership and management skills within a team-oriented environment.
  • Knowledgeable in water and effluent treatment and water chemistry.
  • Good working knowledge of PC applications such as Word, Excel, Outlook, and SAP.
  • Ability to manage projects related to the maintenance and upgrade of equipment listed under “Main Functions”.
  • Demonstrate knowledge and experience with the mechanical process equipment, process automation systems, boilers, electrical distribution systems, plumbing and instrumentation.
  • Preferred qualifications include 3-5 years of operations experience in the food industry.
  • Must demonstrate servant leadership attributes

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

 

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled
