title: Quality Technician
description:
IKON Complete Inc. is a Recruitment & Search Firm specializing in identifying, & sourcing top performers for our clientele. Our clients include industry leading organizations who partner with us to be an extension of their HR & Recruitment function.
 
Position: Quality Technician
Location: Brantford, ON
Industry: Automotive Manufacturing
Pay Rate: $22.00 per hour
Shift(s): 3 shift rotation
 
Responsibilities:  
  • Perform visual inspections, mechanical, and functional verification of parts to ensure compliance to set specification and quality standards
  • Competent with use of micrometers, verniers, height gauges, CMM, and Optical test equipment
  • Study product specifications and work instructions
  • Follow nonconforming part procedure to identify & isolate defective material
  • Support internal/external audit processes, as required
  • Support cross functional problem-solving activities, as required
  • Ability to read and understand blueprints/inspection plans
  • Support PFMEA and APQP activities, as required
  • Support PPAP activities, as required
 
Qualifications:  
  • High School diploma or equivalent 
  • CQT certification, or College diploma in Quality Technician program and at least two years of equivalent work experience in IATF 16949 environment
  • Must have prior CMM programming experience
  • Must have solid understanding of GD&T
  • Must be able to work 3 shift, 2 week rotation
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
 
IKON Complete Inc. is committed to providing accessibility to qualified candidates with disabilities. Requests for accommodation can be made at any time at ikoncomplete.com/accessibility-policy-aoda/

title: Relief Machine Operator - Full Time Production C Shift
description:
Dessert Holdings is a leading baked goods platform providing premium layer cakes, cheesecakes, brownies, bars, and other desserts to the retail in-store bakery (“ISB”) and foodservice channels on a largely private label basis. We are a rapidly growing company comprised  of The Original Cakerie (acq. December 2015), Lawler’s Foods (acq. July 2016), and Atlanta Cheesecake Company (acq. January 2018). We are poised for continued growth by bringing high-quality products to both retail grocery and foodservice across North America. Led by a senior team with strong company pedigrees and experience driving improvement – we have exciting opportunities to be a part of this high performance, growth-focused organization.  

We are looking to hire Full-Time Relief Machine Operator  to join our production team in our London, Ontario facility

This is a full time production role that provides Relief Machine Operator backup when needed.

  • Equipment set up and troubleshooting adjustments, to keep products within standard and to keep all the lines running at or above required performance.
  • Maintaining the required hygiene standards of the equipment and the facility, consistent with GMP standards and Master Sanitation Schedules.
  • Removing waste from the production areas as needed.
  • Safe use, storage, and maintenance of all company supplied cleaning equipment hand tools and materials.
  • Supporting Setup Support, contract cleaning and maintenance services when necessary.
  • Maintaining all BRC audit paperwork and other required documentation as may be required.
  • Liaising with appropriate staff throughout the shift to ensure continuous process and quality standards.
  • Supporting line staff on day-to-day basis for general troubleshooting/problem-solving/conflict resolution.
  • Adhering to safety, quality and performance standards.
  • Supporting training and continuous learning activities within the department.
  • Responsible to practice the 5 steps of cleaning at all times
  • Start and operate all equipment within the department assigned, however, Critical Equipment such as the VRT and Abrigo robotic cutters will be handled by the Maintenance department.
  • Product change-overs on all equipment not classified as CRITICAL by operations.

  • Work efficiently and be sure that changeovers are smooth with minimal downtime and all time accounted for.

Position Requirements:

  • Chemical knowledge and comfortable working with exposure to cold temperatures
  • Ability to work independently, well organized, effective judgment
  • Mechanical aptitude is a requirement
  • Accountable for the Master Sanitation Schedule
  • Excellent attendance record and demonstrated reliability
  • Ability to perform heavy lifting, climb stairs, navigate around equipment, and work with a sense of urgency
  • Cooperative and works well with others, strong communicator
  • Setup and changeover experience is an asset
  • Previous experience as a machine or set up operator in a continuous process manufacturing environment, preferably food or pharmaceutical is an asset

Note: Candidates will be required to complete a skills evaluation for mechanical aptitude.

What we provide:

Wage Rate : When working as Machine operator

                      Probationary Rate (70 Shifts) $ 21.81

                      Full wage after 70 Shifts $24.24

                      When working in general production

                      Probationary rate (70 shifts) $18.06

                      Full wage after 70 shifts $20.07

This position offers extended health benefits, as well as company contribution pension plan

Machine operator shifts will be prioritized and backfilled with Production roles.

C shift - must be able to work various start times between 5:00PM and 10:00pm

We thank you in advance for your interest in The Original Cakerie.  Due to volume, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

HPAPP

title: Quality Engineer
description:
itec group Inc. is currently recruiting for a Quality Engineer who will provide continuous improvement  and plant support. This opportunity is located in the Greater Toronto Area. Do you want to work for an Award winning company and one of Canada’ s top 100 employers? At itec group we provide a seamless experience transitioning
professionals into suited roles.

Key Qualifications include but are not limited to:
  • Bachelor' s degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering
  • 2 to 3 years of experience in the manufacturing industry
  • Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication, organizational leadership and problem-solving skills
Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Implement and direct manufacturing equipment changes, from testing to quality assurance while maintaining relationships with customers
  • Maintain documentation of the manufacturing and production process, from creation of equipment to the utilization of equipment
  • Create opportunities for feedback from customers and ensure a good quality of production using a revision system
  • Ensure best practices and continuous improvement of equipment, processes and projects
If you are interested in learning more about the Quality Engineer opportunity and meet the required qualifications, please submit your updated resume directly to kate@itecgroup.ca. We are recruitment industry leaders committed to quality service, integrity, respect and equal opportunity. Accommodation is available to all applicants upon request throughout our recruitment process. Please contact us at admin@itecgroup.ca or 1-877-682-8889 x223 if you require accommodation. We will work with all applicants to accommodate their accessibility needs. By applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related to the consideration of employment through itec group and its clients.

Should you wish to stop receiving electronic communications at any time, simply let us know at unsubscribe@itecgroup.ca

title: Manufacturing/Assembly Support Associate (72455-054)
description:
Company Description

Looking for a change, an opportunity to show your exceptional skills, a chance to help lead and build a team? Grow your career with a company that shares your passion!

Contributing to The Well-Being and Quality Of Our Consumers

The well-being of our consumers is at the heart of Sodexo's approach, customer engagement is integral in the services provided by Sodexo employees in various locations across Canada. We work closely with our consumers and clients to create an interactive and personalized environment for the well-being of everyone we serve.

Sodexo is proud to announce these nominations:  2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employer; 2021 Canada’s Greenest Employers; 2020 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index featured company; 2020 Parity Certification - Platinum level and Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Program company – Gold Level.

What We Can Offer You

Sodexo offers you a flexible and dynamic work environment, competitive compensation, access to ongoing training and development programs, and countless opportunities to grow within the company.

Job Description

We are looking for a Manufacturing/Assembly Support Associate to join our dynamic team. This position is a full-time role(Monday till Friday day shift). You will be offered is a great team environment, work/life balance and the ability to ensure customer satisfaction.

General Responsibilities:

  • Maintain bays cleanliness, includes occasional light maintenance/assembly.
  • Tidy and base clean remaining bays, include organizational duties as required.
  • Operate machinery such as forklifts and cranes.
  • Store materials in appropriate areas.
  • Machine clean up.
  • Windows and walls.
  • Spill Clean-up.
  • Sending emails.
  • Review and complete weekly check list.
  • Attend weekly walk-through and team meetings.
  • Any other duties that may come up from time to time, as requested by your supervisor.
  • To report all injuries, accidents and hazardous conditions to management immediately.
  • To support the Sodexo Safety Program.
Qualifications

  • You are a dynamic and reliable person with good communication and interpersonal skills. You are committed to quality assurance and safety. You would support the Sodexo Safety Program and maintains high standards for work areas and appearance.
  • You will be attending training programs (classroom and virtual) as needed, comply with all company safety and risk management policies and procedures, perform all work in accordance with established safety procedures, participate in regular safety meetings, safety training and hazard assessments.  Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned as required
  • High School diploma, GED or equivalent experience is required. You must have 1 or more years of related work experience.
  • Forklift and Overhead Crane experience an asset, but we are willing to train.
  • Criminal Record Search prior to joining.

What's Next?

If you're looking for a role where you can truly impact the lives of others, click "I'm interested" for a quick 5-minute online application.



Additional Information

Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnicity, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other federal, provincial, or local protected class.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates who participate in all aspects of the selection process. 

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

Follow us on social media to see first-hand what we are all about!  

Instagram: @SodexoCanadaCareers

Twitter: @SodexoJobsCA

LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers

Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs

title: Permanent Setup Operator
description:
Are you a machine operator with experience in various manufacturing environments? Do you know how to set up equipment and troubleshoot adjustments? Do you maintain a clean and orderly work environment?

We would like to meet you!

Come and be part of a team of machine operators in a large manufacturing company in Ingersoll, Ontario. You will be responsible for setting up and running machinery for flat-rolled steel. Some hand and power tool and drill press experience will be an asset to assembling and finishing steel when required.

Job Title: Set Up Operator - Flat-rolled steel
Location: Ingersoll, Ontario

Shift: Bi-weekly rotations of days and afternoons
Hours: 6 am to 2 pm and 2 pm to 10 pm (Monday to Friday)
Pay rate: $18.89 hourly to start, at 3 months there will be a pay increase to $20.91 hourly and at 1 year an increase to $25.27 hourly


Advantages
Why make the job change?

Permanent job opportunity
Long-term job opportunity
Full-time hours
Pay increases 2 times in the first year up to $25.27 an hour
Benefits after 3 months
RRSP and Pension benefits after 3 months
2 weeks paid vacation first year
Overtime available after 40 hours
Bonus pay
Training involved
Welcoming environment to new employees
Strong team-oriented company

Responsibilities
Be a reliable team member who works at all times focusing on Safety and Accuracy while being productive.

1. Set up machine according to production schedule
2. Maintain correct locations for tooling
3. Maintain tooling with great care
4. Clean tooling before installing on arbor
5. Ensure the knives are of the highest quality
6. Inspect set up for accuracy
7. Maintain and improve all daily procedures
8. Increase safety and productivity at highest level of quality
9. Maintain and improve a high level of health and safety
10. Build set up according to ASKO
11. Ensure correctness of order from start to finish
12. Troubleshooting of slitting problems
13. Assist operators with loading and unloading of material
14. Build separators as required
15. Assist packager
16. Maintain a clean work area
17. Other duties as assigned by plant supervisor/management

Qualifications
Who are we looking for?

Someone with machine operating experience
High School diploma or greater
1-2 year experience in manufacturing
Forklift and crane experience asset
Basic mechanical knowledge of machines is an asset

Summary
How to apply:

To apply for this position email your resume to Oksana at oksana.chanas@randstad.ca
Or call the office 519..679.0058 ext 1 and ask for Oksana or Jenny
Or apply online at randstad.ca

We are text-friendly. Feel free to text us at 226-387-3922


Are you interested in making your next career move, but this one doesn’t sound right? Please give us a call – we have an extensive list of open positions in the Brantford area. We look forward to speaking with you!

If this job is not for you, but you’re interested in a career change, please call the phone number above and let us know what you’re looking for. We would love to help find you your dream job!

Make sure you download our new app called 'myrandstad' in the Google Play Store or the App Store and give us a call so we can set you up with a pin. This is the new way to get all the latest job notifications! If you need help setting up the app just stop by our office or give us a call and we'll be happy to help!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Production Associate
description:
Group Description

The Mechatronics, Mirrors and Lighting group specializes in automotive technologies that are driving the future of mobility. Combining a deep systems knowledge to develop unique vehicle access experiences, intelligent visions systems and advanced automotive lighting technologies, MML's expertise light the path to innovation, safety and styling.

 

Role Summary

This role is for energetic, enthusiastic individulas who enjoy working as a part of a team.  Full-time and Summer Students work available.

Section Title: Key Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities

•     Perform production tasks according to standard operating procedures and manufacturing guidelines.
•    Inspect and assemble various automotive lighting parts;
•    Complete required paperwork from a safety and quality perspective;
•    Ensure work area is kept clean and free from hazards.

Section Title: Key Qualifications/Requirements

Key Qualifications/Requirements

  • Grade 12 Diploma or equivalent education would be an asset. 
  • Prior manufacturing experience would be an asset.

Section Title: SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

•    must possess initiative, and a willingness to learn;
•    ability to work independently and also as part of a team;
•    effective written and verbal communication skills;
•    ability to follow standardized operating procedures;
•    ability to keep work area clean and organized;
•    ability to adapt to different situations;
•    ability to use various hand tools;
•    ability to work in a fast paced manufacturing environment;
•    ability to inspect product and ensure that it meets quality standards;
•    dependable/ reliable.

Section Title: WORK ENVIRONMENT

WORK ENVIRONMENT

•    ability to stand;
•    ability to move around on the production floor;  
•    ability to bend, twist, lift, reach;
•    ability to work shift work including overtime, as required;
•    ability to work at different plants/ department

Section Title: Additional Information

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.  Everyone is welcome!...Magna Autosystems is a diverse and inclusive company.  Sign-on Bonus.  Safety shoe and prescription safety glass reimbursement.

title: Batch Operator/Helper-(Forklift Operator, Cook, Mixer )
description:
With Staff Management | SMX, you'll get a weekly paycheck, learn new skills, meet new people, and work with a great management team in a clean and safe environment.


We encourage all candidates who have the right mix of skills, abilities and a passion for learning and growing to apply. Additional training will be provided on the Job.


.


Perks & Benefits: Paid Training, Weekly paychecks, Referral Bonus (Restrictions Apply), Modern, high tech Environment.


Bonus: $100 Sign on Bonus after 90 Days.


Shifts: 1st Shift, 2nd Shift, 3rd Shift.


Employment Types: Temp to Hire, Long Term, Full Time.


Pay Rate: $18.00 - $21.00 / hour


Duties:

Review the entire formula with the Supervisor and sign off. - Compare all pre-measured raw materials (RM) with the formula and transfer to cart. - Make sure all other RM and packaging is available before beginning the batch. - Check and record the batch numbers and license plate. - Verify kettle and pumps are clean. -Check weights, complete and attach labels, correct pallet, storage instructions and any other packaging instructions written on the formula. Check the fruit and notify Supervisor of any deviations. Make the batch by following all the instructions and check off all RM's as they are added to the kettle. Report batch as finished goods in DAX system and print labels. Ensure timings and yields are marked on the formula


.


Position Requirements:

- Ability to occasionally lift and/or move up to 40-50 pounds. - Flexible and reliable. - Ability to work well in a team environment. - Strong numeracy, written and verbal communication skills. - Ability to work with Computers. - Food industry experience considered a strong asset. - Be ready to be trained Counterbalance Forklift Operator.


Requirements: Stand for Shift Duration, Must be at least 18 years old.Able to Lift 40 pounds., required education: HS Diploma or GED.


Recruiting Center: Staff Management, 5 Precidio Ct, Brampton, ON L6S6B7.


Work Location: Staff Management, Brampton, ON L6S6B7.


Job Types: Food Production, Manufacturing.


Industry: Manufacturing.
SM | SMX is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, sexual orientation, age, gender identification, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Set-up Operator - Grinding (CNC)
description:
Set-up Operator - Grinding (CNC)

Location: 

Stratford, CA, N4Z 1H3

Job Requisition ID: 4769

 

Schaeffler is a dynamic global technology company and its success has been a result of its entrepreneurial spirit and long history of private ownership. Does that sound interesting to you? As a partner to all of the major automobile manufacturers, as well as key players in the aerospace and industrial sectors, we offer you many development opportunities.  

 

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Sets up, programs and/or operates machines for production and assembly as assigned, assures and supports process release.
  • Sets up and / or programs the operating machine and checks accuracy and effectiveness in test sequences.
  • Oversees ramp up of machines after setup procedure.
  • Operates the machines or supports Operators in operating the machines, and cooperates with maintenance staff, if necessary.
  • Checks finished product/product component and submits for approval.

Your Qualifications

  • Skilled
  • 3 to 5 years

OR

  • Vocationally trained
  • 3 to 5 years

 

Exciting assignments and outstanding development opportunities await you because we impact the future with innovation. We look forward to your application.

 

 

Your contact

Schaeffler Aerospace CDN 

Erica Lynn King 

+15192766627 

 

Schaeffler Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Production Supervisor
description:
Company Description

Do you want a position that is poised for career progression? Have you ever wanted to work for a two time winning Canada's top 50 best managed company?  Do you want to experience a new plant build and put your mark from day 1?

If you answered yes, then Techo-Bloc is your next career move. We are opening a new production facility in Ayr, Ontario.  Starting in June we need a Production Supervisor to train in Montreal to learn all that is the Techo way and then come home to launch the new plant...sound exciting?? It is!

Techo-Bloc produces exceptional paving stones and retaining walls. Our facilities are operated by teams of the highest caliber with the latest technology to deliver superior products. Using the 5S and Kanban philosophies, we are dedicated to a manufacturing collaboration that supports running a “whole-minded” production system, and an excellent way to promote improvement. We ensure our products are functional, durable, and astonishingly beautiful.

With soon to be 9 manufacturing facilities (and counting), 30 international patents and over 700 employees, we operate in an exciting and dynamic environment. As we continue to expand, our team members are offered opportunities to professionally develop, learn new abilities and pursue projects that excite them.

If you want to work for a company that listens and is dedicated to your progress this may be your next career move!

Job Description

Reporting to the Production Manager the Production Supervisor is expected to manage all aspects of the plant for their shift; including production, planning activities, training and employees. Additionally, the Supervisor is responsible for overseeing of the daily production operations while ensuring that all safety procedures are followed and that all production goals are met.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure the efficient management of operations of a multiple shift production facility.
  • Optimize efficiency, productivity and equipment performance to meet objectives.
  • Ensure the proper functioning of equipment and identify potential problems.
  •  Act as a leader in terms of continuous improvement and change management.
  • Ensure compliance with Standards and Operation\Procedures (SOP’s).
  • Analyze data drawn from production reports to identify possible improvements, reduce losses and the number of breakdowns as well as improve efficiency.
  • Communicate, implement and apply company policies and procedures.
  • Support the company business plan.
  • Motivate employees, be a positive source of influence, and lead by example;
  • Encourage autonomous work by empowering employees.
  • Use a training plan and ensure succession planning.
  • Ensure the product quality standards are met through inspections and material testing procedures.
  • Help in managing capital improvement projects including design, engineering, scheduling, purchasing, budgets and installation.
  • Help in administering/ reinforcing the company safety program while ensuring compliance with required training and safety procedures.
  • Oversee the production planning, staffing, and day-to-day manufacturing operations in a cost-effective manner, accurately track and record KPI’s, troubleshoot and resolve operational, manufacturing, and maintenance problems to ensure minimum costs and prevent operational delays.
  • Helps in maintaining staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees; develop personnel growth opportunities by coaching/ mentoring employees verbally and written documentation.
  • Professionally resolves personnel problems by analyzing data, investigating issues, identifying solutions, and recommending ethical plan of action.
  • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications

  • At least 2 years of work experience as Supervisor/ Leader in a production/ manufacturing
  • environment (Preference will be given to candidates with experience in the
  • industry).
  • High School Diploma required - a Bachelor’s degree in business management or related discipline preferred.
  • Excellent proven leadership and change management skills.
  • Ability to quickly establish credibility to develop and maintain excellent business relations both
  • internally and externally.
  • Mechanically inclined with excellent trouble shooting skills.
  • Strong abilities in planning, organizing, project management, and problem solving;
  • Able to work flexible schedules including nights and weekends when necessary.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Experience with of Microsoft Office tools and ERP systems;
  • Experience with Six Sigma and Lean Manufacturing


Additional Information

Additional Information

  • A competitive salary with wage progression;
  • This role is designed as a Monday to Friday fulltime position; however, the right candidate has the willingness to work flexible manufacturing schedules including nights, weekends, etc. when needs demand.
  • Full Benefit package
  • Free access to a virtual family doctor through virtual care
  • Technological tools and a safe workplace
  • Learning and development opportunities
  • Work for 2020  and 2021 Best Managed Company award recipient
  • Work to keep us the #1 best innovative landscaping products manufacturer
  • Positive work environment with great team atmosphere

Physical Demands:

The employee is regularly required to sit; use hands; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand and climb or balance. The employee is occasionally required to walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

title: Manufacturing Engineering Technologist - CNC Machining
description:
Our client requires a Manufacturing Engineering Technologist for their location in Ingersoll, ON. This position will report to the Engineering Manager

Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for N.C programming for all CNC/NC equipment, robot, programming, design and co-ordinate all tooling and gauging. 
  • Design of all process and quality documents including operating procedures, specifications for purchasing of components, inspection test plans and packaging documentation. 
  • Assist manufacturing (production) to improve process tooling or needs as requested by Engineering Manager. 
  • Ensure that all methods, tools, etc., are working at optimum levels. 
  • Complete routings, operation or process drawings and as required APQP documents as outlined in Policy/Procedure manual. 
  •  
Continually ensure that CNC and processing records are updated
  • Assist shop floor supervision in training activities
  • Trouble shoot shop floor as it relates to quality and processing issues.
  • Ensure that all methods, tools, and processes are used by follow-up
  • Ensure that parts are delivered to the customers correct in a price effective method
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Prioritizing/time management skill, ability to cope with multiple tasks
  • Analyze existing productions methods, time studies and operator issues
  • Ability to work in a fast paced, changing environment
  • Estimate and quoting of production jobs as required
  • Performs other duties as required.      
Skill/Effort Requirements
  • Project management using advanced project planning
  • Able to program CNC/NC lathes, machining centres, robots, and other programmable equipment
  • Requires extensive knowledge of general machining practices
  • Requires extensive knowledge of gauge designs and practices
  • Able to specify processes to manufacture components
  • Able to correct machining problems by tooling, gauging, machining or fixturing 
  • Able to estimate machining cycle
  • Able to use CAD/CAM
  • Able to perform method analysis
  • Able to plan, project, and perform project analysis
  • Frequent processing of multiple tasks and projects with frequent interruptions

title: Tugger Operator (Nights)
description:
Job Number: 42745 
Group: Magna Exteriors  
Division: Plastcoat 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: BRAMPTON 

 

Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

Key Responsibilities

•    Maintain “First in, First out” (FIFO) material handling principles
•    Ensure all damaged containers/racks are reported to the Team Leader/Area Leader
•    Work as a team with other Tugger and Fork Lift Operators to ensure the most efficient material flow
•    Working knowledge and understanding of each work area in support of cross training
•    Complete daily tugger inspection and fill out safety check sheet prior to start of each shift
•    Supply parts, components and packaging to appropriate manufacturing areas (Assembly, Moulding, etc) as required
•    Communicate work in process and finished goods racks required to loader 
•    Remove finished product from work cells and transport it to the tugger pick-up / unloading area
•    Ensure a consistent flow of process to avoid a slowdown of production operation
•    Empty racks and tote labels before taking to work cell
•    Participate in rotation schedule to facilitate cross training in each area supported by department
•    Perform all job functions in a safe and healthful manner, abiding by all health, safety and environmental rules and regulations, promoting safety in the workplace 
•    Report all accidents/incidents and unsafe conditions/behavior 
•    Adhere to applicable quality systems and IATF- 16949 standards 
•    Adhere to and promote the Employee Charter and work within the rules, regulations and guidelines of the Plastcoat Employee Handbook
•    Comply with the requirements of C-TPAT/PIP
•    Conduct business in an ethical manner in compliance with the Magna Code of Conduct
•    Participate in and support Continuous Improvement initiatives 
•    Maintain work area in accordance with the principles of 5S and operate daily within these standards 
•    Ensure work area is kept neat and organized 
•    Perform other duties as required 
 

Key Qualifications/Requirements

EDUCATION:
•    Minimum completion of Grade 12 diploma
•    Valid Ontario G-level driver’s license
EXPERIENCE:
•    Experience in automotive manufacturing industry an asset
SKILLS:
•    Must have complete knowledge of all programs handled (part numbers, colors, etc.) and containers used for each part
•    Good verbal and written communication skills 
•    Computer literate in word & spreadsheet programs
•    Demonstrated ability to effectively solve problems
•    Physically capable of performing essential duties of the job (examples: push and pull tugger carts, standing while operating tugger)
 

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: Stacker - Day Shift
description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

 Provide General Labour assistance to the Production Lines.

 

Role and Responsibilities:

 

1)    Perform any of the following activities at various levels of speed as directed by the Team leader:

 

·         Dump empty bottles out of boxes into hoppers and elevators

    

·         Place empty bottles onto moving conveyor belts.

 

·         Place sprayers into bottles moving on conveyor belts

 

·         Pack completed bottles of product into boxes.

 

·         Place hangtags, sleeves or other promotional items on bottles moving on a conveyor belt.

 

·         Clean labels or product off all bottles

 

·         Empty bottles of product.

 

·         Pack into shippers’ final products.

 

·         Use L-Bar machine after training when necessary.

 

2)    Be responsible for the final quality of every unit that is placed into a customer’s shipper.  If unsure of the quality standard required, there is a responsibility to check with the Team Leader before packing questionable product.

 

3)    Be responsible for the safety and housekeeping in the immediate work area.  Help to clean up if the packing line stops for any period. Report any unsafe conditions to your Team Leader or Supervisor.

 

4)    Participate in Continuous Improvement activities.

 

5)    Comply with Good Manufacturing Practices, Standard Operating Procedures, Safety Standards, and follow all plant policies and procedures.

 

6)    Stack finished goods boxes on to a skid (boxes can weigh between 1kg and 14kg).

 

7)    Responsible to set up codes on the case sealer.

 

8)    Fill out Stacker Finished goods checklist.

 

9)    Be able to move skids using a hand pump truck to move single pallets of finished goods out of a line.

 

10)  Bring material to the line with a hand pump truck.

 

11)  Dump bottles and caps into the appropriate hopper (weight of the box ranges from 5kg to 15kg)

 

12)  Other related duties as required.

 

Qualifications and Education Requirements

 

·         Able to visually concentrate and listen intensely for extended periods of time.

 

·         Able to stand, sit, lift, bend, crouch, reach consistently for eight hours.

 

·         Able to grasp and manipulate a variety of packaging components (ie. sprayers, bottles, caps)

 

·         Must be able to read, write and speak English.

 

·         Must be able to work in accordance with Health and Safety and GMP regulations.

 

·         Must be able to work overtime where necessary.

Working Conditions:

 

·         Possibility of working around unpleasant odours.

 

·         Various temperature changes.

 

·         Rotating and/or straight afternoon or midnight shifts.

 

·         Possibility of working around high noise levels, depending on location and constant interaction with a variety of chemicals and chemical product.

title: Material Handler(Temp)
description:
Night Shift Material Handler (Temp)
12 hour 8p-8a, 2-2-3 rotation
TC Transcontinental, Making Impressions Count

TC Transcontinental is a leader in flexible packaging in North America, and Canada’s largest printer. The Corporation is also the leading Canadian French-language educational publishing group. For over 40 years, TC Transcontinental’s story has been one of innovation and transformation to meet our customers’ evolving needs. Our strong family values, entrepreneurial spirit and long-term vision have always been at the heart of our success.  With our 3 business sectors of Packaging, Print and Media, we continue to optimize, transform and grow while making impressions that count! 
TC Transcontinental Packaging brings a distinctive blend of Art, Science and Technology to create flexible packaging that preserves our customers' products and accentuates their brands on the store shelf. The Packaging Sector has over 4,000 employees and 25 facilities worldwide specializing in extrusion, lamination, printing and converting of plastic products.  
We share the Ellen MacArthur Foundation’s vision of a circular economy for plastic, where plastic never becomes waste and have committed, by 2025, for 100% of our plastic packaging to be reusable, recyclable or compostable. And most recently, we joined the United Nations Global Compact – a voluntary initiative of signatory companies committing to social responsibilities around human rights, labor standards and environmental protection.  You will join a high-performing team that is dedicated to sustainability and passionate about our people, operations, communities and products.

About this opportunity

This position will report to the Shift Supervisor. The Material Handler will be responsible for the seamless processing of outgoing / incoming shipments, perform all tasks deemed necessary including but not limited to operating a variety of hand and power tools, equipment, and machinery.

What you will do

  • Read work order to acquire materials for given order.
  • Reviews labels to ensure that finished product is labeled correctly.
  • Verifies that gross pallet weights are within range.
  • Coordinates and cooperates with oncoming shifts to ensure limited disruption of production.
  • Follows all procedures for safe and careful handling of the Product. Rolls are only moved using pole lift.
  • Operates and maintains material handling equipment in a safe and efficient manner.
  • Performs pre-use inspection of forklifts before operating.
  • Other responsibilities and duties as assigned.
What you have to offer
  • High School Diploma, GED or equivalent.
  • A minimum of one (1) year experience in a similar role within a manufacturing warehouse environment including shipping and receiving
  • Ability to complete and maintain TC Transcontinental ITO Driver Training certification and safely operate a fork/clamp truck according to company standards.
  • Computer literacy, including working skills of Excel and e-mail.
  • Ability to lift heavy objects (max. 50 lbs.), walk and stand for long periods of time and perform strenuous physical labor.
  • Ability to work from a ladder or platform.
  • Strong English communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Basic math and measuring capabilities
  • Proven organizational skills.
  • Commitment to quality and safety.
  • Able to work well in a team environment.
  • Must be able to work overtime and weekends as required.
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time

What we have to offer
  • Opportunity to be part of a dynamic and highly motivating work environment where you can develop your potential and launch an exciting career.
  • Development opportunities where your input makes a difference. A competitive compensation package, 401K plan and flexible benefits that are customizable to you and your family’s needs];
  • Employee perks such as discounts from suppliers on various products and services such as insurance, wireless bundles, travel, and much more.

Learn more about us
https://tctranscontinental.com/en-us/packaging
https://www.facebook.com/TC-Transcontinental-Packaging

title: Leader, Fabrication (Quart de soir) / Manufacturing Leader (Night shift)
description:
Leader, Fabrication (Quart de soir) / Manufacturing Leader (Night shift)



Description



Nous sommes des pionniers. Nous avons été les premiers à franchir le mur du son et à concevoir le premier scooter de l’espace fonctionnel. Nous avons pris part à la première mission de la NASA sur la Lune et nous avons mis en marché des systèmes de rotors basculants évolués. Aujourd’hui, nous façonnons l’avenir de la mobilité sur demande. Les employés de Bell sont fiers de travailler pour une entreprise emblématique, regroupant de grands talents, qui produit en peu de temps des appareils à décollage vertical novateurs et recherchés.



Avec le soutien des chefs d’équipe en place, le Leader fabrication devra :



+ Établir l’organisation du travail (planification, cédule, gestion du matériel) en fonction des cédules de production et des priorités

+ Aider l’équipe, à identifier et à résoudre les problématiques de production, d’outillage et de planification/méthodes de travail et escalader le tout aux bonnes personnes au besoin

+ Maintenir et faire le suivi des indicateurs de performances nécessaires à la gestion des processus de son secteur et au besoin, mettre en place des plans d’action afin d’améliorer les résultats d’affaires

+ Participer à la sélection de la main d’œuvre ainsi qu’au développement de celle-ci afin d’avoir une équipe performante, pouvant répondre aux besoins de l’organisation et qui s’adaptera aux différents changements

+ Gérer de manière stratégique et proactive, à l’aide des outils LEAN, les volets reliés à la santé-sécurité, la sécurité aérienne ainsi que nos standards de qualité



Profil recherché :



+ Responsable, intègre et digne de confiance;

+ Orientation vers les clients (internes et externes);

+ Orientation en fonction des résultats;

+ Forte aptitude à communiquer de façon proactive, régulière, consistante aussi bien parlé que par écrit;

+ Capacité d’écoute active en vue de retirer le maximum de rétroaction de ses pairs et de l’équipe;

+ Capacité à mobiliser les employés et utiliser leurs habiletés/talents efficacement;

+ Capacité à bien encadrer les employés et avoir un souci de développer les membres de l’équipe;

+ Aptitude à pouvoir s’adapter et promouvoir les différents changements organisationnels;

+ Adopte et intègre les principes de la culture consultative dans tout ce qu’il entreprend;



Qualifications



Exigences minimales requises :



+ Formation scolaire en administration, gestion ou tout autre domaine lié au poste;

+ Cinq (5) ans d’expérience dont au moins deux (2) sont reliés au secteur de la fabrication

+ Connaissance fonctionnelle du français et de l’anglais;

+ Connaissance des outils informatiques usuels en gestion;

+ La connaissance des outils et techniques des principes Lean manufacturing, Systèmes JIT et Kanban est un atout;



_Toute autre combinaison de scolarité et d’expérience jugée équivalente pourra être considérée_ .



Ne ratez pas votre chance de vous joindre à un milieu diversifié et inclusif qui favorise un sentiment d’appartenance. En tant que membre de notre effectif mondial, vous collaborerez avec des équipes dévouées et enthousiastes, dont les différences d’expériences, d’antécédents et d’idées et une solide passion pour nos produits nous permettent d’aller au-delà du vol.



Bell Textron Canada Ltée adhère aux principes d’équité en matière d’emploi.



Job Manufacturing



Primary Location CA-Quebec-Mirabel



Recruiting Company Bell Textron Inc.



Schedule Full-time



Job Level Individual Contributor



Shift First Shift
Req ID: 298868

title: Production Operator
description:
Production/Machine Operator

Colonial Cookies - Weston Foods

135 Otonabee Drive, Kitchener, ON

Full time permanent position.

Hourly Rate: $21.42/hour + $1.25/hour afternoon shift premium & $2.00/hour night shift premium.

*** Candidates must be able to work ALL shifts (days, afternoons and nights) to apply. ***

Shift Schedule runs from Monday-Friday + a mandatory Saturday Overtime, if needed.

We are a premier North American bakery company and we’ve been in business for 135 years. Our team is passionate about baking the foods your family and friends love to eat, including breads and rolls, donuts, pies, cakes, cookies and more!  

Weston Foods proudly serves communities through our ~35 bakeries across North America, and every day, our team strives to elevate moments for our customers and your loved ones by producing high quality baked goods.  

Our bakery team is the heart of our company and plays an important role in keeping North America’s food supply going. Our Production/Machine Operators are essential to our success, and ensure our production equipment is operating smoothly to produce delicious, premier baked goods for our customers.  

We are not just a job, we are an extended family, committed to elevating everyday moments and feeding communities and families across the country. Join us and find fulfillment and purpose in your work. 

We are currently hiring for Production/Machine Operators who are flexible to work in any shift and on weekends whenever required.

In a typical day, you’ll:  

·        Be responsible for equipment set-up, change overs, and running production lines as needed for various food products. 

·        Read work orders and specifications to define prescribed setup operation(s).

·        Help troubleshoot equipment problems and support preventative maintenance activities to reduce equipment issues and forced production stoppages.

·        Provide input to shift action plan for their equipment area.

·        Collaborate with engineers, supervisors, and process engineers to enhance processes, procedures and training methods.

·        Work closely with all production team members to ensure product quality.

About You:  

·        A lover of bread and baked goods! 

·        You have strong people skills—you’re approachable, a good listener, and empathetic. 

·        You have previously worked in a manufacturing environment (even better if it was food manufacturing!) 

·        You’re dedicated to the health and safety of yourself and your colleagues.

·        You digest constructive feedback as an opportunity to listen, improve your skills, abilities, and performance.

·        You are someone who listens to comprehend a situation first by asking questions to clarify your own understanding, instead of listening to be able to reply quickly.

·        Must be able to work ALL shifts (days, afternoons, and nights).

We offer a competitive benefits package for full-time employees, including strong benefit and pension plans, paid vacation and holidays, overtime opportunities, and a growth path to line leader and supervisory roles. 

If you’re excited about this opportunity and love baked goods, we invite you to apply! 

 

 #IND1

title: Machine Operator
description:
Qualifications:
  • Minimum 2 years experience in the manufacturing field.
  • Insert new material in the machine.
  • Ensure that any material defects are identified and solved quickly.
  • Keep detailed and accurate documentation on production, defect rate, etc.
  • Maintain a clean and organized workspace.
  • Additional job duties as assigned.

Other Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: 
  • Strong analytical skills.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • A responsible individual who is detailed oriented and who can multitask.
  • Someone who can work independently and as part of team.
  • Someone who has experience working on machines and troubleshooting mechanical and/or technical issues (considered an asset).
  • Someone who is willing to learn new skills.
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken).

title: Third Class EOF Control Room Operator/ Support Operator
description:
Position Summary:

The position’s primary roles include operating the deodorizer, vacuum system, oil pumping, wastewater, bleaching equipment, dumping minor ingredients and unloading railcars as required during vacation coverage.  The position requires a conscientious person in the areas of Operational Procedures, Quality Control & Testing, Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), Reporting, Safety, Personal Appearance, Cleanliness & Housekeeping. The area of responsibility includes operating the GEKA  steam generator, the refrigeration for the vacuum system, processing oil through the deodorizer, sampling and some analysis, oil inventory control and bleaching. 

 

Core Functions:

  • Maximizing processing capacities of the deodorizing and bleaching operations, while achieving or exceeding company safety, quality, yield, environmental and operating cost standards.
  • Totally responsible for this area of operations during hours when direct supervision is not on site.
  • Compliance with any Work Instruction - Operational Procedures.
  • Maintaining the Safe and Efficient use of all equipment, ensuring only the equipment that needs to run is operating and in good order.
  • Maintaining Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) at all times.
  • Deodorizing of oil from and to the different tanks as required by the business.  Maintenance and operation of the Geka steam generator.
  • Operation and maintenance of the wastewater system.
  • Maintenance and operation of the deodorizer process refrigeration and vacuum systems.
  • Bleaching oils from and to different tank farms as required by the business.
  • Any other oil pumping as required by the business.
  • Controlling oil inventory & distribution.
  • Quality Control & Testing of all above oils.
  • Provide representative composite samples, tank samples and daily samples to the lab as instructed.
  • Accurately recording oil tank inventories as instructed.
  • Completing and documenting housekeeping inspections once each shift.
  • Accurately recording all information on the deodorizing, bleaching and oil movement reports each shift and entering accurate data into SAP.
  • Provide written reports on Quality and Operations daily as required.
  • Maintain and clean all areas of the operations at all times.
  • Maintaining a tidy and safe operational work area at all times.
  • Maintaining Personal Hygiene, Cleanliness and Appearance including compliance with Bunge Canada Hamilton dress code which will require wearing of company issued uniforms at all times.
  • Must comply with Bunge Safety Policy E-3 Respiratory Equipment.  The incumbent must be and remain sufficiently free of facial hair so as to guarantee the necessary proper fitting of respirator equipment at all times while on site and be willing to undergo periodic fit testing as required by the policy.
  • Provide written reports on all oil inventories daily.
  • Provide written reports on small inventories needed for the area of operations.
  • Provide written reports of Operational / Equipment problems and discrepancies to the Supervisor, utilizing the “Employee Departmental Report” Form, and following the “Operator Protocol for Calling the On-call Supervisor” and the Company Call-In Procedures when necessary. Work orders to be processed through the direct report unless priority #1 during off hours.
  • Provide accurate written reports on any Incidents, Accidents, Fire or Spills as necessary, utilizing the “Employee Departmental Report” Form.
  • Complying with all Bunge Canada Corporate and Hamilton policies, including Hourly Employee’s Handbook, Safe Work Practices, Emergency Measures Plan, and the Health and Safety Act of Ontario.  Maintaining Safety Standards in all areas of work.
  • Must complete any other task required to run a safe and efficient operation or as requested by the Company.

 

Skill/Experience Requirements:

  • Post-secondary education and a valid 3rd class operating engineer ticket in good standing with T.S.S.A
  • Have a current and valid driver’s license in the province of Ontario (Class G or equivalent)
  • This position requires the incumbent to have unrestricted cross border mobility. 
  • Shift schedules may change on a frequent basis as required by the business. 
  • Demonstrates knowledge of GMP, HACCP, BRC, FSSC, and proper employee hygiene practices to meet plant requirements
  • Ability to wear respiratory equipment
  • Ability to work rotating shifts as required.
  • Ability to do heavy lifting (up to 50 lbs.)
  • Working with minimal supervision
  • Repairing and maintaining mechanical defects
  • Experience working in the food industry would be a strong asset
  • Must be able to work across shifts, including weekends and extended hours
  • Experience in Microsoft Word / Excel
  • Knowledge of SAP would be a strong asset

 

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to aoda@bunge.com 

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

 

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Manufacturing Lead Supervisor
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Lonza is currently seeking Manufacturing Lead for the Kingston, ON location. This role is responsible to oversee the manufacturing of Cocoon’s and Single-Use Product for the Cocoon Platform.

Key Responsibilities

  • Plan and prepare production, schedule tasks, and assign duties to operators to meet the production schedule, assess production records and meet release timelines to deliver quality product to our customers.
  • Demonstrate expertise and technical leadership in cGMP compliance and an in-depth understanding of process flow and be able to make decisions based on that experience.
  • Lead the day to day activities including but not limited to safety and regulations, housekeeping, team meetings, equipment maintenance etc. 
  • Proactively suggest and lead areas of improvement.
  • Own performance and the quality of the work of the team, ensuring adherence to written procedures (SOPs), housekeeping, 6S, daily management system (DMS), monitoring equipment and processes, cleanroom  tasks, product testing.

  • Deliver to Plan: Lead and direct the safety, quality, and daily production operations in the cleanroom. Oversee all tasks on the floor as they are carried out and provide assistance and troubleshooting to complex and non-routine process and equipment events.

  • Quality Compliance: Ensure full compliance with GMP and Quality system requirements. Responsible for overall inspection readiness and compliance with quality requirements. Lead and oversee the on time completion of document review (batch record, logbook, forms, DOPs) for completeness, clarity, accuracy to support on-time release of batches with minimal errors

  • Lead and train staff : Support recruiting, staffing, hiring, onboarding. Provide effective training to manufacturing staff related to any current and new process, batch records, or quality system to be used in the Single-Use Product.

  • To maintain individual training plan. Ensure team remains up to date with training readiness. Ensure full compliance with GMP and Quality system requirements.

  • Must be present and engaging on the floor; reinforcing values and promoting the transfer of knowledge through coaching•Documentation: Develop and maintain Single-Use Product DMR according to Octane Biotech and regulations standards. Support the NC and ENC process as needed.

  • Communication: Demonstrate strong technical writing abilities. Communicate effectively, initiate, assess and close low minor deviations, SOP/DOP/Protocol creation, review batch records, logbooks, etc.

  • Hands-on: to execute as a Sr. Technician during manufacture of GMP product, as necessary.• 

Key requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering/Science or related field.
  • Hands-on experience with scalable manufacturing concepts and methodologies•Passion for new engineering technologies and innovation
  • Experience with manufacturing equipment/automated systems
  • Experience in process improvement plans and process mapping•Familiarity with cGMPs, ISO13485 and FDA regulatory guidelines
  • Computer skills, MS Office•Knowledge in the use of metrology measuring and testing equipment for the purpose of calibrating and adjusting instruments
  • Analytical and mathematical skills
  • Detail oriented
  • Through and clear documentation, communication abilities
  • Systematic and organized workflow
  • Independent task management and ability to make decisions•Ability to communicate, both verbally and in writing
  • Ability to multitask while delivering project and accountability on time and on budget

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Quality Control Technician
description:
YOUR CHALLENGE

You are an integral part of delivering the right mix to our customers. As a Quality Control Technician, your responsibilities involve color matching, formula adjustment and quality assurance. You will:

  • Interpret and synthesize data collected from the formulas;
  • Test and adjust formulas to ensure quality control standards and client requirements;
  • Instruct the Production team to adjust parameters of machinery, when necessary;
  • Identify and inspect site safety and equipment, as required;
  • Be accountable for working safely and for maintaining a respectful workplace;
  • Collaborate with other departments (i.e. Production, Logistics, Research & Development, Manufacturing, Marketing) throughout the entire process in order to meet and even exceed customer expectations.

 

YOUR EXPERIENCE & SKILLS

  • Minimum of 1-2 years experience in quality control in the manufacturing industry;
  • College Degree (or equivalent) in a scientific-technical program;
  • English and French language mastery (spoken and written);
  • Understand and apply scientific and technical principles and work methods;
  • Possess excellent attention to detail and work with set deadlines;
  • Willing to cooperate, share responsibilities, take direction and advice within the team and production operations;
  • Able to plan and organize multiple responsibilities simultaneously.

 

OUR OFFER

When you come to work at the Protech Group youâ€™ll become part of a dynamic and rapidly expanding business. Everyone has a part to play in our success to formulate the right mix. In return, we reward our people with a wide range of great benefits, including:

  • Medical and dental insurance program with telemedicine;
  • RRSP pension plan contribution;
  • Opportunities for rapid growth and pay increase into senior roles.

 

OUR COMPANY

For more than 45 years, the Protech Group has been developing and manufacturing coatings, paints, and specialty materials. Through quality and innovation, we formulate the right mix to protect and enhance what matters most to our customers. Headquartered in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, Protech Group products are manufactured in more than 20 sites worldwide. We serve our customers in countless markets and industries, including construction, infrastructure, transportation, consumer goods, and healthcare.

The Protech Group ensures the respect of the health recommendation guidelines set by the Government of Quebec related to the Coronavirus disease (COVID-19). 

We hire personalities, not backgrounds. The Protech Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity and inclusion.

title: General Production Worker (St-Laurent, QC)
description:
Shah Trading Co. Ltd is a leader in the food industry with a 40 year history serving customers both in Canada and globally. With a deep understanding of food markets and food safety requirements we are committed to continued leadership, growth, and service to our customers.

Job Overview: 

Under the general supervision of the Machine Operator, Area Leader, Production Supervisor and/or Plant Manager; the General Production Worker will be responsible to follow directions for various plant tasks to ensure good quality products are efficiently manufactured at all times.
Candidates must be in good physical condition and have the physical abilities to lift, push, carry and stand for entire shift period.

Plant Location: 

3401 Rue Douglas B Floreani, Saint-Laurent, Quebec H4S 1Y6

Shifts: 
Day shift: 7:30 am to 5:00 pm

Key Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for performing various general plant tasks; packaging, feeding product to the line and/or packaging, making boxes, etc that help to ensure good quality product is produced at all times.
  • Responsible for performing any task that will be associated with the assembly or packaging of the product.
  • Responsible to perform the job responsibilities of a back-up Machine Operator for coverage purpose from time to time.
  • Responsible for practicing and adhering to Food Safety, GMP’s (Good Manufacturing Practices) and Health and Safety policy at all times
  • Responsible for practicing and adhering to Shah Trading Company policies and best practices.
  • Responsible for other reasonable duties as assigned by the Area Leader/Supervisor and/or Plant Manager.
Qualifications: 
  • Completion of high school education or equivalent
  • 1-3 years of manufacturing experience an asset; asset to have worked in food processing industry
  • Ability to speak, read, write and basic comprehension of English
  • Good hand and manual dexterity
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time
  • Quick learner
  • Some technical and/or basic troubleshooting skills
  • Coordination and multi-task skills
  • Ability to follow directions
  • High energy individual
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to lift up to 25 kg
  • Not allergic to food & spices
Shah Trading Company is committed to providing equal opportunities for all applicants and employees regardless of race, ancestry, place of origin, color, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences (for which a pardon has been granted), disability, marital or family status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you require an accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us to provide your contact information. While we appreciate all resume submissions, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Electronic Production Assistant
description:
Description:
Hiring Electronic Production Assistants for STEADY SHIFTS!
Agilus is recruiting for several Electronic Production Assistants in the Electrical and Electronic Manufacturing in Windsor, Ontario.
Agilus is recruiting for Electronic Production Associates for our client, an industry leader in electrical and electronic manufacturing! This is a great opportunity for anyone looking to build on their electrical manufacturing experience or just enjoys being part of a fast-paced environment with a great team. This position is temporary with the potential for permanent hire and has immediate starts as well!
A typical day:
  • Inspecting small electrical components and ensuring high quality
  • Provide assembly assistance
  • Scanning parts in a computer system
  • ESD Safety Shoes & Safety Glasses required

Requirements:
  • Someone who is willing to join immediately
  • Able to work full time hours Monday-Friday and overtime as needed
  • Facility does have a vaccination requirement

Total rewards:
  • $16.00 per hours with an 8% premium for afternoons and 12% premium for midnights
  • A WEEKLY paycheck - we pay every Friday
  • 4% vacation pay added to every paycheck
  • Option to purchase medical and dental benefits
  • Opportunity for extension or permanent placement

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email bnagaraju@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Mechanical Project Engineering
description:
Purpose:

  • To develop test equipment from concept through to manufacture
  • To support the equipment throughout the entire lifecycle of D&V products

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • To develop mechanical designs from concept through to final build; meeting safety, reliability, cost, manufacturing and performance requirements
  • Drive project execution (from design to procurement to manufacturing to final acceptance)
  • Coordinate and lead all engineering activities associated with project test equipment development
  • Drive the development, testing and approval of complex mechanical and electro-mechanical systems
  • Plan and execute design verification and validation activities
  • To develop new products using a modular approach, maximizing reusability and efficiency
  • Preparation of technical and regulatory documentation, including drawings, production documentation, BOM, assembly instructions etc.
  • Use computer assisted engineering and design software and tools to perform engineering tasks
  • Participate in design reviews, project meetings, and time/cost budgeting
  • Communicate with different parties - customer, vendor, internal engineering and manufacturing to ensure product meets customer requirements and quality standards
  • Meeting projects scheduled deadlines and budgets
  • Order components, tools and services as required for product and prototype development
  • Experience dealing with suppliers/vendors
  • Experience with product costing highly desired

Education / experience:

  • Sc. in Mechanical Engineering
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD and Inventor or similar 3D software
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • 5 -7 years experience in designing mechanical devises from concept
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills required
  • Ability to interface effectively with Engineering, Manufacturing and Purchasing departments

D & V Electronics values their employees. We encourage life-long learning and foster employee personal growth. If you're someone who enjoys working in a creative and innovative work environment, and would like to join our team, please submit your resume and covering letter to:

careers@dvelectronics.com

We thank all applicants for their interest in our organization, however; only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: General Labour/Truck Body Manufacturer
description:
General Labour/Truck Body Manufacturer

Bolton, ON, Canada Req #4523

Monday, March 28, 2022

Starting wage for ENTRY LEVEL general labour is $17.85/hr with 3% raises every August!

$2,500 sign-on bonus!

$100 bonus for all fully vaccinated new hires!

Morgan Truck Body, the largest truck body manufacturer in North America, has opportunities for ENTRY LEVEL General Labourers!

We promote almost 100% of our production leaders from within. Most start their leadership career in this general labourer/assembler role. Your first promotion can occur between your 6th and 12th month of employment.

Our generous benefits include paid vacation and holidays, Medical, Dental, Vision, group pension, and 80% tuition reimbursement as well as many others!

Job Description

The General Labourer/Assembler is responsible for building and assembly of a multitude of pieces as well as completed truck bodies.

You will receive on the job training for:

  • Basic math, tape measurement, and computer skills
  • Working with hand and power tools
  • Reading and interpreting blueprints
Job Duties
  • Read and interpret: orders and specifications, blueprints, instructions and labels which may contain hazardous warnings and cautions
  • Cut wood or metals to specific sizes using a variety of saws, sheers and cutters
  • Fasten parts together with bolts, screws, speed clips, rivets or fasteners
  • Operate pneumatic tools and hand tools
  • Perform set up of machine and preventative maintenance as required
  • Examine finished project for quality and defects
  • Perform safety and quality checks
  • Work and adhere to all safety policies
Minimum Qualifications
  • Must be 18 years old
Preferred Qualifications (not required)
  • Previous experience in manufacturing
  • Previous experience working on truck bodies
  • Construction experience is a plus
  • High School Diploma or equivalent GED
Physical Requirements:

This job operates in a manufacturing plant environment. While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk or hear. The team member frequently is required to stand (sometimes for extended periods); walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms, and lift up to 35 pounds. The team member may, at times, sit, bend, stoop, squat, reach overhead, or crawl (may be in confined spaces). The team member is expected to perform repetitive tasks using their hands, and have the ability to climb ladders and/or work in high places.

J.B. Poindexter & Co., Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or municipal laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

#LI-TK1
#PIQ

Other details

  • Job Family Morgan Truck Body
  • Job Function Manufacturing
  • Pay Type Hourly
  • Employment Indicator Hourly
  • Hiring Rate $17.85

title: Welder
description:
Job Description:

 

 

$1000 signing bonus after 90 days!      

 

Z-Modular, a division of Zekelman Industries, seeks a Welder for our location in Kitchener, ON. This person welds commonly used metal and alloys of various shapes, sizes and thicknesses.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Welds commonly used metals and alloys of various shapes, sizes, and thicknesses.
  • Selects welding electrodes for specific welds.
  • Fabricates or repairs products according to blueprints, layouts, or work orders by welding metal components together.
  • Able to fit mating parts together according to blueprints
  • Possesses a working knowledge of welding materials and equipment.
  • Works in a safe manner
  • Other duties as instructed by supervisor

 

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE.

The ideal candidate for this role will have a high school diploma, welding certification, and at least three years of previous welding experience.  

 

PHYSICAL ABILITIES:

  • Must be able to move objects and use abdominal and lower back muscles to provide support over time without fatigue. Constant movement and use of limbs; this position requires good manual dexterity, coordination and stamina.
  • Must be able to remain in a stationary position for several hours
  • Regular, full-time, predictable onsite attendance per the posted schedule is an essential function of this role
  • Ability to lift, climb, bend, stoop, push and pull.
  • Must be able to lift 60lbs.
  • Must be able to stand for 10-12 hours
  • Ability to perform work in a plant/manufacturing environment
  • Other physical requirements as needed for job
  • Leadand  promote health and safety work practices as required by regulatory agencies and company policy  

 

 

Zekelman Industries offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits, including high quality medical, dental and vision benefits. In addition, we have an amazing tuition assistance program, and an RRSP with a generous company match.

 

Zekelman is an  Equal Opportunity Employer  compliant with  all Ontario law & Human Rights Code  in providing accommodation to persons with disabilities and to ensuring an accessible environment. Zekelman will accommodate persons with disabilities during the recruitment and assessment processes and persons with disabilities will be accommodated on hiring and during employment.

Should you require accommodation, please do not hesitate to request it.

 

We are Zekelman Industries.

 

We manufacture superior quality tubular and related products and provide outstanding service for our valued customers.

 

We seek to continuously advance the skills and opportunities of our employees, utilizing the latest technology and management tools available to consistently increase profitability and the enterprise value of Zekelman Industries and of our customers.
