title: Production Supervisor
description:
Are you hungry to innovate? To do things differently? To work with a company that's real, thoughtful and very forward-thinking?

Meet Riverside. We are an organic, “better for you” snack company, manufacturing award-winning, nutritious, allergen-free snacks. Your kids know us as MadeGood, tasty school-safe snacks. Your workout buddies grab GoodTo Go Keto certified bars. And your pup begs for a Cookie Pal treat, our human-grade, vegan dog treats.

At Riverside, we make delicious snacks that are good in every way. From our ingredients to our manufacturing practices, we've raised every bar on every aspect. We're friendly and focused on creating foods that are good for you and good to the planet as well. Riverside Natural Foods is B-Corp certified, Triple-Bottom Line, Zero Waste, and Canadian owned and operated.

Come work with a new Canadian leader! We value teamwork, humility, respect, ownership, adaptability, passion and fun. Our amazing culture is reflected in our recent employee engagement score of 92%!

You can learn more about us at www.riversidenaturalfoods.com

We continue to grow and today are looking for a committed, talented, star to join our team as our Production Supervisor.

Position Summary/Objective: 

The Production Supervisor is responsible for role modelling and ensuring that our Core Values are demonstrated by everyone on their team while leading and developing a Production Team to deliver on all manufacturing goals in a safe and engaging work environment.

Primary Responsibilities:

People Leadership & Development

  • Demonstrate and uphold Riverside's Core Values
  • Ensure each team member is fully trained on their job responsibilities and then cross trained in different areas
  • Co-ordinate training in specific duties, machine operations, quality performance and safety procedures (e.g. GMP, WHMIS, Health & Safety)
  • Instill a positive, engaging and RESPECTFUL culture and morale among employees
  • Provide coaching & feedback to team members to support their ongoing development
  • Address any performance, behaviour or attendance concerns proactively and if necessary use the Progressive Coaching policy to provide formal feedback

Health & Safety

  • Understand, train and enforce Health & Safety policies and procedures
  • Actively participate in all H&S communications, audits and training
  • Ensure there is always a “competent person” on site to act as the leader as per the OHSA

Quality & Food Safety

  • Understand, train and enforce Food Safety and GMP policies and procedures
  • Ensure that all product is made to our quality and food safety standards and if required work with the Quality team to place non confirming product on hold

Production Management

  • Schedule daily work assignments for direct reports to ensure production priorities are efficiently met, coordinate line changes for different production runs and optimize the delivery of the scheduled products in the most cost effective manner at standard or better. 
  • Understanding manufacturing throughputs, KPIs, manufacturing metrics, and leveraging daily report analysis to focus resources on the greatest opportunities to deliver the planned schedule
  • Oversee technical resources to ensure focus on the highest impact areas to deliver on the schedule and all other deliverables for their factory
  • Manage workflow, daily production line activities and issues; monitor work TEAMS to ensure that required production procedures and product recipes are followed; monitor quality of product(s) at various stages of production
  • Identify issues or problems, determine root cause of problems identified; rectify whenever possible, or recommend solutions to avoid issues reoccurring.  Drive continuous improvement to lead sustainable solutions that are high impact.
  • Anticipate possible problems, troubleshoot people and machinery to avoid unplanned down time and production delays
  • Act as primary contact with temp agency for production staff
  • Check/approve time submitted to payroll by floor and temp staff
  • Help to develop, update and maintain procedures and documentation for all processes & systems
  • Takes the OWNERSHIP to develop and recommend continuous improvements of facilities, equipment, or procedures to improve safety, quality and efficiency
  • All other duties and responsibilities as assigned

Reporting Relationships:

The Production Supervisor reports to the Plant Manager.

Positions reporting directly to the Production Supervisor:

  • Lead Hand(s) and all production personnel

Key Performance Indicators:

  • Employee engagement
  • Health and Safety Total Incident Rate (TIR)
  • Food Safety and Quality Complaints per million units (CCPMU)
  • Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE)
    • Yield
    • Throughput
    • Run Time
  • Labour costs/variances to standard 
  • Manufacturing conformance (schedule attainment - batches) 

Education & Qualifications:

    • Degree or diploma in Food Science, Business Operations, or a related field (or equivalent education and experience)
    • Mechanical and technical knowledge of food processing (baking & forming/rotary moulding preferred) equipment critical in the short term for stand alone sites
    • 5 years' experience in the food industry with a good understanding of manufacturing processes, regulations regarding safety, quality and GMPs
    • 2 years experience in leading others
    • Intermediate level Microsoft Office and transactional knowledge of SAP an asset

    Critical Leadership Competencies – must be skilled in each [#. FYI competency]:

    • 2. Action oriented
    • 7. Communicates effectively
    • 9. Manages conflict
    • 13. Develops talent
    • 16. Drives engagement
    • 25. Plans and aligns
    • 27. Resourcefulness
    • 28. Drives results
    • 36. Instills trust
    • 38. Optimizes work processes

    Critical Functional (Manufacturing) Competencies:

    • Manufacturing controllable costs management
    • Labour scheduling optimization
    • Continuous improvement processes & principles
    • Root cause analysis
    • Mechanical & PLC trouble shooting (basic)
    • Preventative maintenance (basic)
    • Supply chain fundamentals
    • Employment law fundamentals
    • Occupational health & safety fundamentals
    • Food safety & quality fundamentals
    • Computer Literacy

    How to Apply:

    If you have the commitment to excellence, the energy, the attitude and experience we need, then please submit your resume to careers(AT)riversidenaturals.com with the subject line Production Supervisor or click the apply button!

    Riverside Natural Foods is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you have a disability and require accommodation in the interview process, please let us know when you apply.

    We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to volume, please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

    Depending on the nature of the role, you may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by your hire date to be eligible to start the role. In this case, proof of vaccination will be required by your start date. Riverside will consider and review accommodation requests based on protected human rights grounds for qualified candidates.

title: Extrusion Operator
description:
Want to advance in your career and earn more?
Join a stable organization that will invest in your future, helping you advance and increase your value!

KP Building Products, a member of the Kaycan Group of companies is seeking Extrusion Operators of all levels to join our teams at our Brampton facility. If you have production, warehouse, construction or related experience, this is a career you need to explore.

Schedule: Continental shifts - 3-2-2-3 / 12-hour
Salary starting at: $18/h

We offer :

  • Dental, Medical, Life and Disability insurance plan
  • RRSP plan
  • Pension Plan
  • Ongoing training initiatives
  • Opportunities for growth & development;

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure production goals are met and works closely with the production and quality teams to ensure the product is to the quality standards
  • Ensure all lines are running without quality concerns at the beginning and throughout your shift
  • Keep in contact, if need arises, with Lead Hand Operator, Packer and Production Supervisor when changes occur. (eg. colour changes, scrapping, etc.)
  • Help other operators when needed
  • Make all quality checks as required. Finished products must match all quality standards assigned. (eg. Cosmetic, Functional, and Appearance etc.)
  • Assist in line changeovers including die removal and replacement
  • Maintain housekeeping of your lines and workstation
  • Light maintenance, minor repairs and adjustments to correct extrusion problems
  • Operator extrusion, downtime tracking and running sheets are completed
  • Packer relief as needed
  • Follow any reasonable request from a Supervisor
  • Follow KP Building's ISO quality management system
  • Participate in training as required by the company
  • Adhere to all applicable company policies and procedures, including quality and health and safety

Qualifications:

  • Completed high school diploma, GED, or equivalent
  • One (1) year experience as an extrusion operator within a manufacturing environment
  • Experience in plastics extrusion - an asset
  • Working Conditions
  • Ability to work 12-hour continental shifts. (42 hours a week)
  • Safety glasses and boots are required throughout the plant; PPE as required
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer - Rotating Pressure Vessels
description:
Our Markham based client, a leading provider of industrial refrigeration engineering design and systems integration is looking for a Mechanical Design Engineer to join their growing team.

They are a growing company that produces equipment for thermal processing for many applications and industries, including; green energy, thermal storage, and food processing applications.  As the Mechanical Design Engineer, you will design mechanical assemblies and components and evaluate our existing design to ensure our equipment can be manufactured in a reliable and cost-effective manner. You will achieve this by evaluating customer, application, and regulatory requirements, performing tolerance stack-up, applying GD&T, and creating manufacturing and assembly instructions. You will get a chance to grow and learn in our multidisciplinary team as we strive to build an excellent product that provides unique cooling and thermal storage solutions.  

How you will contribute:  
  • Mentor junior engineers and take lead of design projects 
  • Review customer and application requirements and proposed appropriate solutions
  • You will perform tolerance stack up calculations on the sub-assemblies. 
  • You will utilize GD&T to detail mechanical equipment components to convey design intent and critical features in manufacturing drawings.  
  • You will create BOM, assembly drawings, and manufacturing instructions for assembling the equipment. 
  • You will work in an agile environment with a product focused team to contribute in all aspects of a product life cycle, from ideation to customer support.  
  • You will review ASME and CE requirements for pressure vessels and welding. 
 
Your traits:  
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and have no problem writing technical documents.  
  • You can work both independently and as part of a team. 
  • You are a motivated self-starter and a quick learner who can solve technical roadblocks.  
  • You have a constant desire to learn and improve yourself. 
 
Minimum requirements:  
  • Engineering Diploma or Degree from a recognized post-secondary institution 
  • 5+ years’ experience working with SolidWorks. 
  • 5+ years’ experience designing and detailing mechanical equipment
  • Experience with design and production of rotating mechanical equipment 
  • Experience with welded assemblies
  • Knowledge of machining is an asset. 
  • Understanding of manufacturing, machining, welding processes. 
  • Knowledge of engineering principles, practices, and procedures.  
​​​​​​​
Salary: Commensurate with experience, Benefits

title: Shipper/Packer/Receiver
description:
Grow with us as a Receptionist and Office Administrator at Stage Windows & Doors! 

Company Overview:
Stage Windows & Doors is a manufacturer of custom products tailored to meet client needs. With a facility located in Vaughan, we offer a variety of options and features that are designed to make our windows and doors ideal for the residential replacement and custom home markets. Our focus is on providing our customers value through on time delivery, quality and superior service.
We strive to build a work environment where safety, respect, commitment, success and fun are driving principles. 

Position Summary: 
The Shipper will play a key role by providing hands-on support to the department under the direction of the Supervisor to ensure workflow and timely delivery targets.  The Shipper will partner with team members and cross-functional departments to ensure packaging of material, storage of finished products, and accuracy of shipment details according to associated paperwork, labels, and customer delivery requests.

This is a full-time position which requires strong physical strength, quick response times, ability to work under pressure, and coordination skills. The successful candidate will be disciplined, punctual, and a strong team player.

Key Responsibilities: ·       
  • Pick and pack windows and doors for shipment.
  • Conduct final inspection of product prior to packaging for shipment.
  • Assemble skids utilizing wraps for shipment and inspect packaging ensuring quality of packaging with zero quality issues. 
  • Read and coordinate labels with corresponding skids.
  • Ensure designated storage areas are organized in a manner that maximizes efficiency, safety, and customer order turnaround.
  • Pack away all finished products from Assembly and Fabrication areas in designated storage spaces.
  • Analyze current and established procedures and make suggestions to supervisor on process improvements.
  • Coordinate with external production departments when needed.
  • Utilize proper loading procedures and adhere to health and safety regulations while performing all job functions.
  • Conduct general audits of department, ensuring cleanliness, safety conformance, storage of material, and general housekeeping.
  • Update Supervisor on shipment status, escalated issues, and progress of assigned targets.
  • Other tasks as required.
 
Skills: 
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Ability to read and understand labels, paperwork, and documents.
  • Time management and project prioritization skills. 
  • Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task.
  • Ability to perform repetitive and physically demanding duties when required.
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs.
 
Education & Experience: 
  • 2+ years of experience of shipping and receiving experience. 
  • 2+ years of experience within a manufacturing environment, windows and doors experience is considered an asset.

We thank all interested candidates for applying. Successful candidates will be contacted to participate in the interview process.  

Stage Windows & Doors is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity or testing, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

title: Saw Operator/Material Handler (FT) - Day & Night
description:
Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is looking to hire a DAY & a NIGHT shift Saw Operator/material handler for our Machine Shop. (We also have day shifts available, please look for day shift ad).

Job Details:
  • Important: Apply in PDF formatting. Also, no phone calls or drop-ins.
  • Hours:
Day: Mon - Fri; 7am-3:30pm.
Night: Mon - Thurs; 3:15pm-1:45am.

Company Description:
  • Plainsman Mfg. Inc. is a locally owned manufacturing and distribution company operating out of Edmonton, Alberta since 1966.
  • We manufacture and distribute products for oilfield production, pipeline maintenance, construction, and gas and water distribution.
  • We have an in-house engineering department and a full-service manufacturing facility that enables us to respond efficiently to customer and industry needs.
Responsibilities of the Role:
Knowledge:
  • High School.
  • Basic Lean principles.
Skills:
  • Material handling.
  • Measurement with calipers and tape measure.
  • Machine operation and maintenance.
  • Forklift operation.
  • Troubleshoot small issues and make corrections.
  • Produces quality.
Attitude:
  • Workflow optimization.
  • Desire to learn & improve.
  • Small incremental improvements.
  • Engaged in their work.
  • Accepts overtime and additional duties willingly.
  • Can-do attitude – willing to assist in other tasks as directed.
Habits:
  • Punctual.
  • Organization skills.
  • Prioritizing and balancing workload.
  • Interaction/communication with the rest of the shop.
  • Adhere to the safety program.
Secondary Responsibilities:
  • Miscellaneous tasks as requested by supervisor or manager.
  • The above responsibilities are the basic expectations, any actions above and beyond will be looked at favorably at review time.
How to Excel in the Role:
  • Team member for large-scale projects.
  • Assisting in other departments as possible (eg. Receiving raw material).
Please no phone calls or drop-ins due to COVID!

title: Production line technician
description:
Description du poste

ABOUT MONTEBELLO PACKAGING

Montebello Packaging is a world-class manufacturer of tubes and containers for the pharmaceutical, cosmetics and food industries. The company is a division of the Jim Pattison Group, a $12.7 (CAD) billion conglomerate. Montebello Packaging employs 500 people and has four plants in North America.

THE CHALLENGES THAT AWAIT YOU

Reporting to the production supervisor, your responsibility is to ensure the smooth operation of the production line that is entrusted to you. You will also participate in improving the productivity of the production lines, occupational health and safety and quality according to established standards by ensuring that your work area is kept clean and safe.

  • Set-up changes ;
  • Adjustments, changes and transfers of tooling;
  • Line start-up;
  • Verification of the quality of the products manufactured;
  • Solving technical problems, taking corrective action if necessary;
  • Maintenance of the machines through recommended maintenance;
  • Continuous improvement.

Your profile and skills

  • Ideally, you have a DEP or DEC in technical, mechanical, electromechanical or production management;
  • You have a minimum of 2 years experience as a technician on an automated line in the manufacturing field;
  • Ideally, you have experience in packaging, metal transformation, food, pharmaceutical, cosmetics ...
  • Manual dexterity;
  • Attention to detail;
  • Speed of execution, flexibility and reliability;
  • Able to differentiate shades of color;
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds;
  • Interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Available to work on different shifts;
  • Ability to work alone or in a team;
  • Fluency in English and French is an asset.

The advantages of joining our team

  • Being part of a small company with the advantages of a large group;
  • High quality products;
  • Great work atmosphere;
  • Employee recognition;
  • Rotating shift each week: day (8:00 am - 4:00 pm) / evening (4:00 pm - 12:00 pm) / night (12:00 pm - 8:00 am);
  • Salary of $20.33/hr to start;
  • Full benefits (health, dental, vision, vacations, free parking...) ;
  • Possibility of advancement.

title: Press Helper
description:
C-P Flexible Packaging is a successful and fast-growing essential manufacturing company that uses an impressive array of digital pre-press and wide-web flexographic printing capabilities and extrusion and adhesive laminators to produce creative flexible packaging solutions for our customers. With a primary focus on serving the food industry, C-P specializes in roll stock, pouches, re-sealable packaging and shrink sleeves. With 10 current locations across North America and growing, C-P Flexible Packaging is one of the top 25 flexible packaging companies in the U.S.

We are looking for Press Helpers to join our Team in Aurora, Ontario.

 

Job Summary:

To assist press operator in setting up and operating printing presses

Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities:

  • Follow press operators lead in tearing down jobs and setting up new jobs.
  • Ink management which includes washing up of inks in printing press
  • Transporting ink pails from ink room and solvents pails from the solvent area
  • Moving raw materials from staging areas onto the unwind of the printing press and removal of printed material from the rewind of the printing press
  • Removal of waste from print rolls and either disposing or recycling
  • Removal of cylinders and anilox rollers from press
  • Complete tasks in adequate time limits to meet press daily goals and schedule needs
  • Other house keeping duties as assigned
  • Complete tasks in adequate time limits, as to meet press daily goal and schedule needs.
  • Complies with all general Company-wide standard operating procedures (SOP’s) and any job or department specific SOP’s.
    • SOP’s may cover the areas of (but are not limited to)
      • Employee Health and Safety
      • SQF (Safe Quality Food packager) and GMP (good manufacturing procedures) focused on eliminating contaminates in all packaging manufactured.
      • SGP (Sustainable Green Printer) environmental regulatory procedures and SOP’s
  • Must work within productivity standards and completes work in a timely manner.
  • Special Projects & other duties as necessary

Qualifications:

  • Good organizational skills
  • Communicate well with others
  • Basic reading skills to be able to understand docket information
  • Basic writing skills, (must be legible)
  • Basic mechanical knowledge
  • Use of minor tools, (i.e. allen wrenches)
  • Use of sharp cutting tools
  • Process written information, (orders, SOP’S, etc.)
 
Other knowledge, skills and abilities:
  • Ability to work well in a team environment.
  • Must demonstrate the ability to maintain confidentiality of information to Company and Federal standards.
  • Must be able to adapt to changes in the work environment, manage competing demands and be able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.
  • Must be dependable and work within Company conduct standards; consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance.

Physical Demands:

  • Moving/Carrying ability, 50 lbs repetitively/frequently; 70 lbs intermittently for up to 5 ft.
  • Lifting ability; up to 50 lbs intermittently
  • Standing for extended periods. (consistently – 70-80%)
  • Bending, twisting and reaching (intermittently -60-70%)
  • Push/pull of up to 100 lbs. (occasionally - 20-30%)
  • Extensive use of hands and fingers
  • Extensive time on feet, walking/ standing
  • Use of step ladders, (if needed)

Working Conditions:

  • Working 12 hr. shifts.
  • Ability to work with and around solvents and solvent based inks
  • Ability to work in a non-air conditioned environment: hot conditions during summer months and cool conditions during winter months. (consistently)
  • May have excessive walking at times up to 85% of shift
  • Work around solvent/ink/glue fumes/other solvents used in printing manufacturing.
  • Work in tight places at random times
  • Follow all safety regulations and rules at all times, including wearing all required personal protective equipment (PPE):
    • Steel toe boots or shoes
    • Hearing protection
    • Safety glasses
    • Cut resistant gloves
    • Hairnets and beard nets

Environment:

  • Concrete floors

Mental Effort Requirements:

  • Ability to keep pace with machine

In addition to the other advantages of working for C-P, we offer a compensation package that includes: competitive wages, a night shift and weekend shift premiums.

Benefits Include
  • Employer paid medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage
  • Pension plan with generous company match
  • Bonus program
  • Paid vacation and personal days
  • Paid holidays
  • Life and AD&D insurance
  • Company paid short-term disability coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

title: Mechanical Designer
description:
If you’re looking for a special place to build or grow your career, you’ve found it. Whether you’re an experienced professional, a recent college graduate or somewhere in between, IDEX is a place where you can apply your existing skills and learn new ones in an environment where you can make an impact. With interesting opportunities in engineering, marketing, sales, supply chain, operations, HR, finance, and more across more than 40 diverse businesses (https://www.idexcorp.com/our-businesses/business-segments/) around the globe, chances are, we have something special for you.

POSITION: Mechanical Designer

DEPARTMENT: MPT Mixing

LOCATION: Waterloo, ON

Position Summary

The mission of the Mechanical Designer on the Mixing Team is to work closely with the Engineering, Sales, and Production teams to ensure prompt, accurate completion of 3D Solid Models, drawing packages, Bills of Materials, and related engineering documents.

Essential Functions

+ Designs customized hardware to meet customers’ needs based on the company’s requirements + Generates accurate models and detailed drawings using Solidworks and AutoCAD + Ensures drawings, models, and Bills of Materials are turned over to manufacturing on-time with high accuracy. + Works collaboratively with marketing and sales to meet customer / market design requirements + Works closely with vendors and manufacturing to assemble and test equipment + Ensures that all projects are accurately documented in timely fashion + Other duties, as assigned

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

_EDUCATION_

+ Associates or Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent engineering experience in a related field.

_EXPERIENCE_

+ 1 to 2 + years of professional mechanical design experience + Prior experience in a manufacturing environment is desired.

_COMPETENCIES_

+ Demonstrated ability and experience working in a dynamic, deadline-oriented environment is required. + Excellent verbal and written communication and organizational skills are required. + Proficiency with 3D Solidworks and 2D CAD + Ability to design and document mechanical elements and integrate into final assemblies and systems + Ability to execute engineering change orders and manage related tasks + Able to generate and compile engineering documents and turn over packages, design qualifications, IQOQ, Traceability matrices, manuals etc. + Ability to manage multiple projects + Ability to utilize logic, along with mechanical experience to solve problems + Should be familiar with document vaulting programs + Knowledge of materials, mechanisms and pneumatics + Good written and oral communication skills + A Customer Obsession and Continuous Improvement Mindset is required. + Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications is required. + Familiarity with ERP Systems strongly desired. Infor Visual Manufacturing experience preferred.

Physical Environment and Environmental Factors

+ Regularly works in an office setting. + Frequently required to stand, sit, talk, and hear + Must be able to work in front of a computer for a large portion of the day + May occasionally lift up to 20lbs _Quadro Engineering Corp. is committed to providing a barrier-free workplace. If accommodation is required during the selection or interview process, it will be available upon request. This job posting is available in an accessible format upon request._ Are you ready to join a different kind of company where our people, our culture, and our commitments are centered around providing trusted solutions that improve lives around the world? IDEX is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Affirmative Action Employer. IDEX gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other consideration or protected category made unlawful by federal, state or local laws (Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled).

Business Unit:

Quadro

Job Segment:

HST Health & Science Technologies

title: Machine operator CNC
description:
Are you a machine operator with experience in various manufacturing environments?
Do you know how to operate a CNC or brake press machine?
Do you maintain a clean and orderly work environment?

We would like to meet you!

Come and be part of a team of machine operators in a large manufacturing company in Paris Ontario. You will be operating a CNC laser machine or brake press machine to make steel beams for racks. Some hand and power tool and drill press experience will be an asset to assemble and finish steel when required.

Job Title: Machine Operator CNC
Location: Paris, Ontario
Shift: Days or Afternoons
Hours:
Monday - Thursday 7am- 430pm, Fridays 7 am - 230 pm
OR
Monday to Thursday 5 pm to 2:30 am, Fridays 3 pm to 10:30 pm
Pay Rate: $23/hour


Advantages
Why work for Randstad?

-Straight afternoon shift
-Overtime is available if interested
-Long-term job opportunity
-Team-oriented environment
-Opportunity for advancement and career growth
-Paid weekly
-Health and dental benefits
-Positive work culture
-Health and dental benefits
-Attendance bonus
-Shift premiums
-Boot allowance
-RRSP matching program

Responsibilities
Job duties include:

-operate a CNC laser machine or brake press machine
-may hand and power tools to assemble steel
-other general labour duties as instructed

Qualifications
Who are we looking for?

- 1-2 years experience operating a CNC machine or brake press machine
- Hand and power tool experience is an asset
- Transportation to Paris

Summary
How to apply?

Please send resumes to katie.carmichael@randstad.ca
or
Call 519-758-1511 and ask for Oksana or Katie
or
Apply online at randstad.ca
0r
Text us at 519.717.3982

Are you interested in making your next career move, but this one doesn't sound right? Please give us a call as we have an extensive list of open positions in the Brantford area. We look forward to speaking with you.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Team Lead- Manufacturing
description:
Team Lead- Manufacturing-210000NU

Description

 

We are looking for a talented Team Leadto join our team specializing in hydrogen fuel cell power systems technology for our #NewPower Business Unit in Mississauga, Ontario.

In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:

  • Supervises the daily activities of a production unit or teams and monitors work flow
  • Helps manufacturing staff achieve company goals by communicating expectations, planning, monitoring, and evaluating job results.
  • Completes production plan by scheduling and assigning personnel; accomplishing work results; establishing priorities; monitoring progress; revising schedules; resolving problems; reporting results of the processing flow.
  • Responsible for recruiting, hiring, and training employees.
  • Maintains work flow by monitoring steps of the process; communicates with and assists other manufacturing departments as needed.
  • Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
  • Resolves problems by analyzing data; investigating issues; identifying solutions; recommending action.
  • Maintains safe and clean work environment by educating and directing personnel; maintaining compliance with established policies and procedures.

 

Qualifications

 

To be successful in this role you will need the following:

  • Community college / technical trade / or university, or equivalent plant experience
  • 2+ years plant experience as supervisor or team leader in manufacturing.
  • Supervision, Coaching, Managing Processes, Process Improvement, Tracking Budget Expenses, Production Planning.
  • Able to deal with complex issues in a fast-paced setting.
  • Ability to organize, work collaboratively, and safely lead small work teams.

 

At Cummins, we are committed to the principles of diversity and employment equity under the Employment Equity Act, and we strive to ensure that our workforce reflects the diverse nature of Canadian society.

Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, color, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law.

The successful candidate will be subject to our Pre-Employment Background Screening process that consists of a Criminal Background Check as well as Education and Work Experience Verification.

title: Product Integrity Centre Technician
description:
Eaton is currently seeking a Product Integrity Centre (PIC) Technician to join our team. This position is based at our Perth location.

Position Overview:

As a member of the Distribution Centre (DC) support team, the primary function of the PIC Technician is to improve organizational effectiveness and contribute to supporting the Operational Excellence (OpEx) Department by inspecting and testing returned material within the Product Integrity Centre (PIC).

In this function you will:

  • Consider Safety as number one and support alignment of CI / OpEx / Quality and MESH strategies at the DC.
  • Investigate and drive the root cause of non-conformances from return material to support the site’s ISO and Eaton Quality Management System (EQMS) while continuing to support the Perth DC Eaton Business System (EBS).
  • Support quality and OpEx projects, processes & CI events to ensure that operational, financial, and quality objectives are met, in accordance with High 5 metrics of Safety, Quality, Delivery, Inventory and Productivity as well as considering customer and cost requirements.
  • Coordinate the control, handling and management of defective return material and arrange for disposition through interactions with the Mod Shop, Materials, Planning, Engineering staff and suppliers.
  • Interact with internal and external suppliers to improve & conform to component and assembly design to improve manufacturability and reduce cost.
  • Perform functional / product testing on returned products and conduct defect analysis to drive root cause.
  • Evaluate, test, and inspect Returned Material Authorizations (RMAs).
  • Provide additional support to the OpEx team when required.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Business / Commerce, Engineering (Mechanical, Industrial, Electrical, etc.) or industrial technology; minimum Grade 12 or equivalent level of education with significant experience.
  • Minimum of two (2) years’ experience in a Quality / technical role.
  • Basic knowledge of mechanical and safety procedures of a manufacturing facility.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience within a manufacturing and / or distribution centre environment.
  • Six Sigma, Lean, PMP or ASQ certification is considered an asset.
  • Certified EQMS auditor, or willingness to become qualified.

Position Criteria:

  • Demonstrated experience of utilizing mechanical tools and measuring equipment required for assembly and calibration.
  • Passion for quality, asking questions, understanding how things work and lifelong learning.

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Manufacturing & Operations

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: No

title: Machine Operator - 12hr Shift - MInimal Experience Required
description:
We are looking for machine operators for a facility in Mississauga.
Get to join the market leader in producing solar panels.
We are looking for hardworking, dedicated, and reliable individuals who would like to be in the manufacturing industry.

MINIMAL EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

Industry: Solar Panels

Job title - General Labour
Employment Type: Permanent, Fulltime, Direct Hire

Location - Courtney Park and Kennedy, Mississauga

Available Shifts:

Straight Days - Continental
Monday - Sunday (7:00 am – 7:00 pm)
Payrate: $17.50 /hr

Straight NIghts - Continental
Monday - Thursday (7:00 pm – 7:00 am)
Pay rate - $18.50 /hr

Sample week schedule:
Week 1: Mon to Tues (2 days ON) - Wed to Thu (2 days OFF) - Fri to Sun (3 days ON)
Week 2: Mon to Tues (2 days OFF) - Wed to Thu (2 days ON) - Fri to Sun (3 days OFF)
**repeat**

Advantages
PERMANENT OPPORTUNITY
Immediate start
Paid 1hr breaks
Full medical and dental benefits after three months
Annual vacation days (two weeks after probationary period of three months)
Tuition Reimbursement
Opportunity to grow and advance your career
MINIMAL EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!


Responsibilities
90% mechanical 10% General Labour
Able to stand for the duration of the shift
Able to lift solar panels repetitively
Manual Dexterity
Able to Use of tools (tweezers, screwdrivers, solders, etc.)
Able to work in fast-paced environment
Able to multi-task
Mechanically aligned - experience in machine operation or assembly is an asset
Able to troubleshoot the solar panels is an asset

Qualifications
Fantastic attitude and a great work ethic
Must be able to commit to a long term role
Should be available to start immediately
3-6 months industrial experience (warehousing, production or manufacturing)
Great hand/eye coordination
Ability to lift 30 lbs repetitively

Summary
If you or anyone you know is interested in this Machine Operator - General Labour Permanent Role in Mississauga --- APPLY THROUGH THIS POSTING!

You may also email your resume to Anna and Melanie. Subject: Machine GL
anna.ongtengsiem@randstad.ca / melanie.turchiaro@randstad.ca

For QUESTIONS regarding this job posting, you can EMAIL US or TEXT 416-8592509, include the job name, and we will try to get back to you as soon as possible.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Production Development Coordinator (TEMP - 1 year)
description:
Essential Position Functions:
  • E-receive orders and convert to production orders to be produced in Winnipeg
  • Support new item set up for facility as needed to support customer needs while scrutinizing these requests to make sure the new requests are realistic and we can meet timing.
  • Understand garment/product construction to be able to support setting up bill of material with changes needed for custom product orders
  • Distribute cut orders to production floor denoting any special requirements or expedited timing for the orders.
  • Expedite material, components, outside embellishment requirements, etc. as needed to service production needs
  • Confers with production supervisor to determine progress of work and to provide information to account reps as requested.
  • Liaison between account rep/ sales rep for all new orders
  • Respond to and process all add-on requests and changes received from account reps/sales.
  • Work with product development team as needed to facilitate information for new products being introduced to the production floor.
  • Evaluate orders for needs and timing and work with customer service as needed to make sure we can support the request. This includes working with customer service team as needed to work through timing concerns, identifying raw material needs and requesting/detailing needs to purchasing as to when materials are needed to support timing of production to meet customer delivery, work with production supervisor to help manage priorities on the production floor as orders are received so we can successfully delivery orders in hand as well as new orders.
  • Manage/track embroidery of cut parts that has to be sent out to embroidery contractor.   Work with production supervisor and development team to confirm all detail have been sent for the embroidery and work with contractor on timing of completion and receipt back to the facility so we can complete the order in time for the customer delivery.
Position Summary:

The Production Coordinator works to ensure that production schedules are met and shipments to customers are completed on time. The Coordinator works with production, production development team and account/sales representatives to expedite product through the manufacturing organization.

Qualifications:
  • Previous experience in similar position required
  • High School; College education preferred

title: Quality Assurance - Verification Test Lead
description:
Responsibilities

  • Under the supervision of the System Integration and Test Manager, the Verification Test Lead will be responsible for creating test cases, test plan and test strategies to check the functionality of Blackline Safety products
  • Oversees projects to make sure work is scheduled based on priorities, risks and team strengths
  • Reviews and re-evaluates the test strategy to adjust for new information, changing risks, shifting priorities and schedules
  • Assign testing tasks and responsibility to appropriate team members based on skill levels
  • Reviews the creation and maintenance of test data and test documentation
  • Review requirements and provide feedback
  • Review defects created by team members and track them to resolution
  • Assists Management with creating timelines for current and upcoming projects and helping the team meet those timelines
  • Assists management in setting the direction for quality assurance within the organization
  • Coordinate with Quality team to discuss and resolve product quality issues
  • Identify new test cases/suites required based on feedback from Customer and Factory Quality

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Experience in Agile, VV and SDLC methodology
  • Experience leading a test team of 3+ testers
  • Experience with testing tools and test management tools
  • Experience with FW or SW release processes
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Project Management
  • Detail oriented with a strong ability to prioritize and deliver results
  • Able to adapt to changing priorities
  • Six Sigma accreditation and experience in Lean Manufacturing are assets

About Blackline Safety

Blackline Safety is a world leader in the development and manufacturing of wirelessly connected safety products. We offer the broadest and most complete portfolio available in the industry. Our products are designed to save lives and we monitor personnel working alone in populated areas, complex indoor facilities, and the remote reaches of our planet. Blackline’s products are used to keep people safe in the event of falls, missed check-ins, man-downs and exposure to explosive or toxic gas. Our design, development, sales, marketing, support, and production are all performed in-house at our headquarters in Calgary, AB. Blackline Safety is a publicly traded company (TSX: BLN). To learn more about our company visit www.blacklinesafety.com

Blackline Safety is powered by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer. We consider all applicants, regardless of age, religion, race, color, ancestry, gender, gender identity or expression, disability, national origin, race, sexual orientation. We enthusiastically encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. Come join our inclusive team and start collaborating with us on exciting projects!

title: Material Handler II
description:
The Material Handler is responsible for material handling duties including, but not limited to:

  • Picking machine part orders;
  • Lift and move various items weighing up to 50lbs;
  • Entering data into computerized system;
  • Move various items utilizing a forklift; and
  • Function in an industrial environment in a safe manner in accordance with WorkSafeBC laws and regulations and Company policies.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School diploma or equivalent;
  • Blueprint reading course or equivalent preferred;
  • Supply Chain Management Level 1 course preferred;
  • 1 year industrial or manufacturing experience;
  • Ability to lift and move machinery and other items without damage and with attention to safety;
  • Ability to lift and move items weighing up to 50lbs on a regular basis; and
  • Ability to use and care for mechanical hand tools, power tools, and measuring equipment.

BENEFITS: As a Pro Mach employee, you receive more than just a paycheck. Total compensation includes your pay (hourly rate), very comprehensive medical/dental programs as well as life insurance, and a generous paid time off program.

Pro Mach is committed to providing an accessible workspace. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process please notify the Company.

 

WEXXAR BEL

 

At Wexxar BEL, corrugated container packaging applications are limited only by the imagination. Our Wexxar case formers and case sealers have been installed in nearly 40 countries and consistently bring customers the lowest cost of ownership and the highest standards of safety. Wexxar also offers the BEL line of corrugated box sealers, tapers, and packing systems as well as the IPak line of tray and bliss formers, stackers, and sealers systems. As part of the ProMach End of Line business line, Wexxar helps our packaging customers protect and grow the reputation and trust of their consumers. ProMach is a family of best-in-class packaging solution brands serving manufacturers of all sizes and geographies in the food, beverage, pharmaceutical, personal care, and household and industrial goods industries. ProMach brands operate across the entire packaging spectrum: filling and capping, flexibles, pharma, product handling, labeling and coding, and end of line. ProMach is headquartered near Cincinnati, Ohio, with manufacturing facilities and offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and Asia. For more information about ProMach, visit http://www.ProMachBuilt.com and for more information on ProMach Careers, visit http://www.ProMachCareers.com.

 PMCA01

Experience

Required
  • 3 year(s): Technical Aptitude
  • 1 year(s): Working in an Industrial or Manufacturing Environment
Preferred
  • 1 year(s): Ability to lift and move machinery and other items without damage using a forklift

Education

Required
  • High School or better in Other

Required
  • Data Entry
  • Forklift Operation
  • ERP Software
  • Blueprint Reading
  • Analytical Skills
  • Technically Inclined

Behaviors

Required
  • Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
  • Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well
  • Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest
  • Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity

Motivations

Required
  • Growth Opportunities: Inspired to perform well by the chance to take on more responsibility
  • Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
  • Flexibility: Inspired to perform well when granted the ability to set your own schedule and goals
  • Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization

title: Shipping and Receiving/ Material Handling Associate
description:
SHIPPING & RECEIVING / MATERIAL HANDLING



– ASSOCIATE









OBJECTIVES:











The Shipping & Receiving Material Handling – Associate will be responsible for working in a team environment to facilitate the movement of iNet, rental and customer owned equipment through the various Service processes ranging from receiving for repair to re-deployment in the field. This will involve performing multiple job functions effectively, including receiving, inventory control, material handling, shipping, resolving real-time delivery issues with our Customer Service Team and carriers, and “closing out” at the of the day.







ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:







Coordination





+ Review and make decisions in conjunction with the Office Manager and other members of the Shipping & Receiving Material Handling Team



+ Work closely with the Customer Service Team and Service Technician Team to streamline operations and provide exceptional customer service



+ Assist Customer Service Team with basic job duties as required









Technical Expertise





+ Triage of equipment on the dock as received by various carriers



+ Proper recycling of packaging materials



+ Safe handling and storage of gas cylinders



+ Processing of iNet equipment returns



+ Proper application of FIFO and storage of iNet and Rental pool instruments



+ Pick and process customer orders



+ RMA processing



+ Movement of repaired equipment from staging rack for shipping pickup



+ Accurate entry of customer information into Oracle, Salesforce or iNet control/admin



+ Work cell and warehouse bin replenishment



+ Inventory cycle counting and resolution of discrepancies



+ All other duties as assigned









Process Improvement





+ Follow and assist in development, promotion, and review of Shipping & Receiving Material Handling SOP’s (Standard Operating Procedures)



+ Communicate process or product issues as necessary



+ Proactively seek continuous improvement of Shipping & Receiving Material Handling Department processes (Kaizen)



+ Participate in departmental daily performance reporting (Visual Daily Management)



+ Maintain a clean, safe, and functional work area (6S)








QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED (Non-Negotiable):







Technical





+ High school diploma or equivalent experience



+ Basic computer and typing skills



+ Experience in manufacturing, assembly or repair/service environments









Non-Technical





+ Commitment to safe work practice



+ Ability to plan and schedule work



+ Good communication skills, both verbal and written



+ Very organized and capable of performing multiple tasks simultaneously



+ Strong interpersonal skills



+ Acute attention to detail



+ Ability to work well with others in a cross functional team



+ Experience in providing excellent customer service









QUALIFICATIONS PREFERRED (Negotiable):









+ Basic knowledge of ISC Support Systems (Oracle, JIRA, Service Desk, iNet Systems, Salesforce, Windchill, DSSAC)



+ Basic knowledge of MS Office Applications (Word, Excel, Outlook)



+ Kanban knowledge



+ Inventory management experience





PHYSICAL DEMANDS:



Note: The physical demands described herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.



While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be required to sit or stand for extended periods of time, reach with hands and arms, walk, talk, and actively listen. The employee may be required to regularly use hands and digits to handle or feel work material. The employee may be required to frequently lift or carry up to 20 lbs. and on occasion, be required to lift or carry up to 50 lbs. The employee may be required to frequently ascend/descend stairs/steps, especially at field locations. The employee must be able to use/wear applicable personal protective equipment which may include but is not limited to safety-toed foot wear (with ankle height support), back support belt, hearing protection, and safety eye-wear with side shields.



Equal Opportunity Employer



Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this position at any time, with or without notice.


Fortive is a diversified industrial growth company comprised of Professional Instrumentation and Industrial Technologies businesses that are recognized leaders in attractive markets. With 2017 revenues of $6.7 billion, Fortive’s well-known brands hold leading positions in field instrumentation, transportation, sensing, product realization, automation and specialty, and franchise distribution. Fortive is headquartered in Everett, Washington and employs a team of more than 26,000 research and development, manufacturing, sales, distribution, service and administrative employees in more than 50 countries around the world. Our team grows by tackling challenges that accelerate progress and further their careers. With a culture rooted in continuous improvement, the core of our company’s operating model is the Fortive Business System. For more information please visit: www.fortive.com.


The people at Industrial Scientific are committed to ending death on the job by the year 2050, and we need more help. We hire smart, motivated people, give them world-class tools in a supportive environment, and we let them do their job. Our team is highly engaged, creates quality solutions and delivers outstanding customer service. Our leaders understand the critical elements of breakthrough performance: bringing out the best in people; creating a climate of trust, openness and high performance; fostering candor; and treating people fairly and with dignity.

title: Production Control/Customer Service Coordinator
description:
Job Number: 28650 
Group: Cosma International  
Division: Deco Automotive 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: Etobicoke 

 

 

Group Description

Cosma provides a comprehensive range of body, chassis and engineering solutions to global customers. Through our robust product engineering, outstanding tooling capabilities and diverse process expertise, we continue to bring lightweight and innovative products to market.

 

POSITION OVERVIEW:

 

To ensure customer shipping requirements are met and exceeded to the highest standards of customer service.

 

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

 

  • High School diploma or equivalent, post-secondary program an asset
  • 2 – 3 years’ experience working in a shipping / production environment
  • Experience with MRP, CMS, and other inventory programs
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks

 

RESPONSIBILITIES / EFFORTS / WORKING CONDITIONS:

 

  • To process all EDI releases and manual releases for assigned customers
  • To plan and control shipments for all assigned customers
  • Monitor all releases
  • Daily loading of releases, into the MRP software
  • Maintain and arrange, all routing instructions, routers and expedites, as required
  • Maintain ERP data integrity
  • Maintain production control contact with all assigned customers, as required
  • Monitor customer systems
  • Meet departmental inventory/reduction/accuracy targets
  • Customer delivery performance 100%
  • Continuously challenge past practices by actively exploring and implementing new solutions and methodologies to improve the quality and time to market of our product and services to the company
  • TS16949 awareness and adherence
  • ISO14001 awareness and adherence
  • Lean Manufacturing and 5S concepts awareness and adherence
  • Work safely and within the guidelines of the Deco Employee Handbook
  • Commitment to continuous improvement and work place safety
  • Team Player
  • Other duties as may be required

 

SAFETY PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS

 

  • Accepts personal responsibility to plan and conduct their work safety in compliance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act as well as company policies and guidelines.
  • Responsible for good housekeeping in your area.

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

title: Shipping Supervisor
description:
Location: Mississauga, ON, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 5/3/2022Job ID: 9M26891753Category: Engineering & Technical

If you are a talented and experienced Shipping Supervisor, Gezamin Manuel, Recruitment Consultant at David Aplin Group, has the right opportunity for you!  David Aplin Group has partnered with a Huntsville, Ontario-based manufacturing company to recruit a Shipping Supervisor to lead, manage, and direct all aspects of the Shipping Department.  In this role you will report directly to the Plant Manager and will also be required to participate as a member of the plant management team, in the planning and implementation of plant goals and objectives.

This is a fulltime on-site opportunity, with a work schedule of 8am to 5pm, Monday to Friday.


Perks & Benefits:
  • Competitive base pay plus bonus
  • Strong safety programs
  • Opportunities for career advancement
  • Generous company paid health & dental benefits
  • Generous company pension match up to 5% of salary
  • Ongoing training  

Responsibilities:
  • He / She  will  monitor and manage  finished goods inventory, arranging cost effective and timely transportation of goods
  • Provide supervision to shipping department, including hiring, wage and performance reviews, discipline Ensure proper training of staff, including onboarding, orientation, health & safety, department processes
  • Maintain Shipping department processes and procedures manual
  • Manage and control all activities in the storage yards including finished goods inventory
  • Monitor inventory to ensure proper storage and movement to offsite storage yards
  • Maintain accurate inventory control through timely and proper processing of RGA’s, PPR’s and inventory reconciliation counts and checks
  • Take leadership role for annual audited inventory count
  • Ensure all raw materials are managed  to meet production back log, budgeted volume and sales forecast
  •  Assign daily work schedules to the shipping department, ensuring work meets established procedures and guidelines
  • Determine load configurations, provide shipping dates and transport information to Sales and/or Customer Service
  • Create, coordinate and maintain customer/product specific shipping schedules, Conduct daily review of inventory transactions and reports
  • Establish practices and procedures, utilizing scan guns, barcode labels and other relevant computer hardware and software
  • Manage packing supplies, price quotes and vendor selection as it pertains to the shipping department and related activities
  • Actively support LEAN and 5-S initiatives, encouraging participation from shipping department
  • Provide leadership to our Safety Committee in an effort to coach Safety as a way of life and ensuring that safety is the top consideration to all other activities
  • Actively participate in all Health & Safety training and promote a safe work environment
  • Perform workplace inspections, incident investigations, safety communication, correcting substandard acts or conditions, offer recognition for safe performance
  • Conduct all work according to established procedures, policies, and standards

Qualifications:
  • 5-8 years previous related experience in manufacturing management, or an equivalent combination of experience, education and training that demonstrates the ability to perform the key responsibilities of the position
  • Previous supervisory or management experience required
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma required
  • Exposure to manufacturing facilities safety and quality programs
  • Previous experience in 5-S and Lean Manufacturing is preferred
  • Strong interpersonal, organizational, and time management skills enabling multi-tasking, prioritizing work and exercising initiative to ensure an efficient and quality level of service
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Able to develop strong and effective working relationships at all levels of the organization
  • Excellent computer skills and sound knowledge of MS Office
  • Experience utilizing a fully integrated ERP system an asset
 
Job ID:  9M26891753 

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Quality Control
description:
Quality ControlTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Measurement & Analytics division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers. With thousands of experts around the world and high-performance digital technology, ABB's team is dedicated to making measurement easy for its industrial and energy customers to let them operate more efficiently and profitably.As a member of the quality team, you will act as a Quality Assurance Specialist for two product lines by ensuring quality during development projects and on the production line
Your responsibilities

  • Ensure independent compliance with our processes, standards, and best practices.
  • Ensure that the design activities that influence the quality of the products or services are sufficiently defined and controlled.
  • Ensure the qualification, evaluation, monitoring, and improvement of our suppliers in collaboration with the procurement team.
  • Ensure the qualification, evaluation, monitoring, and improvement of our manufacturing processes.
  • Ensure customer satisfaction through customer feedback processes.
  • Develop control plans and implement them with suppliers.
  • Ensure inspection of 1st item.
  • Together with the quality team and in collaboration with the Operations, measure the costs of non-quality, identify opportunities for improvement, and make the necessary corrections to reduce the costs of non-quality.
  • Ensure the resolution of remedial action requests and of product failures.
  • Conduct audits.
  • Assess the status of a project for technical milestones and avenues

Your background
  • You are recognized for your leadership, your ability to work as a team and bring a team to embrace an approach, idea,
  • concept.
  • Fully committed to the realization of their mandates, the candidate is autonomous, has good analytical skills and is a communicator, both orally and in writing. In addition, they are organized, result-oriented, and rigorous.
  • Bachelor of Science or Engineering (or equivalent experience).
  • Have developed expertise relevant the position, 2 years.
  • Good knowledge of French and English, spoken and written.
  • Knowledge of ISO 9001 standards.
  • Command of recognized problem-solving processes and statistical process control: an asset
  • Be available to travel occasionally

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

Chemtrade est un partenaire industriel fiable pour les secteurs du gaz et du pÃ©trole, des pÃ¢tes et papiers, du traitement de lâ€™eau, des aliments et des boissons et de la pharmacie, et sâ€™engage Ã  respecter les codes et lâ€™Ã©thique de la norme  14001 (Gestion responsable).

 

Nous tenons Ã  remercier tous les candidats pour lâ€™intÃ©rÃªt quâ€™ils ont manifestÃ© et les efforts quâ€™ils ont dÃ©ployÃ©s pour postuler Ã  cette fonction; toutefois, seuls les candidats retenus pour un entretien seront contactÃ©s.

 

Pour en savoir plus sur Chemtrade, rendez-vous sur  www.chemtradelogistics.com  ou suivez-nous sur Facebook!

 

 

 

Scope of the Position

 

This job is diverse in the mechanical ability to perform general plant operator duties. The Chemical Operator is an integral part of our production team and will be responsible for the overall chemical production process. This will include weighing, mixing chemical ingredients, monitoring equipment and the manufacturing process. The ideal candidate will be attentive, knowledgeable, and have a desire to work with other production team members to develop the best processes and products.

 

Position:  Chemical Operator

 

Shift:   Monday to Friday â€“ 40 hours â€“ Overtime

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Perform chemical manufacturing operations in safe and effective manner.
  • Recording information, such as ingredients, weights, and temperature, and inputting into database.
  • Monitor and control pressure and temperature of chemical process equipment.
  • Operate plant equipment as per Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
  • Handle, transport and process chemicals safely.
  • Document plant processes and record production data.
  • Operation of tank truck and railcar vessel opening, loading and unloading of product, operation of pumps, piping and valves.
  • Troubleshooting issues with production equipment and processes.
  • Plant inventory record keeping.
  • Operation of the following mobile equipment: Backhoe, Trackmobile, Forklifts, and other mobile equipment.
  • Daily plant upkeep and daily maintenance. Ability to perform daily housekeeping duties.

Working Environment

  • Chemical manufacturing plant producing Liquid Alum, ACH and PAC chemicals
  • Physical capability of performing tasks in 100 degree ambient temperatures while wearing Protective Personal Protection.
  • This job requires climbing stairs and ladders and also lifting (within OSHA guidelines).
  • This job consists of outside elements where radiant heat or cold is normal work environment, and rotating shifts.
  • Following all plant safety guidelines such as: Confined Space, Working with heights Management of Change, Hot Work and Operating Procedures
  • Must be able to work scheduled 8-hour days with intermittent 14 â€“ 16 hour days for emergency operations/repairs.

 

What You Need To Be Successful

  • High school diploma or GED equivalent.
  • 1-3 years of experience working in chemical manufacturing or manufacturing/production.
  • Experience working with forklifts preferred.
  • Ability to demonstrate experience using Microsoft programs, maintenance management systems and email.
  • Aptitude for mechanics.
  • Willingness to comply with safety and quality regulations, including wearing protective gear when necessary.
  • Ability to lift 50lbs or more.

 

Reports to:   Plant Manager

 

CHEMTRADE is a publically traded (TSX: CHE.UN) chemical manufacturing and handling company headquartered in Toronto, Canada with 65+ locations across North America and Brazil. Chemtrade provides industrial chemicals and services to our customers in three main business segments; Sulphur & Performance Chemicals, Water Solutions and Electrochemicals. Chemtrade is a reliable industry partner to the Oil & Gas, Pulp & Paper, Water Treatment, Food & Beverage and Pharmaceutical industries and is committed to the codes and ethics of Responsible Care 14001.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Learn more about Chemtrade by visiting www.chemtradelogistics.com or follow us on

Facebook!

title: Production Worker (FT)
description:
About the Company:
Redwood Plastics and Rubber, https://www.redwoodplastics.com/, manufactures and distributes many grades of industrial plastic and rubber. We have in-house engineering and fabrication to produce custom components that often replace steel, aluminum, and wood for longer wear life, decreased downtime, increased production, lighter weight, cost-effectiveness and increased safety.

About the Job:
We are growing and hiring 2 Production Workers. We will train on our processes and the safe operation of our equipment. This is a regular, full-time position working at our Port Kells plant.

Responsibilities include:  
  • Become familiar with the production process.
  • Load and run equipment.
  • Other duties as required.

Shift: Day Shift: Monday through Thursday: 5:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

Skills and Experience:
  • Some experience in a manufacturing facility.
  • Physically fit, able to stand for extended periods, lift up to 40 pounds.
  • Good English verbal and written comprehension.
  • Looking for full-time work.

Compensation: $20 to $24 depending on experience.

title: Site Scheduler
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible.

You will be responsible for finite scheduling of SKUs on specific manufacturing assets. You will work with a supply planner to execute the master plan and make weekly adjustments to ensure product quantities are produced on time. You will be closely linked to plant operations and ensure line performance, planned downtime, and staffing assumptions are communicated to the supply planner.

How you will contribute

You will:

  • Maintain master data in company systems to ensure there is a constant stream of accurate information for the blackout calendar including min lot size/rounding values, production versions, master recipes/BOMs; run rates, loss factors and changeover matrices
  • Convert weekly supply planning orders to production planning and detailed scheduling orders as production plans roll into the finite window
  • Hold weekly scheduling meetings with product supply to determine necessary changes to the plant’s production schedule
  • Work cross-functionally to ensure that labor, material, and operational inputs can support the aligned schedule. Hold internal scheduling meetings with all key team members
  • Sequence production planning and detailed scheduling in the finite window to reflect production plans for deployment
  • Create and close process orders for each week’s production and adjust daily as necessary
  • Manage master compliance to schedule by ensuring short-, medium- and long-term plans are equivalent to process orders in the current week
  • Maintain daily CTS report and notify Product Supply as issues arise.
  • Hold monthly blackout calendar reviews with internal team members to capture all necessary downtimes
  • Backup for Materials Planner during vacations

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:

  • Materials, supply chain, finite scheduling, warehousing experience in a manufacturing business
  • Able to work on key priorities and improving the plan
  • Problem-solving and analytical skills – and able to understand and interpret data
  • Team player who can work with other functions on a daily basis
  • Look for opportunities to improve current process

More about this role

What extra ingredients you will bring:

Education / Certifications:

Post Secondary Education preferred or relevant business experience.

APICs CPIM preferred

Job specific requirements:

Scheduling and Supply Planning experience

Travel requirements:

None

Work schedule: Standard Business Hours

No Relocation support available

Business Unit Summary

We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury, Oreo, Mr. Christie and Maynards. We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

Job Type

Regular

Supply Planning (MPS - scheduling - MRP)

Customer Service & Logistics
