title: Leader Operations Manufacturing (4 positions)
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
In your role, you will:
  • Establish and control the achievement of production objectives by planning, organizing, motivating and coordinating the activities of a group assigned to the manufacture of aircraft interior components for the Dorval plant;
  • Manage the budgets of his group, ensure the quality of the product as well as the productivity of his employees (25 to 30 employees);
  • Identify, document and standardize the key processes leading to the achievement of objectives and share best practices within the organization;
  • Ensure continuous improvement, in particular through the use of the problem-solving process;
  • Exercise your leadership while respecting the vision and values ​​of Bombardier;
  • Coach your team to develop talent within the organization.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You have very strong management skills and ideally have experience in aeronautics;
  • You have a college education or equivalent experience;
  • You have the values ​​and a vision that align with the company's philosophy;
  • You have knowledge of French and English;
  • You also have the ability to work under tight deadlines.
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

title: Senior Operator (Meat Cutter) - JBS Foods Ontario
description:
With approximately 3,300 employees, JBS Food Canada ULC (“JBS Canada”) is one of Canada's largest beef processors. Consisting of four locations—the main processing facility located in Brooks, Alberta, where approximately 4,200 head of cattle are harvested and processed daily; the Head Office and a case ready plant, both based in Calgary, Alberta; and JBS Ontario, a case ready plant located in Belleville, Ontario. The JBS Canada facility in Brooks has the capacity to produce products ranging from boxed beef primals, ground beef, beef trimmings, beef by-products and hides which are shipped across Canada and worldwide. At the multi-protein Mountain Creek Farms case-ready facility in Calgary, JBS Canada produces value-added products including marinated, portion sized, multi-pack options, kebabs and much more. JBS Ontario in Belleville produces fresh meat and seafood products for leading retailers in Canada.

During the pandemic, we have implemented many safety measures including offering unlimited PPE, constructing permanent physical barriers in the employee cafeterias, and establishing physical distancing protocols.

At JBS Canada, our people are our greatest asset. We are very proud to have a team of high achieving, engaged employees. We are currently seeking full-time Senior Production Operators (meat cutters) to join our team at our JBS Ontario facility in Belleville, ON.

The basic job of the Senior Operator (meat cutter) is to cut required product in an efficient manner according to specifications, regarding quality, safety and productivity. They are also responsible for keeping a sharp edge on their knives so that it makes theirs cuts easy and less of a safety risk. This involves sharpening and steeling knives.

NOTE: This position will be located in Belleville, ON

You will:

  • Ensure all safety equipment is worn correctly and safety procedures followed.
  • Ensure all equipment is clean and operational.
  • Ensure work area is clean and free of all safety hazards.
  • Cut all meat according to specifications. Specifications may vary depending on the cut required.
  • Understand and apply food safety principles as per Good Manufacturing Processes (GMP) recognizing that “Quality is Everyone’s job 1’ and demonstrates that understanding through action and words
  • Work closely with production team to understand and ensure product quality and specifications are met as per JBS food safety and quality standards
  • Work closely with QC to understand and ensure customer specifications are met with regards to traying, wrapping and presentation, labeling, pricing and packaging.
  • Monitor and identify critical control points and take action and/or advise Supervisor on issues that may impact food safety and quality.
  • Clearly understand how to operate production equipment safely in order to complete daily tasks.
  • Understand emergency shut down procedures including identifying all emergency shut down switches on all processing equipment.
  • Understand and monitor processing equipment and make minor adjustments as necessary while reporting mechanical problems to team leader/supervisor

 

You have:

  • High School Diploma (preferred)
  • Meat cutting experience an asset
  • 1 to less than 7-month full time work experience in a physically demanding job, similar to the food processing industry
  • Working knowledge of production equipment
  • Willingness to take the time to learn the proper, safe way to perform any task.
  • Ability to understand and apply safe work practices and principles
  • A ‘safety first’ attitude
  • Motivated with core values of ownership, accountability and determination
  • Basic English skills
  • Ability to lift up to 23 KG

Work conditions and Physical Capabilities:

  • Repetitive tasks, Handling heavy loads, Physical demanding, Manual dexterity, Attention to detail, Hand-eye co-ordination, Standing for extended periods, Bending, Crouching, kneeling. Cold/refrigerated environment.

Earn Competitive Starting Wages: $17.00 (first three months), $21.07/hour once qualified as per Collective Agreement, Permanent Full-Time Position, Group Benefits and Pension

 

Exceptional Benefits include:

  • Competitive Wage | Group Health/Medical Benefit | Group Life & Accidental Death Insurance | Long Term Disability | Vision/Dental Care | Pension | Career Growth and Continued Training

 

www.jbsfoodcanada.ca

 

Mailing Address: 240 Jamieson Bone Road, Belleville ON, K8N 5S8

Telephone: 613-771-7304 Fax: 1-343-600-0687

Apply online: https://jbsfoodcanada.ca/careers/open-positions/

title: Manufacturing Labourer - Band / Abrasive Saw Operator
description:
Manufacturing Labourer – Band / Abrasive Saw Operator

Immediate start date if you have experience in a manufacturing environment!

On behalf of our Stoney Creek manufacturing client, Westridge HR invites you to apply for this opportunity to work for a well-established custom machining & fabrication shop that offers:
  • Full-time day shift with great benefits
  • Convenient Stoney Creek location, on Hamilton Bus Route
  • Job Security – Established Company – in business for decades!

This team support role will focus on:
  • Operating horizontal bandsaw / abrasive saw
  • Operating overhead crane to assist with lifting of heavier parts
  • Deburring of parts when required

Prepare yourself for an interview if you have:
  • Basic knowledge of machining/machined parts/general fabrication shop processes
  • Excellent tape measure interpretation skills and experience using measuring tools like calipers, micrometers, etc.
  • Experience using small hand power tools for deburring steel parts
  • Working knowledge of operating overhead cranes


sandra@westridgehr.com

if you would like to be considered for the Manufacturing Labourer – Band / Abrasive Saw Operator role. Please include resume outlining your skills and work experience.

We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those advancing through the selection process will be contacted.

Westridge, along with our client are equal opportunity employers committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe in fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment that brings people together to realize their full potential. We are committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.

title: Designer, Mechanical Engineer
description:
About SOLUFAB

SOLUFAB INC. is a manufacturing company specializing in the processing of metal since 2012. In full growth, the company has just added 14,000 ft. Factory to install, among others, a powder paint production line as well as A tube laser. Thanks to these acquisitions we are now fully autonomous for the realization of our projects, ideation to the finished product. Located in Ville Saint-Laurent, one of Quebec's main industrial centers, we accompany our customers in the design and realization of projects of all kinds. Solufab is aiming for excellence and its employees are the key to its continued growth and success.

What we are looking for

Do you want to work for a young and innovative business? Would you like to have the chance to perfect your design skills and work on a variety of projects? You do not just want to see your project behind your screen, but follow it throughout its production? That's exactly what Solufab can offer you!

We are looking for an engineer to join the design and production team, which includes the principles of "Design for Manufacturing" and who wants to to help our customers see their projects pass from the dream to reality.

Your tasks and responsibilities

  • perform 3D modeling SolidWorks
  • s 'Ensure Manufacturerability of Client Commands
  • Execute Miscellaneous Calculations as needed (resistance of material, motor power, etc.);
  • Observe the deadlines;
  • know the current methods of manufacture; welding, machining, folding ...;
  • Participate in design reviews;
  • Maintain 3D CAD and 2D Drawings up-to-date;
  • Create templates, assembly assembly and assembly methods;
  • all other related tasks;
  • track with clients and vendor.

What Solufab can offer you

Collective assurances, flexible hours, casual work environment, young and dynamic team, continuing education, possibility of realizing personal projects.

Profile sought

  • Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering.
  • More than 2 years experience in design or manufacturing domain.
  • Knowledge of SolidWorks
  • Knowledge of sheet metal.
  • Good knowledge of oral English and written
  • meticulous, autonomous, creative
  • Knowledge in finished element analysis (asset )

How to apply

if the extension interests you, sends your CV to Marc Bé Card, Director of Operations, or Stéphane Bouchard, CEO, at

To learn more about

Website:

Social networks: Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.

title: Quality Assurance Auditor
description:
The Organization

De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

 

Profile

Reporting to the General Manager, Training & Simulation, the Quality Assurance Auditor is responsible for compiling objective evidence by conducting interviews, reviewing documentation, observing activities, performing audits, surveillance, and investigations to determine whether the organization and individuals (management or non-management) are conducting activities in accordance with the applicable laws, regulations, and established policies and procedures.

 

The Auditor's primary responsibilities include the audit of the Training and Simulation Transport Canada and other regulatory approvals, including the ATO, MTO and FSTD Simulator department. The Auditor will conduct scheduled and unscheduled surveillance of the training center, maintenance operations, sub-contractors, repair facilities, contract and on-call maintenance, Simulator parts suppliers and manufactures for compliance with Training and Simulation Policies and Procedures and the Canadian Aviation Regulations; to evaluate internal maintenance operations for adequacy of facilities, equipment, procedures, and overall management to ensure safe, effective and compliant operations; and to coordinate investigation and reporting of incidents of non-compliance and non-conformance.

 

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Developing specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.
  • Perform audits, assist with root cause analysis, complete reports, and ensure corrective actions are implemented.
  • Examine records and interview workers to ensure recording of transactions and compliance with laws and regulations.
  • Assist the Training and Simulation Business Unit and Technical/Training Managers with activities such as maintenance control and audit corrective action plan implementation; to complete any special projects or other tasks as required; and may be assigned to other areas of operations, based on business or customer needs.
  • Assist in the development and support of the Training and Simulation Safety Management System
  • Conduct aircraft and ground equipment damage investigations.
  • Be knowledgeable and observe all Regulator regulations and Training and Simulation FSTD/CMP/ATO policies and procedures.
  • Ensure that all activities are controlled per PSAI procedures and performed in accordance with the OEM latest instructions.
  • Complete records of audits performed to sustain an accurate and complete audit system.

 

Education & Professional Qualifications

  • Bachelors degree in Engineering or related field with formal training as an auditor.
  • Minimum 2 years of work experience as an auditor.
  • Valid Transport Canada E, S, M1, or M2 Aircraft Maintenance Engineer license would be an asset
  • Proficient with the full set of Microsoft Office programs.

 

Experience

  • Experience an asset in performing or auditing maintenance activities on any flight simulator device and/or any type aircraft

 

Skills

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills using an organized and logical approach to find solutions to complex problems.
  • Clearly understands how to assess the importance of tasks and decisions and set priorities, focusing time/energy on the most important issues/opportunities.
  • Ability to interact with stakeholders at all organizational levels and the public.
  • Solution oriented, customer service focus, and positive “can do” team attitude.
  • Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communications skills required with demonstrated ability to handle sensitive issues in a professional manner.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate with internal business units.
  • Ability to build strong relationships with external customers and internal business units.
  • Self-motivated team player.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
  • Flexible working hours, statutory holidays, evenings, and weekend work may be required.
  • Travel to operating locations will be required from time to time.

 

At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation and disability, are encouraged to apply.

title: Robot Technician
description:
One of our manufacturing clients in Etobicoke,ON is looking for a Robot Technician for their manufacturing facility.

Shift - Afternoon and Midnight

Key Responsibilities

Establishes and follows-up full project implementation including timing, concept, feasibility, design, specifications, construction and commissioning

Analyses, records and charts documentation required for maintenance records and projects

Filling out Daily shift reports.

Services, maintains, repairs, installs and tests new or existing equipment and verifies conformance to specifications

Complete repairs, modifications and installations as required

Troubleshooting of process problems and complete quality improvements as required to maintain part standards of quality

Evaluate the efficiency and reliability of industrial robotic systems, reprogramming or calibrating to achieve maximum quantity and quality.

Plant support in troubleshooting / repairs and systems improvements (optimization)

Maintain safety standards of equipment and work area and perform all duties in a safe manner in accordance with the safety policies

Co-ordinate activities of apprentices, helpers and assigned contractors

Develop robotic path motions to maximize efficiency, safety, and quality

Disassemble and reassemble robots or peripheral equipment to make repairs such as replacement of defective circuit boards, sensors, controllers, encoders, and servomotors.

Carries out preventative maintenance procedures as laid out by the manufacturer's specifications

Able to work extended or flexible hours/shifts as required

Has good interpersonal and communication skills and is results oriented,

Has an exemplary attitude towards housekeeping, safety and company policies,

Commitment to continuous improvement and work place safety,

Team Player,

TS16949 awareness and adherence,

ISO14001 awareness and adherence,

Lean Manufacturing and 5S Concepts awareness and adherence,

Other duties as may be required.


Qualifications

Electromechanical certification.

Able to work in various locations within and outside the plant.

Proof of completion of an Electrical/Electronic course from a community or recognized college program consisting of two years or more.

3 to 4 years' experience with robots and electronic control systems in a robotic welding or laser field.

title: Processing Operator (Blender Helper)
description:
Who we are

Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee is a leading customer solutions provider, manufacturing and supplying quality coffee and tea to some of North America's largest retailers and foodservice chains. Our fast-growing EcoCupÂ® brand of single-serve pods makes it easy for consumers to recycle through 3 easy steps of separation. Combining state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation with more than 100 years of business success, Mother Parkers continues to grow. We take pride in delivering a better beverage experience for customers and consumers, and a better employment experience for our people! We operate multiple manufacturing facilities in both Canada and the U.S.

We are committed to doing what's right for the planet, people, and the communities in which we operate. From farm to cup, we're engaged locally and at the industry level in ensuring a sustainable future for our customers and consumers.

At Mother Parkers, we will give you every opportunity to voice your ideas, own what you do, and share your passion for people, our products and our customers. We live by our mission to provide a better beverage experience for our customers; and as a fourth-generation family-run company, we know that it starts with great teams and innovative thinkers. We empower our people to turn their ideas into solutions, execute with integrity, deliver with quality, and take pride in their work. In turn, we foster a culture built on our values that supports everyone to be their best. 

Who we need

Our Ajax plant is adding a Processing Operator (Blender Helper) to our team. You will be trained on our high-quality standards, and work as part of a team to weigh, measure, and operate our automated blending equipment to produce high-quality tea blends. 

Shift Type: Rotating shifts on days (7 am - 3:30 pm), afternoons (3 pm - 11:30 pm) and nights (11 pm - 7:30 am). Must be able to work all three shifts and on weekends as required. 

Pay Rate: $26.29/hour shift premiums

What's in it for you

Impact. You want to play a critical role in producing quality tea blends that get packaged and shipped out to our customers. You want to learn the business, understand the environment, and do your best work. This is a chance to contribute to processes that reduce non-value tasks and streamline the work of the Blending Team. 

Career development. At Mother Parkers, our commitment to continuous improvement starts with our people. With ongoing training and learning opportunities, this is a place to build your career. Whether you are interested in moving into a more technical role in another production and packaging area, you will be supported in your goals.

A company that cares. This is a well-structured, organized, and collaborative environment. Joining us is a chance to be part of a company that prioritizes the health and safety of their teams, from the highest level of plant operations, preventative maintenance, and quality standards. It's an opportunity to work with leading programming, technology, and operations at a Canadian-owned food & beverage company.

What you will do:

  • Learn. You will undertake training in primary and secondary roles and participate in annual performance reviews with your Supervisor. You will gain insights into the emphasis on quality and how to prevent mistakes that have a high-cost impact. You will build out a good understanding of our tea blending, processing and packaging from end-to-end.
  • Preparing the blend. You will be responsible for preparing the tea blend, which includes picking, weighing and measuring the required ingredients per the blend specifications. You will safely operate a lift truck to retrieve and return the pallet of ingredients to its racking location. You will then add the ingredients into the automated blending system to be processed; this will be completed by hand as well as by utilizing the vacuum-lift system. Upon completing each blend, you will follow the sanitization processes to prepare the system for the next blend. 
  • Be responsive and meet demands. You will maintain an awareness of when and how the equipment needs to be adjusted to correct for out-of-spec conditions. You will attend to mechanical problems. You will prioritize and plan the blending order to ensure optimal efficiency. 
  • Ensure quality. You will be part of our lean manufacturing environment and gain exposure to Six Sigma processes and approaches. You will develop an understanding of our Data Management System and ensure the accuracy and effectiveness of the supply chain from receiving to packaging. 

What you bring to the role:

  • The certification and knowledge. Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent with manufacturing experience in highly-automated packaging equipment. You have a technical and a mechanical aptitude with troubleshooting, analytical, and mathematical skills. You have a lift truck operating license (Counter Balance, Reach and Walkie) and can competently operate one in a plant environment.
  • The experience and growth mindset. You may have direct experience in the food and beverage industry or another processing and packaging industry. You want to grow your knowledge through training to develop an in-depth understanding of our automated manufacturing process in a lean environment.
  • The accountability. You take ownership of your work and the quality of the products. You are detailed, accurate and capable of reading and understanding technical information. You work well under pressure, make quick decisions when needed, and handle multiple tasks at a physically and mentally demanding job.
  • The interpersonal skills. You can take verbal and written directions and communicate effectively. You can work independently with minimal supervision and prioritize your work in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment.
  • The flexibility. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing environment with high complexity. You can adapt to different shifts.

What we offer you:

  • We want you to feel appreciated. We provide a competitive Total Rewards package, including health benefits from Day 1, employer matched retirement savings plans, and optional Health or Wellness Spending Account. 
  • We value continuous learning, skills development, and career growth and we offer a Tuition Assistance Program for learning outside our environment.
  • We want you to take your work home. While you donâ€™t have to drink coffee to work here, we have an employee discount on our tea and coffee products.

If you want to join our mission of creating a better beverage experience as an integral and valued member of our team, and you have 70% or more of the qualifications we are looking for, we invite you to express your interest here. While we canâ€™t guarantee an interview, we do promise to review your resume and see if this might be a good fit for both of us. 

Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates.

title: Scale Operator - Summer Student (Temp)
description:
Lehigh Materials is currently looking for responsible, safe, and dependable Summer Students to join our team in Vancouver, B.C. In this role, you will be responsible for providing Scale Operator coverage in the Vancouver area aggregate depots. The position is slatedto run from May to August 2022. Come grow your career with an industry leader!

What You Will Get to Do:

  • Generate scale tickets for loaded vehicles in accordance with established policy
  • Enter Purchase Orders, addresses, vehicle, customer, and other required information accurately
  • Prepare end of day reports, pre-authorize credit cards and balance debit/credit purchases
  • Notify customers coming into the yard of safety hazards or yard policies where applicable
  • Communicate general product descriptions, availability, and location to customers upon request
  • Liaise with Loader Operator, Depot Supervisor, Dispatch, Marine Dispatch and Sales Team when necessary regarding any Yard, Barge, Inventory or Customer concerns
  • Notify Dispatch of material unavailability or any issues regarding orders
  • Answer phones
  • Other duties as assigned

Essential Experience and Skills:

  • Excellent communications skills
  • Motivational skills
  • Organizational, team work, multi-tasking skills
  • Computer skills
  • High School graduate and some post-secondary education
  • Must be punctual and reliable
  • Must be able to work day/night shifts
  • Must be able to work at various plant sites - own transportation is required
Work Environment:
  • Role operates in an office and manufacturing environment with moving mechanical equipment, inclement weather, heat, humidity, elevated noise levels, and dusty conditions.
  • We are a drug free work environment.

title: Machine Operator AFTERNOON SHIFT
description:
Company Description

***This is an afternoon shift hours M-F 3:00 PM - 11:18, however, training for the first few months of training will take place during the day shift M-F 7:00 - 3:18 PM***

Our drive and control technologies ensure efficient, powerful and safe movement in machines and systems of any size. We inspire our customers with intelligent components, tailored system solutions, and services – from fully connected applications to the factory of the future. Bosch Rexroth Canada is dedicated to making the world a better place through innovation and technology. We are looking for associates who will take on our customers’ challenges with passion and persistence until the right solution is found and who will thrive in a face-paced, collaborative and exciting environment.

Why work with Bosch Rexroth Canada?

  • Challenging Projects: We are driven by innovation and being at the cutting edge of everything that we do. At Bosch Rexroth every day is different and your time will be filled with interesting and exciting projects.
  • Amazing Colleagues: Our people make us who we are, and we are very proud of our diverse and skilled global team. Having a supportive and encouraging team around you can make all the difference.
  • Learning and Development: We want you to reach your fullest potential, for both yourself and for Bosch Rexroth. That’s why we actively promote growth and development.
  • Change the World: We want to give you the opportunity to not only drive your career forward but also to change the world. The work we do at Bosch Rexroth can make a big difference to the world around you.
  • Social & Value-Driven: We have a tradition of assuming social responsibility in all that we do. Our success, and our roadmap for the  future, is based on our lived values. This covers everything, from community to the environment, to being a social employer.
  • Flexibility & Freedom: We strive to give you a balance between your work and home life, as well as the freedom to drive your career forward.
  • International Opportunities: We are a truly global, fully networked company, with locations in more than 80 countries all over the world.

Join us and help set the world in motion!

Job Description

***This is an afternoon shift hours M-F 3:00 PM - 11:18, however, training for the first few months of training will take place during the day shift M-F 7:00 - 3:18 PM***

As a Machine Operator, you will be responsible for:

  • Cutting, Chamfering, Deburring, Grinding, Washing
  • Studying and reviewing prints to prepare for set up of job on the machine and establish a running plan.
  • Laying out jobs in the machine to effectively produce correct and accurate parts.
  • Measuring and marking dimensions and reference points on material as guides for subsequent machining.
  • Starting and observing machine operations to detect malfunctions or out-of-tolerance machining and adjust machine controls as required.
  • Providing feedback to all related areas to optimize machining process.
  • Verifying conformance of finished work piece to specifications.
  • Maintaining a clean and safe workplace.
  • Performing other essential and related peripheral duties as may be assigned.
Qualifications

  • High school graduate or equivalent with vocational/technical training from an accredited school 
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in machining or similar job shop environment.
  • Knowledge of measuring tools and gauging in order to measure pocket size and depth with a micrometer
  • Good working knowledge of running machine tools and cutting tools
  • Able to work with minimal supervision and produce good quality
  • Ability to read and interpret manufacturing prints and Rexroth product model code 
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Capable of operating various cranes is an asset
  • Able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs


Additional Information

***This is an afternoon shift hours M-F 3:00 PM - 11:18, however, training for the first few months of training will take place during the day shift M-F 7:00 - 3:18 PM***

By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce and are an equal opportunity employer. Bosch Rexroth welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process.

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
A little bit about the role:

ORBCOMM has an opportunity for a Manufacturing Engineer within our industrial IoT device design Team. The successful candidate will contribute to the development, prototyping and production of industrial IoT products through innovative and practical approaches and leverage lessons learned from production problem solving for continuous quality improvement. This important role includes responsibilities in new product introduction (NPI), design engineering support, and component engineering support.

New Product Introduction Coordination:
  • QTA (Quick Turn Assembly) NPI planning with PCB fabricators and contract manufacturing partners
  • NPI assembly support
  • Main Point of Contact with local Contract Manufacturer
  • Compile documentation packages for quotation
  • Establish and prioritize clear-to-build readiness with recurring reviews
  • Procurement Support – quotations, PR generation (JD Edwards), order tracking and prototype inventory status
  • Assisted engineering teams with Agile PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) entries, new item creation and documentation support necessary for demand planning
Design Engineering Support:
  • Assembly documentation creation/updates using Altium Designer, AutoCAD and SolidWorks
  • BOM entry using Agile PLM system
  • Documentation preparation for Agile PLM Engineering/Manufacturing changes
  • Agile change traffic support
  • Manufacturing supply chain support
Component Engineering Support:
  • Agile new item creation
  • Identify and rationalize duplicate electrical components using Agile PLM
  • Validate the existing manufacturer’s part numbers against the part descriptions
  • Assist with the approval of alternate components or provide alternate sourcing
  • Verify RoHS/REACH status of electrical and custom parts
  • Manage change activity required to address above using Agile PLM
  • Source applicable second-sources for components
Required Skills/Experience:
  • A degree or diploma in a technical discipline (Preferably Electrical Engineering) or equivalent education and 4+ years of experience in the field
  • Experience working directly with electronics manufacturers
  • Familiarity with change management/item creation using PLM systems, preferably Agile PLM
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Highly organized with a good attention to detail and strong time management skills
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Electrical/Mechanical CAD experience would be considered an asset

title: Material Handler
description:
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Key responsibilities:

  • Follow cGMP requirements
  • Perform all duties following safe practices and procedures
  • Maintain a safe working environment in the warehouse
  • Know and leverage the ERP system (Visual/Infor) to receive and dispense inventory items
  • Receive Work Orders from Manufacturing, Generate pick lists and deliver the picked parts to Manufacturing.
  • Ensure part tracing.
  • Create kits for internal and external customers for shipping
  • Receive incoming raw materials and consumables deliveries
  • Complete Level 1 inspection of raw materials and inventory the items
  • Operate a Tow truck and place & retrieve inventory in racks in the warehouse
  • Follow the SOPs as prescribed for the role
  • Maintain adequate inventory of consumable parts and create purchase orders for consumables parts
  • Follow-up with Outside services vendors as required to ensure delivery of completed part
  • Pack and Ship parts to internal and external customers work with Logistics providers as needed.
  • Maintain good records of Certificate of Compliance, Pack lists, Receivers, etc.
  • Work within a high performing, self-directed team environment
  • Other duties as assigned or determined

Key requirements:

  • GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices) experience is highly preferred
  • Supply Chain and Inventory Control experience
  • Previous shipping, receiving, data management experience
  • Sound knowledge of Quality Assurance and Quality Control
  • ERP (Visual, SAP) experience
  • Company Quality System Training
  • Tow motor license required
  • Dangerous goods handling license a plus  
  • Company specified health and safety training
  • Organizational skills
  • MS Office experience

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Quality Assurance - Verification Test Lead
description:
Responsibilities

  • Under the supervision of the System Integration and Test Manager, the Verification Test Lead will be responsible for creating test cases, test plan and test strategies to check the functionality of Blackline Safety products
  • Oversees projects to make sure work is scheduled based on priorities, risks and team strengths
  • Reviews and re-evaluates the test strategy to adjust for new information, changing risks, shifting priorities and schedules
  • Assign testing tasks and responsibility to appropriate team members based on skill levels
  • Reviews the creation and maintenance of test data and test documentation
  • Review requirements and provide feedback
  • Review defects created by team members and track them to resolution
  • Assists Management with creating timelines for current and upcoming projects and helping the team meet those timelines
  • Assists management in setting the direction for quality assurance within the organization
  • Coordinate with Quality team to discuss and resolve product quality issues
  • Identify new test cases/suites required based on feedback from Customer and Factory Quality

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Experience in Agile, VV and SDLC methodology
  • Experience leading a test team of 3+ testers
  • Experience with testing tools and test management tools
  • Experience with FW or SW release processes
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Project Management
  • Detail oriented with a strong ability to prioritize and deliver results
  • Able to adapt to changing priorities
  • Six Sigma accreditation and experience in Lean Manufacturing are assets

About Blackline Safety

Blackline Safety is a world leader in the development and manufacturing of wirelessly connected safety products. We offer the broadest and most complete portfolio available in the industry. Our products are designed to save lives and we monitor personnel working alone in populated areas, complex indoor facilities, and the remote reaches of our planet. Blackline's products are used to keep people safe in the event of falls, missed check-ins, man-downs and exposure to explosive or toxic gas. Our design, development, sales, marketing, support, and production are all performed in-house at our headquarters in Calgary, AB. Blackline Safety is a publicly traded company (TSX: BLN). To learn more about our company visit www.blacklinesafety.com

Blackline Safety is powered by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer. We consider all applicants, regardless of age, religion, race, color, ancestry, gender, gender identity or expression, disability, national origin, race, sexual orientation. We enthusiastically encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. Come join our inclusive team and start collaborating with us on exciting projects!

title: In-Process Inspector
description:
Overview

OSI Systems companies have a long history of developing innovative solutions to bring a better quality of life to the world. Our OSI Electronics (OSIE) division is a diversified manufacturer of electronic devices and value-added manufacturing services.

 

We provide our customers with the manufacturing capabilities and purchasing power of a global Electronics Manufacturing Services provider. By delivering regional and personalized support best provided by a smaller company, we strive to build lasting relationships and create close and valued partnerships with our customers. Our singular focus is to help security experts, clinical professionals and high-tech developers solve real-world problems and issues.

 

PFC Flexible Circuits Ltd, a division of OSI Electronics, is seeking In-Process inspectors for its flexible circuit assembly operations.


Responsibilities

  • To ensure that materials and products meet or exceed the established quality requirements as contracted by the customer.
  • Interface with supporting departments as necessary to clarify any vague or ambiguous instructions.
  • Verify all documentation revision and configuration levels of product being inspected.
  • Document inspection and audit activities at appropriate location on the production router and any applicable logs (paper and/or electronic). Includes data entry into computerized quality system.
  • Process product at a rate appropriate to meet production requirements.
  • Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork
  • Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct
  • It is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem
  • Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business.

Qualifications

  • HS Diploma or equivalent, years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
  • The ability to decipher assembly drawings, part lists, manufacturing instructions, and workmanship standards.
  • Able to use a computer to enter quality data.
  • Experience using measuring devices such as calipers and micrometers, microscopes, and digital multi meters.
  • Knowledge IPC-A-610, and of component identification and values.

 

OSI Systems, Inc. has three operating divisions: (a) Security, providing security and inspection systems, turnkey security screening solutions and related services; (b) Healthcare, providing patient monitoring, diagnostic cardiology and anesthesia systems; and (c) Optoelectronics and Manufacturing, providing specialized electronic components and electronic manufacturing services for original equipment manufacturers with applications in the defense, aerospace, medical and industrial markets, among others.

Includes data entry into computerized quality system.', 'HS Diploma or equivalent, years of experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.', 'Experience using measuring devices such as calipers and micrometers, microscopes, and digital multi meters.', 'Uphold the company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork', 'Verify all documentation revision and configuration levels of product being inspected.', 'Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct', 'Able to use a computer to enter quality data.']

title: Mold Changer
description:
Company Overview:

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Mold Changer at our 591 Arvin facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure:

Reporting to the Mold Maintenance Manager, the Mold Changer is responsible to for mold changes, machine troubleshooting and repair. They will be responsible for, adhering to the policies and procedures outlined in the ISO9001:2015 AND IATF 16949 Quality System and practicing continuous improvement wherever possible.

Responsibilities:

  • On a three shift rotation, Perform mold changes based on schedule and prepare/setup the machine for production. Ensure the work environment is safe to perform the mold change and communication to all impacted employees is clear.
  • Able to operate a 40 Ton overhead crane
  • Understand and follow Standardized work established as it relates to Mold changes.
  • Provide input into efficiency improvements regarding Mold changes
  • Assist maintenance technician/electrician with machine maintenance including mechanical, hydraulic and pneumatic troubleshooting and repair.
  • Assist mold maker with injection mold tool troubleshooting, repair and maintenance.
  • Support the production team priorities of Safety, Quality and Delivery.
  • Assist in monitoring process conditions to ensure they are in control.
  • Assist in trials on new programs
  • Assist in trials on new technology
  • Perform duties as assigned from time to time by Supervisor.

Qualifications:

Education Required

Grade 12 at minimum, Applicable Post-Secondary schooling or trade an asset

Skills Required

Demonstrated mechanical aptitude

Demonstrated experience with various hand tools

Training and experience on a crane-an asset

Ability to support significant physical demands of assignment

Equivalent Experience

A Minimum of 3 years' experience in mechanically related role

Experience in a manufacturing environment an asset


Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at

hr@tiercon.com

title: Production Supervisor
description:
Position: Production Supervisor         

Location: Kitchener, Ontario              

Experience: 5+ Years of relevant work experience

Education: Diploma in a related field

Division: Clearpath Robotics

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job

As Production Supervisor, you will be the first point of contact for all robot builders. Communication skills are utmost important in your day to day activities. You will have a strong understanding of manufacturing priorities, and will ensure the team is operating smoothly and effectively collaborating. Ultimately, you should lead by a good example and engage the team to achieve department goals. This position will include leading the assembly teams for our  Clearpath Robotics platforms.

Responsibilities: 

  • Day-to-day direction and supervision of all robot builders.
  • Manage kit deliveries, shortage status, blockers, production flow and tasks for all product lines.
  • Provide encouragement to team members, including communicating team goals and identifying areas for new training or skill checks.
  • Completing 1:1 meetings, and performance reviews for direct reports.
  • Generate detailed reports about team performance, strategic initiatives, and deadlines.
  • Work with manufacturing engineers to ensure benches, tooling, and work instructions are up to date.
  • Champion & implement continuous improvement initiatives in all production areas.
  • Promote and ensure a safe work environment; investigate safety concerns and take appropriate action to maintain the health and safety of department personnel. 5S audits and housekeeping.
  • Ensure and maintain quality procedures and standards are consistently followed, and take effective corrective actions to remediate any manufacturing deficiencies.
  • Ensure the team enters accurate and actionable data, and maintain production jobs in our ERP system
  • Organize the repair and routine maintenance of production tools and equipment.
  • Step in to assist robot builds when required

Qualifications:

  • Strong interpersonal skills to allow efficient communication with team members, management and engineers.
  • Critical thinking and analytical skills.
  • Mechanical aptitude.
  • Able to work independently.
  • Able to read technical drawings and interpret BOMs.
  • Good understanding of products and their required process steps, including assembly and other sub-assembly processes a plus.
  • Excellent computer skills.
  • Excellent written language and verbal communication skills.

 At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

title: Compounder
description:
Job Descriptions:
• Verify that all batch cards are correct and match the W/O before commencing batching
• Complete all documentation to the required level of quality, accuracy and time line and ensure all information is recorded in good documentation practices
• Ensure always working in a safe way to support fellow staff in maintaining a safe, clean and compliant working environment.
• Clean and sanitize tanks and batching equipment according to Standard Operating Procedure (SOP).
• Conduct general housekeeping of compounding rooms and chemical staging areas, includes keeping all pipes, hoses, clamps, gaskets, and other processing equipment off the floor and in proper storage area.
• Collect representative samples of product batches and submit to QC Lab for analysis
• Ability to operate various batching equipment, including pumps, agitators, hoists, scales.
• Be able to compound all batches without supervision and assist on some batches under supervision
• Understand and follow Good Manufacturing Practices, Standard Operating Procedures, Safety Standards, Plant Policies/Procedures
• Complete all tasks strictly in line with approved manufacturing procedures and processes. Communicate immediately with respective team leader/supervisor or manager any un-expected issues and deviations from procedure if they occur.

Qualifications:
• High School Diploma or Equivalent
• Diploma in Chemical or Food Processing Technology or equivalent experience in a GMP manufacturing environment is an advantage
• Mechanical ability, understand basics in equipment operation
• Able to color match with good understanding of primary and secondary colors is an advantage
• Math skills required for the accurate checking/weighing of ingredients and for bulk reconciliation

title: Manufacturing Engineering Technician
description:
Manufacturing Engineering TechnicianTake your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Measurement & Analytics division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers. With thousands of experts around the world and high-performance digital technology, ABB's team is dedicated to making measurement easy for its industrial and energy customers to let them operate more efficiently and profitably.In this position, you are dedicated to managing the improvement of the production for the manufacturing units of the Measurement and Analytics (PAMA) business unit in Québec.Reporting to the manufacturing engineering supervisor, your objective will be to help define the production processes in order to optimize costs, quality, and product delivery timeframes while determining the pace of work phases within the budgets allocated to the materials.
Your responsibilities

  • In collaboration with the team leader, the manufacturing engineering specialist acts as the technical point of contact of the manufacturing cell.
  • Supports the daily operations with the objective of delivery on time and according to the quality targeted (sales, purchases, service, and others).
  • Acts as a technical reference to Production for his field of expertise, in particular equipment and templates.
  • Maintains the database containing the equipment calibration and maintenance plan and template (i.e. IT Guide).
  • Suggests ideas for improvements, and implements those in his technical field.
  • Supports production improvement projects, together with the process specialist.
  • In collaboration with the other manufacturing engineering specialists, supports and conducts problem investigations and corrections.
  • Implements and communicates engineering changes to Production, including work instructions.
  • Defines new working methods and tools in his technical field and trains cell staff.

Your background
  • Diploma of college studies or diploma of vocational studies in technology (mechanical, physical, electronics, or other) or in an appropriate field. Equivalent technical experience may be considered.
  • Good understanding of spoken and written English.
  • Be comfortable with the Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Demonstrate good autonomy, a sense of responsibility and of taking charge.
  • Collaborative solution-oriented approach, with strong spoken and written communication skills.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
AGS is looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer to join our dynamic organization. This role is located in our plant in Windsor, Ontario.

AGS Automotive Systems is a full-service automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and supply of complex high value-add automotive metal components, including in particular front and rear impact assemblies, principally for pick-ups and the heavy truck market. AGS offers full range of in-house capabilities including design and engineering, high tonnage metal stamping, light weighting solutions, innovative multi-material joining, high performance coatings including chrome plating and automated manufacturing processes.

AGS is committed to delivering high quality, high value products to our customers, who include several of North America's largest automakers. For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork.

AGS Automotive Systems is proud to support the full inclusion of persons with disabilities as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At AGS we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request by contacting AGS Human Resources at

HR@agsautomotive.com

.

Job Summary: Reporting to the Assistant QA Manager, the Quality Assurance Engineering is responsible for, but not limited to, providing quality-engineering services to internal and external customers and to assist in maintaining quality standards in accordance with customer requirements.

MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The Quality Engineer is responsible forthe effective and efficient delivery of duties and responsibilities as outlined below in accordance with AGS' cultural priorities. The duties and responsibilities described are not a comprehensive list. The scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands and other considerations.

The Quality Engineer is responsible for the APQP/PPAP process. He/she is also responsible for the continual improvement strategies to maintain and achieve high levels of customer satisfaction, thus supporting AGS's profit and growth objectives. In the absence of the Quality Manager, the Quality Engineer will assume as needed those responsibilities.

  • As per PPAP requirements, supervise all physical laboratory work and reliability testing ensuring product meets customer specifications.
  • In the absence of the Quality Manager, initiates initial response documentation to customers when a compliant has been received and advises Quality Manager of details and action taken.
  • Assist the Quality Manager as a Customer Liaison.
  • Responsible for all PPAP requirements and the PPAP timing.
  • Complete internal IATF16949 audits and Layered Process Audits
  • Ensure that inspectors are kept aware of changing criteria, methods, etc. by making sure that inspectors read log books, information sheets, news notices, Quality Alerts and conducts quality meetings when required.
  • Participates in 8D/PPSR corrective action team activities and using a cross-functional team approach in resolving problems related to customer complaints.
  • Leads APQP for Quality to meet all Customer Requirements.Ensure adherence that the quality system includes:
  • Lessons learned actions
  • Scrap process/procedures
  • Non-conforming product handling process/procedures
  • Contamination control for as shipped product
  • Process error proofing in place with challenges
  • Product containment (batch & hold systems) and final release strategy
  • Process control and capability
  • Validate conformance to Engineering Specification and part print requirements
  • Works in conjunction with Engineering, Manufacturing and Sales/Marketing for all PPAP/APQP time-line development and completion of same.
  • Completing and documenting capability studies on various processes (i.e. Cpk, Ppk)
  • Documenting Control Plans, PFMEA and Flow Charts
  • Responsible for Supplier metrics, Supplier PPAP and Supplier issues.
  • Comply with all Company safety policies, procedures and rules.
  • Participate in information sessions such as safety talks and other forms of staff meetings.
  • Perform any other duties that may be specifically or generally assigned.

    EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS:

    • College Diploma/University Degree in Quality Engineering (or equivalent experience)
    • Minimum of three (3) years Quality Assurance Engineering experience in automotive. (ie: APQP, PPAP, FMEA, MSA, GR&R, Control plans), GD&T competency
    • Experience in problem solving / process improvement techniques (ie. 8D's, root cause tools).
    • Able to read prints/drawings and interpret
    • Excellent verbal/written and interpersonal communication skills in English language
    • Computer literate, MS Office, etc.
    • Good judgment, analytical, problem solving, decision-making.

    PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:

    • 3-5 yrs related automotive or stamping experience and processes
    • Training in Core Tools and knowledge of Customer Specific Requirements.
    • Experience working in a QMS within a corporate registration scheme
    • Experience with conducting in-depth audits.
    • Previous Quality or Supervisory experience and able to manage small groups of unionized employees
    • Strong leadership skills and able to make quick decisions regarding part disposition

    WORK ENVIRONMENT

    • Automotive stamping plant. You will be required to wear personal protective equipment.
    • Exposure to noise; confined spaces, lighting conditions, material, products, and by-products associated with the manufacture of automotive parts including steel, temperature and weather extremes that require the use of specialized protective devices or equipment.
    • Required to climb stairs, able to crouch for periods of time, push, pull, lift, and turn while carrying work tools in various parts of the facilities.

title: Production Supervisor
description:
Production Supervisor
Day Shift
Richmond Hill, On
Manufacturing
Competitive Salary & Benefits

Our Canadian client in one of the leading manufacturers of architectural building products in Canada. The Production Supervisoris critical in driving operational excellence and and profitability throughout plant operations. The position is responsible for managing groups of employees in a department, planning for production requirements, maintaining production goals, implementing manufacturing processes and continuous improvement initiatives; ensuring safety requirements are met and maintained as well as overseeing departmental inventory levels. The ideal candidate is a team player, focused on people development and performance of the operation.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • In charge of production, personnel, quality and safety requirements on the shift
  • Provide leadership to all leads and employees on the shift
  • Establish methods to meet work schedules and coordinate work activities of the plant
  • Train and evaluate employees in job duties, safety procedures and company policies
  • Investigate and deal with personnel issues. Administer progressive disciplinary action when necessary
  • Maintain a safe working environment and ensure all safety rules are followed
  • Prepare reports on status of established KPIs and champion production-related continuous improvement projects
  • Lead and participate in Kaizen events to ensure continuous improvement goals are being achieved
  • Resolve production errors and disputes
  • Requisition or request materials and supplies
  • Prepare production and other reports where required
  • Attend and contribute to production meetings
  • Assist maintenance from an administrative and technical perspective. Interact with maintenance to facilitate effective P.M. execution and timely crisis repairs
  • Undertake projects as assigned by the Production Manager to improve plant processes
  • Maintain professional behavior in all dealings with employees, colleagues and other departments

The Ideal Candidate:
  • 5+ years of experience as a Production Supervisor in a manufacturing environmentwith a preference given to those with industrial manufacturing experience
  • University degree or college diploma in Engineering/Operations Management or similar field
  • Demonstrate strong leadership, problem solving, coaching, technical skills and interpersonal skills
  • Experience implementing continuous improvement efforts, including but not limited to Lean manufacturing and Six Sigma is preferred
  • Must possess good verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical ability and detail orientation
  • Experience in dealing with personnel issues including coaching, discipline, and health/safety compliance
  • Ability to influence others and effectively work in a team
  • Solid computer skills including Microsoft Office, Word, and Excel

title: Ingénieur d'outils mécaniques
description:
ABOUT MONTEBELLO PACKAGING

Montebello Packaging is a world-class manufacturer of tubes and containers for the pharmaceutical, cosmetics and food industries. The company is a division of the Jim Pattison Group, a $12.7 (CAD) billion conglomerate. Montebello Packaging employs 500 people and has four plants in North America.

Today Montebello Packaging is looking for a mechanical tooling & automation engineer.

ESSENTIAL TASKS:

-Design and Model in 3D SolidWorks products, tooling, machine components, sub-assemblies and mechanisms

-Hold regular mechanical design project reviews with Engineering Team and compile minutes

-Produce detailed drawings suitable for outside manufacturing

-Prepare as-built documentation for tooling and completed automation machines and projects

-Direct and review technical manuals for all manufactured machines and systems

-Automate CAD drawing processes and administrate PDM drawings and documents revision -control in the vault

-Create detailed BOM for machine component purchasing

-Liaise closely with Manufacturing department to ensure accuracy of prints and efficiency of manufacturing of parts

-Direct, review and approve product or machine design and changes

-Mentor new design or drafting employees, assign and direct their work and provide necessary training to improve their design skills

-Define and report detailed project tasks, timelines and resources

-Support Quality and Sales with Technical evaluations and reports

-Communicate with Customers and update them project milestone status and deliverables

Your profile and competencies:

-Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering

-OIQ membership

-Solidworks CAD, PDM and Simulation experience

-5-10 years or more in relevant tooling design, manufacturing engineering and/or automation projects

-Working knowledge in plastics and mold making materials and tools is an asset

-Tooling design experience (impact extrusion, injection molding)

-Machining understanding

-Control system design and implementation

-Project management and multi-tasking ability

-Motivate people and share the vison as well as details required to lead the Team through the projects

-Complex Problem Solving and Troubleshooting

-Communication skills required for meetings, interviews, issuing directives and rephrasing technical issues to non-technical audience

-Responsibility to technical staff whether it is of corrective or praising nature

-Time Management

-Delegate effectively, by knowing staff’s strengths and weaknesses and to identify necessary training opportunities to the Team

The advantages of joining our team

-Being part of a small company with the advantages of a large group;

-High quality products;

-Great work atmosphere ;

-Employee recognition;

-Full benefits (health, dental, vision, vacations, free parking...) ;
